hebrew_text: ואמר רב יצחק בר אבדימי מאי טעמא כיון דאמר עלי כמאן דטעון ליה אכתפיה דמי
human_translation: And Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi says: What is the reasoning Once said: upon me as though loaded upon his shoulders.
llm_translation: And Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: What is the reason? Since he said about me, "Like the shoulder of those who bear burdens" (Psalm 68:14), it is as if he has burdened me.

hebrew_text: רב אשי מונרצה לו לכפר קאמר:
human_translation: Rav Ashi says from “And it shall be accepted for him,”
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said from Monartzah to the village he said:

hebrew_text: אשכחן זביחה וזריקה קבלה מנלן
human_translation: We found slaughter and sprinkling From where do we collection
llm_translation: We found: slaughtering and sprinkling, from where do we derive?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא לילף מזביחה וזריקה מה לזביחה וזריקה שכן עבודה שחייבין עליה בחוץ
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from slaughter and sprinkling What about slaughter and sprinkling? in that a rite for which one is liable outside
llm_translation: And if you will say to exclude slaughtering and sprinkling, what about slaughtering and sprinkling, for it is also a service for which one is liable outside.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי אתיא מאיל נזיר דכתיב (במדבר ו, יז) ואת האיל יעשה זבח שלמים שתהא עשייתו לשם שלמים ואם אינו ענין לשינוי קודש דנפקא ליה מהתם תנהו ענין לשינוי בעלים
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says is derived from a nazirite’s ram. As it is written: “And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ] of peace offerings that its offering should be for the sake of a peace offering. And if is not matter of deviation offering, as we derived that from there, apply it matter of deviation owner.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: It is derived from the ram of a Nazirite, as it is written (Numbers 6:17), "And the ram shall be a sacrifice of peace offerings." Its making should be for the sake of peace offerings. And if it is not for the purpose of changing its sanctity, it is derived from there that he should make it for the purpose of changing ownership.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בר אבא לרבא אימא יעשה כלל זבח פרט כלל ופרט אין בכלל אלא מה שבפרט זביחה אין מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba said to Rava, Say “Shall offer,” is a generalization “A sacrifice [ zevaḥ ],” is a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization includes only that which is in the detail. slaughter [ zeviḥa ], yes, no other
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Abba said to Rava, "Say: 'A generalization, a specific case, a generalization.' The generalization includes only what is in the specific; there is no other matter in the generalization."

hebrew_text: אי כתיב יעשה שלמים זבח כדקאמרת השתא דכתיב יעשה זבח שלמים הוה ליה כלל שאינו מלא וכל כלל שאינו מלא אין דנין אותו בכלל ופרט
human_translation: If written: Shall offer for peace offerings as a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ], as you say. Now that it is written: “Shall offer for a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ] of peace offerings,” an incomplete generalization, And one cannot derive any incomplete generalization by a generalization and a detail.
llm_translation: If it is not written "he shall offer a peace offering" as you said, now that it is written "he shall offer a peace offering," it would have been a generalization that is not complete, and any generalization that is not complete, we do not judge it as a generalization and a specification.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר לעולם דנין ולה חזר וכלל
human_translation: Ravina says Actually, one can derive And “unto the Lord,” then makes a generalization.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Always judge, and let her return and conclude.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא מדיפתי לרבינא והא לא דמי כללא קמא לכללא בתרא כללא קמא מרבה עשיות ותו לא כללא בתרא כל לה' ואפילו שפיכת שיריים והקטרת אימורין הא תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל בכללי ופרטי דריש כי האי גוונא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: But the former generalization is dissimilar to the latter generalization. The former generalization includes actions and nothing more, the latter generalization any unto the Lord, and even pouring remains and burning sacrificial portions The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught generalizations and details in cases like this.
llm_translation: Rav Acha said to Ravina: Since the first general principle is not similar to the final general principle, the first general principle includes more actions, and yet the final general principle does not include even the pouring of leftover wine libations and the offering of leftover incense. This is as taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: General and specific principles are expounded, for in this manner.

hebrew_text: כלל ופרט וכלל אי אתה דן אלא כעין הפרט מה הפרט מפורש עבודה ובעינן לשמן אף כל עבודה ובעינן לשמן
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. Just as the detail, defined rite and we require for the sake of so too, we require every rite for the sake of
llm_translation: General and specific and general. You do not judge except according to the type of the specific. Just as the specific is explicit service, and we require intent, so too all service, and we require intent.

hebrew_text: אי מה הפרט מפורש עבודה וחייבין עליה בחוץ אף כל עבודה וחייבין עליה בחוץ שחיטה וזריקה אין קבלה והולכה לא
human_translation: If just as the detail, defined rite, and one is liable for it outside so too, any rite one is liable for it outside slaughter and sprinkling are collection and conveying not.
llm_translation: If what the detail explicitly is service and liable upon it outside, so too all service and liable upon it outside, slaughtering and sprinkling not, receiving and walking no.

hebrew_text: אי נמי מה הפרט מפורש דבר הטעון צפון וישנו בחטאות הפנימיות אף כל הטעון צפון וישנו בחטאות הפנימיות שחיטה וקבלה אין זריקה לא
human_translation: Alternatively, just as the detail defined an action that requires north and is in the inner sin offerings, so too, any that requires north and is in the inner sin offerings slaughter and collection are sprinkling not.
llm_translation: If also what the detail explicit a matter that requires north and it is in the internal sins also all that requires north and it is in the internal sins slaughtering and receiving not sprinkling.

hebrew_text: איכא למימר הכי ואיכא למימר הכי שקולין הן ויבאו שניהן לישנא אחרינא וחדא חדא תיקו במילתא
human_translation: this can be said and that can be said. they are equal, and both are included. another version and each one, shall stand in status.
llm_translation: There is to say thus, and there is to say thus, they are equal, and both come to another teaching, and each one, each one, let it stand in abeyance regarding the matter.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא זריקה מדרב אשי נפקא
human_translation: If you wish, say sprinkling is derived from that Rav Ashi
llm_translation: If you will say, "Zerikah (throwing) is derived from Rav Ashi, it emerges."

hebrew_text: אשכחן איל נזיר שאר שלמים מנלן
human_translation: We found a nazirite’s ram From where do we other peace offerings
llm_translation: We found: A ram of a Nazirite, how do we know that it is from the category of peace offerings?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא נילף מאיל נזיר מה לאיל נזיר שכן יש עמהן דמים אחרים
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from a nazirite’s ram What about a nazirite’s ram? in that there is other blood, with
llm_translation: And if you say, we learn from the case of a Nazirite, what about a Nazirite ram, for a Nazirite ram also has other blood with it.

hebrew_text: א"כ נכתוב שלמי מאי שלמים לרבות כל שלמים
human_translation: If that is so, let write: His peace offerings [ shelamav ]. What “peace offerings [ shelamim ]”? to include all peace offerings.
llm_translation: So, if it is written "shelamim," what does "shelamim" come to include?

hebrew_text: אשכחן שלמים שאר כל קדשים מנלן
human_translation: We found a peace offering From where do we all other offerings?
llm_translation: We find Shlamin, the rest of all holy things, from where?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא נילף משלמים מה לשלמים שכן טעונין סמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק
human_translation: And if you would say: Let us derive from a peace offering What about a peace offering? in that it requires placing hands and libations, and waving of breast and hind leg
llm_translation: And if you say, we derive the laws of peace offerings from peace offerings, what is the law regarding peace offerings, for they require leaning of hands, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר קרא (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה לעולה ולמנחה ולחטאת ולאשם ולמילואים ולזבח השלמים היקישן הכתוב לשלמים מה שלמים בין שינוי קודש בין שינוי בעלים בעינן לשמה אף כל בין שינוי קודש בין שינוי בעלים בעינן לשמה
human_translation: Rather, the verse states: “This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the guilt offering, and of the consecration offering, and of the sacrifice of peace offerings” The verse juxtaposes with peace offerings, just as we require a peace offering for its sake, both deviation offering and deviation owner, so too, we require every for its sake, both deviation offering and deviation owner.
llm_translation: Rather, the verse states (Leviticus 7:37): "This is the Torah of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the consecration offering, and the sacrifice of peace offerings." Can the Scripture be comparing peace offerings to peace offerings specifically, whether there is a change in sanctity or a change in ownership, we require it to be for its sake, just as in the case of peace offerings, whether there is a change in sanctity or a change in ownership, we require it to be for its sake.

hebrew_text: אימא היכא דשחיט להו שלא לשמה ליפסלו
human_translation: say where slaughtered them not for their sake, they are disqualified?
llm_translation: Say: Where they slaughter for them not for the sake, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך תשמור ועשית כאשר נדרת וגו' האי נדבה נדר הוא [אלא] אם כמה שנדרת עשית יהא נדר ואם לאו יהא נדבה
human_translation: The verse states: “That which has gone out of your lips you shall observe and do; according to what you have vowed [ nadarta ] this a gift [ nedava ]? It is a vow [ neder ]. Rather, if you did what you had vowed it shall be vow but if not it shall be gift
llm_translation: The verse says (Deuteronomy 23:24), "You shall keep and do according to what you have vowed, etc." This is a vow of a freewill offering. Rather, if you have fulfilled as much as you vowed, let it be a vow; and if not, let it be a freewill offering.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך מוצא שפתיך ואיצטריך זאת התורה דאי כתב רחמנא מוצא (הוה אמינא)
human_translation: And it was necessary “That which has gone out of your lips,” and it was necessary “This is the law.” As, had the Merciful One written “That which has gone out I would say
llm_translation: And it was necessary, "the going forth of your lips," and it was necessary, "this Torah," for if the Merciful One had written, "going forth" (I would have said)...

hebrew_text: לא ידע במאי כתב רחמנא זאת התורה ואי כתב רחמנא זאת התורה הוה אמינא ליפסלו כתב רחמנא מוצא שפתיך
human_translation: do not know what the Merciful One writes This is the law, And if the Merciful One had written This is the law, I would say should be disqualified. the Merciful One writes That which is gone out of your lips,
llm_translation: He did not know with what He wrote, the Merciful One, "This Torah," and if the Merciful One wrote, "This Torah," I would have said to disqualify, "the utterance of your lips."

hebrew_text: רמי ריש לקיש על מעוהי בי מדרשא ומקשי אם כשרים הם ירצו ואם אין מרצין למה באין
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised a difficulty while lying on his stomach in the study hall: If are fit, let them propitiate and if they do not propitiate why are they brought
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama raises an objection from the study hall and asks: "If they are valid, why do they need to be accepted? And if they are not accepted, why do they come?"

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' אליעזר מצינו בבאין לאחר מיתה שהן כשרין ואין מרצין דתנן האשה שהביאה חטאתה ומתה יביאו יורשין עולתה עולתה ומתה לא יביאו יורשין חטאתה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to him: We have found in brought after death as they are fit, but they do not propitiate as we learned a woman who brought her sin offering and died, heirs shall bring her burnt offering. her burnt offering and died, heirs shall not bring her sin offering.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Eliezer: "We find in they come after death that they are valid and not pleasing. For we learned: The woman who brought her sin-offering and died, her heirs shall bring her burnt-offering. Her burnt-offering and died, her heirs shall not bring her sin-offering."

hebrew_text: א"ל מודינא לך בעולה דאתיא לאחר מיתה אשם דלא אתי לאחר מיתה מנלן
human_translation: said to him: I concede to you with regard to a burnt offering since it is brought after death from where do we a guilt offering, which not brought after death,
llm_translation: He said to him: "I concede to you regarding the burnt offering that comes after death. But how do we know that the guilt offering does not come after death?"

hebrew_text: א"ל הרי מחלוקתך בצידו רבי אליעזר אומר אף האשם
human_translation: said to him: Your dispute next to Rabbi Eliezer says: The guilt offering too
llm_translation: He said to him: "Behold, your dispute is on its side." Rabbi Eliezer says, "Even the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: אמר זהו שאומרין עליו אדם גדול הוא קאמינא אנא משנה שלימה ואת אמרת לי ר' אליעזר
human_translation: said Is he of whom people say he is a great man? I am referring to the entire mishna, And you say to me Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: Said: This is what they say about him, "A great man he is." I am saying, "A complete Mishnah," and you said to me, "Rabbi Eliezer."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר ריש לקיש אפתח אנא פתחא לנפשאי (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך וגו' האי נדבה נדר הוא כו' כדלעיל
human_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said: I will introduce a solution to my own “That which has gone out of your lips etc.” this a gift It is a vow and so on, as above.
llm_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said, "I will open with my own opening (Deuteronomy 23:24) 'What has gone forth from your lips, etc.' This is a voluntary offering, a vow, etc., as above."

hebrew_text: יתיב רבי זירא ורבי יצחק בר אבא ויתיב אביי גבייהו ויתבי וקאמרי קשיא ליה לריש לקיש אשם דלא אתי לאחר מיתה ונסיב לה תלמודא מוצא שפתיך אימא הבא בנדר ובנדבה לייתי ולא לירצי אשם לא לייתי כלל
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Abba were sitting, and Abaye was sitting with them. And they were sitting and saying: a guilt offering was difficult for Reish Lakish, as not brought after death, and he adduced the derivation “That which has gone out of your lips,” to it. say that is brought for a vow or a gift is brought does not propitiate, a guilt offering, should not be brought at all
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Yitzchak bar Abba were sitting, and Abaye was sitting in front of them, and they were sitting and saying: It is difficult for Reish Lakish - a guilt offering that does not come after death, and he marries her, the Talmud finds your lips, say: "If one brings a vow or a freewill offering, he does not bring a guilt offering at all."

hebrew_text: אמר להו אביי ריש לקיש מהכא פתח (ויקרא ד, לג) ושחט אותה לחטאת אותה לשמה כשרה שלא לשמה פסולה הא שאר קדשים שלא לשמן כשירין יכול ירצו ת"ל מוצא שפתיך
human_translation: Abaye said to them: Reish Lakish introduced from here: “And slaughter it for a sin offering” “it” for its sake, fit; not for its sake, unfit. Consequently, other offerings not for their sake, are fit. might propitiate the verse states: “That which has gone out of your lips,”
llm_translation: He said to them, Abaye said to Resh Lakish from here he began (Leviticus 4:33) "And he shall slaughter it for the sin offering, for her, it is valid; not for her, it is invalid." The other holy offerings, if not for their sake, are valid. You might think they would be acceptable, therefore it says, "from the utterance of your lips."

hebrew_text: ואימא הבא בנדר ונדבה לייתי ולא לירצי אשם (נמי) ארצויי נמי לירצי
human_translation: But brought for a vow or a gift, say do not propitiate one must bring a guilt offering propitiates as well?
llm_translation: And say: One who comes with a vow and a freewill offering should bring it, and not bring a guilt-offering for acceptance, also a guilt-offering should not be brought for acceptance.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אשם דמירצי לא מצית אמרת קל וחומר מעולה ומה עולה שאינה מכפרת אינה מרצה אשם שמכפר אינו דין שאינו מרצה
human_translation: Abaye said You cannot say that a guilt offering propitiates an a fortiori from a burnt offering: Just as a burnt offering, which does not atone does not propitiate a guilt offering, which atones is it not logical that it does not propitiate
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "A guilt-offering that does not achieve atonement - you have not found. You said: 'A fortiori reasoning is excellent.' And what is excellent? That which does not achieve atonement is not acceptable. A guilt-offering, which achieves atonement, is it not logical that it is acceptable?"

hebrew_text: מה לעולה שכן כליל
human_translation: What about a burnt offering? in that it is consumed
llm_translation: What is the case of an Olah offering? So too is the case of a Chatat offering.

hebrew_text: שלמים יוכיחו
human_translation: A peace offering can prove
llm_translation: "Shelamim yochichu."

hebrew_text: מה לשלמים שכן טעונין נסכין ותנופת חזה ושוק
human_translation: What about a peace offering? in that it requires libations, and the waving of breast and hind leg.
llm_translation: What for the peace-offerings that they require libations and the waving of the breast and the thigh.

hebrew_text: עולה תוכיח וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן קדשים ושחטן שלא לשמן כשירין ואין מרצין אף אני אביא אשם שהוא קודש ושחטו שלא לשמו כשר ואינו מרצה
human_translation: a burnt offering can prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that And the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are offerings and slaughtered them not for their sake, they are fit but they do not propitiate. So too, I shall include a guilt offering as it is an offering, and slaughtered it not for its sake, fit but it does not propitiate.
llm_translation: Offering will rebuke and the judgment returned not evidence this like evidence this and not evidence this like evidence this the side equal in them that they are holy and slaughtered not for its sake valid and not pleasing also I will bring a guilt-offering that is holy and slaughtered not for its sake valid and not pleasing.

hebrew_text: מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן ישנו בציבור
human_translation: What about their common element, in that they are by public.
llm_translation: What is the equalizing factor between them? For there is sleep in the public.

hebrew_text: תודה תוכיח
human_translation: A thanks offering can prove
llm_translation: Acknowledgment will prove.

hebrew_text: מה לתודה שכן טעונה לחם
human_translation: What about a thanks offering? in that it requires bread.
llm_translation: What for thanksgiving, so requires bread.

hebrew_text: עולה ושלמים יוכיחו וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן קדשים ושחטן שלא לשמן כשר ואינו מרצה אף אני אביא אשם שהוא קדש ושחטו שלא לשמו כשר ואינו מרצה
human_translation: a burnt offering and a peace offering can prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are offerings, and slaughtered them not for their sake, fit but do not propitiate So too, I shall include a guilt offering as it is an offering, and slaughtered it not for its sake, fit but does not propitiate
llm_translation: Burnt offerings and peace offerings will prove, and the judgment returned: this proof is not like that proof, and not like that proof. The common denominator between them is that they are holy, and their slaughter, though not for their sake, is valid, and it does not satisfy. I too will bring a guilt offering, which is holy, and its slaughter, though not for its sake, is valid, and it does not satisfy.

hebrew_text: מה להצד השוה שבהן שהן באין בנדר ובנדבה
human_translation: What about the common element of that are brought as a vow or as a gift
llm_translation: What is the equalizing factor between them, that they both come in a vow and a freewill offering.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא זאת התורה וגו' הקישו הכתוב לשלמים מה שלמים שהן קדשים ושחטן שלא לשמן כשרים ואין מרצין אף אני אביא אשם שהוא קודש כו'
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: The verse: “This is the law juxtaposes with a peace offering, just as peace offerings are offerings and slaughtered them not for their sake, they are fit but do not propitiate, so too, I shall include a guilt offering, as it is an offering,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "This is the Torah, etc." The verse compared peace offerings to guilt offerings. Just as peace offerings, which are holy, and if slaughtered not for their sake are valid, and do not require intent, so too I will bring a guilt offering, which is holy, etc.

hebrew_text: מאי חזית דאקשת לשלמים אקיש לחטאת
human_translation: What did you see, that you compared to a peace offering? compare to a sin offering,
llm_translation: What did you see that you compared the guilt offering to the peace offering?

hebrew_text: הא מיעט רחמנא אותה
human_translation: The Merciful One excluded it
llm_translation: This is a difficult task, as the phrase "הא מיעט רחמנא אותה" is not a complete sentence and lacks context. However, a literal word-for-word translation would be: הא - This מיעט - diminishes רחמנא - the Merciful One אותה - it So, a possible translation could be: "This diminishes the Merciful One."

hebrew_text: (סימן הנ"ש בש"ר)
human_translation: a mnemonic Heh , nun , shin ; beit , shin , reish .
llm_translation: Tractate: Siman Hanashim Beshir אמר רבי יוחנן כל המקיים דברי התורה בעיניו כאילו מקיים את כולה וכל המבטלן בעיניו כאילו מבטל את כולה Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who upholds the words of the Torah in his eyes, it is as if he upholds it all, and anyone who nullifies them in his eyes, it is as if he nullifies it all.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב הונא ורב נחמן ויתיב רב ששת גבייהו ויתבי וקאמרי קשיא ליה לריש לקיש אשם דלא אתי לאחר מיתה לימא ליה ר"א אשם נמי אתי לאחר מיתה
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Naḥman were sitting, and Rav Sheshet was sitting with them. And they were sitting and saying: Reish Lakish raised difficulty a guilt offering, since it is not brought after death. Let Rabbi Elazar say to him a guilt offering is also brought after death,
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rav Nahman were sitting, and Rav Sheshet was sitting in front of them, and the others were sitting, and they were saying: It is difficult for Reish Lakish - the guilt offering that does not come after death, let him say to him, "Rabbi Eliezer, the guilt offering also comes after death."

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב ששת אשם למאי קרב למותרו חטאת נמי מיקרב קרבה מותרה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: What of a guilt offering is sacrificed its remainder, a sin offering, the remainder of which is also sacrificed,
llm_translation: Said to them Rav Sheshet: "Guilt offering for what? It is brought for his permit. Sin offering too, its offering is permitted."

hebrew_text: חטאת אף ע"ג דקרבה מותרה מיעט רחמנא הוא
human_translation: A sin offering even though its remainder is sacrificed, the Merciful One excludes it
llm_translation: Sin-offering even though it was brought permissible limited is the Merciful One He.

hebrew_text: אשם נמי כתיב ביה הוא
human_translation: also written with regard to a guilt offering: it
llm_translation: Guilt-offering also written in it is.

hebrew_text: ההוא לאחר הקטרת אימורים הוא דכתיב כדתניא אבל אשם לא נאמר בו הוא אלא לאחר הקטרת אימורין והוא עצמו אם לא הקטירו אימורין כשר
human_translation: That is written after the burning of the sacrificial portions as it is taught But with regard to a guilt offering, “It is stated only after the burning of the sacrificial portions. And itself fit if the sacrificial portions were not burned
llm_translation: That one, after the incense, is with regard to the meal-offerings, as it is written, as we have learned: "But guilt-offering was not stated regarding it." Rather, it is after the incense of the meal-offerings, and it itself, if they did not burn the meal-offerings, it is valid.

hebrew_text: ואלא הוא למה לי לכדרב הונא אמר רב דאמר רב הונא אמר רב אשם שניתק לרעיה ושחטו סתם כשר
human_translation: But why do I “It for that which Rav Huna Rav says. As Rav Huna says Rav says: a guilt offering that was consigned to grazing slaughtered it without specification fit
llm_translation: And rather, why do I need it? For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav, a guilt-offering that was disconnected from its fellow and slaughtered it without specific intent is valid.

hebrew_text: ניתק אין לא ניתק לא מאי טעמא אמר קרא הוא בהווייתו יהא
human_translation: it was consigned yes, it was not consigned not What is the reason The verse states: “It it shall as it is,
llm_translation: He was disconnected, he was not disconnected. What is the reason? The verse says, "He is in His being, let it be."

hebrew_text: יתבי רב נחמן ורב ששת ויתיב רב אדא בר מתנה גבייהו ויתבי וקאמרי הא דקאמר רבי אלעזר מצינו בבאין לאחר מיתה שהן כשרין ואין מרצין לימא ליה ריש לקיש הנהו נמי לייתו ולירצו
human_translation: Rav Naḥman and Rav Sheshet were sitting, and Rav Adda bar Mattana was sitting with them. And they were sitting and saying: that which Rabbi Elazar said We have found in are brought after death, as they are fit but they do not propitiate let Reish Lakish say to him: These should also be brought and propitiate
llm_translation: Sitting were Rav Nahman and Rav Sheshet, and sitting was Rav Adda bar Matna with them, and they were sitting and saying: "This that Rabbi Elazar said, we find that those who come after death are valid, but they do not run. Let Reish Lakish say to him: These also they brought and did not run."

hebrew_text: אמר להן רב אדא בר מתנה יולדת אם היא ילדה בניה מי ילדו
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to them: a woman after childbirth If she gave birth, did her children give birth?
llm_translation: Said to them Rav Adda bar Matna: "A woman who gives birth, is she the one who gave birth to her sons?"

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אסי ומאן לימא לן דאי איכא כמה עשה גבה לא מיתכפרא וכיון דכי איכא כמה עשה גבה מיכפרא יורשיה נמי מיכפר
human_translation: Rav Asi objects to this And who shall say to us that if has several positive mitzvot she does not atone And since, when she has several positive mitzvot she atones so too, her heirs atone
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Asi: And who will say to us that if there are many, height does not atone? And since if there are many, height atones, his heirs also atone.

hebrew_text: למימרא דקניא להו והאמר רבי יוחנן הניח מנחה לשני בניו ומת קריבה ואין בו שותפות ואי ס"ד קניא להו (ויקרא ב, א) נפש אמר רחמנא
human_translation: Is this to say that acquired by But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say left his two sons a meal offering and died, sacrificed, and it does not have partnership? And if it enters your mind acquired by the Merciful One states one
llm_translation: To say that it is acquired for them, but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: If one leaves a meal offering for his two sons and then dies, it is brought and there is no partnership in it? And if you think it is acquired for them, the Merciful One says, "A soul" (Leviticus 2:1).

hebrew_text: ולא קניא להו והאמר ר' יוחנן הניח בהמה לשני בניו ומת קריבה ואין ממירין בה אי אמרת בשלמא קניא להו היינו דאין ממירין בה דהויא להו כשותפין
human_translation: And is not acquired by them? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say left his two sons an animal and died, sacrificed, and they cannot effect substitution for it? Granted, if you say acquired by them, this is that they cannot effect substitution for it: because they are like partners,
llm_translation: "And not zealous for them, but didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: If one leaves an animal to two of his sons, and it dies nearby, they do not exchange it? If you say, well, zealous for them, that's why they don't exchange it, because it is theirs jointly."

hebrew_text: ושותפין לא מצו ממירין אלא אי אמרת לא קניא להו אמורי נמי לימרו
human_translation: and partners cannot effect substitution But if you say not acquired by them, let them also effect substitution
llm_translation: And partners not found, we do not exchange, rather if you say not zealous for them, say also to teach.

hebrew_text: שאני התם דאמר קרא (ויקרא כז, י) אם המר ימיר לרבות את היורש אחד ממיר ואין שנים ממירין
human_translation: There it is different, as the verse states: “If he shall at all change [ hamer yamir ] to include the heir one can effect substitution, but two cannot effect substitution.
llm_translation: Different there, for scripture says (Leviticus 27:10), "If he shall exchange, to include the heir, one exchanges, and not two exchange."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב יעקב מנהר פקוד אלא מעתה גבי מעשר דכתיב (ויקרא כז, יג) ואם גאל יגאל לרבות את היורש הכי נמי אחד גואל ואין שנים גואלין
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov of Nehar Pekod objects to this If that is so, with regard to tithe, as it is written: “And if will redeem [ gaol yigal ] to include the heir So too, one redeems but two redeem they do not
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov from Nahar Pekod objects to him: Rather, now regarding tithing, as it is written (Leviticus 27:13), "But if he indeed redeems it, he shall add its fifth part to it," to include the heir as well. So too, there is one redeemer, and not two redeemers.

hebrew_text: שאני מעשר דגבי אבוהון נמי איתיה בשותפות
human_translation: tithe is different, as father had even in partnership
llm_translation: It is different with the tithe of fish in their father's house, there is also partnership.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אסי לרב אשי ומינה אי אמרת בשלמא קניא להו היינו דחד מיהא מימר אלא אי אמרת לא קניא להו היכי מימר
human_translation: Rav Asi said to Rav Ashi: But from itself, Granted, if you say acquired by them, this is that one in any event, can effect substitution But if you say not acquired by them, how can effect substitution?
llm_translation: Rav Assi said to Rav Ashi, "And from there, if you say, 'Granted, they are zealous for it,' that is why one of them says it. But if you say, 'They are not zealous for it,' how can one say it?"

hebrew_text: והאמר רבי אבהו אמר ר' יוחנן המקדיש מוסיף חומש ומתכפר עושה תמורה והתורם משלו על של חבירו טובת הנאה שלו
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Abbahu say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one consecrates adds one-fifth one for whom atones can render a substitute And one separates teruma from his to of another the benefit of discretion is his.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who consecrates adds a fifth and atones, makes a substitution, and the one who donates from his own for the benefit of his fellow, his own benefit.

hebrew_text: מקיבעא לא מכפרא מקופיא מכפרא:
human_translation: does not atone by essence, does atone incidentally [ mikkufeya ].
llm_translation: Establishment does not atone, covering atones.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו כיפרו על מה שבאו או לא כיפרו
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before did they atone for which they came, or did they not atone
llm_translation: The question was asked: Did they atone for what they came for or did they not atone?

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת בריה דרב אידי מסתברא דלא כיפרו דאי סלקא דעתך כיפרו שני למה הוא בא
human_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: It stands to reason that they did not atone, as, if it enters your mind they did atone, for what is second brought?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: It is reasonable that they did not atone, for if it entered your mind that they atoned, why then did they come?

hebrew_text: ואלא מאי לא כיפרו למה הוא קרב
human_translation: Rather, what they did not atone? for what is sacrificed?
llm_translation: And rather what not atoned for why it is brought

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי רב שישא בריה דרב אידי הכי קא קשיא ליה אי אמרת בשלמא לא כיפרו שלא לשמו מכח לשמו קאתי ושני למה הוא בא לכפר אלא אי אמרת כיפרו שני למה הוא בא:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This difficult for Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi: Granted, if you say did not atone, is brought not for its sake on the strength of for its sake. And for what is second brought? to atone But if you say atoned for what is second brought?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, raised the following difficulty to him: If you say that the offering was not brought for its sake, but rather from an unauthorized place to an authorized place, then why is it brought? But if you say that it was brought for its sake, then why is it brought?

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו אעשה דלאחר הפרשה מכפרא או לא מכפרא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before does it atone for a positive mitzva that after designating or does it not atone
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: Should one perform the atonement after the separation or not after the separation?

hebrew_text: מי אמרינן מידי דהוה אחטאת מה חטאת דקודם הפרשה אין דלאחר הפרשה לא אף הכא נמי דקודם הפרשה אין לאחר הפרשה לא
human_translation: Do we say just as it is with regard to a sin offering, just as a sin offering does that before designation not that after designation, here too, does that before designation not after designation?
llm_translation: We say something that was a sin, what sin was it? A sin that was before the separation, not after the separation, here too, before the separation, not after the separation.

hebrew_text: או דלמא לא דמיא לחטאת דחטאת על כל חטא וחטא בעי לאיתויי חדא חטאת והכא כיון דאיכא כמה עשה גביה מכפרא אעשה דלאחר הפרשה נמי מכפרא
human_translation: Or, perhaps not similar to a sin offering, as a sin offering one must bring one sin offering for each and every sin But here, since atones has several positive mitzvot, it also atones for a positive mitzva that after designation
llm_translation: Or perhaps it is not comparable to a sin offering, for a sin offering is required for each and every sin, whereas here, since there are many acts, one sin offering should be brought, and here, since there are many acts, it atones.

hebrew_text: תא שמע (ויקרא א, ד) וסמך ונרצה וכי סמיכה מכפרת והלא אין כפרה אלא בדם שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יא) כי הדם הוא בנפש יכפר אלא מה תלמוד לומר וסמך ונרצה לכפר שאם עשאה לסמיכה שירי מצוה מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו לא כיפר וכיפר
human_translation: Come hear “And he shall place and it shall be accepted And does placing hands atone But isn’t atonement only by the blood, as it is stated: “For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life” Rather, what the verse states: “And he shall place…and it shall be accepted to atone”? that if one deemed placing hands a non-essential mitzva the verse ascribes to him as though did not atone and atoned
llm_translation: Come and hear: "And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him." (Leviticus 1:4) Is laying on of hands effective for atonement? But is not atonement only through blood, as it is stated: "For the blood is the life, and it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life." (Leviticus 17:11) Rather, what is the teaching when it says, "And he shall lay his hand... and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement"? It is to teach that if one performs the laying on of hands without the intention of fulfilling the commandment, the Scripture accounts it to him as if he did not atone, and as if he did atone.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו דכיפר עשה דקודם הפרשה לא כיפר אעשה דסמיכה דהוה ליה עשה דלאחר הפרשה
human_translation: What, not that atoned positive mitzva that before designation it did not atone for the positive mitzva of placing hands as that constitutes a positive mitzva after designation
llm_translation: What is the negative commandment of "Lo D'Kipper Asah" (not to perform the atonement service) that if done before the separation (of the limbs) it is not considered as having performed the atonement service, due to the proximity (of the act) that would have made it (the atonement service) valid, but if done after the separation (of the limbs) it is considered as having performed the atonement service.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא עשה דסמיכה קאמרת שאני התם דכל כמה דלא שחיט בעמוד וסמוך קאי אימת קא הוי עשה לאחר שחיטה לאחר שחיטה לא קא מיבעיא לן
human_translation: Rava said You say the positive mitzva of placing hands There it is different, since as long as he does not slaughter he remains to stand and place hands When does positive mitzva occur? after slaughter, after slaughter, we do not raise the dilemma;
llm_translation: Rava said: "You have said to make leaning." Different is there, for as long as he did not slaughter at the pillar and lean, when is it? It is considered an act after slaughter, after slaughter, it is not necessary for us.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב הונא בר יהודה לרבא אימא כיפר גברא
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said to Rava: Say atoned the person,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Judah said to Rava: Say, "Kipar is a man."

hebrew_text: לא כיפר קמי שמיא
human_translation: it did not atone before Heaven,
llm_translation: Not like Keifar before Heaven.

hebrew_text: מי לא תנן (ויקרא יד, יח) והנותר בשמן אשר על כף וגו' לכפר עליו לפני ה' אם נתן כיפר ואם לא נתן לא כיפר דברי ר"ע ר' יוחנן [בן נורי] אומר שירי מצוה הן בין ניתן בין שלא ניתן כיפר ומעלין עליו כאילו לא כיפר
human_translation: Didn’t we learn “And the rest of the oil that is in hand to make atonement for him before the Lord” if placed it atoned but if he did not place it did not atone the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri says: is a non-essential mitzva. whether was placed whether it was not placed it atoned but ascribes as though it did not atone
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "Who did not teach (Leviticus 14:18) 'And the rest of the oil that is on the palm, etc.' - to atone for him before the Lord. If he gave, atoned; and if he did not give, did not atone." These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri says: "They are remnants of a mitzvah, whether given or not given, atoned, and they elevate for him as if he did not atone."

hebrew_text: מאי כאילו לא כיפר אילימא דמבעי לאיתויי קרבן אחרינא האמרת בין ניתן בין לא ניתן כיפר אלא כיפר גברא לא כיפר קמי שמיא הכא נמי כיפר כו'
human_translation: What As though it did not atone If we say that it is necessary to bring another offering didn’t you say whether was placed whether it was not placed it atoned Rather, It atoned the person, did not atone before Heaven. Here too, atoned
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "as if he did not atone"? If you say it means to bring another sacrifice, didn't you say whether it was given or not given, atonement was achieved? Rather, it means he did not atone like a man, not like the heavens. Here too, it atoned, etc.

hebrew_text: התם נמי כיפר מתן בהונות לא כיפר מתנות הראש
human_translation: There too, atoned; placement thumb and big toe, did not atone, placement the head,
llm_translation: There too, Kipar Matan with money, not Kipar Matanot HaRosh.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ר' שמעון אומר כבשי עצרת למה הן באין
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Shimon says: lambs Shavuot , for what are they brought?
llm_translation: Come and hear. Rabbi Shimon says: "Why do the Festival lambs come in?"

hebrew_text: כבשי עצרת שלמים נינהו אלא שעירי עצרת למה הן באין
human_translation: The lambs Shavuot they are peace offerings Rather, For what are the goats Shavuot brought?
llm_translation: The sheep of Shavuot are peace-offerings, except for the goats of Shavuot, why do they come?

hebrew_text: על טומאת מקדש וקדשיו
human_translation: for defiling of Temple, or its sacrificial foods,
llm_translation: On the impurity of the Temple and its holy items.

hebrew_text: נזרק דמו של ראשון שני למה קרב על טומאה שאורעה בין זה לזה אמור מעתה ראויין היו ישראל להקריב קרבנותיהן בכל עת ובכל שעה אלא שחיסך הכתוב
human_translation: the blood of first is sprinkled for what is second one sacrificed? for impurity that occurred between that and this Based on this, say the Jewish people should have sacrifice their offerings at all times and at every moment, but the verse spared
llm_translation: The blood of the first one was thrown, why did the second one come close for impurity that occurred between them? Say now, the Israelites were fitting to offer their sacrifices at any time and at any hour, except that the Scripture withheld.

hebrew_text: והא הכא דעשה דלאחר הפרשה וקא מכפרא
human_translation: And here, where positive mitzva after designation And atones
llm_translation: And here, where it is done after the separation, and it atones.

hebrew_text: אי דאפרשינהו בבת אחת הכי נמי הכא במאי עסקינן דאפרשינהו בזה אחר זה
human_translation: If designated simultaneously, indeed here we are dealing with where designated sequentially,
llm_translation: If they were stated together in one place, so too here, with what are we dealing that they were stated one after the other.

hebrew_text: וליקו ולימא ליה לקרא דכי כתיבא בזה אחר זה כתיבא
human_translation: But shall we stand and say about the verse that when it is written, it is written where sequentially?
llm_translation: And let him say to him the verse, for it is written, "one after another it is written."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא קרבנות צבור קאמרת שאני קרבנות צבור דלב בית דין קמתנה עליהן כדרב יהודה אמר שמואל דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל קרבנות צבור סכין מושכתן למה שהן
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Do you say communal offerings? Communal offerings are different, as court makes a non-verbal stipulation about them, in accordance with Rav Yehuda Shmuel says. As Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: communal offerings, knife, designates them for what they are.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Public sacrifices" you are saying, they are different, public sacrifices, for the court stands over them, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Public sacrifices, their knife is drawn, why? Because they are...

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב יוסף בריה דרב שמואל לרב פפא ומי אית ליה לרבי שמעון לב בית דין מתנה עליהן והאמר רב אידי בר אבין אמר רב עמרם אמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי יוחנן תמידין שלא הוצרכו לצבור
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Shmuel, said to Rav Pappa: But does Rabbi Shimon accept the court can make a non-verbal stipulation about Doesn’t Rav Idi bar Avin say Rav Amram says Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: daily offerings which were not necessary for the public,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rav Shmuel, said to Rav Papa, "Does Rabbi Shimon have a court that rules gifts for them?" But didn't Rav Idi, son of Avin, say in the name of Rav Amram, in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak, in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, "The continual offerings that were not needed for the public"?

hebrew_text: לדברי ר' שמעון אין נפדין תמימים לדברי חכמים נפדין תמימין
human_translation: according to the statement of Rabbi Shimon, they may not be redeemed unblemished, according to the statement of the Rabbis, they may be redeemed unblemished,
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Shimon, the unblemished are not redeemed; according to the words of the Sages, the unblemished are redeemed.

hebrew_text: ועוד הא בעא מיניה ר' ירמיה מר' זירא שעירי עצרת שקבל דמן בשני כוסות ונזרק דמו של ראשון שני למה הוא בא על טומאה שאורעה בין [זריקה של] זה לזה (נזרק דמו של שני למה הוא קריבין)
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: goats Shavuot their blood was collected in two cups, and the blood of first was sprinkled, for what is second brought? for impurity that occurred between the sprinkling of that and this
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yirmiyah asked Rabbi Zeira: The goat of the Day of Atonement, which received its blood in two cups, and the blood of the first one was thrown, why does the blood of the second one come to be on impurity that occurred between them? (The blood of the second one, why are they brought near?)

hebrew_text: עד כאן לא מיבעיא ליה אלא עשה דלאחר שחיטה אבל עשה דלאחר הפרשה לא קא מיבעיא ליה
human_translation: raised the dilemma only a positive mitzva after slaughter But a positive mitzva that after designation he did not raise the dilemma.
llm_translation: Until here, it is not necessary for him except for the one who did it after the slaughter, but the one who did it after the separation is not necessary for him.

hebrew_text: דלמא אם תימצי לומר קאמר:
human_translation: Perhaps he was saying: if you say
llm_translation: Perhaps if you wish to say, he said:

hebrew_text: איתמר תודה ששחטה לשם תודת חבירו (כשרה) רבה אמר כשרה רב חסדא אמר פסולה
human_translation: It was stated a thanks offering that slaughtered for the sake of another’s thanks offering: Rabba says fit Rav Ḥisda says unfit
llm_translation: It was stated: A thanksgiving offering that was slaughtered for the sake of giving thanks for his fellow (is valid). Rabba said: It is valid. Rav Ḥisda said: It is invalid.

hebrew_text: רבה אמר כשרה תודה לשם תודה נשחטה רב חסדא אמר פסולה לשום שלמים דידיה נשחטה בעינן
human_translation: Rabba says fit thanks offering was slaughtered for the sake of a thanks offering. Rav Ḥisda says unfit it must be slaughtered for the sake of his own peace offering.
llm_translation: Rabah said: "A kosher thanksgiving offering was slaughtered for the sake of thanksgiving." Rav Ḥisda said: "A non-kosher thanksgiving offering was slaughtered for the sake of its own peace."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה מנא אמינא לה דתניא (ויקרא ז, טו) ובשר זבח תודת שלמיו ביום הקריבו את זבחו וגו' אבא חנין אמר משום ר' אליעזר בא ללמד תודה ששחטה לשם שלמים כשרה שלמים שנשחטו לשם תודה פסולים ומה הפרש בין זה לזה תודה קרויה שלמים ואין שלמים קרויין תודה
human_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say as it is taught “And the meat of the sacrifice of his thanksgiving peace offering on the day that he presents his offering Abba Ḥanin said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: comes to teach a thanks offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a peace offering fit, a peace offering that was slaughtered for the sake of a thanks offering unfit. And what difference between this and that A thanks offering is called a peace offering but a peace offering is not called a thanks offering.
llm_translation: Rabbah said: From where do I know this? As it was taught (Leviticus 7:15), "And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of his offering, etc." Abba Hanin said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: It comes to teach that a thanksgiving offering that was slaughtered for the sake of peace offerings is valid, but peace offerings that were slaughtered for the sake of a thanksgiving offering are invalid. And what is the distinction between them? A thanksgiving offering is called peace offerings, but peace offerings are not called thanksgiving offerings.

hebrew_text: שלמים לשם תודה פסולה הא תודה לשם תודה כשרה מאי לאו דחבריה
human_translation: a peace offering for the sake of a thanks offering unfit, but a thanks offering for the sake of thanks offering fit. What, is it not of another,
llm_translation: "Peace-offerings for the sake of thanksgiving are invalid. But a thanksgiving-offering for the sake of thanksgiving is valid. What is it, if not that it is different from its counterpart?"

hebrew_text: לא דידיה
human_translation: No, of his own,
llm_translation: Not his.

hebrew_text: אבל דחבריה מאי פסולה אדתני שלמים לשם תודה פסולה ליתני תודה לשם תודה וכ"ש שלמים לשם תודה
human_translation: But another’s what unfit, rather than teaching a peace offering for the sake of a thanks offering unfit, let teach a thanks offering for the sake of thanks offering and all the more so a peace offering for the sake of a thanks offering
llm_translation: But his fellow, what is the disqualification? It was taught: An offering of peace for the purpose of thanksgiving is disqualified; let him bring a thanksgiving offering for the purpose of thanksgiving, and all the more so a peace offering for the purpose of thanksgiving.

hebrew_text: שלמים לשם תודה דידיה איצטריך ליה סלקא דעתך אמינא מדתודה קרויה שלמים שלמים נמי קרויין תודה וכי שחיט להו לשם תודה ליכשרו קא משמע לן:
human_translation: It was necessary a peace offering for the sake of his own thanks offering. enter your mind to say since a thanks offering is called a peace offering, a peace offering is called a thanks offering as well, and when one slaughters for the sake of a thanks offering it should be fit. teaches us
llm_translation: "Peace offerings for the sake of thanksgiving, for it was necessary for him. Is it not obvious to you? I say, since it is for thanksgiving, it is called peace offerings. Peace offerings are also called thanksgiving. And if one slaughters them for the sake of thanksgiving, it implies that they are fit for us."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא חטאת ששחטה לשם חטאת כשירה לשם עולה פסולה
human_translation: Rava says: A sin offering that one slaughtered for the sake of sin offering fit; for the sake of a burnt offering unfit.
llm_translation: Rava said: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for the sake of a sin-offering is valid; for the sake of a burnt-offering, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא (ויקרא ד, לג) ושחט אותה לחטאת אמר רחמנא והרי חטאת לשם חטאת נשחטה לשם עולה פסולה
human_translation: What is the reason The Merciful One states “And slaughter it for a sin offering” and sin offering was slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering, for the sake of a burnt offering unfit.
llm_translation: What is the reason? (Leviticus 4:33) "And he shall slaughter it as a sin offering." The Merciful One said, "Yet it was slaughtered as a sin offering, it is invalid for an elevation offering."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא חטאת ששחטה על מי שמחוייב חטאת פסולה על מי שמחוייב עולה כשרה
human_translation: And Rava says: A sin offering that one slaughtered for who obligated a sin offering, unfit. for who obligated a burnt offering, fit.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for one obligated to bring a sin-offering is invalid, but for one obligated to bring a burnt-offering it is valid.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא וכפר עליו עליו ולא על חבירו חבירו דומיא דידיה במחוייב כפרה כמותו
human_translation: What is the reason “And he shall be forgiven” he, who and not another The other similar to in he is obligated atonement similar to
llm_translation: What is the reason that "and he shall make atonement for him, and not for his fellow"? His fellow is similar to himself in that he is obligated to atone like him.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא חטאת ששחטה על מי שאינו מחוייב כלום פסולה שאין לך אדם בישראל שאינו מחוייב עשה
human_translation: And Rava says: A sin offering that one slaughtered for who is not obligated anything unfit, as there is no person among the Jewish people who is not obligated a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for one who is not obligated is invalid, for there is no person in Israel who is not obligated in a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא חטאת מכפרת על חייבי עשה מק"ו על חייבי כריתות מכפרת על חייבי עשה לא כל שכן
human_translation: And Rava says a sin offering atones for those obligated a positive mitzva, due to an a fortiori atones for those who are liable excision from the World-to-Come all the more so not for those liable a positive mitzva?
llm_translation: And Rava said: A sin-offering atones for those liable for positive commandments, how much more so for those liable for excisions, a sin-offering atones for those liable for positive commandments, certainly.

hebrew_text: למימרא דבת מינה היא והאמר רבא חטאת ששחטה על מי שמחוייב חטאת פסולה על מי שמחוייב עולה כשרה
human_translation: Is this to say that is of the same type as But doesn’t Rava say a sin offering that one slaughtered for who obligated a sin offering unfit, for who is obligated a burnt offering, fit,
llm_translation: To say that it is a daughter of a species, and Rava said: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for one obligated to bring a sin-offering is invalid for one obligated to bring a burnt-offering, it is valid.

hebrew_text: מקיבעא לא מכפרא מקופיא מכפרא
human_translation: does not atone by essence, atones incidentally.
llm_translation: Establishing does not atone, covering atones.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא עולה ששחטה שלא לשמה אסור לזרוק דמה שלא לשמה
human_translation: And Rava says: a burnt offering that one slaughtered not for its sake, it is prohibited to sprinkle its blood not for its sake.
llm_translation: And Rava said: An offering that was slaughtered not for its sake, it is forbidden to sprinkle its blood not for its sake.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא קרא איבעית אימא סברא איבעית אימא קרא (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך תשמור וגו' איבעית אימא סברא משום דשני בה כו' כדריש פירקא
human_translation: If you wish, cite a verse; if you wish, propose a logical argument. If you wish, cite a verse: “That which has gone out of your lips you shall observe If you wish, propose a logical argument: because deviated in its as the beginning of the chapter
llm_translation: If you say bring a proof from a verse, if you say bring a proof from reasoning, if you say bring a proof from a verse (Deuteronomy 23:24) "You shall keep what has gone out of your lips," if you say bring a proof from reasoning, because he repeated it, as it is interpreted.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא עולה הבאה לאחר מיתה שחטה בשינוי קודש פסולה בשינוי בעלים כשרה דאין בעלים לאחר מיתה
human_translation: And Rava says: a burnt offering that is brought after death, slaughtered it with a deviation offering, unfit, with a deviation owner, fit, as has no owner after death.
llm_translation: And Rava said: An olah offering that comes after death, if it was slaughtered with a change of intent for holiness, it is invalid; with a change of intent for ownership, it is valid, because there is no ownership after death.

hebrew_text: ורב פנחס בריה דרב אמי אמר יש בעלים לאחר מיתה אמר ליה רב אשי לרב פנחס בריה דרב אמי דוקא קאמר מר יש בעלים לאחר מיתה ובעי לאיתויי עולה אחריתי או דלמא דאי איכא כמה עשה גביה מכפרא
human_translation: And Rav Pineḥas, son of Rav Ami, says has an owner after death, Rav Ashi said to Rav Pineḥas, son of Rav Ami: Is the Master saying actually has an owner after death, and must bring another burnt offering, Or perhaps that if has several positive mitzvot, atones
llm_translation: Rav Pinchas, son of Rav Ami, said: There are owners after death. Rav Ashi said to Rav Pinchas, son of Rav Ami: Specifically, the Master is saying there are owners after death, and he wants to bring a final offering, or perhaps if there are many, the offering serves as atonement.

hebrew_text: א"ל דוקא קאמינא
human_translation: said to him: I am saying actually
llm_translation: I said to him specifically.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא עולה דורון היא היכי דמי אי דליכא תשובה (משלי כא, כז) זבח רשעים תועבה ואי דאיכא תשובה התניא עבר על מצות עשה ושב לא זז משם עד שמוחלים לו אלא ש"מ דורון הוא
human_translation: And Rava says: A burnt offering is a gift [ doron ] What are the circumstances If without repentance “the sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination” And if there is repentance, isn’t it taught violates a positive mitzva and repents, forgives him before he moves from Rather, conclude from it is a gift
llm_translation: And Rava said: A gift is like a burnt offering. How so? If there is no repentance, (Proverbs 21:27) "The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination." But if there is repentance, it was taught: If one transgressed a positive commandment and repented, he does not move from there until they forgive him. Rather, infer from this that a gift is like a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: (חטא"ת ע"ל מ"י מכפ"ר עול"ה לאח"ר דורו"ן סימ"ן)
human_translation: a mnemonic A sin offering atones for who, a burnt offering after a gift.
llm_translation: Sin offering atones for unintentional sins, burnt offering for transgressions after deliberation, and guilt offering for doubts.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי א"ר שמעון חטאת למה באה למה באה לכפר אלא למה באה לפני עולה לפרקליט שנכנס [ריצה פרקליט נכנס] דורון אחריו:
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Shimon said: For what is a sin offering brought? For what is it brought? to atone Rather, For what is it brought before a burnt offering to an advocate [ lifraklit ] who enters advocate has appeased gift is brought in after him.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says, "For what purpose does the sin offering come? It does not come to atone, rather, for what purpose does it come? It comes before the burnt offering, like a defense attorney who enters the courtroom, the gift offering follows after him."

hebrew_text: חוץ מן הפסח והחטאת כו': פסח מנלן
human_translation: except for the Paschal offering and the sin offering. From where do we a Paschal offering
llm_translation: Except for the Passover sacrifice and the sin offering, etc.: Where do we derive the Passover sacrifice from?

hebrew_text: דכתיב (דברים טז, א) שמור את חדש האביב ועשית פסח שיהו כל עשיותיו לשם פסח
human_translation: as it is written: “Observe the month of the spring and offer [ ve’asita ] the Paschal offering” that all of the actions [ asiyyotav ] of for the sake of Paschal offering.
llm_translation: As it is written (Deuteronomy 16:1), "Observe the month of the Aviv, and perform the Passover to the Lord your God, for in the month of the Aviv, the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night."

hebrew_text: אשכחן שינוי קודש שינוי בעלים מנלן
human_translation: We found deviation offering From where do we deviation owner
llm_translation: We found: "Shinuy Kodesh, Shinuy Baalim - from where do we derive this?"

hebrew_text: דכתיב (שמות יב, כז) ואמרתם זבח פסח הוא שתהא זביחה לשם פסח אם אינו ענין לשינוי קודש תניהו ענין לשינוי בעלים
human_translation: as it is written: “And you shall say: It is the sacrifice [ zevaḥ ] of Passover” that slaughter [ zeviḥa ] must be for the sake of Paschal offering. If is not to the matter deviation offering, apply it matter of deviation owner.
llm_translation: As it is written (Exodus 12:27), "And you shall say, 'It is the Passover sacrifice to the Lord, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt when He struck the Egyptians and saved our houses.'" If it is not a matter for changing sanctity, it is a matter for changing ownership.

hebrew_text: אשכחן למצוה לעכב מנלן
human_translation: We found for mitzva From where do we indispensable
llm_translation: We have found a commandment to delay, from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: אמר קרא (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח לה' אלהיך וגו'
human_translation: The verse states: “And you shall sacrifice [ vezavaḥta ] the Paschal offering unto the Lord, your God,
llm_translation: The verse says (Deuteronomy 16:2), "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, etc."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב ספרא האי וזבחת להכי הוא דאתא האי מיבעי ליה לכדרב נחמן דאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה מנין למותר פסח שקרב שלמים שנאמר (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח לה' אלהיך צאן ובקר והלא אין פסח בא אלא מן הכבשים ומן העזים מכאן למותר הפסח שיהא לדבר הבא מן הצאן ומן הבקר ומאי ניהו שלמים
human_translation: Rav Safra objects to this: Does this “And you shall sacrifice,” come to this It is necessary for of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: From where that a leftover Paschal offering, is sacrificed as a peace offering that is stated: “And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering unto the Lord, your God, of the flock and the herd.” But isn’t a Paschal offering brought only from the lambs and from the goats? From here that a leftover Paschal offering should be as brought from the flock and from the herd. And what is that? a peace offering.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Safra: "This one, 'and you shall sacrifice,' for this reason he came." This one requires it for him according to Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuhah said: From where is it derived that a Paschal offering that is brought as a peace offering is permissible? As it is stated (Deuteronomy 16:2), "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." But is not the Passover offering only from lambs and goats? From here it is derived that the Paschal offering should be for a matter that comes from sheep and cattle. And what are they? Peace offerings.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב ספרא וזבחת פסח לכדרב נחמן שמור את חדש האביב למצוה בשינוי קודש ואמרתם זבח פסח בשינוי בעלים למצוה הוא לעכב בין הכא והכא
human_translation: Rather, Rav Safra says “And you shall sacrifice the Paschal offering” of Rav Naḥman, “Observe the month of the spring a mitzva deviation offering. “And you shall say: the sacrifice of Passover” a mitzva deviation owner. “it is” both here and there, indispensable.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Safra said, "And you shall slaughter the Passover offering," according to Rav Nachman, "Observe the month of the Aviv for a mitzvah with the change of sanctity. And you shall say, 'The Passover offering with the change of ownership is a mitzvah to delay between here and there."

hebrew_text: ואשכחן זביחה שאר עבודות מנלן הואיל וגלי גלי
human_translation: And we found slaughter. From where do we other rites Since revealed revealed
llm_translation: And we found that slaughter, the rest of the services, from where? Since it is revealed, it is revealed.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר הואיל וגלי גלי לא אמרינן אלא [עבודות] מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה לעולה ולמנחה וגו'
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: We do not say since revealed revealed Rather, from where do we rites? as it is written: “This is the law of the burnt offering, and of the meal offering,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Since he revealed, we only say regarding Avodot. From where do we know this? As it is written (Leviticus 7:37): "This is the Torah of the burnt offering, the meal offering, etc."

hebrew_text: ותניא (ויקרא ז, לח) ביום צותו את בני ישראל להקריב את קרבניהם זה בכור ומעשר ופסח
human_translation: And it is taught “In the day that he commanded the children of Israel to present their offerings” this firstborn tithe, and Paschal offering,
llm_translation: "And it was taught (Leviticus 7:38), 'On the day He commanded the children of Israel to bring their sacrifices, this is the firstborn, the tithe, and the Passover.'"

hebrew_text: הקישו הכתוב לשלמים מה שלמים בין שינוי קודש בין שינוי בעלים בעינן למצוה אף כל בין שינוי קודש בין שינוי בעלים למצוה
human_translation: The text juxtaposes with a peace offering, just as a peace offering is required both deviation offering and deviation owner, as a mitzva, so too, any both deviation offering and deviation owner, as a mitzva.
llm_translation: The verse compared peace offerings to peace offerings, whether there is a change in sanctity or a change in ownership, we require it for the mitzvah, so too in all cases, whether there is a change in sanctity or a change in ownership, we require it for the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וכשלמים מה שלמים בין זביחה בין שאר עבודות לא חלקת בהן למצוה אף פסח לא תחלוק בו בין זביחה לשאר עבודות לעכב (משום שנאמר הוא בזביחה אינו אלא לעכב)
human_translation: And similar to a peace offering Just as a peace offering, you did not distinguish between slaughter and other rites with regard to mitzva so too, with regard to Paschal offering, do not distinguish between slaughter and other rites to indispensable.
llm_translation: "And as for peace offerings, what are peace offerings? Whether it is a slaughter or other types of service, you do not divide them for the mitzvah. Likewise, the Passover offering, you do not divide it whether for slaughter or other types of service to delay (because it is stated, 'It is for the slaughter,' which is only to delay)."

hebrew_text: אלא הוא למה לי
human_translation: Rather, why do I “it is”
llm_translation: Rather, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: כדתניא נאמר בפסח הוא בשחיטה לעכב אבל אשם לא נאמר בו הוא אלא לאחר הקטרת אימורין והוא עצמו שלא הוקטרו אימוריו כשר:
human_translation: As it is taught Concerning Paschal offering, “it is” is stated with regard to slaughter to indispensable. But a guilt offering, “it is” is stated only after the burning of sacrificial portions, and itself fit when its portions were not burned
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: It was stated regarding the Paschal offering that it is valid through slaughter, but regarding the guilt offering, it was not stated about it, rather only after the burning of the portions of the offering, and it itself, if its portions were not burned, is valid.

hebrew_text: חטאת מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא ד, לג) ושחט אותה לחטאת שתהא שחיטה לשם חטאת
human_translation: From where do we a sin offering as it is written: “And slaughter it for a sin offering” that slaughter must be for the sake of a sin offering.
llm_translation: Sin offering from where do we derive it? As it is written (Leviticus 4:33), "And he shall slaughter it for a sin offering." That the slaughtering should be for the sake of a sin offering.

hebrew_text: אשכחן שחיטה קבלה מנלן דכתיב

hebrew_text: דוחין קדשים הנאכלים אצל קדשים הנאכלין ואין דוחין קדשים הנאכלין אצל קדשים שאינן נאכלין

llm_translation: We push aside holy items that are eaten near holy items that are eaten, and we do not push aside holy items that are eaten near holy items that are not eaten.

human_translation: Rather, Offerings that are eaten by every person are diverted to offerings eaten by every person, But offerings eaten by every person are not diverted to offerings not eaten by every person,
llm_translation: Rather, we prioritize sacrificial items that are consumed by all people over sacrificial items that are consumed by all people, and we do not prioritize sacrificial items that are consumed by all people over sacrificial items that are not consumed by all people.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ברבי אבין אמר דוחין קדשים קלים אצל קדשים קלים ואין דוחין קדשים קלים אצל קדשי קדשים
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Avin, says Offerings of lesser sanctity are diverted to offerings of lesser sanctity, But offerings of lesser sanctity are not diverted to offerings of the most sacred order,

human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, says: the verse states “Then both it and that for which it is changed it, a substitute, but another not a substitute.
llm_translation: Said Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said: "It says in the verse (Leviticus 27:10), 'And it shall be, he and his substitute.' This is substitution, and there is no other substitution."

hebrew_text: ואימא שחטיה לשם תודה ליהוי כי תודה למאי הילכתא להטעינו לחם
human_translation: But say slaughtered for the sake of a thanks offering, let it be like a thanks offering. For what halakha it should require bread.
llm_translation: And say he slaughtered it for the sake of thanksgiving, to whom should the thanksgiving be directed? For what purpose should he load the bread?

hebrew_text: מי איכא מידי דפסח גופיה לא בעי לחם ומותרו בעי לחם
human_translation: Is there anything, that a Paschal offering itself does not require bread, but its leftover, requires bread
llm_translation: There is no need for anything of Passover itself, it does not require bread, and its fat is required to have bread.

hebrew_text: אי הכי השתא נמי מי איכא מידי דפסח גופיה לא בעי נסכים ומותרו בעי נסכים
human_translation: If so, now also Is there anything that a Paschal offering itself does not require libations, but its leftover requires libations
llm_translation: If so, now also, is there anything of the Passover itself that does not require libations, and it requires libations.

hebrew_text: אנן הכי קאמרינן מי איכא מידי דמותר תודה עצמה לא בעי לחם ואילו מותר דאתיא להו מעלמא בעיא לחם
human_translation: This we are saying: Is there anything that the leftover of a thanks offering itself does not require bread, but leftover from other requires bread?
llm_translation: We thus say: Is there anything that requires a thanksgiving offering itself does not require bread, whereas if it comes to them from elsewhere, it does require bread.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב [יימר] בריה דרב הילל וממאי דבמותר פסח כתיב דילמא במותר אשם כתיב
human_translation: Rav Yeimar, son of Rav Hillel, objects to this: But from where that is written with regard to a leftover Paschal offering? Perhaps it is written with regard to a leftover guilt offering;
llm_translation: He objects to her, Rav Yeimar son of Rav Hillel, and from where is it derived that in the case of a Paschal lamb that is permitted, it is written, perhaps it is written "permitted" in the case of a guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אמר קרא (ויקרא ג, ו) ואם מן הצאן קרבנו לזבח שלמים דבר השוה בכל הצאן
human_translation: Rava says: The verse states: “And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings is of [ min ] the flock,” that is equally from all flock,
llm_translation: Rava said, the verse says (Leviticus 3:6), "And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord be of the flock." This includes any animal from the flock.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה ר' אבין בר חייא ואיתימא ר' אבין בר כהנא בכל אתר את אמרת מן להוציא וכאן מן לרבות
human_translation: Rabbi Avin bar Ḥiyya, and some say Rabbi Avin bar Kahana, objects to this: You say everywhere “ min ” to exclude but here “ min ” to include
llm_translation: Challenges him Rabbi Avin bar Chiya, and some say Rabbi Avin bar Kahana: "In every place you said 'from' to exclude, and here 'from' to include."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' מני הכא נמי מן להוציא דלא אתי בן שתי שנים ולא אתי בנקיבה
human_translation: Rabbi Mani says: Here too, “ min ” to exclude as is not brought in its second year, and is not brought from female
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Mani: Here too, it is derived from "to bring out," that a boy of two years old does not come to the obligation of niddah.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב חנא בגדתאה ומי מצית אמרת דכי כתיב האי במותר פסח כתיב והא מדכתיב (ויקרא ג, ז) אם כשב (ויקרא ג, יב) אם עז מכלל דלאו במותר פסח כתיב
human_translation: Rav Ḥana of Baghdad objects to this: How can you say that when this is written, it is written with regard to a leftover Paschal offering? But from which is written “If a lamb” “if a goat” by inference that not written with regard to a leftover Paschal offering;
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Ḥanina of Bagdad, "And who ignites you say, for when it is written 'this is the Passover offering,' it is written, and when it is written 'if it is a sheep,' it is written, implying that it is not written 'this is the Passover offering.'"

hebrew_text: ההוא מיבעי ליה לכדתניא כבש לרבות את הפסח לאליה
human_translation: Those are necessary for that which is taught “lamb” to include the Paschal offering in tail
llm_translation: That one requires for him, as it was taught: "A lamb" to include the Passover offering for Elijah.

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר אם כבש לרבות פסח שעיברה שנתה ושלמים הבאים מחמת פסח לכל מצות שלמים שיטענו סמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק כשהוא אומר אם עז הפסיק הענין לימד על העז שאינה טעונה אליה
human_translation: When states: “If a lamb,” to include in all the mitzvot of peace offerings a Paschal offering whose year has passed and peace offerings brought due to a Paschal offering. that they require placing hands libations, and the waving of breast and thigh. And when states: if goat,” it interrupted the matter taught that the a goat does not require tail
llm_translation: When it says, "if a lamb," to include the Passover offering that has passed its year and peace offerings that come due to the Passover, for all peace offerings that require leaning, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh. When it says, "if a goat," it interrupts the matter to teach about the goat that does not require them.

hebrew_text: והא מהכא נפקא מדאבוה דשמואל נפקא דאמר אבוה דשמואל ואם מן הצאן קרבנו לזבח שלמים דבר הבא מן הצאן יהא לזבח שלמים
human_translation: But is it derived from here It is derived from that Shmuel’s father as Shmuel’s father says: “And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings is of the flock” that is brought from the flock, will be a sacrifice of peace offerings.
llm_translation: And from here it is derived from the father of Shmuel, it is derived, for the father of Shmuel said, "And if from the flock his offering for a peace offering, a matter that comes from the flock shall be for a peace offering."

hebrew_text: ואכתי מדרב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה נפקא דאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה מנין למותר פסח שקרב שלמים שנאמר (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח לה' אלהיך צאן ובקר והלא אין פסח בא אלא מן הכבשים ומן העזים אלא מכאן למותר הפסח שיהא לדבר הבא מן הצאן ומן הבקר ומאי ניהו שלמי
human_translation: But still derived from that which Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh says. As Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: From where that a leftover Paschal offering is sacrificed as a peace offering? As it is stated: “And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering unto the Lord, your God, of the flock and the herd” But isn’t a Paschal offering brought only from the lambs and from the goats? Rather, from here that a leftover Paschal offering should be brought from the flock and from the herd. And what is that? a peace offering.
llm_translation: And thus, from Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuhah came out, as Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuhah: From where do we derive that a Paschal offering may be brought from peace-offerings? As it is stated (Deuteronomy 16:2), "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." But is not the Paschal offering brought only from lambs and goats? Rather, from here we learn that the Paschal offering that it should be from the matter that comes from sheep and cattle. And what are they? Peace-offerings.

hebrew_text: אלא תלתא קראי כתיבי
human_translation: Rather, three verses are written
llm_translation: Rather, three verses are written.

hebrew_text: חד לעיברה זמנו ועיברה שנתו וחד לעיברה זמנו ולא שנתו וחד ללא עיברה לא זמנו ולא שנתו
human_translation: One its time has passed, and its year has passed, And one its time has passed, but not its year. And one neither its time nor its year has passed,
llm_translation: One for the leap year its time, and the leap year its year, and one for the leap year its time, but not its year, and one for neither its leap year nor its time, nor its year.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי כתב רחמנא חד הוה אמינא היכא דעיברה שנתו וזמנו דאידחי מפסח לגמרי אבל עיברה זמנו ולא שנתו דחזי לפסח שני אימא לא
human_translation: And are necessary. As, had the Merciful One written one I would say where its year and its time have passed. as it was completely rejected from a Paschal offering. But its time has passed, but its year not which fit to second Pesaḥ , I would say not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if the Merciful One had written "one," I would have said: Wherever his time and his year passed, and the time for Passover was completely missed. But if his time passed and not his year, for he sees the second Passover, I would say no.

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא הני תרתי משום דאידחי להו ממילתייהו אבל היכא דלא עבר לא זמנו ולא שנתו דחזי לפסח אימא לא צריכי:
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written these two as they were rejected from their status But where neither its time nor its year have passed, which fit to a Paschal offering I would say not are necessary.
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One had written these two cases because they are pushed aside from their matter, but where it did not pass, neither its time nor its year, and it sees the time of Passover, say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: אמר רב משמיה דמבוג חטאת ששחטה לשום חטאת נחשון כשירה דאמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יח) זאת תורת החטאת תורה אחת לכל החטאות
human_translation: Rav says in the name of Mavog: A sin offering that slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering of Nahshon, fit as the verse states: “This is the law of the sin offering” one law for all the sin offerings.
llm_translation: Rav said in the name of Mivug: If one slaughtered a sin-offering for the sake of a sin-offering of Nahshon, it is valid, as the verse states, "This is the law of the sin-offering; it is one law for all sin-offerings." (Leviticus 6:18)

hebrew_text: יתיב רבא וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רב משרשיא לרבא רבי שמעון אומר כל המנחות שנקמצו שלא לשמן כשירות ועלו לבעלים לשום חובה
human_translation: Rava sat and stated this halakha Rav Mesharshiyya raised an objection to Rava Rabbi Shimon says: All meal offerings from which a handful was removed not for their sake are fit, and satisfied the obligation of the owner,
llm_translation: Rava was sitting and saying to her, to that teaching. Rav Mesharshia raised an objection to Rava: Rabbi Shimon says, "All meal offerings that became leavened not for the sake of their oil are valid, and they ascend to the owners as a gift."

hebrew_text: לפי שאין המנחות דומות לזבחים שהקומץ מחבת לשם מרחשת מעשיה מוכיחין עליה שהיא מחבת חריבה לשם בלולה מעשיה מוכיחין שהיא חריבה
human_translation: because meal offerings are not similar to slaughtered offerings. As, if one removes a handful pan for the sake of a deep pan, its preparation proves that it is pan. a dry for the sake of mixed its preparation proves that it is a dry
llm_translation: Due to the fact that the meal offerings are not similar to the sacrifices, for the handful is taken from the pan to the altar, its action proves that it is a pan of burning for the sake of mixing. Its action proves that it is burning.

hebrew_text: אבל בזבחים אינו כן שחיטה אחת לכולן קבלה אחת לכולן זריקה אחת לכולן
human_translation: But with regard to slaughtered offerings this is not so. one slaughter for all of one collection for all of them, one sprinkling for all of them.
llm_translation: But in sacrifices, it is not so. One slaughtering for all, one receiving for all, one sprinkling for all.

hebrew_text: טעמא דמעשיה מוכיחין הא אין מעשיה מוכיחין לא אמאי לימא (ויקרא ו, ז) זאת תורת המנחה תורה אחת לכל המנחות
human_translation: The reason is that its preparation proves But its preparation does not prove not Why let us say “This is the law of the meal offering” one law for all of the meal offerings,
llm_translation: Reason of his action proves this, but action does not prove this. No! Why not say (Leviticus 6:7) "This is the law of the meal offering; it is one law for all meal offerings."

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר הכי איתמר אמר רב משמיה דמבוג חטאת ששחטה על מנת שיתכפר בה נחשון כשירה אין כפרה למתים
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated like this: Rav says in the name of Mavog: A sin offering that one slaughtered on the condition that Nahshon, be atoned for by it is fit; there is no atonement for the dead.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rav said in the name of Mivug: A sin-offering that was slaughtered with the intention of achieving atonement for it is valid; there is no atonement for the deceased.

hebrew_text: ולימא מת בעלמא
human_translation: But Let him state a dead in general.
llm_translation: And let us say, "Death in general."

hebrew_text: הא קמ"ל טעמא דמת הא דחי דומיא דנחשון פסולה ומאי ניהו חטאת נזיר וחטאת מצורע
human_translation: This teaches us the reason is that he is dead. Consequently, a living similar to Nahshon, unfit. And what is that? a nazirite’s sin offering or a leper’s sin offering,
llm_translation: This teaches the reason why the dead is similar to the living, like the case of Nahshon, it is disqualified. And what are they? The sin-offering of a Nazirite and the sin-offering of a leper.

hebrew_text: הני עולות נינהו
human_translation: These are burnt offerings,
