llm_translation: These are the burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר הכי איתמר אמר רב משמיה דמבוג חטאת ששחטה על שמחוייב חטאת כנחשון כשירה חטאת נחשון עולה היא
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, it was stated like this: Rav says in the name of Mavog: A sin offering that one slaughtered for one who is obligated to bring a sin offering similar to Nahshon fit; Nahshon’s sin offering is a burnt offering.
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav said in the name of Mivug: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for one who is obligated to bring a sin-offering, like the offering of Nahshon, is valid. The sin-offering of Nahshon is an elevation-offering.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמר אמר רב משמיה דמבוג חטאת ששחטה לשם חטאת נחשון פסולה חטאת נחשון עולה היא
human_translation: There is who says Rav says in the name of Mavog: A sin offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering of Nahshon unfit. a sin offering of Nahshon is a burnt offering,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav said in the name of Mivug: If one slaughtered a sin-offering for the sake of a sin-offering, it is invalid. It is an elevation-offering.

hebrew_text: ולימא חטאת נזיר וחטאת מצורע עיקר חטאת נקט
human_translation: But Let him say a nazirite’s sin offering and a leper’s sin offering, cited the primary sin offering,
llm_translation: And let us say, the sin offering of a Nazirite and the sin offering of a leper, the primary sin offering is designated.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חטאת חלב ששחטה לשם חטאת דם לשם חטאת עבודה זרה כשירה
human_translation: Rav says: A sin offering fat that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering blood, for the sake of a sin offering idol worship, is fit;
llm_translation: Rav said: A sin-offering of fat, if one slaughtered it for the sake of a sin-offering, its blood for the sake of idolatrous worship, it is valid.

hebrew_text: לשם חטאת נזיר לשם חטאת מצורע פסולה הני עולות נינהו
human_translation: for the sake of a nazirite’s sin offering, for the sake of a leper’s sin offering, unfit; these are burnt offerings,
llm_translation: For the sake of a sin-offering of a Nazirite, for the sake of a sin-offering of a leper, they are disqualified, these burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא חטאת חלב ששחטה לשם חטאת דטומאת מקדש וקדשיו מהו מי אמרינן כרת כמותה
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: a sin offering fat that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial what is Do we say karet similar to
llm_translation: Rava asked: If one slaughters a sin-offering of fat for the sake of a sin-offering of impurity, what is the law regarding the sanctity and its consecrated items? Do we say that it is liable to excision like it?

hebrew_text: או דילמא אין קבוע כמותה
human_translation: Or perhaps not a set like
llm_translation: Or perhaps it is not fixed like it.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בריה דרבא מתני כולהו לפסולא מ"ט (ויקרא ד, לג) ושחט אותה לחטאת לשם אותה חטאת
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches all of unfit. What is the reason? “And slaughter it [ otah ] for a sin offering” for the sake of that [ otah ] sin offering,
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches: All of them are invalid. What is the reason? "And he shall slaughter it for a sin offering" (Leviticus 4:33) - for the sake of that sin offering.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי לרב אחא בריה דרבא [בעיא דרבא] היכי מתניתו לה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Aḥa, son of Rava: How do you teach Rava’s dilemma?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Acha, son of Rava Baya deRava, "How do you explain his teaching?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אנן בשינוי בעלים מתנינן לה [והכי מתנינן לה] אמר רבא חטאת חלב ששחטה על מי שמחוייב חטאת דם וחטאת עבודת כוכבים פסולה על מי שמחוייב חטאת נזיר וחטאת מצורע כשירה
human_translation: said to him: We teach with regard to deviation owner And this is how we teach it: Rava says: A sin offering fat that one slaughtered for who is obligated a sin offering blood, or a sin offering idol worship, unfit. for one who is obligated a nazirite’s sin offering or a leper’s sin offering, fit,
llm_translation: He said to him, "We teach it in the case of a change of owners." And so we teach it. Rava said: A sin-offering of fat that was slaughtered for one who is obligated in a sin-offering of blood and a sin-offering of idol worship is invalid. But if it was slaughtered for one who is obligated in a sin-offering of a Nazirite or a sin-offering of a leper, it is valid.

hebrew_text: ובעיין לה הכי בעי רבא חטאת חלב ששחטה על מי שמחוייב חטאת דטומאת מקדש וקדשיו מהו מי אמרי' כרת כמותה או דילמא אין קבוע כמותה
human_translation: And we pose the dilemma like this: Rava raises a dilemma: a sin offering fat that one slaughtered for one who is obligated a sin offering for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial what is Do we say karet , similar to Or perhaps not a set like
llm_translation: And Rava inquired thus: Rava inquired about a sin offering of fat that was slaughtered for one who is obligated in a sin offering for impurity of the sanctuary and its consecrated items - what is the law? Do we say that its punishment is like its measure, or perhaps its measure is not fixed?

hebrew_text: תיקו:
human_translation: shall stand
llm_translation: The case remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: איתמר שחטה לשמה לזרוק דמה שלא לשמה רבי יוחנן אמר פסולה וריש לקיש אמר כשירה
human_translation: It was stated: slaughtered for its sake to sprinkle its blood not for its sake Rabbi Yoḥanan says unfit, and Reish Lakish says fit.
llm_translation: It was stated: If one slaughtered an animal for the sake of the offering, intending to throw its blood on the altar, but not for the sake of the offering, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is invalid, and Reish Lakish said: It is valid.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר פסולה מחשבין מעבודה לעבודה וילפינן ממחשבת פיגול
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says unfit, one can have intention from rite to rite, And we derive from intent of piggul ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Invalid is calculated from one service to another, and we learn from the thought of Pigul."

hebrew_text: ור"ל אמר כשירה אין מחשבין מעבודה לעבודה ולא ילפינן ממחשבת פיגול
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says fit, one cannot have intention from rite to rite, and we do not derive from intent of piggul .
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: "When it is valid, one does not calculate from one service to another, and we do not learn from the thought of Pigul."

hebrew_text: ואזדו לטעמייהו דאיתמר
human_translation: And follow [ ve’azdu ] their reasoning as it was stated:
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons that were stated.

hebrew_text: השוחט את הבהמה ע"מ לזרוק דמה לעבודת כוכבים ולהקטיר חלבה לעבודת כוכבים ר' יוחנן אמר אסורה מחשבין מעבודה לעבודה וילפינן חוץ מפנים
human_translation: one who slaughters an animal in order to sprinkle its blood for idol worship, or to burn its fat for idol worship, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: prohibited, one can have intention from rite to rite; And we derive outside from inside
llm_translation: The one who slaughters the animal in order to sprinkle its blood for idol worship and to burn its fat for idol worship, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is prohibited to calculate from one act of worship to another, and we flog him except for lashes.

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר מותרת אין מחשבין מעבודה לעבודה ולא ילפינן חוץ מפנים
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: permitted. One cannot have intention from rite to rite, and we do not derive outside from inside
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Permitted, not calculate from work to work, and not we shall teach except from inside."

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן בהא בהא אמר ריש לקיש אבל פנים מפנים אימא מודי ליה לרבי יוחנן
human_translation: And if had taught us with regard to that Reish Lakish says with regard to that But say he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan inside from inside
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this, in this, Reish Lakish said, but face to face, say, let Rabbi Yochanan concede.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הא בהא קאמר רבי יוחנן אבל בההיא אימא מודי ליה לריש לקיש צריכי
human_translation: And if had taught us this Rabbi Yoḥanan says with regard to this But with regard to that say he concedes to Reish Lakish are necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to say this, in this case Rabbi Yochanan is saying, but in that case say it is necessary for Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר מתיב רב ירמיה לסיועיה לרבי יוחנן ורבי אילא לסיועיה לריש לקיש
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Rav Yirmeya responds to support Rabbi Yoḥanan; and Rabbi Ila to support Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rav Yirmiyah raised an objection to assist Rabbi Yochanan, and Rabbi Ila raised an objection to assist Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: רב ירמיה לסיועיה לרבי יוחנן ומה במקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט חוץ לזמנו שהוא כשר שחטו על מנת לזרוק דמו חוץ לזמנו פסול מקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט שלא לשמו פסול שחטו על מנת לזרוק דמו שלא לשמו אינו דין שיהא פסול
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya to support Rabbi Yoḥanan Just as in case where if said: I am hereby slaughtering beyond its time, fit, slaughtered it in order to sprinkle its blood beyond its time, unfit, case where if he said: I am hereby slaughtering not for its sake, unfit, isn’t it logical that he slaughtered it in order to sprinkle its blood not for its sake, it should be unfit?
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiyah to assist him to Rabbi Yochanan: And what is the law in a case where if one said, "I will slaughter this animal outside of its designated time," it is valid; he slaughtered it with the intention of throwing its blood outside of its designated time - it is invalid. In a case where if one said, "I will slaughter it not for its sake," it is invalid; he slaughtered it with the intention of throwing its blood not for its sake - it is not the law that it should be invalid.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבא בר אהילאי מה לחוץ לזמנו שכן כרת
human_translation: Rava bar Ahilai objects to this What about beyond its time? in that karet ,
llm_translation: Rava bar Ahilai objects to her: "What is external to its time, is thus excised."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא בר אהילאי הכי קאמר ומה מקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט חוץ למקומו שהוא כשר שחטו על מנת לזרוק דמו חוץ למקומו פסול מקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט שלא לשמו שהוא פסול [שחטו ע"מ] לזרוק דמו שלא לשמו אינו דין שיהא פסול
human_translation: Rather, Rava bar Ahilai says: this he is saying: Just as case where if said: I am hereby slaughtering outside its area, it is fit, slaughtered it in order to sprinkle its blood outside its area, unfit, case where if he said: I am hereby slaughtering not for its sake, it is unfit, isn’t it logical that he slaughtered it in order to sprinkle its blood not for its sake, it should be unfit?
llm_translation: Rather, Rava son of Ahilai said thus: And what is the law in a case where if one said, "I will slaughter this animal outside of its designated place," it is valid, but if he slaughtered it with the intention of throwing its blood outside of its designated place, it is invalid? In a case where if one said, "I will slaughter this animal not for its sake," it is invalid, but if he slaughtered it in order to throw its blood not for its sake, it is not a valid judgment that it should be invalid.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אשי מה לחוץ למקומו שכן נוהג בכל הזבחים תאמר בשלא לשמו שאינו נוהג אלא בפסח וחטאת
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this What about outside its area? in that applies to all slaughtered offerings. Can you say not for its sake, which applies only to a Paschal offering and a sin offering?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi objects to her: "What about the external altar? For it is the practice with all sacrifices." You shall say: "Regarding something not for its sake, which is only practiced with the Paschal offering and the sin offering."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי הכי קאמר ומה במקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט לשם פלוני שהוא כשר לזרוק דמו (שלא לשמו) לשם פלוני פסול מקום שאם אמר הריני שוחט שלא לשמן שהוא פסול [שחטו ע"מ] לזרוק דמן שלא לשמן אינו דין שיהא פסול
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says: This is saying: Just as in case where, if said: I am hereby slaughtering for the sake of so-and-so, it is fit, to sprinkle its blood for the sake of so-and-so, unfit, case where if he said: I am hereby slaughtering not for its sake, it is unfit, isn’t it logical that he slaughtered it in order to sprinkle its blood not for its sake, it should be unfit?
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said this: Just as in a case where if one says, "I am slaughtering for the sake of so-and-so," who is fit, his blood is invalid if it is thrown for the sake of so-and-so (i.e., not for its intended purpose), in a case where if one says, "I am slaughtering not for its sake," which is invalid, if he slaughtered it in order to throw the blood not for its sake, it is not the law that it should be invalid.

hebrew_text: רבי אילא לסיועיה לריש לקיש לא תאמר בזריקה ותיתי מק"ו מבינייא משחיטה וקבלה למאי הלכתא כתב רחמנא לומר דאין מחשבין מעבודה לעבודה
human_translation: Rabbi Ila to support Reish Lakish, should not have stated with regard to sprinkling and should have derive by an a fortiori from common of from slaughter and collection for what halakha does the Merciful One write to say that one cannot have intention from rite to rite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila assisted Reish Lakish: Do not say regarding throwing and coming, "from where do we know?" Rather, from slaughtering and receiving. For what halakha? The Merciful One wrote to say that we do not calculate from one service to another.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא ודלמא דמחשבין מעבודה לעבודה
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this But perhaps that one can have intention from rite to rite.
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to this: "But perhaps one might think that we calculate from one service to another."

hebrew_text: אם כן לשתוק קרא מיניה ותיתי מקל וחומר דרב אשי
human_translation: If that were so, let the verse remain silent with regard to and one could derive from Rav Ashi’s a fortiori
llm_translation: If so, to be silent, the verse from him reads, and I will bring a proof and a stringency of Rav Ashi.

hebrew_text: ואידך פריך הכי מה להנך שכן טעונות צפון וישנן בחטאות הפנימיות
human_translation: And the other would refute like this: What about these? in that they must north And they are in the inner sin offerings
llm_translation: And the other one asked thus: What about those that dwell in the north, and they are involved in the inner sins.

hebrew_text: ואידך השתא מיהא בשלמים קיימין
human_translation: And the other now, in any event, we stand with regard to peace offerings,
llm_translation: And the other one now, they are established in peace.

hebrew_text: איתמר שחטה לשמה לזרוק דמה שלא לשמה רב נחמן אמר פסולה רבה אמר כשרה והדר ביה רבה לגבי רב נחמן מק"ו דרב אשי:
human_translation: was stated: slaughtered for its sake to sprinkle its blood not for its sake, Rav Naḥman says unfit, Rabba says fit. And Rabba retracted his to Rav Naḥman, due to Rav Ashi’s a fortiori
llm_translation: It was stated: If one slaughtered an animal for the sake of the offering but with the intention to throw its blood for a different purpose, Rav Nachman said: It is invalid, Rabba said: It is valid. Rabba then retracted his opinion in favor of Rav Nachman, in accordance with the view of Rav Ashi.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר אף (את) האשם: תניא אומר ר' אליעזר חטאת באה על חטא ואשם בא על חטא מה חטאת שלא לשמה פסולה אף אשם שלא לשמו פסול
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The guilt offering, too, it is taught Rabbi Eliezer said: A sin offering is brought for a transgression and a guilt offering is brought for a transgression. Just as a sin offering not for its sake unfit, so too, a guilt offering not for its sake unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even the Asham. It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, the sin-offering comes for a sin, and the guilt-offering comes for a sin. Just as a sin-offering that is not for its sake is invalid, so too a guilt-offering that is not for its sake is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע לא אם אמרת בחטאת שכן דמה למעלה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: not If you say with regard to a sin offering, whose blood above
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: No, if you say "in the sin offering," for it is similar above.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר פסח יוכיח שדמו למטה ושחטו שלא לשמו פסול
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: A Paschal offering can prove as its blood is below and slaughtered it not for its sake unfit.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Eliezer: "The Passover offering will prove that if its blood is below and it is slaughtered not for its sake, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע מה לפסח שכן זמנו קבוע
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: What about a Paschal offering? in that its time is fixed.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua, "What for Passover that its time is fixed."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר חטאת תוכיח
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: A sin offering can prove
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Eliezer, "The sin offering shall prove it."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him:
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Joshua

hebrew_text: חוזרני חלילה
human_translation: I return around [ ḥalila ]
llm_translation: Returning, God forbid.

hebrew_text: חזר רבי אליעזר ודנו דין אחר חטאת נאמר בה היא בשחיטה היא לשמה כשירה שלא לשמה פסולה ופסח נאמר בו הוא בזביחה הוא לשמו כשר שלא לשמו פסול
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer then presented a different logical inference: With regard to a sin offering, “it” is stated concerning slaughter, it for its sake fit; not for its sake unfit. And with regard to a Paschal offering, “it” is stated concerning slaughter [ zeviḥa ], it for its sake fit; not for its sake unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer reconsidered and judged another case: regarding a sin-offering, it was stated about it, "it is for the purpose of slaughter, it is valid; for not the purpose of slaughter, it is invalid." And regarding the Passover offering, it was stated about it, "it is for his sake in the slaughter, it is valid; for not his sake, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: אף אשם נאמר בו הוא הוא לשמו כשר שלא לשמו פסול
human_translation: “it” is stated with regard to a guilt offering as well, it for its sake fit; not for its sake unfit.
llm_translation: Even "guilt-offering" is said in it, "it is it" for its name, valid; not for its name, invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע חטאת נאמר בה היא בשחיטה היא לשמה כשרה שלא לשמה פסולה פסח נאמר בו הוא בזביחה הוא לשמו כשר שלא לשמו פסול אבל אשם לא נאמר בו הוא אלא לאחר הקטרת אימורין והוא עצמו שלא הוקטרו אימורין כשר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: With regard to a sin offering, “it” is stated concerning slaughter, it for its sake fit, not for its sake unfit. With regard to a Paschal offering “it” is stated concerning slaughter, it for its sake fit, not for its sake unfit. But with regard to a guilt offering, “it” is stated only after the burning of sacrificial portions. And itself is fit sacrificial portions were not burned
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehoshua: "A sin-offering, it was stated regarding it, it is valid for its sake; if not for its sake, it is invalid. A Passover offering, it was stated regarding it, it is for its slaughter; if not for its slaughter, it is invalid. But a guilt-offering, it was not stated regarding it, rather, after the offering of the handful of frankincense, and it itself, if its handful of frankincense was not offered, it is valid."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' אליעזר הרי אומר (ויקרא ו, י) כחטאת כאשם מה חטאת שלא לשמו פסול אף אשם שלא לשמו פסול
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: states: “As is the sin offering, so is the guilt offering” just as a sin offering not for its sake unfit, so too, a guilt offering not for its sake unfit.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: Behold I say (Leviticus 6:10) "As the sin offering, so is the guilt offering." Just as a sin offering that is not for its sake is invalid, so too a guilt offering that is not for its sake is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אמר לו ר' יהושע חוזרני חלילה ולמיהדר דינא ולייתי במה הצד
human_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: I return around And let the derivation revert and let derive by the common element
llm_translation: The Master said, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "Heaven forbid! I retract, and the judgment is reversed, and let it be brought in what way the side."

hebrew_text: משום דאיכא למיפרך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן יש בהן צד כרת
human_translation: as it can be refuted: What about their common element? in that they have an element of karet .
llm_translation: Because there is to refute "what is the equal side in them, so there is in them a side of excision."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' יהושע לא אם אמרת בחטאת שכן דמה למעלה ולימא ליה לא אם אמרת בחטאת שכן נכנס דמה לפני ולפנים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: not If you say with regard to a sin offering, whose blood is above And let say to him not if you say with regard to a sin offering, whose blood enters the innermost sanctum,
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: No, if you say regarding a sin offering, that its blood is above, then say to him: No, if you say regarding a sin offering, that its blood enters before and before.

hebrew_text: בחטאות החיצונות קאמרינן
human_translation: We are stating with regard to the external sin offerings,
llm_translation: In the outer sins we are speaking.

hebrew_text: שאם נכנס דמה [לפני] ולפנים פסולה
human_translation: as, if the blood of enters the innermost sanctum, disqualified.
llm_translation: If entered its blood before and inside disqualified.

hebrew_text: אית ליה לרבי אליעזר אף האשם
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer holds a guilt offering also
llm_translation: He has to Rabbi Eliezer also the guilt offering.

hebrew_text: שכן מכפרת על חייבי כריתות
human_translation: as atones for liable to karet
llm_translation: So too, it atones for those liable for excisions.

hebrew_text: מחטאת דשמיעת הקול
human_translation: from a sin offering for hearing the voice,
llm_translation: Sin offering of hearing the voice

hebrew_text: שכן טעונה ארבע מתנות
human_translation: that requires four placements
llm_translation: So too required four gifts.

hebrew_text: כרבי ישמעאל דאמר כל הדמים טעונה ארבע מתנות
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who says the blood all requires four placements.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yishmael said: "All blood requires four gifts."

hebrew_text: (שכן טעונה) על ארבע קרנות
human_translation: that requires on four corners
llm_translation: (שכן טעונה) על ארבע קרנות "Because it requires" on four horns.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך האיכא אצבע האיכא קרן האיכא חודה אלא חד מתרי תלת טעמי נקט
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, Isn’t there finger? Isn’t there corner isn’t there the edge of Rather, mentioned one of two three claims
llm_translation: And to your taste, there is a finger, there is a horn, there is a hole. Rather, one of the two, three tastes is taken.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אמר לו ר' יהושע לא אם אמרת לימא ליה רבי אליעזר אשם נמי דמו למעלה
human_translation: The Master says: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: not If you say Let Rabbi Eliezer say to him: The blood of a guilt offering is also above
llm_translation: Said Mar, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you were to say to him, "Rabbi Eliezer, his guilt-offering is also above."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אשם דמו למעלה לא מצית אמרת ק"ו מעולה ומה עולה שהיא כליל דמה למטה אשם שאינו כליל לא כל שכן
human_translation: Abaye said: You cannot say the blood of a guilt offering is above an a fortiori from a burnt offering: Just as a burnt offering, which is consumed its blood below all the more so not a guilt offering, which is not consumed
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "The guilt-offering whose blood is above, you do not find it. You said: 'Is it not all the more so above?' Above, which is complete, is similar to below, the guilt-offering which is not complete. All the more so."

hebrew_text: מה לעולה שכן אינה מכפרת
human_translation: What about a burnt offering? in that it does not atone
llm_translation: What for burnt-offering so it does not atone

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף תוכיח
human_translation: A bird sin offering can prove
llm_translation: Sin-offering of bird shall prove

hebrew_text: מה לחטאת העוף שכן אינה מין זבח
human_translation: What about a bird sin offering? in that it is not a type of offering slaughtered;
llm_translation: What for the sin-offering of a bird, for thus it is not a kind of sacrifice.

hebrew_text: עולה תוכיח לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן קדשי קדשים ודמן למטה אף אני אביא אשם שהוא קודש קדשים ודמו למטה
human_translation: a burnt offering can prove The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are offerings of the most sacred order, and their blood is below So too, I shall include a guilt offering as it is an offering of the most sacred order, and its blood is below
llm_translation: Offering will prove not evidence this like evidence this and not evidence this like evidence this the side equal in them that they are holy of holies and its blood below also I will bring guilt offering that is holy of holies and its blood below

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא מפרזקיא לרב אשי ולפרוך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן אין להן קצבה תאמר באשם שיש לו קצבה
human_translation: Rava of Parzakya said to Rav Ashi: Let refute What about the common element of in that neither has a fixed you say to a guilt offering, which has a fixed
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ashi and to P'rook: "What about the equal side of them, for they do not have a fixed measure. You shall say regarding the guilt-offering, which has a fixed measure."

hebrew_text: אלא היינו טעמא דרבי אליעזר דאמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יט) הכהן המחטא אותה אותה דמה למעלה ואין דמו של אחר למעלה
human_translation: Rather, this is Rabbi Eliezer’s reason As the verse states “The priest who offers it” its blood above but the blood of another not above
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason according to Rabbi Eliezer who said: The verse states (Leviticus 6:19), "The priest who sins, bringing guilt upon the people." "Upon her" - her blood is above, and the blood of another is not above.

hebrew_text: אי הכי חטאת נמי נימא אותה לשמה כשרה שלא לשמה פסולה הא שאר זבחים בין לשמן בין שלא לשמן כשרין
human_translation: If so, let him also say it a sin offering is fit for its sake, unfit not for its sake. Consequently, other slaughtered offerings, whether for their sake or not for their sake, are fit.
llm_translation: If so, the sin offering also should we say is valid for its sake; for its sake it is valid, not for its sake it is invalid. But other sacrifices, whether offered for its sake or not for its sake, are valid.

hebrew_text: ההוא אותה לאו דוקא דהא שייר פסח
human_translation: That “it” not specifically as excludes Paschal offering
llm_translation: That one, that not specifically that because leave Passover.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי לאו דוקא דהא שייר עולת העוף
human_translation: here too, not specifically as excludes a bird burnt offering
llm_translation: Here also not specifically that it remains a burnt offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: בזביחה מיהא לא שייר מידי
human_translation: With regard to slaughter, in any event, excluded nothing
llm_translation: In slaughtering, water does not leave anything.

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא הא מני רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון היא דאמר האי מקום לחוד והאי מקום לחוד
human_translation: And if you wish, say whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says: This place discrete, and that place discrete.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This is the opinion of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, for he said: "This place is for alone, and that place is for alone."

hebrew_text: דתניא דמים התחתונים ניתנין מחוט הסיקרא ולמטה והעליונים מחוט הסיקרא ולמעלה אמר רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון במה דברים אמורין בעולת העוף אבל בחטאת בהמה היא עצמה אין נעשה אלא על גופה של קרן:
human_translation: As it is taught The blood the lower is placed from the red [ hasikra ] line and below, and the upper from the red line and above. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said: In what is this statement said? with regard to a bird burnt offering. But an animal sin offering is itself performed only on the actual corner
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: The lower blood is placed below the crimson thread, and the upper blood is placed above the crimson thread. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said: In what case are these words said? In the case of a bird offering. But in the case of a sin offering of an animal itself, it is only done on the body of its horn.

hebrew_text: תנן התם שהיה רבי עקיבא אומר כל דמים שנכנסו להיכל לכפר פסולים וחכמים אומרים חטאת בלבד רבי אליעזר אומר אף האשם שנאמר כחטאת כאשם
human_translation: We learned elsewhere As Rabbi Akiva would say: Any blood that entered to atone in the Sanctuary unfit. And the Rabbis say: only a sin offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: a guilt offering also as it is stated: “As is the sin offering, so is the guilt offering”
llm_translation: We learned there (in a different place) that Rabbi Akiva used to say: "All bloods that entered the sanctuary to atone are disqualified." And the sages say: "Only the sin offering." Rabbi Eliezer says: "Even the guilt offering, as it is stated, 'Like the sin offering, so is the guilt offering.'"

hebrew_text: בשלמא רבי אליעזר כדקאמר טעמא אלא רבנן מאי טעמא
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Eliezer as he states the reason But what is the reason the Rabbis?
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as he said, "The reason is..." But according to the Rabbis, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אשם נכנס דמו לפנים פסול לא מצית אמרת קל וחומר מעולה מה
human_translation: Rava said: You cannot say the blood of a guilt offering that entered into disqualified, an a fortiori from a burnt offering: Just as
llm_translation: Rava said: "If the blood of a guilt-offering entered inside, it is disqualified. Shouldn't you infer a fortiori reasoning from the case of a burnt-offering, how much more so..."

hebrew_text: עולה שהיא כליל נכנס דמה לפנים כשרה אשם שאינו כליל לא כ"ש
human_translation: a burnt offering, which is consumed its blood enters into fit, a guilt offering, which is not consumed all the more so not
llm_translation: Offering that is whole enters its blood inside valid guilt-offering that is not whole, needless to say.

hebrew_text: מה לעולה שכן אינה מכפרת
human_translation: What about a burnt offering? in that it does not atone
llm_translation: What for burnt-offering so it does not atone

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא תוכיח
human_translation: The meal offering of a sinner can prove
llm_translation: The meal offering of a sinner shall prove.

hebrew_text: ולימא חטאת העוף תוכיח חטאת העוף בעיא דרבי אבין היא
human_translation: But let us say a bird sin offering can prove a bird sin offering is a dilemma by Rabbi Avin.
llm_translation: And let it say, "Chatat ha'of" - "Chatat ha'of" should prove it. It is a question of Rabbi Avin.

hebrew_text: ולפרוך מה למנחת חוטא שכן אינה מין זבח
human_translation: But let us refute What about a sinner’s meal offering? in that it is not a type of slaughtered offering.
llm_translation: And to differentiate what for the Minchat Chotei, for it is not a type of sacrifice.

hebrew_text: עולה תוכיח וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן קדשי קדשים ונכנס (דמן) לפנים כשרין אף אני אביא אשם שהוא קודש קדשים ונכנס דמו לפנים כשר
human_translation: a burnt offering can prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are offerings of the most sacred order, and enter into they are fit. So too, I shall include a guilt offering since it is an offering of the most sacred order, its blood enters into fit.
llm_translation: The burnt-offering will rebuke, and the judgment returned; this proof is not like that proof, and not like that proof. The equal side in them, which are most holy, and its blood entered inside, are valid. I too will bring a guilt-offering, which is most holy, and its blood entered inside, is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא מברניש לרב אשי ולפרוך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן אין להן קצבה תאמר באשם שיש לו קצבה
human_translation: Rava of Barnish said to Rav Ashi: But let us refute What about their common element? in that neither has a fixed Should you say to a guilt offering, which has a fixed
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ashi and to P'rook: "What about the equalizing side in them, for they do not have a fixed measure? Should you say regarding the guilt-offering, which has a fixed measure?"

hebrew_text: אלא היינו טעמייהו דרבנן דאמר קרא דמה דמה של זו ולא דמה של אחר
human_translation: Rather, this is the reason of the Rabbis: As the verse states: whose blood the blood of this and not the blood of another
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reasoning of the Rabbis, for it is stated: "Like this likeness" and not like the likeness of another.

hebrew_text: ואידך דמה ולא בשרה
human_translation: And the other its blood but not its flesh.
llm_translation: And the other opinion is: "What is the case of 'blood' but not 'flesh'?"

hebrew_text: ואידך דם דמה
human_translation: And the other Blood, “Whose blood.”
llm_translation: And the other opinion is "blood is like its blood."

hebrew_text: ואידך דם דמה לא דריש
human_translation: And the other does not interpret Blood, “Whose blood,”
llm_translation: And the other opinion is that "blood" is similar to not being required.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבנן דאמרי אשם ששחטו שלא לשמו כשר היינו דאיתקש מנחה לחטאת מנחה לאשם
human_translation: Granted, according to the Rabbis, who say a guilt offering that one slaughtered not for its sake fit, that is why a meal offering is juxtaposed with a sin offering, a meal offering with a guilt offering.
llm_translation: In accordance with the Rabbis who say: If one slaughtered a guilt-offering not for its sake, it is valid. This is because a meal-offering is compared to a sin-offering, and a meal-offering is compared to a guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי שמעון אומר (ויקרא ו, י) קדש קדשים היא כחטאת וכאשם מנחת חוטא הרי היא כחטאת לפיכך קמצה שלא לשמה פסולה מנחת נדבה הרי היא כאשם לפיכך קמצה שלא לשמה כשרה
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: “It is most sacred, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering” a meal offering of a sinner is like a sin offering. Therefore, removed its handful not for its sake, disqualified. a voluntary meal offering is like a guilt offering. Therefore, removed its handful not for its sake, fit.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says (Leviticus 6:10), "It is most holy, like the sin offering and like the guilt offering." It is like the sin offering; therefore, if one takes a handful not for its sake, it is invalid. The meal offering of a voluntary offering is like the guilt offering; therefore, if one takes a handful not for its sake, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי אליעזר למאי הלכתא איתקש מנחה לחטאת ומנחה לאשם
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Eliezer, for what halakha is a meal offering juxtaposed with a sin offering, and a meal offering with a guilt offering?
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Eliezer, for what halakha? A comparison is made between the Minchah offering and the Chatat offering, and between the Minchah offering and the Asham offering.

hebrew_text: לכי אידך דרבי שמעון דתנן שלא בכלי שרת פסולה ורבי שמעון מכשיר
human_translation: to the other by Rabbi Shimon as we learned not in a service vessel, unfit. And Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: Go and learn the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as we have learned: "A sacrifice is invalid if not performed with sacred vessels," and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה בריה דרבי חייא מ"ט דר"ש אמר קרא קדש קדשים היא כחטאת וכאשם בא לעובדה ביד עובדה בימין כחטאת בכלי עובדה בשמאל כאשם
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states “It is most sacred, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering,” comes to perform by hand, he must perform with right like a sin offering. with a vessel, he may perform with left like a guilt offering,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon said: "It is most holy, holy things it is, like the sin offering and like the guilt offering, it comes to actual service - with the right hand in the case of actual service, like the sin offering, in the utensils, with the left hand in the case of actual service, like the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: ור"ש האי קרא מפיק ליה להכי ומפיק ליה להכי
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon does he expound this verse for this and expound it for that
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon said: This verse brings it out for this, and brings it out for this.

hebrew_text: עיקר קרא לכדרב יהודה בריה דרבי חייא הוא דאתא ומנחת חוטא דפסולה שלא לשמה [טעמא אחרינא הוא] חטאת טעמא מאי דכתיב בה היא מנחת חוטא נמי כתיב בה היא
human_translation: The verse comes mainly to that which Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, And that a meal offering of a sinner not for its sake unfit is another reason: What is the reason a sin offering that “it” is written with regard to it “it” is also written with regard to the meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: Mainly according to Rav Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, he is the one who came and the sin-offering that is disqualified for not being offered for its intended purpose is for another reason. The sin-offering, what is the reason for its disqualification? What is written about it, "It is the sin-offering" is also written about it, "It is."

hebrew_text: ולרבנן למאי הלכתא איתקש אשם לחטאת לומר לך מה חטאת טעונה סמיכה אף אשם טעון סמיכה:
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, for what halakha is a guilt offering juxtaposed with a sin offering? to tell you just as a sin offering requires placing hands so too, a guilt offering requires placing hands
llm_translation: And for the Rabbis, for what halakha is the guilt-offering compared to the sin-offering? To tell you: Just as the sin-offering requires semikha, so too the guilt-offering requires semikha.

hebrew_text: יוסף בן חוני אומר הנשחטין כו': א"ר יוחנן יוסף בן חוני ורבי אליעזר אמרו דבר אחד
human_translation: Yosef ben Ḥoni says: that are slaughtered Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Yosef ben Ḥoni and Rabbi Eliezer said the same thing,
llm_translation: Yosef ben Ḥoni says, "The slaughtered ones, etc." Rabbi Yoḥanan says, "Yosef ben Ḥoni and Rabbi Eliezer said one thing."

hebrew_text: רבה אמר באחרים לשם חטאת פליגי
human_translation: Rabba says: they disagree with regard to other for the sake of a sin offering.
llm_translation: Rabah said: In the case of others, they argue regarding a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: דתניא הפסח שעברה שנתו ושחטו בזמנו לשמו וכן השוחט אחרים לשם פסח בזמנו רבי אליעזר פוסל ורבי יהושע מכשיר
human_translation: as it is taught a Paschal offering whose year has passed, and one slaughtered it at its time for its own sake and likewise, one slaughtered other for the sake of a Paschal offering at its time, Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit, and Rabbi Yehoshua deems fit.
llm_translation: As it was taught: The Passover offering, if its year has passed and one slaughtered it in its proper time for its sake, and likewise one who slaughters others for the sake of the Passover in its proper time, Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it, and Rabbi Joshua validates it.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהושע אם בשאר ימות השנה שאינו כשר לשמו אחרים כשרים לשמו בזמנו שהוא כשר לשמו אינו דין שיכשרו אחרים לשמו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: If, during the rest of the days of the year, when is not fit for its own sake, other for its sake are fit, at its time, when is fit for its own sake, isn’t it logical that other for its sake should be fit?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: If in the remaining days of the year that are not fitting for his name, others are fitting for his name, at his time when he is fitting for his name, it is not proper that others should be fitting for his name.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר או חילוף הדברים ומה אם בשאר ימות השנה שאינו כשר לשמו כשר הוא לשם אחרים בזמנו שהוא כשר לשמו אינו דין שיוכשר לשם אחרים ויוכשר פסח בארבעה עשר שלא לשמו
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: Or conversely, just as during the rest of the days of the year, when is not fit for its own sake, it is fit for the sake of other at its time, when it is fit for its own sake, isn’t it logical that it should be fit for the sake of other And a Paschal offering not for its own sake on fourteenth should be deemed fit,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer, or a change of words, and what if in other days of the year that are not valid for its name, it is valid for other names in its time that it is valid for its name, it is not proper that it should be valid for other names, and it should be valid for Passover on the fourteenth that is not for its name.

hebrew_text: וכך אתה אומר מה לי הוכשרו אחרים בשאר ימות השנה לשמו שכן הוא כשר לשם אחרים ויוכשרו אחרים בזמנו לשמו שכן הוא פסול לשם אחרים
human_translation: And do you say this What to me other during the rest of the days of the year for the sake of are deemed fit? After all, for the sake of other is fit. But other at its time for its sake should be deemed fit? After all, for the sake of other is unfit.
llm_translation: And so you say, "What do I care if others were permitted during the rest of the year for His name, for it is indeed permitted for the sake of others, and others were permitted in its time for His name, for it is indeed invalid for the sake of others."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע אם כן הורעתה כח פסח ונתת כח בשלמים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: If, you have diminished the force a Paschal offering and you have given force to a peace offering
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: If so, you have weakened the strength of Passover and given strength to peace offerings.

hebrew_text: חזר רבי אליעזר ודנו דין אחר מצינו מותר פסח בא שלמים ואין מותר שלמים בא פסח
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer then presented a different logical inference: We find a leftover Paschal offering, brought a peace offering; but a leftover peace offering, not brought a Paschal offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer reconsidered and judged another case: "We found that a Paschal lamb brought as a peace offering is permitted, but a peace offering brought as a Paschal lamb is not permitted."

hebrew_text: ומה פסח שמותרו בא שלמים שחטו בזמנו לשום שלמים פסול שלמים שאין מותרן בא פסח אם שחטם לשם פסח בזמנו אינו דין שיהו פסולין
human_translation: And Just as a Paschal offering, whose leftover is brought a peace offering, slaughtered it at its time for the sake of a peace offering unfit, a peace offering, whose leftover is not brought a Paschal offering, if slaughtered for the sake of a Paschal offering at its time, isn’t it logical that should be unfit?
llm_translation: And what about the Passover offering, if their original intent was for peace-offerings, and they slaughtered it in its proper time for the sake of peace-offerings - it is invalid. But if peace-offerings that are not permitted to be offered came first, and then the Passover offering was brought, if one slaughtered them for the sake of the Passover offering in its proper time, it is not a judgment that they are invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע מצינו מותר חטאת בא עולה ואין מותר עולה בא חטאת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: we find a leftover sin offering, is brought a burnt offering, a leftover burnt offering is not brought a sin offering.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: We find "permitted" sin-offering comes, burnt-offering does not come, and "permitted" burnt-offering comes, sin-offering does not come.

hebrew_text: ומה חטאת שמותרה בא עולה שחטה לשם עולה פסולה עולה שאין מותרה בא חטאת שחטה לשם חטאת אינו דין שתהא פסולה
human_translation: And Just as a sin offering, whose leftover is brought a burnt offering, slaughtered it for the sake of a burnt offering unfit, a burnt offering, whose leftover is not brought a sin offering, slaughtered it for the sake of a sin offering, isn’t it logical that it should be unfit?
llm_translation: And what about a sin-offering that is permitted to be brought? If it was brought as a burnt-offering, it is invalid. If a burnt-offering that is not permitted to be brought was brought as a sin-offering, it is not the law that it should be invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר לא אם אמרת בחטאת שכן כשרה לשמה כל השנה כולה תאמר בפסח שאינו כשר לשמו אלא בזמנו הואיל והוא פסול לשמו דין הוא שיפסלו אחרים לשמו:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: No, if you said with regard to a sin offering, because is fit for its sake all year long. Shall you say with regard to a Paschal offering, which is fit for its sake only at its time? Since is unfit for its sake it is logical that other should be disqualified for its sake
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: No, if you say regarding a sin offering that it is valid for its intended purpose throughout the entire year, you should say the same regarding the Passover offering, which is not valid for its intended purpose except at its designated time. Since it is invalid for its intended purpose, it is fitting that others invalidate it for its intended purpose.

hebrew_text: שמעון אחי עזריה אומר כו':
human_translation: Shimon, brother of Azarya, says
llm_translation: Shimon, the brother of Azariah, says, etc.

hebrew_text: רב אשי מתני משמיה דרבי יוחנן ורב אחא בריה דרבא מתני משמיה דרבי ינאי מאי טעמא דשמעון אחי עזריה דאמר קרא (ויקרא כב, טו) ולא יחללו את קדשי בני ישראל את אשר ירימו לה' במורם מהן אין מתחללין בנמוך מהם מתחללין
human_translation: Rav Ashi teaches in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches in the name of Rabbi Yannai: What is the reason of Shimon, brother of Azarya? which the verse states: “And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they will set apart [ yarimu ] unto the Lord” are not profaned, by more elevated [ muram ] than theirs; they are profaned by less than theirs.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi teaches in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches in the name of Rabbi Yannai: What is the reason that Shimon, the brother of Azariah, said a verse, "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord" (Leviticus 22:15)? Just as they do not profane the holy things when they are higher in status, so too they do not profane them when they are lower in status.

hebrew_text: והאי להכי הוא דאתא והא מיבעי ליה לכדשמואל דאמר שמואל מנין לאוכל את הטבל שהוא במיתה שנאמר ולא יחללו את קדשי בני ישראל את אשר ירימו לה' בעתידים לתרום הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: And does that come to this But isn’t it necessary for Shmuel’s As Shmuel says: From where that one who eats untithed produce is to death As it is stated: “And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they will set apart unto the Lord.” the verse is speaking of that are to be set apart in the future,
llm_translation: And this is why he came, and this is what Shmuel requires, as Shmuel said: From where do we derive that one may eat tevel that is subject to death? As it is stated: "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the Lord" - in the future, concerning terumah, the verse speaks.

hebrew_text: אם כן לכתוב קרא אשר הורמו מאי אשר ירימו שמע מיניה תרתי:
human_translation: If so, the verse should have written: Which they have set apart. What “Which they will set apart,” Conclude from it two
llm_translation: If so, to write a verse that they were taught, what is "asher" that they should raise from it two:

hebrew_text: בעי רבי זירא כשרין ואין מרצין וכי פליג בחדא פליג או דלמא כשרין ומרצין ובתרתי פליגי
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: are fit but do not propitiate when disagrees he disagrees with regard to one Alternatively, perhaps fit and propitiate and they disagree about two
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira inquired: "Are they valid but not effective, or do they disagree in one case and not in the other, or perhaps they are both valid and effective, and they disagree in both cases?"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ואיתימא רבי זריקא תא שמע הבכור והמעשר ששחטן לשם שלמים כשרים שלמים ששחטן לשם בכור או לשם מעשר פסולין
human_translation: Abaye, and some say Rabbi Zerika, said: Come hear A firstborn and the tithe that one slaughtered for the sake of peace offerings are fit, Peace offerings that one slaughtered for the sake of a firstborn or for the sake of tithe are unfit.
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and some say it was Rabbi Zerika: Come and hear: The firstborn and the tithe, if one slaughters them for the sake of completeness, they are valid; if one slaughters them for the sake of a firstborn or for the sake of a tithe, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד כשרין ומרצין בכור בר ריצויי הוא אלא כשרין ואין מרצין ומדסיפא כשרין ואין מרצין רישא נמי כשרין ואין מרצין
human_translation: And if it enters your mind fit and propitiate is a firstborn propitiates? rather, are fit but do not propitiate. And since the latter clause they are fit but do not propitiate, the former clause as well, they are fit but do not propitiate.
llm_translation: And if you will say: they are valid and they run, the firstborn is a son of running, it is; rather, they are valid and do not run. And the latter clause: they are valid and do not run. The beginning clause also: they are valid and do not run.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From Irya's statement: This one as it was stated, and this one as it was stated.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי קמ"ל גבוה ונמוך קמ"ל תנינא כיצד קדשי קדשים ששחטן לשם קדשים קלים כו'
human_translation: Rather, what is teaching us, Does it teach us higher and lower We learn How so? Offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered for the sake of offerings of lesser sanctity
llm_translation: Rather, what does it come to teach us? "High and low" it comes to teach us. We learned: How so? The most holy sacrifices that were slaughtered for the sake of the most holy sacrifices, etc.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא קדשי קדשים וקדשים קלים הוא דאיכא גבוה ונמוך אבל קלים וקלים לא
human_translation: lest you say that higher and lower applies only offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity, but lesser and lesser not
llm_translation: What is it that you might say? Holy of Holies and lesser holies, it is that there is high and low, but lesser and lesser not.

hebrew_text: הא נמי תנינא שלמים קודמים את הבכור מפני שהן טעונין מתן ארבע וסמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק
human_translation: We learn this as well, peace offering precedes the firstborn because requires placement four placing hands libations, and waving of breast and thigh
llm_translation: This also we learned: Peace-offerings precede the firstborn, because they require the giving of the four portions, laying on of hands, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh.

hebrew_text: הא עיקר ההיא אגררא נסבה:
human_translation: primary this that cites it incidentally,
llm_translation: This is the main point: that Aggara married.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הפסח ששחטו שחרית בארבעה עשר שלא לשמו רבי יהושע מכשיר כאילו נשחט בשלשה עשר בן בתירא פוסל כאילו נשחט בין הערבים
human_translation: the Paschal offering that one slaughtered morning of fourteenth not for its sake, Rabbi Yehoshua deems it fit as though it were slaughtered on the thirteenth Ben Beteira deems it unfit as though it were slaughtered afternoon
llm_translation: Mishnah: The Paschal lamb that was slaughtered in the morning by fourteen people not for its sake, Rabbi Yehoshua deems it valid as if it was slaughtered by thirteen. Ben Beteira disqualifies it as if it was slaughtered between the evenings.

hebrew_text: אמר שמעון בן עזאי מקובל אני מפי שבעים ושנים זקן ביום שהושיבו את רבי אליעזר בישיבה שכל הזבחים הנאכלין שנזבחו שלא לשמן כשרין אלא שלא עלו לבעלים משום חובה חוץ מן הפסח ומן החטאת ולא הוסיף בן עזאי אלא העולה ולא הודו לו חכמים:
human_translation: Shimon ben Azzai said: I received from seventy-two elders, on the day that they installed Rabbi Elazar at the yeshiva that all the slaughtered offerings that are eaten that were slaughtered not for their sake are fit, but did not satisfy the obligation of the owner, except for the Paschal offering and the sin offering. ben Azzai added only the burnt offering, and the Rabbis did not concede to him.
llm_translation: Shimon ben Azai said: I received a tradition from the mouths of seventy-two elders on the day when they seated Rabbi Eliezer in the assembly, that all sacrificial offerings that were slaughtered not for the sake of their intended purpose are valid, except that they do not fulfill the obligation of the owners, except for the Passover offering and the sin offering. And Ben Azai added only the burnt offering, and the Sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבי אלעזר אמר רבי אושעיא מכשיר היה בן בתירא בפסח ששחטו שחרית בארבעה עשר לשמו דכוליה יומא זימניה הוא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: With regard to a Paschal offering that one slaughtered morning of fourteenth for its sake, ben Beteira would deem fit, as the entire day, is its time.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: Ben Beteira was fit for the Passover offering, as it was slaughtered in the morning of the fourteenth of Nisan for his sake, as that was his usual practice every day.

hebrew_text: ומאי כאילו
human_translation: And what as though
llm_translation: And what is "ke'ilu"?

hebrew_text: איידי דאמר רבי יהושע כאילו אמר איהו נמי כאילו
human_translation: Since Rabbi Yehoshua says As though also says As though
llm_translation: Due to the fact that Rabbi Yehoshua said, it is as if he himself said it as well.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אדמיפלגי בשלא לשמו ליפלגו בלשמו
human_translation: If so, rather than disagreeing with regard to not for its sake, let them disagree with regard to for its sake;
llm_translation: If so, they disputed regarding something that was not for its sake, they will dispute for its sake.

hebrew_text: אי איפלגו בלשמו הוה אמינא אבל בשלא לשמו מודי רבי יהושע לבן בתירא הואיל ומקצתו ראוי קא משמע לן
human_translation: If they disagree with regard to for its sake, I would say: But in not for its sake, Rabbi Yehoshua concedes to ben Beteira since part of fit teaches us
llm_translation: If they argued about his own name, I would say that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira agrees, since part of it is fitting, it implies to us.

hebrew_text: והכתיב (שמות יב, ו) בין הערבים
human_translation: But isn’t it written: in the afternoon [ bein ha’arbayim ]”
llm_translation: And the Scripture (Exodus 12:6) states, "Between the evenings."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא בריה דרב עילאי בין שני ערבים
human_translation: Ulla, son of Rav Ilai, says: Between two evenings,
llm_translation: Ula, son of Rav Ilai, said: Between two evenings.

hebrew_text: תמיד דכתיב ביה (שמות כט, לט) בין הערבים הכי נמי דכולי יומא כשר
human_translation: daily offering, concerning which it is written: bein ha’arbayim ” the entire day fit also?
llm_translation: Continual as it is written in it (Exodus 29:39) "between the evenings," so too all day valid.

hebrew_text: התם מדכתיב (שמות כט, לט) את הכבש אחד תעשה בבקר מכלל דבין הערבים בין הערבים ממש
human_translation: There, since it is written: “The one lamb you shall offer in the morning,” by inference, bein ha’arbayim actual afternoon.
llm_translation: There, from where is it written (Exodus 29:39), "The one lamb you shall offer in the morning"? From the inference that it is between the evenings, literally.

hebrew_text: אימא חד בבקר אידך כוליה יומא
human_translation: Say one in the morning, the other all day.
llm_translation: Say one in the morning, the other the entire day.

hebrew_text: אחד בבקר ולא שנים בבקר
human_translation: “One in the morning” two not in the morning;
llm_translation: One in the morning and not two in the morning.

hebrew_text: נרות דכתיב (שמות כט, לט) בין הערבים הכי נמי דכולי יומא כשר
human_translation: lamps as it is written: bein ha’arbayim ” the entire day fit also,
llm_translation: Lamps as it is written (Exodus 29:39) "between the evenings," so too all day valid.

hebrew_text: שאני התם דכתיב מערב ועד בקר ותניא (שמות כז, כא) מערב ועד בקר תן לה מדתה שתהא דולקת והולכת מערב ועד בקר דבר אחר אין לך עבודה כשרה מערב ועד בקר אלא זו בלבד
human_translation: There it is different, as it is written: from evening to morning” And it is taught “from evening to morning” allocate its measure that it will burn from evening until morning. Alternatively, Only this rite is valid from evening until morning,
llm_translation: There is a difference there, for it is written "from evening until morning," and it was taught in a Baraita (Exodus 27:21) "from evening until morning" - give it its measure that it should burn and go from evening until morning. Another explanation: You do not have valid work from evening until morning, except this alone.

hebrew_text: קטורת דכתיב בה (שמות ל, ח) בין הערבים הכי נמי דכולי יומא כשר
human_translation: incense, as it is written with regard to it: “ Bein ha’arbayim the entire day also fit
llm_translation: Incense, as it is written in it (Exodus 30:8), "Between the evenings," so too, all day is valid.

hebrew_text: שאני קטרת
human_translation: incense is different,
llm_translation: Different is incense

hebrew_text: דאיתקש לנרות
human_translation: as it is juxtaposed with lamps
llm_translation: There is a connection to lamps.

hebrew_text: התם נמי כתיב (דברים טז, ו) שם תזבח את הפסח בערב
human_translation: there too, it is written: “There you shall sacrifice the Passover offering at evening”
llm_translation: There too it is written (Deuteronomy 16:6), "There you shall sacrifice the Passover in the evening."

hebrew_text: ההוא ליאוחר דבר הוא דאתא דתניא יאוחר דבר שנאמר בו בערב ובין הערבים לדבר שלא נאמר בו אלא בין הערבים בלבד
human_translation: That comes to item should be after As it is taught An item, with regard to which “In the evening,” and: “ Bein ha’arbayim ,” stated, should be after an item, with regard to which only “ bein ha’arbayim ” is stated.
llm_translation: That which is delayed is a matter that came, as it was taught: "A delayed matter" - that which is said about it in the evening and between the evenings, as opposed to that which is said about it only between the evenings.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא מידי דאילו שחיט ליה מצפרא אמרת זימניה הוא וכי מטי בין הערבים אמרת יאוחר דבר
human_translation: But is there anything that if one slaughters it in the morning, you say it is its time but when afternoon comes, you say item should be after
llm_translation: And is there anything that if one slaughters it with a knife, you would say it is permitted? If you say it is his designated time, and if it was done between the evenings, you would say it is delayed.

hebrew_text: אין דהא"ר יוחנן הלכה מתפלל של מנחה ואח"כ מתפלל של מוספין
human_translation: Yes, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha recite the afternoon prayer, and recite the additional prayers thereafter.
llm_translation: There is a teaching of Rabbi Yochanan: the law is that one prays the Mincha prayer and afterwards prays the Musaf prayer.

hebrew_text: ובין הערבים דכתיב גבי קטרת ונרות למה לי
human_translation: But “ bein ha’arbayim ” why do I that written with regard to incense and lamps,
llm_translation: And between the evenings, as it is written regarding the incense and the lamps, why do I need them?

hebrew_text: ועוד השיב רבי תחת בן בתירא לדברי רבי יהושע לא אם אמרת בשלשה עשר שאין מקצתו ראוי תאמר בארבעה עשר שמקצתו ראוי
human_translation: Furthermore, Rabbi responded on behalf of ben Beteira to the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua No, if you said with regard to thirteenth, as no part of fit shall you say with regard to fourteenth, part of which fit
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Tachas ben Btira responded to the words of Rabbi Yehoshua, saying: No, if you said in thirteen that part of it is not fitting, you should say in fourteen that part of it is fitting.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא כולו ראוי הוא
human_translation: And if it is so all of it is fit,
llm_translation: And if it is so, entirely fitting it is.

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר יוחנן פוסל היה בן בתירא בפסח ששחטו בארבעה עשר שחרית בין לשמו בין שלא לשמו הואיל ומקצתו ראוי
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: With regard to a Paschal offering that one slaughtered on the fourteenth in the morning, ben Beteira would deem unfit, whether for its sake or not for its sake. since part of fit
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: Ben Beteira was invalid in the Passover offering if it was slaughtered on the fourteenth day in the morning, whether for its sake or not for its sake, since part of it was fitting.

hebrew_text: מגדף בה רבי אבהו א"כ פסח כשר לבן בתירא היכי משכחת לה אי דאפרשיה האידנא דחוי מעיקרו הוא ואי דאפרשינהו מאתמול נראה ונדחה הוא
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu ridiculed [ megaddef ] If so, how can you find a fit Paschal offering according to ben Beteira? If designated now, it is disqualified from the outset, And if designated it the previous day, it was fit and disqualified
llm_translation: The one who reviles her, Rabbi Abbahu said: If so, a Paschal lamb is valid for a white house, how do you find it? If you explain it according to the present case, it is rejected from its inception, and if you explain it according to yesterday, it appears and is rejected.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבי אבהו תהא לאחר חצות
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abbahu says: Let be after noon,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abbahu said: "It should be after midnight."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר אפילו תימא מצפרא אין מחוסר זמן לבו ביום
human_translation: Abaye says: You even say in the morning, not whose time has not yet on that same day.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Even if you say "from the morning," there is no deficiency of time in his heart during the day.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר אפילו תימא מאורתא לילה אין מחוסר זמן דתני דבי ר' ישמעאל ליל שמיני נכנס לדיר להתעשר
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: You even say from night, night not whose time has not yet as it is taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: night eighth enter the den to be tithed.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even if you say "from the light of night," there is no issue of time, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: On the eighth night one enters the chamber to become wealthy.

hebrew_text: וכדרבי אפטוריקי דרבי אפטוריקי רמי כתיב (ויקרא כב, כז) והיה שבעת ימים תחת אמו הא לילה חזי וכתיב (ויקרא כב, כז) ומיום השמיני והלאה ירצה הא לילה לא חזי
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rabbi Appetoriki, as Rabbi Appetoriki raises a contradiction: It is written: then it shall be seven days with its mother” consequently, night, it is fit And it is written “But from the eighth day and on it may be accepted consequently, night, it is not fit.
llm_translation: And like Rabbi Eftoriki, Rabbi Eftoriki raises a contradiction: It is written (Leviticus 22:27), "And it shall be that for seven days it shall be under its mother." This refers to the night. And it is written (Leviticus 22:27), "And from the eighth day and onwards it shall be accepted." This refers to the night, it is not seen.

hebrew_text: הא כיצד לילה לקדושה ויום להרצאה
human_translation: How these night for consecration, and day for effecting acceptance,
llm_translation: This is how: night for holiness, and day for lecture.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי זירא לרבי אבהו לימא קסבר רבי יוחנן בעלי חיים נדחין
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abbahu: Shall we say Rabbi Yoḥanan holds animals are disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Abahu: "Let Rabbi Yochanan say: 'Ba'alei Chayim are rejected.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אין דא"ר יוחנן בהמה של שני שותפין הקדיש חציה וחזר ולקח חציה והקדישה קדושה ואינה קריבה
human_translation: said to him: Yes, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: an animal belonging to two partners, consecrated half of it and then purchased half of it and consecrated it, it is consecrated, But it may not be sacrificed,
llm_translation: He said to him: "No, as stated by Rabbi Yochanan: An animal belonging to two partners, if one sanctified half of it, then went back and sanctified the other half, it is sanctified but not fit for offering."

hebrew_text: ועושה תמורה ותמורתה כיוצא בה
human_translation: But render a substitute And its substitute is like it;
llm_translation: And one who makes an exchange, and its exchange is equivalent to it.

hebrew_text: ושמע מינה תלת שמע מינה בעלי חיים נדחין וש"מ דחוי מעיקרא הוה דחוי וש"מ
human_translation: And conclude three from Conclude from it animals are disqualified; and conclude from it disqualification from the outset, is disqualification; and conclude from it
llm_translation: And learn from it: three learn from it, animals are rejected. And learn from it, rejected from the outset was rejected.

hebrew_text: יש דחוי בדמים
human_translation: there is disqualification in monetary
llm_translation: There is one who pushes away with blood.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא אמר רבי יוחנן אכל חלב והפריש קרבן והמיר דת וחזר בו הואיל ונדחה ידחה
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat and designated an offering and apostatized, and recanted since disqualified, it shall be disqualified
llm_translation: Ula said, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who ate forbidden fat, separated an offering, and changed his religion, and then returned to it, since he was rejected, he is rejected.

hebrew_text: איתמר נמי אמר ר' ירמיה אמר רבי אבהו אמר רבי יוחנן אכל חלב והפריש קרבן ונשתטה וחזר ונשתפה הואיל ונדחה ידחה
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: ate fat and designated an offering and became an imbecile, and again became competent, since disqualified, it shall be disqualified
llm_translation: It was also stated: Rabbi Yirmiyah said, Rabbi Abahu said, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who ate forbidden fat, set aside an offering, became insane, then recovered and became insane again, since he was already disqualified, he remains disqualified.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי אשמעינן קמייתא משום דהוא דחי נפשיה בידים אבל הכא דממילא אידחי כישן דמי
human_translation: And are necessary. As, if had taught us the first because he disqualified himself by action, but here, where he was disqualified by itself, considered as asleep.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the initial statement, because he is endangering himself with his own hands, but here, where it happens automatically, it is considered as if it were like sleep.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הכא משום דאין בידו לחזור אבל הכא דיש בידו לחזור אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And if had taught us here, because it is not in his power to return but here, since it is in his power to recant I would say not necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here because he does not have the ability to retract, but here, where he has the ability to retract, say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה אכל חלב והפריש קרבן והורו בית דין שחלב מותר וחזרו בהן מהו מי הוי דחוי או לא הוי דחוי
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: ate fat and designated an offering and court ruled that fat permitted, and retracted what is Is disqualified, or is it not disqualified?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: One who ate forbidden fat and then separated an offering, and the court ruled that the fat is permissible, and then they reconsidered their ruling - what is the law? Is it considered as if it was annulled or not annulled?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ההוא סבא כי פתח רבי יוחנן בדחויין מהא פתח מאי טעמא התם גברא אידחי קרבן לא אידחי הכא קרבן נמי אידחי:
human_translation: A certain elder [ hahu sava ] said to When Rabbi Yoḥanan introduced disqualified he introduced with this What is the reason? There, the person was disqualified, offering was not disqualified. here, offering was also disqualified,
llm_translation: He said to him that elder, when Rabbi Yochanan began with "Dachuyin," what is the reason there a man pushes aside the offering, but here the offering is also pushed aside.

hebrew_text: אמר שמעון בן עזאי מקובלני מפי שבעים ושנים זקן כו': למה לי למתנא שבעים ושנים זקן דכולהו בחדא שיטתא הוו קיימי:
human_translation: Shimon ben Azzai said: I received from seventy-two elders [ zaken ] Why do I teach seventy-two Zaken , Because they all maintained one opinion,
llm_translation: Shimon ben Azai said: I received a tradition from the mouths of seventy-two elders, etc. Why do I need the Mishnah of seventy-two elders, since they all follow one method?

hebrew_text: לא הוסיף בן עזאי אלא העולה:
human_translation: Ben Azzai added only the burnt offering
llm_translation: Ben Azzai added only the one who ascends.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא מאי טעמא דבן עזאי (ויקרא א, יג) עולה הוא אשה ריח ניחוח לה' היא לשמה כשרה שלא לשמה פסולה
human_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason of ben Azzai? “It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasing aroma unto the Lord” “it” for its sake, fit; not for its sake, unfit.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason for the statement of Ben Azzai? (Leviticus 1:9) "It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet aroma to the Lord." It is valid when offered for its own sake, but invalid when not offered for its own sake.

hebrew_text: אשם נמי כתיב ביה הוא
human_translation: “it” written with regard to a guilt offering as well,
llm_translation: Guilt-offering also written in it is.

hebrew_text: ההוא לאחר הקטרת אימורים הוא דכתיב
human_translation: That is written after the burning of sacrificial portions
llm_translation: That one, after the incense, is the offerings that are written

hebrew_text: האי נמי לאחר הקטרת אימורים הוא דכתיב
human_translation: this also written after the burning of sacrificial portions
llm_translation: This too, after the burning of the incense, is what is written:

hebrew_text: תרי הוא כתיבי
human_translation: “it” is written two
llm_translation: Two it is written.

hebrew_text: גבי אשם נמי תרי הוא כתיבי
human_translation: With regard to a guilt offering as well, “it” written two
llm_translation: Regarding the guilt offering, it is also written: "two" (Leviticus 5:7).

hebrew_text: אלא בן עזאי בקל וחומר מייתי לה ומה חטאת שאינה כליל שחטה שלא לשמה פסולה עולה שהיא כליל לא כל שכן
human_translation: Rather, ben Azzai derives by an a fortiori Just as a sin offering, which is not consumed one slaughtered it not for its sake disqualified, a burnt offering, which is consumed all the more so not
llm_translation: Rather, Ben Azzai brings a fortiori argument, and what about a sin offering that is not complete - if it was slaughtered not for its intended purpose, it is invalid; how much more so a burnt offering, which is complete, should certainly be invalid.

hebrew_text: מה לחטאת שכן מכפרת
human_translation: What about a sin offering? in that it atones
llm_translation: "What for the sin-offering that it atones."

hebrew_text: פסח יוכיח
human_translation: A Paschal offering can prove
llm_translation: Passover will prove.

hebrew_text: מה לפסח שכן זמנו קבוע
human_translation: What about a Paschal offering? in that its time is set
llm_translation: Regarding Passover, for its time is fixed.

hebrew_text: חטאת תוכיח וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן קדשים ושחטן שלא לשמן פסול אף אני אביא עולה שהיא קדשים ושחטה שלא לשמה פסולה
human_translation: a sin offering can prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are offerings, and slaughtered them not for their sake, disqualified. So too, I shall include a burnt offering as it is an offering, and slaughtered it not for its sake, disqualified.
llm_translation: Sin-offering proves and returned the judgment not seen this like seen this and not seen this like seen this the side equal in them that they are holy and slaughtered not for its sake invalid also I bring burnt-offering that it is holy and slaughtered not for its sake invalid

hebrew_text: מה להצד השוה שבהן שיש בהן צד כרת
human_translation: What about their common element? that they have an element of karet .
llm_translation: What is the equalizing factor between them that they both have a side of excision.

hebrew_text: בן עזאי
human_translation: Ben Azzai
llm_translation: Son of Azai

hebrew_text: צד כרת לא פריך
human_translation: does not refute element of karet ,
llm_translation: Side of cutting not asked.

hebrew_text: אשם נמי לייתי

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הפסח והחטאת ששחטן שלא לשמן קבל והלך וזרק שלא לשמן או לשמן ושלא לשמן או שלא לשמן ולשמן פסולים
human_translation: the Paschal offering and the sin offering, where one slaughtered them not for their sake, collected conveyed or sprinkled not for their sake, or for their sake and not for their sake, or not for their sake and for their sake, are unfit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The Paschal offering and the sin offering, if slaughtered not for its sake, are invalid. If one slaughtered it not for its sake, or for its sake, or not for its sake and for its sake, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: כיצד לשמן ושלא לשמן לשם פסח ולשם שלמים שלא לשמן ולשמן לשם שלמים ולשם פסח

llm_translation: How for oil and not for oil for the sake of Passover and for the sake of peace offerings, not for oil and for oil for the sake of peace offerings and for the sake of Passover.

hebrew_text: שהזבח נפסל בארבעה דברים בשחיטה ובקבול ובהילוך ובזריקה
human_translation: because a slaughtered offering is disqualified in four matters: In slaughtering in collecting in conveying and in sprinkling
llm_translation: The sacrifice is invalidated by four things in slaughter, acceptance, walking, and sprinkling.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון מכשיר בהילוך שהיה אומר אי אפשר שלא בשחיטה ושלא בקבלה ושלא בזריקה אבל אפשר בלא הילוך שוחט בצד המזבח וזורק
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon deems fit during conveying as he would say: It is impossible without slaughtering or without collection or without sprinkling but it is possible without conveying slaughters alongside the altar and sprinkles
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon permits an animal through walking, for he used to say: It is impossible to permit it except through slaughter, and not through receiving the blood, and not through sprinkling the blood, but it is possible without walking - he slaughters on the side of the altar and sprinkles.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר המהלך במקום שהוא צריך להלך מחשבה פוסלת במקום שאינו צריך להלך אין מחשבה פוסלת:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: one who conveys in a situation where he is required to convey intent disqualifies in a situation where he is not required to convey intent does not disqualify
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One who walks in a place where he needs to walk, thought disqualifies; in a place where he does not need to walk, thought does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וקבלה מי פסלה
human_translation: And does collection disqualify
llm_translation: Gemara: And tradition, from where did it receive disqualification.

hebrew_text: והתניא (ויקרא א, ה) והקריבו זו קבלת הדם אתה אומר קבלת הדם או אינו אלא זריקה כשהוא אומר וזרקו הרי זריקה אמור הא מה אני מקיים והקריבו זו קבלת הדם בני אהרן הכהנים שתהא בכהן כשר ובכלי שרת
human_translation: But isn’t it taught “And shall present this collection of the blood. Do you say collection of the blood, or is it only sprinkling When it states “And sprinkle sprinkling is thereby stated. how do I realize “And shall present”? This collection of the blood. “the sons of Aaron, the priests” that must be by a fit priest, and service vestments.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught (Leviticus 1:5), "And they shall offer" - this is the receiving of the blood. Do you say the receiving of the blood, or is it only the sprinkling? When it says, "And he shall sprinkle," behold, sprinkling is mentioned. How then do I fulfill, "And they shall offer" - this is the receiving of the blood, by the sons of Aaron the priests, that it should be with a valid priest and in sacred vessels.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי עקיבא מנין לקבלה שלא תהא [אלא] בכהן כשר ובכלי שרת נאמר כאן בני אהרן ונאמר להלן (במדבר ג, ג) אלה שמות בני אהרן הכהנים המשוחים מה להלן בכהן כשר ובכלי שרת אף כאן בכהן כשר ובכלי שרת
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: From where that collection may be only by a fit priest and service vestments? “the sons of Aaron” is stated here and it is stated there: “These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests that were anointed, Just as there, with regard to fit priests, and with regard to service vestments so too here, to a fit priest and with regard to service vestments.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Akiva: From where do we derive that the acceptance of sacrifices should only be performed by a qualified priest and with sacred vessels? It is stated here in this verse, "sons of Aaron," and it is stated there (Numbers 3:3), "These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests." Just as there it is performed by a qualified priest and with sacred vessels, so too here it should be performed by a qualified priest and with sacred vessels.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי טרפון אקפח את בניי אם לא שמעתי להבחין הפרש בין קבלה לזריקה ואין לי לפרש
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: I will bury my sons if I did not hear discerning a distinction between collection and sprinkling but I cannot explicate
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Tarfon: I would have taken hold of my sons if I had not heard to distinguish between receiving and sprinkling, and I have no explanation.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי עקיבא אני אפרש קבלה לא עשה בה מחשבה כמעשה זריקה עשה בה מחשבה כמעשה קבלו בחוץ אינו חייב כרת זרקו בחוץ ענוש כרת קבלוהו פסולין אין חייבין עליו זרקוהו פסולין חייבין עליו
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I will explicate: collection, does not render intent like action. sprinkling, does render intent like action. collected outside he is not liable karet . sprinkled outside he is punished karet . unfit collected they are not liable for unfit sprinkled they are liable for that
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I will explain. Kabbalah, if not done with intention, is not like the act of throwing. If one did it with intention, it is like the act of receiving. If they received it outside, they are not liable to receive the punishment of excision. If they threw it outside, they are liable to receive the punishment of excision. If they received it while impure, it is invalid; they are not liable. If they threw it while impure, it is invalid; they are liable.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי טרפון העבודה את הטית ימין ושמאל אני שמעתי ואין לי לפרש אתה דורש ומסכים לשמועה בלשון הזה אמר לו עקיבא כל הפורש ממך כפורש מחייו
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said to him the service you have deviated left or right I heard and I cannot explicate you teach in concurrence with the halakha He said to using this language: Akiva, anyone who leaves you is like one who leaves his life.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said to him: "The service, you have twisted right and left, I have heard, and I have no explanation. You expound and agree to the teaching in this language." Akiva said to him: "Whoever separates from you, it is as if he separates from his own life."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא לא קשיא כאן במחשבת פיגול כאן במחשבת שלא לשמה
