llm_translation: Rava said: It is not difficult here regarding the intent of Pigul, here regarding the intent of not for its sake.

hebrew_text: ומחשבת פיגול לא פסלה בקבלה
human_translation: And does intent of piggul during collection not disqualify

hebrew_text: והתניא יכול לא תהא מחשבה מועלת אלא בזריקה בלבד מנין לרבות שחיטה וקבלה ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח שלמיו (פיגול הוא) לא ירצה בדברים המביאין לידי אכילה הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: But isn’t it taught might intent is effective only during sprinkling. From where to include slaughter and collection The verse states: “And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is at all eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, the verse speaks of matters that lead to consumption,
llm_translation: And it was taught: Can it be that improper intent is only effective through sprinkling alone? From where do we derive to include slaughter and receiving the blood? The verse states (Leviticus 7:18), "And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings be eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offers it; it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity."

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה אף שפיכת שיריים והקטרת אימורין
human_translation: might that I include even pouring of remainder and burning of sacrificial portions
llm_translation: I might say, perhaps, that the pouring of libations and the offering of sacrificial portions are different.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יח) ביום השלישי לא ירצה המקריב אותו לא יחשב זריקה בכלל היתה ולמה יצתה להקיש אליה לומר לך מה זריקה מיוחדת שהיא עבודה (ומכפרת) ומעכבת כפרה אף כל עבודה ומעכבת כפרה יצאו שפיכת שיריים והקטרת אימורין שאין מעכבין את הכפרה
human_translation: the verse states: “On the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed to the one who offers it” Sprinkling was included And for what was it singled out? To compare to it, to say to you: Just as sprinkling is unique, as it is a rite and it prevents atonement, so too, any rite prevents atonement Pouring remainder and burning sacrificial portions are excluded, as they do not prevent atonement
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was taught: It is stated (Leviticus 7:18), "On the third day, it shall not be accepted, it shall not be credited as a sacrifice." If the sprinkling was not included in the service, why was it necessary to compare it to it, to say to you: Just as sprinkling is unique in that it is a service (and atones) and delays atonement, so too, any service that delays atonement, such as the pouring of leftover blood and the offering of sacrificial portions, which do not delay atonement.

hebrew_text: אלא לא קשיא הא דאמר הריני [שוחט] ע"מ לקבל דמה למחר הא דאמר הריני מקבל דמה על מנת לשפוך שירים למחר
human_translation: Rather, not difficult. This where says: I am hereby slaughtering in order to collect its blood tomorrow. That where says: I am hereby collecting its blood in order to pour remainder tomorrow.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult. This one who said, "I hereby slaughter in order to receive its blood tomorrow," and this one who said, "I hereby receive its blood with the intention of pouring it out tomorrow."

hebrew_text: א"ל ההוא מרבנן לרבא ושפיכת שירים והקטרת אימורין לא פסלה בהו מחשבה
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rava: And does intent with regard to pouring of remainder and burning of sacrificial portions not disqualify
llm_translation: He said to him, that Sage to Rava, "The pouring of songs and the offering of incense do not render them invalid with intent."

hebrew_text: והתנן יכול לא תהא מחשבה מועלת אלא באכילת בשר מנין לרבות שפיכת שירים והקטרת אימורים ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל בשתי אכילות הכתוב מדבר אחת אכילת אדם ואחת אכילת מזבח
human_translation: But didn’t we learn might only intent with regard to consumption of the meat is effective From where to include pouring of remainder and burning of sacrificial portions? The verse states: “And if is at all eaten [ he’akhol ye’akhel ] the verse speaks of two consumption: One is consumption by man, and one is consumption on the altar.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: One might have thought that sinful intent is only applicable in the eating of meat. How do we know to include the pouring of drink offerings and the burning of sacrificial parts? The verse teaches (Leviticus 7:18): "And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offers it; it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity." The Scripture speaks of two eatings: one is the eating of a person, and the other is the eating of the altar.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא דאמר הריני זורק על מנת לשפוך שירים למחר הא דאמר הריני שופך שירים על מנת להקטיר אימורין למחר:
human_translation: not difficult. This where says: I am hereby sprinkling in order to pour remainder tomorrow. That where he says: I am hereby pouring remainder in order to burn sacrificial portions tomorrow.
llm_translation: Not difficult. This one who said, "I am hereby committing to sprinkle libations tomorrow," is not difficult with this one who said, "I am hereby pouring libations tomorrow in order to offer sacrifices the next day."

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה בריה דרבי חייא שמעתי שטבילת אצבע מפגלת בחטאת פנימית
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: I heard that with regard to an inner sin offering, dipping finger renders piggul .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah son of Rabbi Chiya said: I heard that the immersion of a finger invalidates the inner sin-offering.

hebrew_text: שמעה אילפא אמרה קמיה דרב פדא אמר כלום למדנו פיגול אלא משלמים מה שלמים אין טבילת אצבע מפגלת בהן אף חטאת אין טבילת אצבע מפגלת בהן
human_translation: Ilfa heard said it before Rav Padda. said Did we derive piggul from anything but a peace offering? just as a peace offering, dipping finger does not render it piggul , so too, a sin offering, dipping finger does not render it piggul .
llm_translation: Shema Ilfa said before Rav Pada: Did we not learn anything about Pigul? Rather, they pay for what they have to pay. Just as the payment does not render the immersion of the finger invalid, so too, the sin offering does not render the immersion of the finger invalid.

hebrew_text: וכי הכל משלמים למדו אי מה שלמים שלא לשמן אין מוציא מידי פיגול אף חטאת שלא לשמה אין מוציא מידי פיגול
human_translation: But are all derived from a peace offering? If just as a peace offering not for its sake does not preclude piggul , so too, a sin offering not for its sake does not preclude piggul .
llm_translation: And when all pay learn if what pay not for its sake not exempt from the liability of pigul also sin-offering not for its sake not exempt from the liability of pigul.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי אית לך למימר מרבויא דקראי קאתיא [ה"ג מרבויא דקרא קאתי]
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say derived from an amplification of the verse. Here too, derived from an amplification of the verse.
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say about the abundance of verses that come?

hebrew_text: אמר ריב"ל בעליה זו שמעתי שטבילת אצבע מפגלת תהי בה רשב"ל כלום למדו פיגול אלא משלמים מה שלמים אין טבילת אצבע מפגלת בהן אף חטאת אין טבילת אצבע מפגלת בהן
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: I heard in this upper story that dipping finger renders piggul . Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish wondered [ tahei ] at this Did derive piggul from anything but a peace offering? Just as a peace offering, dipping finger does not render it piggul , so too, a sin offering, dipping finger does not render it piggul .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Levi said: With regard to this matter, I heard that the immersion of a finger renders the offering disqualified. Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Did they not learn the law of Pigul only from the laws of offerings that require payment? Just as with offerings that require payment, the immersion of a finger does not render them disqualified, so too with regard to a sin offering, the immersion of a finger does not render it disqualified.

hebrew_text: וכי הכל משלמים למדו אי מה שלמים שלא לשמן אין מוציא מידי פיגול אף חטאת שלא לשמה אין מוציא מידי פיגול
human_translation: But are all derived from a peace offering? If just as a peace offering not for its sake does not preclude piggul , so too, a sin offering not for its sake does not preclude piggul .
llm_translation: And when all pay learn if what pay not for its own sake not exempt from liability of pigul also sin-offering not for its sake not exempt from liability of pigul

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא אין הכל משלמים למדו הואיל וחוץ למקומו פוסל בשלמים ושלא לשמו פוסל בחטאת מה חוץ למקומו הפוסל בשלמים מוציא מידי פיגול אף שלא לשמו הפוסל בחטאת מוציאה מידי פיגול
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Indeed, all are derived from a peace offering. Since in a peace offering, outside its area disqualifies and in a sin offering, not for its sake disqualifies just as outside its area, which disqualifies a peace offering, precludes piggul , so too, not for its sake, which disqualifies a sin offering, precludes its piggul .
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: Not everyone is fit to bring offerings, since if it is outside its designated place, it invalidates the Shelamim offering, and if it is not for its intended purpose, it invalidates the Chatat offering. Just as being outside its designated place invalidates the Shelamim offering, it renders the offering Pigul, so too, if it is not for its intended purpose, it renders the Chatat offering Pigul.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה מצדה תברא מה לחוץ למקומו הפוסל בשלמים שכן נוהג בכל הזבחים תאמר בשלא לשמו שאינו נוהג אלא בפסח וחטאת בלבד
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: inherently disjointed: What about outside its area, which disqualifies a peace offering? in that applies to all slaughtered offerings. you say with regard to not for its sake, which applies only to a Paschal offering and a sin offering?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: "From Tzadah Tavra, what is external to its place invalidates the Shelamim, for this is the practice with all sacrifices. You shall say, 'Regarding something not for its sake, which is only practiced with the Pesach and the Chatat.'"

hebrew_text: אלא מאי אית לך למימר דבר הפוסל בהן מוציאם מידי פיגול דבר המעכב בהן מביאן לידי פיגול
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say matter that disqualifies precludes its piggul , matter that prevents renders piggul
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? Something that disqualifies them removes them from the category of Pigul. Something that delays them brings them into the category of Pigul.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי דבר הפוסל בה מוציא מידי פיגול דבר המעכב בה מביאה לידי פיגול
human_translation: here too, matter that disqualifies it, precludes piggul , matter that prevents renders it piggul
llm_translation: Here also, a matter that disqualifies it, one who brings it out from the category of Pigul; a matter that impedes it, brings it to the category of Pigul.

hebrew_text: אמר רב מרי אף אנן נמי תנינא זה הכלל כל הקומץ ונותן בכלי והמוליך והמקטיר
human_translation: Rav Mari says: We learn as well This is the principle: anyone who removes a handful or places in a vessel, or who conveys or who burns
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: We also learned: This is the principle - anyone who gathers and places in a vessel, and who leads and who burns.

llm_translation: Not forever of blood to receive and you said here automatically there he is taking and giving since both giving vessel is what to me automatically what to me taking and giving.

hebrew_text: לימא כתנאי דתני חדא טבילת אצבע מפגלת בחטאת ותניא אידך לא מפגלת ולא מתפגלת מאי לאו תנאי היא
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im . As it is taught one With regard to sin offering, dipping finger renders it piggul . And it is taught another does not render piggul , and neither does render piggul . What, is it not is tanna’im ?
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tanna who taught one: The immersion of the finger renders the sin-offering disqualified. And it was taught in another place: It does not render it disqualified, nor does it render it fit. What is it if not a dispute between Tannaim?

human_translation: as Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: was sprinkling and the hand of the one sprinkling was severed before blood reached the airspace of the altar, what is And said to him: not valid. What is the reason? We require “And sprinkle “And place
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: For Rabbi Yirmiyah asked Rabbi Zeira: If one was sprinkling the blood and the hand of this one was severed before the blood reached the air of the altar, what is the ruling? And he said to him: It is disqualified because we require sprinkling.

hebrew_text: כי אתו רב פפא ורב הונא בריה דרב יהושע מבי רב אמרי היינו חוכא ובהולכה רבתי לא פליגי והא כי פליגי בהולכה רבתי פליגי
human_translation: When Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came from the study hall, they said: This is the laughter With regard to greater conveying, do not disagree? when they disagree they disagree with regard to greater conveying,
llm_translation: When Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua came from the house of Rav, they said: This is the law, and they do not disagree in the case of a significant distance. But when they disagree, they disagree in the case of a significant distance.

hebrew_text: אלא בהולכה זוטרתי כולי עלמא לא פליגי דלא פסלה כי פליגי בהולכה רבתי
human_translation: Rather, With regard to lesser conveying, everyone agrees that it does not disqualify When they disagree, with regard to greater conveying,
llm_translation: Rather, in minimal walking, everyone agrees that it does not disqualify, as they disagree in extensive walking.

hebrew_text: הוליכו זר והחזירו כהן וחזר והוליכו פליגי בה בני רבי חייא ור' ינאי חד אמר כשר וחד אמר פסול מר סבר אפשר לתקונה ומר סבר לא אפשר לתקונה
human_translation: a non-priest conveyed and a priest returned it and conveyed it again the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Yannai disagree with regard to One says fit, and one says unfit. Sage holds possible to correct it, and Sage holds not possible to correct it.
llm_translation: They led a non-priest and brought back a priest, and he returned, and they led him again. The sons of Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Yannai argued about it. One said it is valid, and one said it is invalid. The Master thinks it can be rectified, and the other Master thinks it cannot be rectified.

hebrew_text: הוליכו כהן והחזירו וחזר והוליכו זר אמר רב שימי בר אשי לדברי המכשיר פסול לדברי הפוסל מכשיר
human_translation: a priest conveyed it and returned it, and a non-priest conveyed it again, Rav Shimi bar Ashi says: According to the statement of the one who deems fit unfit, According to the statement of the one who deems unfit he deems fit.
llm_translation: They led the priest and brought him back, and he returned, and they led the non-priest. Rav Shimei bar Ashi said: According to the opinion that deems it valid, it is invalid; according to the opinion that deems it invalid, it is valid.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אף לדברי הפוסל פסול מאי טעמא דהא צריך
human_translation: Rava says: Even according to the statement of the one who deems unfit unfit What is the reason? Because it is necessary
llm_translation: Rava said: Even according to the words of the disqualifier, it is disqualified. What is the reason? Because it requires.

hebrew_text: לאמטוייה
human_translation: to bring it
llm_translation: To its truth.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב ירמיה לרב אשי הכי אמר רב ירמיה מדיפתי הא צריך לאמטוייה מחלוקת רבי אליעזר ורבנן
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rav Ashi: This Rav Yirmeya of Difti said that it is necessary to bring a dispute Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiyah said to Rav Ashi: So said Rav Yirmiyah: Since it is pushed aside, it requires the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דתנן ר"א אומר המהלך במקום שצריך להלך מחשבה פוסלת מקום שאין צריך להלך אין מחשבה פוסלת
human_translation: as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: one who conveys in a situation where he is required to convey intent disqualifies in a situation where he is not required to convey intent does not disqualify
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "One who walks in a place where it is necessary to walk, thought invalidates; in a place where it is not necessary to walk, thought does not invalidate."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הכל מודים קבלו בחוץ והכניסו בפנים זהו הילוך שצריך להלך קבלו בפנים והוציאו לחוץ זהו הילוך שאין צריך להלך
human_translation: And Rava says: All concede collected outside, and he brought it inside, that is necessary conveying. collected it inside and took it outside, that is unnecessary conveying.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Everyone agrees, receive outside and bring inside, this is the way it needs to be done. Receive inside and bring outside, this is the way it does not need to be done.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא כשהכניסו וחזר והוציאו מר סבר הא צריך לאמטוייה ומ"ס לאו כהילוך הצריך לעבודה דמי
human_translation: They disagree only where he brought it in and took it out again. Sage, holds it is necessary to bring it And Sage, holds it is not considered conveying that is necessary for the service,
llm_translation: They only disagreed when he brought it in and then took it out. Mar thought: Does it require its measurement? And the Sages say: It is not like the offering, it requires an act of acquisition.

hebrew_text: איתיביה אביי ר"א אומר המהלך מקום שצריך להלך מחשבה פוסלת כיצד קבלו בחוץ והכניסו לפנים זהו הילוך שצריך להלך קבלו בפנים והוציאו לחוץ זהו הילוך שאין צריך לילך והא חזר והכניסו הילוך שצריך להלך הוא
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rabbi Eliezer says: one who conveys in a situation where he is required to convey intent disqualifies How so? collected outside, and he brought it inside, that is necessary conveying. collected it inside and took it outside, that is unnecessary conveying. And consequently, he brought it in again, it is necessary conveying
llm_translation: Abbaye raised an objection: Rabbi Eliezer says, "One who walks to a place where he needs to walk, his intent is disqualifying." How so? If they received an object outside and brought it inside, this is considered walking that requires walking. If they received it inside and brought it outside, this is considered walking that does not require walking. But didn't he then bring it back inside? That is considered walking that requires walking.

hebrew_text: א"ל אי תניא תניא:
human_translation: said to him: If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is taught, it is taught.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל הזבחים:
llm_translation: We will return to you all the sacrifices.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הזבחים שקבלו דמן זר אונן טבול יום ומחוסר כפורים ומחוסר בגדים שלא רחץ ידים ורגלים ערל טמא יושב עומד על גבי כלים על גבי בהמה על גבי רגלי חברו פסל
human_translation: all slaughtered offerings, who collected their blood a non-priest; an acute mourner, one who immersed that day or one who has not yet an atonement or lacking vestments; who did not wash his hands and feet an uncircumcised a ritually impure sitting; standing upon vessels, upon an animal, upon the feet of another, disqualified
llm_translation: Mishnah: All the sacrifices that received blood from a non-priest, a mourner, one who immersed that day, one lacking atonement, one lacking garments, one who did not wash hands and feet, a circumcised person, an impure person, one sitting, standing, on top of vessels, on top of an animal, on top of his fellow's feet, are disqualified.

hebrew_text: קבל בשמאל פסל ר"ש מכשיר:
human_translation: he collected with left disqualified Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: Receive with the left, invalidates, Rabbi Shimon deems valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ זר מנלן דתני לוי (ויקרא כב, ב) דבר אל אהרן ואל בניו לאמר וינזרו מקדשי בני ישראל וגו' בני ישראל למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי נשים קרבן נשים בטומאה קרב
human_translation: From where do we a non-priest As Levi teaches: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the sacred items of the children of Israel [ benei Yisrael ]” “The children of Israel” to exclude what If we say to exclude women, an offering of women is sacrificed in impurity?
llm_translation: Gemara: Whence do we derive that Levi taught (Leviticus 22:2), "Speak to Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and so forth"? "The children of Israel" - to exclude what? Shall we say, to exclude women? A woman's offering is brought in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אלא למעוטי עובדי כוכבים השתא ציץ לא מרצה דאמר מר ובעובדי כוכבים בין בשוגג בין במזיד לא הורצה בטומאה קרב
human_translation: Rather, to exclude gentiles. Now, frontplate does not effect acceptance as the Master said: And with regard to gentiles, whether unintentionally or intentionally, it was not accepted; is sacrificed in impurity
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude idolaters now, the tzitz does not atone. For Rav said, "With idolaters, whether unintentionally or intentionally, atonement is not achieved through impurity."

hebrew_text: אלא הכי קאמר וינזרו מקדשי בני ישראל ולא יחללו
human_translation: Rather, this is saying, That they separate themselves from the sacred items; the children of Israel, and that they not profane
llm_translation: Rather, this is what it means: "And they shall guard the holy things of the children of Israel, and they shall not profane."

hebrew_text: דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא אתיא בק"ו מבעל מום מה בעל מום שאוכל אם עבד חילל
human_translation: school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: is derived via an a fortiori from a blemished Just as a blemished who may partake if he performed rites desecrated
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: It was derived through a verbal analogy - "from a blemished owner" - what is a blemished owner? One who eats terumah if he has desecrated its sanctity.

hebrew_text: זר שאינו אוכל אינו דין שאם עבד חילל
human_translation: a non-priest, who may not partake is it not right that if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: Stranger who not eating not law that if did profane

hebrew_text: מה לבעל מום שכן עשה בו קרב כמקריב
human_translation: what about a blemished in that rendered is sacrificed like sacrifices
llm_translation: What for a blemished animal that one brought near as one brings near.

hebrew_text: טמא יוכיח מה לטמא שכן מטמא
human_translation: an impure will prove What about an impure in that imparts impurity
llm_translation: Impure shall prove what to impure, for thus impure.

hebrew_text: בעל מום יוכיח וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שמוזהרין ואם עבדו חיללו אף אני אביא זר שהוא מוזהר ואם עבד חילל
human_translation: A blemished will prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element that they are prohibited and if they performed rites they have desecrated I will also include a non-priest, who is prohibited and if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: The one with a blemish shall prove, and the judgment returned not this proof like that proof, and not this proof like that proof, the equal side in them that are warned. And if they transgressed, they profaned. Also, I will bring a stranger who is warned, and if he transgressed, he profaned.

hebrew_text: מנלן דמוזהר אי מוינזרו חילול בגופיה כתיב ביה אלא (במדבר יח, ד) מוזר לא יקרב אליכם
human_translation: From where do we that is prohibited If from that they separate themselves profanation itself is writ-ten in Rather, from but a common man shall not draw close to you”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that one is warned against engaging in desecration of God's name through harming oneself? It is written regarding this, "A stranger shall not come near to you" (Numbers 18:4).

hebrew_text: איכא למיפרך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן לא הותרו בבמה
human_translation: can be refuted: What about their common element? in that were not permitted on altar
llm_translation: There is to refute: "What to the side equal in them, thus not permitted in the high place."

hebrew_text: לא תימא טמא יוכיח אלא אימא אונן יוכיח מה לאונן שכן אסור במעשר [בעל מום] יוכיח
human_translation: Do not say an impure will prove rather, say an acute mourner will prove What about an acute mourner? in that is prohibited from tithe, A blemished will prove
llm_translation: Do not say that a ritually impure person may argue, rather say that a mourner may argue. Just as a mourner is prohibited in eating tithes of animals with blemishes, he may argue.

hebrew_text: וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שמוזהרין כו'
human_translation: And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that Their common element that they are prohibited
llm_translation: And the law returned, not a proof this like a proof this, the equal side in them that they are warned, etc.

hebrew_text: ה"נ לפרוך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן לא הותרו בבמה מתקיף לה רב סמא בריה דרבא ומאן לימא לן דאונן אסור בבמה דלמא שרי בבמה
human_translation: Here, too, let one refute What about their common element? in that were not permitted on altar, Rav Samma, son of Rava, objects to this: And who shall say to us that an acute mourner prohibited on altar? Perhaps permitted on altar.
llm_translation: So too, regarding the matter of separating terumah, what is the law for the side that is equal between them? For they were not permitted on a high place. Rav Sama, son of Rava, objects: Who will say to us that one who is impure is forbidden on a high place? Perhaps he is permitted on a high place.

hebrew_text: רב משרשיא אמר אתיא ק"ו מיושב מה יושב שאוכל אם עבד חילל זר שאינו אוכל אינו דין שאם עבד חילל
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says: is derived an a fortiori from sitting: Just as sitting, who may partake if he performed rites he has desecrated a non-priest, who may not partake is it not right that if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: Comes a question and an answer. Who is considered seated? One who is seated and eats. If he performed a desecration of a foreign deity, and he does not eat, he is not considered seated.

hebrew_text: מה ליושב שכן פסול לעדות מיושב ת"ח
human_translation: What about a sitting in that is disqualified from bearing witness, from a sitting Torah scholar,
llm_translation: What is the matter with a resident who is disqualified to testify, but a resident Torah scholar is qualified to testify.

hebrew_text: מה לשם יושב שכן פסול לעדות שם יושב לא פריך ואם ת"ל פריך אתיא מיושב ומחדא מהנך
human_translation: what the category of a sitting in that is disqualified from bearing witness, The category of a sitting cannot refute And if you say it can refute can be derived from a sitting and from one of those
llm_translation: What is the law regarding a neighbor who is disqualified to testify? Regarding a neighbor who is sitting, it was not asked. And if you will say it was asked, the answer is: the case of one who is sitting is different from those cases.

hebrew_text: ויושב דכשר בבמה מנלן אמר קרא (דברים י, ח) לעמוד לפני ה' לשרתו לפני ה' ולא לפני במה:
human_translation: And from where do we that sitting is fit on altar? The verse states: to stand before the Lord to minister to Him” before the Lord, and not before altar,
llm_translation: And one who is sitting is valid on the altar, from where do we derive this? The verse says (Deuteronomy 10:8), "To stand before the Lord to serve Him before the Lord," and not before the altar.

hebrew_text: אונן: מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא כא, יב) ומן המקדש לא יצא ולא יחלל הא אחר שלא יצא חילל
human_translation: an acute mourner From where do we As it is written “And he shall not leave the Sanctuary, and he will not profane But other who did not leave has desecrated
llm_translation: Mourner: From where do we derive that it is written (Leviticus 21:12) "And he shall not leave the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God"? This teaches that if he left, he profaned.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אמר מהכא (ויקרא י, יט) הן הקריבו אני הקרבתי מכלל דאי אינהו אקריב שפיר אישתרוף
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: from here they offered I offered By inference, that if they had offered proper it was burned.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: From here (Leviticus 10:19) "Behold, they brought their offering, which I have offered." This implies that if they do not bring it, it will be consumed.

hebrew_text: ורבי אלעזר מאי טעמא לא אמר מומן המקדש לא יצא אמר לך מי כתיב הא אחר שלא יצא חילל
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Elazar does not say from “And he shall not leave the Sanctuary”? said to you: Is it written: But other that did not leave has desecrated
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, what is the reason he did not say "one who is blemished shall not go out"? He said to you, who is it written about? After one who did not go out, he desecrated.

hebrew_text: ואידך מ"ט לא אמר מהן הקריבו קסבר מפני טומאה נשרפה
human_translation: And the other what is the reason he did not say from they offered holds was burned because ritually impure,
llm_translation: And the other one, what is the reason he did not say "from them they shall bring near"? He holds that because of impurity it was burned.

hebrew_text: דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא אתיא בק"ו מבעל מום ומה
human_translation: school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: is derived by an a fortiori from a blemished And just as
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "It comes with a 'Kaf' and a 'Vav' from 'ba'al mum' (owner of a blemish), and what is the meaning of this?"

hebrew_text: בעל מום שאוכל אם עבד חילל אונן שאין אוכל אינו דין שאם עבד חילל
human_translation: a blemished who may partake if he performed rites he has desecrated an acute mourner, who may not partake is it not right that if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: Ba'al mum who eats if slave profaned onen who does not eat not law if slave profaned

hebrew_text: מה לבעל מום שכן עשה בו קרבין כמקריבין
human_translation: what about a blemished in that rendered are sacrificed like sacrifice
llm_translation: What for a Ba'al Mum that thus he does in him offerings as offerings.

hebrew_text: זר יוכיח מה לזר שכן אין לו תקנה
human_translation: a non-priest will prove what about a non-priest? in that he has no remedy,
llm_translation: Stranger will prove what to stranger for thus he has no rectification.

hebrew_text: בעל מום יוכיח וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שהן מוזהרין ואם עבדו חיללו אף אני אביא אונן שמוזהר ואם עבד חילל
human_translation: A blemished will prove And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this Their common element is that they are prohibited and if they performed rites they have desecrated I will also include an acute mourner, who is prohibited and if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: The one with a blemish shall prove, and the judgment returned not this proof like that proof, and not this proof like that proof, the equal side in them that they are warned. And if they transgressed, they profaned. Also, I will bring the mourner who is warned, and if he transgressed, profaned.

hebrew_text: היכן מוזהר אילימא מומן המקדש לא יצא חילול בגופיה כתיב ביה אלא (ויקרא י, יט) מהן הקריבו וקסבר מפני אנינות נשרפה
human_translation: Where is prohibited If we say from “And he shall not leave the Sanctuary, profanation itself is written in Rather, from they offered and holds was burned because acute mourning.
llm_translation: Where is one warned? If you say, "A blemished one who serves in the Sanctuary has not fulfilled his obligation," it is written about it, "From them you shall offer," and he holds that it was burned due to mourning.

hebrew_text: איכא למפרך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן לא הותרה מכללו
human_translation: can be refuted: What about their common element? in that no its general prohibition was permitted.
llm_translation: There is to refute: what to the side equal in them, thus not permitted from its entirety.

hebrew_text: טמא יוכיח
human_translation: an impure will prove
llm_translation: Impure shall prove.

hebrew_text: מה לטמא שכן מטמא הנך יוכיחו וחזר הדין כו' הצד השוה שבהן שמוזהרין כו'
human_translation: What about an impure in that he imparts impurity Those will prove And the inference has reverted their common element is that they are prohibited
llm_translation: What is the case of impurity that imparts impurity? These will prove it, and the law returns, etc. The common factor among them for which they are warned, etc.

hebrew_text: ולפרוך מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן לא הותרו מכללן אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד שם טומאה מיהא אישתראי
human_translation: But let one refute What about their common element? in that its general prohibition was not permitted, in a High Priest for an individual’s offering. The category of impurity, at least, is permitted
llm_translation: And to distinguish what to the side equal in them for not permitted from all of them by the high priest in an individual offering there impurity from any way is permitted.

hebrew_text: רב משרשיא אמר אתיא בקל וחומר מיושב ומה יושב שאוכל אם עבד חילל אונן שאינו אוכל אינו דין שאם עבד חילל
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says: is derived by a fortiori from a sitting And just as a sitting who may partake if he performed rites he has desecrated an acute mourner, who may not partake is it not right that if he performed rites he has desecrated
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: It comes with a fortiori reasoning. Just as one who is sitting can eat, if he performed the act of profaning the dead, which he is not allowed to eat, it is not considered a violation.

hebrew_text: מה ליושב שכן פסול לעדות מיושב תלמיד חכם
human_translation: What about a sitting in that is disqualified from bear-ing witness, from a sitting Torah scholar,
llm_translation: What is the matter with a permanent resident that makes him ineligible to testify? A permanent resident is equivalent to a Torah scholar.

hebrew_text: מה לשם יושב שכן פסול לעדות שם יושב לא פריך ואם תימצי לומר פריך אתיא מיושב ומחדא מהנך:

hebrew_text: מה טומאה שלא הותרה מכללה אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד הותרה אצל הדיוט בקרבן צבור אנינות שהותרה מכללה אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד אינו דין שהותרה אצל כהן הדיוט בקרבן ציבור
human_translation: Just as ritual impurity, whose general prohibition was not permitted in a High Priest for an individual’s offering, was permitted in an ordinary [ hedyot ] for a communal offering, acute mourning, whose general prohibition was permitted in a High Priest for an individual’s offering, is it not right that was permitted in an ordinary priest for a communal offering?
llm_translation: The impurity that was not permitted in general by the High Priest in a private offering was permitted by a layperson in a communal offering. Aninut, which was permitted in general by the High Priest in a private offering, is not the same as being permitted by a layperson in a communal offering.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבא בר אהילאי לא תותר אנינות אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד מקל וחומר ומה טומאה שהותרה אצל כהן הדיוט בצבור לא הותרה אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד אנינות שלא הותרה אצל כהן הדיוט בקרבן צבור אינו דין שלא תותר אצל כהן גדול בקרבן יחיד
human_translation: Rava bar Ahilai objects to this: acute mourning should not be permitted in a High Priest for an individual’s offering, by a fortiori And just as ritual impurity, was permitted in an ordinary priest for a communal offering, was not permitted in a High Priest for an individual’s offering; acute mourning, was not permitted in an ordinary priest for a communal offering, is it not right that should not be permitted in a High Priest for an individual’s offering?
llm_translation: Rava son of Ahilai objects to her: Do not leave mourning with the High Priest in the case of an individual offering, from a fortiori reasoning. And just as impurity which is permitted with a common priest in a communal offering is not permitted with the High Priest in an individual offering, so too mourning which is not permitted with a common priest in a communal offering is not permitted with the High Priest in an individual offering.
