llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: "Marushalin are valid when removed, invalid when attached." And it was taught: "When removed, they are valid." Rami bar Hama said: "This is not difficult - here, where they were removed by a belt, and here, where they were not originally attached at all."

hebrew_text: רב אמר אחד זה ואחד זה פסולין:
human_translation: Rav says: both this and that they are unfit.
llm_translation: Rav said: "Both this one and that one are invalid."

hebrew_text: רב הונא איקלע לארגיזא רמא ליה בר אושפיזכניה מי אמר שמואל מרושלין כשרין ומסולקין פסולין והתניא מסולקין כשרין א"ל בר מינה דההיא דשנייה רמי בר חמא
human_translation: Rav Huna happened to Argiza. The son of his innkeeper [ oshpizekhaneih ] raised a contradiction him: Did Shmuel say dragging they are fit, but raised up they are unfit? But isn’t it taught raised up they are fit? said to him: apart from this as Rami bar Ḥama answered it
llm_translation: Rav Huna arrived in Argiza, Bar Oshpizkanei threw him a question: Did Shmuel say, "Marushalin are valid, and those removed are invalid"? But it was taught: Those removed are valid. He said to him: The son of the family that repeats, Rami bar Hama.

hebrew_text: אלא לרב קשיא וכי תימא מאי מרושלין מסולקין על ידי אבנט ואבנט מיגז אגיז אלא מסולקין קשיא
human_translation: But a difficulty for Rav, And if you would say: What Dragging, raised up by a belt and belt trims but Raised up, a difficulty.
llm_translation: Rather, for Rav it is difficult. And if you will say, what is the meaning of "from Jerusalem they are removed by way of a belt, and a belt from the waist," rather, they are removed. This is difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא רב חדא תני מרושלין שסילקן ע"י אבנט כשרין
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Rav taught one dragging that raised up by belt are fit.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: Rav Hada taught in the name of the scholars of Jerusalem: "Silken garments are valid when tied with a belt."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' ירמיה מדיפתי מרושלין שלא סילקן תנאי היא דתניא (דברים כב, יב) על ארבע כנפות כסותך ארבע ולא שלש או אינו אלא ארבע ולא חמש כשהוא אומר (דברים כב, יב) אשר תכסה בה הרי בעלת חמש אמור הא מה אני מקיים ארבע ארבע ולא שלש ומה ראית לרבות בעלת חמש ולהוציא בעלת שלש מרבה אני בעלת חמש שיש בכלל חמש ארבע ומוציא אני בעלת שלש שאין בכלל שלש ארבע
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti says: dragging that did not raise is tanna’im . As it is taught “On the four corners of your garment” Four, but not three, Or it is only four, but not five? When it says “With which you cover yourself,” of five is mentioned how do I realize “Four four, but not three. And what did you see to include of five and to exclude of three I include of five as four is included in five, and I exclude of three as four is not included in three.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah from Difti said: From Jerusalem they did not remove it. It is a dispute of Tannaim as it was taught (Deuteronomy 22:12), "On four corners of your garment you shall make tassels." Not three, but four. And not five, but only four. When it says (Deuteronomy 22:12), "With it you shall cover yourself," behold, a woman with five is spoken of. How do I fulfill four? Four and not three. And what did you see to include a woman with five and exclude a woman with three? I include a woman with five, which includes four, and I exclude a woman with three, which does not include three but four.

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך על ארבע כנפות כסותך ארבע ולא שלש ארבע ולא חמש מאי לאו בהא קמיפלגי דמר סבר יתר כמאן דאיתיה דמי ומר סבר כמאן דליתיה דמי
human_translation: And it is taught another “On the four corners of your garment,” Four, but not three, four, but not five, What, is it not disagree with regard to this: That Sage, holds an extra is considered as though it exists and Sage, holds is considered as though it does not exist
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: "On four corners your garment, four and not three, four and not five." What is it? Is it not in this that they dispute? For one Sage holds: "Like the one who has it is more," and the other Sage holds: "Like the one who does not have it is more."

hebrew_text: לא דכ"ע כמאן דאיתיה דמי ושאני הכא דרבי רחמנא אשר תכסה בה
human_translation: No, everyone is considered as though it exists, And is different here, as the Merciful One amplifies “with which you cover yourself.”
llm_translation: Not like the opinion of the one who holds it is similar, and it is different here, for "Rabbi, the Merciful One, may He be covered by her."

hebrew_text: ואידך האי אשר תכסה בה מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לכדתניא (במדבר טו, לט) וראיתם אותו פרט לכסות לילה או אינו אלא פרט לכסות סומא כשהוא אומר אשר תכסה בה הרי כסות סומא אמור הא מה אני מקיים וראיתם אותו פרט לכסות לילה
human_translation: And the other what does he do with this “With which you cover yourself”? He requires it for that which is taught that you may look upon it” exclude a night garment Or is it only exclude the garment of a blind person, When it states “With which you cover yourself” the garment of a blind person is mentioned. how do I realize “That you may look upon it”? exclude a night garment.
llm_translation: And the other interpretation - this phrase "which you shall cover with it," what does it do for him? It is necessary for him, as it was taught in a Baraita (Numbers 15:39), "And you shall see it," excluding covering at night. Or perhaps it is only excluding covering a blind person, when it says "which you shall cover with it," behold, covering a blind person is spoken of. Say: How do I fulfill "And you shall see it," excluding covering at night.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות כסות סומא ולהוציא כסות לילה מרבה אני כסות סומא שישנה בראיה אצל אחרים ומוציא אני כסות לילה שאינה בראיה אצל אחרים
human_translation: And what did you see to include the garment of a blind person and to exclude a night garment I include the garment of a blind person because it is visible to others, and I exclude a night garment because it is not visible, to others.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include a blind person's garment and to exclude a night garment? I include a blind person's garment that is noticeable to others, and I exclude a night garment that is not noticeable to others.

hebrew_text: [ואידך נפקא ליה מאשר ואידך אשר לא דריש]:
human_translation: And the other He derives it from “which” And the other He does not interpret “which”
llm_translation: And the other one derives it from "asher," and the other one does not derive it from "asher."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בד שיהו של בוץ בד שיהו חדשים בד שיהו שזורים בד שיהו חוטן כפול ששה בד שלא ילבש של חול עמהן
human_translation: The Sages taught “linen” that they be of fine linen [ butz ]; “linen,” that they be new; “linen,” that be twisted “linen,” that their thread be folded six “linen,” that not wear non-sacred with them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In the case of linen, let its warp threads be of linen, let its woof threads be of linen, let it be new linen, let it be twisted linen, let its thread be doubled sixfold, and let it not be worn with woolen garments.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לרב יוסף בשלמא שיהו של בוץ הא קמ"ל בוץ אין מידי אחרינא לא אלא בד שיהו חדשים חדשים אין שחקין לא והתניא משוחקין כשרים
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Granted, that they be of fine linen this teaches us fine linen are something else not. But Linen, that they be new, new are frayed not. But isn’t it taught frayed are fit?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: Granted, if they are of linen, this teaches that linen is different. But if they are of butz, it is not anything else, only that they should be new, new, not worn out. And it was taught: If they are worn out, they are valid.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה וליטעמיך בד שיהו חוטן כפול ששה בד חד חד לחודיה משמע אלא הכי קאמר בגדים שנאמר בהן בד צריכין שיהו של בוץ חדשים שזורין שיהא חוטן כפול ששה יש מהן למצוה יש מהן לעכב
human_translation: said to him: And according to your reasoning Linen, that their thread be folded six bad means each one on its own Rather, this is saying: garments with regard to which it is stated: Linen, must be of fine linen, new twisted, their thread be folded six Some of a mitzva some of them are indispensable.
llm_translation: He said to him, "And to taste your knowledge in linen, let the thread be doubled six threads, one thread next to the other." This implies, rather, this is what he is saying: Linens, as it is stated regarding them, "linen garments" - they require that the warp threads be of fine linen, the woof threads be new, and that the thread be doubled six threads. Some of them are for the commandment, some of them are for delay.

hebrew_text: ממאי דהאי בד כתנא הוא אמר רבי יוסף ברבי חנינא דבר העולה מן הקרקע בד בבד
human_translation: From where that this bad is flax Rabbi Yosef, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: an item that grows from the ground each on its own [ bad bevad ],
llm_translation: From what is this "bad" linen made? Rabbi Yosef, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: something that ascends from the ground, linen in linen.

hebrew_text: אימא עמרא עמרא מיפצל כיתנא נמי מיפצל על ידי לקותא מיפציל
human_translation: say wool? wool split flax also splits. It splits by being struck.
llm_translation: Say: "Omer" Omer is divided. Ketina is also divided. Through a blow, it is divided.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר מהכא (יחזקאל מד, יח) פארי פשתים יהיו על ראשם [ומכנסי פשתים יהיו על מתניהם לא יחגרו ביזע]
human_translation: Ravina says from here: “They shall have linen [ pishtim ] crowns upon their heads, and shall have linen breeches upon their loins; they shall not gird themselves with yaza ”
llm_translation: Ravina said: From here (Ezekiel 44:18) "They shall have linen turbans on their heads, and linen breeches on their loins; they shall not gird themselves with anything that causes sweat."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי לרבינא והא עד דאתא יחזקאל מנלן ולטעמיך הא דאמר רב חסדא דבר זה מתורת משה רבינו לא למדנו מדברי יחזקאל בן בוזי למדנו (יחזקאל מד, ט) כל בן נכר ערל לב וערל בשר לא יבא אל מקדשי (לשרתני) עד שבא יחזקאל מנלן אלא גמרא גמירי לה ואתא יחזקאל ואסמכיה אקרא הכא נמי גמרא גמירי לה כו'
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ravina: But before Ezekiel came, from where did we And according to your reasoning, that which Rav Ḥisda said We did not learn this matter from the Torah of Moses, our teacher; we learned from the words of Ezekiel, son of Buzi: “No stranger, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into My Sanctuary to serve Me” Until Ezekiel came, from where did we Rather, is learned as a tradition and Ezekiel came and gave it support by a verse. Here too, it is learned as a tradition,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ravina: "But until Ezekiel came, from where do we derive this, and according to your reasoning, this that Rav Chisda said, 'This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher, we learned from the words of Ezekiel son of Buzi' (Ezekiel 44:9), that every foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall not enter My sanctuary (to serve Me), until Ezekiel came from where do we derive it? Rather, it is a tradition that we have received, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse. Here too, it is a tradition that we have received."

hebrew_text: מאי (יחזקאל מד, יח) לא יחגרו ביזע אמר אביי לא יחגרו במקום שמזיעין כדתניא כשהם חוגרין אין חוגרין לא למטה ממתניהן ולא למעלה מאציליהן אלא
human_translation: What “They shall not gird themselves with yaza ”? Abaye said: They shall not gird themselves in a place which sweat [ mezi’in ]. As it is taught When they gird they may not gird below their loins nor above their elbows, rather
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'They shall not gird themselves with sweat' (Ezekiel 44:18)? Abaye said: They shall not gird themselves in a place where they sweat, as it was taught in a Baraita: When they gird themselves, they do not gird below their waists nor above their armpits, but..."

hebrew_text: כנגד אצילי ידיהן
human_translation: at the level of their elbows.
llm_translation: Corresponding to the nobles of their hands.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמר לי הונא בר נתן זימנא חדא הוה קאימנא קמיה דאיזגדר מלכא והוה מדלי לי המיינאי ותיתייה ניהליה ואמר לי (שמות יט, ו) ממלכת כהנים וגוי קדוש כתיב בכו כי אתאי קמיה דאמימר א"ל אקיים בך (ישעיהו מט, כג) והיו מלכים אומניך:
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: Huna bar Natan said to me: Once, I was standing before Izgadar, king and my belt was raised and he lowered it and said to me: “A kingdom of priests, and a holy nation” is written about you; When I came before Ameimar he said to me: With regard to you, “And kings shall be your foster fathers” was fulfilled.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, Huna the son of Nathan told me, once I was standing before the king's treasury guard, and he was giving me water to drink, and I was taking it and drinking it. And he said to me, "From the kingdom of priests and holy nation it is written about you." When I came before Imma's son, he said to me, "I will establish you." And "Kings shall be your foster fathers" (Isaiah 49:23).

hebrew_text: תנן התם כהן שלקה באצבעו כורך עליה גמי במקדש אבל לא במדינה ואם להוציא ממנה דם כאן וכאן אסור
human_translation: we learned elsewhere A priest who was injured on his finger wrap it with a reed in the Temple, but not in the country, But if to draw blood from it is prohibited here and there.
llm_translation: We learned there: A priest who received a wound on his finger may wrap a bandage around it with a reed in the Temple, but not in an unwalled city. And if the purpose is to extract blood from it, it is prohibited both here and there.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יהודה בריה דרבי חייא לא שנו אלא גמי אבל צילצול קטן הוי יתור בגדים ורבי יוחנן אמר לא אמרו יתור בגדים אלא במקום בגדים אבל שלא במקום בגדים לא הוי יתור
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: They taught only a reed But a small sash [ tziltzul ] is an extra garment And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They said extra garments only in a place vestments But in a place vestments not is not an extra
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya: They only taught regarding a camel, but a small bell is considered an additional garment. And Rabbi Yochanan said: They did not say an additional garment except in a place of garments, but if not in a place of garments, it is not considered an additional garment.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה משום חציצה בשמאל א"נ שלא במקום עבודה
human_translation: And let derive because an interposition on left Alternatively, not in a place service,
llm_translation: And it emerged for him because of a barrier on the left, or rather, not in the place of work.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דרבא דאמר רבא אמר רב חסדא במקום בגדים אפי' נימא אחת חוצצת שלא במקום בגדים שלש על שלש חוצצות פחות מכאן אינן חוצצות
human_translation: And disagrees of Rava, as Rava says Rav Ḥisda says: In a place vestments even one thread interposes in a place vestments not three by three it interposes, less than that it does not interpose.
llm_translation: And there is a dispute of Rava, for Rava said, Rav Ḥisda said: In a place of garments, even one thread is considered a separation. Not in a place of garments, three by three threads are not considered a separation.

hebrew_text: אדרבי יוחנן ודאי פליגא אדר' יהודה בריה דרבי חייא מי לימא דפליגא
human_translation: certainly disagrees with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, Shall we say he disagrees with of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: On the contrary, Yochanan certainly disagrees with Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Chiya. Who can say that he disagrees?

hebrew_text: שאני צילצול קטן דחשיב
human_translation: a small sash is different, as it is significant,
llm_translation: It is different, a small bell is significant.

hebrew_text: לישנא אחרינא אמרי לה אמר ר' יהודה בריה דרבי חייא לא שנו אלא גמי אבל צילצול קטן חוצץ ורבי יוחנן אמר לא אמרו חציצה בפחות משלש על שלש אלא במקום בגדים אבל שלא במקום בגדים שלש על שלש חוצצות פחות מיכן אינה חוצצת והיינו דרבא אמר רב חסדא
human_translation: Some say another version Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says they taught only a reed but a small sash interposes. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They said an interposition when less than three by three only in a place vestments But in a place vestments not three by three it interposes, less than this, it does not interpose. And this is that Rava Rav Ḥisda says.
llm_translation: Another teaching they said: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: They only taught regarding a complete vessel, but a small chip does not constitute a separation. And Rabbi Yochanan said: They did not say that a separation occurs in less than three handbreadths by three handbreadths except in a place of garments, but if not in a place of garments, even three handbreadths by three handbreadths do not constitute a separation. Less than this is not considered a separation. And this is what Rava said in the name of Rav Chisda.

hebrew_text: לימא פליגא אדר' יהודה בריה דרבי חייא שאני צילצול קטן דחשיב
human_translation: Let us say disagrees with of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, a small sash is different, since it is significant.
llm_translation: Let us say a dispute: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Chiya, differs, for a small bell is significant.

hebrew_text: ולר' יוחנן מאי איריא גמי לשמועינן צילצול קטן מילתא אגב אורחיה קמ"ל דגמי מסי
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, why specifically a reed? Let teach us a small sash, It teaches us a matter in passing, that a reed heals.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yochanan, what is the relevance of "Gemi" for us to hear? A small tinkling sound regarding his way. This teaches us that Gemi is effective.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא נכנסה לו רוח בבגדו מהו על בשרו בעינן והא ליכא או דלמא דרך לבישה בכך
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: wind entered vestment, what is we require “Upon his body” and this not Or perhaps this manner of wearing
llm_translation: Rava asked: "If a spirit entered his garment, what is the law regarding placing it on his flesh? Do we require it to be placed on his flesh, or perhaps it is considered a normal way of wearing garments in this manner?"

hebrew_text: כינה מהו שתחוץ
human_translation: what is a louse Does it interpose
llm_translation: Kina, what is the meaning of "Shetachutz"?

hebrew_text: מתה לא תבעי לך דודאי חייצא חיה מאי מי אמרינן כיון דאתא ואזלא רביתא היא ולא חייצא או דלמא כיון דקפיד עלה חייצא
human_translation: Do not raise a dilemma a dead as certainly interposes, what a live Do we say since it comes and goes, it is a growth and does not interpose? Or perhaps, since he objects to its it interposes?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Do not inquire about a dead animal, for sure it is alive. What is it? Do we say that since it came and went, it is a revivable animal and not a dead one? Or perhaps, since it has decomposed, it is a dead animal."

hebrew_text: עפר מהו שיחוץ עפר ודאי חייץ אלא אבק עפר מהו
human_translation: what is dirt Does it interpose? dirt certainly interposes. Rather, What is dust of dirt,
llm_translation: Dust, what is the meaning of "sifting dust"? Certainly sifting. Rather, what is the meaning of "dust"?

hebrew_text: בית השחי מהו שיחוץ על בשרו בעינן והא ליכא או דלמא דרך לבישה בכך
human_translation: what is armpit? Does it interpose? we require “upon his body” and this not Or perhaps this manner of wearing
llm_translation: The House of Shachai, what is the meaning of "scratching upon his flesh" that we require? But there is none, or perhaps it is a way of modesty in this.

hebrew_text: הכניס ידו לתוך חיקו מהו גופו מי חייץ או לא
human_translation: inserted his hand into his chest, what is Does his body interpose or not?
llm_translation: He inserted his hand into his bosom - what is the law regarding his body, is it considered as if he has withdrawn it or not?

hebrew_text: נימא מהו שתחוץ נימא ודאי חייצא אלא נימא מדולדלת מהו
human_translation: what is a thread [ nima ]? Does it interpose? a thread certainly interposes. Rather, What is a thread hangs
llm_translation: Nima, what is "Shetachutz Nima"? Nima is certainly a wall. Rather, Nima is from "Doldaltah," what is it.

hebrew_text: בעי מר בר רב אשי יצא שערו בבגדו מהו שערו כגופו דמי או לאו כגופו דמי
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: his hair emerged into his vestment what is Is his hair considered like his body, or is it not considered like his body?
llm_translation: The Master, son of Rav Ashi, asked: If one's hair protruded from his garment, is his hair considered like his body or not like his body?

hebrew_text: בעי רבי זירא תפילין מהו שיחוצו אליבא דמאן דאמר לילה לאו זמן תפילין הוא לא תבעי לך כיון דלילה חייצי יום נמי חייצי כי תיבעי לך למ"ד לילה זמן תפילין מאי מצוה דגופיה חייץ או לא חייץ
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: What is phylacteries? Do they interpose? According to of one who says night is not time phylacteries, do not raise the dilemma. Since they interpose night, they also interpose day. when you raise the dilemma, according to the one who says night is time phylacteries. what Does a mitzva with his body interpose, or does it not interpose?
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira asked: Regarding phylacteries, what is the law if one holds that night is not the time for phylacteries? You need not ask, for since night is considered a part of the day, it is also considered a part of the time for phylacteries. If you were to ask according to the opinion that night is the time for phylacteries, what is the mitzvah itself - is it considered a part of the day or not a part of the day?

hebrew_text: איגלגל מילתא ומטא לקמיה דרבי אמי א"ל תלמוד ערוך הוא בידינו תפילין חוצצות
human_translation: matter circulated and came before Rabbi Ami, said to him: It is a settled tradition in our possession phylacteries interpose.
llm_translation: The matter was confused and came before Rabbi Ami. He said to them, "It is a well-arranged Talmud in our hands, phylacteries are an interruption."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כהנים בעבודתן ולוים בדוכנן וישראל במעמדן פטורין מן התפלה ומן התפילין מאי לאו אם הניחן אינן חוצצות לא אם הניחן חוצצות
human_translation: raises an objection Priests in their service; and Levites on their platform and Israelites at their watches, are exempt from prayer and from phylacteries. What, is it not if they donned they do not interpose? No, if they donned they interpose.
llm_translation: The scholars asked: Priests in their service, Levites in their platform, and Israelites in their standing are exempt from prayer and from phylacteries. What, is it not so? If they put them on, they are not considered an interruption; if they put them on, they are considered an interruption.

hebrew_text: א"ה פטורים אסורים מיבעי ליה כיון דאיכא לוים וישראל דלא מתנו ליה אסור משום הכי תנא פטורין
human_translation: If so, Exempt? It should have Prohibited, Since there are Levites and Israelites concerning whom not teach Prohibited, due to that taught Exempt,
llm_translation: The Kohanim and Levi'im are exempt, the Yisraelim are forbidden. It is necessary for him since there are Levi'im and Yisraelim who did not give to him, it is forbidden because of this. Therefore, it was taught: The Kohanim and Levi'im are exempt.

hebrew_text: והתניא אם הניחן אינן חוצצות לא קשיא הא דיד הא דראש
human_translation: But isn’t it taught If donned they do not interpose? not difficult. This of the hand, that of the head.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If he left them, they are not considered an interruption. This is not difficult: this one is according to my opinion, and that one is according to the opinion of Rava.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא דיד דכתיב (ויקרא ו, ג) ילבש על בשרו שלא יהא דבר חוצץ בינו לבשרו דראש נמי כתיב (שמות כט, ו) ושמת המצנפת על ראשו
human_translation: What is different of the hand as it is written “Shall he put upon his body” that nothing may interpose between and his body. also written with regard to the head: “And you shall set the mitre upon his head”
llm_translation: "What is the difference between us, as it is written (Leviticus 6:3), 'He shall put on his body,' so that nothing should intervene between his body and his garment? For the head also it is written (Exodus 29:6), 'And you shall place the turban upon his head.'"

hebrew_text: תנא שערו היה נראה בין ציץ למצנפת
human_translation: taught: The hair of was visible between the frontplate and the mitre.
llm_translation: It was taught: "His hair was visible between the Tzitz and the Mitznefet."

hebrew_text: ששם מניחין תפילין:
human_translation: there that don phylacteries.
llm_translation: There, they place tefillin.

hebrew_text: מחוסר כיפורים מנלן אמר רב הונא אמר קרא (ויקרא יב, ח) וכפר עליה הכהן וטהרה טהרה מכלל שהיא טמאה:
human_translation: one who has not yet an atonement From where do we Rav Huna says: The verse states “And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be pure” she shall be pure,” by inference that she is ritually impure
llm_translation: Lacking atonements from where? Rav Huna said, Scripture says (Leviticus 12:8), "And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean." Cleanliness implies that she is impure.

hebrew_text: ושלא רחוץ ידים ורגלים: אתיא חוקה חוקה ממחוסר בגדים:
human_translation: one whose hands and feet are not washed is derived “statute” “statute” from one lacking vestments,
llm_translation: And that he did not wash his hands and feet: it comes as a decree from one who lacks garments.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כהן גדול שלא טבל ושלא קידש בין בגד לבגד ובין עבודה לעבודה ועבד עבודתו כשרה ואחד כהן גדול ואחד כהן הדיוט שלא קידש ידיו ורגליו שחרית ועבד עבודתו פסולה
human_translation: The Sages taught: a High Priest who did not immerse or did not sanctify between garments and garments, or between rite and rite, and he performed service his service is valid But either a High Priest or an ordinary priest who did not sanctify his hands and feet morning and performed service, his service is disqualified.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A High Priest who did not immerse, and did not sanctify, whether between one garment and another, or between one service and another, and performed his service - it is valid. And both a High Priest and an ordinary priest who did not sanctify their hands and feet in the morning, and performed their service - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אסי לרבי יוחנן מכדי חמש טבילות ועשרה קדושין דאורייתא וחוקה כתיב בהו ליעכבו
human_translation: Rav Asi said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Now, five immersions and ten sanctifications by Torah law, and “Statute” is written with regard to them. they should be indispensable
llm_translation: Rav Assi said to Rabbi Yochanan: "Since five immersions and ten sanctifications are written in the Torah and it is written regarding them 'to delay.'"

hebrew_text: א"ל אמר קרא (ויקרא טז, ד) ולבשם לבישה מעכבת ואין דבר אחר מעכב
human_translation: said to him: the verse states: “And put them on” wearing is indispensable, but nothing else is indispensable.
llm_translation: He said to him, the verse says (Leviticus 16:4), "And he shall put on the holy linen tunic, and the linen breeches shall be upon his flesh, and he shall be girded with a linen sash, and with the linen turban shall he be attired. These are the holy garments; therefore, he shall bathe in water, and put them on."

hebrew_text: צהבו פניו אמר ליה וי"ו אאופתא כתבי לך אי הכי דצפרא נמי
human_translation: face lit up said to him: I have written vav on a piece of wood for you, if that is so, in the morning also
llm_translation: His face shone - he said to him, "And the letter 'ו' I will write for you. If so, then the bird also."

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה אמר קרא (שמות ל, כא) והיתה להם חק עולם לו ולזרעו לדורותם דבר המעכב בזרעו מעכב בו דבר שאינו מעכב בזרעו אין מעכב בו
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says The verse states “And it shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations” anything that is indispensable with regard to his seed, is indispensable with regard to him, anything that is not indispensable with regard to his seed is not indispensable with regard to him.
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah said Scripture (Exodus 30:21) "And it shall be for them an eternal statute for him and for his offspring for their generations." A matter that impedes in his offspring impedes in him, a matter that does not impede in his offspring does not impede in him.

hebrew_text: רבי יונתן אמר מהכא (שמות מ, לא) ורחצו ממנו משה ואהרן ובניו דבר המעכב בבניו מעכב בו דבר שאינו מעכב בבניו אין מעכב בו
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: from here: “That Moses and Aaron and his sons might wash their hands and their feet from it” anything that is indispensable with regard to his sons is indispensable with regard to him. anything that is not indispensable with regard to his sons is not indispensable with regard to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan said: From here (Exodus 30:31) "And Moses and Aaron and his sons shall wash from it." A matter that is dependent on his sons is dependent on him; a matter that is not dependent on his sons is not dependent on him.

hebrew_text: רבי יונתן מ"ט לא אמר מדחזקיה אמר לך ההוא לדורות הוא דכתיב
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Yonatan did not say from by Ḥizkiyya? said to you: That is written for generations,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan: What is the reason that he did not say "from the time of Hezekiah"? Because that one is for generations, as it is written:

hebrew_text: ואידך מ"ט לא אמר מהאי מיבעי ליה לכדרבי יוסי ברבי חנינא דאמר רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא כל כיור שאין בו כדי לקדש ארבעה כהנים ממנו אין מקדשין בו שנאמר ורחצו ממנו משה ואהרן ובניו:
human_translation: And the other what is the reason he did not say from that He requires for by Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina. As Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: any which Basin does not contain enough for four priests to sanctify from it, may not sanctify with it, as it is stated: “That Moses and Aaron and his sons might wash from it.”
llm_translation: And the other one, what is the reason he did not say from this? It is necessary for him according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: Any basin that does not contain enough water to sanctify four priests from it, they do not sanctify with it, as it is stated, "And Moses, Aaron, and his sons shall wash from it."

hebrew_text: ת"ר כיצד מצות קידוש מניח ידו הימנית על גבי רגלו הימנית וידו השמאלית על גבי רגלו השמאלית ומקדש רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר מניח שתי ידיו זו על גב זו ועל גבי שתי רגליו זו על גבי זו ומקדש אמרו לו הפלגתה אי אפשר לעשות כן
human_translation: The Sages taught: How is the mitzva of sanctification lays his right hand on top of his right foot, and his left hand on top of his left foot, and sanctifies Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: He lays both his hands one on top of the other, and on top of both his feet, one on top of the other, and sanctifies They said to him: You have gone too far; it is impossible to do so.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How is the mitzvah of Kiddush performed? One places his right hand on his right foot and his left hand on his left foot, and sanctifies. Rabbi Yosi bar Rabbi Yehuda says: One places both his hands, one on top of the other, and on top of both his feet, one on top of the other, and sanctifies. They said to him: It is impossible to do so.

hebrew_text: שפיר קאמרי ליה אמר רב יוסף וחבירו מסייעו
human_translation: They speak well to him; Rav Yosef says: while another help him
llm_translation: "Good, they said to him, said Rav Yosef, and his colleague assists."

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר אביי עמידה מן הצד איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between Abaye says: between them is standing from the side.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: Standing on the side, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב סמא בריה דרב אשי לרבינא וליתיב מיתב ולקדש אמר קרא (שמות ל, כ) לשרת ושירות מעומד הוא:
human_translation: Rav Samma, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina: And let him sit and sanctify The verse states: to minister” and ministration is standing,
llm_translation: Rav Sama, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina: "Let him sit and sanctify." He said: A verse states (Exodus 30:20), "To serve and to minister he stands."

hebrew_text: ת"ר קידש ידיו ורגליו ביום אין צריך לקדש בלילה בלילה צריך לקדש ביום דברי רבי שהיה רבי אומר לינה מועלת בקידוש ידים ורגלים רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אומר אין לינה מועלת בקידוש ידים ורגלים
human_translation: The Sages taught: sanctified his hands and feet during the day, he does not need to sanctify night, at night, he must sanctify during the day. the statement of Rabbi as Rabbi would say: left overnight is determinative with regard to sanctification of hands and feet, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: left overnight is not determinative with regard to sanctification of hands and feet.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He sanctified his hands and feet during the day, he does not need to sanctify at night. At night, he must sanctify during the day." These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi said: "Sleep renders the sanctification of hands and feet unnecessary." Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said: "Sleep does not render the sanctification of hands and feet unnecessary."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך היה עומד ומקריב על גבי מזבח כל הלילה לאורה טעון קידוש ידים ורגלים דברי רבי רבי אלעזר בר"ש אומר כיון שקידש ידיו ורגליו מתחילת עבודה אפילו מיכן ועד עשרה ימים אינו צריך לקדש
human_translation: It is taught another was standing and sacrificing on top of the altar all night, in the morning he requires sanctification of hands and feet the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Once he sanctified his hands and feet at the beginning of service, even for the next ten days, he does not need to sanctify
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: He would stand and offer on the altar throughout the entire night. For the morning, he requires sanctification of the hands and feet. These are the words of Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon. Rabbi Eliezer ben Shimon says: Once he sanctified his hands and feet at the beginning of the service, even from here until ten days, he does not need to sanctify them again.

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן קמייתא בההיא קאמר רבי דפסק ליה מעבודה לעבודה אבל בהא דלא פסק ליה אימא מודי ליה רבי לרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון ואי אשמעינן בהא בהא קאמר רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אבל בהא אימא מודי ליה לרבי צריכא
human_translation: And necessary, As, if it had taught us the first Rabbi stated with regard to that as paused between rite and rite. But in this where he did not pause say Rabbi concedes to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, And if it had taught us with regard to that Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, stated in that But in this say he concedes to Rabbi necessary.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear the first part, in that Rabbi said that he ruled from one service to another, but in this case where he did not rule from one service to another, say that Rabbi agrees with Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon. And if we were to hear in this case and in that case, Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon said, but in this case say that Rabbi agrees with Rabbi. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דרבי דכתיב (שמות ל, כ) בגשתם מ"ט דרבי אלעזר בר"ש דכתיב (שמות ל, כ) בבואם
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi As it is written: “When they come near what is the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written “When they go into
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? As it is written (Exodus 30:20), "when they come near." What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon? As it is written (Exodus 30:20), "when they enter."

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב בבואם אי כתיב בגשתם ולא כתיב בבואם הוה אמינא על כל גישה וגישה כתב רחמנא בבואם
human_translation: But the other as well, isn’t it written: “When they go into If “when they come near” had been written, and “when they go into” had not been written, I would say for each and every approach, the Merciful One wrote: “When they go into,”
llm_translation: And the other one also, this is written in their coming, if it were written in their approaching, and it is not written in their coming, I would say for every approach and approach, the Merciful One wrote in their coming.

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב בגשתם אי כתיב בבואם ולא כתיב בגשתם הוה אמינא אפילו אביאה ריקנית
human_translation: But the other as well, isn’t it written: “When they come near”? If “when they go into” had been written, and “when they come near” had not been written, I would say even for an entrance with no purpose,
llm_translation: And the other one also, this is written in their coming near, if it were written in their entering, and it is not written in their coming near, I would say even an empty bringing.

hebrew_text: אביאה ריקנית הא כתיב לשרת אלא בגשתם מיבעי ליה לכדרב אחא בר יעקב דאמר רב אחא בר יעקב הכל מודים בקידוש שני כשהוא לבוש מקדש דאמר קרא או בגשתם מי שאינו מחוסר אלא גישה בלבד יצא זה שמחוסר לבישה וגישה
human_translation: for an entrance with no purpose? Isn’t is written “To minister”? Rather, “when they come near” is necessary for by Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov. As Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: All concede with regard to the second sanctification sanctify while he is dressed as the verse states: “Or when they come near one who is lacking only to come near Excluded is this who is lacking dressing and coming near.
llm_translation: Bring an empty vessel. Is it written "to serve"? Rather, in their approach, it is necessary for him. According to Rav Acha bar Yaakov who said, Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Everyone agrees regarding the sanctification of the second Temple service when he is clothed in the holy garments, as the verse states: "Or in their approach." One who is lacking only in approach has fulfilled his obligation, but one who is lacking in both clothing and approach has not.

hebrew_text: (שמות ל, כ) להקטיר אשה למה לי
human_translation: Why do I “To cause an offering by fire to smoke”?
llm_translation: (Exodus 30:20) "To burn incense, why do I need it?"

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא הני מילי עבודה דמעכבא כפרה אבל עבודה דלא מעכבא כפרה לא קמ"ל
human_translation: Lest you say this matter, a rite that is indispensable atonement, but a rite that is not indispensable atonement, not teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason that you might say these matters, the service that delays atonement, but the service that does not delay atonement, it does not teach.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר רבי יוחנן בעי אילפא לדברי האומר אין לינה מועלת בקידוש ידים ורגלים מי כיור מהו שיפסלו מי אמרינן הני למאי לקידוש ידים ורגלים קידוש ידים ורגלים גופייהו לא פסול בהו לינה או דלמא כיון דקדוש להו בכלי שרת מיפסלי
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Ilfa raises a dilemma: According to the statement of who says left overnight is not determinative with regard to sanctification of hands and feet, what is the water Basin? Is it disqualified Do we say: For what this for the sanctification of hands and feet, sanctification of hands and feet itself is not disqualified left overnight, Or perhaps, since is sanctified in a service vessel, it is disqualified
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Iltfa inquired regarding the words of one who says that sleeping is beneficial during the sanctification of the hands and feet. What about a basin? Will they invalidate it? Do we say that these are designated for the sanctification of the hands and feet, and the sanctification of the hands and feet themselves are not invalidated by them sleeping, or perhaps since they were sanctified with sacred vessels, they will be invalidated?

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר רבי ירמיה אמר רבי אמי אמר ר' יוחנן הדר פשיט אילפא כמחלוקת בזו כך מחלוקת בזו
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yirmeya says Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Ilfa then resolved as a dispute with regard to that so a dispute with regard to this
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yirmiyah said, Rabbi Ami said, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Return, I will explain. Just as there is a dispute in this one, so too is there a dispute in this one."

hebrew_text: אמר לפניו ר' יצחק בר ביסנא רבי אתה אומר כן אלא הכי אמר ר' אסי אמר ר' יוחנן [משמיה דאילפא] כיור שלא שקעו מבערב מקדש ממנו לעבודת לילה ולמחר אינו מקדש
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Bisna said before My teacher, you say so? But this Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Ilfa: a Basin that they did not sink at night, sanctifies from it for the service of night, and the next day he does not sanctify
llm_translation: Said before Him Rabbi Yitzchak bar Bisna: "Rabbi, do you say so? Rather, thus said Rabbi Assi in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Ilfa: A laver that was not immersed from evening sanctifies it for nighttime service, but the next day it does not sanctify."

hebrew_text: והוינן בה למחר אינו מקדש דלא צריך לקדוש או דלמא איפסלו בלינה ולא פשיט לן ומר קא פשיט ליה מיפשיט
human_translation: And we discussed it: the next day he does not sanctify that he does not require sanctification Or perhaps was disqualified by left overnight? And did not resolve for us. But Master, are resolving
llm_translation: And we establish it for the next day does not sanctify, for it does not require sanctification, or perhaps they became disqualified overnight, and it is not clear to us, and the Master clarifies it for us.

hebrew_text: ת"ש בן קטין עשה שנים עשר דד לכיור אף הוא עשה מוכני לכיור שלא יהיו מימיו נפסלין בלינה מאי לאו רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון היא לא רבי היא
human_translation: Come hear ben Katin made twelve spigots for the Basin He also made a mechanism [ mukhani ] for the Basin that its water would not be disqualified by left overnight. What, is it not is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? No, it is Rabbi
llm_translation: Come and hear: Ben Katin made twelve handles for the basin, he also made sockets for the basin so that its waters would not become disqualified through overnight stagnation. What, is it not the opinion of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? No, it is not Rabbi Elazar, but rather Rabbi Yehudah HaNasi.

hebrew_text: והא מדרישא רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון סיפא נמי רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון
human_translation: But from that the first clause Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, the latter clause is also Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And this is the teaching: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. The latter part also is taught by Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: דקתני רישא בא לו אצל פרו ופר היה עומד בין האולם ולמזבח ראשו לדרום ופניו למערב והכהן עומד במזרח ופניו למערב מאן שמעת ליה דאמר  בין האולם ולמזבח צפון רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון
human_translation: As the first clause teaches come next to his bull, and bull was standing between the Entrance Hall and the altar its head to the south and its face to the west. And the priest stands to the east and his face to the west. Whom have you heard who says between the Entrance Hall and the altar north Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If the blood reached him while he was with his bull, and the bull was standing between the hall and the altar, its head to the south and its face to the west, and the priest was standing to the east with his face to the west, who agrees with him that it should be 'between the hall and the altar' to the north? Rabbi Eliezer, the son of Rabbi Shimon."

hebrew_text: דתניא איזהו צפון מקיר מזבח צפוני ועד כותל עזרה צפוני וכנגד כל המזבח כולו צפון דברי רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון מוסיף אף בין האולם ולמזבח רבי מוסיף אף מקום דריסת רגלי הכהנים ומקום דריסת רגלי ישראל אבל מן החליפות ולפנים הכל מודים שפסול
human_translation: as it is taught What is north? from the northern wall of the altar until the northern wall of the Temple courtyard. And opposite the entire altar north; the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, adds even between the Entrance Hall and the altar Rabbi adds even the place where the priests walk, and the place where the Israelites walk. But all concede that from the Knives [ haḥalifot ] and inward, unfit
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: What is considered the north? From the northern wall of the altar until the northern wall of the Temple courtyard, and opposite the entire altar is considered north. These are the words of Rabbi Yosi, the son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Shimon, adds that even between the Hall and the altar is considered north. Rabbi Moshe adds that even the place where the priests tread and the place where the Israelites tread is considered north. However, regarding the chambers and the inner areas, everyone agrees that it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ותסברא רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון היא ולא רבי [השתא רבי] אדרבי יוסי ברבי יהודה מוסיף אדרבי אלעזר בר' שמעון לא מוסיף
human_translation: And you understand is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and not Rabbi Now, Rabbi add to of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, not add to of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: And it was thought by Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, and not Rabbi it is thought Rabbi Adarbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda adds, on the contrary, Elazar son of Shimon does not add.

hebrew_text: אנן הכי קאמרינן אי ס"ד רבי היא לוקמה במקום דריסת רגלי כהנים ובמקום דריסת רגלי ישראל
human_translation: This is what we are saying: If it enters your mind is Rabbi let him stand in the place where the priests walk and in the place where the Israelites walk,
llm_translation: We thus say: If you will say that she is a Rabbi, she is established in the place where the priests tread and in the place where the Israelites tread.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון היא לוקמה מקיר מזבח צפוני עד כותל עזרה צפוני אלא מאי אית לך למימר משום חולשא דכהן גדול הכא נמי משום חולשא דכהן גדול:
human_translation: Rather, what is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? let him stand from the north wall of the altar to the north wall of the Temple courtyard, Rather, what have you to say due to the weakness of High Priest, Here too, due to the weakness of High Priest
llm_translation: Rather, what is the explanation of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon? It the ramp is established from the northern wall of the altar to the northern wall of the Temple courtyard. Rather, what can you say to explain this? Due to the weakness of the High Priest. Here too, it is due to the weakness of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן קידש ידיו ורגליו לתרומת הדשן למחר אינו צריך לקדש שכבר קידש מתחילת עבודה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: sanctified his hands and feet for the removal of the ashes, the next day, he does not need to sanctify as he already sanctified at the beginning of service.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: He sanctified his hands and feet for the removal of the ashes, for the next day he does not need to sanctify, as he already sanctified from the beginning of the service.

hebrew_text: למאן אי לרבי האמר פסלה לינה אי לרבי אלעזר בר"ש האמר אין צריך לקדש אפי' מיכן ועד עשרה ימים
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi doesn’t he say left overnight disqualifies if in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say he does not need to sanctify even for the next ten days?
llm_translation: To whom? If according to Rabbi who said invalidates the night, if according to Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon who said not necessary to sanctify even from here until ten days.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לעולם לרבי ולינה דרבנן היא ומודי דמקרות הגבר ועד צפרא לא פסלה לינה
human_translation: Abaye says: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi and left overnight is by rabbinic law. And they concede that from the rooster’s crow until morning, left overnight does not disqualify
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Always the law follows the opinion of the Rabbi, and the night is considered Rabbinic, and they agree that if a man reads the Shema until dawn, he has not invalidated the night."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לעולם רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון [היא וראה ר"י דבריו] בתחילת עבודה ולא בסוף עבודה
human_translation: Rava says: Actually, is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. And Rabbi Yoḥanan saw the statement of with regard to the beginning of service, But not with regard to the end of service.
llm_translation: Rava said: Always Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon is it, and see Rabbi Yehuda the Reish Lakish his words at the beginning of the work and not at the end of the work.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ראוהו אחיו הכהנים שירד והן רצו ובאו מיהרו וקידשו ידיהם ורגליהם מן הכיור
human_translation: raises an objection His priestly brethren, saw that descended and they ran and arrived They hurried and sanctified their hands and their feet from the Basin.
llm_translation: The scholars asked: His brothers, the priests, saw him descending, and they ran and came, and they hurried and sanctified their hands and feet from the laver.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לאביי דמוקים לה כרבי ומודי רבי דמקרות הגבר עד צפרא לא פסלה לינה הא מני רבי היא
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, who interprets in accordance with Rabbi and Rabbi concedes that from the rooster’s crow until morning, left overnight does not disqualify whose is this It is Rabbi
llm_translation: In accordance with Abaye who establishes it like Rabbi and Rabbi concedes that when a man calls his wife "Tzafra" it does not disqualify her from staying overnight, this is indeed the opinion of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבא דמוקים לה כרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אבל לרבי מקרות הגבר עד צפרא פסלה לינה הא מני אי רבי פסלה לינה אי רבי אלעזר בר"ש הא אמר אפי' מיכן ועד עשרה ימים אינו צריך לקדש
human_translation: But according to Rava, who interprets in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, but according to Rabbi from the rooster’s crow until morning left overnight disqualifies whose is this If Rabbi left overnight disqualifies if Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say even for the next ten days, he does not need to sanctify
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rava who establishes it like Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon. But according to Rabbi Me'akarot, the man is disqualified until Zafra. If so, is it from here that Rabbi disqualifies until Zafra, and Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon permits even from here until ten days, he does not need to sanctify.

hebrew_text: לעולם כרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון והכא במאי עסקינן בכהני חדתי:
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and here we are dealing with new priests,
llm_translation: Always follow like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, and here, with what are we dealing with? With the new priests.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו יציאה מהו שתועיל בקידוש ידים ורגלים אם תימצי לומר לינה לא פסלה דלא פריש אבל יציאה דפריש אסוחי מסח דעתיה או דלמא כיון דבידו לחזור לא מסח
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is leaving effective to sanctification of hands and feet If you say left overnight does not disqualify because he does not separate but leaving where separates becomes distracted Or perhaps, since it is in his power to return he does not become distracted,
llm_translation: The question was asked: What is the law regarding exiting a private domain to a public domain - does it help to permit the action with the sanctification of the hands and feet? If you wish to say that sleep does not disqualify the sanctification, for he did not separate from the sanctification, but exiting, since he separated, perhaps his mind is diverted, or maybe since it is in his nature to return, it is not diverted.

hebrew_text: ת"ש קידש ידיו ורגליו ונטמאו מטבילן ואין צריך לקדש יצאו הרי הן בקדושתן
human_translation: Come hear sanctified his hands and feet and became impure, he may immerse them and he does not need to sanctify they left they retain their sanctity.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "He sanctified his hands and feet, and they became impure. He immerses them, and there is no need to sanctify them again. He has fulfilled his obligation; they are in their sanctity."

hebrew_text: יצאו ידיו לא קמיבעיא לן כי קמיבעיא לן יצא כל גופו מאי
human_translation: We do not raise the dilemma his hands left When we raise the dilemma, his entire body left what
llm_translation: His hands went out not it was asked for us when it was asked for us went out all his body what

hebrew_text: ת"ש שלא רחוץ ידים ורגלים מקדש בכלי שרת בפנים קידש בכלי שרת בחוץ או בכלי חול בפנים או שטבל במי מערה ועבד עבודתו פסולה טעמא דקידש בכלי שרת בחוץ הא קידש בפנים ויצא עבודתו כשירה
human_translation: Come hear One whose hands and feet are not washed sanctify with a service vessel inside sanctified with a service vessel outside or with a non-sacred vessel inside, or he immersed in cave water and performed service, his service is disqualified. The reason that he sanctified with a service vessel outside, but sanctified inside and left, his service is valid.
llm_translation: Come and hear: one who did not wash his hands and feet sanctified in sacred vessels inside, he sanctified in sacred vessels outside or in common vessels inside, or he immersed in the waters of a cave and performed his service - it is invalid. The reason is that if he sanctified in sacred vessels outside, he sanctified inside and his service is valid.

hebrew_text: דלמא קידש בכלי שרת בחוץ היכי דמי כגון דאפיק ידיו לבר וקידש (הא קידש בפנים ויצא דאפיק ידיה לבר כשירה) אבל יצא כל גופו תיבעי לך
human_translation: Perhaps What are the circumstances sanctified with a service vessel outside? where he removed his hands outside and sanctified Consequently, he sanctified inside and left, where he removed his hand outside, valid. But his entire body left you should raise the dilemma.
llm_translation: Perhaps he sanctified with a sacred vessel outside, what is the case? Like one who extends his hands to the outside and sanctifies (for he sanctified inside and went out, his hands extended outside, it is valid), but if his entire body went out, it should be asked of you.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב זביד לרב פפא ת"ש יצא חוץ למחיצת חומת העזרה אם לשהות טעון טבילה אם לפי שעה טעון קידוש ידים ורגלים
human_translation: Rav Zevid said to Rav Pappa: Come hear left the boundary of the wall of the Temple courtyard, if to remain he requires immersion. If for a moment, he requires sanctification of hands and feet.
llm_translation: Rav Zebid said to Rav Pappa: "Come and hear: If one goes out beyond the partition of the wall of the Azarah, whether to stay requires immersion, if temporarily requires sanctification of the hands and feet."

hebrew_text: א"ל הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שיצא להסך רגליו ולהטיל מים
human_translation: said to him: Here we are dealing with where left to cover his legs, or to urinate.
llm_translation: He said to him: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, when one goes out to wash his feet and pour water.

hebrew_text: הא בהדיא קתני לה כל המיסך רגליו טעון טבילה וכל המטיל מים טעון קידוש ידים ורגלים תני והדר מפרש
human_translation: But teaches it explicitly: Anyone who covers his legs requires immersion and anyone who urinates requires sanctification of hands and feet teaches and then explains
llm_translation: This is what it explicitly teaches: Anyone who rinses his feet requires immersion, and anyone who pours water requires sanctification of the hands and feet. It taught this and then explained.

hebrew_text: ת"ש פרה רבי חייא בר יוסף אמר מקדש בכלי שרת בפנים ויוצא ורבי יוחנן אמר אפי' בחוץ ואפי' בכלי חול ואפי' במקידה של חרס
human_translation: Come hear heifer, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: sanctify with a service vessel inside and leaves And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even outside and even with a non-sacred vessel, and even with an earthenware bowl [ bimkeida ].
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said, "One sanctifies the ashes of the Red Heifer in vessels of service inside, and the sanctity extends outside." And Rabbi Yochanan said, "Even outside, and even in common vessels, and even in an earthenware container."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שאני פרה הואיל וכל מעשיה בחוץ לא פסלה בה יציאה אי הכי למה לי דמקדש כעין עבודה פנים
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: heifer is different, since all of its acts are outside leaving does not disqualify with regard to it. If so, why do I that sanctify similar to service inside
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A cow is different, since all its actions are performed outside, its exit does not disqualify it. If so, why do I need that it sanctifies like an inner service.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו טומאה מהו שתועיל לקידוש ידים ורגלים אם תימצי לומר יציאה לא פסלה דגברא חזי אבל הכא דגברא לא חזי אסוחי מסח דעתיה או דלמא כיון דהדר חזי [דק ליה] ולא מסח דעתיה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is ritual impurity effective to sanctification of hands and feet If you say leaving does not disqualify because the person fit but here, where the person is unfit he becomes distracted. Or perhaps, since he fit again he takes care not to become distracted.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: What is the law regarding impurity - does it render the sanctification of the hands and feet effective? If you wish to say that the act of leaving the area of impurity does not invalidate the sanctification, see the case of a man - he sees the impurity and yet it does not invalidate his sanctification. Or perhaps, since he will later see the impurity, it does not invalidate his sanctification.

hebrew_text: ת"ש קידש ידיו ורגליו ונטמאו מטבילן ואין צריך לקדש
human_translation: Come hear sanctified his hands and feet and they became impure, he immerse them, and he does not need to sanctify
llm_translation: Come and hear: "He sanctified his hands and feet, and they became impure. He immerses them, and there is no need to sanctify them again."

hebrew_text: נטמאו ידיו לא מיבעיא לן [כי מיבעיא לן] נטמא כל גופו כל גופו תיפוק לי כיון דבעי למעבד הערב שמש אסוחי מסח דעתיה כגון דאיטמי סמוך לשקיעת החמה
human_translation: We do not raise the dilemma his hands became impure. When we raise the dilemma his entire body became impure. his entire body let me derive since he needs to allow the sun to set he becomes distracted where he became impure adjacent to sunset,
llm_translation: His hands became impure - we do not need to ask when we need to ask - his entire body became impure, his entire body became impure - it is unnecessary for me, since he needs to perform the evening service, he diverts his attention, like one who is tending to a sick person near sunset.

hebrew_text: ת"ש פרה רבי חייא ברבי יוסף אמר מקדש בכלי שרת בפנים ויוצא ורבי יוחנן אמר אפילו בחוץ ואפילו בכלי חול ואפילו במקידה של חרס
human_translation: Come hear heifer, Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Yosef, says: sanctify with a service vessel inside and leaves And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even outside and even with a non-sacred vessel, and even with an earthenware bowl.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Chiya, son of Rabbi Yosef, said: One sanctifies the incense in vessels of service inside the Temple, and then takes it out. And Rabbi Yochanan said: One may sanctify it even outside the Temple, and even in vessels of mundane use, and even in a pottery vessel.

hebrew_text: והא פרה דטמויי מטמינן ליה דתנן מטמאין היו הכהן השורף את הפרה ומטבילין אותו להוציא מלבן של צדוקין שהיו אומרים במעורבי שמש היתה נעשית ש"מ לא פסלה בה (מחשבת) טומאה
human_translation: And heifer, we impart impurity to as we learned They would render the priest who burns the heifer ritually impure and immerse him to remove from the hearts of Sadducees As would say: by those for whom the sun set was performed. learn from it impurity does not disqualify
llm_translation: And this, a cow that was concealed, we hide it, for we learned: "The priests who burn the cow become impure, and they immerse it to remove the suspicion of the Sadducees, who used to say that it was done with mixed oil. Learn from this that it did not render it impure with impure thoughts."

hebrew_text: שאני פרה הואיל דטבול יום לא פסיל בה אי הכי למה לי דמקדש כעין עבודה [בעינן]
human_translation: heifer is different, as one who immersed that day is not unfit for it, If so, why do I that sanctify We require similar to service
llm_translation: It is different with a cow, since if it immersed for a day it does not render it invalid. If so, why do I need it to be sanctified like an offering?

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מהו לקדש ידיו [ורגליו] בכיור (שמות ל, יט) ממנו אמר רחמנא ולא בתוכו או דלמא אפילו בתוכו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is to sanctify his hands and feet in the Basin the Merciful One states: from it” and not inside it? Or perhaps even inside it.
llm_translation: The question was asked: What is the law regarding sanctifying his hands and feet in the basin (Exodus 30:19)? From it, the Merciful One said, "and not within it," or perhaps even within it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק תא שמע או שטבל במי מערה ועבד עבודתו פסולה הא מי כיור דומיא דמי מערה ועבד עבודתו כשרה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Come hear Or immersed in cave water and performed service, his service is disqualified, But water from Basin similar to cave water, and performed service, his service is valid.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Come and hear. If one immersed in the waters of a cave and performed his service, it is invalid. But if one immersed in a mikveh, which is similar to a cave, and performed his service, it is valid.

hebrew_text: לא מי מערה איצטריכא ליה שלא תאמר כל גופו טובל בהן ידיו ורגליו לא כל שכן
human_translation: No, was necessary for cave water that you shall not say: may immerse his entire body in all the more so not his hands and feet
llm_translation: "Not who cave necessary for him lest you say all his body dips in them his hands and feet not all the more."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חייא בר יוסף מי כיור נפסלין למתירין כמתירין לאברים כאברים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: The water in Basin is disqualified For permitting factors like permitting factors for limbs like limbs
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: "Who are like the ones who are disqualified for immersion? Like the ones who are disqualified for limbs, like limbs."

hebrew_text: רב חסדא אמר אף למתירין אין נפסלין אלא בעמוד השחר כאברין ורבי יוחנן אמר כיור כיון ששקעו שוב אין מעלהו
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Even for permitting factors, is disqualified only at dawn, as limbs. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Once has sunk he may not raise it up again
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: Even the permit holders are only invalidated at the break of dawn like the limbs. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Like a basin, once it has sunk, one does not raise it.

hebrew_text: למימרא דלעבודת לילה נמי לא חזי והאמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן משמיה דאילפא כיור שלא שקעו מבערב מקדש ממנו לעבודת לילה ולמחר אינו מקדש
human_translation: Is this to say that unfit for night’s service as well? But doesn’t Rabbi Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Ilfa: a Basin that did not sink at night, sanctifies from it for the service of night, and the next day he does not sanctify
llm_translation: To say that for nighttime service also it is not fitting, but didn't Rabbi Assi say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan from Ilpha: "A basin that was not immersed from evening, sanctifies from it for nighttime service, and the next day it does not sanctify."

hebrew_text: מאי אינו מעלהו נמי דקאמר לעבודת יום אבל לעבודת לילה חזי
human_translation: What when it says: He may not raise it up for day’s service; but fit for night’s service.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "he does not bring it up"? Also, because it says "for daytime service," but for nighttime service, it is different.

hebrew_text: [אי הכי] היינו דרבי חייא בר יוסף
human_translation: If so, this is of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef,
llm_translation: If so, this is the same as Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef.

hebrew_text: איכא בינייהו גזירת שיקוע
human_translation: between them decree of sinking
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: the decree of Shekiah.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבי יוחנן קידש ידיו לתרומת הדשן למחר אין צריך לקדש שכבר קידש מתחילת עבודה

llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yochanan: "He sanctified his hands for the removal of the ashes, tomorrow he does not need to sanctify, for he already sanctified from the beginning of the service."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבא דמוקים לההיא כרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון הא כרבי

hebrew_text: למימרא דלמתירין מיחזא חזי היינו דרב חסדא

hebrew_text: מיתיבי לא היו רואין אותו ולא שומעין את קולו עד ששומעים קול של עץ שעשה בן קטין מוכני לכיור והן אומרים הגיע [עת] קידוש ידים ורגלים מן הכיור מאי לאו דמסלק ליה אלמא משקע ליה
human_translation: raises an objection would not see nor would they hear his voice. until they would hear the sound of the wood which ben Katin made a mechanism for the Basin And they would say The time for sanctifying hands and feet from the Basin has come. What, is it not that raising Apparently, sink it

Is it not because they remove it? This implies that they immerse it.

human_translation: No, sinking If sinking it, would its sound be audible? sink it by a wheel,
llm_translation: Not found in him. If not found in him, does it not imply that his voice is found in him in a wheel.

hebrew_text: לישנא אחרינא דמשקע ליה בחומרתיה כי כי היכי דלישתמע קליה ולשמעי וליתי והא הוה גביני כרוז בי תרי היכרי הוו עבדי דשמע מהאי אתי ושמע מהאי אתי:
human_translation: another version sink it by its wheel so that its sound would be audible, and would hear and come But wasn’t there Gevini crier, They would make two conspicuous markers who heard from this would come, and heard from that would come.
llm_translation: Another teaching that supports him in his stringency, for when? So that his voice will be heard and to listen and come, and there was a cheese seller in two towns who would come from this one and listen, and come from that one and listen.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא כל כיור שאין בו כדי לקדש ארבעה כהנים ממנו אין מקדשין בו שנאמר (שמות מ, לא) ורחצו ממנו משה ואהרן ובניו וגו'
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: any Basin that does not contain enough for four priests to sanctify from it, may not sanctify with it, as it is stated: “That Moses and Aaron and his sons might wash from it”
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa amar Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Chanina kol kiur she'ein bo kedei l'kadesh arba'ah kohanim mimenu ein mikdashin bo, shenemar (Shemot 30:31) 'u'rchatzu mimenu Moshe v'Aharon u'vanei.'" Translation: The body of the text Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: Any basin that does not contain enough water to sanctify four priests from it, one does not sanctify with it, as it is stated (Exodus 30:31) "And they shall wash from it, Moses and Aaron and his sons."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כל הכלי' מקדשין בין שיש בהן רביעי'
human_translation: raises an objection sanctify all vessels, whether they can hold a quarter
llm_translation: Challenger: All vessels sanctify whether they contain a quarter.

hebrew_text: בין שאין בהן רביעית ובלבד שיהו כלי שרת
human_translation: or they cannot hold a quarter provided that they are service vessels.
llm_translation: Between that not in them a quarter and only they be vessels of service

hebrew_text: אמר רב אדא בר אחא בקודח בתוכו
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Aḥa says: where one drills in
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "In its midst is a thorn."

hebrew_text: והא ממנו אמר רחמנא ירחצו לרבות כלי שרת
human_translation: But doesn’t the Merciful One state “from it,” “they should wash,” to include service vessel.
llm_translation: And this, from it, said the Merciful One: "They shall wash to include the vessels of service."

hebrew_text: אי הכי כלי חול נמי אמר אביי כלי חול לא מצית אמרת מקל וחומר מכנו ומה כנו שנמשח עמו אינו מקדש כלי חול שאינו נמשח עמו אינו דין שאינו מקדש
human_translation: If so, a non-sacred vessel as well. Abaye says: You cannot say a non-sacred vessel, by a fortiori from the base of And just as its base, which was anointed along with it is not sanctify a non-sacred vessel, which was not anointed along with is it not right that it is not sanctify
llm_translation: If so, also a weekday vessel, Abaye also said, a weekday vessel, you did not find, you said, an a fortiori argument, call it, and how his a fortiori argument, that is anointed with it, does not sanctify a weekday vessel that is not anointed with it, does not sanctify.

hebrew_text: וכנו מנלן דתניא ר' יהודה אומר יכול יהא כנו מקדש כדרך שהכיור מקדש תלמוד לומר (שמות ל, יח) ועשית כיור נחשת וכנו נחשת לנחשת הקשתיו ולא לדבר אחר
human_translation: And from where do we the base of As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: might its base should be sanctify just as the Basin sanctify the verse states: “You shall also make a Basin of copper, and the base thereof of copper” I have equated with regard to copper, but not for another matter.
llm_translation: And whence do we derive that it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One might have thought that its base should sanctify it, just as the basin sanctifies. The Torah states (Exodus 30:18), 'And you shall make a basin of copper,' to indicate that its base should be of copper, and not of any other material."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מר זוטרא בריה דרב מרי לרבינא מה לכנו שאין עשוי לתוכו תאמר בכלי חול שעשוי לתוכו אלא ממנו למעוטי כלי חול
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Mari, said to Ravina: What about its base? in that its inside is not made for you say for a non-sacred vessel, which its inside is made for Rather, “from it” to exclude a non-sacred vessel.
llm_translation: Said to him Master Zutra, son of Rav Mari, to Ravina: "What about a vessel that is not made for it, should you say in a mundane vessel that is made for it, rather from it to exclude all mundane vessels."

hebrew_text: אי הכי כלי שרת נמי הא רבי רחמנא ירחצו
human_translation: If so, a service vessel as well. But the Merciful One amplifies “they should wash,”
llm_translation: If so, also the sacred vessels, Rabbi, have mercy, they shall bathe.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית זה טעון משיחה כמוהו וזה אין טעון משיחה כמוהו:
human_translation: And what did you see This, requires anointing like and that, does not require anointing like
llm_translation: And what did you see? This one requires anointing like him, and this one does not require anointing like him.

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש כל המשלים למי מקוה משלים למי כיור לרביעית אינו משלים
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Any that complete water for a ritual bath may complete water for Basin. it may not complete quarter
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish: "Anyone who compares a mikveh to a kiyor, for the fourth level, does not compare."

hebrew_text: למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי טיט הנדוק היכי דמי אי דפרה שוחה ושותה ממנו אפי' לרביעית נמי ואי אין פרה שוחה ושותה ממנו אפילו למקוה נמי אין משלים
human_translation: to exclude what If we say to exclude liquefied clay, what is like? If that a cow can kneel and drink from it, even to a quarter And if a cow cannot kneel and drink from it, it should not even complete a ritual bath.
llm_translation: To exclude what? If you say to exclude fine clay, what is the case? If a cow digs and drinks from it, even for a quarter-log of water it is considered a valid mikveh. But if a cow does not dig and drink from it, even for a mikveh, it is not valid.

hebrew_text: אלא למעוטי יבחושין אדומין אפילו בעינייהו נמי דהא תניא רשב"ג אומר כל שתחילת ברייתו מן המים מטבילין בו ואמר רב יצחק בר אבדימי מטבילין בעינו של דג
human_translation: Rather, to exclude red gnats even by themselves as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: anything that originates in the water, one may immerse in it, And Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi says: One may immerse in fish eye
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude the red fish, even in their own eyes. Also, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says, "Any creature whose initial creation is from water, one may immerse it in water." And Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said, "One may immerse it in the eye of a fish."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא למעוטי נתן סאה ונטל סאה דתנן מקוה שיש בו מ' סאה מכוונות נתן סאה ונטל סאה הרי זה כשר ואמר רב יהודה בר שילא אמר רב אסי א"ר יוחנן עד רובו
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: to exclude one added a se’a and removed a se’a , as we learned a ritual bath that contains exactly forty se’a one added a se’a and removed a se’a fit. And Rav Yehuda bar Sheila says Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says up to the greater part
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: To exclude, he gave a se'ah and took a se'ah. As we learned in a Mishnah: A mikveh that contains forty se'ah, if one gave a se'ah and took a se'ah, it is valid. And Rav Yehudah bar Shila said in the name of Rav Assi, who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Until its majority.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא אם קדח בו רביעית מטבילין בו מחטין וצינוריות הואיל ומהכשירא דמקוה אתיא
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: If one drilled in a quarter one may immerse needles and hooks in since derives from the fitness of the ritual bath.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If a quarter-log of water was removed from it, one may immerse needles and tubes in it, since it is considered a valid mikveh.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה אמר ריש לקיש מי מקוה כשירים למי כיור
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says Reish Lakish says: Water of a ritual bath is fit to water of Basin.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said, Reish Lakish said: Who is the mikveh that is fit for the kiyor?

hebrew_text: למימרא דלא מים חיים נינהו והתניא (ויקרא א, ט) במים ולא ביין במים ולא במזוג במים לרבות שאר מים וק"ו למי כיור מאי ק"ו למי כיור לאו דמים חיים נינהו
human_translation: Is this to say that does not flowing water, But isn’t it taught “With water” and not with wine; “with water,” and not with mixed “with water,” to include other water, And a fortiori the water for Basin What a fortiori the water for the Basin not that it is flowing water
llm_translation: To say that they are not "living waters," and it was taught (Leviticus 1:9), "with water," and not with wine, with water, and not with a mixture, with water to include other waters. And is it not a kal vachomer for the water of the laver? What is the kal vachomer for the water of the laver? Is it not that the water of the laver are not "living waters"?

hebrew_text: לא (לקדוש) דקדיש וקדישי מעליותא היא והא תנא רבי שמואל מים שאין להם שם לווי
human_translation: No, that sanctified But is sanctified preferable, But didn’t Rabbi Shmuel teach: “water” whose has no modifier;
llm_translation: Not (to the Holy One) of the Holy and the Holy of Holies it is, and but it was taught: Rabbi Shmuel - waters that do not have a carrier name.

hebrew_text: יצאו מי כיור שיש להם שם לווי אלא לאו דראויין למי כיור אלמא מים חיים נינהו
human_translation: excluded is water of Basin, which has a modifier Rather, is it not that is fit to water of Basin? Apparently, is flowing water.
llm_translation: They went out the water of the laver that have there a name of accompanying, rather not that are fitting for the water of the laver, thus they are living waters.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דאמר ר' יוחנן מי כיור ר' ישמעאל אומר מי מעין הן וחכמים אומרים שאר מימות הן:
human_translation: is tanna’im , as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the water of Basin, Rabbi Yishmael says: It spring water, and the Rabbis say: It another water.
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic dispute, as Rabbi Yochanan said: "Who is like You, O Lord?" Rabbi Yishmael says: "Who is like You among the mighty, O Lord?" And the Sages say: "Who is like You among the gods?"

hebrew_text: ערל: מנלן אמר רב חסדא דבר זה מתורת משה רבינו לא למדנו מדברי יחזקאל בן בוזי למדנו (יחזקאל מד, ט) כל בן נכר ערל לב וערל בשר לא יבא אל מקדשי (לשרתני)
human_translation: uncircumcised From where do we Rav Ḥisda says: We did not learn this matter from the Torah of Moses, our teacher; we learned from the words of Ezekiel, son of Buzi: “No stranger, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into My Sanctuary to serve Me”
llm_translation: Uncircumcised: From where do we derive? Rav Chisda said: This matter we did not learn from the teachings of Moses our teacher, but rather we learned from the words of Yechezkel ben Buzi (Ezekiel 44:9): "No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary."

hebrew_text: ומנלן דמחלי עבודה דכתיב (יחזקאל מד, ז) בהביאכם (את) בני נכר ערלי לב וערלי בשר להיות במקדשי לחלל את ביתי:
human_translation: And from where do we that he desecrates service As it is written: “In that you have brought in strangers, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My Sanctuary, to profane My house”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that one who desecrates the Temple service, as it is written (Ezekiel 44:7), "When you brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary, to desecrate My Temple"?

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בן נכר יכול בן נכר ממש תלמוד לומר ערל לב אם כן מה תלמוד לומר בן נכר שנתנכרו מעשיו לאביו שבשמים ואין לי אלא ערל לב ערל בשר מנין תלמוד לומר וערל בשר
human_translation: The Sages taught: “stranger”; might an actual stranger, the verse states: “Uncircumcised in heart,” If so, what the verse states: “Stranger”? whose actions are estranged from his Father in Heaven, And I have only one uncircumcised in heart from where one uncircumcised in flesh The verse states: “Or uncircumcised in flesh.”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "A son of a stranger" - one might think that a son of a stranger literally. The Torah says, "uncircumcised of heart." If so, what does the Torah say "a son of a stranger" for? To teach that his actions have estranged him from his Father in Heaven. And I have only "uncircumcised of heart," how do I know "uncircumcised in flesh"? The Torah says, "and uncircumcised in flesh."

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי כתב רחמנא ערל בשר משום דמאיס אבל ערל לב דלא מאיס אימא לא ואי אשמעינן ערל לב משום דאין לבו לשמים אבל ערל בשר דלבו לשמים אימא לא צריכי:
human_translation: And are necessary. As, had the Merciful One written “Uncircumcised in flesh,” because he is disgusting but one uncircumcised in heart, who is not disgusting, I will say not And had taught us uncircumcised in heart because his heart is not toward Heaven, but one uncircumcised in flesh, whose heart is toward Heaven, I will say not are necessary.
llm_translation: "And it is necessary, for if the Merciful One wrote 'uncircumcised in flesh' it is because he despises, but 'uncircumcised in heart' which he does not despise, say no. And if we hear 'uncircumcised in heart' it is because his heart is not towards Heaven, but 'uncircumcised in flesh' whose heart is towards Heaven, say no, it is not necessary."

hebrew_text: טמא פסול: אמרו זקני דרום לא שנו אלא טמא שרץ אבל טמא מת מתוך שמרצה בציבור מרצה נמי ביחיד
human_translation: impure unfit The Elders of the South said: They taught only impure due to a creeping animal. But impure due to a corpse, since he can effect acceptance for communal he can effect acceptance for individual as well
llm_translation: Impure disqualified: The elders of the south said they only taught impure of a creeping thing, but impure of a corpse, since it disgusts in public, it also disgusts in private.

hebrew_text: אי הכי טמא שרץ נמי ליתי בקל וחומר מטמא מת מה טמא מת שטעון הזאה שלישי ושביעי מרצה טמא שרץ שאינו טעון הזאה ג' ושביעי אינו דין שמרצה
human_translation: If so, let be derived one impure due to a creeping animal by a fortiori from one impure due to a corpse: Just as impure due to a corpse, who requires sprinkling third and seventh effects acceptance, one impure due to a creeping animal, who does not require sprinkling third and seventh is it not right that he effect acceptance?
llm_translation: If so, impure creeping thing also should come with a fortiori reasoning to impurity of a corpse. What is impurity of a corpse that requires sprinkling on the third and seventh days? Impurity of a creeping thing that does not require sprinkling on the third and seventh days is not a valid comparison.
