hebrew_text: קסברי זקני דרום מכפרין כמתכפרין מה מתכפרין טמא מת אין טמא שרץ לא אף מכפרין טמא מת אין טמא שרץ לא
human_translation: The Elders of the South hold those who effect atonement like those who achieve atonement: Just as those who achieve atonement impure due to a corpse may impure due to a creeping animal not, so too those who effect atonement, impure due to a corpse, yes, impure due to the carcass of a creeping animal, not.
llm_translation: The elders of the south hold the opinion: They atone like one who atones. Just as one who atones, if impure, is not impure for contact with a corpse, nor is he impure for contact with a creeping thing, so too those who atone, if impure, are not impure for contact with a corpse, nor are they impure for contact with a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: מאי קסברי אי קסברי אין שוחטין וזורקין על טמא שרץ אמאי לא עבדי ציבור בטומאה הא כל שביחיד נדחה ציבור עבדי בטומאה
human_translation: What do hold If they hold one may not slaughter nor sprinkle for impure due to a creeping animal, Why can’t community perform in impurity? Isn’t any for which an individual is deferred community may perform in impurity?
llm_translation: What do they hold? If they hold that one may not slaughter and sprinkle on a ritually impure creeping animal, why do they not perform communal offerings in a state of impurity? Since any individual who is impure is disqualified, why do they perform communal offerings in a state of impurity?

hebrew_text: אלא קסברי שוחטין וזורקין על טמא שרץ
human_translation: Rather, they hold one may slaughter and sprinkle for impure due to a creeping animal.
llm_translation: Rather, they hold that one may slaughter and sprinkle on an impure creeping creature.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא תקע להו ר"ל לדרומאי וכי איזה כח מרובה כח מכפרין או כח מתכפרין הוי אומר כח מתכפרין
human_translation: Ulla says: Reish Lakish shouted [ teka ] to of the South: But which power is greater the power of those who effect atonement, or the power of those who achieve atonement, you must say the power of those who achieve atonement
llm_translation: Ula said: Strike them, Rabbi Eliezer, to the southern one. And is there any greater power, the power of those who atone or the power of those who are atoned for? You would say, the power of those who are atoned for.

hebrew_text: ומה במקום שנטמאו בעלים בשרץ משלחין קרבנותיהן כהן שנטמא בשרץ אינו מרצה מקום שנטמאו בעלים במת שאין משלחין קרבנותיהן כהן שנטמא במת אינו דין שאינו מרצה
human_translation: And just as in a case where owner became impure due to a creeping animal, may send his offerings a priest who became impure due to a creeping animal cannot effect acceptance, a case where the owner became impure due to a corpse, where he may not send his offerings is it not right that a priest who became impure due to a corpse cannot effect acceptance?
llm_translation: "And what is the law in a place where the owners became impure with a creeping creature, they send forth their offerings; a priest who became impure with a creeping creature is not acceptable. In a place where the owners became impure with a corpse, they do not send forth their offerings; a priest who became impure with a corpse is not considered unfit."

hebrew_text: קסברי זקני דרום טמא מת [נמי] משלח קרבנותיו
human_translation: The Elders of the South hold impure due to a corpse may also send his offerings,
llm_translation: The elders of the South hold that one who is impure due to contact with a corpse also invalidates his offerings.

hebrew_text: והכתיב (במדבר ט, י) איש איש כי יהיה טמא ועשה פסח בחדש השני וגו' למצוה
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “If any man of you or of your generations shall be impure he shall perform the Paschal offering In the second month as a mitzva
llm_translation: And it is written (Numbers 9:10), "Any man who is impure and cannot observe the Passover shall observe it in the second month, etc." for the commandment.

hebrew_text: והא כתיב (שמות יב, ד) איש
human_translation: But isn’t it written: a man,
llm_translation: And behold, it is written (Exodus 12:4), "a man."

hebrew_text: לפי אכלו למצוה
human_translation: according to his eating, as a mitzva
llm_translation: According to his eating for the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ולעכובי לא והתניא (שמות יב, ד) במכסת נפשות מלמד שאין הפסח נשחט אלא למנוייו שחטו שלא למנוייו יכול יהא כעובר על המצוה תלמוד לומר תכוסו הכתוב שנה עליו לעכב ואיתקש אוכלין למנויין
human_translation: And not indispensable But isn’t it taught “according to the number of the souls” teaches that the Paschal offering may be slaughtered only for those who registered for it slaughtered for who did not register for it, might it would be like transgressing a mitzva, the verse states: “You shall make your count”; the verse repeats to indispensable, And those who eat are juxtaposed to those registered
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for those who are delayed, no. And it was taught (Exodus 12:4), 'In the covering of souls' - this teaches that the Paschal lamb is only slaughtered for those designated for it. If it was slaughtered for those not designated for it, one might think it should be considered as if he transgressed a commandment. The verse comes to teach us to delay. And the eating is compared to those designated."

hebrew_text: זקני דרום לא מקשי וכי לא מקשי נמי מהא נמי אית להו פירכא ומה במקום שנטמאו בעלים בשרץ שמשלחין קרבנותיהם לכתחילה כהן שנטמא בשרץ אינו מרצה מקום שנטמאו בעלים במת שאין משלחין קרבנותיהן לכתחילה כהן שנטמא במת אינו דין שאינו מרצה
human_translation: The Elders of the South do not juxtapose But even if they do not juxtapose there is a refutation to from this as well: And just as in a case where the owner became impure due to a creeping animal, where he may send his offerings ab initio , a priest who became impure due to a creeping animal cannot effect acceptance, a case where the owner became impure due to a corpse, where he may not send his offerings ab initio , is it not right that a priest who became impure due to a corpse cannot effect acceptance?
llm_translation: Elders of the South do not ask, and if they do not ask, indeed from this also there is a refutation. And what is the law in a place where the owners became impure with a creeping thing, that they send their sacrifices initially? A priest who became impure with a creeping thing does not facilitate the process. In a place where the owners became impure with a corpse, that they do not send their sacrifices initially? A priest who became impure with a corpse is not considered unfit.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מפני שאמרו נזיר ועושה פסח הציץ מרצה על טומאת דם ואין הציץ מרצה על טומאת הגוף
human_translation: raises an objection As said a nazirite and one who performs Paschal offering, the frontplate effects acceptance for impurity of blood, but the frontplate does not effect acceptance for impurity of the body
llm_translation: Challenged: Because they said, "A Nazirite who performs the Passover offering scrutinizes the impurity of blood, but he does not scrutinize the impurity of the body."

hebrew_text: במאי אילימא בטומאת שרץ האמרת שוחטין וזורקין על טומאת שרץ אלא טומאת מת וקתני אין הציץ מרצה אלמא נטמאו בעלים במת אין משלחין קרבנותיהם
human_translation: To what If we say to impurity due to a creeping animal, didn’t you say one may slaughter and sprinkle for impurity due to a creeping animal? Rather, impurity due to a corpse, and teaches: The frontplate does not effect acceptance. Evidently, owner became impure due to a corpse, he may not send his offerings
llm_translation: With what? If you say with the impurity of a creeping thing, you said that one may slaughter and sprinkle for the impurity of a creeping thing. Rather, it is referring to the impurity of a corpse. And it teaches: "The forehead-plate does not atone." This implies that the owners became impure through contact with a corpse; they do not send forth their sacrifices.

hebrew_text: לא אי דאיטמו בעלים במת ה"נ הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שנטמא כהן בשרץ
human_translation: No, if the owner became impure due to a corpse, indeed here we are dealing with where priest became impure due to a creeping animal.
llm_translation: Not if they became impure with the owner in a case of a corpse; here, what are we dealing with? For example, if a priest became impure with a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אימא סיפא ניטמא טומאת התהום הציץ מרצה הא תני רבי חייא לא אמרו טומאת התהום אלא למת בלבד למת למעוטי מאי לאו למעוטי טומאת התהום דשרץ
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause contracted ritual impurity in the depths, the frontplate effects acceptance Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: They stated impurity in the depths only with regard to a corpse. to a corpse, to exclude what? not to exclude impurity a creeping animal in the depths?
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: he became impure with the impurity of the abyss. The Tanna Rabbi Chiya taught: They did not say impurity of the abyss except for a corpse alone, to exclude what? To exclude the impurity of the abyss of a creeping thing.

hebrew_text: לא למעוטי טומאת התהום דזיבה
human_translation: No, to exclude impurity by discharge [ ziva ] in the depths.
llm_translation: Not to exclude the impurity of the abyss of ziva.

hebrew_text: ואלא הא דבעי רמי בר חמא כהן המרצה בקרבנותיהם הותרה לו טומא' התהום או לא הותרה לו טומאת התהום תפשוט דטומאת התהום הותרה לו דהא הכא בכהן קיימינא
human_translation: But this dilemma that Rami bar Ḥama raises: a priest who effects acceptance for the offerings of was impurity in the depths permitted for him or was impurity in the depths not permitted for him? resolve that impurity in the depths was permitted for him, since we interpret here to priest?
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rami bar Hama asks: Is a priest who is involved in their sacrifices permitted the impurity of the abyss or not permitted the impurity of the abyss? It is obvious that the impurity of the abyss is permitted to him, for here we are dealing with a standing priest.

hebrew_text: דרמי בר חמא ודאי פליגי
human_translation: of Rami bar Ḥama certainly disagrees
llm_translation: Darmi bar Hama and D'ai disagree.

hebrew_text: תא שמע (שמות כח, לח) ונשא אהרן את עון הקדשי' וכי איזהו עון נושא
human_translation: Come hear and Aaron shall bear the sin committed with the sacred And Which sin does bear?
llm_translation: Come and hear: "And Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things" (Exodus 28:38). And what is the iniquity that he bears?

hebrew_text: אם עון פיגול הרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ז, יח) לא יחשב אם עון נותר הרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ז, יח) לא ירצה
human_translation: If the sin of piggul , it is already stated: neither shall it be credited If the sin of notar , it is already stated “It shall not be accepted.”
llm_translation: If the iniquity of Pigul, behold already stated (Leviticus 7:18) "it shall not be accounted." If the iniquity of Nosar, behold already stated (Leviticus 7:18) "it shall not be accepted."

hebrew_text: הא אינו נושא אלא עון טומאה שהותרה מכללה בצבור
human_translation: bears only the sin of impurity, whose general prohibition was permitted in the pub-lic.
llm_translation: This one does not carry except the sin of impurity that was permitted from its general prohibition in public.

hebrew_text: מאי טומאה אילימא מטומאת שרץ היכא אישתרי אלא טומאת מת ולאו כגון שנטמאו בעלים במת אלמא נטמאו בעלים במת משלחין קרבנותיהן
human_translation: What impurity If we say for impurity due to a creeping animal, where permitted Rather, impurity due to a corpse. And not where the owner became impure from a corpse? Evidently, the owner became impure from a corpse, he may send his offerings
llm_translation: What is impurity? If you say it is impurity of a creeping thing, where is it permitted? Rather, impurity of a corpse. And is it not like when the owners became impure through a corpse? Hence, when the owners become impure through a corpse, they may still send their sacrifices.

hebrew_text: ובמאי אי בנזיר (במדבר ו, ט) וכי ימות מת עליו אמר רחמנא אלא לעושה פסח (ולאו כגון שנטמאו בעלים במת)
human_translation: And to what If to a nazirite, the Merciful One state: “And if any man die beside him, Rather, to one who performs Paschal offering.
llm_translation: And with what? If with a Nazirite (Numbers 6:9) "And if a person dies very suddenly beside him" - the Merciful One said, rather for one who is making the Passover (and not in a case where the owners became impure through a corpse).

hebrew_text: לעולם בשרץ ושם טומאה בעולם
human_translation: Actually, to a creeping animal, And the category of impurity in general
llm_translation: Forever in a creeping thing and there is impurity in the world.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דדייק ומייתי הכי עון הקדשים אין עון מקדישין לא מאי טומאה אילימא טומאת שרץ מי אישתריא בציבור אלא לאו טומאת מת ועון קדשים אין עון מקדישים לא
human_translation: And some infer and derive like this: does the iniquity of the sacred items, not the iniquity of those who consecrate what impurity If we say impurity a creeping animal, is permitted in public? Rather, is it not impurity a corpse, and does the iniquity of sacred items not the iniquity of those who consecrate
llm_translation: And there are those who are precise and bring it thus: "The sin of the holy things, there is no sin of consecrated items." Not what is impurity? If impurity of a creeping thing, is it permitted in public? Rather, is it not impurity of a corpse, and the sin of holy things, there is no sin of consecrated items.

hebrew_text: לעולם טומאת שרץ ושם טומאה בעולם:
human_translation: Actually, impurity due to a creeping animal, and the category of impurity in general
llm_translation: Forever impurity of a creeping thing and its name impurity in the world.

hebrew_text: יושב: מנלן אמר רבא אמר רב נחמן אמר קרא (דברים יח, ה) לעמוד לשרת לעמידה בחרתיו ולא לישיבה
human_translation: sitting From where do we Rava says Rav Naḥman says: The verse states to stand to minister” I have chosen him for standing and not for sitting.
llm_translation: Sitting: From where? Rava said, Rav Nachman said, Scripture says (Deuteronomy 18:5), "to stand to serve in his name, for standing, I have chosen, and not for sitting."

hebrew_text: ת"ר לעמוד לשרת מצוה כשהוא אומר (דברים יח, ז) העומדים שנה עליו הכתוב לעכב
human_translation: The Sages taught: “To stand to minister,” a mitzva When it says: who stand the verse repeats to invalidate
llm_translation: The Sages taught: To stand to serve is a mitzvah, as it says (Deuteronomy 18:7), "Those who stand to serve."

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא לרב נחמן מכדי יושב כזר דמי ומחיל עבודה אימא מה זר במיתה אף יושב במיתה אלמה תניא אבל ערל אונן יושב אינן במיתה אלא באזהרה
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Now, one who is sitting is considered like a non-priest and desecrates service. I will say: Just as a non-priest to death so too one who is sitting to death why is it taught But one who is uncircumcised, an acute mourner, one who is sitting are not to death rather, a prohibition?
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: Since one who sits is considered like one who performs labor, shall I say that just as a non-priest is liable to death penalty, so too one who sits is liable to death penalty? But isn't it taught: Only uncircumcised individuals and mourners who sit are not liable to death penalty, but rather to a warning.

hebrew_text: משום דהוי מחוסר בגדים ושלא רחוץ ידים ורגלים שני כתובין הבאין כאחד
human_translation: because lacking vestments and one whose hands and feet are not washed are two verses that come as one,
llm_translation: Because it is considered lacking in garments and unwashed hands and feet, two Scriptures that come together.

hebrew_text: וכל שני כתובים הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: And any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: And all two Scriptures that come not as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דאמר מלמדין שתויי יין הוה ליה שלישי ושלשה לד"ה אין מלמדין:
human_translation: And according to the one who says teach those who drank wine constitutes a third And all agree three do not teach
llm_translation: And according to the one who says that teaching drunken individuals, wine was to him a third and three to the door of "Ein Malmedin."

hebrew_text: עומד על גבי כלים על גבי בהמה על גבי רגלי חבירו פסול: מנלן דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל הואיל ורצפה מקדשת וכלי שרת מקדשים מה כלי שרת לא יהא דבר חוצץ בינו לבין כלי שרת אף רצפה לא יהא דבר חוצץ בינו לבין הרצפה
human_translation: standing upon vessels, upon an animal, upon the feet of another, unfit From where do we as from the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Since the floor sanctifies and service vessels, sanctify Just as service vessels, nothing may interpose between and service vessel, so too floor, nothing may interpose between and the floor.
llm_translation: Standing on top of vessels, on top of an animal, on top of the feet of his fellow, is disqualified. From where do we derive this? As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Since a floor sanctifies, and the vessels of the Temple service sanctify, just as the vessels of the Temple service should not have anything intervening between them and the vessels of the Temple service, so too, the floor should not have anything intervening between it and the floor.

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן כלי משום דלאו מינא דבשר נינהו אבל בהמה דמינא דבשר הוא אימא לא ואי אשמעינן בהמה דלא מינא דאדם הוא אבל חבירו דאדם הוא אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And necessary. As, had taught us a vessel because it is not a type of flesh, but an animal, which is a type of flesh, I will say does not And had it taught us an animal because it is not of the human species, but another who is human, I will say not necessary.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear vessels, it is because they are not of the species of flesh, but an animal, which is of the species of flesh, one might say no. And if we were to hear an animal, which is not of the species of man, but its fellow, which is of the species of man, one might say no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי אליעזר אומר רגלו אחת על הכלי ורגלו אחת על הרצפה רגלו אחת על האבן ורגלו אחת על הרצפה רואין כל שאילו ינטל הכלי ותנטל האבן יכול לעמוד על רגלו אחת ויעבוד עבודתו כשירה ואם לאו עבודתו פסולה
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: one of feet on a vessel and one of his feet on the floor, one of his feet on a stone and one of his feet on the floor, sees: Any where, were the vessel to be removed or the stone removed, he able to stand on one foot and perform rites, his service valid. But if not his service disqualified.
llm_translation: It is taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "One foot on the vessel and one foot on the floor, one foot on the stone and one foot on the floor, if one could remove the vessel and the stone, he can stand on one foot and perform his service validly; but if not, his service is invalid."

hebrew_text: בעי רבי אמי נדלדלה האבן ועמד עליה מהו היכא דאין דעתו לחברה לא תיבעי לך דודאי חייצא כי תיבעי לך דדעתו לחברה מאי כיון דדעתו לחברה כמה דמחבר' דמיא או דילמא השתא מיהא הא תלישא
human_translation: Rabbi Ami raises a dilemma: the stone came loose and stood on it, what is Do not raise the dilemma where he does not intend to attach as it certainly interposes when you raise this dilemma, where he intends to attach it what since he intends to attach it, it is considered like that which is attached? Or perhaps now, at least, it is disconnected,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami asked: If a stone was shaken and someone stood on it, what is the ruling when his intention was not to attach himself to it? Do not ask, for surely it is like a case where his intention was to attach himself. What is the ruling when his intention was to attach himself? Is it like attaching or perhaps now it is different? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רבה זוטי בעי לה הכי בעי רבי אמי נעקרה האבן ועמד במקומה מהו
human_translation: Rabba Zuti raises this dilemma like this: Rabbi Ami raises a dilemma: the stone was uprooted and stood in its place, what is
llm_translation: Rabba Zuti asked thus: Rabbi Ami asked, "If the stone was uprooted and stood in its place, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: מאי קא מיבעיא ליה כי קדיש דוד רצפה עליונה קדיש או דילמא עד לארעית דתהומא קדיש ותיבעי ליה כל העזרה כולה
human_translation: What is the dilemma he is raising? When David sanctified did he sanctify upper floor or perhaps he sanctified to the depths of the earth? But let him raise the dilemma the entire Temple courtyard,
llm_translation: What is he inquiring about? When King David recited the "Kaddish" prayer, did he say the "Kaddish" of the Upper World, or perhaps until the depth of the abyss he said the "Kaddish," and he asked for the entire assistance.

hebrew_text: לעולם פשיטא ליה דעד ארעית דתהומא קדיש והכי קמיבעיא ליה דרך שירות בכך או אין דרך שירות בכך תיקו:
human_translation: Actually, obvious to him that sanctified to the depths of the earth, and this is the dilemma that he raised: is this manner of ministration, or is this not manner of ministration? shall stand
llm_translation: Always obvious to him until the land of the abyss holy and thus it is asked to him the way of service in this or is there a way of service in this - unresolved.

hebrew_text: קיבל בשמאל פסול ור"ש מכשיר: ת"ר באצבע ולקח מלמד שלא תהא קבלה אלא בימין (ויקרא ד, כה) באצבע ונתן מלמד שלא תהא נתינה אלא בימין
human_translation: collected with left disqualified, and Rabbi Shimon deems it fit. The Sages taught: “with his finger” “and shall take” teaches that collection may be only with right “with his finger and put it” teaches that placing may be only with right
llm_translation: Received with the left hand invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid. The Rabbis taught: "With a finger" and "he shall take" teach that reception should only be with the right hand (Leviticus 4:25). "With a finger" and "he shall place" teach that giving should only be with the right hand.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש וכי נאמרה יד בקבלה אלא באצבעו ונתן שלא תהא נתינה אלא בימין הואיל ולא נאמרה יד בקבלה קיבל בשמאל כשר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: But is Hand, stated with regard to collection Rather, “With his finger and put it,” that placing may be only with right Since Hand, is not stated with regard to collection one collected with left fit.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: "And was the term 'hand' mentioned in the context of receiving? Rather, it was with his finger that he gave, so that the giving should only be with the right hand, since the term 'hand' was not mentioned in the context of receiving, he received with his left hand - it is valid."

hebrew_text: ור"ש ממה נפשך אי אית ליה גזירה שוה כי לא נאמרה יד בקבלה מאי הוי ואי לית ליה גזירה שוה כי נאמרה יד בקבלה מאי הוי
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon, whichever you If he holds a verbal analogy if Hand, is not stated with regard to collection what of it? And if he does not hold verbal analogy, if Hand, were stated with regard to collection what of it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: "And what is your opinion? If there is a gezeirah shavah, for it was not stated 'hand' in the receiving, what is the ruling? And if there is no gezeirah shavah, for it was stated 'hand' in the receiving, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה לעולם לית ליה גזירה שוה והכי קאמר וכי נאמר יד ימין בקבלה הואיל ולא נאמר יד ימין בקבלה קבל בשמאל כשר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: Actually, he does not hold verbal analogy. And this is saying: But is Right hand, stated with regard to collection since Right hand, is not stated with regard to collection one collected with left fit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Always there is no gezeirah shavah, and thus he is saying: And when it is said "right hand" in receiving, since it is not said "right hand" in receiving, receiving with the left is valid.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבה א"ה אפילו נתינה נמי ועוד וכי לית ליה לר"ש ג"ש והתניא ר"ש אומר כל מקום שנאמר יד אינה אלא ימין אצבע אינה אלא ימין
human_translation: Rabba said to him: If so, even placing as well. And furthermore, does Rabbi Shimon not hold verbal analogy? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: every instance that “hand” is stated, is only right “finger,” is only right
llm_translation: Rabba said to Abaye: Even if it is a Natinah also, and furthermore, does Rabbi Shimon not hold the same opinion? And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says, "Every place where it is stated 'hand' is nothing other than the right hand, and 'finger' is nothing other than the right hand."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא לעולם אית ליה ג"ש והכי קאמר וכי נאמרה יד בקבלה הואיל ולא נאמר' יד בקבלה אלא אצבע ואי אפשר לקבלה באצבע קיבל בשמאל כשר
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: Actually, holds verbal analogy, and this is saying: But is Hand, stated with regard to collection Since Hand, is not stated with regard to collection but “finger” and collection cannot with a finger one collected with left fit.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Indeed, he has a "hand" i.e., a measure of authority, and this is what he is saying: Since it was not stated "hand" in the receiving of the tradition, but rather "finger," and it is impossible to receive with a finger, he received with his left hand, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב סמא בריה דרב אשי לרבינא איפשר דעביד ליה אזן לשפת מזרק ומקבל בה
human_translation: Rav Samma, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina: it is possible to fashion handle for the rim of bowl, and collect in it.
llm_translation: Rav Sama, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina: It is possible that one can make an ear into a lip, and receive with it.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי
human_translation: Rather, Abaye says:
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said:

hebrew_text: במקרא נדרש לפניו ולאחריו קמיפלגי
human_translation: They disagree with regard to a verse is interpreted preceding it and following it.
llm_translation: In the Scripture, they dispute before and after Him.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הא דרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון מפקא מדאבוה ומפקא מדרבנן דתניא רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אומר כל מקום שנאמר אצבע בקבלה שינה בקבלה פסול בנתינה כשר וכל מקום שנאמר אצבע בנתינה שינה בנתינה פסול בקבלה כשר
human_translation: Abaye says: This of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, diverges from of his father, and it diverges from of the Rabbis: As it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: every instance that “finger” is stated with regard to collection deviated of collection disqualified, of placing fit. And every instance that “finger” is stated with regard to placing deviated of placing, disqualified, of collection, fit.
llm_translation: Abaye said: This that Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon distinguishes between the laws of Avuah and the laws of the Rabbis, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Shimon says, "In any place where it is stated 'finger' regarding receiving, sleep regarding receiving is invalid, but regarding giving it is valid. And in any place where it is stated 'finger' regarding giving, sleep regarding giving is invalid, but regarding receiving it is valid."

hebrew_text: והיכן נאמר אצבע בנתינה דכתיב (שמות כט, יב) ולקחת מדם הפר ונתת על קרנות המזבח באצבעך וקסבר מקרא נדרש לפניו ולא לפני פניו ולאחריו:
human_translation: And where is “finger” stated with regard to placing? As it is written: “And you shall take of the blood of the bullock and put it upon the corners of the altar with your finger” And he holds a verse is interpreted preceding it and not before that precedes it, nor following it.
llm_translation: And where is it stated "with a finger in giving," as it is written (Exodus 29:12), "And you shall take from the blood of the bull and place it on the horns of the altar with your finger," and he holds that the verse is expounded before Him, and not before His face, and not after Him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן כל מקום שנאמר אצבע וכהונה אינה אלא ימין
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: every instance that it is stated a finger and priesthood, only right
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any place where it is stated "finger" and "priesthood" is nothing other than the right hand.

hebrew_text: קא סלקא דעתין תרתי בעינן כדכתיב (ויקרא ד, כה) ולקח הכהן מדם החטאת באצבעו ויליף ממצורע דכתי' (ויקרא יד, טז) וטבל הכהן את אצבעו הימנית והרי קמיצה דלא כתיב בה אלא כהונה ותנן קמץ בשמאל פסול
human_translation: enter our mind we require both as it is written: “And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger” And is derived from a leper, as it is written: “And the priest shall dip his right finger” as the removal of a handful in which only priesthood is written, and we learned removed the handful with left disqualified.
llm_translation: The matter has arisen in two minds, for we require as it is written (Leviticus 4:25), "And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger," and it is written concerning the leper (Leviticus 14:16), "And the priest shall dip his right finger." And the verse of the handful (Leviticus 2:2) does not mention it, only priesthood. And we have learned: If one takes the handful with his left hand, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא או אצבע או כהונה
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: either a finger or priesthood,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: either a finger or priesthood.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי הרי הולכת אברים לכבש דכתיב בהו כהונה דכתיב (ויקרא א, יג) והקריב הכהן את הכל [והקטיר] המזבחה ואמר מר זו הולכת אברים לכבש ותנן הרגל של ימין בשמאלו ובית עורה לחוץ
human_translation: Abaye said to the conveyance of limbs to the ramp as priesthood is written with regard to it, as it is written: “And the priest shall sacrifice the whole upon the altar” and the Master said this conveyance of limbs to the ramp. And we learned the foot of right in the left of and the place of its skin, outward.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Behold, the limbs are going to the sheep," as it is written regarding them, "as a burnt offering," as it is written (Leviticus 1:13), "And the priest shall offer the whole and shall burn it upon the altar." And Mar said: "This is referring to the limbs going to the sheep." And we learned: "The right leg is opposite its left, and the skinning house is outside."

hebrew_text: [כי אמרינן] או אצבע או כהונה בדבר המעכב כפרה דומיא דמצורע
human_translation: When we say either finger or priesthood with regard to a matter that precludes atonement, similar to leper
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ki amrinan" o etzba o kehunah b'davar ha'me'akev kapparah domiya d'metzora. English translation: "For we say: either a finger or priesthood in a matter that impedes atonement is similar to the case of a leper."

hebrew_text: והרי קבלה דכתב בהו כהונה ודבר המעכב בכפרה הוא ותנן קבל בשמאל פסול ור"ש מכשיר
human_translation: But collection about which priesthood is written and is a matter that precludes atonement? And we learned one collected with left disqualified and Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: And behold, it is a tradition that if one writes in them "priesthood," and the matter that invalidates atonement is this. And we learned: If one receives with the left hand, it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: ר"ש תרתי בעי
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon requires both
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon inquired: "Tarti?"

hebrew_text: מי בעי ר"ש תרתי והתניא רבי שמעון אומר כל מקום שנאמר יד אינו אלא ימין אצבע אינו אלא ימין
human_translation: Does Rabbi Shimon require both? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: every instance that “hand” is stated, is only right “finger,” is only right
llm_translation: Who requires? Rabbi Shimon two. And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "Every place that it says 'hand' is nothing but right, 'finger' is nothing but right."

hebrew_text: אצבע לא בעיא כהונה כהונה בעיא אצבע
human_translation: “finger,” does not require priesthood priesthood, requires “finger”
llm_translation: Finger not requires priesthood, priesthood requires finger.

hebrew_text: ואלא כהן למה לי בכיהונן
human_translation: But why do I a priest in their priestly state,
llm_translation: And rather, why do I need a priest for Yehonan?

hebrew_text: והרי זריקה דלא כתב בהו אלא כהונה ותנן זרק בשמאל פסול ולא פליג רבי שמעון
human_translation: But sprinkling concerning which only priesthood is written and we learned: one sprinkled with left disqualified; and Rabbi Shimon does not disagree
llm_translation: And behold, the throwing, for he did not write in them except "priesthood." And we learned: if he threw with his left hand, it is invalid. And Rabbi Shimon does not disagree.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי פליג בברייתא דתניא קיבל בשמאל פסול ורבי שמעון מכשיר זרק בשמאל פסול ורבי שמעון מכשיר
human_translation: Abaye says: He disagrees in a baraita , as it is taught one collected with left disqualified, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit. one sprinkled with left disqualified, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It is disputed in the Baraita as it was taught: If one received the blood with his left hand, it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid. If one sprinkled the blood with his left hand, it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: אלא הא דאמר רבא יד יד לקמיצה רגל רגל לחליצה אזן אזן לרציעה למה לי מדרבה בר בר חנה נפקא
human_translation: But that which Rava says “hand” “hand” to the removal of a handful “foot” “foot” to ḥalitza “ear” “ear” to piercing Why do I derived from of Rabba bar bar Ḥana
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava said: "Hand to hand for kneading, foot to foot for removing, ear to ear for tearing." Why do I need it? It is derived from the teaching of Ravah bar Bar Ḥana.

hebrew_text: חד לקומץ וחד לקידוש קומץ
human_translation: one for handful and one for the sanctification of handful,
llm_translation: One for the handful and one for the sanctification handful.

hebrew_text: ולר"ש דלא בעי קידוש קומץ ולמאן דאמר לר"ש נמי בעי קידוש קומץ בשמאל אכשורי מכשר יד יד דרבא למה לי
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who does not require sanctification of handful, or according to the one who says Rabbi Shimon also requires sanctification of handful he deems fit with left why do I of Rava “hand” “hand”?
llm_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, one does not require sanctification of the handful. And according to the one who says to Rabbi Shimon, one also requires sanctification of the handful, with the left hand. "Achshori" validates the hand. Why do I need Rava's hand?

hebrew_text: אי לקמיצה עצמה מדרב יהודה בריה דרבי חייא נפקא דאמר ר"י בריה דרבי חייא מאי טעמא דרבי שמעון [דאמר קרא] (ויקרא ו, י) קודש קדשי' היא כחטאת וכאשם
human_translation: If to removal of handful itself derived from Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya. As Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon As the verse states “It is most holy, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering”
llm_translation: If for a handful itself from Rav Yehudah son of Rabbi Chiya came out, as Rabbi Yochanan son of Rabbi Chiya said, what is the reason of Rabbi Shimon who said a verse (Leviticus 6:10) "It is most holy, like the sin offering and like the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: בא לעובדה ביד עובדה בימין כחטאת בא לעובדה בכלי עובדה בשמאל כאשם
human_translation: comes to perform with hand, he performs it with right like a sin offering, comes to perform it with a vessel, he perform it with left like a guilt offering,
llm_translation: He came to perform a service with a service vessel in his right hand, like a sin offering. He came to perform a service with a service vessel in his left hand, like a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: לא נצרכא [אלא] לקומץ מנחת חוטא סד"א הואיל ואמר ר"ש שלא יהא קרבנו מהודר כי קמץ לה בשמאל נמי תיתכשר קא משמע לן:
human_translation: is necessary only for the handful of a meal offering of a sinner, enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Shimon says so that his offering will not be of superior when he removed the handful with left it should be fit as well. teaches us
llm_translation: Not needed but for the handful of the sin offering. Since Rabbi Shimon said: His offering should not be honored, for if he gathers it with his left hand, it is also deemed fit.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נשפך הדם על הרצפה ואספו פסול:
human_translation: the blood spilled on the floor and collected it disqualified.
llm_translation: Mishnah: spilled the blood on the floor and gathered it - invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (ויקרא ד, ה) ולקח הכהן המשיח מדם הפר מדם הנפש ולא מדם העור ולא מדם התמצית
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And the anointed priest shall take from the blood of the bull [ middam happar ]” from the blood of the soul, but not from the blood of the skin, nor from the blood of exudate,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 4:5), "And the anointed priest shall take from the blood of the bull from the blood of the soul, but not from the blood of the skin, and not from the blood of the essence."

hebrew_text: מדם הפר דם מהפר יקבלנו דאי סלקא דעתך מדם הפר כדכתיב מדם ואפילו מקצת דם והאמר רב השוחט צריך שיקבל את כל דמו של פר שנאמר (ויקרא ד, ז) ואת כל דמו ישפוך
human_translation: “From the blood of the bull,” He shall collect the blood from the bull, As, if enters your mind “from the blood of the bull” as it is written, “from the blood” even a portion of the blood, But doesn’t Rav say: One who slaughters must collect all the blood of bull, as it is stated: “And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out
llm_translation: From the blood of the bull, blood from the bull he shall receive, for if you were to say that from the blood of the bull, as it is written "from the blood," even from a small amount of blood, and yet Rav said: One who slaughters must receive all the blood of the bull, as it is stated (Leviticus 4:7) "and all its blood he shall pour out."

hebrew_text: אלא מדם הפר דם מהפר יקבלנו וקסבר גורעין ומוסיפין ודורשין
human_translation: Rather, “from the blood of the bull” shall collect blood from the bull. And holds subtract and add and interpret homiletically,
llm_translation: Rather, from the blood of the bull, he shall receive the blood of the bull, and he holds that we subtract and add and expound.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב יהודה אמר רב השוחט צריך שיקבל את כל דמו של פר שנאמר (ויקרא ד, ז) ואת כל דם הפר ישפך והא בשיריים כתיב
human_translation: the itself: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: One who slaughters must collect all the blood of bull, as it is stated: “And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out But isn’t written with regard to the remainder
llm_translation: The body itself, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, the slaughterer must receive all the blood of the bull, as it is stated (Leviticus 4:7), "And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out," yet it is written in the songs.

hebrew_text: אם אינו ענין לשיריים דהא ליתיה לכוליה דם תניהו ענין בקבלה
human_translation: If is not to the matter of the remainder as not all of the blood is apply it the matter of collection
llm_translation: If it is not relevant to the songs, for it does not apply to all of them, as they taught: it is a matter of tradition.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל השוחט צריך שיגביה סכין למעלה שנאמר (ויקרא ד, ה) ולקח מדם הפר ולא מדם הפר ודבר אחר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: One who slaughters must hold the knife up as it is stated: “And shall take from the blood of the bull,” and not from the blood of the bull and something else,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah, said Shmuel: One who slaughters must lift the knife upwards, as it is stated (Leviticus 4:5), "And he shall take from the blood of the bull," not from the blood of the bull, and another explanation.

hebrew_text: ודם סכין במאי מקנח ליה אמר אביי בשפת מזרק כדכתיב (עזרא א, י) כפורי זהב
human_translation: And with what does he wipe blood knife? Abaye says: with the rim of bowl as it is written “Atoning-bowls [ keforei ] of gold”
llm_translation: The blood of a knife, with what does one wipe it? Abaye said: With the lip of a flask, as it is written (Ezra 1:10), "golden goblets."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא השוחט צריך שיתן
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says: One who slaughters must place
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said, Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said: "The one slaughtering must place..."

hebrew_text: ורידין לתוך הכלי איתמר נמי אמר רב אסי אמר רבי יוחנן ורידין צריך שיראו אויר כלי
human_translation: veins into the vessel, It was also stated: Rav Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: veins must see the airspace of vessel.
llm_translation: And regarding pouring liquid into a vessel, it was stated also, Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "And when pouring one must ensure that the vessel's air hole is visible."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי אסי מרבי יוחנן היה מקבל ונפחתו שולי מזרק עד שלא הגיע דם לאויר מהו אויר שאין סופו לנוח כמונח דמי או לא כמונח דמי
human_translation: Rabbi Asi raised a dilemma before Rabbi Yoḥanan: was collecting and the bottom of the bowl broke before blood reached the airspace, what is airspace that will not ultimately to settle considered as settled Or not considered as settled,
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Assi from Rabbi Yochanan: If one was receiving bloodletting and the edge of the lancet was blown upon until the blood did not reach the air, what is the status of the air - is it considered as if it is at rest like still blood, or not like still blood?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה תניתוה חבית שמונחת תחת הזינוק מים שבתוכה ושבחוצה לה פסולין צירף פיה לזינוק מים שבתוכה פסולין ושבחוצה לה כשירין
human_translation: said to him: You learned a barrel that is placed under a pipe water that inside and which is outside it unfit joined the mouth of to the pipe, water that is inside unfit, but that is outside it fit,
llm_translation: He said to him: "You taught: A barrel that is placed beneath a spout, with water inside it and outside it, the contents are disqualified. If its mouth is attached to the spout, the water inside it is disqualified, but the water outside it is valid."

hebrew_text: האי מאי בעי מיניה אויר שאין סופו לנוח וקא פשט ליה אויר שסופו לנוח
human_translation: What is this raises a dilemma before airspace that will not ultimately to settle and resolves airspace that will ultimately to settle
llm_translation: This one, what does he require of it? Air that has no end to rest, and he interpreted for it air that has an end to rest.

hebrew_text: תרתי קא בעי מיניה אם תימצי לומר אויר שאין סופו לנוח לאו כמונח דמי אויר שסופו לנוח מאי
human_translation: raises two dilemmas before if you say airspace that will not ultimately to settle not considered as settled what airspace that will ultimately to settle
llm_translation: Two things it asks of it: if you want to say "air that has no end to rest," is it like something at rest, or "air that will eventually come to rest," what is it?

hebrew_text: רב יוסף מתני הכי רב כהנא מתני חבית בעא מיניה ופשט ליה חבית
human_translation: Rav Yosef teaches this Rav Kahana teaches raised the dilemma before a barrel, and resolved for him a barrel,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef teaches thus: Rav Kahana teaches thus: A barrel was requested from him, and he gave him a barrel.

hebrew_text: רבה מתני חבית בעא מיניה ופשט ליה מזרק אי אתה מודה במזרק שאי איפשר לו בלא זינוק
human_translation: Rabba teaches raised the dilemma before a barrel, and resolved for him a bowl Do you not concede with regard to the bowl that it is impossible to it without a stream
llm_translation: Rabbah taught: If a barrel was requested from him, and he handed him a pitcher, if you admit to the pitcher, since it is impossible for him without a spout.

hebrew_text: תנן התם נתן ידו או רגלו או עלי ירקות כדי שיעברו מים לחבית פסולין עלי קנים ועלי אגוזים כשירה זה הכלל דבר המקבל טומאה פסולין דבר שאינו מקבל טומאה כשירין
human_translation: We learned elsewhere placed his hand or his foot or vegetable leaves in order water to pass to barrel, disqualified. leaves of reeds or leaves of nuts, fit. This is the principle: an item that is susceptible to impurity, disqualified; an item that is not susceptible to impurity, fit.
llm_translation: We learned there: If one placed his hand or foot or leaves of vegetables in order for water to pass over them into a barrel, they are invalid. Leaves of reeds and leaves of nuts are valid. This is the principle: an item that can become ritually impure is invalid, while an item that cannot become ritually impure is valid.

hebrew_text: מנא הני מילי דאמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי יוסי בר אבא אמר קרא (ויקרא יא, לו) אך מעין ובור מקוה מים יהיה טהור הוייתן על ידי טהרה תהא
human_translation: From where are these matters As Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Abba: The verse states: “Nevertheless a fountain or a cistern wherein is a gathering of water shall be pure” their being must be by way of purity,
llm_translation: From where are these matters that Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Abba derived? It is derived from the verse, "Nevertheless, a spring or a cistern, a gathering of water, shall be pure, but if it is touched by impurity, it shall be unclean" (Leviticus 11:36).

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חייא אמר רבי יוחנן זאת אומרת אויר כלי ככלי דמי
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: that is to say airspace a vessel considered as vessel
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya said Rabbi Yochanan: This means "air is like a vessel."

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי זירא לרבי חייא בר אבא ודילמא בשותת א"ל תרדא כדי שיעברו מים לחבית תנן
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: But perhaps where flows weakly said to him: Imbecile, we learned In order water to pass to barrel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: "But perhaps when one pours..." He said to him: "A bucketful, so that the water will pass into the barrel, we learned."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן מעדותו של רבי צדוק נישנית משנה זו דתנן העיד רבי צדוק על הזוחלין שקילחן בעלי אגוזין שהן כשירין זה היה מעשה באוהלייא ובא מעשה לפני חכמים בלשכת הגזית והכשירו
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This mishna was taught from the testimony of Rabbi Tzadok, as we learned Rabbi Tzadok testified with regard to rivulets that one diverted with leaves of nuts that fit This was an incident in Ohalya, and incident came before the Sages in the Chamber of Hewn Stone and they deemed fit.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The testimony of Rabbi Tzadok has been forgotten from this Mishnah, as we learned: Rabbi Tzadok testified regarding creeping creatures that their owners are ritually impure, for they are like nuts. This incident occurred in Ohalya, and the matter came before the sages in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, and they deemed it permissible.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא אמר רבי הצורם אזן הפר ואח"כ קיבל דמו פסול שנאמר (ויקרא ד, ה) ולקח מדם הפר פר שהיה כבר
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rabbi says: one who slits the ear of the bull and thereafter collected its blood disqualified, as it is stated: “And shall take from the blood of the bull” bull it already was
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira, said Rabbi Hatzurm: The ear of the cow, and afterwards he received its blood, invalid. As it is stated (Leviticus 4:5): "And he shall take from the blood of the bull," a bull that was already.

hebrew_text: אשכחן קדשי קדשים קדשים קלים מנלן
human_translation: We found offerings of the most sacred order, from where do we offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: We find the concept of "holy of holies," "holy," and "light" - from where do we derive these distinctions?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא תניא (שמות יב, ה) שה תמים זכר בן שנה שיהא תמים ובן שנה בשעת שחיטה בקבלה בהולכה בזריקה מנין ת"ל יהיה כל הוייותי' לא יהיו אלא תם ובן שנה
human_translation: Rava says: It is taught “A lamb without blemish, a male of the first year that it shall be unblemished and in its year at the time of slaughter. From where at collection at conveying at sprinkling The verse states: “It shall be,” all its happenings shall be only unblemished and in its year.
llm_translation: Rava said: It was taught in a Baraita (Exodus 12:5), "a male lamb in its first year, it shall be unblemished." And a male in its first year should be unblemished at the time of slaughter, at the time of acceptance, at the time of walking, and at the time of sprinkling. From where do we derive this? The Torah states, "it shall be unblemished," meaning all its states should only be unblemished, and in its first year.

hebrew_text: איתיביה אביי רבי יהושע אומר כל הזבחים שבתורה שנשתייר מהן כזית בשר או כזית חלב זורק את הדם
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to Rabbi Yehoshua says: any of the offerings that in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of flesh or an olive-bulk of fat, sprinkles the blood
llm_translation: Abbaye raised an objection: Rabbi Yehoshua says, "Regarding all the sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them an olive's worth of flesh or an olive's worth of fat, one should sprinkle the blood."

hebrew_text: תרגומא אבן שנה
human_translation: Interpret to in its year
llm_translation: Targum of the Stone of Years

hebrew_text: ומי איכא מידי דבשעת שחיטה בן שנה בשעת הולכה וזריקה בן שתים
human_translation: But is there any where in its year at the time of slaughter, at the time of conveying and sprinkling in its second
llm_translation: And is there anything that at the time of slaughter is one year old, at the time of walking is two years old.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא זאת אומרת שעות פוסלות בקדשים
human_translation: Rava says: That is to say hours disqualify sacrificial
llm_translation: Rava said: This means that certain hours invalidate offerings.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אמי אמר רבי אלעזר היא בפנים ורגליה בחוץ חתך ואח"כ שחט כשירה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says Rabbi Elazar says: inside but its legs outside severed and thereafter slaughtered fit,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ami, said Rabbi Elazar: It is inside, and its legs are outside, one may cut and then slaughter it, it is valid.

hebrew_text: שחט ואחר כך חתך פסולה
human_translation: slaughtered and thereafter severed disqualified
llm_translation: Slaughter and afterwards cut, invalid.

hebrew_text: חתך ואח"כ שחט כשרה בעל מום קא מקריב אלא אימא [חתך ואח"כ קיבל כשרה] קיבל ואח"כ חתך פסולה
human_translation: severed and thereafter slaughtered fit? he sacrificing a blemished Rather, say: severed and thereafter collected fit. collected and thereafter severed disqualified,
llm_translation: He cut and afterwards slaughtered a blemished animal validly, rather say he cut and afterwards accepted a valid one, he accepted and afterwards cut an invalid one.

hebrew_text: חתך ואח"כ קיבל כשרה והא א"ר זירא הצורם אזן בבכור ואח"כ קיבל דמו פסול שנאמר ולקח מדם הפר פר שהיה כבר
human_translation: severed and thereafter collected fit? But doesn’t Rabbi Zeira say: slits the ear of a firstborn and thereafter collected its blood disqualified, as it is stated: “And shall take from the blood of the bull” bull it already was
llm_translation: He cut and afterwards received the kosher part. But didn't Rabbi Zeira say: "If one cuts the ear of a firstborn animal and then receives its blood, it is invalid," as it is stated: "And he shall take of the blood of the bull" - a bull that was already slaughtered.

hebrew_text: א"ר חסדא אמר אבימי חותך באבר עד שמגיע לעצם
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says Avimi says: cuts of the limb until he reaches the bone,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥisda said in the name of Avimi: One cuts the animal's limb until reaching the bone.

hebrew_text: קיבל ואח"כ חתך פסולה שמעת מינה דם המובלע באברים דם הוא
human_translation: collected and thereafter severed disqualified, you conclude from it blood absorbed in the limbs is blood,
llm_translation: Received and afterwards cut invalid. Heard from it blood that is absorbed in the limbs is blood.

hebrew_text: דלמא משום שמנונית
human_translation: Perhaps because of fat
llm_translation: Perhaps because of Shemnonit.

hebrew_text: שמעת מינה בשר קדשים קלים שיצא לפני זריקת דם פסול
human_translation: you conclude from it: meat of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of blood, disqualified,
llm_translation: Heard from it, the conclusion is: the flesh of light holy offerings that went out before the sprinkling of blood is invalid.

hebrew_text: דלמא בקדשי קדשים
human_translation: Perhaps with regard to offerings of the most sacred order,
llm_translation: Perhaps in the case of "holy of holies"

hebrew_text: ת"ר קדשי קדשים שחיטתן בצפון וקבול דמן בכלי שרת בצפון עמד בדרום והושיט ידו לצפון ושחט שחיטתו כשרה קיבל קבלתו פסולה הכניס ראשו ורובו כאילו נכנס כולו פרכסה ויצתה לדרום וחזרה כשרה
human_translation: the Sages taught offerings of the most sacred order, their slaughter is in the north and collection of their blood in a service vessel in the north. stood in the south and extended his hand into the north and slaughtered his slaughter valid. collected his collection not valid. he inserted his head and most of his as if his entire entered convulsed and left to the south and returned fit.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The most holy sacrifices, their slaughter is in the north, and receiving their blood in a vessel is in the north. If one stood in the south and extended his hand to the north and slaughtered it, the slaughter is valid, but the receiving is invalid. If he inserted its head and most of its body as though the entire animal had entered the partition, and it emerged to the south and then returned, it is valid.

hebrew_text: קדשים קלים שחיטתן בפנים וקיבול דמן בכלי שרת בפנים עמד בחוץ והכניס ידו לפנים ושחט שחיטתו כשרה קיבל קבלתו פסולה הכניס ראשו ורובו כאילו לא נכנס פרכסה ויצתה לחוץ וחזרה פסולה שמע מינה בשר קדשים קלים שיצא לפני זריקת דמים פסולים
human_translation: offerings of lesser sanctity, their slaughter is inside and collection of their blood in a service vessel inside stood outside and inserted his hand into and slaughtered his slaughter valid. collected his collection not valid. And inserted his head and most of his as if he had not entered convulsed and left to the outside and returned, disqualified. Conclude from meat of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of blood, are disqualified.
llm_translation: Holy things light their slaughter inside and receive their blood in a sacred vessel inside. He stood outside and inserted his hand inside and slaughtered it, its slaughter is valid, he received it, his receiving is invalid. He inserted its head and most of its body as if he did not enter, it exited and returned invalid. Learn from this, the flesh of holy things light that exited before the sprinkling of the blood is invalid.

hebrew_text: דילמא באליה ויותרת הכבד ושתי כליות
human_translation: Perhaps to tail, diaphragm, and two kidneys
llm_translation: Perhaps it is due to Eliyah and the extra liver and two kidneys.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה אבוה דשמואל משמואל היא בפנים ורגליה בחוץ מהו
human_translation: Shmuel’s father raised a dilemma before Shmuel: inside and its legs outside, what is
llm_translation: Requested by his father from Shmuel: "Is Shmuel considered 'inside' with regards to her face and 'outside' with regards to her legs?" What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: א"ל כתיב (ויקרא יז, ה) והביאום לה' עד שתהא כולה לפנים
human_translation: said to him: It is written: “That they may bring them to the Lord” unless all of it is inside.
llm_translation: He said to him: It is written (Leviticus 17:5), "And they shall bring them to the Lord until the whole is before the Lord."

hebrew_text: תלה ושחט מהו א"ל כשרה א"ל אישתבשת בעינן שחיטה על ירך וליכא
human_translation: suspended and slaughtered what is said to him: valid. said to him: You are mistaken. We require slaughter on side and not
llm_translation: Hung and slaughtered, what is it? He said to him: It is valid. He said to him: We require the slaughter on the thigh, and there is none.

hebrew_text: נתלה ושחט מהו אמר ליה פסולה אמר ליה אישתבשת שחיטה על ירך ולא שוחט על ירך
human_translation: was suspended and slaughtered what is said to him: not valid. said to him: You are mistaken. slaughter on side but not one who slaughters on side
llm_translation: He hanged and slaughtered, what is the ruling? He said to him: It is invalid. He said to him: The disgrace of slaughter is on the thigh, and he did not slaughter on the thigh.

hebrew_text: נתלה וקבל מהו אמר ליה כשרה אמר ליה אישתבשת אין דרך שירות בכך
human_translation: was suspended and collected what is said to him: valid. said to him: You are mistaken. This is not manner of ministration.
llm_translation: He was hanged and received, what is the ruling? He said to him: It is valid. He said to him: It is disgraceful, it is not the way of service in this manner.

hebrew_text: תלה וקיבל מהו אמר ליה פסולה אמר ליה אישתבשת שחיטה על ירך ולא קבלה על ירך
human_translation: suspended and collected what is said to him: not valid. said to him: You are mistaken. slaughter on side but not collection on side
llm_translation: He hanged and received. What is it? He said to him: It is invalid. He said to him: The slaughter was disgraceful on the thigh, and it did not receive on the thigh.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בקדשי קדשים כולן פסולות בר מנתלה ושחט בקדשים קלים כולן כשרות בר מן נתלה וקיבל
human_translation: Abaye said: With regard to offerings of the most sacred order, all of are disqualified, except for was suspended and slaughtered With regard to offerings of lesser sanctity, all of are fit, except for was suspended and collected
llm_translation: Abbaye said: In the most holy things, all are disqualified if the sinew shrank, and in the less holy things, all are valid if the sinew shrank and he received.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאי שנא תלה וקיבל בקדשים קלים דכשרה דאויר פנים כפנים דמי בקדשי קדשים נמי אויר צפון כצפון דמי
human_translation: Rava said: What is different suspended and collected offering of lesser sanctity, that fit? because the air inside is considered inside with regard to offerings of the most sacred order as well, air north is considered north
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the difference between hanging a vessel and receiving a vessel with light consecrated items? The difference is that when it comes to hanging, it is valid if the airspace is like the space of the Temple Sanctuary. Similarly, when it comes to light consecrated items, the northern airspace is like the north of the Temple Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא בין בקדשי קדשים בין בקדשים קלים כשרות בר מן תלה ושחט בקדשי קדשים נתלה וקיבל בין בקדשי קדשים בין בקדשים קלים
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: Both with regard to offerings of the most sacred order and with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity, are fit except suspended and slaughtered in offerings of the most sacred order, was suspended and collected both with regard to offerings of the most sacred order and with regard to offerings of lesser sanctity,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Whether in the Holy of Holies or in the lesser sanctified areas, offerings are valid if the son of Amram hanged and slaughtered in the Holy of Holies, it is hanged and accepted, whether in the Holy of Holies or in the lesser sanctified areas.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי ירמיה מרבי זירא הוא בפנים וציציתו בחוץ מהו אמר ליה לאו אמרת והביאום לה' עד שתבא כולה לפנים הכא נמי (שמות כח, מג) בבואם אל אהל מועד עד שיבא כולו לאהל מועד:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: inside and his fringes, outside, what is said to him: Did you not say “That they may bring them to the Lord” unless all of it comes inside? Here, too, “When they go into the Tent of Meeting” unless all of him comes into the Tent of Meeting.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Baa minei Rabbi Yirmiyah meRabbi Zeira hu be'pnim u'tzitzito b'chutz mahu amar lei lav amarta vehavi'em laHashem ad shetavo kolah le'pnim hacha nami (Shemot 28:43) b'vo'am el ohel mo'ed ad shiavo kulo la'ohel mo'ed." English translation: "Rabbi Yirmiyah asked Rabbi Zeira: If it (the garment) is inside and its fringes are outside, what is the law? He said to him: Did you not say, 'And they shall bring them to the Lord' until the entire thing comes inside? Here too (it is the same law) (Exodus 28:43) 'When they come into the tent of meeting, until it all comes into the tent of meeting.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נתנו על גבי הכבש שלא כנגד היסוד נתן את הניתנין למטה למעלה ואת הניתנין למעלה למטה ואת הניתנין בפנים בחוץ ואת הניתנין בחוץ בפנים פסול ואין בו כרת:
human_translation: placed upon the ramp that not opposite the base he placed that is placed below above or that is placed above below or that is placed inside outside or that is placed outside inside disqualified. there is no karet for
llm_translation: Mishnah: They placed upon the lamb not opposite the foundation, he placed the ones that are given below above, and the ones that are given above below, and the ones that are given inside outside, and the ones that are given outside inside, it is invalid, and it does not have karet.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר שמואל פסול בשר אבל בעלים נתכפרו מאי טעמא דאמר קרא (ויקרא יז, יא) ואני נתתיו לכם על המזבח לכפר כיון שהגיע דם למזבח נתכפרו בעלים
human_translation: Shmuel says: disqualified, meat But owner achieved atonement What is the reason as the verse states “And I have given it to you upon the altar to atone once the blood reaches the altar, owner achieved atonement.
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said: If the flesh is disqualified, but the owners are atoned for. What is the reason? As the verse states (Leviticus 17:11), "For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life." Once the blood reaches the altar, the owners are atoned for.

hebrew_text: אי הכי בשר נמי אמר קרא לכפר לכפרה נתתיו ולא לדבר אחר
human_translation: If so, meat as well. The verse states “to atone,” I have given it for atonement and for nothing else,
llm_translation: If so, also flesh said Scripture "for atonement, for at atonement I have given it" and not for something else.

hebrew_text: אלמא קסבר שלא במקומו כמקומו דמי תנן באידך פירקין נתנו על הכבש שלא כנגד היסוד נתן את הניתנין למטה למעלה ואת הניתנין למעלה למטה ואת הניתנין בפנים בחוץ ואת הניתנין בחוץ בפנים אם יש דם הנפש יחזור הכשר ויקבל
human_translation: Apparently, holds not in its place is considered as its place. we learned in another chapter placed upon the ramp, that not opposite the base he placed that is placed below above or that is placed above below or that is placed inside outside or that is placed outside inside if there is blood of the soul the fit should collect again
llm_translation: The Gemara infers: He holds that an item not in its proper place is considered as if it were in its proper place. We learned in the other chapter: They placed beams on the lamb not corresponding to the foundation, he placed those that were below above, and those that were above below, and those that were inside outside, and those that were outside inside. If there is blood, the offering is valid, and he may accept it.

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד שלא במקומו כמקומו למה לי יחזור הכשר ויקבל וכי תימא להתיר בשר באכילה מי איכא זריקה דלא מכפרת ושריא בשר באכילה
human_translation: And if enter your mind that not in its place as its place, why do I the fit collect again And if you would say to permit the meat for consumption, is there a sprinkling that does not effect atonement and permits meat for consumption?
llm_translation: And if you will say that not in its place as its place, why do I need that it should return fit and be accepted? And if you will say to permit meat for consumption, is there sprinkling that does not atone and permitted meat for consumption.

hebrew_text: אי דיהביה כשר ה"נ הכא במאי עסקינן דיהביה פסול
human_translation: If a fit had placed indeed here we are dealing with where an unfit placed
llm_translation: If one gave it, it is valid. So too here, with what are we dealing that if one gave it, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: וליהוי דחוי דתנן וכולן שקיבלו חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו אם יש דם הנפש יחזור הכשר ויקבל קיבלו אין זרקו לא מ"ט לאו משום דהוי דחוי
human_translation: But should be rejected as we learned And all who collected beyond its time or outside its area, if there is blood of the soul the fit should collect again collected indeed sprinkled cannot. What is the reason not because is rejected
llm_translation: And for Elijah who was pushed, as we learned, "And all of them accepted the offering outside of its time and outside of its place, if there is blood of the soul, it shall return to its validity, and he shall accept the offering." They accepted it, if they did not sprinkle the blood, what is the reason? Not because it is considered pushed aside.

hebrew_text: לא משום דפסיל במחשבה
human_translation: No, because it is disqualified by intent
llm_translation: Not because it is nullified in thought.

hebrew_text: אי הכי קבלה נמי ועוד מי פסלה מחשבה והאמר רבא אין מחשבה מועלת אלא במי שראוי לעבודה ובדבר הראוי לעבודה ובמקום הראוי לעבודה
human_translation: If so, collection as well. And furthermore, does intent disqualify But doesn’t Rava say: Intent is effective only by one who is fit for the service, and with regard to an item that is fit for the service, and in a place that is fit for the service?
llm_translation: If so, also tradition, and furthermore, who disqualified thought? And Rava said: Thought is effective only in one fit for service, in a matter fit for service, and in a place fit for service.

hebrew_text: לא תימא זרקו לא אלא אימא שחטו לא
human_translation: Do not say sprinkled cannot Rather, say slaughtered cannot
llm_translation: Do not say "they threw," rather say "they slaughtered."

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל דפסלה מחשבה תנינא לפיכך הן פוסלין במחשבה
human_translation: what is teaching us? that intent disqualifies We learn therefore, these disqualify with intent.
llm_translation: What is the teaching that we learn that thought disqualifies? We learned: therefore they disqualify with thought.

hebrew_text: הא קמ"ל דמקבלה ואילך לא פסלה מחשבה מ"ט כדרבא
human_translation: This teaches us: That from collection onward intent does not disqualify What is the reason like that which Rava
llm_translation: This teaches that from here onward, intention does not invalidate the ritual act. What is the reason? As Rava said.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חישב ליתן את הניתנין למעלה למטה למטה למעלה לאלתר כשר (למחר פסול) חזר וחישב
human_translation: raises an objection had intent to place that is placed above below below above immediately, fit. he subsequently had intent
llm_translation: The question was raised: If one intended to place the items above below, below above, immediately valid (but the next day invalid), then reconsidered.

hebrew_text: חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: outside its area, disqualified, and there is no karet for it. beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: Outside of its place, invalid, and it does not have karet. Outside of its time, pigul, and one is liable for karet.

hebrew_text: למחר פסול חזר וחישב בין חוץ לזמנו בין חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: the next day, disqualified. he subsequently had intent whether beyond its time or outside its area, disqualified and there is no karet for it,
llm_translation: On the morrow, invalid. He returned and calculated, whether outside its time or outside its place, invalid, and it does not contain karet.

hebrew_text: ואי שלא במקומו כמקומו דמי האי פסול פיגול הוא
human_translation: But if not in its place as its place, this disqualified? it is piggul ?
llm_translation: And if not in its place like its place, it is considered as if it is disqualified, it is a case of Pigul.

hebrew_text: אמר מר זוטרא זריקה דשריא בשר באכילה מייתא לידי פיגול זריקה דלא שריא בשר באכילה לא מייתא לידי פיגול
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: sprinkling that permits meat for consumption cause to piggul . sprinkling that does not render meat permitted for consumption does not cause to piggul .
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: "The act of throwing is permitted in the case of meat for consumption, it can lead to the status of Pigul. The act of throwing that is not permitted in the case of meat for consumption does not lead to the status of Pigul."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי למר זוטרא מנא לך הא דכתיב (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח שלמיו פיגול יהיה מי שפיגולו גרם לו יצא זה שאין פיגולו גרם לו אלא איסור דבר אחר גרם לו
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra: From where do you this? as it is written: “And if any of the flesh of his peace offerings be at all eaten it shall be piggul ” whose piggul caused it Excluded is this whose piggul did not cause it rather, the prohibition of something else, caused it
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Mar Zutra: From where do you derive this which is written (Leviticus 7:18), "And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offering be eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offers it; it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity"? This one, whose own intention caused it to become disqualified, he is exempt. This one, whose own intention did not cause it to become disqualified, but rather another prohibition caused it to become disqualified, he is liable.

hebrew_text: אי הכי איפסולי נמי לא ליפסל
human_translation: if so, it should not even be disqualified
llm_translation: If so, they are also disqualified, but they do not disqualify.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק מידי דהוה אמחשבת הינוח ואליבא דרבי יהודה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: just as is with regard to the intent to leave and according to of Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "From the moment that one's thought is settled, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda..."

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר לעולם פסול ממש ושלא במקומו כמקומו דמי ולא קשיא כאן שנתן בשתיקה כאן שנתן באמירה
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Actually, disqualified, literally, And not in its place is considered as its place, And not difficult: Here, where where he placed in silence, there, where he placed with a statement,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Always invalid literally and not in its proper place is considered as in its proper place, and it is not difficult: here where it was given silently, here where it was given verbally.

hebrew_text: תנן חישב ליתן את הניתנין למטה למעלה למעלה למטה עד מידי דהוה אמחשבת הינוח ואליבא דרבי יהודה כו'
human_translation: We learned had intent to place that is placed below above above below until Just as is with regard to the intent to leave and according to of Rabbi Yehuda, etc.
llm_translation: We have learned: If one intended to place the items that are to be given below above, above below, until the thought process ceases, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, etc.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר אידי ואידי שנתן בשתיקה ושלא במקומו לאו כמקומו דמי והא דאיכא דם הנפש הא דליכא דם הנפש
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: here and there, where he placed in silence. And not in its place is not considered as its place. And that where there is blood of the soul this where there is no blood of the soul
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Both this and that, if given in silence and not in its proper place, is not considered as if it were in its proper place. And as for the case where there is blood of a life, and the case where there is no blood of a life."

hebrew_text: תנן פסול ואין בו כרת בשלמא לריש לקיש היינו דקתני פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: We learned disqualified, but there is no karet for Granted, according to Reish Lakish, this is that teaches: Disqualified, but there is no karet for it,
llm_translation: We have learned: It is invalid, yet does not incur karet. Granted, according to Reish Lakish, this is what he taught: It is invalid, yet does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי יוחנן מאי אין בו כרת קשיא
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what There is no karet for it? difficult
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan, what is the difficulty that there is no karet.

hebrew_text: ולשמואל מאי אין בו כרת ה"ק אם נתן במחשבה פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: And according to Shmuel, what There is no karet for it? This is saying: If one placed with intent disqualified, but there is no karet for it,
llm_translation: And regarding Shmuel, what is meant by "it does not incur karet"? The Holy One, blessed be He, if one gives it with intent, it is invalid, and it does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אי שלא במקומו לאו כמקומו דמי ליהוי כי נשפך מן הכלי על הרצפה ויאספנו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, if not in its place is not considered as its place, it should be as if it spilled from the vessel onto the floor, and let gather it up
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan: If not in its place, is it not as its place, that it should be considered as if it spilled from the vessel onto the floor and one may gather it up.

hebrew_text: סבר לה כמ"ד לא יאספנו דאמר רב יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן הכל מודים בניתנין למעלה שנתנן למעלה למטה שנתנן למטה שלא כמצותן לא יאספנו לא נחלקו אלא בניתנין למעלה שנתנן למטה למטה שנתנן למעלה שרבי יוסי אומר לא יאספנו ורבי שמעון אומר יאספנו
human_translation: holds in accordance with the one who says: He may not gather it up. As Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All concede with regard to that is placed above that one placed it above below placed it below not in accordance with its mitzva, he may not gather it up They disagree only with regard to that is placed above that one placed below below that one placed above as Rabbi Yosei says: He may not gather it up, and Rabbi Shimon says: He may gather it up.
llm_translation: He thought according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir, "They shall not be gathered," for Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Everyone agrees that if they were given above and placed below, or if they were given below and placed above, not in accordance with their requirements, they shall not be gathered. They only disagreed regarding if they were given above and placed below, or if they were given below and placed above. Rabbi Yosei says they shall not be gathered, and Rabbi Shimon says they shall be gathered.

hebrew_text: ומשנתינו כדברי האומר לא יאספנו
human_translation: And our mishna is in accordance with the statement of the one who says: He may not gather it up.
llm_translation: And from our Mishnah, like the words of the one who says, "They shall not gather us."

hebrew_text: ורב חסדא אמר אבימי הכל מודין בניתנין למטה שנתנן למעלה שלא יאספנו וכל שכן בניתנין למעלה שנתנן למטה הואיל ודמים העליונים למטה הן באין לא נחלקו אלא בניתנין לפנים שנתנן בחוץ בחוץ שנתנן לפנים שר' יוסי אומר יאספנו ור"ש אומר לא יאספנו
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda Avimi says: Everyone concedes with regard to that is placed below that one placed it above he may not gather it up And all the more so with regard to the that is placed above that one placed below since the blood above reach below They disagree only with regard to that is placed inside that one placed outside outside that one placed inside, as Rabbi Yosei says: He may gather it up, and Rabbi Shimon says: He may not gather it up,
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda said: Avimi said, everyone agrees that if they were given below that they were given above, so that they should not be gathered. And certainly if they were given above that they were given below, since the upper bloods come below, they only disagreed regarding if they were given inside that they were given outside, outside that they were given inside. Rabbi Yosei says they should be gathered, and Rabbi Shimon says they should not be gathered.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק אף אנן נמי תנינא רבי יהודה אומר (ויקרא ו, ב) זאת היא העולה הרי אלו מיעוטין פרט לנשחטה בלילה ושנשפך דמה ושיצא דמה חוץ לקלעים אם עלתה תרד
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: We learn as well Rabbi Yehuda says “This It is that which goes up [ ha’ola ] These are exclusion, to exclude was slaughtered at night, whose blood was spilled, and whose blood emerged outside the curtains, if ascended it shall descend.
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: We also learned: Rabbi Yehuda says (Leviticus 6:2), "This is the burnt offering." These are the exclusions: specifically slaughtered at night, and if its blood was spilled, and if its blood exited outside the curtains. If it ascended, it shall descend.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר עולה אין לי אלא עולה כשרה מנין לרבות שנשחטה בלילה ושנשפך דמה ושיצא דמה חוץ לקלעים והלן והיוצא והטמא ושנשחט חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו ושקיבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמה והניתנין למעלה שנתנן למטה והניתנין למטה שנתנן למעלה והניתנין בפנים שנתנן בחוץ והניתנין בחוץ שנתנן בפנים והפסח והחטאת ששחטן שלא לשמן מנין
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “burnt offering [ ola ]” I have only a fit burnt offering From where that includes that was slaughtered at night, or whose blood was spilled, or whose blood emerged outside the curtains, or that was left overnight, or that left or that impure, or that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, or which an unfit collected and sprinkled its blood, or one placed that is placed above below or one placed that is placed below above or one placed that is placed inside outside or one placed that is placed outside inside or a Paschal offering or a sin offering that one slaughtered not for their sake? From where
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "An Olah offering, I only have an Olah offering. How do I know to include one that was slaughtered at night, one whose blood was spilled, one whose blood exited outside the Temple courtyard, one that was left overnight, one that was taken out, one that is impure, one that was slaughtered outside its designated time, one that was slaughtered outside its designated place, one that was received by those who are disqualified, one whose blood was thrown, one that was placed above when it should have been below, one that was placed below when it should have been above, one that was placed inside when it should have been outside, one that was placed outside when it should have been inside, the Paschal offering, and the sin offering that were slaughtered not for their sake - how do I know to include them?"

hebrew_text: ת"ל תורת העולה ריבה תורה אחת לכל העולין שאם עלו לא ירדו
human_translation: The verse states: “The law of the burnt offering [ ha’ola ],” included one law all that ascend that if they ascended they shall not descend.
llm_translation: It is taught: "It is stated, 'The law of the burnt offering is one law for all the burnt offerings, that if they ascend, they shall not descend.'"

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה אף הרובע והנרבע והמוקצה והנעבד והאתנן והמחיר והכלאים והטריפה ויוצא דופן ת"ל זאת
human_translation: might that I include even an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, or that was set aside or that was worshipped or payment or the price or diverse kinds, or a tereifa , or born by caesarean section. The verse states: “This,”
llm_translation: It is possible that I might include also the one who traps, the one who is trapped, the one who is designated for a specific purpose, the one who is consecrated, the one who is pledged, the one who is exchanged, the one who is appraised, the one who is penalized, and the one who is disqualified. The Torah teaches "this."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות את אלו ולהוציא את אלו מרבה אני את אלו שהיה פסולן בקודש ומוציא אני את אלו שלא היה פסולן בקודש
human_translation: And what did you see to include and to exclude I include these whose disqualification occurred in sanctity, and I exclude these whose disqualification did not occur in sanctity
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those? I include these that were disqualified in matters of holiness, and I exclude those that were not disqualified in matters of holiness.
