hebrew_text: קתני מיהא הניתנין למטה שנתנן למעלה ולמעלה שנתנן למטה ולא פליג רבי יהודה מ"ט לאו משום דקלטיה מזבח ושמע מינה לא יאספנו
human_translation: In any event, teaches one placed that is placed below above or one placed above below And Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree, What is the reason not because the altar has absorbed Conclude from it may not gather it up
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Those that are designated for below that were placed above, and those that were placed above that were designated for below." And Rabbi Yehudah does not disagree. What is the reason? Not because the altar is missing, and we learn from this that they should not be gathered.

hebrew_text: א"ר אליעזר מזבח הפנימי מקדש פסולין
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The inner altar, sanctifies disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer: "The inner altar renders the Temple disqualified."

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל תנינא הניתנין בפנים כו'
human_translation: What is teaching us? We learn that is placed inside
llm_translation: What is the teaching that we learn from the Mishnah: "Those who are placed inside, etc."

hebrew_text: אי מהתם הוה אמינא ה"מ דם דחזי ליה אבל קומץ דלא חזי ליה אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: If from there, I would say: This matter blood as it is fit to but a handful which is not fit to I will say not teaches us
llm_translation: If you wish, I can provide a word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text you provided. Would you like me to proceed with that?

hebrew_text: מיתיבי קטרת זרה שעלה לגבי מזבח תרד שאין לך מקדש פסולין אלא מזבח החיצון בראוי לו חיצון אין פנימי לא
human_translation: raises an objection strange incense, ascended onto the altar, it shall descend, as only the external altar sanctifies disqualified suited for it. external does inner not.
llm_translation: The question was raised: The incense offered by a non-priest that ascended upon the Altar, is there any Temple service that is disqualified, except for the outer Altar, which is fitting for it, but not the inner Altar.

hebrew_text: תריץ הכי קטרת זרה שעלתה למזבח החיצון תרד שאין מזבח החיצון מקדש פסולין אלא הראוי לו והפנימי בין ראוי לו בין שאין ראוי לו מאי טעמא האי רצפה והאי כלי שרת:
human_translation: Answer like this: strange incense ascended onto the external altar, it shall descend, as the external altar sanctifies only disqualified that are suited for it. But the inner whether it is suited for it or it is not suited for it. What is the reason This, floor, and that, a service vessel
llm_translation: The incense that was offered on the outer altar, whether fitting or not fitting, is invalid. What is the reason? Because of the floor and the sacred vessels.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט את הזבח לזרוק דמו בחוץ או מקצת דמו בחוץ להקטיר אימוריו בחוץ או מקצת אימוריו בחוץ לאכול בשרו בחוץ או כזית מבשרו בחוץ או לאכול כזית מעור האליה בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: one who slaughters the offering to sprinkle its blood outside or part of its blood outside to burn its sacrificial portions outside or part of its sacrificial portions outside to partake of its meat outside or an olive-bulk of its meat outside or to partake of an olive-bulk of the skin of the tail outside disqualified, and there is no karet for
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters the sacrifice to sprinkle its blood outside, or some of its blood outside, to burn its portions outside, or some of its portions outside, to eat its flesh outside, or an olive's worth of its flesh outside, or to eat an olive's worth of the skin of the tail outside - it is invalid, and does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: לזרוק דמו למחר מקצת דמו למחר להקטיר אימוריו למחר או מקצת אימוריו למחר לאכול בשרו למחר או כזית מבשרו למחר או לאכול כזית מעור האליה למחר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת:
human_translation: to sprinkle its blood the next day part of its blood the next day, to burn its sacrificial portions the next day or part of its sacrificial portions the next day, to partake of its meat the next day or an olive-bulk of its meat the next day, or to partake of an olive-bulk of the skin of the tail the next day, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: To throw his blood tomorrow, some of his blood tomorrow, to burn his offerings tomorrow, or some of his offerings tomorrow, to eat his flesh tomorrow, or an olive's worth of his flesh tomorrow, or to eat an olive's worth of the fatty tail tomorrow - it is considered disqualified and one is liable for it with excision.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ סברוה עור אליה
human_translation: assumed the skin of the tail
llm_translation: Gemara: Sabruha Or Elaya

hebrew_text: כאליה דמי והא קא מחשב מאכילת מזבח לאדם
human_translation: is considered as tail But has intent from consumption by altar, to a person.
llm_translation: Like Eliyahu, it is considered, and yet it is calculating the feeding of the altar for a person.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל הא מני ר' אליעזר היא דאמר מחשבין מאכילת מזבח לאכילת אדם ומאכילת אדם לאכילת מזבח
human_translation: Shmuel says: whose is this? It is Rabbi Eliezer, who says: One can have intent from consumption by altar to consumption by a person, or from consumption by a person to consumption by altar,
llm_translation: Said Samuel: This is the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer, for he said, "We calculate from the eating of the altar to the eating of a person, and from the eating of a person to the eating of the altar."

hebrew_text: דתנן השוחט את הזבח לאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול להקטיר דבר שאין דרכו להקטיר כשר ור"א פוסל
human_translation: as we learned one who slaughters the offering to partake of an item whose manner not partake to burn an item whose manner not burn fit. And Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit.
llm_translation: As we have learned in the Mishnah: One who slaughters the sacrifice to eat something that is not normally eaten, or to burn something that is not normally burned, it is valid according to the Sages, but Rabbi Eliezer deems it invalid.

hebrew_text: במאי אוקימתא כר"א אימא סיפא זה הכלל כל השוחט והמקבל והמוליך והזורק לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר
human_translation: In accordance with which did you interpret in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. say the latter clause, This is the principle: Anyone who slaughters or who collects or who conveys or who sprinkles to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns
llm_translation: With what was the statement of Rabbi Akiva established? Say the latter clause: This is the general principle: Anyone who slaughters, receives, transports, or throws an offering to be eaten, something whose manner is to be eaten, and to burn, something whose manner is to be burned.

hebrew_text: דבר שדרכו לאכול אין שאין דרכו לאכול לא אתאן לרבנן רישא ר' אליעזר וסיפא רבנן אמר ליה אין
human_translation: an item whose manner partakes does whose manner not partake not we arrive at the Rabbis. the first clause Rabbi Eliezer, the latter clause the Rabbis? said to him: Yes.
llm_translation: A matter that its way is to eat, if its way is not to eat, it does not come to the Rabbis. The first part is Rabbi Eliezer, and the latter part is the Rabbis. He said to him, "No."

hebrew_text: רב הונא אמר עור אליה לאו כאליה דמי אמר רבא מ"ט דרב הונא (ויקרא ג, ט) חלבו האליה ולא עור האליה
human_translation: Rav Huna says: The skin of tail is not considered as tail Rava said: What is the reasoning of Rav Huna? The fat thereof, the fat tail” but not the skin of the tail.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: "The skin of an Eliyah is not like an Eliyah." Rava said: "What is the reason of Rav Huna? (Leviticus 3:9) Its fat is the Eliyah and not the skin of the Eliyah."

hebrew_text: רב חסדא אמר לעולם עור האליה כאליה דמי והכא במאי עסקינן באליה של גדי
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: Actually, the skin of the tail is considered as tail And here, we are dealing with the tail of a kid,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Always the skin of the fetus is like the fetus itself, and here we are dealing with the skin of a kid.

hebrew_text: כולהו כשמואל לא אמרי רישא ר"א וסיפא רבנן לא מוקמי כרב הונא לא אמרי עור אליה כאליה דמי קא משמע להו
human_translation: All of them, do not say as Shmuel they do not interpret the first clause Rabbi Eliezer and the latter clause the Rabbis. do not say as Rav Huna they heard skin of tail is considered as tail
llm_translation: All of them like Shmuel do not say. The first part according to Rabbi Eliezer, and the latter part according to the Rabbis. They do not establish it like Rav Huna. They do not say "skin" is like Eliyah, rather it is implied that it is like Eliyah.

hebrew_text: כרב חסדא מאי טעמא לא אמרי מאי קמ"ל עור אליה כאליה דמי תנינא ואלו שעורותיהן כבשרן עור שתחת האליה
human_translation: What is the reason do not say as Rav Ḥisda what is teaching us skin of tail is considered like tail We learn These whose skin like their meat, skin beneath the tail.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda: What is the reason that they did not say, "What is he teaching us?" The verse is like its skin, we learn, and these are its measurements like its flesh. The skin beneath the fur.

hebrew_text: ורב חסדא איצטריך סד"א ה"מ לענין טומאה דרכיך מצטרף אבל הכא אימא (במדבר יח, ח) למשחה לגדולה כדרך שהמלכים אוכלין ולא עבידי מלכים דאכלי הכי אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: And Rav Ḥisda, was necessary, enter your mind to say: This matter, with regard to the matter of ritual impurity, as soft counted But here, I will say “As a consecrated portion” to greatness, in the way that the kings eat. And kings do not generally eat I will say not teaches us
llm_translation: And Rav Ḥisda required the support of the opinion of the School of Rabbi Ishmael, as follows: In the matter of ritual impurity, the way of joining is effective, but here one might say (Numbers 18:8), "As an anointing oil of great value," just as kings eat, and it is not the practice of kings to eat in this manner. Therefore, one might say that this is not necessary to teach.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי השוחט את העולה להקטיר כזית מעור שתחת האליה חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: raises an objection One who slaughters a burnt offering to burn an olive-bulk of skin beneath the tail outside its area disqualified, but there is no karet for beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: A question was raised: One who slaughters the burnt offering to burn a olive-bulk of the skin beneath the fatty tail outside its proper place, it is invalid, and does not incur karet. Outside its designated time, it is considered pigul, and one is liable to karet for it.

hebrew_text: אלעזר בן יהודה איש אבלי' אומר משום רבי יעקב וכן היה רבי שמעון בן יהודה איש כפר עיכוס אומר משום ר' שמעון אחד עור בית הפרסות בהמה דקה ואחד עור הראש של עגל הרך ואחד עור שתחת האליה וכל שמנו חכמים גבי טומאה ואלו שעורותיהן כבשרן להביא עור של בית הבושת חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: Elazar ben Yehuda of Avelim says in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov, and so Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda of Kefar Ikos would say in the name of Rabbi Shimon: Whether hide of the hooves small livestock, or skin of the head of a young calf, or skin beneath the tail, or any that the Sages listed with regard to ritual impurity These whose skin like their meat, to include the skin of the womb, outside its area, disqualified, but there is no karet for it, beyond its time, piggul , and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: Elazar ben Yehuda, a man of Avlay, says in the name of Rabbi Yaakov, and similarly Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, a man of Kfar Aikus, says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "One skin of the innermost part of the uterus of a small animal, and one skin of the head of a soft calf, and one skin beneath the womb - and all of these, the Sages have equated to their flesh regarding impurity. And if their skins are brought outside of their proper place, it is invalid, and there is no karet penalty for it, but it is considered pigul, and one is liable to karet for it."

hebrew_text: עולה אין אבל זבח לא בשלמא לרב הונא היינו דקתני עולה אלא לרב חסדא מאי איריא דתני עולה ליתני זבח
human_translation: a burnt offering, yes, But offering, not Granted, according to Rav Huna, this is that teaches a burnt offering But according to Rav Ḥisda, why does specifically teach a burnt offering? let teach offering.
llm_translation: Offering, no; Mourning, yes. Sacrifice, no. But according to Rav Huna, that's what it teaches: Offering. Rather, according to Rav Ḥisda, what is the relevance that it teaches Offering? Let it teach Sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רב חסדא איבעית אימא באליה של גדי ואיבעית אימא תני זבח:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to you: If you wish, say to the tail of a kid, And if you wish, say teach: offering,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to you: If you wish, say "ba'alyah shel gedi," and if you wish, say "tani zevach."

hebrew_text: פסול ואין בו כרת כו': מנה"מ אמר שמואל תרי קראי כתיבי
human_translation: disqualified, and there is no karet for From where are these matters Shmuel says: Two verses are written.
llm_translation: Invalid and does not incur karet, etc. What is the source? Shmuel said: Two verses are written.

hebrew_text: מאי היא אמר רבה (ויקרא ז, יז) שלישי זהו חוץ לזמנו
human_translation: What are Rabba said: third this is beyond its time.
llm_translation: What is it? Rabbah said: "Third" - this is outside its designated time. (Leviticus 7:17)

hebrew_text: פיגול זהו חוץ למקומו והנפש האוכלת ממנו אחד ולא שנים זהו חוץ לזמנו ולמעוטי חוץ למקומו
human_translation: piggul ,” this is outside its area. “And the soul that eats of it one but not two this is beyond its time, to the exclusion of outside its area,
llm_translation: "Pigul, this is outside its place, and the soul that eats from it, one and not two, this is outside its time, and to exclude, outside its place."

hebrew_text: ואימא והנפש האוכלת ממנו זהו חוץ למקומו ולמעוטי חוץ לזמנו מסתברא חוץ לזמנו עדיף דפתח ביה אדרבה חוץ למקומו עדיף דסמיך ליה
human_translation: But say “And the soul that eats of it this is outside its area, to the exclusion of beyond its time? It stands to reason beyond its time preferable as opened with it. On the contrary, outside its area preferable, as adjacent to it.
llm_translation: And say: "And the soul that eats from it, this is outside its place." And to exclude what is outside its time, it is logical that outside its time is preferable, for it begins with it. On the contrary, outside its place is preferable, for it is adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי כי אתא רב יצחק בר אבדימי [אמר רב] סמיך אדתני תנא כשהוא אומר שלישי בפרשת קדושים תהיו שאין ת"ל שהרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח השלמים ביום השלישי
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: When Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi came, Rav says: relied on that which the tanna taught: when it states: third in the portion “You shall be holy” as no the verse to state since it is already stated: “And if any of the flesh of his peace offerings be at all eaten on the third day
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: When Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi came, Rav said, "It is adjacent to what the Tanna taught: 'When it says, "You shall be holy," it does not teach anything new,' for it has already been stated (Leviticus 7:18), 'If any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings be eaten on the third day.'"

hebrew_text: אם אינו ענין לחוץ לזמנו תנהו לענין חוץ למקומו ומיעט רחמנא גבי נותר (ויקרא יט, ח) ואוכליו עונו ישא למעוטי חוץ למקומו
human_translation: if is not to the matter beyond its time, apply it to the matter of outside its area. And the Merciful One restricted notar , “But whoever eats it shall bear his iniquity” to the exclusion of outside its area.
llm_translation: If it is not relevant for its time, attribute it to a different context, and the Merciful One limited the verse regarding what is left (Leviticus 19:8) "And those who eat it shall bear his iniquity" to exclude cases outside of its place.

hebrew_text: ואימא ואוכליו עונו ישא זהו חוץ למקומו ולמעוטי נותר מכרת
human_translation: But say “But whoever eats it shall bear his iniquity,” this is outside its area, and to exclude notar from karet ?
llm_translation: And say, "And its eaters shall bear its iniquity," this is excluding from its place, and to exclude the remainder from karet.

hebrew_text: מסתברא נותר הוה ליה לאוקמי בכרת למגמר עון עון לחוץ לזמנו דדמי ליה בז"ב
human_translation: It stands to reason notar should be interpreted as karet , to derive “iniquity” “iniquity” to beyond its time, since is similar to in zayin , beit :
llm_translation: It is logical that if there was a leftover, he should establish it as a burnt offering to complete the atonement, one atonement for the external altar and one atonement for its time, its value being in accordance with the value of a bull.

hebrew_text: אדרבה חוץ למקומו הוה ליה לאוקמי בכרת למגמר עון עון לחוץ לזמנו דדמי ליה במקד"ש
human_translation: On the contrary, outside its area should be interpreted as karet , to derive “iniquity” “iniquity” to beyond its time, since is similar to in mikdash :
llm_translation: On the contrary, outside of its proper place, he should have been liable for karet for completing the sin outside of its proper time, he is liable for it in the Temple.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבי יוחנן תני זבדי בר לוי אתיא קודש קודש כתיב הכא (ויקרא יט, ח) את קדש ה' חילל ונכרתה וכתיב התם (שמות כט, לד) ושרפת את הנותר באש וגו' מה להלן נותר אף כאן נותר
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says Zavdi bar Levi taught: It is derived “sacred” “sacred.” It is written here: he has profaned the sacred item of the Lord; and shall be cut off And it is written there: then you shall burn the remainder [ notar ] with fire; Just as there notar , so too, here notar .
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: Zavdi son of Levi taught: The term "kodesh" is written here. (Leviticus 19:8) "You shall profane the holy things of the Lord." And it is written there: (Exodus 29:34) "And you shall burn the remainder with fire, etc." Just as there, it refers to what remains, so too here it refers to what remains.

hebrew_text: ומיעט רחמנא גבי נותר ואוכליו עונו ישא למעוטי חוץ למקומו מכרת
human_translation: And the Merciful One restricted to notar , “But whoever eats it shall bear his iniquity,” to exclude outside its area from karet .
llm_translation: And the Merciful One limited regarding leftover and its eaters, its punishment is to be excluded from its place, excision.

hebrew_text: ומאי חזית דקרא אריכא בחוץ לזמנו ושלישי דפרשת קדושים תהיו חוץ למקומו איפוך אנא
human_translation: And what did you see that the long verse to beyond its time, and third in the portion “You shall be holy,” outside its area? I reverse
llm_translation: And what do you see that the verse is lengthy outside of its time, and the third reading of the portion "You shall be holy" shall be read outside of its place? On the contrary, I say.

hebrew_text: מסתברא אריכא בחוץ לזמנו דגמר עון עון מנותר דדמי ליה בז"ב
human_translation: It stands to reason the long to beyond its time, as derive “iniquity” “iniquity” from notar since is similar to in Zayin , beit .
llm_translation: It is reasonable that he is liable outside of his designated time, for he completes the sin, the sin remains, and its value is included in the principal.

hebrew_text: אדרבה אריכא בחוץ למקומו ושלישי דקדושים תהיו בחוץ לזמנו משום דדמי ליה סמכיה וקא ממעט ליה
human_translation: On the contrary, the long to outside its area, and third in “You shall be holy,” to beyond its time. due to that similar to juxtaposed And excludes
llm_translation: On the contrary, it should be longer outside its place, and the third cup of sanctification should be outside its time, because it is similar to it, and it diminishes it.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא כולהו מקרא אריכא אתיין דכתיב (ויקרא ז, יח) האכל יאכל בשתי אכילות הכתוב מדבר אחד אכילת אדם ואחד אכילת מזבח
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: all of are derived from the long verse. As it is written: “Be at all eaten [ he’akhol ye’akhel ],” the verse speaks of two consumptions, one consumption by a person, and one consumption by altar,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: All of them come to lengthen the text, as it is written (Leviticus 7:18): "The eater shall eat in the two eatings." The verse speaks of one eating of a person and one eating of the altar.

hebrew_text: מבשר זבח שלמיו מה שלמים מפגלין ומתפגלין אף כל מפגלין ומתפגלין
human_translation: “any of the flesh of his peace offerings” just as a peace offering renders piggul and is rendered piggul , so too all renders piggul and is rendered piggul .
llm_translation: From the flesh of his peace-offering, what is of peace-offerings, both disqualified and becoming disqualified, so too all that is disqualified and becomes disqualified.

hebrew_text: שלישי זה חוץ לזמנו
human_translation: third beyond its time,
llm_translation: "Third, this is outside its designated time."

hebrew_text: לא ירצה כהרצאת כשר כן הרצאת פסול ומה הרצאת כשר עד שיקריבו כל מתיריו אף הרצאת פסול עד שיקרבו כל מתיריו
human_translation: “it shall not be accepted” like the acceptance of a fit so the acceptance of a disqualified and just as the acceptance of a fit until one sacrifices all its permitting factors, so too the acceptance of a disqualified until one sacrifices all its permitting factors.
llm_translation: He will not be pleased as the pleasing of valid, so the pleasing of invalid. And what is the pleasing of valid? Until all its permissible ones are brought. Likewise, the pleasing of invalid is not valid until all its permissible ones are brought.

hebrew_text: המקריב בהקרבה הוא נפסל ואינו נפסל בשלישי אותו בזבח הכתוב מדבר ואינו מדבר בכהן
human_translation: “he who offers” is disqualified at offering, and it is not disqualified on the third “it,” the verse is speaking of offering but it is not speaking of priest,
llm_translation: The one who offers in the offering, he is disqualified and is not disqualified in the third generation. That which the Scripture speaks of that sacrifice, and does not speak of the priest.

hebrew_text: לא יחשב
human_translation: “neither shall it be credited [ yeḥashev ]”
llm_translation: Not to be considered.

hebrew_text: לא יערב בו מחשבות אחרות
human_translation: does not mix other intentions [ maḥashavot ] with

hebrew_text: יהיה מלמד שמצטרפין זה עם זה
human_translation: “It shall be,” teaches that join together with one another
llm_translation: He shall teach that they join together this with this.

hebrew_text: והנפש האוכלת ממנו אחד ולא שנים ואיזה זה חוץ לזמנו דגמר עון עון מנותר דדמי ליה בז"ב
human_translation: “And the soul that eats of it one but not two And which is this? beyond its time, as derives “iniquity” “iniquity” from notar since is similar to in Zayin , beit .
llm_translation: And the soul that eats from it, one and not two, and which is this? Except for its time, for it has completed its sin, the sin of the remaining portion, for its blood is like its flesh.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לרבא לדידך שלישי דפרשת קדושים תהיו מאי דרשת ביה ההוא מיבעי ליה למקום שיהא משולש בדם בבשר ובאימורין
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: According to your what you interpret third in the portion “You shall be holy”? That necessary to that location is in three ways, of blood, of meat, and of sacrificial portions.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Rava: According to your opinion, the third reading of the portion of "You shall be holy" - what do you expound in it? He needs it for the place where it is stated that it should be tripled in blood, flesh, and sacrificial portions.

hebrew_text: תיפוק לי מקרא קמא אם האכל יאכל מדאפקיה רחמנא בלשון שלישי
human_translation: let me derive from the first verse: if be at all eaten since the Merciful One expresses with the term “third”?
llm_translation: Let the first verse depart from me, if he eats he will eat, as the Merciful One has established in the third person language.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמריתה לשמעתא קמיה דרב מתנה א"ל אי מהתם הוה אמינא שלישי פרט פיגול כלל ונעשה כלל מוסף על הפרט ואיתרבו שאר מקומות קא משמע לן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I stated halakha before Rav Mattana, he said to me: If from there I would say: “third” a detail, “ piggul ” a generalization, and the generalization becomes an addition to the detail, and other areas are included teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said before Rav Mattana, he said to me: If so, I would have said third, excluding Pigul entirely, and it becomes a general principle, an addition to the specific, and the other places support us.

hebrew_text: ת"ר (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח שלמיו אמר רבי אליעזר כוף אזנך לשמוע במחשב לאכול מזבחו ביום השלישי הכתוב מדבר או אינו אלא באוכל מזבחו ליום שלישי אמרת אחר שהוא כשר יחזור ויפסל
human_translation: The Sages taught “And if any of the flesh of his peace offerings be at all eaten Rabbi Eliezer said: Bend your ear to hear The verse is speaking of one who intends to partake of his offering on the third day. Or only to who partakes of his offering on the third day, you say after is fit it should then be disqualified
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And if it is eaten at all on the third day, it is an abomination; it shall not be accepted" (Leviticus 7:18). Rabbi Eliezer said: "Incline your ear to hear with understanding: to eat from his peace offering on the third day, the verse speaks. Or is it only when one eats from his offering on the third day that you said, 'After it is valid, it shall be disqualified'?"

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי עקיבא הן מצינו בזב וזבה ושומרת יום כנגד יום שהן בחזקת טהרה וכיון שראו סתרו אף אתה אל תתמה על זה שאע"פ שהוכשר שיחזור ויפסל
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: Yes, we find with regard to a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ], or a woman who experiences a discharge of uterine blood after her menstrual period [ zava ], or a woman who observes day for a day that they have the presumptive status of purity But once they have seen they have negated you as well should not be surprised about this that even though it was rendered fit, it may then be disqualified
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: "We find with a male zav, a female zavah, and a woman who observes a day corresponding to a day, that they are in a state of presumed purity. And once they are seen to have hidden, you too should not be amazed by this, for even though they were deemed fit, they may revert and become disqualified."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה הרי הוא אומר המקריב בשעת הקרבה הוא נפסל ואינו נפסל בשלישי או אינו אומר המקריב אלא זה כהן המקריב כשהוא אומר אותו בזבח הוא מדבר ואינו מדבר בכהן
human_translation: said to him: But says: “He who offers is disqualified at the time of offering, and it is not disqualified on the third Or says: “He who offers this only the priest who sacrifices when it states it,” is speaking of the offering, and it is not speaking of the priest.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Behold, it says, 'The one who offers at the time of offering, he becomes disqualified, but he does not become disqualified on the third offering.' Or does it not say, 'The one who offers,' rather, 'this priest who offers,' when he says 'that sacrifice,' he is speaking, but he is not speaking about the priest."

hebrew_text: בן עזאי אומר אותו מה ת"ל לפי שנא' (דברים כג, כב) לא תאחר לשלמו יכול אף מאחר נדרו בלא ירצה ת"ל אותו אותו בלא ירצה ואין המאחר נדרו בלא ירצה
human_translation: Ben Azzai says: Why the verse state: “It”? because it is stated: you shall not delay paying it; might even is late his vow in: “It shall not be accepted” the verse states: “It,” it, is in “It shall not be accepted,” but one who is late his vow is not in “It shall not be accepted.”
llm_translation: Ben Azai says: What does the Torah teach us by stating (Deuteronomy 23:22), "Do not delay to pay it"? One might think that one can delay fulfilling his vow without consequence. Therefore, the Torah states "it" twice, without delay. And one who delays fulfilling his vow without consequence.

hebrew_text: אחרים אומרים לא יחשב במחשבה הוא נפסל ואינו נפסל בשלישי
human_translation: Aḥerim say: “neither shall it be credited [ yeḥashev ],” is disqualified by intention [ maḥashava ], and it is not disqualified on the third
llm_translation: Others say: "If one intends in thought, he is disqualified, but if he does not intend in thought, he is not disqualified on the third generation."

hebrew_text: ובן עזאי דבזבח הכתוב מדבר ואינו בכהן מנא ליה אי בעית אימא נפקא ליה מדאחרים ואיבעית אימא מדכתיב לא ירצו ולא ירצה זיבחא הוא
human_translation: And ben Azzai, from where does he that the verse is speaking of offering and not of priest? If you wish, say he derives it from of Aḥerim Or, if you wish, say From that it is written: “They shall not be accepted” and: “It shall not be accepted” is an offering,
llm_translation: Ben Azai, regarding the sacrifice that the verse speaks of, and he is not a kohen, how does he derive it? If you wish, say that he deduces it from others, and if you wish, say that he deduces it from the verse "neither shall they accept."

hebrew_text: ובן עזאי אותו בלא ירצה ואין מאחר נדרו בלא ירצה מהכא נפקא מדאחרים נפקא דתניא אחרים אומרים יכול יהא בכור שעיברה שנתו
human_translation: And ben Azzai it, in “It shall not be accepted,” but is late his vow is not in “It shall not be accepted,” derived from here? It is derived from of Aḥerim , as it is taught Aḥerim say: might a firstborn whose year passed, should be
llm_translation: Ben Azai, that one without desire, and not from another, his vow is without desire. From here it is derived that it is from others it is derived, as it is taught: Others say, "Perhaps he shall be the firstborn if his year has passed."

hebrew_text: כפסולי המוקדשין ויפסל
human_translation: like disqualified consecrated and it should be disqualified
llm_translation: Like the invalidations of consecrated items, so shall he invalidate.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (דברים יד, כג) ואכלת לפני ה' אלהיך מעשר דגנך וגו' מקיש בכור למעשר מה מעשר אינו נפסל משנה לחבירתה אף בכור אינו נפסל משנה לחבירתה
human_translation: the verse states: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, juxtaposes a firstborn to tithe just as tithe is not disqualified from year to the next so too a firstborn is not disqualified from year to the next.
llm_translation: The verse teaches (Deuteronomy 14:23), "And you shall eat before the Lord your God, in the place which He shall choose to cause His name to dwell there, the tithe of your grain, etc." It draws an analogy between the firstborn and the tithe: just as the tithe is not disqualified through substitution, so too the firstborn is not disqualified through substitution.

hebrew_text: איצטריך סלקא דעתך אמינא הני מילי בכור דלאו בר הרצאה הוא אבל קדשים דבני הרצאה נינהו אימא לא לירצו קמ"ל
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say this matter a firstborn, which is not for acceptance, but sacrificial that are for acceptance, say they shall not effect acceptance teaches us
llm_translation: It was necessary for your mind to ascend, I say these words: "Firstborns" that are not offspring of a pleasing one, they are not. But "holy things" of the offspring of a pleasing one, they are. Say not, "Let them not be pleasing." This teaches.

hebrew_text: ואכתי מהתם נפקא (דברים כג, כב) והיה בך חטא ולא בקרבנך חטא
human_translation: But still, derived from elsewhere: and it will be sin in you” but no sin in your offering,
llm_translation: And thus it is derived from there (Deuteronomy 23:22), "But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty of sin."

hebrew_text: ובן עזאי ההוא מבעי ליה והיה בך חטא ולא באשתך חטא סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ואמר רבי אלעזר ואיתימא רבי יוחנן אין אשתו של אדם מתה אא"כ מבקשין ממנו ממון ואין לו שנאמר (משלי כב, כז) אם אין לך לשלם למה יקח משכבך מתחתיך בהאי עון דבל תאחר נמי מתה קמ"ל:
human_translation: Ben Azzai requires that “and it will be sin in you” but not sin in your wife. enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Elazar said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan A man’s wife does not die unless ask him for money and he does not have as it is stated: “If you do not have with what to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?” also dies for this transgression of You shall not delay, teaches us
llm_translation: Ben Azai that one asked him and was in you sin and not in your wife sin it is impossible your mind I say since and said Rabbi Elazar and alternatively Rabbi Yochanan the wife of a man does not die unless they demand from him money and he does not have as it is stated (Proverbs 22:27) if you have nothing to pay why should he take your bed from under you in this sin also delayed also dies teaches.

hebrew_text: אחרים אומרים במחשבה הוא נפסל ואינו נפסל בשלישי ורבי אליעזר לא יחשב מאי עביד ליה
human_translation: Aḥerim say: is disqualified by intention, and it is not disqualified on the third And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with “neither shall it be credited”?
llm_translation: Others say: in thought he is disqualified, and he is not disqualified in the third generation. And Rabbi Eliezer does not consider, what does he do to him.

hebrew_text: מיבעי ליה לכדרבי ינאי דאמר רבי ינאי מנין למחשבות שמוציאות זו מזו שנאמר לא יחשב לא יערב בו מחשבות אחרות
human_translation: He requires it for which Rabbi Yannai as Rabbi Yannai says: From where with regard to intentions that they displace one another, As it is stated: “Neither shall it be credited [ yeḥashev ],” not mix other intentions [ maḥashavot ] with
llm_translation: It is required according to Rabbi Yannai, for Rabbi Yannai said: From where do we derive that thoughts can nullify one another? As it is stated: "Let him not reckon, nor shall he mix other thoughts with it."

hebrew_text: ורב מרי מתני אמר רבי ינאי מנין למחשב בקדשים שהוא לוקה ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יח) לא יחשב
human_translation: And Rav Mari teaches Rabbi Yannai says: From where that one who has intentions with regard to sacrificial is flogged The verse states: “Neither shall it be credited [ lo yeḥashev ],”
llm_translation: And Rav Mari taught: Rabbi Yannai said, "From where do we derive that one who calculates with consecrated items is liable to receive lashes? It is stated (Leviticus 7:18), 'He shall not reckon.'"

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי לרב מרי לאו שאין בו מעשה הוא וכל לאו שאין בו מעשה אין לוקין עליו אמר ליה רבי יהודה היא דאמר לאו שאין בו מעשה לוקין עליו:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Mari: it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and for any prohibition that does not involve an action one is not flogged. said to him: It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: For a prohibition that does not involve an action one is flogged.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Mari: "Is it not a negative commandment that does not involve an action, and for every negative commandment that does not involve an action, one is not liable to receive lashes?" Rabbi Yehuda said to him: "It is as he said, that for a negative commandment that does not involve an action, one is liable to receive lashes."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ זה הכלל כל השוחט והמקבל והמהלך והזורק לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר כזית חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פגול וחייבין עליו כרת ובלבד שיקריב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: This is the principle: anyone who slaughters or who collects or who conveys or who sprinkles to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns an olive-bulk outside its area, disqualified, but there is no karet for it. beyond its time, piggul and one is liable karet for it, provided that the permitting factor, is sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: Mishnah: This is the general rule: anyone who slaughters, receives, walks, or throws to eat something whose way is to be eaten, and to burn something whose way is to be burned, an olive's bulk outside its proper place is invalid, and does not incur karet, outside its designated time is disqualified, and one is liable for karet, provided that the one who permits it does so in accordance with his obligation.

hebrew_text: כיצד קרב המתיר כמצותו שחט בשתיקה קבל והלך וזרק חוץ לזמנו או ששחט חוץ לזמנו וקבל והלך וזרק בשתיקה או ששחט וקבל והלך וזרק חוץ לזמנו זהו שמקריב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: How the permitting factor sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? slaughtered in silence he collected and conveyed and sprinkled beyond its time; or slaughtered beyond its time, and he collected and conveyed and sprinkled in silence; or slaughtered and collected and conveyed and sprinkled beyond its time, that is where sacrifices the permitting factor in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: How does the one who permits the offering bring it like his obligation? He slaughtered in silence, received the blood, and went and sprinkled it outside its designated time. Or if he slaughtered outside its designated time, and received the blood, and went and sprinkled it in silence. Or if he slaughtered, and received the blood, and went and sprinkled it outside its designated time. This is how the one who permits brings it like his obligation.

hebrew_text: כיצד לא קרב המתיר כמצותו שחט חוץ למקומו קבל והלך וזרק חוץ לזמנו או ששחט חוץ לזמנו קבל והלך וזרק חוץ למקומו או ששחט וקבל והלך וזרק חוץ למקומו (ולזמנו)
human_translation: How the permitting factor not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? slaughtered outside its area, he collected and conveyed and sprinkled beyond its time; or slaughtered beyond its time, collected and conveyed and sprinkled outside its area; or slaughtered and collected and conveyed and sprinkled outside its area,
llm_translation: How did the one who permits not approach like his obligation? He slaughtered outside his place, received, and went and threw outside its time. Or if he slaughtered outside its time, received, and went and threw outside its place. Or if he slaughtered and received, and went and threw outside its place (and its time).

hebrew_text: הפסח והחטאת ששחטן שלא לשמן וקבל והלך וזרק חוץ לזמנו או ששחט חוץ לזמנו קיבל והלך וזרק שלא לשמן או ששחט וקבל והלך וזרק דמן שלא לשמן זהו שלא קרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: the Paschal offering and the sin offering that one slaughtered not for their sake, and collected and conveyed and sprinkled beyond its time; or slaughtered beyond its time, he collected and conveyed and sprinkled not for their sake; or that one slaughtered and collected and conveyed and sprinkled their blood not for their sake, that is whose permitting factor is not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: The Passover offering and the sin offering that were slaughtered not for its sake, and he received it, and went and threw it outside its designated time, or if he slaughtered it outside its designated time, he received it, and went and threw it not for its sake, or if he slaughtered it and received it, and went and threw its blood not for its sake - this is what it means that the one who permits did not bring it according to its requirements.

hebrew_text: לאכול כזית בחוץ כזית למחר כזית למחר כזית בחוץ כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: to eat an olive-bulk outside an olive-bulk the next day, an olive-bulk the next day an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk the next day, half an olive-bulk the next day half an olive-bulk outside disqualified and there is no karet for it.
llm_translation: To eat an olive's bulk outside, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, like half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, like half an olive's bulk outside - it is invalid, and does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה זה הכלל כל שמחשבת הזמן קדמה למחשבת המקום פגול וחייבין עליו כרת ואם מחשבת המקום קדמה למחשבת הזמן פסול ואין בו כרת וחכמים אומרים זה וזה פסול ואין בו כרת לאכול כחצי זית להקטיר כחצי כזית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said this is the principle: any where the intent the time preceded the intent the area, piggul and one is liable karet for it. And if the intent the area preceded the intent the time, disqualified and there is no karet for it. And the Rabbis say: this and that disqualified and there is no karet for it. to eat half an olive-bulk to burn half an olive-bulk fit because eating and burning do not join together.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah: This is the principle: whenever the thought of time precedes the thought of place, it is disqualified, and one is liable to receive karet. But if the thought of place precedes the thought of time, it is invalid, and there is no karet. And the sages say: both scenarios are invalid, and there is no karet. To eat, like half an olive's bulk, or to burn, like half a log's bulk, is valid, as eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר אילפא מחלוקת בשתי עבודות אבל בעבודה אחת דברי הכל עירוב מחשבות הוי ורבי יוחנן אמר אף בעבודה אחת מחלוקת
human_translation: Ilfa says: a disagreement with regard to two rites, but in one rite, all agree it constitutes a combination of intentions, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Even in one rite, a disagreement.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ilfa said, a dispute in two works, but in one work, everyone agrees, combining thoughts is effective. And Rabbi Yochanan said, even in one work there is a dispute.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לאילפא מדרישא בשתי עבודות סיפא נמי בשתי עבודות אלא לרבי יוחנן רישא בשתי עבודות וסיפא בעבודה אחת
human_translation: Granted, according to Ilfa, since the first clause in two rites, the latter clause to two rites as well. But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, the first clause to two rites, and the latter clause to one rite?
llm_translation: In accordance with the first part of the teaching, in two types of work; the latter part also in two types of work. However, according to Rabbi Yochanan, the first part is in two types of work, and the latter part is in one type of work.

hebrew_text: אין רישא בשתי עבודות סיפא בין בעבודה אחת בין בשתי עבודות:
human_translation: Yes, the first clause to two rites, the latter clause, to both one rite and two rites.
llm_translation: The beginning is in two services, the end is whether in one service or in two services.

hebrew_text: תנן אמר רבי יהודה זה הכלל אם מחשבת הזמן קדמה למחשבת המקום פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת בשלמא לרבי יוחנן היינו דקתני זה הכלל אלא לאילפא מאי זה הכלל קשיא:
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Yehuda says this is the principle: If the intent the time preceded the intent the area, piggul and one is liable karet for it. Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, this that teaches: This is the principle, But according to Ilfa, what This is the principle? a difficulty
llm_translation: We learned: Rabbi Yehudah said: This is the principle - if the intent of the time preceded the intent of the place, it is disqualified as "pigul," and one is liable to receive karet for it. According to Rabbi Yochanan, this is what he taught: This is the principle. However, what is the difficulty in the first part of the principle?

hebrew_text: תנן התם הרי זו תמורת עולה תמורת שלמים הרי זו תמורת עולה דברי רבי מאיר
human_translation: We learned elsewhere This is hereby the substitute of burnt offering, the substitute of peace offering, that is the substitute of burnt offering; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: We learned there: "Behold, this is the exchange for a burnt offering." "Behold, this is the exchange for peace offerings." These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוסי אם לכך נתכוון תחילה הואיל ואי אפשר להוציא שתי שמות כאחת דבריו קיימין ואם משאמר הרי זו תמורת עולה ונמלך ואמר הרי זו תמורת שלמים הרי זו עולה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: If that was his intent from the outset, since it is impossible to produce two designations simultaneously his statement is effective, But if after he said: This is hereby the substitute of burnt offering, he reconsidered and said: This is hereby the substitute of peace offering, that is the substitute of a burnt offering
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei: If for this he intended initially, since it is impossible to utter two names simultaneously, his words stand. And if he said, behold this is an exchange for a burnt offering, and he became silent, and said, behold this is an exchange for peace offerings, behold this is a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו הרי זו תמורת עולה ושלמים מהו לחצות מהו
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before This is hereby the substitute of a burnt offering and a peace offering, what is to split what is
llm_translation: The question was asked before them: "Behold, this is the exchange of burnt offerings and peace offerings, what is the ruling regarding dividing it?"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בהא ודאי מודה רבי מאיר רבא אמר עדיין היא מחלוקת
human_translation: Abaye said: In this Rabbi Meir certainly concedes Rava said: It is still a disagreement;
llm_translation: Abbaye said: In this case, for sure, Rabbi Meir concedes. Rava said: It is still a dispute.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא לאביי לדידך דאמרת בהא ודאי מודה רבי מאיר הרי שחיטה דלכי לחצות דמי ופליגי
human_translation: Rava said to Abaye: According to your as you say in this Rabbi Meir certainly concedes, slaughter which is comparable to To split, And disagree,
llm_translation: Rava said to Abaye: According to your statement in this case, surely Rabbi Meir concedes that slaughtering for the purpose of dividing is considered a valid slaughter, and they disagree.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מי סברת אינה לשחיטה אלא לבסוף ישנה לשחיטה מתחילה ועד סוף ומשנתינו דאמר סימן ראשון חוץ לזמנו סימן שני חוץ למקומו
human_translation: said to him: Do you hold slaughter is only at end, slaughter is from beginning to end, and our mishna where one says: first siman , beyond its time, second siman outside its area.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Do you think it is for slaughter only? Rather, ultimately it is for slaughter from the beginning to the end." And from our Mishnah that says, "The first sign is outside its time, the second sign is outside its place."

hebrew_text: הרי קמיצה דלכי לחצות דמי ופליגי
human_translation: But removal of a handful which is comparable to To split, and disagree
llm_translation: Behold, the "kemitza" of "lakki" is considered as half, and they dispute.

hebrew_text: התם נמי שהקטיר קומץ מנחה חוץ לזמנו קומץ לבונה חוץ למקומו
human_translation: there too, that burned the handful of meal offering beyond its time, the handful of frankincense outside its area.
llm_translation: There too, that he offered a handful of meal-offering outside its designated time, a handful of frankincense outside its designated place.

hebrew_text: הרי קומץ דמנחת חוטא דליכא לבונה בהדיה ופליגי
human_translation: But the handful from a meal offering of a sinner, which has no frankincense with it, and disagree?
llm_translation: Behold, the handful of the sin offering, for which there is no frankincense mixed with it, and they dispute.

hebrew_text: לא פליגי אמר רב אשי אם תימצי לומר פליגי פליגי בפסיעות
human_translation: they do not disagree. Rav Ashi says: if you say they disagree they disagree with regard to steps
llm_translation: They do not argue. Rav Ashi said, "If you want to say they argue, they argue about steps."

hebrew_text: רב שימי בר אשי מתני כדאביי רב הונא בר נתן מתני כדרבא
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi teach in accordance with of Abaye Rav Huna bar Natan teach in accordance with of Rava
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi teaches as Abaye; Rav Huna bar Natan teaches as Rava.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר רבי מאיר בשיטת רבי יהודה אמרה דאמר תפוס לשון ראשון
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Meir said this according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who says attend first statement.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Meir said in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, she said, "He held onto the original language."

hebrew_text: דתנן אמר רבי יהודה זה הכלל אם מחשבת הזמן קדמה את מחשבת המקום פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda said this is the principle: If the intent the time preceded the intent the area, piggul and one is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda said: This is the principle - if the intention of the time preceded the intention of the place, it is considered "pigul" and one is liable to receive the punishment of excision for it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי והא רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן כי מגעת להו רבי מאיר ורבי יוסי בהדי הדדי לא פליגי
human_translation: Abaye said to But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana Rabbi Yoḥanan says: When you consider their Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei do not disagree with one another,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: But didn't Rabbah bar bar Ḥannah say in the name of Yoḥanan: When Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yosei met each other, they did not disagree?

hebrew_text: ולא פליגי והא מיפלג פליגי א"ל פליגי במאי דפליגי ולא פליגי במאי דלא פליגי
human_translation: And they do not disagree? But don’t they disagree said to him: They disagree where they disagree, but they do not disagree where they do not disagree,
llm_translation: They do not argue. But they do argue. He said to him: They argue about what they argue, and they do not argue about what they do not argue.

hebrew_text: דאמר רבי יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן הכל מודים היכא דאמר תחול זו ואחר כך (אמר) תחול זו דברי הכל לא חיילא לא תחול זו אלא א"כ חלה זו דברי הכל חיילא
human_translation: as Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All, concede that where one says: Let this take effect and afterward let that take effect, everyone agrees does not take effect, This shall not take effect unless that applies, everyone agrees takes effect
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees where he said "this one precedes" and afterwards he said "this one precedes," everyone's words do not have validity, only if he said "this one precedes" and afterwards "this one precedes," everyone agrees.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי דאמר תמורת עולה תמורת שלמים רבי מאיר סבר מדהוה ליה למימר תמורת עולה ושלמים ואמר תמורת עולה תמורת שלמים שמע מינה מיהדר קא הדר ביה
human_translation: They disagree where one says: a substitute for a burnt offering, a substitute for a peace offering. Rabbi Meir holds: Since he should have said: A substitute for a burnt offering and a peace offering, but he said A substitute for a burnt offering, a substitute for a peace offering, learn from retracted
llm_translation: When they argued, as Rabbi Meir said, the exchange of a burnt offering for a peace offering, Rabbi Meir holds that since he can say the exchange of a burnt offering and peace offerings, and he said the exchange of a burnt offering for a peace offering, infer from it that he retracts.

hebrew_text: ור' יוסי אי אמר תמורת עולה ושלמים הוה אמינא פלגא תמורת עולה ופלגא תמורת שלמים להכי אמר תמורת עולה תמורת שלמים למימרא דכולה עולה וכולה שלמים הויא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei if he said: A substitute for a burnt offering and a peace offering, I would say half a substitute for a burnt offering and half a substitute for a peace offering. He therefore says: A substitute for a burnt offering, a substitute for a peace offering; that is to say that all of it is a burnt offering and all of it is a peace offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi: If he said "in exchange for an Olah and Shelamim," I would say half for an Olah and half for Shelamim. Therefore he said, "in exchange for an Olah, in exchange for Shelamim," to say that it is all Olah and all Shelamim.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה הוא אמר לא פליגי ואנא אמינא פליגי
human_translation: said to He, says they do not disagree, but I say they disagree,
llm_translation: He said to him, "He said they do not disagree, and I say they do disagree."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא ואיתימא רב אושעיא אפשר ידעין חברין בבלאה כזית כזית תנן או כזית וכזית תנן
human_translation: Ulla and some say Rav Oshaya said: Perhaps our colleagues, the Babylonians, know we learn an olive-bulk an olive-bulk or we learn: An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk
llm_translation: Ula said, and some say Rav Oshaya said: Is it possible that the colleagues knew the law regarding a mixture of forbidden substances the size of an olive each, but we learned the law regarding an olive and an olive separately?

hebrew_text: כזית כזית תנן אבל כזית וכזית דברי הכל עירוב מחשבות הוי או דלמא כזית וכזית תנן דלרבי יהודה פרטא הוי וכל שכן כזית כזית
human_translation: we learn: An olive-bulk, an olive-bulk, But An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, everyone agrees it constitutes a combination of intentions, Or perhaps we learn: An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, where according to Rabbi Yehuda constitutes a separate and all the more so An olive-bulk, an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: We learned: An olive's bulk, an olive's bulk - we taught. But an olive's bulk and an olive's bulk - the words of all, it is an eruv of thoughts. Is it so, or perhaps an olive's bulk and an olive's bulk we learned, for Rabbi Yehuda is a specific case, and all the more so an olive's bulk, an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דבעא מיניה לוי מרבי חישב לאכול כזית למחר בחוץ מהו א"ל זו שאילה עירוב מחשבות הוי
human_translation: Come hear dilemma which Levi raised before Rabbi one had intent to consume an olive-bulk the next day outside what is said to him: This question. constitutes a combination of intentions
llm_translation: Come and hear: Levi asked Rabbi Hisda, "If one intends to eat a kezayit tomorrow outside, what is the ruling?" He said to him, "This is a question of eruv thoughts."

hebrew_text: אמר לפניו רבי שמעון ברבי לא משנתינו היא לאכול כזית בחוץ כזית למחר כזית למחר כזית בחוץ כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת הא אידך עירוב מחשבות הוי
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi said before him: is it not our mishna? to eat an olive-bulk outside an olive-bulk the next day, an olive-bulk the next day an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk the next day, half an olive-bulk the next day half an olive-bulk outside disqualified and there is no karet for it. but another it constitutes a combination of intentions.
llm_translation: Said before Him Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi: "It is not from our Mishnah: to eat an olive's bulk outside, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk for the next day, an olive's bulk outside, half an olive's bulk outside, half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, half an olive's bulk for the next day, half an olive's bulk outside - it is invalid, and does not incur karet. The other one: the combining of thoughts is effective."

hebrew_text: א"ל הוא שאל בי דבר חכמה ואת אמרת משנתינו לדידך דאתניתך תרתי לא קשיא לך
human_translation: said to him: asked me a matter of wisdom, and you say our mishna. For you, whom I taught two not difficult,
llm_translation: He said to me a matter of wisdom, and you said from our Mishnah to you, that you have given me two, it is not difficult for you.

hebrew_text: לדידיה דלא אתניתיה אלא חדא ושמעינהו לרבנן דקא גרסי תרתי וסבר דידי דווקא ודידהו עירוב מחשבות הוי או דלמא דידהו דווקא ולדידי שיורי שייר לי ומדשייר לי לדידי הא שייר להו לדידהו נמי בהך
human_translation: For him, whom I taught only one and heard the Rabbis reciting two, thought: my exact, and their constitutes a combination of intentions Or perhaps their exact, and my omitted And my omitted this their also omitted that
llm_translation: Regarding his (the other person's) opinion that I only gave him one (item), and the Rabbis heard that he (the other person) claims two, and I think that my (item) specifically and his (item) generally constitute an Eruv of thoughts, or perhaps his (item) specifically and mine generally, let him leave it for me and I will leave it for him, for me it is left for him, and for him it is also left for me.

hebrew_text: והי אתנייה אילימא כזית וכזית אתנייה האי לאו שיורא הוא אלא כזית כזית אתנייה
human_translation: And which did teach If we say he taught him: An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, this is not an omission, Rather, he taught him: An olive-bulk, an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If you say "like an olive" and "like an olive," it was taught: This is not a remnant, rather, "like an olive" and "like an olive" it was taught.

hebrew_text: ותיבעי ליה כזית וכזית
human_translation: Let him raise the dilemma An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: And it was asked of him, "like an olive and an olive."

hebrew_text: סבר איבעי מיניה חדא דשמענא תרתי דאי בעינא כזית וכזית הא ניחא אי אמר לי כללא כ"ש כזית למחר בחוץ אלא אי אמר לי פרטא אכתי כזית למחר בחוץ קא מיבעיא לי
human_translation: thought: I will raise one dilemma before him so as to learn two As, if I ask An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, it will work out well if he says to me general all the more so An olive-bulk the next day outside, But if he says to me a separate I will still raise the dilemma An olive-bulk the next day outside.
llm_translation: He thought he needed one of the two that I heard, two. If I want an olive's bulk and an olive's bulk, it is fine. If he tells me a general principle, all the more so an olive's bulk for tomorrow outside. Rather, if he tells me a specific detail, an olive's bulk for tomorrow outside is what he is asking me.

hebrew_text: אי הכי השתא נמי התינח אי אמר ליה כזית למחר בחוץ פרטא כ"ש כזית וכזית אלא אי א"ל כללא אכתי כזית וכזית מיבעי ליה
human_translation: If so, now too, it works out well if he says to him An olive-bulk the next day outside, separate all the more so An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, But if he says to him general he will still raise the dilemma An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: If so, now also it is resolved. If he said to him, "Like an olive's bulk for tomorrow outside," it is a detail. All the more so, an olive's bulk and an olive's bulk. Rather, if he said to him, "In general," an olive's bulk and an olive's bulk are required for him.

hebrew_text: אם כן מרתח רתח
human_translation: If this become angry
llm_translation: If so, he boils a boiling.

hebrew_text: השתא כזית וכזית כללא כזית למחר בחוץ מיבעיא
human_translation: Now An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk, general is necessary An olive-bulk the next day outside?
llm_translation: At present, an olive's worth and an olive's worth, in general, an olive's worth for tomorrow outside, is required.

hebrew_text: (לישנא אחרינא כזית למחר בחוץ פרטא כזית כזית מיבעיא)
human_translation: another version An olive-bulk the next day outside, separate, is necessary An olive-bulk, an olive-bulk?
llm_translation: Another teaching: "Like an olive's size for tomorrow outside, except for an olive's size, an olive's size is needed."

hebrew_text: איתמר חצי זית חוץ לזמנו חצי זית חוץ למקומו וחצי זית חוץ לזמנו אמר רבא ויקץ כישן הפיגול ורב המנונא אמר עירוב מחשבות הוי
human_translation: It was stated: half an olive- beyond its time, half an olive- outside its area, and half an olive- beyond its time, Rava says: the piggul “Awaked as one asleep” And Rav Hamnuna says: It constitutes a combination of intentions.
llm_translation: It was stated: Half an olive's bulk outside its designated time, half an olive's bulk outside its designated place, and half an olive's bulk outside its designated time. Rava said: "The end is like the beginning; pigul is like invalid." And Rav Hamnuna said: "Eruv nullifies intentions."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתנן כביצה אוכל ראשון וכביצה אוכל שני שבללן זה בזה ראשון חלקן זה שני וזה שני הא חזר ועירבן ראשון הוי
human_translation: Rava said: From where, do I state As we learned An egg-bulk of food first- and an egg-bulk of food that one mixed together first- separated them this second- and that second- But mixed them again, be first-
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: Like an egg, one may eat the first and like an egg, one may eat the second. If one mixed them together, the first one is considered distinct and the second one is considered distinct. And this one and this one are both the second. But if he went back and mixed them, the first one is considered the first.

hebrew_text: ממאי מדקתני סיפא נפל זה בעצמו וזה בעצמו על ככר של תרומה פסלוה נפלו שניהן כאחת עשאוה שניה
human_translation: From where From that the latter clause teaches: this fell by itself and that by itself onto a loaf of teruma , it disqualifies it, they both fell simultaneously they render it second
llm_translation: From what source do we derive this? The latter clause of the Mishnah states: "If one animal fell by itself and the other animal fell by itself on a loaf of Terumah, they render it unfit." If they both fell together, they render it fit.

hebrew_text: ורב המנונא אמר התם איכא שיעורא הכא ליכא שיעורא
human_translation: And Rav Hamnuna says: There, there is measure Here, there is no measure
llm_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said there, there is a measurement, here there is no measurement.

hebrew_text: אמר רב המנונא מנא אמינא לה דתנן האוכל שנטמא באב הטומאה ושנטמא בולד הטומאה מצטרפין זה עם זה לטמא בקל שבשניהם מאי לאו אע"ג דהדר מלייה
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: From where do I say As we learned The food that became ritually impure with a primary source of ritual impurity, and that became ritually impure with a derivative source of ritual impurity, join together to impart impurity in accordance with the lenient of the two, What, is it not even if one makes up again?
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: One who eats something that became impure through the primary source of impurity, and then eats something that became impure through a secondary source of impurity, they combine with each other to render him impure with the lightest form of impurity. What, is it not because the matter returns to its original state?

hebrew_text: דלמא דלא הדר מלייה
human_translation: Perhaps where one does not complete again.
llm_translation: Perhaps he will not return to complete it.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר חצי זית חוץ למקומו וחצי זית חוץ לזמנו וחצי זית חוץ לזמנו תני בר קפרא פיגול אין חצי זית מועיל במקום כזית
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: half an olive-bulk outside its area, and half an olive-bulk beyond its time, and half an olive-bulk beyond its time, bar Kappara teaches piggul , half an olive-bulk is not effective where olive-bulk.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Half an olive's bulk outside its place, and half an olive's bulk outside its time, and half an olive's bulk outside its time, Bar Kappara taught: Pigul, half an olive's bulk is not effective in the place of an olive.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר חצי זית חוץ לזמנו וחצי זית חוץ לזמנו וחצי זית חוץ למקומו תני בר קפרא פיגול אין חצי זית מועיל במקום כזית
human_translation: When Ravin came he stated half an olive-bulk beyond its time, and half an olive-bulk beyond its time, and half an olive-bulk outside its area, bar Kappara teaches piggul , half an olive-bulk is not effective where olive-bulk.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: Half an olive's bulk outside its designated time, and half an olive's bulk outside its designated place. Bar Kappara taught: Pigul, half an olive's bulk does not have any effect in a place where a full olive's bulk is required.

hebrew_text: רב אשי מתני הכי חצי זית חוץ לזמנו וכזית חציו חוץ למקומו וחציו חוץ לזמנו תני בר קפרא פיגול אין חצי זית מועיל במקום כזית
human_translation: Rav Ashi teaches in this half an olive-bulk beyond its time, and olive-bulk half of it outside its area and half of it beyond its time, bar Kappara teaches piggul , half an olive-bulk is not effective where olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi teaches thus: Half an olive's volume outside its designated time, and like an olive's volume, half of it outside its designated place, and half of it outside its designated time. Bar Kappara taught: Pigul - half an olive's volume does not have efficacy in the place of an olive's volume.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ינאי חישב שיאכלוהו כלבים למחר פיגול דכתיב (מלכים ב ט, י) ואת איזבל יאכלו הכלבים בחלק יזרעאל
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: had intent that dogs would eat the next day, piggul , as it is written: “And the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: "He thought that dogs would eat it tomorrow, making it disqualified as 'pigul,' as it is written (2 Kings 9:10), 'And the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel.'"

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבי אמי אלא מעתה חישב שתאכלהו אש למחר דכתיב (איוב כ, כו) תאכלהו אש לא נופח ה"נ דפיגול וכי תימא הכי נמי והתנן לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר חצי כזית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין
human_translation: Rabbi Ami objects to this: If that is so, had intent that fire would consume it the next day, as it is written: “A fire not blown shall consume him” this too piggul . And if you would say indeed But didn’t we learn to eat half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit because eating and burning do not join together?
llm_translation: He (Rabbi Ami) objects to him (Rabbi Yehuda): But now, consider that she will eat it as fire tomorrow, as it is written (Job 20:26), "She will eat it as fire." Is it not the same as Pigul? And if you say, so too, didn't we learn: To eat like half an olive and to burn like half an olive is valid, as eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: אי דאפקה בלשון אכילה ה"נ הכא במאי עסקינן דאפקה בלשון הקטרה דלשון אכילה לחוד ולשון הקטרה לחוד
human_translation: If one expressed in terms of consumption, indeed here we are dealing with where he expressed it in terms of burning. since terms of consumption and terms of burning are discrete
llm_translation: If one engaged in forbidden speech with the language of eating, so too here in our case with what are we dealing? We are dealing with engaging in forbidden speech with the language of incense, treating the language of eating separately and the language of incense separately.

hebrew_text: בעי רב אשי חישב לאכול כזית בשני בני אדם מהו בתר מחשבה אזלינן דאיכא שיעורא או בתר אוכלין אזלינן וליכא שיעורא
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: one had intent that two people eat an olive-bulk, what is Do we follow intent, which there is measure Or do we follow those who eat, and neither measure?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi asked: If one intended to eat an olive's worth of food between two people, what is the law? Do we follow the thought process, where there is a measure, or do we follow the eating, where there is no measure?

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ת"ש לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear to eat half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit because eating and burning do not join together.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Come and hear: Eating like half an olive's bulk and burning like half an olive's bulk are valid, for eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: הא לאכול ולאכול דומיא דלאכול ולהקטיר והיכי דמי בשני בני אדם מצטרף ש"מ
human_translation: that to eat and to eat similar to to eat and to burn And what are the circumstances with two people, join together. Learn from it
llm_translation: This is not a direct translation, but rather a transliteration of the Hebrew and Aramaic text into the English alphabet: Ha le'echol ul'echol domeya le'echol ul'haktir vehayki d'mi b'shnei bnei adam mitztaref sha"m.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא חישב לאכול כזית ביתר מכדי אכילת פרס מהו לאכילת גבוה מדמינן ליה או לאכילת הדיוט מדמינן ליה
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: had intent to eat an olive-bulk in more than to eat a half-loaf what is Do we equate to the consumption of the Most High, Or do we equate it to the consumption of an ordinary
llm_translation: Rava asked: If one intended to eat an olive's bulk more than the amount required for eating a Persian date, what is the law regarding eating for a high status individual - do we compare it to eating for a commoner or not?

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ת"ש לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין טעמא דלאכול ולהקטיר הא לאכול ולאכול מצטרף והא הקטרה ביותר מכדי אכילת פרס הוא
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear to eat half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit because eating and burning do not join together. reason to eat and to burn But to eat and to eat join together. But burning more than to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: Abaye said: Come and hear: Eating like half an olive's bulk and burning like half an olive's bulk is valid, for eating and burning combine in taste. But for eating and eating to combine, and for burning to be more than the size of a Perutah, it is.

hebrew_text: דלמא בהיסק גדול:
human_translation: Perhaps in a large fire,
llm_translation: Perhaps in the case of a large beam:

hebrew_text: לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר: טעמא דלאכול ולהקטיר הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול מצטרף
human_translation: to eat half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit. reason that to eat and to burn But to eat and to eat an item whose manner not partake join together
llm_translation: To eat like half an olive and to burn like half an olive is valid. The reason for eating and burning is that eating and burning are not combined. Eating and eating something that is not normally eaten do combine.

hebrew_text: הא קתני רישא לאכול את שדרכו לאכול (מצטרף) את שדרכו לאכול אין שאין דרכו לא
human_translation: But the first clause teaches: to partake whose manner partakes joins together whose manner partakes does whose manner not not
llm_translation: This is what the first part teaches: to eat in its normal way, to eat (combining) in its normal way, to eat what is not its normal way.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ירמיה הא מני רבי אליעזר היא דאמר מחשבין מאכילת אדם לאכילת מזבח ומאכילת מזבח לאכילת אדם דתנן השוחט את הזבח לאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שאין דרכו להקטיר כשר ורבי אליעזר פוסל
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer, who says: One can have intent from consumption by a person to consumption by altar, or from consumption by altar to consumption by a person. As we learned one who slaughters the offering to partake of an item whose manner not or to burn an item whose manner not burn fit, and Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: This is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, for he said: We consider the intent of a person eating for the sake of the altar, and the intent of the altar eating for the sake of a person. As we learned: One who slaughters the sacrifice to eat something that is not normally eaten, or to burn something that is not normally burned, it is valid. And Rabbi Eliezer deems it invalid.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר אפי' תימא רבנן ולא תימא הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול אלא אימא הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול
human_translation: Abaye says: You even say the Rabbis. And do not say that to eat and to eat an item whose manner not partake Rather, say that to eat and to eat an item whose manner partakes
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say "Rabbanan" and not "Hava l'akhol," say not to eat and eat something that is not its way to be eaten, but rather say to eat and eat something that is its way to be eaten.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל אי דבר שדרכו לאכול קמ"ל מרישא ש"מ כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר פסול (הא כחצי זית למחר פיגול
human_translation: what teaching us? If it teaches us an item whose manner partakes learn from the first clause half an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk the next day, disqualified. that half an olive-bulk the next day, piggul .
llm_translation: What is the teaching? If something whose way is to be eaten, the teaching is from the beginning, learn from here: like half an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk the next day, it is disqualified. (Now, like half an olive's bulk the next day, it is Pigul.)

hebrew_text: אלא) אי לאכול ולהקטיר מדוקיא דרישא ש"מ לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול אין שאין דרכו לאכול לא
human_translation: But if to eat and to burn learn from the inference from the first clause to partake an item whose manner partakes does whose manner not partake not.
llm_translation: Rather, if the case is not regarding eating and burning the incense from the pile of the first fruits, learn from the first clause: regarding eating something that its way is to be eaten, but something that its way is not to be eaten, it is not permissible.

hebrew_text: השתא ומה לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול לא מצטרף לאכול ולהקטיר מיבעי
human_translation: Now, And just as to partake and to partake of an item whose manner not partake do not join together, is it necessary to consume and to burn
llm_translation: At present, and what about eating and eating something that is not its usual manner of eating, does it not combine to eat and to offer incense?

hebrew_text: לאכול ולהקטיר איצטריך ס"ד אמינא התם הוא דלאו כי אורחיה קא מחשב אבל הכא דבהאי כי אורחיה ובהאי כי אורחיה אימא ליצטרף קא משמע לן:
human_translation: was necessary to eat and to burn, enter your mind to say is there, since he has intent not its manner But here, where with regard to this in its manner, and with regard to that in its manner, say they should join together. teaches us
llm_translation: To eat and to burn incense - it was necessary. What is the meaning of this? I say there, it is not as one would think, but here, in this case, when this one and that one are both considered, it implies that they should be combined.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל הזבחים שקבלו דמן:
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding all the sacrifices that received their blood.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הפסולין ששחטו שחיטתן כשרה שהשחיטה כשרה בזרים ובנשים ובעבדים ובטמאים ואפילו בקדשי קדשים ובלבד שלא יהיו טמאים נוגעין בבשר לפיכך הן פוסלין במחשבה
human_translation: all who are unfit who slaughtered their slaughter is valid, as the slaughter is valid by non-priests, by women, by slaves, and by ritually impure And even with offerings of the most sacred order, provided that the ritually impure will not touch the flesh Therefore, disqualify with intent,
llm_translation: Mishnah: All disqualified individuals whose slaughter is valid, their slaughter is valid. For the slaughter is valid with non-priests, women, slaves, and the ritually impure, even with the most holy sacrifices, provided they are not ritually impure touching the flesh. Therefore, they disqualify with intent.

hebrew_text: וכולן שקיבלו את הדם חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו אם יש דם הנפש יחזור הכשר ויקבל
human_translation: And all of them, where they collected the blood beyond its time or outside its area, if there is blood of the soul the fit should again collect
