hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דריש לקיש בכל קודש לא תגע אזהרה לאוכל אתה אומר אזהרה לאוכל או אינו אלא לנוגע
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish. “Every consecrated item she shall not touch”; a prohibition for eats Do you say a prohibition for eats or it is only for touches
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish: "With regard to all that is holy, 'Do not touch' is a prohibition against eating. You might say that it is a prohibition against eating, or is it rather only against touching."

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר בכל קודש לא תגע ואל המקדש לא תבא מקיש קודש למקדש מה מקדש דבר שיש בו
human_translation: The verse states: “Every consecrated item she shall not touch, and to the Temple she shall not come” juxtaposes sacrificial to Temple Just as Temple a matter that involves
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: It says, "In all holiness you shall not touch, and to the sanctuary you shall not come." It draws an analogy between holiness and the sanctuary - just as the sanctuary is something that has in it...

hebrew_text: נטילת נשמה אף קודש דבר שיש בו נטילת נשמה ואי בנוגע נטילת נשמה מי איכא אלא באכילה
human_translation: the taking of a life, so too, matter sacrificial that involves the taking of a life. And if with regard to touching is there the taking of a life? Rather, with regard to eating.
llm_translation: The taking of the soul, even the holy thing that has the taking of the soul, and if in contact, is there the taking of the soul? Rather, in eating.

hebrew_text: ואכתי מיבעי ליה לטמא שאכל בשר קודש לפני זריקה דאתמר טמא שאכל בשר קודש לפני זריקה ריש לקיש אמר לוקה ורבי יוחנן אמר אינו לוקה
human_translation: But still necessary for a ritually impure who ate sacrificial meat before sprinkling As it was stated: an impure who ate sacrificial meat before sprinkling Reish Lakish says: flogged and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged.
llm_translation: And thus it is necessary to say that one becomes impure if he ate holy meat before the sprinkling, as it was stated: One becomes impure if he ate holy meat before the sprinkling. Reish Lakish said: He is liable to receive lashes, and Rabbi Yochanan said: He is not liable to receive lashes.

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר לוקה בכל קודש לא תגע לא שנא לפני זריקה ולא שנא לאחר זריקה רבי יוחנן אמר אינו לוקה כדתני ברדלא אתיא טומאתו טומאתו וכי כתב ההוא לאחר זריקה
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: flogged, “Every consecrated item she shall not touch,” is no different prior to sprinkling and is no different after sprinkling Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged, as Bardela teaches is derived “his impurity” “his impurity” And when is written, after sprinkling
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: One is liable for any sanctified item, whether before the sprinkling or after the sprinkling. Rabbi Yochanan said: One is not liable, as it was taught in the school of R. Della: His impurity remains his impurity. And did that one write "after the sprinkling"?

hebrew_text: אם כן לימא קרא בקודש מאי בכל קודש ש"מ תרתי
human_translation: If so, let the verse say: A consecrated item What “every consecrated item”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: If so, let him say a verse in the Holy Language. What does "in all holiness" mean? It teaches two things.

hebrew_text: גופא טמא שאכל בשר קודש לפני זריקה ר"ל אמר לוקה רבי יוחנן אמר אינו לוקה אמר אביי מחלוקת בטומאת הגוף אבל בטומאת בשר דברי הכל לוקה
human_translation: the itself: an impure who ate sacrificial meat before sprinkling Reish Lakish says: flogged and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged. Abaye says: dispute with regard to impurity of the body but with regard to impurity of the flesh all agree flogged.
llm_translation: The body impure that ate meat holy before sprinkling. Said Rabbi Yochanan said lashes. Rabbi Yochanan said not lashes. Said Abaye dispute in impurity of the body but in impurity of meat words of all lashes.

hebrew_text: דאמר קרא (ויקרא ז, יט) והבשר לרבות עצים ולבונה דלאו בני אכילה נינהו ואפילו הכי רבינהו קרא
human_translation: as the verse states: “and the flesh” to include wood and frankincense, which are not fit for consumption, and even so the verse included them
llm_translation: The verse says (Leviticus 7:19), "And the flesh to include wood and frankincense, which are not for consumption." And even so, the verse includes them.

hebrew_text: ורבא אמר מחלוקת בטומאת הגוף אבל בטומאת בשר דברי הכל אינו לוקה מאי טעמא כיון דלא קרינא ביה (ויקרא ז, כ) וטומאתו עליו ונכרתה לא קרינא ביה (ויקרא ז, יט) והבשר אשר יגע בכל טמא לא יאכל
human_translation: And Rava says: dispute with regard to impurity of the body, but with regard to impurity of the meat all agree he is not flogged. What is the reason? Since does not apply to having his impurity upon him, shall be cut off does not apply to it “And the flesh that touches any impure item shall not be eaten”
llm_translation: Rava said: Dispute regarding impurity of the body, but regarding impurity of flesh, the words of everyone are not liable. What is the reason? Since we do not read in it (Leviticus 7:20) "and his impurity is upon him, and he shall be cut off," we do not read in it (Leviticus 7:19) "and the flesh that touches any impure thing shall not be eaten."

hebrew_text: והאמר מר והבשר לרבות עצים ולבונה
human_translation: But doesn’t the Master say “and the flesh” to include wood and frankincense
llm_translation: And the Master said, "And the flesh includes wood and frankincense."

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שקדשו בכלי דנעשה כמי שקרבו כל מתיריו
human_translation: What are we dealing with here, where were sanctified in a vessel, that considered like which all of its permitting factors were sacrificed,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with a case where he sanctified it with a vessel, it becomes like one whose offering all its permittees have approached.

hebrew_text: דתנן כל שיש לו מתירים משקרבו מתיריו כל שאין לו מתירין משקדש בכלי
human_translation: as we learned anything that has permitting factors, from that its permitting factors were sacrificed. anything that does not have permitting factors, from it is sanctified in a vessel.
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Anyone who has relatives who are permitted to handle the dead, when his deceased is brought near, his relatives who are permitted to handle the dead permit him to approach. But anyone who does not have relatives who are permitted to handle the dead, when he becomes impure, he becomes impure with a vessel.

hebrew_text: איתמר המעלה אברי בהמה טמאה ע"ג המזבח ריש לקיש אמר לוקה רבי יוחנן אמר אינו לוקה ריש לקיש אמר לוקה טהורה אין טמאה לא ולאו הבא מכלל עשה לוקין עליו ורבי יוחנן אמר אין לוקין עליו לאו הבא מכלל עשה אין לוקין עליו
human_translation: It was stated: one who offers up the limbs of a non-kosher animal upon the altar, Reish Lakish says: flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged. Reish Lakish says flogged, a kosher yes, a non-kosher not and a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva flogged for it. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: not flogged for it, a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva not flogged for it.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who brings limbs of an impure animal onto the altar. Reish Lakish said: He is liable. Rabbi Yochanan said: He is not liable. Reish Lakish said: He is liable for a pure animal, not for an impure one. And Rabbi Yochanan said: He is not liable for either.

hebrew_text: מותיב רבי ירמיה (ויקרא יא, ג) אותה תאכלו ולא בהמה טמאה ולאו הבא מכלל עשה עשה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises an objection that may you eat” But not a non-kosher animal; and a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Challenger Rabbi Yirmiyah (Leviticus 11:3) "That you may eat, and not an unclean animal" - Is it not a positive commandment derived from a general principle?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי יעקב לרבי ירמיה בר תחליפא אסברא לך באברי בהמה טמאה דכולי עלמא לא פליגי כי פליגי בחיה והכי איתמר רבי יוחנן אמר עובר בעשה ריש לקיש אמר אינו עובר בולא כלום
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Taḥlifa: I will explain to you: With regard to limbs of a non-kosher animal everyone agrees When they disagree, with regard to undomesticated animal and it was stated like this: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He transgresses a positive mitzva. Reish Lakish says: He does not transgress anything.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said to Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Tachlifa: I will explain to you regarding the limbs of an impure animal, that everyone does not disagree about them, they only disagree about a living animal. And so it was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said, "One transgresses a positive commandment." Reish Lakish said, "He does not transgress anything at all."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר עובר בעשה בהמה אין חיה לא ריש לקיש אמר אינו עובר עליו בולא כלום ההוא למצוה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He transgresses a positive mitzva, a domesticated animal, yes, an undomesticated animal not Reish Lakish says: He does not transgress anything, that to mitzva,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who transgresses a positive commandment regarding an animal, there is no liability. Reish Lakish said: He does not transgress upon it at all. That one is for the sake of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: מותיב רבא אילו נאמר (ויקרא א, ב) קרבן לה' בהמה הייתי אומר חיה בכלל בהמה כענין שנאמר (דברים יד, ד) זאת הבהמה אשר תאכלו שור שה כשבים ושה עזים איל וצבי וגו' תלמוד לומר (ויקרא א, ב) בקר וצאן בקר וצאן אמרתי לך ולא חיה
human_translation: Rava raised an objection Had stated an offering to the Lord, animals [ behema ] I would say an undomesticated animal in the category of an animal [ behema ], like that is stated: “These are the animals [ behema ] that you may eat: The ox, the sheep, and the goat, the deer, and the gazelle, the verse states: cattle and flock” I have told you cattle and flock, but not an undomesticated animal.
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: If it had only stated (Leviticus 1:2), "An offering to the Lord, an animal," I would have said that a wild animal is included in the category of animal, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 14:4), "These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat, the deer, the gazelle, and so forth." Therefore, the Torah teaches (Leviticus 1:2), "Cattle and flock." Cattle and flock I have told you, but not a wild animal.

hebrew_text: יכול לא יביא ואם הביא כשר הא למה זה דומה לתלמיד שאמר לו רבו הבא לי חטים והביא לו חטים ושעורים שאינו כמעביר על דבריו אלא מוסיף על דבריו וכשר
human_translation: might not bring but if did bring valid, to what is this comparable? To a student whose teacher says to him: Bring me wheat, and brought him wheat and barley. it is not as disobeying the statement of rather, adding to his statement, and valid.
llm_translation: He can not bring, and if he brought, valid. But to what is this similar? To a student whom his teacher said to him, "Bring me wheat," and he brought him wheat and barley, which does not contradict his words, but adds to his words, and is valid.

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר בקר וצאן בקר וצאן אמרתי לך ולא חיה הא למה זה דומה לתלמיד שאמר לו רבו אל תביא לי אלא חיטין והביא לו חיטין ושעורים שאינו כמוסיף על דבריו אלא כמעביר על דבריו
human_translation: the verse states cattle” and: flock” I have told you cattle and flock, but not an undomesticated animal. To what is this comparable? To a student whose teacher told him: Bring me only wheat, and brought him wheat and barley. It is not as adding to the statement of rather, it is as he is disobeying his statement,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: It is written, "Cattle and sheep, cattle and sheep" - I have told you, and not a beast. What is this comparable to? To a student whom his teacher said, "Bring me only wheat," and he brought him wheat and barley, which does not add to his words but rather goes against his words.

hebrew_text: ופסול תיובתא דריש לקיש תיובתא:
human_translation: and disqualified. The refutation of Reish Lakish a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And invalid is the refutation of Reish Lakish, a refutation.

hebrew_text: וכולן שקיבלו כו': בעא מיניה ריש לקיש מרבי יוחנן פסול מהו שיעשה שירים
human_translation: And all of them, where they collected Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: unfit what is that he render a remainder
llm_translation: And all of them who accepted etc.: Reish Lakish asked from Rabbi Yochanan, is it invalid if one performs shirim.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אין עושה שירים אלא חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו הואיל ומרצה לפיגולו
human_translation: said to him: does not render a remainder unless beyond its time or outside its area, since effects acceptance, with regard to piggul ,
llm_translation: He said to him: One does not compose songs except outside of their time and outside of their place, since it pleases him due to its putridness.

hebrew_text: רב זביד מתני הכי בעא מיניה ריש לקיש מרבי יוחנן כוס פסול מהו שיעשה שירים אמר ליה פסול גופיה מאי סבירא לך אי פסול משוי שירים כוס פסול נמי משוי שירים אי פסול לא משוי שירים כוס פסול נמי לא משוי שירים
human_translation: Rav Zevid teaches this Reish Lakish asked Rabbi Yoḥanan: a cup disqualified what is rendering a remainder said to him: an unfit himself what do you hold If an unfit renders a remainder, a cup disqualified also render a remainder. If an unfit not render a remainder, a cup disqualified also not render a remainder.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid teaches thus: Reish Lakish inquired of Rabbi Yochanan, "A disqualified cup, what is the law if one makes it into a vessel for singing?" He said to him, "It is disqualified in itself." What do you think? If it is disqualified because it is made into a vessel for singing, then a disqualified cup is also disqualified if made into a vessel for singing. If it is disqualified if not made into a vessel for singing, then a disqualified cup is also disqualified if not made into a vessel for singing.

hebrew_text: רב ירמיה מדיפתי מתני הכי בעא מיניה אביי (מרבא) [מרבה] כוס מהו שיעשה את חבירו דחוי או שירים
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya of Difti teaches this Abaye asked Rabba: cup, what is render the other rejected, or a remainder,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiyah of Difti teaches thus: Abaye (Marba) asked him: What is the ruling if one makes his fellow's cup pushed aside or overturned?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה פלוגתא דרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון ורבנן דתניא למעלה הוא אומר (ויקרא ד, כה) את דמו ישפך למטה הוא אומר (ויקרא ד, ל) ואת כל דמה ישפך
human_translation: said to him: a dispute between Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and the Rabbis. As it is taught above, it states: he shall pour its blood below, it states: “And he shall pour all its blood
llm_translation: He said to him: The dispute of Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis, as it was taught: Above, it says (Leviticus 4:25), "He shall pour out its blood below," and below, it says (Leviticus 4:30), "And he shall pour out all its blood."

hebrew_text: מנין לחטאת שקיבל דמה בארבעה כוסות ונתן מתנה אחת מזה ומתנה אחת מזה שכולן נשפכין ליסוד תלמוד לומר ואת כל דמה ישפך
human_translation: From where with regard to a sin offering which collected its blood in four cups and placed one placement from this and one placement from that that all are poured onto the base The verse states: “And he shall pour all its blood.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive the law of the sin offering whose blood was received in four cups, and he gave one gift from this one and one gift from that one, that all of them are poured at the base? Scripture states, "And all of its blood shall be poured out."

hebrew_text: יכול נתן ארבע מתנות מכוס אחד יהו כולן נשפכין ליסוד תלמוד לומר ואת דמו הא כיצד הוא נשפך ליסוד והן נשפכין לאמה
human_translation: might he placed four placements from one cup, all should be poured onto the base the verse states: “And its blood,” How so? that is poured onto the base and are poured into the drain.
llm_translation: It is possible that one may give four gifts from one cup, they all will be poured into the foundation. The Talmud says, "And his blood." How is it poured into the foundation? And they are poured into the cubit.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אומר מנין לחטאת שקיבל דמה בארבעה כוסות ונתן ד' מתנות מכוס אחד שכולן נשפכין ליסוד תלמוד לומר ואת כל דמה ישפך והכתיב ואת דמו ישפך א"ר אשי ההוא למעוטי שירים שבצואר בהמה:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: From where with regard to a sin offering which collected its blood in four cups and placed four placements from one cup, that all are poured onto the base The verse states: “And he shall pour all its blood.” But isn’t it written: “And he shall pour its blood,” Rav Ashi said: That to exclude remainder that is in the throat of animal
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: From where do we derive regarding the sin offering that he received its blood in four cups and gave four gifts from one cup, all of which are poured onto the foundation? Scripture states, "And all its blood shall be poured out." But it is written, "And its blood shall be poured out." Rav Ashi said: That is to exclude the sinews on the neck of the animal.

hebrew_text: קיבל הכשר ונתן לפסול כו':
human_translation: the fit collected and gave to an unfit
llm_translation: Received the valid and gave to the invalid, etc.

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן פסול הוה אמינא מאי פסול טמא דחזי לעבודת ציבור אבל שמאל לא
human_translation: And necessary as had taught us an unfit I would say: What Unfit, an impure as is fit for communal service but left no
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear "invalid," I would say, "What is the invalidity? Impure, for it is fit for communal service, but not for the left."

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן שמאל דאית ליה הכשירא ביום הכיפורים אבל כלי חול לא
human_translation: And had taught us left that has validity on Yom Kippur, but a non-sacred vessel not
llm_translation: And if we were to hear that the left hand has validity on Yom Kippur, but not a weekday vessel.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן כלי חול משום דחזו לקדושינהו אבל הנך אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And had taught us a non-sacred vessel because are suitable to be consecrated, but these, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say that vessels of mundane use are considered holy because they are designated for their sanctity, but these others, say they are not needed.

hebrew_text: וליהוי ליה דחוי אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי הכי אמר רב ירמיה מדיפתי משמיה דרבא הא מני חנן המצרי הוא דלית ליה דחויין
human_translation: But let be rejected Ravina said to Rav Ashi: This is Rav Yirmeya of Difti says in the name of Rava: whose is this It is Ḥanan the Egyptian, who does not rejection,
llm_translation: And it should be for him a pushed aside one. Rabbina said to Rav Ashi: Thus said Rav Yirmiyah in the name of Rava: This is Meni Hanan the Egyptian, who does not have pushed aside ones.

hebrew_text: דתניא חנן המצרי אומר אפי' דם בכוס מביא חבירו ומזווג לו
human_translation: as it is taught Ḥanan the Egyptian says: even blood in the cup, he brings its counterpart, and pairs it with
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: Hanan the Egyptian says, "Even blood in a cup brings one's fellow and matches him."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר כל שבידו לא הוי דחוי
human_translation: Rav Ashi says Anything that is in his power is not rejected,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Anyone whose hand is not busy, is considered pushed away."

hebrew_text: אמר רב שייא כוותיה דרב אשי מסתברא מאן שמעת ליה דאית ליה דחויין רבי יהודה דתנן ועוד אמר רבי יהודה נשפך הדם ימות המשתלח מת המשתלח ישפך הדם
human_translation: Rav Shaya said: is reasonable in accordance with of Rav Ashi, whom have you heard who accepts rejection? Rabbi Yehuda, as we learned And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: the blood spilled the scapegoat die. the scapegoat died, the blood should be spilled,
llm_translation: Rav Shaiya said: According to the opinion of Rav Ashi, it is logical. Who did you hear it from that Rabbi Yehuda holds that one is liable for throwing blood? As we learned in a Mishnah, and furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: "If the blood spills, the one who sent it will die; if the one who sent it dies, the blood will spill."

hebrew_text: ושמעינן ליה דאמר כל שבידו לא הוי דחוי דתניא רבי יהודה אומר כוס אחד היה ממלא מדם התערובת וזורקו זריקה אחת כנגד היסוד ש"מ כל שבידו לא הוי דחוי ש"מ
human_translation: And we have heard that says: Anything that is in his power is not rejected. As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: would fill one cup with blood of the mixed and sprinkle it a single sprinkling against the base Conclude from anything that is in his power is not rejected. Conclude from it
llm_translation: And we heard from him that he said, "Anyone whose hand is not free is not considered pushed aside." As it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says, "There was one cup that was filled with the blood of the mixture, and it was poured out in one pouring opposite the foundation." Learn from this that anyone whose hand is not free is not considered pushed aside.

hebrew_text: גופא תניא רבי יהודה אומר כוס אחד היה ממלא מדם התערובת שאם ישפך אחד מהם נמצא שהוא מכשירו אמרו לו לרבי יהודה והלא לא נתקבל בכלי מנא ידעי אלא שמא לא נתקבל בכלי אמר להן
human_translation: the itself: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: would fill one cup with the mixed blood, that if one of were to spill, found that this would render valid. said to Rabbi Yehuda: But was not collected in a vessel. From where do know Rather, Perhaps it was not collected in a vessel. said to them:

They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "But was it not accepted in a vessel of a Minai?" They knew, but perhaps it was not accepted in a vessel. He said to them:

hebrew_text: אף אני לא אמרתי אלא כשנתקבל בכלי והוא גופיה מנא ידע כהנים זריזין ועבדין הייא ומשתפכין
human_translation: I too said only when it was collected in a vessel. But he, himself, from where did he know priests are vigilant, But they work swiftly, and spills

hebrew_text: והלא דם התמצית מעורב בו רבי יהודה לטעמיה דאמר דם התמצית קרי דם

llm_translation: And isn't it so that the essence of blood is mixed in it? Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning said: The essence of blood is called blood.

hebrew_text: דתניא דם התמצית באזהרה רבי יהודה אומר בכרת
human_translation: as it is taught Blood of exudate subject to a prohibition, Rabbi Yehuda says: to karet ,
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: The blood of the essence is warned against. Rabbi Yehuda says: with excision.

hebrew_text: והאמר ר' אלעזר מודה רבי יהודה לענין כפרה שאינו מכפר שנאמר (דברים יב, כג) (כי הדם הוא הנפש)
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say Rabbi Yehuda concedes with regard to atonement that does not effect atonement, as it is stated: for it is the blood of the soul”
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding atonement that does not atone, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 12:23) "For the blood is the soul."

hebrew_text: דם שהנפש יוצאה בו קרוי דם שאין הנפש יוצאה בו אין קרוי דם
human_translation: blood with which the soul leaves is called blood; with which the soul does not leave is not called blood.
llm_translation: Blood in which the soul exits from it is called blood, blood in which the soul does not exit from it is not called blood.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי יהודה לטעמיה דאמר אין דם מבטל דם
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he says: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning said: "Blood does not nullify blood."

hebrew_text: אמר להם רבי יהודה לדבריכם למה פוקקין העזרה אמרו לו שבח הוא לבני אהרן שיהלכו עד ארכובותיהן בדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to According to your statement why do they plug the courtyard said to him: It is praise for the sons of Aaron that they should walk in blood up to their ankles,
llm_translation: Said to them Rabbi Yehuda: "According to your words, why are they clearing the Temple courtyard?" They said to him: "It is praiseworthy for the sons of Aaron to walk in their garments in blood up to their ankles."

hebrew_text: והא דם הוי חציצה לח הוא ולא הוי חציצה דתנן הדם והדיו והדבש והחלב יבישין חוצצין לחין אין חוצצין
human_translation: But blood is an interposition is moist and is not an interposition, as we learned blood, ink, honey, and milk, dry they interpose, moist they do not interpose.
llm_translation: And this, that blood is considered a barrier for dough, and it is not considered a barrier, as we learned in a Mishnah: blood, ink, honey, and milk, when dried, form a barrier for dough; when wet, they do not form a barrier.

hebrew_text: והא קא מיתווסי מאנייהו ותנן היו בגדיו מטושטשין ועבד עבודתו פסולה וכי תימא דמדלו להו והתניא (ויקרא ו, ג) מדו כמדתו שלא יחסר ושלא יותיר בהולכת אברים לכבש דלאו עבודה היא
human_translation: But don’t their garments become soiled? And we learned garments were soiled and he performed rite his rite is disqualified. And if you would say that they raised but isn’t it taught his garment [ middo according to his measure [ kemiddato ], that it should not be short and that it should not be long. while carrying the limbs to the ramp which is not a rite,
llm_translation: And behold, they are being cleaned from them, and we learned: If his garments were soiled and he performed his service, it is invalid. And if you were to say that they washed them for him, but it was taught: "Measure like his measure, so that he does not lack or have excess in the dismemberment of the lamb, for it is not considered service."

hebrew_text: ולא והתניא (ויקרא א, יג) והקריב הכהן את הכל זו הולכת אברים לכבש אלא בהולכת עצים למערכה דלאו עבודה היא ולעבודה היכי אזלי אזלי אאיצטבי:
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught “And the priest shall bring it all this is the carrying of the limbs to the ramp? Rather, while carrying wood to the arrangement which is not a rite. But how did they walk to the rites They would walk on platforms
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And not as it was taught (Vayikra 1:13), 'And the Kohen shall bring the whole' - this refers to the carrying of limbs to the ramp, but not the carrying of wood to the arrangement, for that is not considered service. And how do they go for the service? They go, they go, they stand."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט את הזבח לאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שאין דרכו להקטיר כשר ורבי אליעזר פוסל
human_translation: one who slaughters an offering to eat, an item whose manner not partake or to burn, an item whose manner not burn fit, and Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters the sacrifice to eat something that is not its usual way to be eaten, or to burn something that is not its usual way to be burned, it is valid. And Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it.

hebrew_text: לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר פחות מכזית כשר לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין
human_translation: to eat, an item whose manner partake or to burn, an item whose manner burn less than an olive-bulk, fit. to eat half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit, because eating and burning do not join together.
llm_translation: To eat a thing that its way is to eat, and to burn a thing that its way is to burn, less than the size of an olive is fit to eat, like half an olive, and to burn like half an olive is fit, for eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: השוחט את הזבח לאכול כזית מן העור ומן הרוטב ומן הקיפה ומן האלל ומן העצמות ומן הגידין ומן הקרנים ומן הטלפים חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו כשר ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול ונותר וטמא
human_translation: one who slaughters an offering to eat, beyond its time or outside its area, an olive-bulk from the hide, or from the gravy, or from the spices or from a tendon in the neck, or from the bones, or from the tendons, or from the horns, or from the hooves, fit and one is not liable for it, due to piggul , nor leftover nor ritually impure.
llm_translation: The one who slaughters the sacrifice to eat an olive's bulk from the skin and from the gravy and from the liver and from the gallbladder and from the bones and from the sinews and from the horns and from the hooves, outside its time and outside its place, it is valid, and one is not liable for them regarding the issues of "pigul," "leftover," and "impure."

hebrew_text: השוחט את המוקדשין לאכול שליל או שיליא בחוץ לא פיגל המולק את התורין לאכול ביציהן בחוץ לא פיגל
human_translation: one who slaughters sacrificial to eat fetus or placenta outside he has not rendered piggul . one who pinches doves, to eat their eggs outside he has not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: The one who slaughters the consecrated animals to eat the negative or the positive outside, it is not disqualified. The one who offers the incense of the incense-offerings to eat their eggs outside, it is not disqualified.

hebrew_text: חלב מוקדשין וביצי תורין אין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול ונותר וטמא:
human_translation: the milk of sacrificial or the eggs of doves is not liable for due to piggul , nor notar , nor ritually impure.
llm_translation: Fat of offerings and eggs of doves are not liable upon them because of improper intent, remainder, and impurity.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבי אלעזר פיגל בזבח נתפגל השליל בשליל לא נתפגל הזבח פיגל באלל נתפגלה מוראה במוראה לא נתפגל אלל
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: renders an offering piggul fetus is rendered piggul of the fetus the offering has not been rendered piggul . he rendered piggul by a tendon in the neck, the crop is rendered piggul of the crop a tendon in the neck is not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said, "Pigul, if the offering became disqualified, when the negative intent was directed at the offering, but if the intent was directed at something else, the offering is not disqualified. Regarding 'Pigul' intent in a different offering, if it was directed at the same type of offering, it is disqualified, but if directed at a different type of offering, it is not disqualified."

hebrew_text: פיגל באימורין נתפגלו פרים בפרים לא נתפגלו אימורים

human_translation: But he intended, with regard to the sacrificial portions sacrificial portions themselves are rendered piggul ,
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "This: calculated in offerings, the offerings themselves were revealed."

human_translation: Come hear bulls that are burned and goats that are burned, from them misuse from that they were consecrated. they were slaughtered, they are susceptible to being rendered disqualified through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight
llm_translation: Come and hear: Bulls that were burnt offerings and goats that were burnt offerings, if they were slaughtered after they were sanctified, they are disqualified if they were slaughtered on the day of immersion, or on the day before Yom Kippur, or at night.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו לינת בשר וש"מ מגו דפסלה בלינה פסלה בה מחשבה
human_translation: What, is it not flesh left overnight, And conclude from since is rendered disqualified by left overnight, rendered disqualified intention
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "לאו לינת בשר"? And learn from it that if it was disqualified in the night, it is disqualified with regard to intention.

hebrew_text: לא לינת אימורים הא מדקתני סיפא כולן מועלין בהן על בית הדשן עד שיותך הבשר מכלל דרישא לינת בשר מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא רישא אימורים וסיפא בשר

Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is. The first clause sacrificial portions and the latter clause flesh.

By inference from the former clause, the lodging of flesh is distinct. This one, as it was stated, and this one, as it was stated. The former clause pertains to sacrificial portions, and the latter to flesh.

hebrew_text: מותיב (רבא) [רבה] ואלו שאין מפגלין ואין מתפגלין צמר שבראשי כבשים ושער שבזקן תיישים והעור והרוטב והקיפה והאלל והמוראה והעצמות והגידין והקרנים והטלפים והשליל והשיליא וחלב המוקדשין וביצי תורין
human_translation: Rabba raises an objection And these that do not render piggul , and they do not become piggul : wool that is on the head of lambs, hair that is in the beard of goats, the hide, the gravy, the spices a tendon in the neck, the crop, the bones, the tendons, the horns, the hooves, the fetus, the placenta, the milk of sacrificial and the eggs of doves.
llm_translation: Challenger (Rava) Raba and these are not disqualified and do not disqualify: wool from the heads of lambs, and hair from the beards of goats, and the skin, and the saliva, and the placenta, and the amniotic sac, and the bones, and the sinews, and the horns, and the hooves, and the spleen, and the kidneys, and the tail, and the diaphragm, and the fat of sacrifices, and the eggs of doves.

hebrew_text: [כולן] לא מפגלין ולא מתפגלין ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא והמעלה מהן בחוץ פטור
human_translation: All of these do not render piggul and they are not rendered piggul , and one is not liable for them, due to piggul , notar , nor ritually impure. And one who offers up of these outside exempt,
llm_translation: All not disqualify and not disqualified and not liable upon them because of disqualified remaining and impure and one who offers from them outside exempt.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו לא מפגלין הזבח ולא מתפגלין מחמת זבח
human_translation: What, not do not render the offering piggul and they are not rendered piggul due to offering
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "not disqualified for Pigul" and "not disqualified due to Pigul"?

hebrew_text: לא לא מפגלין את הזבח ולא מתפגלין מחמת עצמן א"ה הא דקתני סיפא כולן לא מפגלין ולא מתפגלין הא תו למה לי
human_translation: No, they do not render the offering piggul , and they are not rendered piggul due to themselves If so, that which is taught the latter clause: All of these do not render piggul and they are not rendered piggul , why do I also this?
llm_translation: Not do invalidate the sacrifice and not are invalidated due to themselves. The Gemara asks: What is the reason that the latter clause teaches: All of them do not invalidate the sacrifice and are not invalidated? The Gemara answers: Why do I need it?

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך אין חייבין עליו משום פיגול הא תו למה לי אלא איידי דבעי למיתנא נותר וטמא תנא פיגול
human_translation: And according to your reasoning One is not liable for due to piggul , why do I also this? Rather, since wants to teach notar and ritually impure, he taught piggul
llm_translation: And to taste, one is not liable on account of Pigul. Why do I need this? Rather, since it is necessary to teach "leftover and impure," the Tanna taught Pigul.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי איידי דבעי למיתני המעלה מהן בחוץ תנא נמי וכולן לא מפגלין ולא מתפגלין
human_translation: Here too, Since wants to teach one who offers up of these outside he also taught: And all of these do not render piggul and they are not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: Here also, since it is necessary to teach "the offering from them outside," a Tanna also taught, and all of them do not render the offering invalid, and they do not become disqualified.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אף אנן נמי תנינא השוחט את המוקדשים לאכול שליל או שיליא בחוץ לא פיגל והמולק את התורים לאכול ביציהם בחוץ לא פיגל
human_translation: Rava says: We learn as well: One who slaughters sacrificial to eat fetus or placenta outside has not rendered piggul . And one who pinches doves, to eat their eggs outside has not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: Rava said: We also learned: One who slaughters consecrated animals to eat the negative or the positive parts outside, it is not considered disqualified due to improper intent (pigul). And one who burns the fats of sacrifices to eat their eggs outside, it is not considered disqualified due to improper intent (pigul).

hebrew_text: והדר תני חלב המוקדשין וביצי תורים אין חייב עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא הא שליל ושיליא חייבים
human_translation: And then it is taught: the milk of sacrificial or the eggs of doves is not liable for due to piggul , notar , nor ritually impure. But fetus or placenta, liable
llm_translation: And return teaches: the fat of consecrated items and eggs of doves are not liable for the prohibition of "rejected" or "leftover" or "impure," but the negative and positive limbs are liable.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו ש"מ כאן מחמת הזבח כאן מחמת עצמן ש"מ:
human_translation: Rather, isn’t conclude from here, due to the offering, there, due to themselves, Conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, isn't it learned here regarding the matter of the sacrifice, here regarding their own matter? Is that conclusive?

hebrew_text: תנן התם ובעלי מומין ר"ע מכשיר בבעלי מומים
human_translation: We learned there and blemished Rabbi Akiva deems blemished fit,
llm_translation: We have learned there: "And those with blemishes are valid" - Rabbi Akiva deems those with blemishes valid.

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן לא הכשיר ר"ע אלא בדוקין שבעין הואיל וכשירים בעופות והוא שקדם הקדישה את מומה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Akiva deemed fit only on the cornea of the eye since they are valid in birds. And is that its consecration preceded its blemish,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Akiva only deemed it valid with the doves of the seven species, since they are valid for offerings, and this is provided that he designated its blemish beforehand.

hebrew_text: (א"ר חייא בר אבא) ומודה רבי עקיבא בעולת נקבה דכמאן דקדם מומה להקדישה דמי
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says: And Rabbi Akiva concedes with regard to a female burnt offering that it is comparable to where its blemish preceded its consecration,
llm_translation: (א"ר חייא בר אבא) Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: And Rabbi Akiva concedes regarding a female burnt offering, for since its blemish preceded its consecration, it is considered as if it were consecrated.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי זירא המעלה מהן בחוץ פטור הא מאימן חייב והיכי משכחת לה בעולת נקבה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection One who offers up of these outside exempt, But from mother of these liable. And how can you find these in a female burnt offering.
llm_translation: Challenged Rabbi Zeira: One who brings them up outside is exempt, but from where do you know that he is liable for bringing up a female burnt offering?

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא קסבר רבי עקיבא עולת נקבה אם עלתה לא תרד הא מני ר"ע היא אלא אי אמרת אם עלתה תרד הא מני
human_translation: Granted, if you say Rabbi Akiva holds a female burnt offering if it ascended it does not descend, whose is this is Rabbi Akiva. But if you say if it ascended it descend, whose is this
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, according to Rabbi Akiva, if a female burnt offering ascended, it shall not descend," this is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva. However, if you say, "If it ascended, it shall descend," this is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: אימא המעלה מהן בחוץ פטור הא מאימורי אימן חייב
human_translation: Say One who offers up of those outside exempt, but from the sacrificial portions of mother of these, liable.
llm_translation: Say: One who carries above them outside is exempt, but from the words of Imun, he is liable.

hebrew_text: והא מהן קתני ואימן דומיא דידהו אלא אימא המעלה מאימוריהן בחוץ פטור הא מאימורי אימן חייב:
human_translation: But teaches Of these, And their mother similar to them, Rather, say One who offers up of their sacrificial portions outside exempt, but of the sacrificial portions of mother of these liable.
llm_translation: And this, from them, it teaches, and a nursemaid who is similar to them, except say, one who brings up from their words outside is exempt, but from their words inside is liable.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחטו על מנת להניח את דמו או אימוריו למחר או להוציאן לחוץ רבי יהודה פוסל וחכמים מכשירין ע"מ ליתנן על גבי הכבש שלא כנגד היסוד וליתן את הניתנים למעלן למטה ואת הניתנים למטה למעלן ואת הניתנים
human_translation: one slaughters in order to leave its blood or its sacrificial portions for the next day, or to remove them outside Rabbi Yehuda deems unfit, and the Rabbis deem fit. in order to place upon the ramp that not opposite the base or to place that is placed above below or that is placed below above or that is placed
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one slaughtered an animal with the intention to place its blood or its sacrificial portions on the altar the next day, or to take them outside the Temple, Rabbi Yehuda disqualifies the offering, and the Sages deem it fit. hebrew_text: תניא רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר בית שמאי אומרים שתי מתנות שבחטאת ואחת שבכל הזבחים מתירות
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Beit Shammai say two placements in a sin offering, and one in offerings, they render permitted
llm_translation: It is taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, Beit Shammai say two gifts of the sin offering and one in all sacrifices are permitted.

hebrew_text: ומפגלות בית הלל אומרים אחת שבחטאת ואחת שבכל הזבחים מתרת ומפגלת
human_translation: And they render piggul . Beit Hillel say: One in a sin offering, and one in all offerings, permitted and, renders piggul .
llm_translation: And regarding disqualified offerings, Beit Hillel say: one of a sin-offering and one of all sacrifices are permitted and disqualified.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אושעיא אם כן ליתנייה גבי קולי בית שמאי וחומרי בית הלל
human_translation: Rav Oshaya objects to this: If so, let be taught alongside Beit Shammai’s leniencies and Beit Hillel’s stringencies.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Oshaya: If so, let him present it regarding the voice of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא כי איתשיל להתירא איתשיל דהוו להו בית שמאי לחומרא:
human_translation: Rava said to When was asked, it was asked with regard to the permission Beit Shammai who are stringent,
llm_translation: Rava said to him: When they were able to permit, they were able, for Beit Shammai, to be stringent.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן שלש מתנות שבחטאות אינן באות בלילה ובאות לאחר מיתה והמעלה מהן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: three placements in a sin offering may not be performed at night, And may be performed after death And one who offers up outside liable
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Three gifts of sin-offerings do not come at night and they come after death, and one who brings them outside is liable.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא יש מהן כתחלתו ויש מהן כסופו
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: There are some like at the outset, and there are some like at the end,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Some of them are like its beginning, and some of them are like its end.

hebrew_text: חוץ ולילה זרות וכלי שרת קרן ואצבע כיבוס ושירים כתחלתן
human_translation: outside and night, a non-priest and a service vessel, corner and finger, launder and remainder like the outset,
llm_translation: Outside and night, strangers and vessels of service, horn and finger, washing and songs as they began.

hebrew_text: מיתה לא שריא ולא מפגלא ולא עיילא לגואי כסופן
human_translation: But may be performed after death not permitted nor render piggul and not enters inside like at the end,
llm_translation: Death is not permitted, nor is it disqualified, nor does it exempt from the requirement of burial.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא מנא אמינא לה דתנן ניתז מן הצואר על הבגד אינו טעון כיבוס מן הקרן ומן היסוד אינו טעון כיבוס הא מן הראוי לקרן טעון כיבוס
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: From where do I say as we learned sprayed from the neck onto a garment, does not require laundering, from the corner or from the base does not require laundering. But fit on the corner, requires laundering,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: From where do I say this? As we learned: If blood splattered from the neck onto a garment, it does not require laundering from the horn or from the foundation. It does not require laundering from the horn and from the foundation. However, if it splattered from what is fitting for the horn, it requires laundering.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך מן היסוד אינו טעון כיבוס הא מן הראוי ליסוד טעון כיבוס (ויקרא ו, כ) אשר יזה כתיב פרט לזה שכבר הוזה
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, from the base does not require laundering; but that is fit for the base requires laundering. it is written: when there will be sprinkled [ yizze ] exclude as it has already been sprinkled.
llm_translation: And to taste from the foundation is not required immersion, but from what is fitting for the foundation is required immersion. "Which he shall sprinkle" is written, excluding this one, as it has already been specified.

hebrew_text: הא מני רבי נחמיה דתנן רבי נחמיה אומר שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: whose is this Rabbi Neḥemya, as we learned Rabbi Neḥemya says: remainder of the blood which one presented it outside liable.
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Nechemiah, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Nechemiah says, "The leftover blood that one offered outside the Temple is liable."

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לר' נחמיה לענין העלאה מידי דהוי אאיברים ופדרים לענין כיבוס מי שמעת ליה אין
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Neḥemya with regard to the offering up just as with regard to limbs and fats. did you hear him with regard to laundering, Yes,
llm_translation: Say that you heard from Rabbi Nechemiah regarding the matter of an elevation-offering made from limbs and tendons, regarding the matter of rinsing - who heard? No.

hebrew_text: והתניא דמים הטעונין יסוד טעונין כיבוס ומחשבה מועלת בהן והמעלה מהן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: And it is taught blood that requires base requires laundering; and intent is effective with regard to it, and one who offers it up outside liable.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: blood that requires foundation requires rinsing, and intention is involved with them, and one who removes them outside is liable.

hebrew_text: ודמים הנשפכין לאמה אין טעונין כיבוס ואין מחשבה מועלת בהן והמעלה מהן בחוץ פטור
human_translation: And blood that is poured into the drain does not require laundering, and intent is not effective with regard to it, and one who offers it up outside exempt.
llm_translation: And blood that spills into a cubit does not require rinsing, and no intent is involved in them, and one who carries them outside is exempt.

hebrew_text: מאן שמעת ליה דאמר מעלה מהן בחוץ חייב רבי נחמיה היא וקאמר טעון כיבוס
human_translation: whom did you learn that he said one who offers up outside is liable? It is Rabbi Neḥemya and he states requires laundering.
llm_translation: Who heard to him that said "carrying out from them outside is liable" Rabbi Nechemiah it is and he said requires pressing.

hebrew_text: ומחשבה מועלת בהן והתניא יצאו שירים והקטרת אימורין שאין מעכבין את הכפרה שאין מחשבה מועלת בהן
human_translation: And is intent effective with regard to But isn’t it taught exclude remainder and burning sacrificial portions that are not indispensable for atonement, that intent is not effective with regard to them.
llm_translation: And thought is a trespass in them. And it was taught: Songs may be recited, and the incense of the sacrificial portions may be offered, as they do not impede atonement, for thought is a trespass in them.

hebrew_text: כי תניא ההיא בשלש מתנות שבחטאת
human_translation: when that is taught, to three placements of a sin offering.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita concerning the three types of sin-offerings:

hebrew_text: אי הכי טעונין יסוד לקרן אזלי אימא ניטענין יסוד ומחשבה מועלת בהן האמרת לא שרי' ולא מפגלא ולא עיילא לגואי כסופן
human_translation: If so, requiring base goes to the corner Say required base, But is intent effective with regard to Didn’t you say not render permitted nor render piggul , and not enters inside like the end,
llm_translation: If so, they require a foundation for the horn to go. Say: "We require a foundation and intention." You have said: "It is not permitted, and it is not disqualified, and it does not ascend to the heap like them."

hebrew_text: אלא כי תניא ההיא בדמים הפנימים
human_translation: Rather, when that is taught, with regard to the blood of inner
llm_translation: Rather, as it was taught in a Baraita: that case is regarding internal blood.

hebrew_text: אבל בדמים החיצונים מאי פטור אדתני דמים הנשפכין לאמה ליפלוג וליתני בדידה במה דברים אמורים בדמים הפנימים אבל בדמים החיצונים פטור
human_translation: But with regard to the blood of external what exempt? rather than teaching blood that is poured into the drain, let distinguish and teach within the itself, In what is this statement said? In the blood of inner But in the blood of external exempt.
llm_translation: But in the case of external blood, what is the exemption? For it was taught: Blood that spills to the ground is not subject to flaying, and it should be taught separately. In what case are these words spoken? In the case of internal blood. But in the case of external blood, one is exempt.

hebrew_text: הא מני רבי נחמיה היא דאמר שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב ולא מתני ליה תלתא פטורי לבהדי תלתא חיובי
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Neḥemya, who says: remainder of the blood where one presented it outside liable. And he would not teach three exemptions corresponding to three liabilities,
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Nechemiah: The leftover blood that was offered outside the Temple is liable. And he did not teach him Rabbi Yehudah that three cases are exempt and three cases are liable.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר מן הקרן ממש מן היסוד מן הראוי ליסוד
human_translation: Ravina says, From the corner, literally, From the base From that is fit for the base
llm_translation: Ravina said: "From the horn, literally; from the foundation; from that which is fitting for a foundation."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב תחליפא בר גזא לרבינא אימא אידי ואידי ראוי הוא האי מאי השתא ראוי לקרן אמרת לא ראוי ליסוד מיבעיא אלא מן הקרן מן הקרן ממש מן היסוד מן הראוי ליסוד:
human_translation: Rav Taḥlifa bar Gazza said to Ravina: say this and that, is fit What is this Now you say fit for the corner not is necessary fit for the base Rather, From the corner, from the corner, literally, From the base, from that is fit for the base,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Tachlifa bar Giza said to Ravina, "Say, is this one fitting or not fitting?" "What is it fitting for now?" "Fitting for a horn," you said, "not fitting for a foundation." Rather, from the horn, from the horn itself, from the foundation, from what is fitting for a foundation."

hebrew_text: כל הניתנין על מזבח הפנימי כו': ת"ר (ויקרא ד, כ) ועשה כאשר עשה מה בא ללמוד
human_translation: all whose placed on the inner altar, The Sages taught “And he shall do…as he did,” what come to teach?
llm_translation: All that are placed on the inner altar etc.: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 4:20) "And he shall do as he did" - what is it coming to teach?

hebrew_text: לכפול בהזאתו ולמד שאם חיסר אחת מכל המתנות לא עשה ולא כלום אין לי אלא מתן שבע שמעכבות בכל מקום מתן ד' מניין ת"ל כן יעשה
human_translation: to repeat the sprinkling of teaching that if omitted one of the placements he has done nothing. I have only seven placements as are indispensable in all cases, From where four placements The verse states: “So shall he do”
llm_translation: To double with his offering, and learn that if he lacked one of all the gifts, he did not do anything, I only have the gift of seven that delay everywhere, the gift of four, how do I know? The verse says, "So shall he do."

hebrew_text: לפר זה פר יום הכפורים
human_translation: with the bull” this the bull of Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Regarding this bull, it is the bull of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ד, כ) כאשר עשה לפר זה פר כהן משיח החטאת אלו שעירי עבודת כוכבים יכול שאני מרבה אף שעירי הרגלים ושעירי ראשי חדשים תלמוד לומר לו
human_translation: “As he did with the bull” this bull of the anointed priest, “A sin offering”; these are goats for idol worship, might that I include also the goats of the Festivals and the goats New Moons, the verse states: with this”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Vayikra 4:20) "As he did to this bull, so shall he do to the bull of the anointed Kohen for a sin-offering." These are the goats of idol worship. One might think to include also the goats of the festivals and the goats of the new moons. The Torah teaches us to say to him:

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות את אלו ולהוציא את אלו אחר שריבה הכתוב ומיעט מרבה אני את אלו שמכפרין על עבירת מצוה ידועה ומוציא אני אלו שאין מכפרין על עבירת מצוה ידועה
human_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those After that the verse included and excluded I include these as they atone for the known transgression of a mitzva, And I exclude those as they do not atone for the known transgression of a mitzva,
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those after the Scripture has made a comparison and diminished from the greater? I include those that atone for a known transgression of a positive commandment, and I exclude those that do not atone for a known transgression of a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: וכפר אף על פי שלא סמך ונסלח אף על פי שלא נתן שירים
human_translation: “And shall make atonement”; even if did not place hands “And shall be forgiven”; even if did not place remainder
llm_translation: And Kafar, even though he did not lean, and he is forgiven even though he did not recite the songs.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לפסול בהזאות ולהכשיר בסמיכה ושירים
human_translation: And what did you see to disqualify in sprinklings; And to render fit in placing hands and remainder
llm_translation: And what did you see to disqualify with sprinkling and to validate with leaning and songs.

hebrew_text: אמרת פוסל בהזאות שמעכבות בכל מקום ומכשיר אני בסמיכה ושירים שאין מעכבות בכל מקום
human_translation: You should say disqualify in sprinklings, as are indispensable in all cases, and I render fit in placing hands and remainder as are not indispensable in all cases,
llm_translation: You said: invalid with sprinklings that are essential everywhere, and valid with leaning and songs that are not essential anywhere.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אין לי אלא מתן שבע שמעכבות בכל מקום היכא אמר רב פפא בפרה ובנגעים
human_translation: The Master said I have only seven placements as are indispensable in all cases. Where Rav Pappa says: In heifer and in marks
llm_translation: Said Mar: "I have only the gift of seven that delay everywhere." Where did Rav Papa say? In Parah and Negaim.

hebrew_text: מתן ארבע מנין ת"ל כן יעשה מ"ש מתן ז' דכתיבן וכפילן מתן ד' נמי כתיבן וכפילן
human_translation: From where four placements The verse states: “So shall he do” What is different seven placements, that are written and repeated, four placements as well are written and repeated.
llm_translation: The giving of four cattle - it is written "so shall he do." What is the meaning of "gift of seven" that is written and double them? The giving of four is also written and double them.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה לא נצרכא אלא לר"ש דתניא למעלה אומר קרן קרנות שתים למטה הוא אומר קרן קרנות ארבע דברי ר"ש
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: is necessary only according to Rabbi Shimon, As it is taught Above, states corner corners two below, it states corner corners four the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: It was only necessary for Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught in a Baraita: Above, it says "a horn, two horns," below, he says "a horn, four horns." These are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר באהל מועד על כל האמור באהל מועד ורבי יהודה כן יעשה מאי עביד ליה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: is not necessary, as it states in the Tent of Meeting” on all that are stated with regard to the Tent of Meeting, And Rabbi Yehuda, what does he do with “so shall he do,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not necessary. For he says, "In the Tent of Meeting," regarding everything that is said in the Tent of Meeting. And Rabbi Yehuda will do likewise. What can he do for him?

hebrew_text: מיבעי ליה לכדתניא לפי שלא למדנו לפר יוה"כ לסמיכה ושירי הדם מנין ת"ל כן יעשה
human_translation: requires for that which is taught As we did not learn to the bull of Yom Kippur that placing hands and remainder of blood From where The verse states: “So shall he do.”
llm_translation: It is necessary for him, as it was taught in a Baraita: "Because we have not learned for the bull of Yom Kippur for the leaning and the sprinkling of the blood, from where do we derive it? The Torah states, 'So shall he do.'"

hebrew_text: ולפר יוה"כ לא למדנו הא אמרת לפר זה יוה"כ
human_translation: And did we not learn to the bull of Yom Kippur But you said “With the bull” this Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: And for the bull of Yom Kippur we did not learn this. But you said, "For this bull is Yom Kippur."

hebrew_text: איצטריך סד"א הני מילי עבודה דמעכבא כפרה אבל עבודה דלא מעכבא כפרה אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: was necessary, enter your mind to say this matter, a service that is indispensable for atonement, But a service that is not indispensable for atonement, say not teaches us:
llm_translation: It is necessary according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai these matters of service that delay atonement, but service that does not delay atonement, say no.

hebrew_text: ור"ש האי באהל מועד מאי עביד ליה באהל מועד מבעי ליה שאם נפחתה תקרה של היכל לא היה מזה ואידך מאשר ואידך אשר לא דריש
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, what does he do with this “In the Tent of Meeting,” requires “in the Tent of Meeting” that if the roof of the Sanctuary was breached would not sprinkle And the other from “which is And the other He does not interpret “which is”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "In the Tent of Meeting, what does he do in the Tent of Meeting? He requires it, that if the ceiling of the sanctuary sags, he would not be exempt. And the other opinion is that 'asher' and the other 'asher' are not expounded."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר לר' יהודה נמי איצטריך סד"א מידי דהוה אסמיכה ושירי הדם דאע"ג דכתיבן וכפילן לא מעכבא מתן ארבע נמי לא תתעכב קמ"ל
human_translation: Abaye said: According to Rabbi Yehuda as well, was necessary enter your mind to say just as it is with regard to placing hands and remainder of the blood, that even though they are written and repeated they are not indispensable, too, four placements should not be indispensable. teaches us
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rabbi Yehudah: Also, the opinion of the School of Rabbi Akiva is necessary for something that was leaning and the leftover blood, for even though they are written and folded, it does not prevent the giving. It also teaches that four are not to be delayed.

hebrew_text: לפר זה פר יום הכפורים למאי הילכתא אי לעכב פשיטא חוקה כתיבה ביה
human_translation: “With the bull” this the bull of Yom Kippur. To what halakha If to indispensable, obvious, “statute” is written concerning it:
llm_translation: Regarding this bull, the bull of Yom Kippur, what is the halakha? If to delay, it is obvious; a statute is written about it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק לא נצרכא אלא לרבי יהודה דאמר כי כתיבה (ויקרא טז, לד) חוקה אדברים הנעשים בבגדי לבן בפנים שאם הקדים מעשה לחבירו לא עשה ולא כלום
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: is necessary only according to Rabbi Yehuda, who says: When “statute” is written with regard to actions performed in white garments inside that if performed actions before another, he has done nothing.
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: It was necessary only for Rabbi Yehuda who said, as it is written (Leviticus 16:34), "A statute of words," which are done in white garments inside, that if one preceded his action to his fellow, he has done nothing.

hebrew_text: אבל דברים הנעשים בבגדי לבן בחוץ הקדים מעשה לחבירו מה שעשה עשוי אימא מדכסידרן לא מעכבי הזאות נמי לא מעכבי קמ"ל
human_translation: But those actions performed in white garments outside, performed action before another, what he did is done say from that their order is not indispensable, sprinklings, themselves are also not indispensable. teaches us
llm_translation: But things that are done with white garments outside, one who precedes his fellow in the action, what he did is considered as if it were done. Say, from the fact that they do not impede the sprinkling, they also do not impede the sprinkling. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא ומי מצית אמרת הכי והתניא (ויקרא טז, כ) וכלה מכפר את הקודש אם כיפר כילה ואם לא כיפר לא כילה דברי ר"ע
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: And how can you say this, But isn’t it taught “And when he has finished atoning for the Sanctuary” if he performed the atonement, he has finished and if he did not perform the atonement, he has not finished; the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: "And did you really say so? But it was taught in a Baraita: 'And the atonement shall be made for the Holy Place' (Leviticus 16:20). If atonement was made, it is finished; but if atonement was not made, it is not finished." These are the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי יהודה מפני מה לא נאמר אם כילה כיפר ואם לא כילה לא כיפר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: For what do we not say: If he finished he has facilitated atonement; and if he did not finish, he has not facilitated atonement?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehuda, why was it not stated, "If it is complete, it atones, and if it is not complete, it does not atone"?

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא לא נצרכא אלא לאת דם ובטבילה את אמר רב אחא בר יעקב לא נצרכא להכשיר
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: is necessary only to Et , blood, and with immersion. et , Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov says: is necessary only to render fit
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It was only necessary for the purpose of blood ritual impurity, and in the case of immersion, Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It was not necessary to render it fit for use.

hebrew_text: אמין שבאצבע בדם שיהא בדם שיעור טבילה מעיקרא וטבל ולא מספג
human_translation: a wart on finger. “in the blood” that the blood must be of a measure for immersion from the outset. “and shall immerse and not wipe
llm_translation: Believe that with a finger in blood, that it should be in blood the size of immersion from the outset, and immerse, and not from absorption.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל מפני מה נאמרו יותרת ושתי כליות בפר כהן משיח ולא נאמרו בפר העלם דבר של צבור משל למלך בשר ודם שזעם על אוהבו ומיעט בסרחונו מפני חיבתו
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: For what are diaphragm and two kidneys stated with regard to bull of the anointed priest, and they are not stated with regard to bull for an unwitting communal sin? a parable: to a flesh-and-blood king who grew angry with his beloved but spoke little of offense due to his affection
llm_translation: Mishna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael: Why were the two kidneys and the fat tail specified in the bull of the anointed priest, and not specified in the bull of the congregation? It can be compared to a king of flesh and blood who became angry with his beloved and diminished his portion due to his love.

hebrew_text: ותנא דבי רבי ישמעאל מפני מה נאמרה (ויקרא ד, ו) פרוכת הקדש בפר כהן משיח ולא נאמר בפר העלם דבר של צבור משל למלך בשר ודם שסרחה עליו מדינה אם מיעוטה סרחה פמליא שלו מתקיימת אם רובה סרחה אין פמליא שלו מתקיימת:
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: For what is it stated: the Curtain of the Sanctuary” with regard to the bull of the anointed priest, and is not stated with regard to the bull for an unwitting communal sin, a parable: to a flesh-and-blood king against whom a province sinned. If a minority of sinned, his entourage [ pamalya ] remains, if the majority of sinned, his entourage does not remain,
llm_translation: "And a Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: For what reason is it stated (Leviticus 4:6), 'The curtain of the Sanctuary, in the bull of the anointed Kohen,' and it is not stated 'in the bull of the community'? A parable: To a king of flesh and blood to whom a rebellion arose in his kingdom, if it is a minority rebellion, his council stands; if it is a majority rebellion, his council does not stand."

hebrew_text: לפיכך אם נתן כולן כתיקנן כו': תנן התם פיגל בקומץ ולא בלבונה בלבונה ולא בקומץ רבי מאיר אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: therefore if placed all in their proper manner, we learned there render piggul , during the handful but not during the frankincense, during the frankincense but not during the handful, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one liable karet .
llm_translation: Therefore, if he placed all of them as they were arranged, etc. We learned there: Pigul with the handful, but not with the frankincense; with the frankincense, but not with the handful. Rabbi Meir says: Pigul, and one is liable for it with excision.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: There is no karet in this unless he renders piggul during the entire permitting factor,
llm_translation: And the sages say: There is no karet until he nullifies in all that permits.

hebrew_text: א"ר שמעון בן לקיש לא תימא טעמא דר' מאיר דקסבר מפגלין בחצי מתיר אלא הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שנתן את הקומץ במחשבה והלבונה בשתיקה קסבר כל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Do not say reason of Rabbi Meir, that he holds one renders piggul during half a permitting factor. Rather, what are we dealing with here? where he placed the handful with intention and the frankincense silently, holds: Anyone who performs performs with his initial intent.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Do not say the reason of Rabbi Meir, who holds that one can render a sacrifice invalid with intent halfway through. Rather, here we are dealing with what? For example, if one placed the handful with intent and the frankincense silently. He holds that whoever acts with initial intent, he is acting.

hebrew_text: ממאי מדקתני לפיכך אם נתן כולן כתיקנן ואחת שלא כתיקנה פסול ואין בו כרת הא אחת שלא כתיקנה וכולן כתיקנן פיגול
human_translation: From where from that teaches: Therefore, if he placed all in their proper manner and one in an improper manner, disqualified, but there is no karet . Consequently one in an improper manner, and all in the proper manner, piggul .
llm_translation: From what source do we learn this? Therefore, if one priest placed all the limbs as they should be on the altar, and one limb he did not place as it should be, it is invalid, and it does not incur karet. But if one limb he did not place as it should be, and all the other limbs he placed as they should be, it is considered pigul.

hebrew_text: מני אילימא רבנן הא אמרי רבנן אין מפגלין בחצי מתיר אלא רבי מאיר
human_translation: Whose If we say the Rabbis, don’t the Rabbis say one cannot render piggul in half a permitting factor? Rather, Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Who are the Rabbis? These are the Rabbis who say: One does not render a sacrifice invalid in the middle of its permissibility, except for Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: ואי טעמא דרבי מאיר משום דמפגלין בחצי מתיר הוא אפילו כדקתני נמי לאו משום דקסבר כל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה
human_translation: And if Rabbi Meir’s reason is that one renders piggul during half a permitting factor, even as it taught also factor. not because he holds anyone who performs performs with initial intent?
llm_translation: And if the reason for Rabbi Meir is because they become disqualified in the middle, it is even as it is taught, also not because he holds that anyone who acts with initial intent is acting.

human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Yitzḥak says: Actually, is the Rabbis, And what In their proper manner, in their proper manner with regard to piggul ,

hebrew_text: והא מדקתני לפיכך אם נתן כולן כתיקנן ואחת שלא כתיקנן פסול ואין בו כרת מכלל דתיקנה להכשירה הוא דאתא
human_translation: But from that it teaches: Therefore, if he placed all in their proper manner and one in an improper manner, disqualified but there is no karet , by inference that In their proper manner, comes to renders fit,
llm_translation: And here, since it was taught, therefore if one gave all of them as they were instituted, and one that was not as they were instituted, it is invalid, and it does not have karet, from the inference that the institution came to validate it, is where it came.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאי שלא כתיקנה חוץ למקומו רב אשי אמר שלא לשמו

hebrew_text: איידי דתנא רישא פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת תנא נמי סיפא פסול ואין בו כרת:
human_translation: since taught the first clause, piggul and one is liable karet for he likewise taught the latter clause, disqualified, but there is no karet for
llm_translation: Due to the fact that the Tanna taught in the beginning of the Mishnah that if one intends to eat Pigul, he is liable to receive karet, the Tanna also taught in the end of the Mishnah that if the offering becomes disqualified, it does not have karet liability.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי במה דברים אמורים בדמים הניתנין על מזבח החיצון
