human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avin says: What are we dealing with here? where render piggul during slaughter. that is one permitting factor, If so, what is the reason for the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avin said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if one made the intent to disqualify during the slaughter, it is permitted. If so, what is the reason of the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאן חכמים רבי אליעזר היא דתנן הקומץ והלבונה והקטורת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים שהקריב מאחת מהן כזית בחוץ חייב ור' אליעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את כולן
human_translation: Rava says: Who are Rabbis? is Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned the handful and the frankincense, and the incense, and the meal offering of priests, and the meal offering of anointed priest, and the meal offering libations where one sacrificed an olive-bulk from one of these, outside liable, And Rabbi Eliezer deems exempt unless he sacrifices the whole of
llm_translation: Rava said: Who are the sages? Rabbi Eliezer. This is as we learned: The handful, the frankincense, the incense, the meal-offering of the priests, the meal-offering of the anointed priest, and the meal-offering of libations, if one brought from any one of them an olive's bulk outside, he is liable, and Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he brings all of them.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבא ומודה רבי אליעזר בדמים דתנן רבי אליעזר ור' שמעון אומרים ממקום שפסק משם הוא מתחיל
human_translation: But doesn’t Rava say: And Rabbi Eliezer concedes with regard to blood As we learned Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: from the place that he interrupted there he resumes
llm_translation: And Rava said, and Rabbi Eliezer concedes with regard to blood, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say, "From the place where he stopped, he begins."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא כגון שפיגל בראשונה ושתק בשניה וחזר ופיגל בשלישית
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: where render piggul during the first and was silent during the second and again render piggul during the third
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: For example, if he invalidated it in the first instance, remained silent in the second, and then invalidated it again in the third.

hebrew_text: מה"ד אי ס"ד על דעת ראשונה הוא מיהדר פיגולי בשלישית למה לי קמ"ל מתקיף לה רב אשי מידי שתק קתני
human_translation: Lest you say if enters your mind he with initial intent, why do I again render piggul during the third teaches us Rav Ashi objects to this: Is taught silent
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "What is the reasoning? If you say it is according to the first opinion, he returns to the status of Pigul in the third. Why do I need this? The Gemara teaches us this to respond. Rav Ashi objected: Something that is silent, the Mishnah teaches."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שפיגל בראשונה ובשניה ובשלישית מהו דתימא אי ס"ד כל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה מהדר פיגולי בכל חדא וחדא למה לי קא משמע לן
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: What are we dealing with here? where render piggul during the first and during the second and during the third, Lest you say if enters your mind anyone who performs performs with initial intent, why do I again render piggul during each and every teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if one rendered it disqualified in the first, second, and third instances, what is the law? Lest you say, if you hold that anyone who acts with the intent of the first instance, he renders it disqualified in each and every instance, why do I need this to be implied to us?

hebrew_text: והא בין בין קתני קשיא
human_translation: But doesn’t teach: whether whether difficult,
llm_translation: And this, between the two, is difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר מר רבי מאיר אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת מכדי כרת לא מיחייב עד שיקרבו כל מתיריו דאמר מר כהרצאת כשר כך הרצאת פסול מה הרצאת כשר עד שיקרבו כל מתיריו אף הרצאת פסול עד שיקרבו כל מתיריו
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for its Now one is not liable karet unless all the permitting factors have been sacrificed, As the Master said: As the acceptance of a valid so the acceptance of a disqualified Just as acceptance of a valid unless all its permitting factors have been sacrificed, so too, acceptance of a disqualified unless all its permitting factors have been sacrificed.
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Meir says, "Pigul," and liable upon it excision. From where? excision not liable until they approach all its permitter. For Master said, like the approval of valid, so the approval of invalid. Just as the approval of valid until they approach all its permitter, so the approval of invalid until they approach all its permitter.

hebrew_text: והא כיון דחשיב ביה בפנים פסולה כמאן דלא אדי דמי כי הדר מדי בהיכל מיא בעלמא הוא דקא אדי
human_translation: But since he intended inside not valid, considered like one who did not sprinkle when sprinkles again in the Sanctuary, he is merely sprinkling water,
llm_translation: And the word "since" - since he considers it inside, it is disqualified, like one who does not admit, for when he returns to the sanctuary, it is as if he admits.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה משכחת לה בארבעה פרים ובד' שעירים
human_translation: Rabba says: You find it of four bulls and of four goats.
llm_translation: Rabbah said: "She is acquired with four bulls and four goats."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אפילו תימא בפר אחד ושעיר אחד לפיגולו מרצה
human_translation: Rava said: You even say one bull and one goat, effects acceptance with regard to piggul .
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you were to say "with one bull and one goat," it is considered "for its own sake."

hebrew_text: ארבעים ושלש והא תניא ארבעים ושבע הא כמאן דאמר מערבין לקרנות והא כמאן דאמר אין מערבין לקרנות
human_translation: forty-three But isn’t it taught forty-seven This is in accordance with the one who says mixes on the corners And that is in accordance with the one who says does not mix on the corners,
llm_translation: Forty and three. But isn't it taught: Forty and seven? According to whom does one say we mix for the corners, and according to whom does one say we do not mix for the corners?

hebrew_text: והא תניא ארבעים ושמונה הא כמאן דאמר שיריים מעכבין הא כמאן דאמר אין שיריים מעכבין:
human_translation: But isn’t it taught forty-eight This is in accordance with the one who says remainder is indispensable, That is in accordance with the one who says remainder is not indispensable.
llm_translation: And behold, it was taught: forty-eight. Now according to whom is this taught? According to the one who says that the recitation of songs during the offering of the incense are a hindrance. And according to whom is this taught? According to the one who says that the recitation of songs are not a hindrance.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי במה דברים אמורים בקמיצה במתן כלי ובהילוך
human_translation: raises an objection In what is this statement said, in the removal of the handful, or in the placement in vessel, or in the walking
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: In what case are these matters spoken of? In the case of taking a handful, in the case of giving a vessel, and in the case of walking.

hebrew_text: אבל בא לו להקטרה נתן את הקומץ במחשבה ואת הלבונה בשתיקה או שנתן את הקומץ בשתיקה ואת הלבונה במחשבה רבי מאיר אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכמים אומרים אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: But he came to the burning he presented the handful with intention and the frankincense silently, or he presented the handful silently and the frankincense with intention, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for it. And the Rabbis say: There is no karet unless render piggul during the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: But if he intended for the incense offering, he placed the handful with intent and the frankincense in silence, or if he placed the handful in silence and the frankincense with intent, Rabbi Meir says it is disqualified as "pigul" and one is liable to receive karet, and the Sages say there is no karet until he completes the entire process.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא את הקומץ בשתיקה ואת הלבונה במחשבה ופליג אימא כבר נתן את הלבונה במחשבה
human_translation: In any event, teaches: the handful silently and the frankincense with intention, and disagrees Say he had already presented the frankincense with intention.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One should perform the handful offering in silence, and the frankincense offering with intent. And it was disputed: Say, perhaps he already placed the frankincense with intent.

hebrew_text: חדא דהיינו רישא ועוד הא תניא ואחר כך קשיא:
human_translation: One that this is the first clause. And furthermore, isn’t it taught And afterward difficult
llm_translation: One that is the beginning and furthermore it was taught and afterwards it is difficult:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו דברים שאין חייבין עליהם משום פיגול הקומץ והקטרת והלבונה
human_translation: And these are items for which one is not liable due to piggul . The handful the incense, the frankincense,
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are the things for which one is not liable on account of Pigul: the handful, the incense, and the frankincense.

hebrew_text: ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח והדם והנסכים הבאין בפני עצמן דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים אף הבאין עם הבהמה
human_translation: the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, the blood, and the libations that are brought by themselves the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: even that are brought with an animal
llm_translation: "And the meal offering of the priests, and the meal offering of the anointed priest, and the blood, and the libations that come on their own, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say, even those that come with the animal."

hebrew_text: לוג שמן של מצורע ר' שמעון אומר אין חייבין עליו משום פיגול ורבי מאיר אומר חייבין עליו משום פיגול שדם האשם מתירו וכל שיש לו מתירין בין לאדם בין למזבח חייבין עליו משום פיגול
human_translation: the log of oil of leper, Rabbi Shimon says: One is not liable for it due to piggul , And Rabbi Meir says: One is liable for it due to piggul , as the blood of the guilt offering permits its And any that has permitting factors, either for a person or for the altar, one is liable for it due to piggul .
llm_translation: Log of oil of a leper. Rabbi Shimon says: one is not liable on it because of Pigul, and Rabbi Meir says: one is liable on it because of Pigul, for the blood of the guilt-offering permits it, and anything that permits, whether to a person or to the altar, one is liable on it because of Pigul.

hebrew_text: העולה דמה מתיר את בשרה למזבח ועורה לכהנים עולת העוף דמה מתיר את בשרה למזבח חטאת העוף דמה מתיר את בשרה לכהנים פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים דמן מתיר את אימוריהן ליקרב
human_translation: The burnt offering, its blood permits its flesh to the altar and its hide to the priests. The bird burnt offering, its blood permits its flesh to the altar. The bird sin offering, its blood permits its meat for the priests. Bulls that are burned, and goats that are burned, their blood permits their sacrificial portions to be sacrificed
llm_translation: The burnt offering, its blood permits its flesh for the altar and its skin for the priests. The burnt offering of birds, its blood permits its flesh for the altar. The sin offering of birds, its blood permits its flesh for the priests. The burnt bulls and burnt goats, their blood permits their portions to be brought near.

hebrew_text: ר' שמעון אומר כל שאינו על המזבח החיצון כשלמים אין חייבין עליו משום פיגול:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: any whose is not on the external altar like a peace offering, one is not liable for it due to piggul .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone who is not on the outer altar, like the peace offerings, is not liable for the prohibition of "pigul."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר עולא קומץ פיגול שהעלו על גבי המזבח פקע פיגולו ממנו אם אחרים מביא לידי פיגול הוא עצמו לא כל שכן מאי קאמר הכי קאמר אם אינו מתקבל היאך מביא אחרים לידי פיגול
human_translation: Ulla says: a handful piggul that was offered up on the altar, its piggul has left it. If brings other to piggul , itself not all the more so? What is saying? this he is saying: If is not accepted, how can it bring other to piggul ?
llm_translation: Gemara: Ula said, "A handful of the offering that became disqualified as 'pigul' when it was placed on the altar, its 'pigul' is annulled from it. If others bring it to the state of 'pigul,' it is certainly not annulled from itself. What is Ula saying? He is saying, if it is not accepted, how can others bring it to the state of 'pigul'?"

hebrew_text: מאי קא משמע לן אי דאין חייבין עליו משום פיגול תנינא אלו דברים שאין חייבין עליהם משום פיגול הקומץ והקטרת והלבונה ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים והדם
human_translation: What is teaching us? If that one is not liable for due to piggul , we learn These are items for which one is not liable due to piggul : The handful, the incense, the frankincense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, the meal offering libations and the blood.
llm_translation: What is implied to us? If it is that one is not liable for Pigul, we learned: These are the things for which one is not liable for Pigul - the handful, the incense, the frankincense, the meal-offering of priests, the meal-offering of the anointed priest, the meal-offering of libations, and the blood.

hebrew_text: אלא דאם עלו לא ירדו תנינא הלן והיוצא והטמא ושנשחט חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו אם עלו לא ירדו
human_translation: Rather, that if ascended they shall not descend. we learn that left or that emerges or that is ritually impure, or that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, if ascended they shall not descend.
llm_translation: Rather, if they ascended, they do not descend. We learned there: the one who went out, the one who was taken out, the impure one, and the one who was slaughtered outside its designated time and place, if they ascended, they do not descend.

hebrew_text: ואלא דאם ירדו יעלו הא נמי תנינא כשם שאם עלו לא ירדו כך אם ירדו לא יעלו לא צריכא שמשלה בהן האור
human_translation: Rather, that if descended they ascend we also learn this Just as if they ascended they shall not descend, so if they descended they shall not ascend. No, necessary where the fire has taken hold of it,
llm_translation: And rather, if they descended, they ascend. This also we learned: Just as if they ascended, they do not descend, so too if they descended, they do not ascend. It is necessary that the light be compared to them.

hebrew_text: הא נמי אמרה עולא חדא זימנא דאמר עולא לא שנו אלא שלא משלה בהן האור אבל משלה בהן האור יעלו מהו דתימא הני מילי
human_translation: this too, Ulla said it another occasion. As Ulla says: taught only where the fire has not taken hold of them, but where the fire has taken hold of them, they shall ascend. Lest you say this matter
llm_translation: This also Ulla said once: Ulla said only that they did not compare it to the light, but if they compared it to the light, what is the law? Lest you say these words...

hebrew_text: אבר דמחבר אבל קומץ דמיפרת אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: a limb which is connected but a handful, which separate say not teaches us
llm_translation: A limb of a living creature that is attached, but a detached limb of a bird, say it is not attached.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אחאי הלכך האי קומץ פיגול דפלגיה מחית אארעא ופלגיה אסקיה המערכה ומשלה בו האור מסיקנא ליה לכוליה לכתחלה:
human_translation: Rav Aḥai says: therefore, this handful of piggul , half of which lies on the ground and half of which was brought up to the arrangement and the fire took hold of it, one brings all of it up ab initio .
llm_translation: Rav Ahai said: Therefore, this handful of flour that was separated, half of it was placed on the altar and half of it was removed, the fire consumes it all initially.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי יוחנן הפיגול והנותר והטמא שהעלן לגבי מזבח פקע איסור מהן אמר רב חסדא מרי דיכי מזבח מקוה טהרה אמר רבי זירא שמשלה בהן האור
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: piggul , notar , and ritually impure where one brought them up to the altar, their prohibition has left them. Rav Ḥisda said Teacher of this altar a bath of ritual purification Rabbi Zeira says: where the fire took hold of them,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak said Rabbi Yochanan: Pigul, Notar, and Tamei that were brought upon the altar annul their prohibition. Rav Chisda said: The master of the slaughterhouse is like a mikveh for the altar. Rabbi Zeira said: The light is compared to them.

hebrew_text: מתיב ר' יצחק בר ביסנא אחרים אומרים (ויקרא ז, כ) וטומאתו עליו מי שטומאה פורחת ממנו יצא בשר שאין טומאה פורחת ממנו ואם איתא הרי טומאה פורחת ממנו על ידי האור
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Bisna raises an objection Others say: having his impurity upon him, one whose impurity can depart from him, exclude flesh as its impurity cannot depart from it, And if it is so impurity can depart from it by means of the fire
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Yitzchak bar Bisna raised an objection. Others say (Leviticus 7:20), "And his uncleanness is upon him." If his uncleanness that spreads from him has departed, then flesh that does not have uncleanness spreading from it has departed. And if it is so, behold, uncleanness spreads from him through the light.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא על ידי מקוה קאמרינן מידי מקוה כתיב אלא אמר רב פפא בבשר שלמים עסקינן דלא חזי להקרבה
human_translation: Rava says: we say by means of a ritual bath, Is ritual bath written Rather, Rav Pappa says: we are dealing with the meat of peace offerings, which are not fit for sacrificing,
llm_translation: Rava said: By means of a mikveh we are speaking. "By means of a mikveh" is written. Rather, Rav Papa said: We are dealing with the flesh of sacrifices that is not fit for offering.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר וטומאתו עליו מי שטומאה פורחת ממנו כשהוא שלם יצא בשר דבר שאין טומאה פורחת כשהוא שלם אלא כשהוא חסר:
human_translation: Ravina says “having his impurity upon him” one whose impurity departs from him when he is whole; exclude flesh, an item whose impurity does not depart from it when it is whole, but when it is deficient,
llm_translation: Ravina said, "And his impurity is upon him, one from whom impurity emanates when he is whole, flesh of a matter from which impurity does not emanate when it is whole, but only when it is lacking."

hebrew_text: גופא וטומאתו עליו בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: the itself. “Having his impurity upon him”; the verse speaks of impurity of the body
llm_translation: The body and its impurity upon him in the impurity of the body the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר בטומאת הגוף או אינו אלא בטומאת בשר נאמר כאן טומאתו ונאמר להלן טומאתו (עליו) [בו] מה להלן בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר אף כאן בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Do you say with impurity of the body? Or is it only of impurity of the flesh, here it is stated: his impurity and there it is stated: his impurity is upon him” Just as there, the verse is speaking of impurity of the body, so too here, the verse is speaking of impurity of the body.
llm_translation: You say in the impurity of the body, or is it only in the impurity of the flesh that it is stated here his impurity and it is stated there his impurity. Just as there the Scripture is speaking of impurity of the body, so too here the Scripture is speaking of impurity of the body.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי אומר הואיל ונאמרו קדשים בלשון רבים ונאמרה טומאה בלשון יחיד בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר רבי אומר ואכל בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר אחרים אמרו וטומאתו עליו מי שטומאה פורחת ממנו יצא בשר שאין טומאה פורחת ממנו
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says Since sacrificial are mentioned in the plural but impurity is mentioned in the singular: the verse is speaking of impurity of the body, Rabbi says and eat the verse is speaking of impurity of the body, Others say “having his impurity upon him” one whose impurity can depart from him, exclude flesh as impurity cannot depart from it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi says: Since the term "holy things" is stated in the plural form, and impurity is stated in the singular form regarding bodily impurity, the verse is speaking about bodily impurity. Rabbi says: "And he shall eat in his bodily impurity" - the verse is speaking about other impurities. They said: "And his impurity is upon him" - one from whom impurity emanates, flesh that does not emanate impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר מר רבי אומר ואכל בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר מאי משמע אמר רבא כל קרא דלא מפרש ליה רב יצחק בר אבודימי וכל מתניתא דלא מפרשא לה רב זעירי לא מיפרשא
human_translation: The Master said: Rabbi says “and eat” the verse is speaking of impurity of the body. From where inferred? Rava said: Any verse that was not explained by Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi, and any baraita that was not explained by Rav Ze’eiri, was not explained,
llm_translation: The Master said, Rabbi says, "And he shall eat in a state of bodily impurity." What does the verse imply? Rava said, "Any verse that Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi does not explain, and any Mishnah that Rav Zeiri does not explain, is not explained."

hebrew_text: הכי אמר ר' יצחק בר אבודימי הואיל ופתח הכתוב בלשון נקבה וסיים בלשון נקבה ולשון זכר באמצע בטומאת הגוף הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: This Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: Since the verse begins in the feminine and ends in the feminine and the masculine in the middle, the verse speaking of impurity of the body,
llm_translation: So said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avudimi: Since the Scripture began in the language of the female and concluded in the language of the female, and the language of the male in the middle, the Scripture is speaking about bodily impurity.

hebrew_text: מתניתא דתניא אם נאמרו קלות למה נאמרו חמורות ואם נאמר חמורות למה נאמר קלות אם נאמר קלות ולא חמורות הייתי אומר על הקלות בלאו ועל החמורות במיתה לכך נאמר חמורות ואם נאמר חמורות ולא נאמרו קלות הייתי אומר על החמורות יהא חייב ועל הקלות יהא פטור לכך נאמר קלות
human_translation: baraita , As it is taught If lenient are stated, why are stringent stated; and if stringent stated, why lenient stated? If lenient were stated and not stringent, I would say: For the lenient, for a prohibition, and for the stringent, to death Therefore, stringent stated. And if stringent were stated and lenient were not stated, I would say: for the stringent should one be liable but for the lenient, one should be exempt. Therefore, lenient stated.
llm_translation: Mishnah as taught: If light transgressions were spoken of, why were severe transgressions spoken of? And if severe transgressions were spoken of, why were light transgressions spoken of? If only light transgressions were spoken of and not severe transgressions, I would say regarding the light transgressions, one is liable with a negative commandment, and regarding the severe transgressions, one is liable with death penalty. Therefore, severe transgressions were spoken of. And if severe transgressions were spoken of and light transgressions were not spoken of, I would say regarding the severe transgressions, one should be liable, and regarding the light transgressions, one should be exempt. Therefore, light transgressions were spoken of.

hebrew_text: מאי קלות ומאי חמורות אילימא קלות מעשר חמורות תרומה הייתי אומר במיתה השתא נמי הא במיתה
human_translation: What lenient, and what stringent? If we say lenient tithe stringent teruma , I would have said with death Now too, this to death
llm_translation: What are the light and what are the heavy obligations? If you say that light obligations are tithes and heavy obligations are offerings, I would say it is in the case of death; now also it is in the case of death.

hebrew_text: [ותו] ואי לא נאמר הייתי אומר במיתה דיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון
human_translation: And furthermore, And if had not stated I would say of death it is sufficient for the emerges from inference to be like source.
llm_translation: And furthermore, and if it were not stated, I would say regarding death, "Enough for the heart to be consoled from the judgment to be like a verdict."

hebrew_text: אלא קלות טומאת שרץ חמורות טומאת מת
human_translation: Rather, lenient the impurity of a creeping animal, stringent the impurity a corpse,
llm_translation: Rather, light impurity of a creeping creature, severe impurity of a corpse.

hebrew_text: ובמאי אי בתרומה אידי ואידי הוא במיתה ותו לכך נאמרו חמורות דבלאו הא במיתה היא (ואי לא נאמר הייתי אומר במיתה דיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון)
human_translation: But to what If of teruma , this and that are with death And furthermore, Therefore, the stringent are stated, that for a prohibition, is to death
llm_translation: And with what? If with terumah, both he and he are liable to death. And furthermore, therefore they said, "Donkeys of Bilao, this is with death." (And if not said, "I would say with death, enough to come from the law to be like a judge.")

hebrew_text: ואי באכילת מעשר
human_translation: And if to the eating of tithe,
llm_translation: And if it is in the eating of tithe.

hebrew_text: אם לא נאמרו חמורות הייתי אומר על החמורות במיתה הא מטומאת שרץ קאתיא ודיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון
human_translation: If stringent were not stated, would I say the stringent of death Rather, derived from the impurity of a creeping animal and it is sufficient for that emerges from inference to be like source,
llm_translation: If not said donkeys I would say on the donkeys in death the here impurity of creeping thing comes and enough to come from the law to be like a judgment.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי קלות טומאת שרץ חמורות טומאת מת והכי קאמר אילו נאמר טומאת שרץ ונאמר מעשר ותרומה ולא נאמרה טומאת מת הייתי אומר [קלות] על הקלות בלאו ועל החמורות במיתה
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: lenient the impurity of a creeping animal, stringent impurity a corpse. And this is saying: If the impurity of a creeping animal was stated, and it was stated tithe and teruma and the impurity a corpse was not stated I would say lenient with regard to lenient involves a prohibition, and with regard to stringent with death
llm_translation: Za'iri said: The impurity of a creeping thing is light, the impurity of a donkey is like that of a corpse. And this is what he meant: If only the impurity of a creeping thing had been stated, and the laws of tithes and heave-offerings had been stated, but the impurity of a corpse had not been stated, I would have said that the lighter impurity is punishable with a negative commandment, and the heavier impurity is punishable with death.

hebrew_text: ומדקלות על החמורות במיתה חמורות נמי על הקלות במיתה לכך נאמרו חמורות:
human_translation: And from that lenient with regard to stringent with death also stringent with regard to lenient with death Therefore, the stringent was stated
llm_translation: And from palm trees upon donkeys, by death. Donkeys also upon palm trees, by death. Therefore it is said, donkeys.

hebrew_text: כל שיש לו מתירין בין לאדם בין למזבח חייבין עליו משום פיגול:
human_translation: any that has permitting factors, either for a person or for the altar, one is liable for it due to piggul .
llm_translation: All who have permits, whether for a person or for the altar, are liable on account of pigul.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן או אינו מביא אלא כיוצא בשלמים. מה שלמים מיוחדים נאכלין לשני ימים ולילה אחד אף כל נאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: The Sages taught Or perhaps extends only to similar to peace offerings: Just as peace offerings are notable they are eaten for two days and one night, so too, any eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Or he brings only the equivalent of peace offerings. Just as peace offerings are unique in that they may be eaten for two days and one night, so too, everything may be eaten for two days and one night."

hebrew_text: נאכל ליום ולילה מנין תלמוד לומר מבשר כל ששירין נאכלין עולה שאין שיריה נאכלין מנין תלמוד לומר זבח
human_translation: is eaten for one day, and night, from where “Of the flesh any whose remainder is eaten a burnt offering, whose remainder is not eaten, from where The verse states: “Sacrifice,”
llm_translation: We may eat for a day and a night - from where do we derive this? The Talmud teaches to say, "From the flesh of any songbirds may be eaten." But the songs themselves are not eaten - from where do we derive this? The Talmud teaches to say, "Sacrifice."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות העופות והמנחות עד שאני מרבה לוג שמן של מצורע תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כב, ב) אשר הם מקדישים לי
human_translation: From where to include bird and meal offerings, until I include log of oil of leper? The verse states which they consecrate to Me,
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include birds and meal offerings? Until I increase the measure of oil for a leper. The Talmud teaches (Leviticus 22:2), "Which they sanctify to Me."

hebrew_text: ואתי נותר חילול חילול מטומאה ואתי פיגול עון עון מנותר.
human_translation: notar derived profanation profanation ritual impurity: And piggul derived “iniquity” “iniquity” notar .
llm_translation: And comes leftover desecration desecration from impurity and comes pigul sin sin from leftover.

hebrew_text: ומאחר שסופו לרבות כל דבר למה נאמר שלמים מעתה? לומר לך מה שלמים מיוחדים שיש להן מתירין בין לאדם בין למזבח אף כל שיש לו מתירין בין לאדם בין למזבח חייבין עליהן משום פיגול.
human_translation: And since eventually includes all items, now Why does state peace offerings? to tell you Just as peace offerings are notable that they have permitting factors, either for a person or for the altar, so too, any that has permitting factors, either for a person or for the altar, one is liable for it due to piggul .
llm_translation: And since its end includes everything, why is it stated "whole" from now on? To tell you that just as the "whole" are distinct in that they have permissions both for a person and for the altar, so too, anyone who has permissions both for a person and for the altar is liable for them due to the prohibition of "pigul."

hebrew_text: העולה דמה מתיר את בשרה למזבח ועורה לכהנים עולת העוף דמה מתיר את בשרה למזבח; חטאת העוף דמה מתיר את בשרה לכהנים; פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים דמם מתיר את אימוריהן ליקרב.
human_translation: the burnt offering, its blood renders its flesh permitted to the altar and its hide by the priests. the bird burnt offering, its blood renders its flesh permitted to the altar. the bird sin offering, its blood renders its flesh permitted for the priests. bulls that are burned, and goats that are burned, their blood renders their sacrificial portions permitted to be sacrificed
llm_translation: The burnt offering, its blood permits its flesh for the altar and its skin for the priests; the burnt offering of birds, its blood permits its flesh for the altar; the sin offering of birds, its blood permits its flesh for the priests; the bulls that are burnt and the goats that are burnt, their blood permits their innards to be brought near.

hebrew_text: ומוציא אני את הקומץ ואת הלבונה והקטרת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים והדם.
human_translation: And I exclude, the handful the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, the meal offering libations and the blood.
llm_translation: And I shall take out the handful and the frankincense and the incense and the meal-offering of the priests and the meal-offering of the anointed priest and the drink-offerings and the blood.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר מה שלמים מיוחדין שיש בו על מזבח החיצון וחייבין עליו אף כל שישנן על מזבח החיצון חייבין עליו משום פיגול. יצאו פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים הואיל שאין על מזבח החיצון כשלמים אין חייבין עליו משום פיגול.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says Just as peace offerings are notable that they have on the external altar, and one is liable for them so too, any that is on the external altar, one is liable for it due to piggul . exclude bulls that are burned and goats that are burned: Since not on the external altar like peace offerings, one is not liable for them due to piggul .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: What is unique about the Shelamim offering, that if it is on the outer altar, one is liable for it, so too, any offerings that are on the outer altar, one is liable for them due to Pigul. The burnt bulls and burnt goats are exempt, since they are not like Shelamim on the outer altar, one is not liable for them due to Pigul.

hebrew_text: [אמר מר] כיוצא בשלמים מאי ניהו בכור דנאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד. במאי אתי אי במה מצינו איכא למיפרך
human_translation: The Master said: similar to peace offerings: What is this a firstborn which is eaten for two days and one night, By what is derived? If by What do we find can be refuted.
llm_translation: The Master said: "Regarding the same as peace offerings, what are they? The firstborn that is eaten for two days and one night. With what does it come? If with what we find, there is something to refute."

hebrew_text: מה לשלמים שהן טעונין סמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק
human_translation: What about peace offerings? that they require placing hands libations, and waving of the breast and thigh.
llm_translation: What for the peace-offerings that require leaning of hands and libations and waving of the breast and thigh.

hebrew_text: אלא (ויקרא ז, יח) מאם האכל יאכל
human_translation: Rather, from “And if any be at all eaten
llm_translation: Rather (Leviticus 7:18) "From the mother's milk, he shall eat."

hebrew_text: הני תרי כללי דסמיכי אהדדי נינהו אמר רבא כדאמרי במערבא כל מקום שאתה מוצא שני כללות הסמוכים זה לזה - הטל פרט ביניהם ודונם בכלל ופרט.
human_translation: These two are generalizations that are adjacent to one another, Rava said: as they say in the West, every place that you find two generalizations that are adjacent to one another, cast detail between them, and interpret them in a generalization and a detail
llm_translation: These two principles that are adjacent to each other, Rava said: As they say in the West, wherever you find two adjacent principles, exclude the space between them and judge them as a single principle, both inclusive and exclusive.

hebrew_text: עד שאני מרבה לוג שמן של מצורע: הא מני רבי מאיר היא דתניא לוג שמן של מצורע חייבין עליו משום פיגול דברי רבי מאיר אימא סיפא ומוציא אני מנחת נסכים והדם אתאן לרבנן
human_translation: Until I include the log of oil of a leper. whose is this it is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught log of oil of the leper, one is liable for it due to piggul , the statement of Rabbi Meir. Say the latter clause: And I exclude the meal offering libations and the blood, we arrive at the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Until I increase a log of oil of a leper: This is the teaching of Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: A log of oil of a leper, one is liable for it due to the prohibition of "pigul." These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Say the latter part: "And I bring forth a meal-offering and libations, and the blood comes to the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: דתניא נסכי בהמה חייבין עליהן משום פיגול מפני שדם הזבח מתירן ליקרב דברי רבי מאיר. אמרו לו והלא אדם מביא את זבחיו היום ונסכין מיכן עד עשרה ימים? אמר להן אף אני לא אמרתי אלא בבאין עם הזבח.
human_translation: As it is taught libations of an animal one is liable for them due to piggul , as the blood of the offering renders them permitted to be offered the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to him: But a person bring his offerings today and libations from now until ten days said to them: I too spoke only about come with the offering.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: The libations of an animal are liable for Pigul, because the blood of the sacrifice permits them to be brought near, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to him: But does not a person bring his sacrifices today and the libations from here until ten days? He said to them: I also only said this when they come with the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף הא מני רבי היא דאמר לוג שמן של מצורע מתנותיו שרו ליה. ומדמתנותיו שרו ליה -- מתנותיו מפגלי ליה,
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: whose is this It is Rabbi who says log of oil of a leper placements of its render permitted And from that placements of its render permitted, placements of its render it piggul ,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is the teaching of Rabbi: If a leper's log of oil was permitted to him from his gifts, and from his gifts it was permitted to him - his gifts are disqualified for him.

hebrew_text: דתניא לוג שמן של מצורע מועלין בו עד שיזרוק הדם. נזרק הדם - לא נהנין ולא מועלין.
human_translation: As it is taught log of oil of a leper, from it misusing until the blood is sprinkled. the blood has been sprinkled, one may not derive benefit But not misuse.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: A log of oil of a leper - one may benefit from it until the blood is sprinkled. Once the blood is sprinkled - one may neither benefit from it nor use it.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר מועלין עד שיתן מתנותיו. ושוין שאסור באכילה עד שיתן מתן שבע ומתן בהונות.
human_translation: Rabbi says: misusing until places its placements, And agree that consumption prohibited until places the seven placements, and placing on the thumb and big toe.
llm_translation: Rabbi says, "One is liable for trespass until he gives his gifts." And they are equal in that it is prohibited to eat until he gives the gift of the tithe and the gift of the priestly portion.

hebrew_text: אמרוה קמיה דרבי ירמיה אמר גברא רבא כרב יוסף לימא כי הא מילתא
human_translation: They said this before Rabbi Yirmeya he said: a great man such as Rav Yosef say such a matter,
llm_translation: They said before Rabbi Yirmeya, a man said: "A great man like Rabbi Yosef should say this matter."

hebrew_text: הרי לוג [הבא] בפני עצמו דלכ"ע מתנותיו שרו ליה ולא מפגלין ליה דתניא לוג שמן של מצורע חייבין עליו משום פיגול מפני שדם מתירו לבהונות דברי ר"מ
human_translation: log of oil that is brought by itself, everyone its placements render permitted to and they do not render piggul , as it is taught log of oil of a leper, one is liable for it due to piggul , as blood renders it permitted to the thumb and big toe the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Behold, a log that comes by itself, according to Rabbi Meir, his gifts are valid for him, and they do not disqualify him. For it was taught: A log of oil of a leper, one is liable for it due to pigul, because its blood permits it for the priests. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לר"מ והלא אדם מביא אשמו עכשיו ולוג מיכן ועד עשרה ימים אמר להן אף אני לא אמרתי אלא בבא עם האשם
human_translation: said to Rabbi Meir: But a person bring his guilt offering today and log from now until ten days said to them: I too spoke only about comes with the guilt offering.
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Meir: But doesn't a person bring his guilt offering now, and a log from here until ten days? He said to them: I also only said this in the case of one who comes with the guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר ירמיה לעולם ר"מ היא וסמי מיכן נסכים אמר אביי לעולם לא תסמי ותנא לוג הבא עם האשם והוא הדין לנסכים הבאין עם הזבח והדר תנא נסכים הבאין בפני עצמן והוא הדין ללוג הבא בפני עצמו:
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya says: Actually, is Rabbi Meir, and omit libations from Abaye says: Actually, do not omit taught log that comes with the guilt offering, and the same is true of libations that come with offering, And then taught libations that come by themselves, and the same is true of a log that comes by itself.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmiyah said: "Rabbanan Meir it is, and Simeon from here libations." Abaye said: "Rather, do not 'simeon' and teach 'log' that comes with the guilt-offering, and the same applies to libations that come with the sacrifice. Then teach: libations that come by themselves, and the same applies to 'log' that comes by itself."

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף דמה מתיר את בשרה לכהנים: מנא הני מילי דתני לוי
human_translation: the bird burnt offering, its blood renders its meat permitted to the priests. From where is this matter, that Levi teaches,
llm_translation: Sin-offering of the bird its blood permits its flesh to the priests: From where are these matters that Levi taught.

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, ט) כל קרבנם לרבות לוג שמן של מצורע סלקא דעתך אמינא מן האש כתב רחמנא והאי לאו מותר מן האש הוא קמ"ל:
human_translation: “Every offering of theirs,” to include log of oil of a leper; enter your mind to say the Merciful One writes “From the fire,” and this is not reserved from the fire. teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: (Numbers 18:9) "All their offerings to include the log of oil of the leper." Would you say that it is from the fire? The Merciful One wrote "not from the fire," and this teaches that it is not permitted from the fire.

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, ט) לכל מנחתם לרבות מנחת עומר ומנחת הקנאות סלקא דעתך אמינא (שמות כט, לג) ואכלו אותם אשר כפר בהם ומנחת העומר להתיר אתיא ומנחת קנאות לברר עון קאתיא קמ"ל:
human_translation: “Every meal offering of theirs,” to include omer meal offering, and the meal offering of jealousy, enter your mind to say “And they shall eat those items with which atonement is achieved” And the omer meal offering comes to permit and the meal offering of jealousy comes to clarify transgression teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "To all their offerings, to include the Omer offering and the offering of jealousy. Would you say? 'And they shall eat those with which atonement was made' (Exodus 29:33) - the Omer offering comes to permit, and the offering of jealousy comes to clarify sin."

hebrew_text: ולכל חטאתם לרבות חטאת העוף סלקא דעתך אמינא נבילה היא:
human_translation: “And every sin offering of theirs,” to include the bird sin offering; enter your mind to say it is animal carcass,
llm_translation: And for all their sin to include the sin offering of a bird, is it really your opinion? I say, is it a carcass?

hebrew_text: לכל אשמם לרבות אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע סלקא דעתך אמינא להכשיר קאתו קמ"ל
human_translation: “Every guilt offering of theirs,” to include the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper. enter your mind to say they come to qualify teaches us
llm_translation: To all their guilt to include guilt of a Nazirite and guilt of a leper. Is it your opinion to say that it comes to permit? It teaches us no.

hebrew_text: אשם מצורע בהדיא כתיב ביה אלא לרבות אשם נזיר כאשם מצורע:
human_translation: It is explicitly written with regard to the guilt offering of a leper Rather, to include the guilt offering of a nazirite, like the guilt offering of a leper,
llm_translation: Guilt-offering leper specifically written in it, rather to include guilt-offering Nazirite like guilt-offering leper.

hebrew_text: אשר ישיבו זה גזל הגר לך הוא שלך יהיה אפילו לקדש בו את האשה
human_translation: “which they shall render this is stolen a convert. “for you” it shall be yours, even to betroth a woman with it,
llm_translation: "That which he shall return, this is the theft of the proselyte for you it shall be, even to sanctify with it the woman."

hebrew_text: תניא ר' אלעזר אומר משום רבי יוסי הגלילי פיגל בדבר הנעשה בחוץ פיגל בדבר הנעשה בפנים לא פיגל
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: render piggul with regard to a matter that is performed outside he has rendered piggul . with regard to a matter that is performed inside he has not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, "Pigul applies to something done outside, but does not apply to something done inside."

hebrew_text: כיצד היה עומד בחוץ ואמר הריני שוחט להזות מדמו למחר לא פיגל שמחשבה בחוץ בדבר הנעשה בפנים לא פיגל היה עומד בפנים ואמר הריני מזה על מנת להקטיר אימורים ולשפוך שירים למחר לא פיגל שמחשבה בפנים בדבר הנעשה בחוץ
human_translation: How so? he was standing outside and said: I hereby slaughter sprinkling its blood tomorrow he has not rendered piggul . that an intention outside with regard to a matter that is performed inside, one has not rendered piggul . was standing inside and said: I hereby sprinkle in order to burn sacrificial portions and to pour out remainder tomorrow, he has not rendered piggul , as an intention inside with regard to a matter that is performed outside.
llm_translation: How was he standing outside and said, "Behold, I will slaughter to sprinkle its blood tomorrow"? It is not disqualified due to improper intent outside for something that is done inside. It is not disqualified due to improper intent if he was standing inside and said, "Behold, I will offer incense and pour libations tomorrow," for improper intent inside for something that is done outside.

hebrew_text: אבל היה עומד בחוץ ואמר הריני שוחט לשפוך שירים למחר או להקטיר אימורים למחר פיגל שמחשבה בחוץ בדבר הנעשה בחוץ
human_translation: But he was standing outside, and said: I hereby slaughter pouring out remainder tomorrow, or to burn sacrificial portions tomorrow, he has rendered piggul , as an intention outside with regard to a matter that is performed outside.
llm_translation: But he was standing outside and said, "Behold, I will slaughter to pour libations tomorrow, or to offer up sacrifices tomorrow." It is disqualified due to the intention being outside for something that is done outside.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהושע בן לוי מאי קרא (ויקרא ד, י) כאשר יורם משור זבח השלמים וכי מה למדנו משור זבח השלמים מעתה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: What is the verse “As it is taken off from the bull of the peace offering” But what, then, do we learn from the bull of a peace offering?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: What is the verse (Leviticus 4:10) "as it is lifted from the ox of the peace offering" teaching us? And what have we learned from the ox of the peace offering?

hebrew_text: אלא מקיש פר כהן משיח לשור זבח השלמים מה שור זבח השלמים עד שיהו מעשיו ומחשבותיו על מזבח החיצון אף פר כהן משיח עד שיהו מחשבותיו ומעשיו על המזבח החיצון
human_translation: Rather, juxtaposes the bull of anointed priest with the bull of the peace offering: Just as the bull of the peace offering unless actions and intentions on the external altar, so too, the bull of anointed priest unless intentions and actions on the external altar.
llm_translation: Rather, it compares a bull of the anointed priest to a sacrificial ox of peace-offerings. Just as the sacrificial ox of peace-offerings is valid only when its actions and intentions are directed towards the outer altar, so too the bull of the anointed priest is valid only when his intentions and actions are directed towards the outer altar.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ קדשי עובדי כוכבים אין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא והשוחטן בחוץ פטור דברי רבי שמעון רבי יוסי מחייב:

llm_translation: Mishnah: The consecrated offerings of idolaters, one is not liable for them due to the prohibition of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei, and if one slaughters them outside the Temple, he is exempt. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon; Rabbi Yosei obligates one for these actions.

llm_translation: Rav Huna said to Rav Papa, son of Rav Nathan: "Rather now (Leviticus 22:2) 'those who sanctify' - they and not idolaters."

hebrew_text: אימא לאחר כפרה כלפני כפרה מה לפני כפרה יש בו מעילה אף לאחר כפרה יש בו מעילה אין לך דבר שנעשית מצותו ומועלין בו
human_translation: say after atonement as before atonement. Just as before atonement is subject to misuse so too after atonement it is subject to misuse There is no item whose mitzva has been performed that is subject to misusing
llm_translation: Say we should not bring after atonement, just as before atonement. What is before atonement? It has forgiveness. So too, after atonement has forgiveness. There is nothing that is done with its commandment and yet one can be negligent in it.

hebrew_text: ולא והרי תרומת הדשן
human_translation: And no But there is the removal of the ashes
llm_translation: And not, behold, the terumat hadeshen.

hebrew_text: משום דהוי תרומת הדשן ובגדי כהונה שני כתובין הבאין כאחד וכל שני כתובים הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and priestly vestments, are two verses that come as one, And Any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because it is considered the removal of the ashes and the priestly garments, two Scriptures that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: הניחא לרבנן דאמרי (ויקרא טז, כג) והניחם שם מלמד שטעונין גניזה
human_translation: This works out well according to the Rabbis, who say and shall leave them there” teaches that they require interment.
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the Rabbis who say (Leviticus 16:23) "and he shall leave them there" - this teaches that they require genizah.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי דוסא דאמר מותרות הן לכהן הדיוט ובלבד שלא ישתמש בהן ליה"כ אחר מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Dosa, who says are fit for an ordinary priest provided that does not use them on Yom Kippur a different what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rabbi Dosa who said, "Permitted are they for the common priest, provided that he does not make use of them for another Yom Kippur." What can be said in response to this?

hebrew_text: משום דהוי תרומת הדשן ועגלה ערופה שני כתובין הבאין כאחד וכל שני כתובין הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because it is considered a "heaping of the ashes" and "a decapitated calf," two Scriptures that come together do not teach.

hebrew_text: הניחא למאן דאמר אין מלמדין אלא למאן דאמר מלמדין מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach but according to the one who says teach what is there to say?
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says we only teach, but according to the one who says we do teach, what can be said?

hebrew_text: תרי מיעוטי כתיבי הכא כתיב (דברים כא, ו) הערופה והתם כתיב (ויקרא ו, ג) ושמו
human_translation: Two exclusions are written Here, it is written: “Whose neck was broken” And there, it is written: “And he shall put it”
llm_translation: Two minority writings are written here. Here it is written (Deuteronomy 21:6) "הערופה" and there it is written (Leviticus 6:3) "ושמו."

hebrew_text: ותלתא קראי בדם למה לי
human_translation: And why do I these three verses with regard to blood,
llm_translation: And three verses in blood, why do I need them?

hebrew_text: למעוטי ממעילה מנותר ומטומאה
human_translation: to exclude from from notar . And from ritual impurity.
llm_translation: To exclude from embezzlement, leftover, and impurity.

hebrew_text: אבל פיגול לא צריך קרא דתנן כל שיש לו מתירין בין לאדם בין למזבח חייבין עליו משום פיגול ודם גופיה מתיר הוא
human_translation: But no verse is required piggul , as we learned any that has permitting factors, either for a person or for the altar, one is liable for it due to piggul . And blood itself, it permitted
llm_translation: But Pigul does not need a verse, as we learned in a Mishnah: "Any offering that has those who permit it, whether for a person or for the altar, they are liable for it on account of Pigul, and its blood permits it."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן שלשה כריתות בשלמים למה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why do I three karet with regard to peace offerings
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "Three excisions in peace offerings, why?"

hebrew_text: אחת לכלל ואחת לפרט ואחת לדברים שאינן נאכלין
human_translation: One for a generalization, and one for a detail. And one to items whose not to be eaten,
llm_translation: One for the general rule, and one for the specific case, and one for things that are not edible.

hebrew_text: ולרבי שמעון דאמר דברים שאין נאכלין אין חייבין עליהם משום טומאה לאיתויי מאי לאיתויי חטאות הפנימיות
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who says items whose not to be eaten, is not liable for them due to ritual impurity, what to include? to include the sin offerings inside
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who said: things that are not edible, one is not liable for them regarding impurity, to bring what? To bring the inner sin offerings.

hebrew_text: ס"ד אמינא הואיל ואמר רבי שמעון כל שאינו על מזבח החיצון כשלמים אין חייבין עליו משום פיגול משום טומאה נמי לא ליחייב קמ"ל:
human_translation: enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Shimon says any whose is not on the external altar like a peace offering, one is not liable for it due to piggul , not be liable due to ritual impurity. teaches us
llm_translation: It is taught: I say, since Rabbi Shimon said, "Anyone that is not on the outer altar, like the peace offerings, is not liable for pigul." Also, not liable for impurity. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: נומי ר' שמעון מחייב את שדרכו לאכול כו': איתמר רבי יוחנן וריש לקיש רבי אלעזר ורבי יוסי ברבי חנינא חד מהאי זוזא וחד מהאי זוזא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon stated deems liable whose manner eats was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina. one of this pair and one of that pair.
llm_translation: נומי ר' שמעון - Numi, Rabbi Shimon, מחייב את שדרכו לאכול - obligates his path to eat, איתמר - it was stated: רבי יוחנן וריש לקיש - Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish, רבי אלעזר ורבי יוסי ברבי חנינא - Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosi son of Rabbi Chanina, חד מהאי זוזא וחד מהאי זוזא - one from this coin and one from that coin.

hebrew_text: חד אמר מחלוקת בטומאת בשר אבל בטומאת הגוף דברי הכל אינו לוקה
human_translation: One says: dispute with regard to the impurity of meat, But in impurity of the body, everyone agrees he is not flogged.
llm_translation: One said: Dispute in impurity of flesh, but in impurity of the body, the words of all, not liable.

hebrew_text: וחד אמר כמחלוקת בזו כך מחלוקת בזו מאי טעמא כיון דקרינא ביה (ויקרא ז, יט) והבשר אשר יגע בכל טמא קרינן ביה (ויקרא ז, כ) וטומאתו עליו
human_translation: And one says: As a dispute with regard to this so a dispute with regard to that What is the reason Since one reads with regard to “And the flesh that touches any impure item” one reads with regard to having his impurity upon him,
llm_translation: And one said: Just as there is a dispute in this case, so too there is a dispute in that case. What is the reason? Since we read regarding it (Leviticus 7:19) "And the flesh that touches any unclean thing," and we read regarding it (Leviticus 7:20) "And his uncleanness is upon him."

hebrew_text: רב טביומי מתני הכי רב כהנא מתני הכי חד מהאי זוזא וחד מהאי זוזא אסיפא חד אמר מחלוקת בטומאת הגוף אבל בטומאת בשר דברי הכל לוקה וחד אמר כמחלוקת בזו כך מחלוקת בזו
human_translation: Rav Tavyumei teaches this Rav Kahana teaches this One of this pair and one of that pair with regard to the latter clause One says dispute with regard to the impurity of the body, But with regard to the impurity of flesh, everyone agrees flogged. And one says: As a dispute with regard to this so a dispute with regard to that
llm_translation: Rav Tavyumi teaches thus, Rav Kahana teaches thus: One coin from this zuz and one coin from that zuz. The first clause: One says there is a dispute regarding impurity of the body, but regarding impurity of flesh, everyone agrees one is liable. And one says: Just as there is a dispute in this case, so too there is a dispute in that case.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מסתברא כמ"ד כמחלוקת בזו כך מחלוקת בזו מאי טעמא כיון דלא קרינא ביה וטומאתו עליו ונכרתה לא קרינן ביה והבשר אשר יגע בכל טמא לא יאכל
human_translation: Rava said: stands to reason like the one who says: As a dispute with regard to this so a dispute with regard to that What is the reason? Since one does not read with regard to “Having his impurity upon him, that soul shall be cut off,” one does not read with regard to “And the flesh that touches any impure item shall not be eaten.”
llm_translation: Rava said: It is logical. Just as there is a dispute in this case, so too there is a dispute in that case. What is the reason? Since we do not read regarding it, "and his uncleanness is upon him, and he shall be cut off," we do not read regarding it, "but the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten."

hebrew_text: והאמר מר והבשר לרבות עצים ולבונה לפוסלה בעלמא:
human_translation: But doesn’t the Master say “And as for the flesh,” to include wood and frankincense? merely to disqualification,
llm_translation: And the Master said, "And the flesh to include wood and frankincense to disqualify it in general."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ לשם ששה דברים הזבח נזבח לשם זבח לשם זובח לשם השם לשם אשים לשם ריח לשם ניחוח והחטאת והאשם לשם חטא
human_translation: The slaughtered offering is slaughtered for the sake of six matters, For the sake of offering for the sake of the one who sacrifices for the sake of God; for the sake of fires for the sake of aroma; for the sake of pleasing and, a sin offering and a guilt offering, for the sake of sin.
llm_translation: Mishnah: For the sake of six things the sacrifice is offered: for the sake of sacrifice, for the sake of offering, for the sake of slaughtering, for the sake of the Name, for the sake of placing, for the sake of fragrance, and the sin-offering and the guilt-offering for the sake of sin.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוסי אף מי שלא היה בלבו לשם אחד מכל אלו כשר שהוא תנאי בית דין שאין המחשבה הולכת אלא אחר העובד:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even one who did not have in mind for the sake of any one of these, valid, as it is a stipulation of the court because the intent follows only the one performing the rite,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei: Even one who did not have in his heart to worship any of these idols, is valid, as it is a condition of the court that only the action is followed.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה אמר רב עולה לשם עולה לאפוקי לשם שלמים דלא אשים לשם אשים לאפוקי כבבא דלא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says “a burnt offering” for the sake of a burnt offering, to the exclusion of for the sake of a peace offering, which not fires, for the sake of fires to the exclusion of roasted as not
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "He ascends for the sake of ascending, not for the sake of peace. If he did not intend for the sake of peace, he should intend for the sake of ascending, like a burnt offering that was not designated for the sake of offering."

hebrew_text: ריח לשם ריח לאפוקי אברים שצלאן והעלן דלא דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב אברים שצלאן והעלן אין בהן משום ריח
human_translation: “aroma” for the sake of aroma, to the exclusion of limbs that one roasted and took them up which not As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: limbs that one roasted and took them up they do not constitute aroma.
llm_translation: The scent for the Name, the scent for the limbs, that they roasted and offered, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The limbs that they roasted and offered do not have the status of scent.

hebrew_text: ניחוח לשם הנחת רוח לה' לשם מי שאמר והיה העולם
human_translation: “pleasing” for the sake of pleasing spirit, “to the Lord” for the sake of the One Who spoke and the world came into being.
llm_translation: "Sweet savor to the Name, restful spirit to the Lord, in the name of Him who spoke and the world came into being."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב חטאת ששחטה לשם עולה פסולה לשם חולין כשרה אמר ר' אלעזר מ"ט דרב (ויקרא כב, טו) ולא יחללו את קדשי בני ישראל קדשים מחללין קדשים ואין חולין מחללין קדשים:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: a sin offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a burnt offering, disqualified. for the sake of a non-sacred valid. Rabbi Elazar says: What is the reason of Rav? “And they shall not profane the sacred items of the children of Israel” consecrated items, profane consecrated items, but a non-sacred does not profane consecrated items.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If one slaughters a sin-offering for the sake of a burnt-offering, it is invalid; for the sake of common use, it is valid. Rabbi Elazar said: What is the reason of Rav? "And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel" (Leviticus 22:15) - holy things are profaned by holy things, but common things do not profane holy things.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבה אמר רבי יוסי אף מי שלא היה בלבו לשם אחד מכל אלו כשר שהוא תנאי ב"ד טעמא שלא היה בלבו כלל הא היה בלבו לשם חולין פסול
human_translation: Rabba raises an objection Rabbi Yosei says: Even one who did not have in mind for the sake of any one of these, fit, as it is a stipulation of the court the reason he did not have in mind at all. But had in mind for the sake of a non-sacred disqualified.
llm_translation: Rabba raised an objection: Rabbi Yosei said, "Even someone who did not have in mind any of these intentions is valid, as it is a condition of the court. The reason for this ruling is that he did not have in mind at all. But if he had in mind for secular purposes, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי דלמא לא היה כלל כשר ומרצה הא היה בלבו לשם חולין כשר ואינו מרצה
human_translation: Abaye said to Perhaps did not have at all, valid and effects acceptance, but had in mind for the sake of a non-sacred valid, but it does not effect acceptance,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Perhaps it was not at all valid, and the one who slaughtered had in mind for secular purposes, it is valid, but he did not have in mind.

hebrew_text: א"ר אלעזר חטאת ששחטה לשם חולין כשרה משום חולין פסולה כדבעא מיניה שמואל מרב הונא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: a sin offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a non-sacred valid, as a non-sacred disqualified, like the dilemma that Shmuel raised before Rav Huna:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar: A sin-offering that was slaughtered for the sake of secular use is valid as secular use, but invalid as a sin-offering. This is as Samuel said in the name of Mar Huna.

hebrew_text: מנין למתעסק בקדשים שהוא פסול שנאמר (ויקרא א, ה) ושחט את בן הבקר לפני ה' עד שתהא שחיטה לשם בן בקר
human_translation: From where to one who acts unawares of consecrated that is disqualified? as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter the young bull before the Lord” unless the slaughter is for the sake of a young bull,
llm_translation: From where do we derive that one who is engaged in sacrificial offerings and is disqualified? As it is stated (Leviticus 1:5), "And he shall slaughter the bull before the Lord," indicating that the slaughtering must be for the sake of a bull.

hebrew_text: א"ל זו בידינו היא לעכב מנין א"ל (ויקרא יט, ה) לרצונכם תזבחהו לדעתכם זביחו:
human_translation: said to We have this from where indispensable? said to him “With your will you shall slaughter it” with your awareness you shall slaughter
llm_translation: He said to him: This is in our hands to delay. From where? He said to him: "According to your will, you shall sacrifice it" (Leviticus 19:5) - according to your understanding, you shall sacrifice it.

hebrew_text: שאין המחשבה הולכת אלא אחר העובד: מתני' דלא כי האי תנא דתניא א"ר אלעזר ברבי יוסי שמעתי שהבעלים מפגלין אמר רבא מ"ט דרבי אלעזר ברבי יוסי דאמר קרא והקריב המקריב
human_translation: Because the intent follows only the one performing the rite. The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: I heard that the owner can render it piggul Rava says: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei? As the verse states: “Then he who sacrifices shall sacrifice
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "For thought follows only action: It was taught: Not like this Mishnah, for this Tanna taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said, 'I heard that owners disqualify.' Rava said, 'What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, who said, 'And the one who offers shall bring near' (Leviticus 17:4)?'"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי רבי אלעזר ברבי יוסי ורבי אליעזר ור"ש בן אלעזר כולהו סבירא להו זה מחשב וזה עובד הויא מחשבה רבי אלעזר ברבי יוסי הא דאמרן
human_translation: Abaye says: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar all hold this one has intention and that one performs the service, it is intention Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, that which we said,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, all of them hold the opinion that this one is plotting and this one is acting, it is considered plotting. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, this is what we said.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר דתנן השוחט לעובד כוכבים שחיטתו כשרה ורבי אליעזר פוסל
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer as we learned one who slaughters of a gentile, his slaughter is valid But Rabbi Eliezer deems it unfit,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer as we learned: One who slaughters for a non-Jew, his slaughtering is valid. And Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies.

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן אלעזר דתנן כלל אמר רבי שמעון בן אלעזר כל שאין כשר להצניע ואין מצניעין כמוהו הוכשר לזה והצניעו ובא אחר והוציאו נתחייב זה במחשבה של זה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar as we learned Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar stated a principle: any that is not fit to be stored, and not store like it, it was deemed fit by this and he stored it, and another came and carried out that is rendered liable by the thought of this
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar taught: "Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said a general principle: Anyone who is not fit for modesty, and others are not modest like him, he is fit for this one, and he should be modest. And if another person comes and exposes him, this one is liable for the thought of that one."

hebrew_text: תרוייהו אית להו דרבי אלעזר ברבי יוסי השתא בחוץ אמרינן בפנים מיבעיא
human_translation: These two accept of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei. Now outside we say is necessary inside
llm_translation: Both have Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosi. Now, outside we say, inside is needed.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר ברבי יוסי לית להו דתרוייהו דלמא בפנים הוא דאמרינן בחוץ לא אמרינן
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, does not accept these two Perhaps inside that we say outside we do not say
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei does not have both of them, perhaps it is inside that we say, but outside we do not say.

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן אלעזר אית ליה דר' אליעזר השתא בשבת אמרינן בעבודת כוכבים מיבעיא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar accepts of Rabbi Eliezer: Now with regard to Shabbat we say is necessary concerning idol worship,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar has a teaching of Rabbi Eliezer: Now, regarding Shabbat, we say that in the case of idol worship, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר לית ליה דרבי שמעון בן אלעזר דלמא בעבודת כוכבים הוא דאמרת כעין בפנים אבל שבת מלאכת מחשבת אסרה תורה:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer does not accept of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar: Perhaps it is with regard to idol worship that you say similar to inside But Shabbat, the Torah prohibited planned, labor,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer does not have the same opinion as Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, perhaps he is referring to idol worship, for you said it is like the sin of the face of the idol, but regarding Shabbat, only work of thought the Torah prohibited.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך בית שמאי
llm_translation: We will return to you, House of Shammai.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ איזהו מקומן של זבחים קדשי קדשים שחיטתן בצפון
human_translation: What is the location of offerings? offerings of the most sacred order, their slaughter in the north
llm_translation: Mishnah: What is the designated place for the slaughter of sacrifices of the most holy order? In the north.

hebrew_text: פר ושעיר של יום הכיפורים שחיטתן בצפון וקיבול דמן בכלי שרת בצפון ודמן טעון הזיה על בין הבדים ועל הפרוכת ועל מזבח הזהב מתנה אחת מהן מעכבת שירי הדם היה שופך על יסוד מערבי של מזבח החיצון ואם לא נתן לא עכב:
human_translation: the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur, their slaughter in the north and the collection of their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires sprinkling between the staves and upon the Curtain and on the golden altar. one placement of their disqualifies the remainder of the blood, would pour onto the western base of the external altar. But if he did not place not disqualify
llm_translation: A bull and a goat of Yom Kippur, their slaughter is in the north, and receiving their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires sprinkling between the staves and on the curtain and on the golden altar. One of them delays the remaining blood; if one poured it on the western foundation of the outer altar, and if not, it does not delay.

Rabbi Yehuda said to him: For what do we not say: If he finished, he has performed atonement, if he did not finish, he has not performed atonement? that if one of any of the placements is lacking he did nothing.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And the atonement shall be complete" (Leviticus 16:20) - if it is complete, atonement is achieved; if it is not complete, atonement is not achieved. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: "Why is it not stated, 'if it is complete, atonement is achieved; if it is not complete, atonement is not achieved'? Because if even one of all the gifts is lacking, he has done nothing at all."

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו רבי יוחנן ורבי יהושע בן לוי חד אמר משמעות דורשין איכא בינייהו וחד אמר שיריים מעכבין איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between them? Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi One says interpretation of the meaning is between them, And one says there is between them remainder disqualifies
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said the meaning is sought, there is a difference between them, and one said that songs hinder, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: תסתיים דר' יהושע בן לוי הוא דאמר שיריים דמעכבי דא"ר יהושע בן לוי לדברי האומר שיריים מעכבין מביא פר אחד ומתחיל בתחלה בפנים
human_translation: It may be concluded that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is who says remainder disqualifies As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: According to the statement of the one who says remainder disqualifies bring one bull and begin initially on the inner
llm_translation: The matter is concluded according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, for he said: "The songs of the Levites delay." As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: According to the one who says that the songs delay, he brings one young bull and begins from the beginning inside.

hebrew_text: אטו ר' יוחנן לית ליה הא סברא והאמר ר' יוחנן תנא ר' נחמיה כדברי האומר שירים מעכבין
human_translation: Is that to say Rabbi Yoḥanan does not this reasoning? But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Rabbi Neḥemya taught in accordance with the statement of the one who says remainder disqualifies
llm_translation: So, does Rabbi Yochanan not have this logical reasoning? And Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Nechemia taught in accordance with the opinion of the one who says that reciting songs (Shirim) delays (Ma'akvin).

hebrew_text: אלא כדברי האומר ולאו להני תנאי הכא נמי כדברי האומר ולאו להני תנאי:
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with the statement of the one who says but not to these tanna’im . Here too, in accordance with the statement of the one who says but not to these tanna’im .
llm_translation: Rather, like the words of the one who says, "and not according to these teachings," here too, like the words of the one who says, "and not according to these teachings."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חטאות הצבור והיחיד אלו הן חטאות הצבור שעירי ראשי חדשים ושל מועדות שחיטתן בצפון וקיבול דמן בכלי שרת בצפון ודמן טעון ארבע מתנות על ארבע קרנות כיצד
human_translation: the communal and the individual sin offerings. These are the communal sin offerings: Goats of the New Moon and of the Festivals. Their slaughter in the north and collection of their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires four placements on the four corners of the altar. How
llm_translation: Mishnah: The communal sin offerings and the individual sin offerings, these are the communal sin offerings: the he-goats of Rosh Chodesh and of festivals, their slaughter is in the north, and receiving their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires four applications on the four corners. How so:

hebrew_text: עלה בכבש ופנה לסובב ובא לו לקרן דרומית מזרחית מזרחית צפונית צפונית מערבית מערבית דרומית שירי הדם היה שופך על יסוד דרומית ונאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים לזכרי כהונה בכל מאכל ליום ולילה עד חצות:
human_translation: He ascended the ramp and turned to the surrounding ledge and he came to the southeast corner northeast northwest southwest He would pour the remainder of the blood on the southern base And are eaten within the curtains, by the males of the priesthood. in any food on day and night until midnight.
llm_translation: He went up with a lamb and turned to go around, and he came to the southern horn, eastern, eastern, northern, northern, western, western, southern. The leftover blood he would pour on the southern foundation, and they would eat inside from the curtains, for the sake of the priesthood, with every meal, day and night, until midnight.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ היכי עביד רבי יוחנן ורבי אלעזר חד אמר נותן אמה אילך ואמה אילך וחד אמר מחטא ויורד כנגד חודו של קרן
human_translation: How does perform Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar. One says places a cubit on this or a cubit on that And one says he sprinkles on the edge of corner and down
llm_translation: Gemara: How did Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar do it? One said, "He places a cubit here and a cubit there," and the other said, "He sins and descends opposite the point of the horn."

hebrew_text: אליבא דרבי אלעזר בר"ש דאמר היא עצמה אינה נעשית אלא בגופה של קרן דכולי עלמא לא פליגי כי פליגי אליבא דרבי מר סבר אמה אילך ואמה אילך כנגד קרן הוא ומר סבר כנגד חודה אין טפי לא
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says itself is performed only on the actual corner, everyone agrees When they disagree according to of Rabbi Sage holds a cubit on this and a cubit on that is on corner. And Sage holds on its edge, yes, further not.
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Elazar son of Shimon it was stated: The bone itself is not formed except in the body of the horn. For everyone agrees when they disagree, in the school of Rabbi, one Master holds: "A cubit here and a cubit there" corresponds to the horn, and the other Master holds: Corresponding to the forehead is not more.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חטאת הציבור והיחיד כיצד מתן דמן היה עולה לכבש ופנה לסובב ובא לו לקרן דרומית מזרחית וטובל באצבעו הימנית המיומנת שבימין מן הדם שבמזרק וחומר בגודלו מלמעלה ובאצבעו קטנה מלמטה ומחטא ויורד כנגד חודה של קרן עד שמכלה כל הדם שבאצבע וכן כל קרן וקרן
human_translation: raises an objection communal sin offerings and individual how the placement of their blood would ascend the ramp and turn to the surrounding ledge and come to southeast corner. And dip with his right [ haymanit ] finger, the dexterous [ hamyumenet ] of the right of the blood that is in the bowl, and gather with his thumb above and his smallest finger below, And sprinkle and down on the edge of corner, until finish all the blood that on finger. And similarly each and every corner.
llm_translation: The scholars asked: The sin offering of the congregation and the individual, how is the application of their blood done? It would ascend to the corner of the altar, turn around, approach the southeastern horn, dip with its skilled right finger in the blood from the basin, and apply above the midpoint with the larger part of the finger and with the smaller part below, and it would sin and descend opposite the base of the horn until it consumed all the blood on the finger, and likewise on each horn.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר מצוה בחודה אי עבד אמה אילך ואמה אילך לית לן בה:
human_translation: This is saying: mitzva on the edge of if he did cubit on this or cubit on that we have no with it,
llm_translation: So it is saying: "A commandment in the middle, if one does an amah here and an amah there, we do not have it."

hebrew_text: מאי רבי ומאי רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון דתניא דמים העליונים ניתנין מחוט הסיקרא ולמעלה דמים התחתונים ניתנין מחוט הסיקרא ולמטן דברי רבי
human_translation: What Rabbi and what Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? as it is taught blood the upper is placed from the red line and above. blood the lower is placed from the red line or below it. the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi and what is the opinion of Rabbi Elazar son of Shimon? As it was taught in a Baraita: The upper bloods are given from the thread of the scarlet worm and above, and the lower bloods are given from the thread of the scarlet worm and below. This is the statement of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון אומר במה דברים אמורין בעולת העוף אבל בחטאת בהמה היא עצמה אין נעשית אלא על גופה של קרן
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon says: In what is this statement said? with regard to a bird burnt offering, But with regard to an animal sin offering, itself may be performed only on the actual corner
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: In what matter are these things said regarding the burnt offering of a bird, but regarding the sin offering of an animal itself, it is not done except on its own body of the horn.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבהו מאי טעמא דרבי דכתיב (יחזקאל מג, טו) וההראל ארבע אמות ומההראל ולמעלה וגו' ארבע אמות הוא דהויא אמר רב אדא בר אהבה ומקום קרנות ארבע מקום קרנות ד' הויא אלא אימא רשות קרנות ד':
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: What is the reason of Rabbi As it is written: “And the altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar and above Was four cubits Rav Adda bar Ahava said: And area corners, four Was the area of corners four Rather, say domain corners four
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi? As it is written (Ezekiel 43:15), "And the altar hearth four cubits, and from the altar hearth and upward..." Four cubits is what it is. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: And the place of the horns is four cubits. The place of the horns is four cubits. Rather, say it is the space of the horns that is four cubits.

hebrew_text: תנן התם חוט של סיקרא חוגרו באמצע להבדיל בין דמים העליונים לדמים התחתונים מנא הני מילי אמר רב אחא בר רב קטינא שנאמר (שמות כז, ה) והיתה הרשת עד חצי המזבח התורה נתנה מחיצה להבדיל בין דמים העליונים לדמים התחתונים:
human_translation: We learned there A red line circumscribed in the middle, to separate between blood the upper and blood the lower From where is this matter Rav Aḥa bar Rav Ketina said as it is stated: and the net will reach halfway up the altar” The Torah provided a separation to separate between blood the upper and blood the lower
llm_translation: We learned there: a thread of scarlet wool, he ties it in the middle to distinguish between the upper blood and the lower blood. From where do we derive these matters? Rav Acha bar Rav Ketina said: as it is stated (Exodus 27:5) "And the net shall be to the middle of the altar." The Torah provided a partition to distinguish between the upper blood and the lower blood.

hebrew_text: שירי הדם כו': ת"ר אל יסוד מזבח זה יסוד דרומי אתה אומר זה יסוד דרומי או אינו אלא יסוד מערבי
human_translation: the remainder of the blood The Sages taught “At the base of the altar” this southern base Do you say this southern base, or is it only western base?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shirei HaDam, etc." The Rabbis taught: "Do not say, 'This is the foundation of the altar,' you say, 'This is the southern foundation.' Are you saying this is the southern foundation, or is it rather the western foundation?"

hebrew_text: וילמד סתום מן המפורש אמרת ילמד ירידתו מן הכבש ליציאתו מן ההיכל מה יציאתו מן ההיכל בסמוך לו אף ירידתו מן הכבש בסמוך לו:
human_translation: And derive unspecified from the explicit You said derive descent from the ramp to his exit from the Sanctuary Just as his exit from the Sanctuary on closest to him, so too, his descent from the ramp on closest to him,
