llm_translation: And the anonymous (author) learned from the explicit (text), (as it is written) "He shall learn" (Leviticus 5:26), (this means) he shall learn his descent from the lamb to his exit from the Temple. Just as his exit from the Temple is adjacent to it, so too his descent from the lamb is adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי ישמעאל אומר זה וזה יסוד מערבי ר' שמעון בן יוחאי אומר זה וזה יסוד דרומי
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yishmael says: This and that, western base Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: This and that southern base
llm_translation: It is taught: Rabbi Yishmael says, "This and that is the foundation of the western wall." Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says, "This and that is the foundation of the southern wall."

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר יסוד מערבי קסבר ילמד סתום מן המפורש
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says western base holds derive an unspecified from the explicit
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who says, the foundation of the west, he holds that one should learn the implicit from the explicit.

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דאמר יסוד דרומי מ"ט א"ר אסי קסבר האי תנא כוליה מזבח בצפון קאי ל"א כוליה פתח בדרום קאי
human_translation: But according to the one who says southern base what is the reason? Rabbi Asi said: This tanna holds the entire altar stands in the north another formulation The entire entrance stands in the south
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says the foundation of the southern wall is primary, what is the reason? Rabbi Asi said: This Tanna holds that the entire altar is situated in the north, except for the entire entrance which is situated in the south.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל כרבי שמעון בן יוחי אומרים זה וזה יסוד מערבי וסימניך משכו גברי לגברא:
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael, in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, says: this and that, western base And your mnemonic The men pulled the man.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Like Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, they say, "This and that are the foundation of the evening, and your signs, O men, to a man."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ העולה קדשי קדשים שחיטתה בצפון וקיבול דמה בכלי שרת בצפון ודמה טעון שתי מתנות שהן ארבע וטעונה הפשט וניתוח וכליל לאשים:
human_translation: The burnt offering an offering of the most sacred order. Its slaughter in the north and the collection of its blood in a service vessel in the north, and its blood requires two placements that are four, and requires flaying and the cutting and in its entirety, by the fire
llm_translation: Mishnah: An Olah whose holiness is of the most holy, its slaughter is in the north, and receiving its blood in a service vessel in the north, and its blood requires two applications, which are four, and it requires spreading, and separating, and collecting for the fire.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ עולה מ"ט תני ליה קדשי קדשים משום דלא כתיב בה (לה') קדשי קדשים היא:
human_translation: What is the reason taught a burnt offering an offering of the most sacred order, because it is not written with regard to It is most sacred,
llm_translation: Gemara: Why does it ascend? It was taught to him: "Most holy" because it is not written in it "most holy" it is.

hebrew_text: ודמה טעון שתי מתנות: היכי עביד אמר רב נותן וחוזר ונותן ושמואל אמר מתנה אחת כמין גמא נותן
human_translation: And its blood requires two placements How does perform Rav says: He places and places again And Shmuel says: places one placement similar to gamma,
llm_translation: And similar is the case of one who requires two gifts: how does he act? Rav said, he gives and gives again, and Shmuel said, he gives one gift as a type of a camel.

hebrew_text: כתנאי יכול יזרקנו זריקה אחת ת"ל סביב אי סביב יכול יקיפנו כחוט ת"ל וזרקו הא כיצד כמין גמא (ודמה טעון) שתי מתנות שהן ארבע
human_translation: like tanna’im : might should sprinkle one sprinkling the verse states: around If around might he should circumscribe as a thread, the verse states: and sprinkle How these similar to gamma, and its blood requires two sprinklings that are four.
llm_translation: Disputants: Can one sprinkle it with one sprinkling? It is stated: "Around." If around, can one encompass it like a thread? It is stated: "And they shall sprinkle." How so? Like a type of gum (and similar requires) two handles, which are four.

hebrew_text: ר' ישמעאל אומר נאמר כאן סביב ונאמר להלן (ויקרא ח, טו) סביב מה להלן פיסוק וארבע מתנות אף כאן פיסוק וארבע מתנות
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: It is stated here: around and it is stated there, around Just as there, discretely and four placements, so too here, discretely and four placements.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: It is stated here "around," and it is stated there (Leviticus 8:15) "around." Just as there, it is a separation and four gifts, so too here, it is a separation and four gifts.

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן ארבע מתנות על ארבע קרנות אף כאן ארבע מתנות על ארבע קרנות אמרת עולה טעונה יסוד וקרן מזרחית דרומית לא היה לה יסוד
human_translation: If just as there, four placements on four corners, so too here, four placements on four corners? You said a burnt offering requires a base, and southeast corner had no base
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "If there, four gifts for four corners, so too here, four gifts for four corners. You said: 'An elevation offering requires a foundation, and a horn on the east and south, it did not have a foundation.'"

hebrew_text: מ"ט אמר ר' אלעזר לפי שלא היתה בחלקו של טורף דאמר רב שמואל בר רב יצחק מזבח אוכל בחלקו של יהודה אמה
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Elazar says: Because it was not in the portion of the one who tears, As Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzḥak, says: altar consume, one cubit of the portion of Judah.
llm_translation: Reason why said Rabbi Elazar because not was in portion of predator as said Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak "altar eats in portion of Judah cubit."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי לוי בר חמא אמר רבי חמא ברבי חנינא רצועה היתה יוצאה מחלקו של יהודה ונכנסה בחלקו של בנימין והיה בנימין הצדיק מצטער עליה בכל יום לנוטלה שנאמר
human_translation: Rabbi Levi bar Ḥama says Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: A strip emerged from the portion of Judah and entered into the portion of Benjamin, And Benjamin the righteous would agonize over it every day, to take it As it is stated
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Levi the son of Chama said Rabbi Chama the son of Rabbi Chanina: A strap was extending from the portion of Judah and entered into the portion of Benjamin, and Benjamin the Righteous would feel distressed about it every day to take it off, as it is stated:

hebrew_text: (דברים לג, יב) חופף עליו כל היום לפיכך זכה בנימין הצדיק ונעשה אושפיזכן להקב"ה שנאמר (דברים לג, יב) ובין כתפיו שכן
human_translation: “He covers it throughout the day, Therefore, Benjamin the righteous was privileged and became the host of the Holy One, Blessed be He, As it is stated: “And He dwells between his shoulders.”
llm_translation: (Deuteronomy 33:12) "He dwells between his shoulders." Therefore, Benjamin the righteous merited and became a repository for the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 33:12) "And between his shoulders he dwells."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי עולת העוף כיצד היתה נעשית היה מולק את ראשה ממול עורפה ומבדיל וממצה דמה על קיר המזבח
human_translation: raises an objection How a bird burnt offering performed? would pinch head at nape and sever and squeeze out its blood on the wall of the altar.
llm_translation: The question was raised: How is the burnt offering of a bird performed? One would nip its head opposite its neck, separate it, squeeze its blood onto the side of the altar.

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת לא היה לה יסוד באוירא בעלמא הוא דקא עביד אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק אימר כך התנו אוירא דבנימין קרקע דיהודה
human_translation: And if you say had no base, is he merely performing in the air, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Say made this condition: The airspace of Benjamin, land of Judah.
llm_translation: And if you say she did not have a foundation in the air, it is only that she was doing it. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Say thus: They taught: "The air of Benjamin, the ground of Judah."

hebrew_text: מאי לא הוה לה יסוד רב אמר בבנין לוי אמר בדמים רב מתרגם באחסנתיה יתבני מדבחא לוי מתרגם באחסנתיה יתבני מקדשא מקום מקודש לדמים
human_translation: What had no base? Rav says: with regard to built Levi says: with regard to blood Rav translates In his portion will the altar be built. Levi translates In his portion will the Sanctuary be built, A place sanctified for blood.
llm_translation: "What is the reason that she did not have a foundation? Rav said: in the construction. Levi said: in the blood. Rav interprets: it should be built in its storage. Levi interprets: it should be built in the sanctuary. A sacred place for blood."

hebrew_text: תא שמע היסוד היה מהלך על פני כל הצפון ועל פני כל המערב אוכל בדרום אמה אחת ובמזרח אמה אחת מאי אוכל נמי בדמים
human_translation: Come hear The base would extend along all of the northern and along all of the western consumed one cubit on the southern and one cubit on the eastern What Consume? as well, with regard to blood
llm_translation: Come and hear: The foundation was walking on the face of all the north and on the face of all the west, eating in the south one cubit and in the east one cubit. What does it eat? It also eats blood.

hebrew_text: תא שמע המזבח היה שלשים ושתים על שלשים ושתים הכא במאי עסקינן מן הצד
human_translation: Come hear The altar was thirty-two by thirty-two Here we are dealing with from the side.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The altar was thirty-two by thirty-two. Here, what are we dealing with? From the side.

hebrew_text: ת"ש נמצא פורח אמה על יסוד ואמה על סובב אימא כנגד אמה יסוד ועל אמה סובב:
human_translation: Come hear It turns out overhang cubit over base and cubit over surrounding ledge. Say toward base cubit and cubit over surrounding ledge.
llm_translation: Come and hear: It was found that a beam extends one cubit over the foundation and one cubit over the surrounding area. I would say it corresponds to one cubit of the foundation and one cubit of the surrounding area.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתני לוי כיצד בונין את המזבח מביאין מלבן שהוא שלשים ושתים על שלשים ושתים וגובהו אמה ומביא חלוקי אבנים מפולמות בין גדולות בין קטנות ומביא סיד וקוניא וזפת וממחה ושופך וזה הוא מקום יסוד
human_translation: Come hear as Levi teaches How does one build the altar? brings a square which is thirty-two by thirty-two and its height is one cubit. And he brings pieces of damp [ mefulamot ] stone, both large and small, And he brings plaster and molten lead and tar, and melts and pours And this is the place of base
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Levi taught: How is the altar constructed? One brings white stones, each measuring thirty-two by thirty-two, with a height of one cubit. One brings hewn stones, whether large or small, and brings lime, sand, pitch, and asphalt, and smears and pours. And this is the foundation.

hebrew_text: וחוזר ומביא מלבן שהוא שלשים אמה על שלשים אמה וגובהו חמש אמות ומביא חלוקי אבנים כו' וחוזר ומביא מלבן שהוא כ"ח על כ"ח אמות וגובהו ג' אמות ומביא חלוקי כו' והוא מקום המערכה
human_translation: And then he brings a square which is thirty cubits by thirty cubits, and its height is five cubits. And he brings pieces of stone, And then he brings a square which is twenty-eight by twenty-eight cubits, and its height is three cubits. And he brings pieces of And this is the place of the arrangement
llm_translation: He returns and brings a stone that is thirty cubits by thirty cubits, and its height is five cubits, and he brings blocks of stones, etc. And he returns and brings a stone that is twenty-eight by twenty-eight cubits, and its height is three cubits, and he brings blocks, etc. And this is the place of the altar.

hebrew_text: וחוזר ומביא מלבן שהוא אמה על אמה ומביא חלוקי אבנים מפולמות בין גדולות בין קטנות ומביא זפת וקוניא וממחה ושופך וזהו קרן וכן לכל קרן וקרן
human_translation: And then he brings a square which is cubit by cubit. And he brings pieces of damp stone, both large and small. And he brings plaster and molten lead and tar, and melts and pours And this is corner And so for each and every corner.
llm_translation: And he returns and brings from white, which is a cubit by a cubit, and brings divided stones, whether large or small, and brings pitch and resin and wipes and pours, and this is a horn, and so for every horn and horn.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא
human_translation: And if you would say
llm_translation: And if you will say...

hebrew_text: דגייז ליה אבנים שלמות כתיב
human_translation: that he cuts it is written unhewn stones;
llm_translation: He threw whole stones at him, as it is written.

hebrew_text: דמחית מידי מתותיה ושקיל ליה דאי לא תימא הכי הא דאמר רב כהנא אבנים של קרנות חלולות היו דכתיב (זכריה ט, טו) ומלאו כמזרק כזויות מזבח הכא נמי אבנים שלמות אמר רחמנא אלא דמחית מידי מתותיה ושקיל ליה ה"נ דמחית מידי מתותיה ושקיל ליה
human_translation: that he places something under and removes it, As if you do not say so, that which Rav Kahana says: The stone of the corners were hollow, as it is written: “And they shall be filled like the basins, like the corners of the altar” Here too, the Merciful One state “unhewn stones”? Rather, that he places something, under and removes Here too, he places something under and removes it.
llm_translation: He destroyed from his hands his sacrifices, and took for him. For if you do not say so, this is what Rav Kahana said: The stones of the horns were hollow, as it is written (Zechariah 9:15), "And they shall drink and make noise as from wine; and they shall be filled like basins, like the corners of the altar." Here too, they were whole stones. The Merciful One said, rather, he destroyed from his hands his sacrifices, and took for him. So too, he destroyed from his hands his sacrifices, and took for him.

hebrew_text: דרש רבא מאי דכתיב (שמואל א יט, יח) וילך דוד ושמואל וישבו בנויות ברמה וכי מה ענין נויות אצל רמה אלא שהיו יושבין ברמה ועוסקין בנויו של עולם
human_translation: Rava taught: What which is written “And he and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth. in Ramah” But what does Naioth have to do with Ramah? Rather, that they were sitting in Ramah and involved in the beauty [ benoyo ] of the world,
llm_translation: Rava expounded: What is the meaning of what is written (1 Samuel 19:18), "And David and Samuel went and dwelt in Naioth in Ramah"? What connection do Naioth have with Ramah? Rather, they were dwelling in Ramah and engaging in the study of the world's creation.

hebrew_text: אמרי כתיב (דברים יז, ח) וקמת ועלית אל המקום מלמד שבית המקדש גבוה מכל ארץ ישראל וארץ ישראל גבוהה מכל ארצות לא הוו ידעי דוכתיה היכא
human_translation: said: It is written: “Then you shall arise, and get you up unto the place teaches that the Temple is higher than all Eretz Yisrael. And Eretz Yisrael is higher than all countries. They did not know where place
llm_translation: They said: It is written (Deuteronomy 17:8), "And you shall arise and go up to the place," teaching that the Temple is higher than all the land of Israel, and the land of Israel is higher than all the lands. They did not know where its lower part is.

hebrew_text: אייתו ספר יהושע בכולהו כתיב (יהושע יח, יד) וירד ועלה הגבול ותאר הגבול בשבט בנימין ועלה כתיב וירד לא כתיב אמרי ש"מ הכא הוא מקומו
human_translation: They brought the book of Joshua. With regard to all of it is written: “And went down” “And the border went up “And the border was drawn with regard to the tribe of Benjamin it is written “And went up” is not written: “And went down.” They said: Conclude from place is here,
llm_translation: They brought the book of Joshua in its entirety. It is written (Joshua 18:14), "And the border descended and went around the border of the tribe of Benjamin." It is written "descended" but not "ascended." They said: Learn from here, this is its place.

hebrew_text: סבור למבנייה בעין עיטם דמדלי אמרי ניתתי ביה קליל כדכתיב (דברים לג, יב) ובין כתפיו שכן
human_translation: They thought to build it at Ein Eitam, which is higher They said: Let us lower it a bit, as it is written: and He dwells between his shoulders”
llm_translation: He thought to build it in Aiyn Eitam, as it is said: "He dwells between his shoulders" (Deuteronomy 33:12).

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא גמירי דסנהדרין בחלקו דיהודה ושכינה בחלקו דבנימין ואי מדלינן ליה מתפליג טובא מוטב דניתתי ביה פורתא כדכתיב ובין כתפיו שכן
human_translation: And if you wish, say it is learned that Sanhedrin in the portion of Judah, and Divine Presence is in the portion of Benjamin. And if we raise it it too distant preferable that we lower it a bit, as it is written: and He dwells between his shoulders”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: It is learned that the Sanhedrin was in the portion of Judah, and the Divine Presence was in the portion of Benjamin. And if we bring a contradiction against him, it is better, for it is said, "And He dwells between his shoulders."

hebrew_text: ועל דבר זה נתקנא דואג האדומי בדוד כדכתיב (תהלים סט, י) כי קנאת ביתך אכלתני וכתיב (תהלים קלב, א) זכור ה' לדוד את כל ענותו אשר נשבע לה' וגו' אם אבא באהל ביתי אם אתן שנת לעיני לעפעפי תנומה עד אמצא מקום לה' וגו'
human_translation: And with regard to this matter, Doeg the Edomite was jealous of David, as it is written: “Because jealousy for Your House has eaten me up” and it is written: “Lord, remember for David all his affliction; how he swore to the Lord, I will not come into the tent of my house, if I will give sleep to my eyes, or slumber to my eyelids; until I find a place for the Lord,
llm_translation: And on this matter, Doeg the Edomite was jealous of David, as it is written (Psalms 69:10) "For zeal for Your house consumes me," and it is written (Psalms 132:1) "Remember, O Lord, for David all his hardships, how he swore to the Lord, etc." "If I come into the tent of my house, if I give sleep to my eyes, to my eyelids drowsiness, until I find a place for the Lord, etc."

hebrew_text: הנה שמענוה באפרתה מצאנוה בשדה יער באפרתה זה יהושע דקאתי מאפרים מצאנוה בשדה יער זה בנימין דכתיב (בראשית מט, כז) בנימין זאב יטרף:
human_translation: “We heard of it as being in Ephrath; we found it in the field of the wood” “In Ephrath”; this Joshua, who came from Ephraim. “We found it in the field of the wood”; this Benjamin, as it is written “Benjamin is a wolf that tears apart;
llm_translation: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrath, we found it in the fields of the forest. "In Ephrath" - this is referring to Joshua who came from Ephraim. "We found it in the fields of the forest" - this is referring to Benjamin, as it is written (Genesis 49:27), "Benjamin is a ravenous wolf."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ זבחי שלמי צבור ואשמות אלו הן אשמות אשם גזילות אשם מעילות אשם שפחה חרופה אשם נזיר אשם מצורע אשם תלוי
human_translation: communal peace offerings and guilt offerings. These are guilt offerings: The guilt offering for robbery, the guilt offering for misuse the guilt offering of an espoused maidservant, the guilt offering of a nazirite the guilt offering of a leper, the provisional guilt offering,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The communal peace offerings and guilt offerings, these are the guilt offerings: guilt offering for robbery, guilt offering for breach of trust, guilt offering for a defiled maidservant, guilt offering of a nazirite, guilt offering of a leper, and a hanging guilt offering.

hebrew_text: שחיטתן בצפון וקיבול דמן בכלי שרת בצפון ודמן טעון שתי מתנות שהן ארבע ונאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים לזכרי כהונה לכל מאכל ליום ולילה עד חצות:
human_translation: their slaughter in the north and collection of their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires two placements that are four. And are eaten within the curtains, by male priests. in any food on day and night until midnight.
llm_translation: The slaughtering in the north and receiving their blood in a service vessel in the north, and their blood requires two applications, which are four, and they are eaten inside the curtains, for the sake of the priesthood, for any food, day and night, until midnight.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא לן דבעי צפון דתני רבה בר רב חנן קמיה דרבא (ויקרא כג, יט) ועשיתם שעיר עזים אחד לחטאת מה חטאת בצפון אף שלמי צבור בצפון
human_translation: From where do we that require north As Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan taught before Rava: “And you shall offer one he-goat for a sin offering, Just as sin offering in the north so too, communal peace offerings in the north
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we know that the north is required? For Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan taught before Rava: "And you shall make one male goat for a sin offering" (Leviticus 23:19). Just as the sin offering is sacrificed in the north, so too the communal peace offerings are sacrificed in the north.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא וכי חטאת מהיכן למדה מעולה דבר הלמד בהיקש חוזר ומלמד בהיקש
human_translation: Rava said to him: But from where a sin offering derived? from a burnt offering, a matter derived via a juxtaposition then teach via a juxtaposition?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: And from where did you learn the sin offering? A superior matter, one that is learned through a juxtaposition, returns and teaches through a juxtaposition.

hebrew_text: אלא מדתני רב מרי בריה דרב כהנא (במדבר י, י) על עולותיכם ועל זבחי שלמיכם מה עולה קדשי קדשים אף זבחי שלמי צבור קדשי קדשים מה עולה בצפון אף זבחי שלמי צבור בצפון
human_translation: Rather, from which Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana, teaches: over your burnt offerings, and over your peace offerings; Just as burnt offerings offerings of the most sacred order, so too, communal peace offerings offerings of the most sacred order. just as a burnt offering in the north so too, communal peace offerings in the north
llm_translation: Rather, as it was taught by Rav Mari, son of Rav Kahana (Numbers 10:10), "Upon your burnt offerings and your peace offerings." Just as a burnt offering is of the most holy, so too the peace offerings of the community are of the most holy. Just as the burnt offering is in the north, so too the peace offerings of the community are in the north.

hebrew_text: אלא היקשא קמא למאי אתא כי חטאת מה חטאת אינה נאכלת אלא לזכרי כהונה אף זבחי שלמי צבור לזכרי כהונה
human_translation: Rather, what the first juxtaposition come to like a sin offering. Just as a sin offering is eaten only by male priests, so too, communal peace offerings by male priests.
llm_translation: Rather, the first comparison - for what did it come? Just as the sin offering is not eaten except by male priests, so too communal peace offerings are for male priests.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי אי הכי גבי איל נזיר דכתיב (במדבר ו, יד) והקריב את קרבנו לה' כבש בן שנתו תמים אחד לעולה וכבשה אחת בת שנתה [תמימה] לחטאת ואיל אחד [תמים] לשלמים הכי נמי נימא דהקיש הכתוב לחטאת מה חטאת אינה נאכלת אלא לזכרי כהונה אף איל נזיר נמי אינו נאכל אלא לזכרי כהונה
human_translation: Abaye said to If so, with regard to a nazirite’s ram, which it is written “And he shall present his offering to the Lord, one he-lamb in its first year without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe-lamb in its first year without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for a peace offering” so too shall we say that the Torah juxtaposed with a sin offering just as a sin offering is eaten only by male priests, so too, a nazirite’s ram is eaten only by male priests?
llm_translation: Abaye said to him: If so, regarding the Nazirite ram, as it is written (Numbers 6:14), "And he shall present his offering to the Lord, one male lamb in its first year, unblemished, for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb in its first year, unblemished, for a sin offering, and one ram unblemished for peace offerings." So too, it should be said that the verse compares it to the sin offering. Just as the sin offering is not eaten except by male priests, so too the Nazirite ram is not eaten except by male priests.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם כיון דכתיב (במדבר ו, יט) ולקח הכהן את הזרוע בשלה מן האיל מכלל דכוליה בעלים אכלי ליה
human_translation: How can be compared? There, since it is written: “And the priest shall take the foreleg of the ram when it is cooked” by inference that the owner may eat all of
llm_translation: So now there, since it is written (Numbers 6:19), "And the priest shall take the shoulder of the ram when it is boiled," is it to be inferred that all of it belongs to the owners to eat?

hebrew_text: זרוע בשלה מיהא לא ליתאכיל אלא לזכרי כהונה קשיא
human_translation: in any event, cooked foreleg should be eaten only by male priests. difficult.
llm_translation: "An arm of a thigh, from there not to eat, rather for the remembrance of the priesthood difficult."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא קדשי אקרי קדשי קדשים לא איקרו ואלא למאי הלכתא איתקש אמר רבא שאם גלח על אחד משלשתן יצא:
human_translation: And if you wish, say is called sacred, but it is not called an offering of the most sacred order. But rather, with regard to what halakha is juxtaposed Rava says: that if shaved after one of the three fulfilled
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "The holy things are called 'holy of holies,' they are not called." But rather, for what halakha is it compared? Rava said: If he shaved on one of the three, he fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ התודה ואיל נזיר קדשים קלים שחיטתן בכל מקום בעזרה ודמן טעון שתי מתנות שהן ארבע ונאכלין בכל העיר לכל אדם בכל מאכל ליום ולילה עד חצות המורם מהם כיוצא בהן אלא שהמורם נאכל לכהנים לנשיהם ולבניהם ולעבדיהם:
human_translation: The thanks offering and nazirite’s ram offerings of lesser sanctity. Their slaughter anywhere in the courtyard, and their blood requires two placements that are four, and they are eaten throughout the city by every person, in any food on day and night until midnight. that is separated from them is similar to theirs; but that is separated is eaten by the priests, by their wives, and by their children, and by their slaves.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The thanksgiving offering, the ram of a Nazirite, and light holy offerings - their slaughter is valid anywhere in the Temple courtyard, and their blood requires two applications, which are four, and they may be eaten throughout the entire city by anyone, with any food, day and night until midnight. Their emurim (fatty portions) are eaten by the priests, their wives, their children, and their slaves, similar to them.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא י, יד) את חזה התנופה ואת שוק התרומה תאכלו במקום טהור אמר רבי נחמיה וכי ראשונים בטומאה אכלום
human_translation: The Sages taught “And the breast of waving and the thigh of heaving you shall eat in a pure place; Rabbi Neḥemya said: But did they eat first in impurity?
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "The breast of the waving and the thigh of the contribution you shall eat in a pure place." Rabbi Nechemiah said: "Were the first ones eaten in impurity?"

hebrew_text: אלא טהור מכלל שהוא טמא טהור מטומאת מצורע וטמא מטומאת זב ואיזה זה זה מחנה ישראל
human_translation: Rather, by inference, “pure” that is ritually impure, pure due to the impurity of a leper, but impure due to the impurity of a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ]. And which is this? This the Israelites’ camp
llm_translation: Rather, pure, from the category that he is impure, pure from the impurity of a leper, and impure from the impurity of a zav. And which is this? This is the camp of Israel.

hebrew_text: ואימא טהור מטומאת זב וטמא מטומאת מת ואיזה זה זה מחנה לויה
human_translation: But say pure from the impurity of a zav and impure due to ritual impurity a corpse? And which is this? This the Levites’ camp
llm_translation: And say: pure from impurity of a zav, and impure from impurity of a corpse, and which is this? This is the camp of Levi.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אמר קרא (ויקרא י, יג) ואכלתם אותה במקום קדוש אותה במקום קדוש ולא אחרת במקום קדוש אפקה למחנה לויה הדר כתיב במקום טהור אפקה למחנה ישראל
human_translation: Abaye says the verse states “And you shall eat it in a sacred place” “it,” in a sacred place, but not another in a sacred place. removes to the Levites’ camp. Then it is written: in a pure place,” removes to the Israelites’ camp.
llm_translation: Abbaye said, Scripture says (Leviticus 10:13), "And you shall eat it in a holy place; in the court of the Tent of Meeting you shall eat it." It says "in a holy place" twice, teaching that it should not be eaten in a place that is holy by chance. It was taken outside the camp to the camp of the Levites. It is written "in a clean place," indicating that it was taken outside the camp of Israel.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אותה במקום קדוש ולא אחרת במקום קדוש אפקה לגמרי הדר כתב רחמנא תאכלו במקום טהור עיילא למחנה ישראל
human_translation: Rava says “It,” in a sacred place, but not another in a sacred place. removes completely Then the Merciful One wrote: “You shall eat in a pure place,” brings it into the Israelites’ camp,
llm_translation: Rava said: "That animal in a holy place, and not another animal in a holy place, if it was completely removed, the Merciful One has permitted saying, 'You shall eat in a pure place; it shall be brought to the camp of Israel.'"

hebrew_text: ואימא עיילא למחנה לויה לחדא מעיילינן לתרתי לא מעיילינן
human_translation: But say brings it into the Levites’ camp, We bring it into one we do not bring it into two
llm_translation: And say: One may bring a sacrifice to the Levite camp for one purpose, we do not bring it for two purposes.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אפוקי נמי לחדא מפקינן מתרתי לא מפקינן ועוד (דברים יב, יז) לא תוכל לאכול בשעריך כתיב אלא מחוורתא כדאביי:
human_translation: If so, also removing it, we remove it to one we do not remove it from two And furthermore, it is written: “You may not eat within your gates Rather, it is clear in accordance with of Abaye.
llm_translation: If so, we also exclude one, we do not exclude two, and furthermore, it is written (Deuteronomy 12:17), "You may not eat within your gates," but from the courtyard, as Abaye said.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלמים קדשים קלים שחיטתן בכל מקום בעזרה ודמן טעון שתי מתנות שהן ארבע ונאכלין בכל העיר לכל אדם בכל מאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד המורם מהם כיוצא בהם אלא שהמורם נאכל לכהנים לנשיהם ולבניהם ולעבדיהם.
human_translation: Peace offerings offerings of lesser sanctity. Their slaughter anywhere in the courtyard, and their blood requires two placements that are four, and they are eaten throughout the city by every person, in any food for two days and one night, that is separated from them is similar to theirs; but that is separated is eaten by the priests, by their wives, and by their children, and by their slaves.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Peace-offerings, holy offerings, light offerings - their slaughter is valid anywhere in the Temple courtyard, and their blood requires two applications, which are four, and they may be eaten throughout the entire city by anyone, with any food, for two days and one night. The elevated parts among them are treated like them, except that the elevated parts are eaten by the priests, their wives, their children, and their slaves.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא ג, ב) ושחטו פתח אהל מועד (ויקרא ג, ח) ושחט אותו לפני אהל מועד (ויקרא ג, ח) ושחט אותו לפני אהל מועד
human_translation: The Sages taught and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” and slaughter it before the Tent of Meeting” and slaughter it before the Tent of Meeting”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught (Leviticus 3:2) "And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." (Leviticus 3:8) "And he shall slaughter it before the Tent of Meeting." (Leviticus 3:8) "And he shall slaughter it before the Tent of Meeting."

hebrew_text: להכשיר את כל הרוחות בקדשים קלים ק"ו לצפון ומה קדשי קדשים שלא הוכשרו בכל הרוחות הוכשרו בצפון קדשים קלים שהוכשרו בכל הרוחות אינו דין שהוכשרו בצפון
human_translation: to render fit all directions for offerings of lesser sanctity. an a fortiori to the north Just as offerings of the most sacred order, which are not rendered fit in all directions, are rendered fit in the north, offerings of lesser sanctity, which are rendered fit in all directions, is it not logical that they are rendered fit in the north?
llm_translation: To validate all the winds in light holy items, all the more so in the north. And just as the Holy of Holies, which were not validated in all the winds, were validated in the north, light holy items that were validated in all the winds, it is not the law that they were validated in the north.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר לא נאמר הכתוב אלא להכשיר צפון שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה קדשים קלים שהוכשרו בכל הרוחות לא הוכשר מקומן אצל קדשי קדשים קדשי קדשים שלא הוכשרו אלא בצפון אינו דין שלא הוכשר מקומן אצל קדשים קלים ת"ל אהל מועד
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: the verse is stated only to render fit north. As might And could this not logical inference? Just as offerings of lesser sanctity, whose rendered fit in any direction, their place is not rendered fit for offerings of the most sacred order, offerings of the most sacred order, whose rendered fit only in the north, is it not logical that their place should not be rendered fit for offerings of lesser sanctity? the verse states: “Tent of Meeting,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The verse was only stated to permit the north, for it is possible. And is it not so? And what about light holy items that were permitted in all directions, were they not permitted from their place to the Holy of Holies? Holy of Holies that were only permitted in the north, it is not the same that they were not permitted from their place to light holy items. It is stated: "Ohel Moed."

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי תנא קמא סבר תלתא קראי כתיבי חד לגופיה דניבעי פתח אהל מועד וחד להכשיר צדדין וחד לפסול צידי צדדין וצפון לא איצטריך קרא
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? The first tanna holds three verses are written. One to itself, that we require entrance of the Tent of Meeting. And one to render fit sides, And one to disqualify the sides of the sides, And it was not necessary a verse north,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? The first Tanna holds that three verses are written: one for itself, that the entrance of the Tent of Meeting should be open; one for the qualification of the sides; and one for the disqualification of the sides. The sides of the north do not require a verse.

hebrew_text: ור' אליעזר סבר חד לגופיה דניבעי פתח אהל מועד וחד להכשיר צפון וחד להכשיר צדדין וצידי צדדין לא איצטריך קרא
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer holds one to itself, that we require entrance of the Tent of Meeting. And one to render fit north And one to render fit sides But it was not necessary a verse sides of the sides
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer holds one for itself that it requires a door for the Tent of Meeting, and one for itself to validate the north, and one for itself to validate the sides, and the sides of the sides do not require a verse.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא הכא דכתיב פתח אהל מועד ומאי שנא התם דכתיב לפני אהל מועד קמ"ל כדרב יהודה אמר שמואל דאמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל שלמים ששחטן קודם שיפתחו דלתות ההיכל פסולין שנאמר (ויקרא ג, ב) ושחטו פתח אהל מועד בזמן שהוא פתוח ולא בזמן שהוא נעול
human_translation: What is different here that it is written: “At the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” and what is different there that it is written: “Before the Tent of Meeting” teaches us in accordance with that Rav Yehuda Shmuel says. As Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Peace offerings that one slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are disqualified, as it is stated “And he shall slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” when is open and not when it is locked.
llm_translation: What is the difference here that it is written "he shall slaughter at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," and what is the difference there that it is written "before the Tent of Meeting"? It teaches us, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Peace-offerings that were slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary are invalid, as it is stated, "And he shall slaughter at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," when it is open, and not when it is closed.

hebrew_text: איתמר נמי אמר מר עוקבא בר חמא אמר רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא שלמים ששחטן קודם שיפתחו דלתות ההיכל פסולין שנאמר ושחטו פתח אהל מועד בזמן שפתח ההיכל פתוח ולא בזמן שהוא נעול
human_translation: It was also stated: Mar Ukva bar Ḥama says Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Peace offerings that one slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are disqualified, as it is stated “He shall slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” when the entrance of the Sanctuary is open, and not when it is locked.
llm_translation: It was also stated: Mar Ukva son of Hama said in the name of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina: Peace-offerings that were slaughtered before the opening of the doors of the Sanctuary are invalid, as it is stated, "And they shall slaughter the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." This is when the Sanctuary is open, but not when it is closed.

hebrew_text: במערבא מתני הכי אמר רב יעקב בר אחא אמר רב אשי שלמים ששחטן קודם שיפתחו דלתות ההיכל פסולים ובמשכן קודם שיעמידו לוים את המשכן ולאחר שיפרקו לוים את המשכן פסולים
human_translation: In the West, they teach like this: Rav Ya’akov bar Aḥa says Rav Ashi says: Peace offerings that one slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are disqualified. And in the Tabernacle, before Levites erected the Tabernacle or after Levites dismantled the Tabernacle are disqualified.
llm_translation: In the West, it was taught: Rav Yaakov bar Acha said in the name of Rav Ashi, "Peace offerings that were slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are invalid. And in the Tabernacle, they must be offered before the Levites set up the Tabernacle. And after the Levites dismantle the Tabernacle, offerings are invalid."

hebrew_text: פשיטא מוגף כנעול דמי וילון מאי א"ר זירא הוא עצמו אין נעשה אלא כפתח פתוח
human_translation: obvious closed as if it were locked. a curtain what Rabbi Zeira says: itself is made only like an open entrance,
llm_translation: It is obvious. A plague is like a locked door. What is the ruling? Rabbi Zeira said: It itself is only made like an open doorway.

hebrew_text: גובהה מאי ת"ש דתניא ר' יוסי בר' יהודה אומר שני פשפשין היו בבית החליפות וגובהן שמנה כדי להכשיר את העזרה כולה לאכילת קדשי קדשים ולשחיטת קדשים קלים
human_translation: What a tall Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There were two wickets, in the Chamber of Knives, and their height eight in order to render fit the entire courtyard for the eating of offerings of the most sacred order, and for the slaughter of offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: Height, what is it? Come and hear: as it was taught in a baraita, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There were two steps in the Beit Hamikdash, and their height was eight handbreadths in order to make the entire Azarah fit for eating the Holy of Holies and for slaughtering the lighter holy offerings.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו דאיכא קמייהו שמונה לא דגבהו נינהו שמונה
human_translation: What, is not that in front of eight No, their height eight
llm_translation: What is the negative aspect that there are eight before Him? They are eight.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כל השערים שהיו שם גובהן עשרים אמה ורוחבן עשר אמה פשפשין שאני
human_translation: raises an objection All the gates that were there, twenty cubits high and ten cubits wide. wickets are different,
llm_translation: The question was raised: All gates that were there, their height was twenty cubits and their width ten cubits - they are different.

hebrew_text: והאיכא צדדין דמעייל להו בקרן זוית
human_translation: But there are sides, that they inserted in corner
llm_translation: And there are sides that bring them to the corner horn.

hebrew_text: אחורי בית הכפורת מאי תא שמע דאמר רמי בר רב יהודה אמר רב לול קטן היה אחורי בית הכפורת גבוה שמונה אמות כדי להכשיר את העזרה לאכילת קדשי קדשים ולשחיטת קדשים קלים והיינו דכתי' (דברי הימים א כו, יח) שנים לפר בר מאי לפר בר אמר רבה בר רב שילא כמאן דאמר כלפי בר
human_translation: What behind the Hall of the Ark Cover, Come hear, as Rami bar Rav Yehuda says Rav says: There was a small niche behind the Hall of the Ark Cover, eight cubits high. in order to render fit the entire courtyard for the eating of offerings of the most sacred order, and for the slaughter of offerings of lesser sanctity. And this is as it is written: two at the precinct” What “For the precinct [ laparbar ]”? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: like one who says: Facing outward [ kelappei bar ].
llm_translation: Behind the curtain of the Holy of Holies, what is the reason? - as Rami bar Rav Yehuda said that Rav Lul said: It was a small winding staircase behind the curtain of the Holy of Holies, eight cubits high, in order to make the Temple courtyard fit for the consumption of the most holy offerings and the slaughtering of the lighter holy offerings. And this is as it is written (1 Chronicles 26:18): "two to the bull at a time." What is meant by "two to the bull"? - Rabba bar Rav Shila said: Like someone who says, "towards the son of."

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה אמר שמואל אין חייבין משום טומאה אלא על
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: liable for ritual impurity only with regard to
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One is not liable on account of impurity except for

hebrew_text: אורך מאה ושמונים ושבע על רוחב מאה ושלשים וחמש
human_translation: length 187 by 135 width.
llm_translation: Length one hundred and eighty-seven over width one hundred and thirty-five.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דרב נחמן כל העזרה היתה קפ"ז על רוחב קל"ה אמר ליה הכי אמר לי אבא כגון זה כהנים נכנסין לשם ואוכלין שם קדשי קדשים ושוחטין שם קדשים קלים וחייבין משום טומאה
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: The entire courtyard was 187 by 135 width. said to My father said this to me: such as this, priests enter there and eat offerings of the most sacred order there, and slaughter offerings of lesser sanctity there, and are liable due to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: A Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: All the Temple Courtyard was 187 cubits in length by 135 in width. He said to him: So did Abba tell me, such as this: Priests enter there and eat there holy of holies, and slaughter there common holy offerings, and are liable for impurity.

hebrew_text: למעוטי מאי אילימא למעוטי חלונות דלתות ועובי החומה תנינא החלונות ועובי החומה כלפנים
human_translation: to exclude what? If we say to exclude windows, doors, and thickness of the wall, we learn The windows and the thickness of the wall as though inside
llm_translation: Regarding the exclusions, what does it come to exclude? If you say it comes to exclude windows, doors, and the thickness of the wall, we have learned: windows and the thickness of the wall are in all cases.

hebrew_text: ואלא למעוטי לשכות ואי בנויות בחול ופתוחות לקדש והתנן תוכן קודש מדרבנן
human_translation: But rather, to exclude chambers And if built in the non-sacred and open to the sacred but didn’t we learn their interior sacred by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: And rather to exclude the chambers, and if they are built in secular areas and open to the sanctuary. And we learned in a Mishnah: Their interior is sanctified by rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: ודאורייתא לא והתניא לשכות בנויות בחול ופתוחות לקדש מנין שהכהנים נכנסין לשם ואוכלין שם קדשי קדשים ושירי מנחה תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ו, ט) בחצר אהל מועד יאכלוה התורה ריבתה חצירות הרבה אצל אכילה אחת
human_translation: And not by Torah law? But isn’t it taught chambers built in the non-sacred and open to the sacred from where that the priests enter there and eat there offerings of the most sacred order and the remainders of meal offerings? The verse states in the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting they shall eat it.” the Torah amplified many courtyards with one eating,
llm_translation: And from the Torah, no. And it was taught: "Dwellings built in the secular area and open to the sacred area, from where do we derive that the priests enter there and eat there the holy of holies and the remnants of the meal offering?" The Torah teaches to say (Leviticus 6:9), "In the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting they shall eat it." The Torah multiplied courtyards greatly in comparison to one eating.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא לאכילה שאני
human_translation: Rava said: concerning eating different.
llm_translation: Rava said, "Regarding eating, it is different."

hebrew_text: אבל לענין טומאה לא והתניא לשכות הבנויות לחול ופתוחות לקודש כהנים נכנסין לשם ואוכלין שם קדשי קדשים ואין שוחטין שם קדשים קלים וחייבין משום טומאה
human_translation: But with regard to ritual impurity, not But isn’t it taught chambers that are built in the non-sacred and open to the sacred priests enter there and eat offerings of the most sacred order there, but may not slaughter offerings of lesser sanctity there, and are liable due to ritual impurity
llm_translation: But regarding impurity not. And it was taught: Regarding chambers that are built for secular use and open to sanctity, priests may enter there and eat there holy of holies, but they do not slaughter light sanctities there, and they are liable due to impurity.

hebrew_text: לאו אמרת אין שוחטין תני נמי אין חייבין
human_translation: Did you not say they may not slaughter teach also: They are not liable
llm_translation: Not did you say not slaughter, also taught not obligated.

hebrew_text: בשלמא אין שוחטין בעינא כנגד הפתח וליכא אלא אין חייבין אמאי
human_translation: Granted, may not slaughter requires before the entrance and is not. But why not liable
llm_translation: In peace, we do not slaughter in front of the opening, and there is only no obligation. Why?

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך אין שוחטין מי לא עסקינן דאיכא שחיטה כנגד הפתח דאי ליכא למאי איצטריך אלא אף על גב דקא שחיט כנגד הפתח תני אין שוחטין משום דלא קדיש תני נמי אין חייבין
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, may not slaughter are we not dealing which there is slaughter before the entrance, As if not, for what was necessary Rather, even though he slaughters before the entrance, teaches may not slaughter because is not sacred. teach also are not liable
llm_translation: And to your taste, we do not slaughter. We are not dealing with a case where there is slaughter opposite the entrance. For if there is not, what is the need? Rather, even though he is slaughtering opposite the entrance, it teaches: we do not slaughter because it is not sanctified. It also teaches: we are not liable.

hebrew_text: ולאכילה לא בעינן כנגד הפתח והתניא רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר שני פשפשין היו בבית החליפות גובהן שמונה כדי להכשיר את העזרה לאכילת קדשי קדשים ולשחיטת קדשים קלים אמר רבינא סמי מכאן אכילה
human_translation: And for eating do we not require before the entrance But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There were two wickets in the Chamber of Knives, their height eight in order to render fit the courtyard for the eating of offerings of the most sacred order, and for the slaughter of offerings of lesser sanctity? Ravina said: Remove from here eating.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We do not require for eating opposite the entrance. And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says, "There were two lintels in the Chamber of the Vestibule, their height was eight handbreadths in order to render the Azarah fit for eating Kodshim Kalim and for slaughtering Kodshim Kalim." Ravina said, "From here we learn the laws of eating."

hebrew_text: והכתיב (ויקרא ח, לא) בשלו את הבשר פתח אהל מועד ושם תאכלו אותו קדשי שעה שאני:
human_translation: But isn’t it written Cook the meat at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting; and eat it there” Offerings time are different.
llm_translation: "And it is written (Leviticus 8:31), 'And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons: Boil the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and there you shall eat it, the holy portion of the offering.' This is a temporary sanctity, different."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר אבודימי מנין לדם שנפסל בשקיעת החמה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, טז) ביום הקריבו את זבחו יאכל ביום שאתה זובח אתה מקריב ביום שאי אתה זובח אי אתה מקריב
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi says: From where that the blood becomes disqualified at sunset as it is stated it shall be eaten on the day that he sacrifices his offering [ zivḥo ], on the day that you slaughter [ zove’aḥ ] you sacrifice on the day that you do not slaughter you may not sacrifice
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said: From where do we derive the disqualification of blood that occurred at sunset? As it is stated (Leviticus 7:16), "On the day he offers his sacrifice, it shall be eaten; on the day of his offering he shall offer it; and on the next day."

hebrew_text: האי מיבעי ליה
human_translation: he requires this
llm_translation: This requires him.

hebrew_text: לגופיה אם כן נימא קרא ביום זבחו יאכל הקריבו למה לי ש"מ ביום שאתה זובח אתה מקריב ביום שאי אתה זובח אי אתה מקריב
human_translation: for itself, If so, let the verse state: On the day he slaughters it shall it be eaten, Why do I “that he sacrifices it”? Conclude from on the day that you slaughter you sacrifice on a day that you do not slaughter you do not sacrifice
llm_translation: Regarding itself, if so, let us say: the verse states, "On the day of his sacrifice, he shall eat it." Why do I need this? Learn from it: on the day that you slaughter, you offer; on the day that you do not slaughter, you do not offer.

hebrew_text: ודילמא ה"ק רחמנא אי קריב דם האידנא ניתאכיל בשר האידנא ולמחר אי קריב דם למחר ניתאכיל בשר למחר וליומא אוחרא אם כן נימא קרא ביום הקריבו יאכל זבחו למה לי שמע מינה ביום שאתה זובח אתה מקריבו ביום שאי אתה זובח אי אתה מקריבו:
human_translation: But perhaps this the Merciful One is saying: If blood is sacrificed today, meat be eaten today and tomorrow. If blood is sacrificed tomorrow, meat may be eaten tomorrow and the following day. If so, let the verse state: On the day it is sacrificed it shall be eaten, Why do I his offering”? Conclude from on the day that you slaughter you sacrifice on a day that you do not slaughter you do not sacrifice
llm_translation: And perhaps one might say: The Merciful One, if one offers the blood today, the meat is eaten today; and if one offers the blood tomorrow, the meat is eaten tomorrow. And for the following day, if so, let us say: The verse states, "On the day of his offering, it shall be eaten." What do I need this for? Conclude from it: On the day that you slaughter, you shall offer it; on a day that you do not slaughter, you do not offer it.

hebrew_text: איתמר המחשב לאור שלישי חזקיה אמר כשר רבי יוחנן אמר פסול חזקיה אמר כשר דהא לא אינתיק לשריפה רבי יוחנן אמר פסול דהא אידחי ליה מאכילה
human_translation: It was stated: one who intends on the evening third Ḥizkiyya says: valid, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: disqualified. Ḥizkiyya says valid because not been removed for burning. Rabbi Yoḥanan says disqualified, because it has been rejected from eaten.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who calculates for the third light. Hezekiah said: It is valid. Rabbi Yohanan said: It is invalid. Hezekiah said: It is valid, for it does not depart for burning. Rabbi Yohanan said: It is invalid, for it is set aside for consumption.

hebrew_text: האוכל לאור שלישי חזקיה אמר פטור דלא אינתיק לשריפה רבי יוחנן אמר חייב דהא אידחי לי' מאכילה
human_translation: one who eats on the evening third Ḥizkiyya says: exempt because not been removed for burning. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable because it has been rejected from eaten.
llm_translation: The one who eats on the third day, Hezekiah said exempt, for it does not ignite for burning. Rabbi Yochanan said liable, for it is considered food for me.

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי יוחנן קדשים הנאכלין ליום אחד מחשבין בדמן משתשקע החמה ובבשרן ובאימוריהן משיעלה עמוד השחר קדשים הנאכלין לשני ימים ולילה אחת מחשבין בדמן משתשקע החמה ובאימוריהן משיעלה עמוד השחר ובבשרן משתשקע החמה של שני ימים:
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: sacrificial that may be eaten for one day, intends to their blood after sunset, or to their meat or to their sacrificial portions after the first rays of dawn, sacrificial that may be eaten for two days and one night, intends to their blood after sunset, or to their sacrificial portions after the first rays of dawn, or to their meat after sunset of two days,
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan: Regarding holy items that are consumed within one day, their blood is considered as if it were poured out when the sun sets, and their flesh and their fats when dawn breaks. Regarding holy items that are consumed within two days and one night, their blood is considered as if it were poured out when the sun sets, and their fats when dawn breaks, and their flesh when the sun sets of the second day.

hebrew_text: ת"ר יכול יהו נאכלין לאור שלישי ודין הוא זבחים נאכלין ליום אחד וזבחים נאכלין לשני ימים מה זבחים הנאכלין ליום אחד לילה אחריהן אף זבחים הנאכלין לשני ימים לילה אחריהן
human_translation: The Sages taught: might may be eaten on the evening third And this a logical inference: offerings, are eaten for one day, and offerings are eaten for two days. Just as offerings that are eaten for one day, night follows so too, offerings that are eaten for two days, night follows
llm_translation: The Sages taught: It might have been thought that Jehu's sacrifices are eaten until the third day, and it is a judgment; sacrifices are eaten for one day, and sacrifices are eaten for two days. Just as sacrifices that are eaten for one day have the following night, so too sacrifices that are eaten for two days have the following night.

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר (ויקרא יט, ו) והנותר עד יום בעוד יום הוא נאכל ואינו נאכל לאור שלישי
human_translation: the verse states: and if any remains until day, it may be eaten while daytime, but it may not be eaten on the evening third
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches (Leviticus 19:6), "And that which remains until the third day shall be burned with fire."

hebrew_text: יכול ישרף מיד ודין הוא זבחים נאכלין ליום אחד וזבחים נאכלין לשני ימים מה זבחים הנאכלין ליום אחד תיכף לאכילה שריפה אף זבחים הנאכלין לשני ימים תיכף לאכילה שריפה
human_translation: might be burned immediately and this a logical inference: offerings are eaten for one day, and offerings are eaten for two days. Just as offerings that are eaten for one day, immediately for eating burning so too, offerings that are eaten for two days immediately for eating burning
llm_translation: Could it be that it should be burned immediately, and it is a judgment? Sacrifices that are eaten in one day and sacrifices that are eaten for two days. Just as sacrifices that are eaten in one day are immediately for eating, burning, so too sacrifices that are eaten for two days are immediately for eating, burning.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא יט, ז) ביום השלישי באש ישרף ביום אתה שורפו ואי אתה שורפו בלילה:
human_translation: the verse states: on the third day, it shall be burned with fire” You burn it during the day, but you may not burn it during the night.
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught (Leviticus 19:7), 'On the third day it shall be burned with fire.' On the day you burn it, and if not on the day, you do not burn it at night."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הבכור והמעשר והפסח קדשים קלים שחיטתן בכל מקום בעזרה ודמן טעון מתנה אחת ובלבד שיתן כנגד היסוד
human_translation: The firstborn the tithe and the Paschal offering are offerings of lesser sanctity. Their slaughter is anywhere in the courtyard, and their blood requires one placement, provided that places it on the base
llm_translation: Mishnah: The firstborn, the tithe, and the Passover offering are light sanctities; their slaughter is valid anywhere in the Temple courtyard, and their blood requires only one placement, provided that it is placed opposite the base.

hebrew_text: שינה באכילתן הבכור נאכל לכהנים והמעשר לכל אדם ונאכלין בכל העיר בכל מאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד הפסח אינו נאכל אלא בלילה ואינו נאכל אלא עד חצות ואינו נאכל אלא למנויו ואינו נאכל אלא צלי:
human_translation: differs with regard to their consumption. The firstborn is eaten by the priests, and the tithe by any person, And they are eaten throughout the city in any food for two days and one night. The Paschal offering is eaten only at night, and it is eaten only until midnight, and it is eaten only by its registrants, and it is eaten only roasted,
llm_translation: The firstborn is eaten by the priests, and the tithe by everyone, and they are eaten in every city with any food for two days and one night. The Passover offering is only eaten at night, and it is only eaten until midnight, and it is only eaten by those designated, and it is only eaten roasted.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאן תנא אמר רב חסדא ר' יוסי הגלילי היא דתניא ר' יוסי הגלילי אומר חלבו לא נאמר אלא חלבם דמו לא נאמר אלא דמם לימד על בכור ומעשר ופסח שטעונין מתן דמים ואימורין לגבי מזבח
human_translation: Who taught Rav Ḥisda says it is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: It is not stated: Its fat, but “Their fat.” it is not stated: Its blood, but “Their blood.” teaches with regard to a firstborn and tithe and a Paschal offering, that they require placement of their blood and sacrificial portions on the altar.
llm_translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna that said? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, as it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: It was not stated "his fat" but rather "their fat," it was not stated "his blood" but rather "their blood." This teaches about the firstborn animal, the tithe, and the Paschal lamb, which require the giving of blood and sacrificial portions on the altar.

hebrew_text: כנגד היסוד מנא לן א"ר אליעזר אתיא זריקה זריקה מעולה
human_translation: From where do we on the base Rabbi Eliezer says: derived “sprinkling” from “sprinkling” a burnt offering.
llm_translation: Opposite the foundation, how do we know? Rabbi Eliezer said: "Zerikah zerikah is superior."

hebrew_text: ועולה גופה מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא ד, ז) אל יסוד מזבח העולה למד על עולת חובה שטעונה יסוד
human_translation: And from where do we a burnt offering itself as it is written: at the base of the altar of the burnt offering” teaches that an obligatory burnt offering requires base
llm_translation: "And its elevation, from where do we derive? As it is written (Leviticus 4:7), 'At the base of the altar of the burnt offering.' Learn from the obligatory burnt offering that it requires a base."

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן שתי מתנות שהן ארבע אף כאן שתי מתנות שהן ארבע
human_translation: If just as there, two placements that are four, so too here, two placements that are four,
llm_translation: If what is there, two gifts that are four, also here, two gifts that are four.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי למה לי למכתב (ויקרא א, ה) סביב בעולה סביב בחטאת הוו שני כתובין הבאין כאחד וכל שני כתובין הבאין כאחד אין מלמדין
human_translation: Abaye says: Why do I to write: around with regard to a burnt offering, around with regard to a sin offering? They are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Why do I need the writing "surrounding" in the case of the burnt offering and surrounding in the case of the sin offering? Two scriptures that come together as one, and any two scriptures that come together as one do not teach.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד אין מלמדין אלא למ"ד מלמדין מאי איכא למימר הוי אשם שלשה ושלשה ודאי אין מלמדין:
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says do not teach But according to the one who says teach what is there to say? a guilt offering, there are three and three certainly do not teach
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says: we only teach according to the one who says. What can be said to this? Be guilty of three and three, and certainly we do not teach.

hebrew_text: הבכור נאכל לכהנים: ת"ר מנין לבכור שנאכל לשני ימים ולילה שנאמר (במדבר יח, יח) ובשרם יהיה לך כחזה התנופה וכשוק הימין הקישו הכתוב לחזה ושוק של שלמים מה שלמים נאכלין לשני ימים ולילה אחד אף בכור נאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: The firstborn eaten by the priests, The Sages taught From where with regard to a firstborn that eaten for two days and night? as it is stated “And their flesh shall be yours, as the breast of waving and as the right thigh” The verse juxtaposes with the breast and thigh of peace offerings. Just as peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too, a firstborn eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: The firstborn is eaten by the priests: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that the firstborn is eaten for two days and one night? As it is stated (Numbers 18:18), "Their flesh shall be yours, like the breast of the wave offering and like the right thigh." The verse compared the breast and thigh of the peace offerings to the breast and thigh of the firstborn. Just as the peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too the firstborn is eaten for two days and one night.

hebrew_text: וזו שאלה נשאלה לפני חכמים בכרם ביבנה בכור לכמה נאכל נענה ר"ט ואמר לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: And this question was asked before the Sages in the vineyard, in Yavne: For how many a firstborn eaten? Rabbi Tarfon responded and said: For two days and one night.
llm_translation: And this question was asked before the sages in Karm BeYavneh: "For how many days should the firstborn be eaten?" Rabbi Tarfon answered and said: "For two days and one night."

hebrew_text: היה שם תלמיד אחד שבא לבית המדרש לפני חכמים תחלה ור' יוסי הגלילי שמו אמר לו רבי מנין לך אמר לו בני שלמים קדשים קלים ובכור קדשים קלים מה שלמים נאכלין לשני ימים ולילה אחד אף בכור נאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: There was one student there who came to the study hall before the Sages first and his name Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. He said to My teacher, from where do you said to him: My son, peace offerings offerings of lesser sanctity, and a firstborn an offering of lesser sanctity. Just as peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too, a firstborn eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: There was a certain student who came to the study hall before the sages for the first time, and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean was his name. Rabbi said to him, "How many are you?" He said to him, "Peaceful are light and firstborn are light. Just as peaceful offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too, firstborn offerings are eaten for two days and one night."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי בכור מתנה לכהן וחטאת ואשם מתנה לכהן מה חטאת ואשם ליום ולילה אף בכור ליום ולילה
human_translation: said to him: My teacher, A firstborn a gift to the priest, and a sin offering and a guilt offering a gift to the priest. Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering for day and night, so too, a firstborn for day and night.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Bekor: "Gift to the priest and sin offering and guilt offering gift to the priest. Just as sin offering and guilt offering for a day and a night, so too firstborn for a day and a night."

hebrew_text: אמר לו נדון דבר מ (תוך) דבר ונלמד דבר מ (תוך) דבר מה שלמים אין באין על חטא אף בכור אינו בא על חטא מה שלמים נאכלים לשני ימים ולילה אחד אף בכור נאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: said to him: Let us judge a matter from a matter and learn a matter from a matter, Just as peace offerings do not come for a sin, so too, a firstborn does not come for a sin. Just as peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too, a firstborn eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: He said to him: "We will analyze a matter within a matter, and learn a matter within a matter. Just as shlamin (peace offerings) do not come for a sin, so too a firstborn does not come for a sin. Just as shlamin are eaten for two days and one night, so too a firstborn is eaten for two days and one night."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי נדון דבר מדבר ילמד דבר מדבר חטאת ואשם מתנה לכהן ובכור מתנה לכהן מה חטאת ואשם אין באין בנדר ונדבה אף בכור אינו בנדר ונדבה מה חטאת ואשם נאכלין ליום אחד אף בכור נאכל ליום אחד
human_translation: said to him: My teacher, Let us judge a matter from a matter learn a matter from a matter, A sin offering and a guilt offering a gift to the priest, and a firstborn a gift to the priest. Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering do not come as a vow or a gift so too, a firstborn does not as a vow or as a gift Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering are eaten for one day so too, a firstborn eaten for one day
llm_translation: He said to him, "Rabbi, a matter from a matter shall teach: a sin offering and a guilt offering are a gift to the priest, and a firstborn is a gift to the priest. Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering are not brought in as vows and freewill offerings, so too a firstborn is not brought in as a vow and freewill offering. Just as a sin offering and a guilt offering are eaten for one day, so too a firstborn is eaten for one day."

hebrew_text: קפץ ר"ע ונסתלק ר"ט אמר לו הרי הוא אומר ובשרם יהיה לך הקישן הכתוב לחזה ושוק של שלמים מה שלמים נאכלין לשני ימים ולילה אחד אף בכור נאכל לשני ימים ולילה אחד
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva jumped and Rabbi Tarfon left. said to But states: “And their flesh shall be yours, The verse juxtaposes with a breast and thigh of peace offerings. Just as peace offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too, a firstborn eaten for two days and one night.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva jumped and Rabbi Tarfon departed. He said to him: "Behold, it says, 'And their flesh shall be yours.' The verse juxtaposes the breast and the thigh of the peace-offering. Just as the peace-offerings are eaten for two days and one night, so too the firstborn is eaten for two days and one night."

hebrew_text: אמר לו היקשתו לחזה ושוק של שלמים ואני מקישו לחזה ושוק של תודה מה תודה נאכלת ליום ולילה אף בכור נאכל ליום ולילה
human_translation: said to You juxtaposed it with a breast and thigh of peace offerings. But I juxtapose it with a breast and thigh of a thanks offering, Just as a thanks offering is eaten for day and night, so too, a firstborn eaten for day and night.
llm_translation: He said to him: "You compared it to the breast and the thigh of peace-offerings, and I compare it to the breast and the thigh of thanksgiving-offerings. Just as the thanksgiving-offering is eaten for a day and a night, so too the firstborn is eaten for a day and a night."

hebrew_text: אמר לו הרי הוא אומר ובשרם יהיה לך שאין ת"ל לך יהיה ומה ת"ל לך יהיה הוסיף הכתוב הויה אחרת בבכור
human_translation: said to but states: “And their flesh shall be yours, Since no the verse to state “It shall be yours,” what the verse states “It shall be yours”? The verse adds another for a firstborn be
llm_translation: He said to him: "Behold, He says, 'And their flesh shall be yours.'" For it does not say 'shall be for you,' but 'shall be yours.' And what does 'shall be yours' teach us? The Scripture added another existence in the firstborn.

hebrew_text: וכשנאמרו דברים לפני ר' ישמעאל אמר להן צאו ואמרו לו לר"ע טעיתה תודה מהיכן למדה משלמים [וכי] דבר הלמד בהיקש חוזר ומלמד בהיקש הא אין עליך לידון בלשון אחרון אלא בלשון ראשון
human_translation: And when these matters were said before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to Go out and tell Rabbi Akiva: You were mistaken From where is derived a thanks offering from a peace offering. And can a matter derived via a juxtaposition then teach via a juxtaposition? Consequently, you should not infer from the latter formulation but from the first formulation
llm_translation: And when words were said before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to them, "Go out." And they said to Rabbi Akiva, "You have erred." From where did you learn about thanksgiving offerings? Is it a matter that is learned through a comparison? One who teaches through a comparison, goes back and teaches through a comparison. Here, you are not obligated to judge based on the latter language, but rather based on the former language.

hebrew_text: ור' ישמעאל האי לך יהיה מאי עביד לי' לימד על בכור בעל מום שהוא מתנה לכהן שלא מצינו בכל התורה
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Yishmael do with this “It shall be yours”? teaches about a blemished firstborn that it is a gift to the priest, as we have not found in the entire Torah
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael this "to you it shall be" what does it do for him? It teaches about a firstborn with a blemish that is a gift to a priest, which we did not find in the entire Torah.

hebrew_text: ור"ע יליף ליה מבשרם חד תם וחד בעל מום ור' ישמעאל מבשרם דהנך בכורות קאמר
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva He derives it from “their flesh,” both an unblemished and a blemished And Rabbi Yishmael saying from the flesh of these firstborn
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva derives from their flesh, one unblemished and one blemished, and Rabbi Yishmael derives from their flesh, those firstborns he is speaking of.

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי מ"ס הימנו ודבר אחר הוי היקש ומ"ס לא הוי היקש
human_translation: with regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds from that and another is a juxtaposition. And Sage, holds is not a juxtaposition,
llm_translation: With what do they argue? "Moses" is from him, and another explanation is: it is a comparison, and "Moses" is not a comparison.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד לא הוי היקש היינו דכתיב (ויקרא טז, טז) וכן יעשה לאהל מועד
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says is not a juxtaposition, this is that it is written “And so shall he do for the Tent of Meeting
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who says it is not a valid comparison, this is as it is written (Leviticus 16:16), "And so shall he do for the Tent of Meeting."

hebrew_text: כשם שמזה לפני ולפנים אחת למעלה ושבע למטה מדם הפר כך מזה בהיכל
human_translation: Just as sprinkles in the innermost sanctum, once above and seven below, with the blood of the bull, so he sprinkles in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: Just as from here forward and backward one above and seven below from the blood of the bull, so too from here in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: וכשם שלפני ולפנים אחת למעלה ושבע למטה מדם השעיר כך מזה בהיכל
human_translation: And just as in the innermost sanctum once above and seven below, with the blood of the goat, so he sprinkles in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: And as before and previously, one above and seven below from the blood of the goat, so too from this in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד הוי היקש מאי איכא למימר מקומות הוא דגמרי מהדדי
human_translation: But according to the one who says is a juxtaposition, what can be said? It is locations that are derived from one another
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who learns it, it is necessary to establish a comparison. What is there to say about it? It is places that they learn from each other.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא חוץ מפנים בחד זימנא גמיר
human_translation: And if you wish, say outside is derived from inside, all at once.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: except for "faces" one time it is learned.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד הוי היקש היינו דכתיב (ויקרא כג, יז) ממושבותיכם תביאו לחם תנופה
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says is not a juxtaposition, this is that it is written “You shall bring out of your dwellings two wave loaves
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who says there should be an analogy, this is as it is written (Leviticus 23:17): "From your dwellings you shall bring bread as a wave offering."

hebrew_text: שאין ת"ל תביאו מה ת"ל תביאו כל שאתה מביא ממקום (למקום) אחר הרי הוא כזה מה להלן עשרון לחלה אף כאן עשרון לחלה
human_translation: Since no the verse to state: “You shall bring,” why the verse state: “You shall bring”? anything that you bring from another place shall be like this. Just as there, a tenth for loaf, so too here, a tenth for loaf.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Sh'ein t"l tavi'u mah t"l tavi'u kol sh'atah mavi mimakom (lemakom) acher hinei hu kaze mah lehachan asaron lachala af kan asaron lachala."

hebrew_text: אי מה להלן שני עשרונים אף כאן שני עשרונים ת"ל תהיינה
human_translation: If just as there, two-tenths so too here, two-tenths the verse states: “They shall be,”
llm_translation: If there, twelve, also here, twelve, it is written, they shall be.

hebrew_text: ולמדנו עשרה לחמץ עשרה למצה מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יג) על חלת לחם חמץ נגד חמץ הבא מצה
human_translation: And we have learned ten for leavened bread. From where ten for matza the verse states: “With cakes of leavened bread” bring matza corresponding to leavened bread.
llm_translation: And we learned ten for leaven, ten for matzah, from where do we derive? It is written (Leviticus 7:13), "With loaves of leavened bread he shall offer his offering with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offerings."

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דאמר (לא) הוי היקש מאי איכא למימר תביאו יתירא היא:
human_translation: But according to the one who says is a juxtaposition, what is there to say? “You shall bring,” is extra,
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "Do not be concerned," what can be said? It is an additional proof.

hebrew_text: הפסח אינו נאכל: מאן תנא אמר רב יוסף רבי אלעזר בן עזריה היא דתניא רבי אלעזר [בן עזריה] אומר נאמר כאן (שמות יב, ח) בלילה [הזה] ונאמר להלן (שמות יב, יב) ועברתי בארץ מצרים בלילה הזה
human_translation: The Paschal offering is eaten only Who is the tanna Rav Yosef said it is Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. As it is taught Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: It is stated here: “On that night,” And it is stated there, “And I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night
llm_translation: Passover is not eaten: Who is the Tanna? Rav Yosef said Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. It is as it was taught: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says, It is stated here (Exodus 12:8) "on this night," and it is stated there (Exodus 12:12) "I will pass through the land of Egypt on this night."

hebrew_text: מה להלן עד חצות אף כאן עד חצות
human_translation: Just as there, until midnight, so too, here, until midnight
llm_translation: What is there until midnight, so too here until midnight.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר"ע והלא כבר נאמר ואכלתם אותו בחפזון עד שעת חפזון
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to But isn’t it stated: and you will eat it in haste, until the time of haste,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva, "But hasn't it already been said, 'And you shall eat it in haste, it is the Lord's Passover'?"

hebrew_text: א"כ מה ת"ל בלילה הזה שיכול יהא ככל הקדשים הנאכלים ביום ת"ל בלילה בלילה יהא נאכל ואינו נאכל ביום
human_translation: If so, why the verse state: “On that night,” as might like all the offerings that it should be eaten during the day, the verse states: “On night,” shall be eaten at night, but it shall not be eaten during the day.
llm_translation: So what does the Torah teach us by stating "on this night"? That it should be like all the holy things that are eaten during the day. It teaches us "on this night" - on this night it should be eaten and not during the day.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי וממאי דרבי אלעזר ב"ע ודאורייתא דלמא דרבנן ולהרחיק מן העבירה א"כ מאי אלא עד חצות [אלא] כי התם מה התם דאורייתא אף כאן נמי דאוריית':

llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: And according to the opinion of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, is it from the Torah or perhaps from the Rabbis? And to distance oneself from sin, if so, what then? Rather, until midnight. Just as there, from the Torah, so too here, from the Torah.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ קדשי קדשים ששחטן בראש המזבח רבי יוסי אומר כאילו נשחטו בצפון ר' יוסי בר' יהודה אומר מחצי המזבח ולדרום כדרום מחצי המזבח ולצפון כצפון:
human_translation: offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered atop the altar, Rabbi Yosei says: as though they were slaughtered in the north, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: from the halfway point of the altar and to the south like the south, from the halfway point of the altar and to the north like the north.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The most holy sacrifices, if slaughtered at the top of the altar, Rabbi Yosei says: as if they were slaughtered in the north. hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב אסי א"ר יוחנן אומר היה ר' יוסי כוליה מזבח בצפון קאי ומאי כאילו מהו דתימא בעינן על ירך וליכא קמ"ל

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי זירא לרב אסי אלא מעתה לר' יוסי ברבי יהודה הכי נמי דחציו בצפון וחציו בדרום

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הכי נמי והא את הוא דאמרת משמיה דרבי יוחנן מודי רבי יוסי בר"י שאם שחטן כנגדן בקרקע פסולה
