hebrew_text: אמר רב מזבח שנפגם כל הקדשים שנשחטו שם פסולין מקרא הוא בידינו ושכחנוהו כי סליק מרב כהנא אשכחיה לר"ש ברבי דקאמר משום ר' ישמעאל בר' יוסי מנין למזבח שנפגם שכל הקדשים שנשחטו שם פסולין
human_translation: Rav says: an altar that was damaged, all sacrificial that were slaughtered there disqualified. We have a verse but we have forgotten it When Rav Kahana, ascended he found Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi saying in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei: From where an altar that was damaged, that all sacrificial that were slaughtered there disqualified?
llm_translation: Rav said: "A damaged altar, all the sacrifices that were slaughtered there are invalid." It is a verse in our hands, and we have forgotten it. When Rav Kahana ascended, he found Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, and he said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yose: "From where do we derive that an altar that is damaged, all the sacrifices that were slaughtered there are invalid?"

hebrew_text: שנאמר (שמות כ, כד) וזבחת עליו את עולותיך ואת שלמיך וכי עליו אתה זובח אלא כשהוא שלם ולא כשהוא חסר אמר היינו קרא דאישתמיט ליה לרב
human_translation: as it is stated and you shall slaughter upon it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings [ shelamekha ]” Is it you slaughter on rather, when is complete [ shalem ], but not when it is lacking, said: This is the verse that eluded Rav.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated (Exodus 20:24), "And you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and your peace offerings upon it." And upon it you sacrifice? Rather, when it is whole and not when it is lacking. This is the verse that Rabbi interpreted for him.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר אחד זה ואחד זה פסולין במאי פליגי רב סבר בעלי חיים אינן נדחים ור' יוחנן סבר בעלי חיים נידחין
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Both this and that disqualified, With regard to what disagree? Rav holds living are not deferred, and Rabbi Yoḥanan holds living deferred.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Both this and that are invalid." What do they argue about? Rav holds that living creatures are not disqualified, and Rabbi Yochanan holds that living creatures are disqualified.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כל הקדשים שהיו עד שלא נבנה המזבח ואח"כ נבנה המזבח פסולין נבנה דחויין מעיקרא נינהו
human_translation: raises an objection all sacrificial that were before the altar was built, and then the altar was built, disqualified. was built, initially deferred,
llm_translation: Challenged: All the holy things that were until the altar was not built and afterwards the altar was built disqualified, if built they are considered as if they were pushed aside from the beginning.

hebrew_text: אלא עד שלא נהרס המזבח נהרס הא איזקון להו
human_translation: Rather, before the altar was destroyed destroyed Didn’t become old
llm_translation: Rather, until the altar was not destroyed, was it destroyed? Is it not a disgrace to them?

hebrew_text: אלא עד שלא נפגם המזבח ואחר כך נפגם המזבח פסולין ולא תרוצי קא מתרצת אימא שנשחטו
human_translation: Rather, before the altar was damaged, and subsequently the altar was damaged. disqualified. But did you not emend say that were slaughtered
llm_translation: Rather, until the altar was not damaged, and afterwards the altar was damaged, they are disqualified, and "Lo Tarutzi" is interpreted as saying, "Let us say that they were slaughtered."

hebrew_text: והאמר רב גידל אמר רב מזבח שנעקר מקטירין קטרת במקומו
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Giddel say Rav says: where altar became uprooted one may burn incense in its place?
llm_translation: And Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: "A altar that has been uprooted, one may offer incense in its place."

hebrew_text: כדאמר רבא מודה היה ר' יהודה בדמים הכא נמי מודה רב בדמים
human_translation: like that which Rava says Rabbi Yehuda would concede with regard to blood Here too, Rav concedes with regard to blood
llm_translation: As Rava said, Rabbi Yehuda used to concede regarding blood. Here too, Rav concedes regarding blood.

hebrew_text: מאי ר' יהודה דתניא (מלכים א ח, סד) ביום ההוא קידש המלך תוך החצר וגו' כי מזבח (שעשה משה) קטן מהכיל דברים ככתבן דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: What Rabbi Yehuda? As it is taught “On that day the king sanctified the middle of the court because the copper altar that was before the Lord was too small to receive The matters are as they written, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: What is the explanation of Rabbi Yehuda in the Mishnah? As it was taught (I Kings 8:64), "On that day the king sanctified the middle of the courtyard, etc." This is like the altar (that Moses made), small in size, but containing the words as they were written. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי יוסי
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to him:
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yosei

hebrew_text: והלא כבר נאמר (מלכים א ג, ד) אלף עולות יעלה שלמה על המזבח ההוא ואילו בבית עולמים הוא אומר (מלכים א ח, סג) ויזבח שלמה את זבח השלמים אשר זבח לה' בקר עשרים ושנים אלף
human_translation: But isn’t it already stated “A thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar” while with regard to the Eternal House, it states: “And Solomon offered for the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to the Lord, two and twenty thousand cattle
llm_translation: And isn't it already stated (1 Kings 3:4), "A thousand burnt offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar"? But in the eternal house, it says (1 Kings 8:63), "And Solomon offered a sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to the Lord, cattle twenty-two thousand."

hebrew_text: וכשאתה מגיע לחשבון עולות ולמנין אמות זה גדול מזה
human_translation: And when you arrive at the calculation of burnt offerings and the number of cubits this greater than that,
llm_translation: And when you reach the accounting of burnt offerings and the counting of cubits, this one is greater than that.

hebrew_text: אלא מהו קטן מהכיל כאדם האומר לחבירו פלוני ננס הוא ופסול לעבודה
human_translation: Rather, what is was too small to receive”? like a person who says to his friend: So-and-so is a dwarf [ nanas ], and disqualified from service.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the case of a minor who has the intelligence of an adult? This is like one who says to his fellow, "So-and-so is a miracle-worker, yet he is disqualified for the service."

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה שפיר קאמר ר' יוסי ר' יהודה לטעמיה דאמר מזבח שעשה משה גדול היה דתניא (שמות כז, א) חמש אמות אורך וחמש אמות רוחב דברים ככתבן דברי ר' יוסי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Yosei is saying well, Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he says the altar that Moses built was large. As it is taught “Five cubits long and five cubits wide” The matters as they are written; the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said well, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Yehudah according to his reasoning, as he said: "The altar that Moses made was great," as it was taught (Exodus 27:1): "Five cubits its length and five cubits its width, square, according to its writing." These are the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר נאמר כאן (שמות כז, א) רבוע ונאמר להלן (יחזקאל מג, טז) רבוע מה להלן מאמצעיתו היה מודד אף כאן מאמצעיתו היה מודד
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is stated here “Square” and it is stated there, “Square” Just as there, he was measuring from its center, so too here, was measuring from its center.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is stated here (Exodus 27:1) "square," and it is stated there (Ezekiel 43:16) "square." Just as there, he was measuring from its center, so too here, he was measuring from its center.

hebrew_text: והתם מנלן דכתיב (יחזקאל מג, טז) והאריאל שתים עשרה אמה לכל רוח או אינו אלא י"ב על י"ב כשהוא אומר אל ארבעת רבעיו מלמד שמאמצע הוא מודד
human_translation: And from where do we there, As it is written: “And the hearth shall be twelve cubits in each direction Or only twelve by twelve When states: “To its four sides,” it teaches that measuring from the center
llm_translation: And there, how do we know that it is written (Ezekiel 43:16), "And the Ariel twelve cubits by twelve cubits square"? Or is it only twelve by twelve when it says "to its four sides," teaching that it is measured from the middle?

hebrew_text: ור' יוסי כי גמר גזירה שוה בגובהה הוא דגמיר דתניא (שמות כז, א) ושלש אמות קומתו דברים ככתבן דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei When he learns the verbal analogy, he learns it with regard to height. As it is taught “And its height shall be three cubits” matters as they are written, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, when he completed the gezeirah shavah based on its height, he is the one who completed it as it was taught (Exodus 27:1) "And its height three cubits, its words as they were written." These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר נאמר כאן (שמות כז, א) רבוע ונאמר להלן רבוע מה להלן גובהו פי שנים כארכו אף כאן פי שנים כארכו
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: It is stated here “Square” and it is stated there “Square” just as there, its height twice its length, so too here, twice its length,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: It is stated here (Exodus 27:1) "square," and it is stated there "square." Just as there, its height is twice its length, so too here, its height is twice its length.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי יהודה (והלא כבר נאמר ואת החצר מאה אמה וקומה חמש אמות וגו') אפשר כהן עומד ע"ג המזבח ועבודה בידו וכל העם רואין אותו מבחוץ
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to But isn’t it already stated: the court shall be a hundred cubits…and the height five cubits” possible priest stand atop the altar and service in his hand, and the whole nation see him from outside
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yehuda (but hasn't it already been stated, "and the courtyard one hundred cubits, and its height five cubits, etc.") Is it possible for a priest to stand on the altar and perform the service with his hand, while all the people see him from outside?

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' יוסי והלא כבר נאמר (במדבר ד, כו) ואת קלעי החצר ואת מסך שער החצר אשר על המשכן ועל המזבח מה משכן י' אמות אף מזבח י' אמות ואומר (שמות לח, יב) קלעים חמש עשרה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said to him: But isn’t it already stated: “And the curtains of the court, and the screen for the gate of the court which is by the Tabernacle and by the altar” just as Tabernacle ten cubits so too, altar ten cubits And states: “The curtains were fifteen
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yosei, but hasn't it already been stated (Numbers 4:26), "And the hangings of the courtyard, and the screen for the entrance of the courtyard that is around the Tabernacle and the altar"? Just as the Tabernacle is ten cubits, so too the altar is ten cubits. And it says (Exodus 38:12), "Hangings fifteen."

hebrew_text: אמה אל הכתף ומה ת"ל (שמות לח, טו) ה' אמות משפת מזבח ולמעלה
human_translation: cubits for the one side” And what the verse states: five cubits” from the edge of the altar and above;
llm_translation: Cubit to the shoulder, and what does the Torah teach us? (Exodus 38:15) "The length of the cubit shall be five and twenty cubits."

hebrew_text: ומה ת"ל (שמות כז, א) ושלש אמות קומתו משפת סובב ולמעלה
human_translation: And what the verse states: and its height shall be three cubits” from the edge of surrounding ledge and above.
llm_translation: And what does the verse say (Exodus 27:1), "And three cubits its height, from the edge surrounding and upward"?

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה כי גמיר גזירת שוה ברחבה הוא דגמיר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, When he learns verbal analogy, he learns it with regard to the width,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, when he learns a gezeirah shavah in its breadth, that is when he learns.

hebrew_text: ולרבי יהודה הא קא מיתחזי כהן נהי דכהן מיתחזי עבודה דבידו לא מיתחזי
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, isn’t the priest visible Granted, the priest is visible, service that in his hand not visible.
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Yehuda, this is what appears: a priest, even though a priest appears to be performing the service, his own service does not appear to be performed.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבי יהודה היינו דכתיב (מלכים א ח, סד) קידש אלא לרבי יוסי מאי קידש להעמיד בה מזבח
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, this is which is written: sanctified But according to Rabbi Yosei, what sanctified”? to stand the altar in it.
llm_translation: Regarding Rabbi Yehuda, that is as it is written (1 Kings 1:34), "Sanctify." But according to Rabbi Yossi, what does "sanctify" mean? To establish upon it an altar.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבי יוסי היינו דכתיב קטן אלא לרבי יהודה מאי קטן הכי קאמר מזבח אבנים שעשה שלמה תחת מזבח הנחשת קטן הוה
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yosei, this is which is written too small But according to Rabbi Yehuda, what “too small”? this is saying: The stone altar that Solomon built in place of the copper altar was small
llm_translation: Regarding Rabbi Yosei, that is as it is written "small." But according to Rabbi Yehuda, what is "small"? This is what he is saying: the altar of stones that Solomon made beneath the copper altar was small.

hebrew_text: במאי פליגי מר סבר דנין חוץ מחוץ ואין דנין חוץ מפנים
human_translation: With regard to what disagree Sage, holds we derive external from external but we do not derive external from inner
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Master holds that we judge outside from outside, and we do not judge outside from inside.

hebrew_text: ומר סבר דנין כלי מכלי ואין דנין כלי מבנין
human_translation: And Sage, holds we derive vessel, from vessel, but we do not derive vessel from an edifice,
llm_translation: And Mar said: We evaluate a vessel based on its vesselness, and we do not evaluate a vessel based on its buildingness.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מודה רבי יהודה בדמים דתניא רבי יהודה אומר כוס אחד היה ממלא מדם התערובות ושופכו על גבי מזבח שאם ישפך דמו של אחת מהן נמצא זה מכשירו
human_translation: Rava says: Rabbi Yehuda concedes with regard to blood as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: would fill one cup with the blood of the mixed And pour it on the altar, so that if the blood of one of the spilled this would render fit.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding blood, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One cup would be filled with the blood of the mixtures, and it would be poured on the altar, for if the blood of one of them spills, this one is valid."

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתך סבר רבי יהודה כולה עזרה מיקדשא הא איתעבידא ליה מצוותיה
human_translation: And if enters your mind Rabbi Yehuda maintains the entire Temple courtyard was consecrated the mitzva of was performed
llm_translation: And if it were to your liking, you might think that Rabbi Yehuda holds that the entire Temple is considered a place of offering, as he derives his commandments from it.

hebrew_text: ודלמא משום דקסבר שפיכה מכח האדם בעינן אם כן נשקליה ונשפיך ליה אדוכתיה
human_translation: Perhaps due to that he holds we require pouring by human force. If so, let take and pour it in its place
llm_translation: And perhaps because he holds that shedding blood requires the exertion of a person, we need to weigh it: if so, let his blood be shed.

hebrew_text: ודלמא משום דבעינן מצוה מן המובחר
human_translation: But perhaps due to that we require mitzva the optimal
llm_translation: And perhaps because we require a mitzvah from the choicest.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אלעזר מזבח שנפגם אין אוכלין בגינו שירי מנחה שנאמר (ויקרא י, יב) ואכלוה מצות אצל המזבח וכי אצל המזבח אכלוה אלא בזמן שהוא שלם ולא בזמן שהוא חסר
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: an altar that was damaged, one may not eat the remainder of a meal offering on its account, as it is stated: and eat it without leaven beside the altar; But did eat beside the altar? Rather, at a time when is complete, but not at a time when it is lacking.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar: A altar that was damaged, one may not eat from its leftover meal offerings, as it is stated (Leviticus 10:12), "And they shall eat it as unleavened bread beside the altar." And did they eat it beside the altar? Rather, only when it is whole and not when it is deficient.

hebrew_text: אשכחן שירי מנחה קדשי קדשים מנלן ת"ל קדש קדשים
human_translation: We found remainder of a meal offering; from where do we offerings of the most sacred order? the verse states: most holy.”
llm_translation: We found leftover Mincha offerings of the Holy of Holies. From where do we derive this? The verse states, "Holy of Holies."

hebrew_text: קדשים קלים מנין אמר אביי אתיא מדרשא דר' יוסי דתניא ר' יוסי אומר ג' דברים משום

human_translation: three elders, and this is one of them: Rabbi Yishmael says: might a person would bring second-tithe up to Jerusalem in the present, and eat it. And it a logical inference A firstborn requires bringing to place, and -tithe requires bringing to place just as firstborn only in the presence of the Temple, so too, -tithe only in the presence of the Temple.
llm_translation: Three elders, and one of them is Rabbi Yishmael, says: "One might have thought that a person may ascend with his second tithe to Jerusalem and consume it there in our time. However, the law is that the firstborn requires bringing to a specific place, and the tithe also requires bringing to a specific place. Just as the firstborn must be brought before the Temple, so too must the tithe be brought before the Temple."

hebrew_text: מה לבכור שכן טעון מתן דמים ואימורים לגבי מזבח

human_translation: What does hold? If he holds initial consecration sanctified it for its time and sanctified it forever, even a firstborn And if he holds did not sanctify it forever, let the dilemma be raised a firstborn as well.

hebrew_text: וכי דבר הלמד בהיקש חוזר ומלמד בהיקש מעשר דגן חולין הוא
human_translation: But does a matter derived via a juxtaposition then teach via a juxtaposition tithe grain is non-sacred,
llm_translation: And when a matter that is learned through a comparison returns and teaches through a comparison, it is regarding tithing grain of common (non-sacred) produce.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד בתר למד אזלינן אלא למ"ד בתר מלמד אזלינן מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says: we follow is derived But according to the one who says: We follow teaches, what is there to say?
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says "after 'lamad' we go," rather than according to the one who says "after 'malmed' we go." What can be said?

hebrew_text: דם ובשר חדא מילתא היא
human_translation: blood and meat are one matter.
llm_translation: Blood and flesh - one matter it is.

hebrew_text: כי סליק רבין אמרה לשמעתא קמיה דרבי ירמיה אמר בבלאי טפשאי אמטול דיתבי בארעא חשוכא אמרי שמעתא דמחשכא לא שמיע להו הא דתניא בשעת סילוק מסעות קדשים נפסלין וזבים ומצורעים משתלחים חוץ למחיצה
human_translation: When Ravin ascended he stated this halakha , in the presence of Rabbi Yirmeya. said: Foolish Babylonians! Because they dwell in a dark land, they state halakhot that are dim. Have they not heard that which is taught At the time depart journeys sacrificial disqualified zavim and lepers sent out of partition;
llm_translation: When Ravin ascended, she said to the audience before Rabbi Yirmeya, "The Babylonians are foolish, sitting in a dark land." They said, "The one who is in darkness does not hear." As it was taught: "At the time of the removal of the holy vessels, those with discharges, and lepers are disqualified, and they are sent outside the partition."

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך בשני מקומות קדשים נאכלים מאי לאו הא בקדשי קדשים הא בקדשים קלים
human_translation: And it is taught another Sacrificial consumed in two locations, What, is it not this to offerings of the most sacred order, that to offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: And it was taught in another place: "In two locations, holy items are eaten." What is it not? This one is regarding the holy of holies, and this one is regarding the lighter holy items.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא אידי ואידי בקדשים קלים ולא קשיא
human_translation: Ravina said this and that to offerings of lesser sanctity, and not difficult:
llm_translation: Ravina said: Both this and that in regards to light sanctified items, and it is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הא רבי ישמעאל הא רבנן
human_translation: This Rabbi Yishmael, That the Sages,
llm_translation: This is Rabbi Yishmael, this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא הא והא בקדשי קדשים ומאי בשני מקומות קודם שיעמידו לוים את המשכן
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that to offerings of the most sacred order. And what in two locations? before the Levites erect the Tabernacle,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: this and this in the holy of holies. And what is meant by "in two places"? Before the Levites set up the Tabernacle.

hebrew_text: ולאחר שיפרקו הלוים את המשכן
human_translation: and, after the Levites dismantle the Tabernacle
llm_translation: And after the Levites dismantle the Tabernacle

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא איפסיל להו ביוצא קא משמע לן
human_translation: lest you say has been disqualified because left teaches us
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Ifsil Lehu BeYotza"?

hebrew_text: ואימא הכי נמי אמר קרא (במדבר ב, יז) ונסע אהל מועד אף על פי שנסע אהל מועד הוא
human_translation: And say indeed The verse states: “Then the Tent of Meeting shall travel” even though it traveled it is the Tent of Meeting.
llm_translation: And say so too said the verse (Numbers 2:17) "And the Tent of Meeting shall journey, even though the Tent of Meeting journeyed."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא אמר רב מזבח של שילה של אבנים היה דתניא ר"א בן יעקב אומר מה תלמוד לומר (שמות כ, כא) אבנים (דברים כז, ב) אבנים (דברים כז, ב) אבנים שלש פעמים אחד של שילה ואחד של נוב וגבעון ובית עולמים
human_translation: Rav Huna says Rav says: The altar in Shiloh was of stones, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Why the verses state stones stones stones three times? One in Shiloh, and one in Nov and Gibeon, and Eternal House,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, Rav said: The altar of Shiloh was of stones, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, what is the Talmud to say (Exodus 20:21) "stones," (Deuteronomy 27:2) "stones," (Deuteronomy 27:2) "stones," three times - one of Shiloh, one of Nob, and Gibeah, and Beit Oulamim.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב אחא בר אמי אש שירדה מן השמים בימי משה לא נסתלקה מעל מזבח הנחושת אלא בימי שלמה ואש שירדה בימי שלמה לא נסתלקה עד שבא מנשה וסילקה ואם איתא מעיקרא הוא דאיסתלק ליה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ami raises an objection fire that descended from Heaven in the days of Moses departed from atop the copper altar only in the days of Solomon, and fire that descended in the days of Solomon did not depart until Manasseh came and removed it And if it is so it that departed earlier,
llm_translation: Challenged Rav Akha bar Ami: "Fire that descended from heaven in the days of Moses did not depart from the copper altar until the days of Solomon. And fire that descended in the days of Solomon did not depart until Manasseh came and removed it. And if you say it originally departed for him."

hebrew_text: הוא דאמר כרבי נתן דתניא רבי נתן אומר מזבח של שילה של נחושת היה חלול ומלא אבנים
human_translation: stated in accordance with Rabbi Natan, as it is taught Rabbi Natan says: The altar in Shiloh was of copper; hollow and full of stones.
llm_translation: He who said like Rabbi Nathan, as it was taught: Rabbi Nathan says, "The altar of Shiloh was of copper, hollow, and filled with stones."

hebrew_text: ר"נ בר יצחק אמר מאי לא נסתלקה לא נסתלקה לבטלה מאי היא רבנן אמרי שביבא הוה משדרא רב פפא אמר אושפיזא הוה נקט וזימנין הכא וזימנין הכא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says What did not depart it did not depart nullified; What is it, The Rabbis say: would emit sparks Rav Pappa says: was a guest; sometimes here, and sometimes there,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What does "it did not ascend" mean? It did not ascend for nullification. What is it? The Rabbis said: It was a spark that came from the hearth. Rav Papa said: It was a coal. Sometimes it is referred to as "here" and sometimes as "here."

hebrew_text: תנן התם וכשעלו בני הגולה הוסיפו עליו ד' אמות מן הדרום וד' אמות מן המערב כמין גמא מאי טעמא אמר רב יוסף משום דלא ספק
human_translation: We learned there When the members of the exile ascended they added four cubits to it on the south and four cubits on the west like gamma, What was the reason Rav Yosef said: Because was not sufficient.
llm_translation: We learned there: And when the exiles ascended, they added onto it four cubits from the south and four cubits from the west, like a weaver's beam. What is the reason? Rav Yosef said, because there is no doubt.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי השתא מקדש ראשון דכתיב ביה (מלכים א ד, כ) יהודה וישראל רבים כחול אשר על (שפת) הים ספק מקדש שני דכתיב ביה (עזרא ב, סד) כל הקהל כאחד ארבע רבוא לא ספק א"ל התם אש של שמים מסייעתן הכא אין אש של שמים מסייעתן
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Now, the First Temple about which it is written: “Judah and Israel were many as the sand that is by the sea” was sufficient, the Second Temple about which it is written: “The whole congregation together was forty thousand was not sufficient? said to There, heavenly fire assist them Here, no heavenly fire assist them.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Now, the First Temple, as it is written in it (1 Kings 4:20), 'Judah and Israel were as numerous as the sand by the sea.' Perhaps the Second Temple, as it is written in it (Ezra 2:64), 'The entire congregation together was forty-two thousand.' He said to him: There, the heavenly fire was assisting them; here, the heavenly fire is not assisting them."

hebrew_text: כי אתא רבין אמר ר"ש בן פזי משום בר קפרא שיתין הוסיפו מעיקרא סבור מזבח אדמה שהוא אטום באדמה
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi says in the name of Bar Kappara They expanded cavities Initially, they held “An altar of earth that it filled with earth.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said in the name of Bar Kappara: Sixty were added from the beginning. He thought they were discussing an altar of earth that is sealed in the earth.

hebrew_text: ולבסוף סבור שתיה כאכילה ומאי מזבח אדמה שהוא מחובר באדמה שלא יבננו לא ע"ג כיפים
human_translation: But ultimately, they maintained drinking is like eating, And what “an altar of earth”? that be attached to the earth, that one may not build it on top of arches
llm_translation: And in the end, he thought that drinking is like eating. And what is the law regarding an altar of earth that is connected to the ground, that it should not be built on top of vaults.

hebrew_text: ולא על גבי מחילות
human_translation: and not on top of tunnels.
llm_translation: And not on top of Machiloth.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לאו היינו דתניא (עזרא ג, ג) ויכינו (את) המזבח על מכונותיו שהגיעו לסוף מדותיו והכתיב (דברי הימים א כח, יט) הכל בכתב מיד ה' עלי השכיל
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Is this not as it is taught “And they set the altar upon its bases” that reached its full measure, But isn’t it written “All this in writing, as the Lord has made me wise by His hand upon me,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Is this not what was taught (Ezra 3:3), "And they set up the altar upon its bases, for they were in their proper places"? And it is written (1 Chronicles 28:19), "All this the Lord made me understand in writing by His hand upon me."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב יוסף קרא אשכח ודרש (דברי הימים א כב, א) ויאמר דויד זה הוא בית ה' האלהים וזה מזבח לעולה לישראל כי בית מה בית ששים אמה אף מזבח ששים אמה
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: found a verse and interpreted “Then David said: This is the House of the Lord God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel” like Temple: Just as House sixty cubits so too, altar sixty cubits.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: "He found and expounded (1 Chronicles 22:1), 'And David said, This is the house of the Lord God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.' For just as the house is sixty cubits, so too the altar is sixty cubits."

hebrew_text: בשלמא בית מינכרא צורתו אלא מזבח מנא ידעי
human_translation: Granted, House, its shape discernable but how did they know altar?
llm_translation: In peace, the form of the Minchera house, but how do we know the form of the altar?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אלעזר ראו מזבח בנוי ומיכאל השר הגדול עומד ומקריב עליו ור' יצחק נפחא אמר אפרו של יצחק ראו שמונח באותו מקום ור' שמואל בר נחמני אמר מכל הבית כולו הריחו ריח קטרת משם הריחו ריח אברים
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: They saw altar built and Michael the archangel standing and sacrificing upon it. And Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa says: They saw the ashes of Isaac placed in that location. And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: From the entire House they smelled the scent of incense, from there, they smelled a scent of limbs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "See a built altar, and Michael the great prince stands and offers upon it." And Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha said: "The ashes of Yitzchak, see them placed in that same place." And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "From the entire house, all of it smelled the smell of incense; from there they smelled the smell of limbs."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן שלשה נביאים עלו עמהם מן הגולה אחד שהעיד להם על המזבח ואחד שהעיד להם על מקום המזבח ואחד שהעיד להם שמקריבין אף על פי שאין בית
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Three prophets ascended with them from the exile: One who testified to them about the altar, and one who testified to them about the location of the altar, and one who testified to them that one sacrifices even if there is no Temple,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Yoḥanan: Three prophets ascended with them from the exile, one who testified to them about the altar, and one who testified to them about the place of the altar, and one who testified to them that sacrifices are offered even though there is no Temple.

hebrew_text: במתניתא תנא ר"א בן יעקב אומר שלשה נביאים עלו עמהן מן הגולה אחד שהעיד להם על המזבח ועל מקום המזבח ואחד שהעיד להם שמקריבין אף על פי שאין בית ואחד שהעיד להם על התורה שתכתב אשורית
human_translation: was taught in a baraita Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Three prophets ascended with from the exile: One who testified to them about the altar and about the location of the altar, and one who testified to them that one sacrifices even if there is no Temple, and one who testified to them about the Torah that it be written Assyrian script [ Ashurit ]
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, "Three prophets ascended with the returnees from the exile: one who testified to them regarding the altar and its place, and one who testified to them that sacrifices are offered even without a Temple, and one who testified to them regarding the Torah that it should be written in Assyrian script."

hebrew_text: ת"ר קרן וכבש ויסוד וריבוע מעכבין מדת ארכו ומדת רחבו ומדת קומתו אין מעכבין מנה"מ אמר רב הונא אמר קרא (שמות כז, א) המזבח כל מקום שנאמר המזבח לעכב
human_translation: The Sages taught corner ramp base and square, are indispensable the measurement of its length, and the measurement of its width, and the measurement of its height are not indispensable. From where are these matters Rav Huna says: the verse states “the altar,” wherever “the altar” is stated, to indispensable.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A horn, a ram, a foundation, and a square impede the measurement of its length, width, and height, but do not impede the 100 cubits. Rav Huna said in the name of a verse (Exodus 27:1): "The altar," wherever it is stated "the altar," it impedes.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה כיור לרבי וסובב לרבי יוסי ברבי יהודה הכי נמי דמעכב דכתי' (שמות כז, ה) ונתתה אותה תחת כרכוב המזבח מלמטה ותניא איזהו כרכוב רבי אומר זה כיור רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר זה הסובב
human_translation: If that is so, engraving [ kiyyur ] according to Rabbi or surrounding ledge according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, also be indispensable, as it is written: “And you shall put it under the karkov of the altar beneath” And it is taught What is karkov ? Rabbi says: This is engraving Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: This is the surrounding ledge.
llm_translation: Rather now, a basin for Rabbi and surrounding for Rabbi Yosi son of Rabbi Yehuda. So too, it is a hindrance as it is written (Exodus 27:5), "And you shall place it beneath the ledge of the altar downward." And it was taught: What is the ledge? Rabbi says: This is the basin. Rabbi Yosi son of Rabbi Yehuda says: This is the surrounding.

hebrew_text: אין דתניא אותו היום נפגמה קרן מזבח והביאו בול של מלח וסתמוהו ולא מפני שכשר לעבודה אלא שלא יראה מזבח פגום שכל מזבח שאין לו קרן וכבש ויסוד וריבוע פסול רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר אף הסובב
human_translation: Yes, as it is taught that day the corner of the altar was damaged They brought a fistful of salt and sealed not because fit for the service, but so that the altar would not be seen damaged because any altar that does not have a corner, a ramp, and a base, and square, disqualified. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Even the surrounding ledge
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, detanya, oto hayom nifgamah keren mizbe'ach vehavi'u bol shel melach ve'stamuhu ve'lo mipnei she'kasher la'avodah ela shelo yeraeh mizbe'ach pigum shekol mizbe'ach she'ein lo keren ve'chavesh ve'yisod ve'ribu'a pasul. Rabbi Yosi bar Rabbi Yehuda omer af hasovev." English translation: "It is taught in a Baraita: On that day, the horn of the altar was damaged, and they brought a clod of salt and sealed it. Not because it is fit for service, but so that the defective altar should not be seen. For any altar that lacks a horn, a base, a foundation, and a square is invalid. Rabbi Yosi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: even the surrounding is invalid."

hebrew_text: ת"ר איזהו כרכוב בין קרן לקרן מקום הילוך רגלי הכהנים אמה אטו הכהנים בין קרן לקרן הוו אזלי אלא אימא ומקום הילוך רגלי הכהנים אמה
human_translation: The Sages taught What is karkov between corner and corner, cubit- place the priests walk. Is that to say the priests would walk between corner and corner? Rather, say: and cubit the place the priests walk.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What is considered a "karkov" between one corner and another corner? The space of the walking distance of the Kohanim, which is one cubit. Are the Kohanim between one corner and another corner? They would go. Rather say: And the space of the walking distance of the Kohanim is one cubit.

hebrew_text: והכתיב (שמות לח, ד) תחת כרכובו מלמטה עד חציו אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק תרי הוו חד לנוי וחד לכהנים דלא נשתרקו
human_translation: But isn’t it written: under the karkov beneath, reaching halfway up” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: There were two One for aesthetic and one for the priests, that they not slip
llm_translation: And the verse (Exodus 28:4) "Underneath its hem, round about, it shall have bells of gold between them all around" - Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: There were two, one for beauty and one for the priests, so they would not be confused.

hebrew_text: מדת ארכו ומדת רחבו ומדת קומתו אין מעכבין א"ר מני ובלבד שלא יפחתנו ממזבח שעשה משה וכמה אמר רב יוסף אמה מחכו עליה (שמות כז, א) חמש אמות ארך וחמש אמות רוחב רבוע יהיה המזבח
human_translation: the measurement of length, and the measurement of its width, and the measurement of its height are not indispensable. Rabbi Mani says: provided that one does not decrease its than altar constructed by Moses. And how Rav Yosef says: cubit. mocked “Five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar shall be square”
llm_translation: Measure of its length and measure of its width and measure of its height do not prevent. Rabbi Mani said, as long as it does not diminish from the altar that Moses made. And how much? Rav Yosef said: A cubit its length, and a cubit its width, square shall the altar be.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי דלמא מקום מערכה קאמר מר א"ל מר דגברא רבה הוא ידע מאי קאמינא קרי עלייהו
human_translation: Abaye said to Perhaps the Master is speaking the area of the arrangement said to The Master, who is a great man, knows what I say. read, to those
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Perhaps the Master is referring to the place of the arrangement. The Master said to him: Master, it is a great man who knows what I am saying; he reads upon them.

hebrew_text: (בראשית כה, ד) בני קטורה בני אחתיה דרבי טרפון הוו יתבי קמיה דרבי טרפון פתח ואמר (בראשית כה, א) ויוסף אברהם ויקח אשה ושמה יוחני אמרי ליה קטורה כתיב קרי עליהם בני קטורה
human_translation: “The children of Keturah” The sons of Rabbi Tarfon’s sister were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon. he began and said: And Abraham took another wife, and her name was Yoḥani. They said to It is written: “Keturah” read, about them “the children of Keturah”
llm_translation: Genesis 25:4 "The sons of Keturah, the sons of his concubine, were gathered before Rabbi Tarfon. He opened and said, Genesis 25:1 'And Abraham took another wife, and her name was Keturah.' They said to him, 'Keturah is written; read it as referring to them, the sons of Keturah.'"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בר הונא אמר רב חמא בר גוריא גזירין שעשה משה אורכן אמה ורוחבן אמה ועוביין כמחק גודש סאה
human_translation: Abaye bar Huna says Rav Ḥama bar Gurya says: logs that Moses prepared their length a cubit and their width a cubit, and their thickness like a leveler, heaped se’a .
llm_translation: Abbaye son of Huna said, Rav Ḥama son of Guria said: Decrees that Moses enacted, their length was one cubit, their width was one cubit, and their thickness was like the width of a dried fig cake.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ירמיה באמה גדומה אמר רב יוסף ולאו היינו דתניא (ויקרא א, ח) על העצים אשר על האש אשר על המזבח שלא יהו עצים יוצאין מן המזבח כלום
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says: with a shortened cubit. Rav Yosef said: Is this not as it is taught “Upon the wood that is on the fire that is upon the altar” that the wood should not extend at all beyond the altar
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: "In a raised cubit." Said Rav Yosef: "But is this not what was taught (Leviticus 1:8): 'Upon the wood that is upon the fire that is upon the altar,' that the wood should not protrude from the altar at all?"

hebrew_text: תנן התם כבש היה לדרומה של מזבח אורך שלשים ושתים על רוחב שש עשרה מנא ה"מ אמר רב הונא אמר קרא (ויקרא א, יא) ושחט אותו על ירך המזבח צפונה שיהא ירך בצפון ופניו בדרום
human_translation: We learned there There was a ramp on the south of the altar, a length thirty-two by a width sixteen From where are these matters Rav Huna said: The verse states: “And he shall slaughter it on the side [ yerekh ] of the altar northward” that thigh [ yarekh ] should be in the north, and its face, in the south.
llm_translation: We learned there: A sheep that was designated for the southern side of the altar, its length was thirty-two cubits and its width sixteen cubits. How do we know this? Rav Huna said: The verse states (Leviticus 1:11), "And he shall slaughter it on the north side of the altar." This teaches that the thigh should be to the north and its face to the south.

hebrew_text: אימא ירך בצפון ופניו בצפון אמר רבא רמי גברא אאפיה א"ל אביי אדרבה תריץ ואותיב גברא
human_translation: say thigh in the north and its face in the north? Rava said Place the man on his face, Abaye said to him: On the contrary, sit the man straight up
llm_translation: Say the thigh in the north and its face in the north. Rava said: A man lifts his heel. Abaye said to him: On the contrary, he runs and sits down.

hebrew_text: א"ל (שמות כז, א) רבוע כתיב והא מיבעי ליה דמרבע רבועי מי כתיב מרובע וליטעמיך מי כתיב רבוץ א"ל רבוע כתיב דמשמע הכי ומשמע הכי
human_translation: said to him: It is written “square [ ravua ]” But necessary to that square. Is it written square [ merubba ]? According to your reasoning, is it written ravutz ? is written ravua , which indicates this, and indicates that,
llm_translation: He said to him (Exodus 27:1), "Square is written, but does it require that it be exactly square? Is it written 'square' or 'four-cornered'? And to your reasoning, is it written 'level'? He said to him, 'Square is written,' implying this and implying that."

hebrew_text: ותנא מייתי לה מהכא דתניא רבי יהודה אומר (יחזקאל מג, יז) ומעלותיהו פנות קדים כל פינות שאתה פונה לא יהו אלא דרך ימין למזרח
human_translation: And tanna cites from here, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: “And its steps shall look [ penot ] toward the east” all the turns [ pinot ] that you turn should be only to the right to the east.
llm_translation: And a Tanna brought a proof for it from here, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says (Ezekiel 43:17), "And its steps face eastward." In all directions that you turn, they shall only be towards the right, to the east.

hebrew_text: ואימא שמאל למזרח לא ס"ד דתני רמי בר (יחזקיה) ים שעשה שלמה (דברי הימים ב ד, ד) עומד על שנים עשר (עמודים) בקר שלשה פונים צפונה ושלשה פונים ימה ושלשה פונים נגבה ושלשה פונים מזרחה כל פינות שאתה פונה לא יהו אלא דרך ימין למזרח
human_translation: say left eastward? not enter your mind, as Rami bar Yeḥizkiya teaches: sea, that Solomon built, “It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward [ ponim ] the north, and three looking toward [ ponim ] the west, and three looking toward [ ponim ] the south, and three looking toward [ ponim ] the east” all the turns that you turn should be only to the right to the east.
llm_translation: And say, perhaps to the east not thought, as it teaches Rami bar (Yechizkiya), "The sea that Solomon made" (Chronicles 2:4) stands on twelve (pillars), in the morning three face north, and three face west, and three face south, and three face east. Whichever direction you turn, it should only be towards the right to the east.

hebrew_text: ההוא מיבעי ליה לגופיה א"כ פונים פונים למה לי
human_translation: That is necessary to its own If so, why do I ponim , ponim ?

hebrew_text: שאל רבי שמעון בן יוסי בן לקוניא את ר' יוסי אומר היה ר"ש בן יוחי אויר יש בין כבש למזבח אמר לו ואתה אי אתה אומר כן והלא כבר נאמר (דברים יב, כז) ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם מה דם בזריקה אף בשר בזריקה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei ben Lakonya asked Rabbi Yosei: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai used to say there is airspace, between the ramp and the altar? said to him: And you, don’t you say so But isn’t it already stated: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood” just as blood via tossing so too, flesh via tossing.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei ben Lakunya asked Rabbi Yosi: Rabbi Yosi says, "Was Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai in the air space between the sheep pen and the altar?" He said to him, "And you, do you not say so? But has it not already been stated (Deuteronomy 12:27), 'And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood.' Just as blood is through sprinkling, so too is flesh through sprinkling."

hebrew_text: אמר לו שאני אומר עומד בצד מערכה וזורק
human_translation: said to him: as I say stand next to arrangement and toss

human_translation: said to him: When he tosses does he toss onto arrangement burning or does he toss onto arrangement that is not burning? You must say he tosses onto arrangement burning. there, because it is impossible
llm_translation: He said to him: When he is throwing into a burning pile, he is throwing; or when he is throwing into a non-burning pile, he is throwing. You would say: he is throwing into a burning pile. There, because it is not possible.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר כי דם מה דם אויר קרקע מפסיקו אף בשר אויר קרקע מפסיקו
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: like blood Just as blood space ground interposes so too flesh, space ground interposes
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Just as the blood of the air separates, so too does the flesh of the air separate.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה שני כבשים קטנים יוצאין מן הכבש שבהן פונים ליסוד ולסובב ומובדלין מן המזבח מלא נימא משום שנאמר סביב ורבי אבהו אמר רבוע
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: two small ramps protruding from the ramp on which turn to the base and to the surrounding ledge separated from the altar a hairbreadth, because it is stated: “Roundabout” And Rabbi Abbahu says “Square”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Two small lambs emerge from the lamb, they turn to the foundation and to the surrounding, and they are separated from the altar full of blemish because it is stated "surround." And Rabbi Abahu said: square.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך למכתב סביב ואיצטריך למכתב רבוע דאי כתב רחמנא סביב הוה אמינא דעגיל מעגל כתב רחמנא רבוע ואי כתב רחמנא רבוע הוה אמינא דאריך וקטין כתב רחמנא סביב
human_translation: And it was necessary to write: “Roundabout,” and it was necessary to write: “Square,” as, had the Merciful One written “Roundabout,” I would say that can be circular. the Merciful One wrote “square.” And had the Merciful One written “square [ ravua ],” I would say that long and narrow. the Merciful One wrote “roundabout,”
llm_translation: And it was necessary for a circular writing and it was necessary for a square writing. For if the Merciful One had written circular, I would have said to make a circle. If the Merciful One had written square, I would have said to make it long and narrow.

hebrew_text: תנן התם הכבש והמזבח ששים ושתים הני שיתין וארבעה הוו נמצא פורח אמה על יסוד ואמה על סובב
human_translation: We learned elsewhere The ramp and the altar sixty-two these are sixty-four is found overhung base cubit and surrounding ledge cubit,
llm_translation: We have learned there: the ramp and the altar were sixty-two, these six and four were found, extending a cubit on the foundation and a cubit around.

hebrew_text: אמר רמי בר חמא כל כבשי כבשים שלש אמות לאמה חוץ מכבשו של מזבח שהיה שלש אמות ומחצה ואצבע ושליש אצבע בזכרותא:
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama says: each minor ramps, one cubit per three cubits aside from the ramp of the altar, which three and a half cubits and one fingerbreadth and one-third of a fingerbreadth, by the tip
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama said: All rams of rams three cubits to a cubit except for the ram of the altar which was three cubits and a half and a finger and a third of a finger in the male organ.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מנחות היו נקמצות בכל מקום בעזרה ונאכלות לפנים מן הקלעים לזכרי כהונה בכל מאכל ליום ולילה עד חצות:
human_translation: Handfuls were removed from the meal offerings in any place in the courtyard and were consumed within the curtains by males of the priesthood, in any food for day and night, until midnight.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The meal offerings were kneaded anywhere in the Temple courtyard and eaten inside, from the curtains onward, in remembrance of the priesthood, with any food, day and night, until midnight.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר אלעזר מנחה שנקמצה בהיכל כשירה שכן מצינו בסילוק בזיכין
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: A meal offering that had its handful removed in the Sanctuary valid, as we found with regard to removal of bowls
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said: A meal-offering that became crusted in the Sanctuary is valid, as we find in the case of the removal of the ashes.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי ירמיה (ויקרא ב, ב) וקמץ משם ממקום שרגלי הזר עומדות
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises an objection and he shall take from there from a place where the feet of the non-priest stand,
llm_translation: Challenged Rabbi Yirmiyah: "And he shall take it from there, from the place where the feet of the stranger stand."

hebrew_text: בן בתירא אומר מנין שאם קמץ בשמאל שיחזיר ויקמוץ בימין ת"ל משם ממקום שקמץ כבר
human_translation: Ben Beteira says From where that if removed a handful with left that he should return and remove handful with right The verse states: from there from the place where he already removed a handful.
llm_translation: Ben Batira says: From where do we derive that if one gathered with his left hand, he should return and gather with his right hand? The verse states: "From there," from the place where he already gathered.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי הוא מותיב לה והוא מפרק לה איכא דאמרי א"ל ר' עקיבא לר' ירמיה בר תחליפא אסברא לך לא נצרכא אלא להכשיר כל העזרה כולה
human_translation: There are who say raises the objection and he resolves it, there are who say Rabbi Akiva said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Taḥlifa: I will explain to you is necessary only to render the entire courtyard valid
llm_translation: There are some who say: he poses a challenge to it, and he resolves it. There are some who say: Rabbi Akiva said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Tachlifa, "I hold that it is only necessary to make the entire courtyard fit."

hebrew_text: סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ועולה קדשי קדשים ומנחה קדשי קדשים מה עולה טעונה צפון אף מנחה טעונה צפון
human_translation: enter your mind to say since a burnt offering offerings of the most sacred order, and a meal offering offerings of the most sacred order, just as a burnt offering requires north so too, a meal offering requires north
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "I might say, since the Olah of the Holy of Holies and the Mincha of the Holy of Holies require Tzafon (to be eaten in the northern part of the Temple), so too the Mincha requires Tzafon."

hebrew_text: מה לעולה שכן כליל
human_translation: What about a burnt offering? in that completely

human_translation: from a sin offering, What about a sin offering? in that it atones for those liable to karet .
llm_translation: Sin offering, what for sin offering? For it atones for those liable for excision.

hebrew_text: מאשם מה לאשם שכן מיני דמים
human_translation: from a guilt offering, What about a guilt offering? in that types of blood,
llm_translation: Guilt offering, what for guilt offering, so types of blood.

hebrew_text: מכולהו מה לכולהו שכן מיני דמים
human_translation: from all of the What about all of them? in that types of blood.
llm_translation: From all of them, what for all of them? Thus, various types of blood.

hebrew_text: אלא איצטריך סד"א הואיל וכתיב (ויקרא ב, ח) והגישה אל המזבח (ויקרא ו, ח) והרים ממנו בקומצו
human_translation: Rather, it was necessary enter your mind to say since it is written: “And he shall bring it to the altar” “And he shall take up from there his handful”
llm_translation: Rather, it was necessary according to the opinion of the first Tanna, since it is written (Leviticus 2:8), "And he shall bring it to the altar," (Leviticus 6:5) "and shall lift off of it with his handful."

hebrew_text: מה הגשה בקרן מערבית דרומית אף קמיצה בקרן מערבית דרומית קא משמע לן
human_translation: just as bring to southwest corner so too, removal of handful at southwest corner teaches us
llm_translation: What is the law regarding the offering in the southwestern corner? Just as the offering in the southwestern corner implies a small quantity, so too the offering in the southwestern corner implies for us.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן שלמים ששחטן בהיכל כשרים שנאמר (ויקרא ג, ב) ושחטו (אותו) פתח אהל מועד ולא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Peace offerings that one slaughtered in the Sanctuary are valid, as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” and secondary should not be weightier than the primary
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "Offerings that were slaughtered in the Temple are valid, as it is stated (Leviticus 3:2), 'And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,' and a secondary matter should not be more significant than the primary matter."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי רבי יוחנן בן בתירה אומר מנין שאם הקיפו עובדי כוכבים את כל העזרה שהכהנים נכנסין לשם ואוכלין שם קדשי קדשים ת"ל (במדבר יח, י) בקדש הקדשים תאכלנו
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beteira says: From where that if gentiles surrounded the entire courtyard the priests may enter that area, and eat the offerings of the most sacred order there? The verse states: “In a most holy place shall you eat it”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was asked: Rabbi Yochanan ben Batera says, "From where do we derive that if idolaters surrounded the entire Temple courtyard, and the priests entered there and ate there the most holy offerings?" It is stated (Numbers 18:10), "In a most holy place shall you eat it."

hebrew_text: ואמאי נימא בחצר אהל מועד יאכלוה ולא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר
human_translation: But why Let us say “In the court of the Tent of Meeting they shall eat it” and secondary should not be weightier than the primary
llm_translation: And why should we say "in the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting they shall eat it," and not have the secondary be greater than the primary?

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם עבודה דאדם עובד במקום רבו אמרינן לא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר אכילה דאין אדם אוכל במקום רבו לא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר לא אמרינן:
human_translation: How can be compared? There, rite, a person serves in the presence of his master. we say secondary should not be weightier than the primary eating which a person does not eat in the presence of his master, we do not say secondary should not be weightier than the primary
llm_translation: So now, there, the work that a person does in his master's place, we say: "Let the accessory not be more significant than the principal." Regarding eating, that a person does not eat in his master's place, we say: "Let the accessory not be more significant than the principal." We do not say.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חטאת העוף היתה נעשית על קרן דרומית מערבית ובכל מקום היתה כשירה אלא זה היתה מקומה ושלשה דברים היתה אותה קרן משמשת מלמטה ושלשה מלמעלה מלמטה חטאת העוף והגשות ושירי הדם
human_translation: a bird sin offering would be performed at southwest corner And in any place was valid; but that was its place. And three matters that corner below served and three above below a bird sin offering, and bringing near and the remaining blood.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sin-offering of a bird was performed on the southwestern horn, and in every place it was valid, except for this one was its place, and three things that horn served from below and three from above, from below the sin-offering of a bird, and the offerings, and the leftover blood.

hebrew_text: ומלמעלן ניסוך היין והמים ועולת העוף כשהיא רבה במזרח
human_translation: And above The wine libation and the water and a bird burnt offering when numerous in the east,
llm_translation: And above them, the libation of wine and water, and the burnt offering of the bird when it is abundant in the east.

hebrew_text: כל העולין למזבח עולין דרך ימין
human_translation: All who ascend to the altar ascend via right
llm_translation: All who ascend to the altar ascend on the right side.

hebrew_text: ומקיפין ויורדין דרך שמאל חוץ מן העולה לג' אלו שהיו עולין ויורדין על העקב:
human_translation: and circle and descend via left except for one who ascends for these three matters, where they would ascend and descend on heels
llm_translation: And they encompass and descend to the left, except for the one ascending to these three, who ascends and descends on the heel.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא ה"מ א"ר יהושע אמר קרא (ויקרא ה, יא) לא ישים עליה שמן ולא יתן עליה לבונה כי חטאת היא חטאת קרויה מנחה ומנחה קרויה חטאת
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yehoshua says: The verse states “He shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense on it; for it is a sin offering” a sin offering is called a meal offering and a meal offering is called a sin offering,
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive this? Rabbi Yehoshua said: The verse states (Leviticus 5:11), "He shall not put oil upon it, nor shall he place frankincense upon it, for it is a sin offering." It is called a sin offering, and a sin offering is called a meal offering.

hebrew_text: מה חטאת טעונה צפון אף מנחה טעונה צפון ומה מנחה בקרן מערבית דרומית אף חטאת בקרן מערבית דרומית
human_translation: Just as a sin offering requires north so too, a meal offering requires north. And just as a meal offering to southwest corner so too, a sin offering on southwest corner
llm_translation: What sin-offering requires the north, so too meal-offering requires the north. And just as the meal-offering is placed on the northwest corner, so too the sin-offering is placed on the northwest corner.

hebrew_text: ומנחה גופה מנלן דתניא (ויקרא ו, ז) לפני ה' יכול במערב ת"ל (ויקרא ו, ז) אל פני המזבח
human_translation: And a meal offering itself, from where do we As it is taught before the Lord, might at the west the verse states: “In front of the altar,”
llm_translation: "And a meal offering itself, from where do we derive it? As it was taught (Leviticus 6:7), 'Before the Lord,' could it be in the west? The Torah teaches (Leviticus 6:7), 'In front of the altar.'"

hebrew_text: אי אל פני המזבח יכול בדרום ת"ל לפני ה' הא כיצד מגישה בקרן מערבית דרומית כנגד חודה של קרן ודיו
human_translation: If “In front of the altar,” might at the south the verse states: “Before the Lord,” How these brings it near at southwest corner opposite the edge of corner and sufficient.
llm_translation: If towards the altar, I might think in the south, it teaches "before the Lord." How so? One presents it at the southwest corner, opposite the corner of the altar, and it suffices.

hebrew_text: ר"א אומר יכול יגישנה למערבה של קרן או לדרומה של קרן אמרת כל מקום שאתה מוצא שני מקראות אחד מקיים עצמו ומקיים חבירו ואחד מקיים עצמו ומבטל חבירו מניחין זה שמקיים עצמו ומבטל חבירו ותופשין את שמקיים עצמו ומקיים חבירו
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: might bring it near to the west of corner or to the south of corner. You say: Anywhere you find two verses, one fulfills itself, and fulfills the other one fulfills itself and negates the other one leaves the that fulfills itself and negates the other, and seizes that fulfills itself and fulfills the other
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Can one bring it closer to the western side of the horn or to its southern side? You said, "Wherever you find two verses, one establishes itself and establishes its fellow, and one establishes itself and nullifies its fellow, we leave the one that establishes itself and nullifies its fellow, and we grasp the one that establishes itself and establishes its fellow."

hebrew_text: כשאתה אומר אל פני ה' במערב היכן קיימת אל פני המזבח וכשאתה אומר אל פני המזבח בדרום קיימת לפני ה'
human_translation: when you say: “Before the Lord,” at the west how have you fulfilled “In front of the altar,” But when you say: “In front of the altar,” at the south you have fulfilled “Before the Lord.”
llm_translation: When you say "before the Lord" in the west, where do you stand? Before the altar. And when you say "before the altar" in the south, you stand before the Lord.

hebrew_text: בדרום היכן קיימת אמר רב אשי קסבר האי תנא כוליה מזבח בצפון קאי:
human_translation: at the south how have you fulfilled Rav Ashi says: This tanna holds the entire altar stood in the north
llm_translation: In the south where does it stand? Rav Ashi said: This Tanna holds that the entire altar is in the north.

hebrew_text: בכל מקום היתה כשירה [וכו']: מאי קאמר אמר רב אשי ה"ק בכל מקום היתה כשירה למליקתה אלא זה היה מקומה להזאתה
human_translation: in any place valid, What is saying Rav Ashi said: This is saying: Any place was valid for its pinching, but was the place for sprinkling its
llm_translation: In every place it was fit etc.: What is it saying? Rav Ashi said: This means in every place it was fit for its removal, rather, this was its designated place for its removal.

hebrew_text: תנינא להא דת"ר מלקה בכל מקום במזבח כשירה היזה דמה בכל מקום כשירה היזה ולא מיצה כשירה ובלבד שיתן מחוט הסיקרא ולמטה מדם הנפש
human_translation: We learn that which the Sages taught pinched its in any place on the altar, valid. he sprinkled its blood in any place valid. he sprinkled but did not squeeze out valid, provided that he places of the blood of the soul from the red line and below.
llm_translation: We have learned in the teaching of our Rabbis: One may sprinkle in any place on the altar, it is valid. If the blood was sprinkled in any place, it is valid, but if it was not sprinkled, it is not valid, as long as he places the blood below the red line.

hebrew_text: מאי קאמר ה"ק מלקה בכל מקום במזבח כשירה מיצה דמה בכ"מ במזבח כשירה
human_translation: What is saying? This is saying: he pinched its in any place on the altar, valid. he squeezed out its blood in any place on the altar, valid,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of this? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: "Striking is valid anywhere on the altar." Just as its blood is valid on the altar, so is striking valid.

hebrew_text: שאם היזה ולא מיצה כשירה ובלבד שיתן מחוט הסיקרא ולמטה מדם הנפש:
human_translation: because if he sprinkled but did not squeeze out valid, provided that he places of the blood of the soul from the red line and below.
llm_translation: If he urinated and did not ejaculate, it is valid, as long as he places the thread of the sycamore tree below the blood of the soul.

hebrew_text: שלשה דברים כו': חטאת העוף הא דאמרן
human_translation: three matters the bird sin offering that which we said
llm_translation: Three things, etc.: The sin-offering of a bird, that which we said.

hebrew_text: הגשות דכתיב (ויקרא ב, ח) והגישה אל (פני) המזבח שירי הדם דכתיב (ויקרא ד, ז) ואת כל דם הפר ישפוך אל יסוד המזבח:
human_translation: bringing near which is written: “And he shall bring it to the front of the altar.” the remaining blood as it is written: “And all the remaining blood of the bull he shall pour out at the base of the altar”
llm_translation: The offerings as it is written (Leviticus 2:8) "And he shall bring it (near) to the altar," the remnants of the blood as it is written (Leviticus 4:7) "And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out at the base of the altar."

hebrew_text: מלמעלה ניסוך המים והיין ועולת העוף כשהיא רבה במזרח: מ"ט רבי יוחנן אמר מפני שקרובה מבית הדשן
human_translation: above The water and wine libations, and a bird burnt offering when numerous in the east, What is the reason Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Because it is the closest to the place of the ashes,
llm_translation: Above, the pouring of water and wine, and the offering of the bird when it is abundant in the east. What is the reason? Rabbi Yochanan said, because it is close to the ash heap.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן בא וראה כמה גדול כחן של כהנים שאין לך קל בעופות יותר ממוראה ונוצה פעמים שהכהן זורקן יותר מבשלשים אמה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Come and see how great the strength of the priests, as you have no of birds lighter than the crop and feathers, times when the priest would toss them more than thirty cubits
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Come and see how great is the strength of the priests, for you have no lighter bird than the ostrich, and yet the priest throws it more than thirty cubits.

hebrew_text: דתנן נטל מחתה של כסף ועלה לראש המזבח ופינה את הגחלים אילך ואילך וחתה מן המאוכלות הפנימיות ויורד הגיע לרצפה מחזיר פניו כלפי צפון והולך למזרחו של כבש כעשר אמות צבר את הגחלים על גבי הרצפה רחוק מן הכבש שלשה טפחים מקום שנותנין מוראה ונוצה ודישון מזבח הפנימי והמנורה
human_translation: as we learned would take a coal pan of silver and ascend to the top of the altar and clear the coals to side and to side, and, scoop up from the inner, consumed and descend reached the floor turn his face toward the north, and walk about ten cubits along the eastern heap the coals upon the floor a distance three handbreadths from the ramp. the location where one places crop and feathers, and the ashes removed from the inner altar and the Candelabrum.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: He took a silver firepan and ascended to the top of the altar, and turned the coals this way and that way. He removed from the innermost parts of the food offerings, and descended until he reached the floor. He turned his face northward, and walked to the east of the ram, ten cubits. He piled the coals on the floor, far from the ram, three handbreadths, the place where they would place the incense, and the frankincense, and the spices of the inner altar and the menorah.

hebrew_text: הני טפי מתלתין וחד הויין מקום גברי לא חשיב:

hebrew_text: ורמינהו  בא לו להקיף את המזבח מאין הוא מתחיל מקרן דרומית מזרחית מזרחית צפונית צפונית מערבית מערבית דרומית ונותנין לו יין לנסך

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan

hebrew_text: הקפה ברגל אמר רבא דיקא נמי דקתני נותנין לו יין לנסך ולא קתני אומר לו נסך ש"מ
human_translation: circling on foot, Rava said: is also precise, as it teaches he is given wine to pour, and does not teach one tells him pour Conclude from
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hakafah b'regel," Rava said: "Dika nami d'katani, notnim lo yayin l'nasech, v'lo katani omer lo nasech." Shma.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כל העולין למזבח עולין דרך ימין ויורדין דרך שמאל עולין דרך מזרח ויורדין דרך מערב חוץ מן העולה לשלשה דברים הללו שעולים דרך מערב ויורדין דרך מערב עולין דרך ימין ויורדין דרך ימין
human_translation: The Sages taught All who ascend the altar ascend via right and descend via left ascend via east and descend via west except for one who ascends for these three matters: ascends via west and descends via west ascends via right and descends via right
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All who ascend to the altar ascend on the right side and descend on the left side. They ascend from the east and descend from the west, except for the burnt offering, for these three things ascend from the west and descend from the west. They ascend on the right side and descend on the right side.

hebrew_text: דרך ימין דרך שמאל הוא אמר רבינא תני שמאל רבא אמר מאי ימין ימין דמזבח ומאי שמאל שמאל דגברא
human_translation: via right is via left. Ravina says: teaches left Rava says: What right right of altar, And what left left of a person
llm_translation: The way of the right is the way of the left, said Ravina. Tanna taught: left. Rava said: What is right? The right of the altar. And what is left? The left of a person.

hebrew_text: וניתני או אידי ואידי דמזבח או אידי ואידי דגברא קשיא:
human_translation: But let teach this and that of the altar, or this and that of a person difficult.
llm_translation: And it was taught: Or both this and that, whether of the altar or whether of a man, is difficult.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חטאת העוף כיצד היה נעשית (עלה לכבש ופנה לסובב בא לו לקרן דרומית מזרחית) היה מולק את ראשה ממול ערפה ואינו מבדיל ומזה מדמה על קיר המזבח שירי הדם היה מתמצה על היסוד ואין למזבח אלא דמה וכולה לכהנים:
human_translation: the bird sin offering, how was it performed? would pinch the head opposite its nape and not separate And he sprinkles from its blood on the wall of the altar The remaining blood would be squeezed out on the base The altar has only its blood and the entire to the priests
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sin-offering of a bird, how was it performed? (It ascended to the ramp and turned to face around, approached the southwestern horn from the east) It would nip its head opposite its nape, without separating, and from this, it was compared to the wall of the altar. The leftover blood would be squeezed onto the base, and the altar only requires its blood, and all of it belongs to the priests.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא ה, ט) והזה מדם החטאת מגוף החטאת הא כיצד אוחז בראש ובגוף ומזה על קיר המזבח ולא על קיר הכבש ולא על קיר היכל ולא על קיר אולם ואיזה זה קיר התחתון
human_translation: The Sages taught “And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin offering from the body of the sin offering, How so? holds the head and the body and sprinkles on the wall of the altar. And not on the wall of the ramp, and not on the wall of Sanctuary, and not on the wall of Entrance Hall. And which This is the lower wall,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "And he shall sprinkle from the blood of the sin offering upon the wall of the altar" (Leviticus 5:9). How so? He holds the head and body, and sprinkles on the wall of the altar, but not on the wall of the ramp, nor on the wall of the sanctuary, nor on the wall of the vestibule. And which is the lower wall?

hebrew_text: או אינו אלא קיר העליון ודין הוא ומה בהמה שעולתה למטה חטאתה למעלה עוף שעולתו למעלה אינו דין שחטאתו למעלה
human_translation: Or only the upper wall, And a logical inference: Just as an animal where a burnt offering below the sin offering above a bird where the burnt offering above is it not logical that its sin offering above
llm_translation: Or is it only the upper wall, and it is a judgment, and what about an animal whose elevation offering is below, its sin offering is above; a bird whose elevation offering is above, it is not a judgment, its sin offering is above.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ה, ט) והנשאר בדם ימצה אל יסוד המזבח קיר שהשירין שלו מתמצים ליסוד ואיזה זה קיר התחתון
human_translation: the verse states: “And the rest of the blood shall be squeezed out [ yimmatze ] at the base of the altar” wall where its remaining drains to the base And which This is the lower wall.
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught (Leviticus 5:9), 'And the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar, a wall, for the fats of it are drained out to the base.' And which wall is this, the lower one."

hebrew_text: ונעביד מעילאי והדר נעביד מתתאי אמר רבא מי כתיב ימצה ימצה כתיב דממילא משמע
human_translation: Let perform above, and then perform below Rava said: Is it written: He shall drain [ yematze ]? It is written: It shall be drained [ yimmatze ], which indicates by itself.
llm_translation: And we will do from above, and then we will do from below. Rava said: Is it written "yimtza, yimtza"? It is written "dimimila," implying as if by itself.

hebrew_text: אמר רב זוטרא בר טוביה אמר רב כיצד מולקין חטאת העוף אוחז גפיו בשתי אצבעות ושתי רגלים בשתי אצבעות ומותח צוארה על רוחב גודלו ומולקה
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Toviyya says Rav says: How pinch a bird sin offering? holds its wings with two fingers, and two legs with two fingers, and he stretches its neck over the width of his thumb and pinches
llm_translation: Rav Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav: How is the sin offering of a bird removed? One holds its wings with two fingers, and its legs with two fingers, and stretches its neck over the width of its body, and removes it.

hebrew_text: במתניתא תנא ציפרא מלבר אוחז גפיו בשתי אצבעות ושני רגלים בשתי אצבעות ומותח צוארו על רוחב שתי אצבעותיו ומולק וזו עבודה קשה שבמקדש
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : The bird on the outside holds its wings with two fingers and two legs with two fingers. and stretches its neck over the width of his two fingers, and pinches And this difficult rite in the Temple
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: Tsipra from Libra holds its wings with two fingers, and its two legs with two fingers, and stretches its neck over the width of its two fingers, and pecks. And this is the most difficult labor in the Temple.

hebrew_text: זו היא ותו לא והאיכא קמיצה וחפינה אלא אימא זו עבודה קשה מעבודות קשות שבמקדש:
human_translation: This is and no other? But isn’t there removal of the handful and the handful Rather, say a difficult rite, of the difficult rites in the Temple
llm_translation: This is and not more, and there is a kamitza and a hafinah, rather say this is a difficult service from the difficult services in the Temple.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ עולת העוף כיצד נעשית עלה לכבש ופנה לסובב בא לו לקרן דרומית מזרחית היה מולק את ראשה ממול ערפה ומבדיל ומיצה את דמה על קיר המזבח נטל את הראש והקיף בית מליקתו למזבח וספגו במלח וזרקו על גבי האשים
human_translation: the bird burnt offering, how was it performed? ascended the ramp and turned to the surrounding ledge and came to southeast corner would pinch the head at its nape and separate and squeeze out its blood on the wall of the altar. He took the head and neared the place of its pinching, to the altar He would absorb with salt and throw onto the fire
llm_translation: Mishnah: How is the burnt offering of a bird performed? It ascends to the ramp of the altar, turns to face around, approaches the southwestern horn. The priest pinches its head opposite its neck, separates and squeezes out its blood on the wall of the altar. He takes the head, encircles the base of the altar, dips it in salt, and throws it onto the fire.

hebrew_text: בא לו לגוף והסיר את המוראה ואת הנוצה ואת בני המעיים היוצאין עמם והשליכן לבית הדשן שיסע ולא הבדיל ואם הבדיל כשר סופגו במלח וזרקו על גבי האשים
human_translation: He arrived at the body and removed the crop and the feather and the innards that emerge with them and he tossed them to the place of the ashes. He ripped and did not separate but if he separated valid. absorb with salt and throw onto the fire
llm_translation: He came to the body and removed the gallbladder, the spleen, and the intestines that come out with them, and he threw them into the dung heap to rot. If he cut them and did not separate them, and if he separated them, it is valid. He soaked them in salt and threw them on the coals.

hebrew_text: לא הסיר המוראה ולא הנוצה ואת בני מעיים היוצאין עמם ולא ספגו במלח כל ששינה בה מאחר שמיצה את דמה כשירה הבדיל בחטאת ולא הבדיל בעולה פסול מיצה את דם הראש ולא מיצה דם הגוף פסולה דם הגוף ולא מיצה דם הראש כשירה
human_translation: he neither removed the crop, nor the feather and the innards that emerge with them, nor absorbed with salt, any that he changed in after he squeezed out its blood, valid. he separated in the sin offering, or he did not separate in the burnt offering, disqualified. he squeezed out the blood of the head and did not squeeze out the blood of the body, it is disqualified. blood of the body and did not squeeze out the blood of the head, valid.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He did not remove the membrane, nor the crop, and the offspring of the intestines that come out with them, and did not soak in salt. Any that changed in it after it squeezed its blood is fit. He separated with the sin offering and did not separate with the burnt offering - it is invalid. If he squeezed the blood of the head and did not squeeze the blood of the body - it is invalid; if he squeezed the blood of the body and did not squeeze the blood of the head - it is fit."

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף שמלקה שלא לשמה מיצה דמה שלא לשמה לשמה ושלא לשמה או שלא לשמה ולשמה פסול עולת העוף כשירה ובלבד שלא עלתה לבעלים לשם חובה
human_translation: a bird sin offering that pinched not for its sake, he squeezed out its blood not for its sake, for its sake and not for its sake, or not for its sake and for its sake, disqualified, A bird burnt offering valid; just that it did not satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Sin-offering of bird that sprinkles not for its sake, its blood for not its sake for its sake and for not its sake or for not its sake and for its sake invalid; burnt-offering of bird valid, as long as it did not ascend for owners for obligatory purpose.

hebrew_text: אחד חטאת העוף ואחד עולת העוף שמלקן ושמיצה את דמן לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת ובלבד שיקריב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: both a bird sin offering and a bird burnt offering where pinched its nape or squeezed out its blood to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns outside its area, disqualified. there is no karet for beyond its time, piggul and liable karet for provided that the permitting factor, was sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: One sin-offering of bird and one burnt-offering of bird that one sprinkles and squeezes their blood to eat something that its way is to eat and to burn something that its way is to burn, outside of its place is invalid and does not have karet, outside of its time is pigul and one is liable for karet, as long as the one who permits brings it as commanded.

hebrew_text: כיצד קרב המתיר כמצותו מלק בשתיקה ומיצה הדם חוץ לזמנו או שמלק חוץ לזמנו ומיצה הדם בשתיקה או שמלק ומיצה הדם חוץ לזמנו זהו שקרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: How the permitting factor sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? pinched in silence, and squeezed out blood beyond its time; or who pinched beyond its time, and squeezed out blood in silence; or who pinched and squeezed out the blood beyond its time, that is where permitting factor is sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: How does one who permits the offering like his obligation? He administers lashes silently, and he sprinkles the blood outside its designated time. Or if he administers lashes outside its designated time, and sprinkles the blood silently. Or if he administers lashes and sprinkles the blood outside its designated time. This is one who permits the offering like his obligation.

hebrew_text: כיצד לא קרב המתיר כמצותו מלק חוץ למקומו מיצה הדם חוץ לזמנו או שמלק חוץ לזמנו ומיצה הדם חוץ למקומו או שמלק ומיצה הדם חוץ למקומו
human_translation: How the permitting factor not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? pinched outside its area squeezed out blood beyond its time, or pinched beyond its time and squeezed out blood outside its area, or pinched and squeezed out the blood outside its area,
llm_translation: How did the one who permits not approach like his commandment, he receives lashes outside of its place, the blood is sprinkled outside of its time, or if he receives lashes outside of its time and the blood is sprinkled outside of its place, or if he receives lashes and the blood is sprinkled outside of its place.

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף שמלקו שלא לשמה ומיצה הדם חוץ לזמנו או שמלק חוץ לזמנו ומיצה דמו שלא לשמה או שמלק ומיצה הדם שלא לשמה זהו שלא קרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: a bird sin offering where one pinched not for its sake and squeezed out blood beyond its time, or where he pinched beyond its time and squeezed out blood not for its sake, or where he pinched and squeezed out its blood not for its sake, that is whose permitting factor is not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: Sin-offering of bird that they sprinkled not for its sake and squeezed the blood outside its time, or sprinkled outside its time and squeezed its blood not for its sake, or sprinkled and squeezed the blood not for its sake, this is that it did not draw near the one permitting as his command.

hebrew_text: לאכול כזית בחוץ כזית למחר כזית למחר כזית בחוץ כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: to eat an olive-bulk outside an olive-bulk the next day, an olive-bulk the next day an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk the next day, half an olive-bulk the next day half an olive-bulk outside disqualified and does not include karet .

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה זה הכלל אם מחשבת הזמן קדמה למחשבת המקום פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת ואם מחשבת המקום קדמה למחשבת הזמן פסול ואין בו כרת [וחכ"א זה וזה פסול ואין בו כרת]
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said this is the principle: If the intent the time preceded the intent the area, piggul and one is liable karet for it.
