human_translation: A bird burnt offering that one sacrificed above according to the procedure of a burnt offering for the sake of a burnt offering fit. according to the procedure of burnt offering for the sake of a sin offering, fit, but it did not satisfy the obligation of its owner.
llm_translation: The burnt-offering of a bird that he made above, like the act of a burnt-offering, for the sake of a burnt-offering, is valid; like the act of a burnt-offering, for the sake of a sin-offering, is valid, provided that it did not ascend to its mate.

hebrew_text: כמעשה חטאת לשם עולה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת פסולה עשאה למטה כמעשה כולן פסולה:
human_translation: according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a burnt offering, according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering, disqualified. he sacrificed it below according to the procedure of any of disqualified,
llm_translation: Like the case of a sin-offering for the sake of a burnt-offering, like the case of a sin-offering for the sake of a sin-offering, if one made it below, it is invalid, like the case of all of them, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ דשני במאי אילימא דשני במליקה נימא דלא כר' אלעזר בר' שמעון דאמר שמעתי שמבדילין בחטאת העוף
human_translation: With regard to what did change If we say that he changed pinching we say that is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says: I heard that sever in a bird sin offering?
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in what case? If you say it was taught in the case of melikah ritual slaughter, then say it was taught not like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon who said, "I heard that they separate the blood in the sin-offering of a bird."

hebrew_text: ולא אוקימנא דלא כר' אלעזר בר' שמעון
human_translation: And Have we not explained that is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: And not established that not like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: לא דשני בהזאה
human_translation: No, where changed in sprinkling
llm_translation: Not taught in sprinkling.

hebrew_text: הכי נמי מסתברא מדקתני סיפא עשאה למעלה כמעשה כולן פסולה ואפילו כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת דשני במאי אילימא דשני במליקה האמר מר מליקה בכל מקום במזבח כשירה אלא לאו דשני בהזאה ומדסיפא בהזאה רישא נמי בהזאה
human_translation: This, too, stands to reason from that teaches the latter clause: one sacrificed above according to the procedure of any of disqualified, and even according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering. With regard to what did change If we say that he changed pinching, didn’t the Master say pinching is valid anywhere on the altar? Rather, is it not that he changed sprinkling? And since the latter clause with regard to sprinkling, the first clause also with regard to sprinkling.
llm_translation: So too it is logical, as it is taught in the latter part: if one performed it above like all of them, it is invalid, even if it was done like the act of a sin-offering for the sake of a sin-offering. What does it mean that it was done for the sake of a sin-offering? If you say it was done through burning, but the Master said: burning is valid anywhere on the altar. Rather, is it not that it was done through sprinkling? And just as in the latter part it is through sprinkling, so too in the former part it is through sprinkling.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא:
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From the house of Irya, this is as it was said, and this is as it was said:

hebrew_text: עולת העוף כו' דשני במאי
human_translation: a bird burnt offering With regard to what did change
llm_translation: Burnt offering of a bird, etc. What is the difference?

hebrew_text: אילימא דשני במליקה מדקתני סיפא כולן אין מטמאין בבית הבליעה ומועלין בהן נימא דלא כרבי יהושע דאי כר' יהושע האמר אין מועלין
human_translation: If we say he changed pinching from that the latter clause, teaches: All of do not render ritually impure in the throat, and from them misuse we say is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. As, if in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, doesn’t he say not misusing
llm_translation: If you say that they differ in regard to the act of throwing, since the latter clause teaches: all of them do not render impure in the receptacle, and one is culpable for them, say it is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, for if it were in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua who said: one is not culpable...

hebrew_text: ואלא במיצוי
human_translation: Rather, in squeezing
llm_translation: And rather, in the squeezing out.

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא עולת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת ר"א אומר מועלין בה ר' יהושע אומר אין מועלין בה דשני במאי
human_translation: say the last clause a bird burnt offering that one sacrificed below according to the procedure of a sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering, Rabbi Eliezer says: from it misuse Rabbi Yehoshua says: from it not misuse with regard to what did change
llm_translation: Say the latter part: a burnt offering of a bird that he made below, like the act of a sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: one is liable for misuse. Rabbi Joshua says: one is not liable for misuse, as he differs in what it is used for.

hebrew_text: אילימא במיצוי אימר דאמר ר' יהושע דשני במליקה במיצוי מי אמר
human_translation: If we say squeezing, say that Rabbi Yehoshua says when changed pinching, does he say in squeezing
llm_translation: If you say that it is referring to extracting the blood, let us say that Rabbi Yehoshua said that it is different in regards to salting and extracting, who said it is different in salting, is it also different in extracting?

hebrew_text: ואלא במליקה רישא וסיפא במליקה ומציעתא במיצוי
human_translation: Rather, with regard to pinching. the first clause and the last clause with regard to pinching, but the middle clause with regard to squeezing?
llm_translation: And rather, in malika the beginning, and the end in malika, and the middle in mitzva.

hebrew_text: אין רישא וסיפא במליקה ומציעתא במיצוי:
human_translation: Indeed, the first clause and the last clause with regard to pinching, and the middle clause with regard to squeezing.
llm_translation: The beginning and the end in regards to plucking and inserting are by way of extraction.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ וכולן אין מטמאין בבית הבליעה ומועלים בהן חוץ מחטאת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת
human_translation: And all of do not render ritually impure in the throat. But them misusing except for the bird sin offering that one sacrificed below according to the procedure of sin offering for the sake of a sin offering.
llm_translation: Mishnah: And all of them do not become impure in the house of swallowing, and they are invalidated in them except for the sin-offering of a bird that was made below like the act of a sin-offering for the sake of a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: עולת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת ר"א אומר מועלים בה ר' יהושע אומר אין מועלים בה
human_translation: a bird burnt offering that sacrificed below according to the procedure of sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering, Rabbi Eliezer says: it misusing Rabbi Yehoshua says: it not misusing
llm_translation: Burnt offering of a bird that he made below like the act of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: They are invalidated by it. Rabbi Joshua says: They are not invalidated by it.

hebrew_text: א"ר אליעזר ומה אם חטאת שאין מועלים בה לשמה כששינה את שמה מועלים בה עולה שמועלים בה לשמה כששינה את שמה אינו דין שימעלו בה
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: And if a sin offering that for its sake, not misusing it, when one changed its designation misusing it, a burnt offering, where misusing it for its sake, when one changed its designation is it not right that misusing it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: And what if a sin-offering that is not being misused for its intended purpose, when its name is changed, it is misused for its intended purpose. If its name is changed, it is not proper that it be misused for its intended purpose.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' יהושע לא אם אמרת בחטאת ששינה את שמה לשם עולה שכן שינה את שמה לדבר שיש בו מעילה תאמר בעולה ששינה את שמה לשם חטאת שכן שינה את שמה לדבר שאין בו מעילה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you said with regard to a sin offering which one changed its designation for the sake of a burnt offering because he changed its designation to an item for which there is misuse. Would you say in a burnt offering which one changed its designation for the sake of a sin offering as he changed its designation to an item for which there is no misuse?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say regarding a sin offering that changed its name to that of a burnt offering, as it changed its name to something that involves trespass, you would say regarding a burnt offering that changed its name to that of a sin offering, as it changed its name to something that does not involve trespass.

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' אליעזר והרי קדשי קדשים ששחטן בדרום ושחטן לשם קדשים קלים יוכיחו שכן שינה את שמם לדבר שאין בו מעילה ומועלין בהן אף אתה אל תתמה על העולה אע"פ ששינה שמה לדבר שאין בו מעילה שימעלו בה
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered in the south and slaughtered for the sake of offerings of lesser sanctity, will prove As changed their designation to an item that is not subject to misuse and, misusing them. You too should not be puzzled about the burnt offering, even though one changed its designation to an item that is not subject to misuse, that misusing it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Eliezer, "And behold, the most holy sacrifices that were slaughtered in the south, and were slaughtered for the sake of light sacrifices, they shall prove that he has changed their name for something that does not require a covering, and yet they are considered as having been offered with intent to misuse. Do not be amazed by the burnt offering, even though he changed its name for something that does not require a covering, they will still be considered as having been offered with intent to misuse."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' יהושע לא אם אמרת בקדשי קדשים ששחטן בדרום ושחטן לשם קדשים קלים שכן שינה את שמם לדבר שיש בו איסור והיתר תאמר בעולה ששינה את שמה לדבר שכולו היתר:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you said with regard to offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered in the south and slaughtered them for the sake of offerings of lesser sanctity, that changed their designation to an item for which there are both prohibited and permitted Would you say in a burnt offering which one changed its designation to an item that permitted in its entirety,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua, no, if you say regarding holy of holies that he slaughtered in the south and he slaughtered for the sake of light holy things, for thus he changed their name to something that contains prohibition and permission, will you say regarding burnt offering that he changed its name to something that is entirely permitted.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא אמר לו ר"א לרבי יהושע אשם ששחטו בצפון לשם שלמים יוכיח ששינה את שמו ומועלין בו ואף אתה אל תתמה על העולה שאע"פ ששינה את שמה שימעלו בה
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua: a guilt offering that one slaughtered in the north for the sake of a peace offering will prove as changed its designation and misusing it. And you too should not be puzzled about the burnt offering which even though changed its designation that misusing it.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer said to Rabbi Yehoshua, "A guilt-offering that was slaughtered in the north for the sake of peace offerings, should prove that changing its name renders it invalid, and one transgresses by using it. And you too, do not wonder about the burnt offering, for even though its name was changed, they may offer it."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהושע לא אם אמרת באשם שאם. שינה את שמו לא שינה את מקומו תאמר בעולה ששינה את שמה ושינה את מקומה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say with regard to a guilt offering as although changed its designation, he did not change its location shall you say with regard to burnt offering where changed its designation and changed its location?
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: No, if you say "in guilt offering," then. Changed its name, did not change its place. You will say "in burnt offering," that changed its name and changed its place.

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר"א אשם ששחטו בדרום לשם שלמים יוכיח ששינה את שמו ושינה את מקומו ומועלין בו אף אתה אל תתמה על העולה שאע"פ ששינה את שמה ושינה את מקומה מועלין בה
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: A guilt offering that one slaughtered in the south for the sake of a peace offering will prove as changed its designation and changed its location, and misusing it. You too should not be puzzled about the burnt offering which even though changed its designation and changed its location, misusing it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Eliezer: A guilt-offering that was slaughtered in the south for the sake of peace offerings - let it prove that it changed its name and changed its place, and we are liable for it. Do not be amazed also at the burnt offering, for even though it changed its name and changed its place, we are liable for it.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' יהושע לא אם אמרת באשם ששינה את שמו ושינה את מקומו ולא שינה את מעשיו תאמר בעולה ששינה את שמה ואת מעשיה ושינה את מקומה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you say with regard to a guilt offering which changed its designation and changed its location, but did not change its procedure, shall you say with regard to burnt offering which changed its designation and procedure and changed its location?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: No, if you said regarding a guilt-offering that he changed its name and changed its place but did not change its actions, you should say regarding a burnt-offering that she changed her name and her actions and changed her place.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ונימא ליה אשם ששחטו בדרום לשם שלמים בשינוי בעלים ששינה את שמו ושינה את מקומו ושינה את מעשיו
human_translation: Rava said: Let him say to a guilt offering that one slaughtered in the south for the sake of a peace offering with a deviation with regard to owner, as changed its designation and changed its location and changed its procedure,
llm_translation: Rava said, and let us say to him: A guilt-offering that was slaughtered in the south for the sake of peace-offerings with a change of ownership, he changed its name, he changed its place, and he changed its actions.

hebrew_text: מדלא קאמר ליה הכי שמע מינה נחית רבי אליעזר לטעמיה דרבי יהושע דאמר רב אדא בר אהבה אומר היה רבי יהושע עולת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת כיון שמלק בה סימן אחד נמשכת ונעשית חטא' העוף
human_translation: Since he did not say this to him, learn from it Rabbi Eliezer grasped Rabbi Yehoshua’s reasoning; as Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rabbi Yehoshua would say a bird burnt offering that one sacrificed below according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering, once he pinched one of the organs that must be severed in ritual slaughter [ siman ], is removed and becomes a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: The text does not contain any quotes from Biblical verses.

hebrew_text: אי הכי חטאת העוף נמי שעשאה למעלה כמעשה העולה מכי מליק בה סימן אחד תימשך ותהוי עולת העוף וכ"ת ה"נ והא"ר יוחנן משום רבי בנאה כך היא הצעה של משנה מאי לאו כך היא הצעה ותו לא
human_translation: If so, a bird sin offering that one sacrificed above according to the procedure of a burnt offering, too, as soon as he pinches one siman it should be removed and become a bird burnt offering. And if you would say indeed But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Bena’a this is presentation of the mishna? What, not this is presentation and nothing more?
llm_translation: If so, the sin offering of a bird also, as it is made above like the burnt offering, when one performs the act of pinching with it, one sign will be extended and it will become a burnt offering of a bird. And so it was taught. And Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Bana: This is the suggestion of the Mishnah. What, is it not so? This is the suggestion, and nothing more.

hebrew_text: לא כך הצעה של כולה משנה
human_translation: No, this is presentation of the entire mishna.
llm_translation: Not so the suggestion of the whole Mishnah.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר בשלמא עולת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת כיון דהא הכשירה בסימן אחד והא הכשירה בשני סימנין ועולת העוף למטה ליתא כיון דמלק בה סימן אחד נמשכת ונעשית חטאת העוף
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Granted, a bird burnt offering that one sacrificed below according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering. Since preparing by one siman , and preparing that by two simanim , and there no bird burnt offering below once he pinched one siman is removed and becomes a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Granted, the burnt offering of a bird, when he made it below, is like the sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering. Since he made it valid with one identifying mark, and he made it valid with two identifying marks, and the burnt offering of a bird below is not as good, since with one identifying mark it is invalidated and becomes a sin offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: אלא חטאת העוף כיון דאמר מר מליקה בכל מקום כשירה מכי מלק בה סימן אחד איפסלא כי הדר מליק באידך סימן היכי ממשכה והויא עולת העוף
human_translation: But a bird sin offering Since the Master said Pinching is valid everywhere as soon as one pinched one siman disqualified, when he then pinched the other siman how could it be removed and become a bird burnt offering?
llm_translation: Rather, the sin offering of a bird, since the Master said: "Melikah is valid everywhere," when he performs melikah with it in any place, if he removed one sign, it is disqualified. When he then performs melikah with it in another place, how does he draw it out, and it becomes a burnt offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב אדא בר אהבה אומר היה רבי יהושע עולת העוף שעשאה למטה כמעשה חטאת לשם חטאת כיון שמלק בה סימן אחד נמשכת ונעשית חטאת העוף
human_translation: the itself, Rav Adda bar Ahava says Rabbi Yehoshua would say: a bird burnt offering that one sacrificed below according to the procedure of a sin offering for the sake of a sin offering, once he pinched one siman , is removed and becomes a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: The body, Rav Adda bar Ahava said, Rabbi Yehoshua says: The burnt offering of a bird that he made below, like the act of a sin offering, for the sake of a sin offering. Once he sprinkles with it one mark, it is drawn out and becomes a sin offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: ת"ש חטאת לזו ועולה לזו
human_translation: Come hear a sin offering for this one and a burnt offering for that one,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Sin-offering for this, and burnt-offering for this."

hebrew_text: עשה שתיהן למעלה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול שתיהן למטה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול אחת למעלה ואחת למטה שתיהן פסולות שאני אומר חטאת קרבה למעלה ועולה קרבה למטה
human_translation: sacrificed both of them above half is fit, and half is disqualified. both of them below half are fit, and half are disqualified. one above and one below, they are both disqualified, as I say sin offering was sacrificed above, and burnt offering was sacrificed below.
llm_translation: He made both above half valid and half invalid, both below half valid and half invalid, one above and one below both invalid. I say, the sin offering is brought above and the burnt offering is brought below.

hebrew_text: נהי נמי דעולה קרבה למטה תימשוך ותהוי חטאת העוף
human_translation: even burnt offering was indeed sacrificed below it should be removed and become a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: Indeed, also regarding the elevation-offering that is brought below, it shall be drawn near, and it shall be a sin-offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: אימור דא"ר יהושע בחד גברא בתרי גברי מי אמר
human_translation: say that Rabbi Yehoshua stated with regard to one person, did he state with regard to two people,
llm_translation: Statement: Sayings of Rabbi Yehoshua: With one man after two men, who said?

hebrew_text: ת"ש חטאת ועולה וסתומה ומפורשת
human_translation: Come hear a sin offering and a burnt offering and unspecified and specified
llm_translation: Come and hear: sin offering, burnt offering, hidden, and explicit.

hebrew_text: עשה כולן למעלה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול כולן למטה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול חציין למעלה וחציין למטה אינה כשירה אלא סתומה ומתחלקת ביניהן
human_translation: sacrificed all of them above half are fit, and half are disqualified. all of them below half are fit, and half are disqualified. half of above and half of below, only unspecified fit, And is divided between them,
llm_translation: He made all of them above half valid and half invalid, all of them below half valid and half invalid, half above and half below is not valid except if it is closed and divided between them.

hebrew_text: ואילו מפורשין לא ואמאי נהי נמי דעולה קרבה למטה תימשוך ותיהוי חטאת העוף
human_translation: while specified not, But why even burnt offering was indeed sacrificed below it should be removed and become a bird sin offering.
llm_translation: And if it is explicit, no. And why? Yes, indeed, because the burnt offering is brought below, it is drawn and becomes a sin offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הא דלא כר' יהושע ומי מצית אמרת הכי
human_translation: And if you would say this is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, how can you say that?
llm_translation: And if you say, "But this is not like Rabbi Yehoshua," who then did you say this?

hebrew_text: תא שמע האשה שאמרה הרי עלי קן אם אלד זכר ילדה זכר מביאה שתי קינים אחת לנדרה ואחת לחובתה
human_translation: Come hear a woman who said: It upon me one nest, if I give birth to a male she gave birth to a male, she must bring two nests, one for her vow and one for her obligation.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The woman who says, "Behold, upon me is a nest; if I give birth to a male, I will bring two nests, one for her vow and one for her obligation."

hebrew_text: נתנתן לכהן הכהן צריך לעשותן שלש למעלה ואחת למטה
human_translation: she gave them to the priest the priest must sacrifice three above and one below.
llm_translation: Given to the Kohen, the Kohen must make them three above and one below.

hebrew_text: לא עשה כן אלא עשה שתים למעלה וב' למטה ולא נמלך צריכה שתביא עוד פרידה אחת ותקריבנה למעלה

human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: a fortiori . llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: Similarly, if an animal carcass that imparts impurity through contact and carrying, its slaughter purifies it, its trefah status purifies it from impurity. The carcass of a bird that does not impart impurity through contact and carrying, it is not the same that its slaughter should purify it, its trefah status purifies it from impurity.
