hebrew_text: גמ׳ ור"מ לא דריש דיו והא דיו דאורייתא הוא
human_translation: And does Rabbi Meir not require it is sufficient But isn’t It is sufficient, by Torah law?
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Meir did not expound "dayo," but "dayo" is from the Torah.

hebrew_text: דתניא מדין קל וחומר כיצד (במדבר יב, יד) ויאמר ה' אל משה ואביה ירק ירק בפניה וגו' ק"ו לשכינה ארבעה עשר יום אלא דיו לבא מן הדין להיות כנדון
human_translation: As it is taught How by a fortiori inference “And the Lord said to Moses: If her father had but spit in her face, a fortiori the Divine Presence fourteen days. Rather, It is sufficient for the emerges from inference to be like source.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: a fortiori reasoning, how so? (Numbers 12:14) "And the Lord said to Moses, 'If her father had but spit in her face...'" - how much more so in the case of the Divine Presence, for fourteen days! Rather, it is sufficient to come from the law to be like a judge.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי ברבי אבין ר"מ קרא אשכח וקדרש
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Avin, said: Rabbi Meir he found a verse and interpreted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Avin, said: Rabbi Meir expounded and interpreted.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא יא, מו) זאת תורת הבהמה והעוף וכי באיזו תורה שוותה בהמה לעוף ועוף לבהמה בהמה מטמאה במגע ובמשא עוף אינו מטמא במגע ובמשא עוף מטמא בגדים אבית הבליעה בהמה אינה מטמאה בגדים אבית הבליעה
human_translation: “This is the law of the beast, and of the fowl” But with regard to what law is a beast equal to a fowl and a fowl to a beast? an animal transmits impurity by touching and by carrying, a bird does not transmit impurity by touching or by carrying. a bird renders garments ritually impure in the throat; an animal does not render garments ritually impure in the throat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Leviticus 11:46) "This is the law of the animal and the bird." And in what way is the law of the animal equal to the law of the bird, and the law of the bird equal to the law of the animal? An animal is impure through contact and carrying, while a bird is not impure through contact and carrying; a bird makes garments impure through swallowing, but an animal does not make garments impure through swallowing.

hebrew_text: אלא לומר לך מה בהמה דבר שמכשירה לאכילה מטהר טריפתה מטומאתה אף עוף דבר שמכשיר באכילה מטהר טריפתו מטומאתו
human_translation: Rather, to tell you just as an animal, that which renders it fit for consumption, purifies it, a tereifa , from its impurity, so too a bird, that which renders fit for consumption, purifies a tereifa , from its impurity.
llm_translation: Rather to say to you, what animal, a thing that makes it fit for eating, purifies its treifah from its impurity, so too a bird, a thing that makes it fit for eating, purifies its treifah from its impurity.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה מ"ט קרא אשכח וקדרש נבלה טריפה אמר רבי יהודה טריפה למה נאמרה אם טריפה חיה הרי נבילה אמורה אם טריפה אינה חיה הרי היא בכלל נבילה אלא להביא טריפה ששחטה שמטמאה
human_translation: And what is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda, found a verse and interpreted a carcass, a tereifa Rabbi Yehuda said: Why was a tereifa stated? If a live tereifa , “a carcass” is stated, If a tereifa is not alive, it within the category of a carcass. Rather, to include a tereifa that one slaughtered that it imparts ritual impurity
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: What is the reason that the verse states "nevelah" and "terefah"? Rabbi Yehuda said: Why was "terefah" mentioned? If a terefah animal is alive, then "nevelah" should have been stated. If a terefah animal is not alive, then it is included in the category of "nevelah." Rather, it is to teach that a terefah animal that was slaughtered imparts ritual impurity.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב שיזבי אלא מעתה דכתיב (ויקרא ז, כד) וחלב נבלה וחלב טרפה
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi said to If that is so, as it is written: “And the fat of a carcass, and the fat of a tereifa ,
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said to him: Rather, now that it is written (Leviticus 7:24), "And the fat of a carcass and the fat of a torn animal."

hebrew_text: התם נמי נימא אם טריפה חיה הרי נבילה אמורה אם טריפה אינה חיה הרי היא בכלל נבילה אלא להביא טריפה ששחטה שחלבה טהור מכלל דהיא מטמאה
human_translation: There too let us say, If a live tereifa , “a carcass” is stated. If a tereifa is not alive, it is within the category of “a carcass,” Rather, to include a tereifa that one slaughtered, that its fat pure. By inference, that does impart impurity.
llm_translation: There too it was stated: If a treifah animal, behold it is considered a neveilah; if a treifah is not an animal, behold it is included in the category of neveilah. Rather, to bring a treifah that was slaughtered, its fat is pure, from which it is inferred that it renders impure.

hebrew_text: והאמר רב יהודה אמר רב ואמרי לה במתניתא תנא (ויקרא יא, לט) וכי ימות מן הבהמה מקצת בהמה מטמאה מקצת בהמה אינה מטמאה ואיזו זו זו טריפה ששחטה
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says, and some say it was taught in a baraita : “And if some animal, dies, some animals impart impurity some animals do not impart impurity. And what is that That is a tereifa that one slaughtered.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say it was taught in a baraita: "And if an animal dies, some of the animal makes other animals impure, while some of the animal does not make other animals impure. And which is the case? This is a treifah that was slaughtered."

hebrew_text: אלא טריפה מיבעי ליה למעוטי טמאה מי שיש במינה טריפה יצתה זו שאין במינה טריפה
human_translation: Rather, tereifa is necessary to exclude non-kosher those to whose species tereifa applies, is excluded, as tereifa does not apply to its species.
llm_translation: Rather, "treifah" is needed to exclude impure animals. If it has a defect of its kind, it is treifah; if it does not have a defect of its kind, it is not treifah.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי למעוטי עוף טמא שאין במינו טריפה
human_translation: Here too, excluding a non-kosher bird as tereifa does not apply to its species.
llm_translation: Here also, to exclude the impure bird that does not have a kind of treifah.

hebrew_text: עוף טמא לר' יהודה מנבילה נפקא ליה
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yehuda, a non-kosher bird is derived from “a carcass”
llm_translation: An impure bird according to Rabbi Yehuda emerges from a carcass.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי יהודה אומר יכול תהא נבלת עוף טמא מטמאה בגדים אבית הבליעה ת"ל (ויקרא כב, ח) נבלה וטרפה לא יאכל מי שאיסורו משום בל תאכל נבילה יצא זה שאין איסורו משום בל תאכל נבילה אלא משום בל תאכל טמא
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: might the carcass of a non-kosher bird renders garments ritually impure in the throat. the verse states, “A carcass, or a tereifa , he shall not eat” those that are forbidden due to You shall not eat a carcass, This is excluded, as forbidden not due to You shall not eat a carcass, rather due to You shall not eat a non-kosher
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One might have thought that the carcass of an impure bird imparts impurity to garments through ingestion; the Torah teaches (Leviticus 22:8), 'A carcass or torn animal shall not be eaten.' This excludes one whose prohibition is due to 'do not eat carcass,' indicating that only one whose prohibition is not due to 'do not eat carcass' imparts impurity, but not one whose prohibition is due to 'do not eat impure.'"

hebrew_text: האי נמי תיפוק לי (ויקרא ז, כד) מוחלב נבלה
human_translation: this also derive from “And the fat of a carcass,
llm_translation: This also can be derived: "He shall not eat of the carcass" (Leviticus 7:24).

hebrew_text: מי שאיסורו משום בל תאכל חלב נבלה יצאתה זו שאין איסורה משום בל תאכל [חלב נבלה] אלא משום טמא
human_translation: that forbidden due to You shall not eat the fat of a carcass, to exclude this which is not forbidden due to You shall not eat the fat of a carcass, rather due to a non-kosher
llm_translation: One whose prohibition is due to "do not eat the fat of a carcass," she has fulfilled her obligation. This is one whose prohibition is not due to "do not eat the fat of a carcass" but rather due to impurity.

hebrew_text: אלא האי טריפה מיבעי לאיתויי חיה סלקא דעתך אמינא מי שחלבה אסור ובשרה מותר יצאת זו שחלבה ובשרה מותר קמ"ל
human_translation: Rather, this “ tereifa ” is necessary to include undomesticated animal, enter your mind to say those whose fat is forbidden and whose meat permitted to exclude this whose fat and meat are permitted teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, this case of treifah is necessary to bring up the issue of a living animal. Do you really think I would say that its milk is forbidden and its meat is permitted? No, you have to say that both its milk and its meat are permitted. This teaches us that both its milk and its meat are permitted.

hebrew_text: א"ל מאי שנא טמאה דאין חלבה חלוק מבשרה חיה נמי אין חלבה חלוק מבשרה ועוד הכתיב (ויקרא ז, כד) ואכל לא תאכלוהו
human_translation: He said to him: what is different a non-kosher that its fat is not distinct from its meat, the fat of undomesticated animal is also not distinct from its meat, And furthermore, isn’t it written “But you shall in no way eat of it”
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the difference between the impurity of its fat that its fat is not distinct from its flesh? Also, the fat of a living animal is not distinct from its flesh. Furthermore, it is written (Leviticus 7:24): "And of it you shall not eat."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי טריפה לגופיה איצטריך שלא תאמר הואיל וטמאה אסורה מחיים וטריפה אסורה מחיים מה טמאה חלבה טמא אף טריפה חלבה טמא
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: “ tereifa ” was necessary for its own that you should not say since a non-kosher forbidden while alive, and a tereifa forbidden while alive, just as the fat of a non-kosher impure, so too the fat of a tereifa impure.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "A treifah by itself is necessary, lest you say, since a ritually impure animal is forbidden in life, and a treifah is forbidden in life, just as an impure animal, its milk is impure, so too a treifah, its milk is impure."

hebrew_text: אי הכי האי נמי מיבעי שלא תאמר הואיל ועוף טמא אסור באכילה וטריפה אסורה באכילה מה עוף טמא אינו מטמא אף טריפה אינה מטמאה
human_translation: if so, this is also necessary that you should not say Since a non-kosher bird forbidden for consumption, and a tereifa forbidden for consumption, just as a non-kosher bird does not impart impurity, so too a tereifa does not impart impurity.
llm_translation: If so, this one also requires explanation, lest you say, since a non-kosher bird is prohibited for consumption, and a treifah is prohibited for consumption, just as a non-kosher bird does not transmit impurity, so too a treifah does not transmit impurity.

hebrew_text: ועוד מי איכא למילף טרפה מטמאה טמאה לא היתה לה שעת הכושר טריפה היתה לה שעת הכושר וכי תימא טריפה מבטן מאי איכא למימר במינה מיהא איכא
human_translation: And furthermore, is it to derive a tereifa from a non-kosher a non-kosher never had a kosher period a tereifa had a kosher period And if you would say: What can be said a tereifa from the womb, In any event, there are among its species,
llm_translation: And furthermore, is there anyone to say that a treifah can render impure? It did not have a moment of fitness. It had a moment of fitness. And if you say, "A treifah from the womb," what is there to say? In its kind, there is.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא התורה אמרה יבא איסור נבילה ויחול על איסור חלב יבא איסור טריפה ויחול על איסור חלב
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: the Torah states: Let the prohibition of a carcass come and take effect the prohibition of fat Let the prohibition of a tereifa come and take effect the prohibition of fat
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The Torah stated, "Let the prohibition of nevelah come and take effect on the prohibition of chelev; let the prohibition of treifah come and take effect on the prohibition of chelev."

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי אשמעינן נבילה משום דמטמיא אבל טריפה אימא לא ואי אשמעינן טריפה משום דאיסורה מחיים אבל נבילה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And are necessary, As, had taught us a carcass, as it imparts ritual impurity, but a tereifa , say not And had taught us a tereifa , as its prohibition while alive, but a carcass, say not necessary.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that it is forbidden to benefit from a carcass because it imparts impurity, but regarding a trefah, one might say it is permitted to benefit from it, and if we were to hear that it is forbidden to benefit from a trefah because its prohibition is from the living animal, but regarding a carcass, one might say it is permitted, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: ור"מ האי טריפה מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה למעוטי שחיטה שהיא לפנים
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Meir, do with this “ tereifa ”? It is necessary to exclude slaughter that inside
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir, what does he do with this treifah? He needs it to exclude ritual slaughter that is performed inside.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה טריפה אחרינא כתיב
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda Another tereifa is written
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, "Tereifah" is written elsewhere.

hebrew_text: ורבי מאיר חד למעוטי שחיטה שהיא לפנים וחד למעוטי עוף טמא
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir One to ex-clude slaughter that inside and one to exclude a non-kosher bird,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir: one reason to exclude ritual slaughter, which is internal, and one reason to exclude impure fowl.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה מנבלה נפקא ליה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda derives it from “carcass”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda went out to Navela.

hebrew_text: ורבי מאיר האי נבלה מאי עביד לה לשיעור אכילה בכזית
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Meir do with this “carcass”? to measure of consumption an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir: This carcass, what does he do with it for the measurement of eating, a kezayit.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק לי מקרא קמא מדאפקיה רחמנא בלשון אכילה
human_translation: But let him derive from the first verse: from that the Merciful One expresses the language of consumption.
llm_translation: And it was derived for me from the first verse that the Merciful One engaged in a manner of eating.

hebrew_text: חד לשיעור אכילה בכזית וחד לשיעור אכילה בכדי אכילת פרס
human_translation: one to the measure of consumption an olive-bulk, and one to the measure of consumption to eat a half-loaf
llm_translation: One for the measure of eating in an olive's bulk, and one for the measure of eating in the time it takes to eat half a loaf.

hebrew_text: ס"ד אמינא הואיל וחידוש הוא יותר מכדי אכילת פרס נמי ליטמא קמ"ל
human_translation: enter your mind to say: Since is a novelty, more than to eat a half-loaf should also contract impurity. teaches us
llm_translation: It is taught: I might have thought that since the novelty is greater than the eating of a half-shekel, it should also render one impure. This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ז, כד) "וחלב נבלה וחלב טרפה" -- בחלב בהמה טהורה הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And the fat of a carcass, and the fat of a tereifa , the verse speaks of the fat of a kosher animal.
llm_translation: The Sages taught (Vayikra 7:24), "And the fat of a carcass and the fat of a torn animal" - the Scripture speaks regarding the fat of a pure animal.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר בחלב בהמה טהורה הכתוב מדבר או אינו אלא בחלב בהמה טמאה
human_translation: Do you say the verse speaks of the fat of a kosher animal, or only of the fat of a non-kosher animal?
llm_translation: You say, "In the milk of a pure animal the Scripture speaks," or is it only in the milk of an impure animal?

hebrew_text: אמרת טיהר מכלל שחוטה וטיהר מכלל חלב. מה כשטיהר מכלל שחוטה בטהורה ולא בטמאה אף כשטיהר מכלל חלב בטהורה ולא בטמאה
human_translation: You say renders pure due to the fact slaughtered. And renders pure, due to the fact fat. Just as when renders pure due to the fact slaughtered, to a kosher and not to a non-kosher so too, when renders pure due to the fact fat, to a kosher and not to a non-kosher
llm_translation: You said: "purify from the category of slaughtered animal" and "purify from the category of milk." Just as when purifying from the category of slaughtered animal it is in a state of purity and not impurity, so too when purifying from the category of milk it is in a state of purity and not impurity.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו טיהר מכלל נבילה וטיהר מכלל חלב. מה כשטיהר מכלל נבילה בטמאה ולא בטהורה, אף כשטיהר מכלל חלב בטמאה ולא בטהורה
human_translation: Or go this way renders pure, from the category of a carcass, and renders pure, due to the fact fat; Just as when renders pure, from the category of a carcass, to a non-kosher and not to a kosher so too, when renders pure due to the fact fat, to a non-kosher and not to a kosher
llm_translation: Or go on this way purifies from the category of nevelah and purifies from the category of chelev. Just as when it purifies from the category of nevelah it is impure and not pure, so too when it purifies from the category of chelev it is impure and not pure.

hebrew_text: אמרת
human_translation: You say
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: אמרת English translation: You said.

hebrew_text: כשבא בדרך זו היא בטהורה כשבא בדרך זו היא בטמאה ת"ל טריפה מי שיש במינה טריפה
human_translation: When one approaches this way, applies to kosher when one approaches that way, applies to non-kosher the verse states: a tereifa those to whose species tereifa applies,
llm_translation: When he came on this path, she is pure; when he came on this path, she is impure. It is taught: "Tereifah," one who has in her kind tereifah.

hebrew_text: אוציא את הטמאה שאין במינה טריפה ולא אוציא את החיה שיש במינה טריפה ת"ל (ויקרא ז, כד) ואכל לא תאכלוהו מי שחלבה אסור ובשרה מותר יצא חיה שחלבה ובשרה מותר
human_translation: I will exclude a non-kosher as tereifa does not apply to its species, but I will not exclude an undomesticated animal, as tereifa applies to its species. the verse states “But you shall in no way eat of it,” whose fat forbidden but whose meat permitted, Excluded undomesticated animals, whose fat and meat permitted
llm_translation: I will bring out the impure animal that does not have a blemish, and I will not bring out the live animal that has a blemish. It is taught (Leviticus 7:24), "And you shall not eat it." One whose fat is forbidden and its meat is permitted, the live animal whose fat is forbidden and its meat is permitted shall be brought out.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב יעקב בר אבא לרבא אלא מעתה נבלת בהמה טהורה הוא דמטמאה נבלת בהמה טמאה לא מטמאה אמר ליה כמה סבי שבישתו בה סיפא אתאן לנבלת עוף טמא
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov bar Abba said to Rava: If that is so, the carcass of a kosher animal imparts impurity, the carcass of a non-kosher animal does not impart impurity. said to him: How many elders have you caused to err in the latter clause we come to the carcass of a non-kosher bird,
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov bar Abba said to Rava: Rather now, it is a carcass of a pure animal that renders impure; a carcass of an impure animal does not render impure. He said to him: How much older are you in the latter part? We come to a carcass of an impure bird.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן לא טיהר רבי מאיר אלא בתמימין אבל בבעלי מומין לא ורבי אלעזר אמר אפילו בבעלי מומין איתמר נמי אמר רב ביבי אמר רבי אלעזר מטהר היה רבי מאיר בבעלי מומין ואפילו באווזין ותרנגולין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir deemed pure only unblemished but not blemished And Rabbi Elazar says: even blemished It was also stated Rav Beivai says Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Meir would deem pure blemished and even geese and chickens,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Meir only declared pure with regard to the unblemished, but not with regard to the blemished. And Rabbi Elazar said: Even with regard to the blemished it was stated. Rav Beivi also said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Rabbi Meir would declare pure even with regard to blemished geese and chickens.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה ערף עז מהו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: what is broke the neck of a goat?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah inquired: "What is the law regarding a stubborn ox?"

hebrew_text: אווזין ותרנגולין טעמא מאי דמינא דעופות נינהו אבל עז לאו מינא דעגלה נינהו או דילמא מינא דבהמה הוא
human_translation: What is the reason geese and chickens because they are species of birds but a goat is not species a heifer, Or perhaps is a species of domesticated animal,
llm_translation: Geese and chickens, what is the reason? I might say that they are of the species of birds, but a goat is not of the species of a calf, or perhaps it is of the species of a domestic animal.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב דימי וקאמר לה להא שמעתא אמר ליה אביי מכלל דעגלה ערופה טהורה היא א"ל אין אמרי דבי רבי ינאי כפרה כתיב בה כקדשים
human_translation: Rav Dimi was sitting and saying this halakha , Abaye said to him: By inference a heifer whose neck is broken is pure said to him: Indeed, of the school of Rabbi Yannai say: atonement is written with regard to as sacrificial
llm_translation: Rav Dimi was sitting and saying to her, to that teaching. Abaye said to him: From the fact that the calf is mixed, it is pure. He said to him: The words of the school of Rabbi Yannai are not so; "like the sin offering" is written about it, like the holy things.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב נתן אבוה דרב הונא (בר נתן) ואכל לא תאכלוהו אין לי אלא חלב שאסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה חלב של שור הנסקל ועגלה ערופה מנין
human_translation: Rav Natan, father of Rav Huna bar Natan, raises an objection but you shall in no way eat of it” I have only fat that forbidden for consumption but from which benefit permitted From where fat of an ox that is stoned or a heifer whose neck is broken,
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Natan, the father of Rav Huna (son of Natan), asked, "And if one eats it, you shall not eat it" - I have only the case of forbidden fat that is prohibited for consumption but permitted for benefit, the fat of an ox that was stoned and a heifer whose neck was broken - from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ג, טז) כל חלב
human_translation: The verse states: no fat
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Tal (Vayikra 3:16) kol chelev."

hebrew_text: ואי ס"ד עגלה ערופה טהורה היא היא טהורה וחלבה טמא
human_translation: And if it enters your mind a heifer whose neck is broken is pure, is pure but its fat impure?
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Eglah Arufah is pure, it is pure, and its milk is impure."

hebrew_text: היכא דערף מיערף לא איצטריכא ליה כי איצטריכא היכא דשחטה מישחט
human_translation: was not necessary for where one broke the neck It was necessary where one slaughtered
llm_translation: Where it is necessary to plow, plowing is not necessary; where plowing is necessary, there is no need for slaughtering.

hebrew_text: ותיהני ליה שחיטה לטהרה מידי נבלה לא צריכא שמתה
human_translation: But slaughter should be effective in purifying from a carcass, No, necessary that died
llm_translation: And it is beneficial for him slaughter for purification from a carcass not necessary that it died.

hebrew_text: מכלל דמחיים אסורה אין אמר רבי ינאי גבול שמעתי ושכחתי ונסבין חברייא למימר ירידתה לנחל איתן היא אוסרתה:
human_translation: by inference, prohibited while alive? Indeed, Rabbi Yannai says: I heard boundary, but I have forgotten and the group were inclined to say its descent to a hard valley renders it forbidden.
llm_translation: From the principle that a living creature is forbidden, did Rabbi Yannai say: "I have heard the boundary and forgotten it, and my colleagues have inclined to say that its descent into the Nahal Eitan renders it forbidden."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך חטאת העוף
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding the sin offering of a bird.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הזבחים שנתערבו בחטאות המתות או בשור הנסקל אפילו אחת בריבוא ימותו כולן נתערבו בשור שנעבדה בו עבירה או
human_translation: All the offerings that were intermingled with sin offerings die, or with an ox that stoned, even one in ten thousand, they all must die. were intermingled with an ox with which a transgression was performed, or
llm_translation: Mishnah: All the sacrifices that became mixed up with the sin offerings of the dead or with the ox that is stoned, even if one sacrifice in a multitude, all of them the sacrifices shall die. They became mixed up with the ox that was worshipped idolatrously or

hebrew_text: שהמית את האדם ע"פ עד א' או ע"פ הבעלי' ברובע ונרבע במוקצה ונעבד באתנן ומחיר
human_translation: that killed a person based on one witness or based on the owner. with an animal that copulated with a person; or an animal that was the object of bestiality; with set aside or was worshipped with payment or price
llm_translation: The one who kills a person, whether intentionally or unintentionally, is executed by the sword, stoned, burned, strangled, or executed by the court.

hebrew_text: בכלאים ובטריפה ביוצא דופן ירעו עד שיסתאבו וימכרו ויביא בדמי היפה שבהן מאותו המין
human_translation: with diverse kinds, or with an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], with born by caesarean section. shall graze until they become unfit and they shall be sold. And shall bring of the monetary value of highest-quality among them, of the same type
llm_translation: In kilayim and in treifah, in the case of offspring, they shall graze until they are fattened and sold, and bring with the proceeds the fine of that species.

hebrew_text: נתערבו בחולין תמימים ימכרו החולין לצורכי אותו המין
human_translation: were intermingled with unblemished, non-sacred the non-sacred shall be sold for the purpose of the same type
llm_translation: They became mixed with ordinary animals, the ordinary animals shall be sold for the needs of that species.

hebrew_text: קדשים בקדשים מין במינו [זה יקרב לשם מי שהוא וזה] יקרב לשם מי שהוא
human_translation: sacrificial with sacrificial type with type one shall sacrifice this for the sake of whoever is and one shall sacrifice that for the sake of whoever is
llm_translation: Holy things with holy things, species with its own species this shall be brought near to the Name of the One who it is, and this shall be brought near to the Name of the One who it is.

hebrew_text: קדשים בקדשים מין בשאינו מינו ירעו עד שיסתאבו (וימכרו) ויביא בדמי יפה שבהן ממין זה ובדמי היפה שבהן ממין זה ויפסיד המותר מביתו
human_translation: sacrificial with sacrificial type with not type they shall graze until they become unfit and they shall be sold. And shall bring of the monetary value of highest-quality among them as this type and of the monetary value of highest-quality among them as that type and he will lose the additional from his assets.
llm_translation: Holy things with holy things, species with non-species shall graze until they are satiated (and sell) and bring with the money the best of them from this species and the best of them from that species, and the remainder from his house shall be lost.

hebrew_text: נתערבו בבכור ובמעשר ירעו עד שיסתאבו ויאכלו כבכור וכמעשר
human_translation: were intermingled with a firstborn or with tithe they shall graze until they become unfit and they shall be eaten as a firstborn or as tithe
llm_translation: They mixed together the firstborn and the tithe, they may graze until they are satiated and then eat like a firstborn and like a tithe.

hebrew_text: הכל יכולין להתערב חוץ מן החטאת והאשם:
human_translation: All can become intermingled except for a sin offering and a guilt offering,
llm_translation: All are able to intermingle except for the sin offering and the guilt offering.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי אפי'
human_translation: what Even,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "Efi"?

hebrew_text: ה"ק כל הזבחים שנתערבו בהן חטאות המתות או שור הנסקל אפילו אחד בריבוא ימותו כולן
human_translation: This is saying: All the offerings in which were intermingled sin offerings die, or an ox that stoned even one with ten thousand they all must die.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All sacrifices in which the sin offerings of the dead or the stoned ox became mixed, even if only one in a quarter, all of them shall die.

hebrew_text: תנינא חדא זימנא כל האסורין לגבי מזבח אוסרין בכל שהן הרובע והנרבע
human_translation: We learn another occasion, all whose on the altar prohibited, they render prohibited in any amount, An animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality.
llm_translation: We have learned in one place: all that are forbidden concerning the altar forbid in any amount, whether it is the majority or the minority.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמריתה לשמעתיה קמיה דרב שימי ואצריכן דאי מהתם הוה אמינא הני מילי לגבוה אבל להדיוט אימא לא
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: I said this halakha in the presence of Rav Shimi, and he me are necessary, As, if from there, I would say this statement, to the Most High; but to an ordinary [ hedyot ], say not
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said in the name of Rav Shimi, and it is necessary, for if I were to say these words on my own authority, I might say them regarding a scholar, but regarding a layman, I would not say them.

hebrew_text: ואי מהכא ה"א הני הוא דאיסורי הנאה נינהו אבל הני אימא לא צריכי
human_translation: And if from here, I would say it is these they are items from which benefit is prohibited. But these say not are necessary.
llm_translation: And if you ask, "Is this the same as those that are prohibited from deriving benefit?" - but these, say, are not necessary.

hebrew_text: דלאו איסורי הנאה נינהו הא תנא ליה מי קתני (בכמה כל שהן התם קתני)
human_translation: that are not items from which benefit is prohibited, taught this Does teach by what In any amount, is taught there,
llm_translation: Not prohibitions of benefit they are. This one teaches him: "Who taught it?" (In how many cases all they are there it teaches).

hebrew_text: וניתני הא ולא בעי הא תקנתא איצטריכא ליה
human_translation: But let teach that and not require this was necessary for the remedy,
llm_translation: And it was taught: "And not this, and this does not require this remedy, it is necessary for him."

hebrew_text: דהדיוט נמי תנא ליה ואלו אסורין ואוסרין בכל שהן יין נסך ועבודת כוכבים
human_translation: to an ordinary also taught And these forbidden, and any amount renders forbidden: Wine a libation and idol worship
llm_translation: The commoner also taught him: "And these are prohibited and prohibit in all that they are - wine libation and idol worship."

hebrew_text: צריכי דאי מהתם הוה אמינא להדיוט אבל לגבוה אימא לא נפסדינהו לכולהו
human_translation: are necessary, as, if from there, I would say to an ordinary But to the Most High say we not lose all
llm_translation: Necessary, for if from there, I would say for the layman, but for the scholar, I would say they were not lost to all.

hebrew_text: ואי מהכא הוה אמינא הני מילי קדשים דמאיס אבל חולין דלא מאיס אימא איסורי הנאה ליבטלי ברובא צריכא
human_translation: And if from here I would say this statement, sacrificial as repulsive But a non-sacred which is not a repulsive say: Let items from which benefit is prohibited be nullified in a majority. necessary.
llm_translation: And if from here, I would say these matters of holy things that are despised, but secular things that are not despised, say, prohibitions of benefit are nullified in the majority. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: וניבטלו ברובא וכי תימא חשיבי ולא בטלי הניחא למאן דאמר כל שדרכו לימנות שנינו
human_translation: But let be nullified in a majority, And if you would say are significant, and they are not nullified This works out well according to the one who says we learned Any whose manner is to be counted,
llm_translation: And they were nullified in the majority. And if you say, "they are significant and not nullified," it is preferable according to the one who says, "anything whose way is to be counted, we repeat."

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דאמר את שדרכו לימנות שנינו מאי איכא למימר דתנן מי שהיו לו חבילי תילתן של כלאי הכרם
human_translation: But according to the one who says we learned whose manner is to be counted, what can be said? As we learned one who had bundles of fenugreek, diverse kinds in a vineyard,
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, "If one's practice is to count, we have learned - what can be said? For we learned: 'One who had bundles of grape clusters.'"

hebrew_text: ידלקו נתערבו באחרים (ואחרים באחרים) כולן ידלקו דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים יעלו באחד ומאתים
human_translation: must be burned. were intermingled with others, and others with others, they all must be burned. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They can be nullified when 201
llm_translation: "Yadliku nita'arvu be'acherim (ve'acherim be'acherim) kulam yadliku, divrei Rabbi Meir. Vechachamim omerim, ya'alu be'echad u'me'atayim."

hebrew_text: שהיה רבי מאיר אומר כל שדרכו למנות מקדש וחכמים אומרים אינו מקדש אלא ששה דברים בלבד רבי עקיבא אומר שבעה ואלו הן אגוזי פרך ורימוני באדן וחביות סתומות וחילפי תרדין וקילחי כרוב ודלעת יונית ר' עקיבא מוסיף אף ככרות של בעל הבית
human_translation: as Rabbi Meir would say: Any whose manner is to be counted renders prohibited, And the Rabbis say: Only six items render prohibited. Rabbi Akiva says: seven. And they are: Nuts brittle and pomegranates from Badan, and sealed barrels and beet greens, and cabbage stalks, and Greek gourd. Rabbi Akiva adds: Loaves of a homeowner also
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Meir used to say: Anyone whose manner is to tithe, the Temple sanctifies it, and the Sages say: It is not sanctified unless it is one of six things only. Rabbi Akiva says: Seven, and they are: walnuts of Parah, pomegranates of Aden, sealed barrels, bundles of myrtle twigs, and bundles of cress, and the leaves of the cabbage and the ivy. Rabbi Akiva adds also loaves of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: הראוי לערלה ערלה הראוי לכלאי הכרם כלאי הכרם
human_translation: That which is fit to the prohibition against eating the fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ], orla . That which is fit to diverse kinds in a vineyard, diverse kinds in a vineyard.
llm_translation: Fit for uncircumcision, uncircumcision; fit for forbidden mixtures of vineyards, forbidden mixtures of vineyards.

hebrew_text: ואיתמר עלה רבי יוחנן אמר את שדרכו למנות שנינו רשב"ל אומר כל שדרכו למנות שנינו
human_translation: And it was stated with regard to Rabbi Yoḥanan says we learned: whose manner is to be counted And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says we learned: Any whose manner is to be counted
llm_translation: And it was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One who is accustomed to counting us, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: 'Anyone who is accustomed to counting us.'"

hebrew_text: הניחא לריש לקיש אלא לרבי יוחנן מאי איכא למימר אמר רב פפא האי תנא תנא דליטרא קציעות הוא דאמר
human_translation: This works out well according to Reish Lakish, but according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what can be said? Rav Pappa says: this tanna , is of a litra of dried figs, who says:
llm_translation: It is more preferable for Reish Lakish, rather for Rabbi Yochanan. What can be said? Rav Papa said: This Tanna, the one who taught, is a teacher of litra cuttings.

hebrew_text: כל דבר שיש בו מנין אפילו בדרבנן לא בטיל וכל שכן בדאורייתא
human_translation: Any item that is counted, even by rabbinic law, cannot be nullified, and all the more so by Torah law,
llm_translation: Every matter that has a count, even in Rabbinic law, is not nullified, and certainly not in Torah law.

hebrew_text: דתניא ליטרא קציעות שדרסה על פי עיגול ואינו יודע באיזו עיגול דרסה על פי חבית ואינו יודע באיזו חבית דרסה על פי כוורת ואינו יודע באיזו כוורת דרסה
human_translation: as it is taught a litra of dried figs that pressed onto the opening of circular and he does not know into which circular he pressed it. on the opening of a barrel but he does not know into which barrel he pressed it. on the opening of receptacle but he does not know into which receptacle he pressed it.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: If one trampled figs, not knowing on which fig he trampled; he trampled on a cluster of grapes, not knowing on which cluster he trampled; he trampled on a pitcher, not knowing on which pitcher he trampled.

hebrew_text: ר"מ אומר ר"א אומר רואין את העליונות כאילו הן פרודות והתחתונות מעלות את העליונות
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says Rabbi Eliezer says: One views the upper as though they are separate And the lower nullify the upper
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says, Rabbi Eliezer says, "They see the upper ones as if they are separated, and the lower ones elevate the upper ones."

hebrew_text: ר' יהושע אומר אם יש מאה פומין יעלו ואם לאו הפומין אסורין והשולים מותרין
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there are one hundred openings is nullified But if not, the openings are prohibited, And the insides are permitted,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: If there are one hundred Pumim, they may ascend; but if not, the Pumim are forbidden, and the Shulim are permitted.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר ר"א אומר אם יש שם ק' פומין יעלו ואם לאו הפומין אסורין וכו'
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Eliezer says: If there are one hundred openings there, it is nullified But if not, the openings are prohibited,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says, Rabbi Eliezer says, if there are there 100 mouths, they ascend, and if not, the mouths are forbidden, etc.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר אפילו יש שם שלשה מאות פומין לא יעלו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Even there are three hundred openings there, not nullified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says, "Even if there are three hundred mouths there, they shall not ascend."

hebrew_text: דרסה בעיגול ואינו יודע באיזה מקום בעיגול דרסה או לצפונה או לדרומה דברי הכל יעלו
human_translation: pressed into a circular but does not know onto which place, of the circular he pressed it, whether, to its northern or to its southern everyone agrees nullified.
llm_translation: He trampled on a circle and does not know in which place in the circle he trampled, whether to the north or to the south, the words of all will be valid.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר אפי' תימא רבנן בעלי חיים חשיבי ולא בטלי
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: You even say the Rabbis, living creatures are significant, and they are not nullified.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say the Rabbis are considered living beings, they are still not exempt.

hebrew_text: ונמשוך ונקרב חד מינייהו ונימא כל דפריש מרובא פריש נמשוך הוה לה קבוע
human_translation: And let us draw out and sacrifice one from and say, Any that separates separated from the majority. we draw out is fixed
llm_translation: And we pull and bring close one of them and say, "Whoever separates from the majority, he is separated and established."

hebrew_text: וכל קבוע כמחצה על מחצה דמי אלא ניכבשינהו דניידי ונימא כל דפריש מרובא פריש
human_translation: and anything fixed is considered as half and half, Rather, let us push that they move And let us say Any that separates separated from the majority.
llm_translation: And all fixed like half on half money rather we should establish them as movable property and say: anyone who separates, separates with the majority.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא (השתא דאמור רבנן לא ניקרב) גזירה שמא יבאו י' כהנים בבת אחת ויקרבו
human_translation: Rava says: Now that the Sages have said we do not sacrifice decree, lest ten priests come simultaneously and sacrifice
llm_translation: Rava said (now that the Sages said it was not torn), a decree lest ten priests come at once and offer.

hebrew_text: א"ל ההוא מרבנן לרבא אלא מעתה מגיסא אסירא
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rava: If that is so, the large basin [ megisa ] prohibited?
llm_translation: He said to him, the Rabbi to Rava, rather now, from the roof, a prisoner.

hebrew_text: משום שמא יבאו י' כהנים בבת אחת ויקחו בעשרה כהנים בבת אחת מי אפשר אלא אמר רבא משום קבוע
human_translation: due to lest ten priests will come simultaneously and take Is it possible ten priests simultaneously? Rather, Rava says due to a fixed
llm_translation: Because perhaps ten priests will come at once and take the portions with ten priests at once. Is it possible? Rather, Rava said because of a fixed number.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא השתא דאמרי רבנן לא נקריב אי נקריב לא מרצי איתיביה רב הונא בר יהודה לרבא חטאת שנתערבה בעולה ועולה שנתערבה בחטאת אפי' אחת בריבוא ימותו כולן
human_translation: Rava said: Now that the Sages say we do not sacrifice if we did sacrifice does not effect acceptance Rav Huna bar Yehuda raised an objection to Rava sin offering that was intermingled with burnt offering, or burnt offering that was intermingled with sin offering, even one in ten thousand, they all must die,
llm_translation: Rava said: "Now that the Sages say we do not offer the sacrifices, if we do not offer, we do not achieve favor." Rav Huna the son of Judah raised an objection to Rava: "A sin-offering that became mixed with a burnt-offering, and a burnt-offering that became mixed with a sin-offering, even if there were a thousand of them, all of them should die."

hebrew_text: במה דברים אמורים בכהן נמלך אבל בכהן שאין נמלך עשאן למעלה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול
human_translation: In what is this statement said? In a priest consulted But in a priest who did not consult he performed above half fit, and half unfit.
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? In a priest who is anointed, but in a priest who is not anointed, if he made them above half, they are valid, and if he made them below half, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: למטה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול אחת למטה ואחת למעלה שניהן פסולות שאני אומר חטאת קריבה למעלה ועולה קריבה למטה
human_translation: below half fit, and half unfit. one below one above they are both unfit, as I say sin offering sacrificed above and burnt offering sacrificed below.
llm_translation: Below half valid and half invalid one below and one above both invalid I say sin-offering brought above and burnt-offering brought below

hebrew_text: אלא הא כמאן דאמר בעלי חיים נדחין הא כמאן דאמר בעלי חיים אינן נידחין
human_translation: Rather, This in accordance with the one who says living creatures are rejected That in accordance with the one who says living creatures are not rejected
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "living creatures are rejected," and according to the one who says "living creatures are not rejected."

hebrew_text: הרי שחוטין דלכולי עלמא נידחין
human_translation: there is slaughtered which everyone agrees are rejected.
llm_translation: Behold, the slaughtered animals are invalid for everyone.

hebrew_text: ותנן ר"א אומר אם קרב הראש של אחד מהן יקרבו כל הראשים
human_translation: And we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: If the head of one of them was sacrificed all the heads should be sacrificed,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "If the head of one of them approaches, all the heads shall approach."

hebrew_text: הוא דאמר כחנן המצרי דתניא חנן המצרי אומר אפילו דם בכוס מביא חבירו ומזווג לו
human_translation: states in accordance with Ḥanan the Egyptian, As it is taught Ḥanan the Egyptian says, Even blood in the cup brings another and joins it to
llm_translation: He who said like Chaninah the Egyptian, as it was taught: Chaninah the Egyptian says, "Even blood in a cup, one should bring his friend and mix it for him."

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה אמר רב טבעת של עבודת כוכבים שנתערבה במאה טבעות ונפלה אחת מהם לים הגדול הותרו כולן דאמרינן הך דנפל היינו דאיסורא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rava bar Avuh says Rav says: a ring idol worship, that was intermingled with one hundred rings, and one of them fell into the Great Sea [ Yam HaGadol ], they are all permitted. that we say: That that fell is the prohibited
llm_translation: Said Rav Nahman, said Rabbah bar Avuhah, said Rav: A ring of idol worship that became mixed with one hundred rings, and one of them fell into the great sea, all of them are permitted, for we say: that which fell, that is the prohibition.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן אפילו אחת בריבוא ימותו כולן אמאי נימא דמית איסורא מית
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman even one in ten thousand, they all must die. why Let us say, that died, the prohibited died,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: Even if one of the animals dies within the fourteenth day, all of them the other animals should be considered as if they died. Why then should we say that the prohibition of eating chametz on Passover causes the animal to be considered as if it died?

hebrew_text: א"ל רב דאמר כר' אליעזר דתנן רבי אליעזר אומר אם קרב הראש של אחד מהן יקרבו כל הראשים כולן
human_translation: said to Rav states in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned Rabbi Eliezer says: If the head of one of them is sacrificed all the heads should be sacrificed,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav, as Rabbi Eliezer said, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer says, "If the head of one of them approaches, all the heads will approach."

hebrew_text: והא אמר ר"א לא התיר רבי אליעזר אלא שנים שנים אבל אחד אחד לא א"ל אנא תרתי קאמינא
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Rabbi Eliezer permitted only two two, but not one one, said to I am saying two
llm_translation: And behold, Rabbi Eliezer said: Rabbi Eliezer only permitted two by two, but not one by one. He said to him: I am saying two.

hebrew_text: אמר רב טבעת של עבודת כוכבים שנתערבה במאה טבעות ופרשו ארבעים למקום אחד וששים למקום אחר פרשה אחת מארבעים אינה אוסרת אחת מששים אוסרת
human_translation: Rav says: a ring idol worship that was intermingled with one hundred rings, and forty separated to one place, and sixty to another place, one from forty separated it does not render prohibited. one from sixty renders prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav said: A ring of idol worship that became mixed with one hundred rings, and forty were spread out in one place and sixty in another place, if one from the forty is spread out, it does not prohibit; one from the sixty prohibits.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא אחת מארבעים דלא דאמרינן איסורא ברובא איתיה אחת מששים נמי אמרינן איסורא ברובא איתיה אלא אם פרשו ארבעים כולן למקום אחד אין אוסרות ששים למקום אחד אוסרות
human_translation: What is different one from forty that not that we say: prohibited is in the majority one from sixty we also say prohibited is in the majority Rather, If all forty separated to one place, do not render prohibited, sixty to one place, render prohibited.
llm_translation: What is the difference between one out of forty, that we do not say that the prohibition is based on the majority, and one out of sixty, where we do say that the prohibition is based on the majority? Rather, if all forty are spread out in one place, they do not prohibit, but if sixty are in one place, they do prohibit.

hebrew_text: כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל א"ל הנח לעבודת כוכבים שספיקה וספק ספיקה אסורה עד סוף העולם
human_translation: When I said this in the presence of Shmuel, he said to me: Disregard idol worship, as its uncertainty and its compound uncertainty are prohibited forever,
llm_translation: When she said before Samuel, he said to her, "Leave idol worship, for doubt and double doubt are forbidden until the end of the world."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ספק עבודת כוכבים אסורה וספק ספיקה מותרת כיצד כוס של עבודת כוכבים שנפל לאוצר מלא כוסות כולן אסורין פירש אחד מהן לריבוא ומריבוא לריבוא מותרין
human_translation: raises an objection An uncertainty of idol worship prohibited, but its compound uncertainty permitted. How so? a cup idol worship that fell into a storeroom full of cups, they are all prohibited. one of these separated into ten thousand and from ten thousand into ten thousand they permitted.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: In the case of doubt regarding idol worship, it is prohibited, but in the case of a double doubt, it is permitted. How so? If a cup of idol worship falls into a treasury full of cups, all of them are prohibited. If one separates one cup from the multitude, and from that multitude another multitude, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא ר' יהודה אומר רימוני באדן אוסרין בכל שהוא כיצד נפל אחד מהן לתוך ריבוא ומריבוא לריבוא אסורין
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: pomegranates Badan, prohibit in any amount. How so? one of them fell into ten thousand and from ten thousand into ten thousand, they prohibited,
llm_translation: It is a dispute as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says pomegranates in Adan are prohibited in any form. How so? If one of them falls into a mixture, and from the mixture to another mixture, they are prohibited.

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן יהודה אומר משום ר"ש לריבוא אסורין ומריבוא לשלשה ומשלשה למקום אחר מותר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: into ten thousand they prohibited, But from ten thousand into three and of three into a different place, permitted,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: For a quartet, they are forbidden; for a trio, and from a trio to another place, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: שמואל דאמר כמאן אי כרבי יהודה אפילו בשאר איסורים אסור אי כר"ש אפילו בעבודת כוכבים נמי שרי
human_translation: In accordance with which does Shmuel state If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, even with regard to other prohibitions prohibited, if in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, even in the idol worship permitted,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: According to whom? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, even with other prohibitions it is forbidden. If according to Rabbi Shimon, even with idol worship it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא שאני ליה לר"ש בין עבודת כוכבים לשאר איסורים אלא הא דתניא ספק עבודת כוכבים אסורה וספק ספיקה מותרת מני לא רבי יהודה ולא ר' שמעון
human_translation: And if you would say a difference according to Rabbi Shimon between idol worship and other prohibitions, then that which is taught An uncertainty of idol worship prohibited but its compound uncertainty permitted, whose neither Rabbi Yehuda nor Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And if you will say that it is different for Rabbi Shimon regarding idol worship compared to other prohibitions, rather, this that was taught: A doubt regarding idol worship is forbidden, and a double doubt is permitted. Who is the Tanna? Not Rabbi Yehuda and not Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: לעולם רבי שמעון ושמואל סבר לה כר' יהודה בחדא ופליג עליה בחדא
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Shimon, And Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Shimon and Shmuel hold like Rabbi Yehuda in one matter and they argue with him in one matter.

hebrew_text: אמר מר מריבוא לשלשה ומשלשה למקום אחר מותר
human_translation: The Master, says from ten thousand into three and of three into a different place, permitted.
llm_translation: The Master said: "From three to three, one may transfer to another place."

hebrew_text: מ"ש שלשה דאיכא רובא שנים נמי איכא רובא מאי ג' דקתני תרתי והוא
human_translation: What is different three that there is a majority Even two there is a majority What three that teaches? two and
llm_translation: Three that there is a majority, two also there is a majority. What is the meaning of "three" that it teaches two, and this is the explanation.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא סבר לה כר' אליעזר
human_translation: And if you wish, say holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say that he holds like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל חבית של תרומה שנתערבה במאה חביות ונפלה אחת מהן לים המלח הותרו כולן דאמרינן הך דנפל דאיסורא נפל
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: a barrel of teruma that was intermingled with one hundred barrels And one of fell into the Dead Sea, all are permitted, as we say: that that fell, that the prohibited fell.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Levi: A barrel of terumah that got mixed up with a hundred barrels, and one of them fell into the Dead Sea, all of them are permitted. For we say: that which fell, the prohibition fell.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך דר"נ ואיצטריך דר"ל דאי מדר"נ הוה אמינא ה"מ עבודת כוכבים דאין לה מתירין אבל תרומה דיש לה מתירין לא
human_translation: And was necessary of Rav Naḥman and was necessary of Reish Lakish As, if from of Rav Naḥman, I would say this matter idol worship, which has no permitting factors; But teruma , which has permitting factors, not
llm_translation: And it was necessary for Rabbi Nehemiah and it was necessary for Rabbi Yehudah, for if it were according to Rabbi Nehemiah, I would say: "This is the case with idol worship, which we do not permit, but with terumah, which we do permit."

hebrew_text: ואי מדר"ל ה"א חבית דמינכרא נפילתה אבל טבעת דלא מינכרא נפילתה לא צריכי
human_translation: And if from of Reish Lakish, I would say a barrel as its falling is noticeable, But a ring, whose falling is not noticeable, not are necessary.
llm_translation: And if according to Rabbi Eliezer, a barrel of wine that fell is recognizable, but a ring that is not recognizable does not require checking.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה לא התיר ר"ל אלא חבית דמינכרא נפילתה אבל תאינה לא ורב יוסף אמר אפילו תאינה כנפילתה כך עלייתה
human_translation: Rabba says: Reish Lakish deemed permitted only a barrel, as its falling is noticeable. But a fig not And Rav Yosef says: even a fig. as falling so too, the emerging of
llm_translation: Rabbah said: R. Levi only permitted the wine if the barrel of vinegar fell into it, but not if a straw fell into it. And Rav Yosef said: Even if a straw fell into it, its ascent is like its descent.

hebrew_text: א"ר אלעזר חבית של תרומה שנפלה בק' חביות פותח אחד מהן ונוטל הימנה כדי דימועה ושותה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: a barrel of teruma that fell among one hundred barrels open one of them, and take from it as much as mixture and drink
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar: A barrel of terumah that fell among barrels, one opens it and takes from it to taste and drinks.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב דימי וקאמר לה להא שמעתא א"ל ר"נ גמע ושתי קא חזינא הכא אלא אימא נפתחה אחת מהן נוטל הימנה כדי דימוע ושותה
human_translation: Rav Dimi sat and said this halakha , Rav Naḥman said to him: I see Swallow and drink here, Rather, say: one of was opened, one may take from it as much as mixture and drink
llm_translation: Rav Dimi was sitting and saying to her, to that report, Rabbi Nahman said to him: "Gimme and drink, I see two here, rather say: if one of them opens, take from it for the purpose of hearing and drink."

hebrew_text: א"ר אושעיא חבית של תרומה שנתערבה במאה וחמשים חביות ונפתחו מאה מהן נוטל הימנה כדי דימועה ושותה ושאר אסורין עד שיפתחו לא אמרינן איסורא ברובא איתיה:
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya says: a barrel of teruma that was intermingled with 150 barrels and one hundred of them opened, one may take from it as much as mixture and drink And rest they prohibited, until they are opened we do not say prohibited is in the majority
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: A barrel of terumah that became mixed with one hundred and fifty barrels, and one hundred of them opened, one may take from it to its right measure and drink, while the rest are forbidden until they are opened. We do not say that the prohibition is nullified by the majority.

hebrew_text: הרובע והנרבע כו': בשלמא כולהו לא ידיע אלא האי טריפה היכי דמי אי ידיע ליה ליתי ולישקליה אי לא ידע ליה מנא ידע דאיערב
human_translation: An animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, Granted, all of not known. But this tereifa what are the circumstances? If, known to him let him come and take it If it is not known to him, how does he know that was intermingled
llm_translation: The quarter and the half, etc.: Granted, all of them are not known except for this treifah, what is the case? If he knows, let him bring it and weigh it; if he does not know, how does he know that it became mixed?

hebrew_text: אמרי דבי רבי ינאי הכא במאי עסקינן כגון דאיערב נקובת הקוץ בדרוסת הזאב
human_translation: They say the school of Rabbi Yannai: What are we dealing with here? where pierced by a thorn, was intermingled with clawed by a wolf,
llm_translation: The scholars of the house of Rabbi Yannai said: Here, with what are we dealing? Such as when a thorn bush is mixed with a wolf's den.

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר [כגון] דאיערב בנפולה נפולה נמי ליבדקה קסבר עמדה צריכה מעת לעת הלכה צריכה בדיקה
human_translation: Reish Lakish says where was intermingled with a fallen a fallen as well, let us examine it he holds stood it requires period walked it requires inspection
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said for example if it became mixed with a fallen vessel, the fallen vessel also requires examination. He holds that if it stood, it requires periodic examination; if it fell, it requires examination.

hebrew_text: רבי ירמיה אמר כגון דאיעריב בולד טריפה ור' אליעזר היא דאמר ולד טריפה לא יקרב לגבי מזבח
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya says where was intermingled with the offspring of a tereifa , And is Rabbi Eliezer, who says: The offspring of a tereifa may not be sacrificed upon the altar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said: For example, if one mixed a blemished animal with a healthy one, and Rabbi Eliezer is the one who said, "A blemished animal shall not be brought near the altar."

hebrew_text: כולהו כרבי ינאי לא אמרי בין נקובת הקוץ לדרוסת הזאב מידע ידיע האי משיך והאי עגיל
human_translation: All of them, do not say in accordance with Rabbi Yannai between pierced by a thorn and clawed by a wolf is known, this elongated, and that round.
llm_translation: All of them, like Rabbi Yannai, did not say between the hole of the thornbush and the tread of the wolf, knowledge, this one pulls and that one rolls.

hebrew_text: כריש לקיש לא אמרי קסברי עמדה אינה צריכה מעת לעת הלכה אינה צריכה בדיקה
human_translation: do not say in accordance with Reish Lakish, they hold stood, does not require period, walked it does not require inspection
llm_translation: Karis Lakish did not say: They hold, it does not require constant supervision, it does not require examination.

hebrew_text: כר' ירמיה לא אמרי כרבי אליעזר לא מוקמי:
human_translation: do not say in accordance with Rabbi Yirmeya, do not interpret in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: Like Rabbi Yirmeya, do not say like Rabbi Eliezer, not established.

hebrew_text: קדשים בקדשים מין במינו כו': והא בעי סמיכה
human_translation: sacrificial with sacrificial type with type But requires placing hands
llm_translation: Holy things with holy things, species with its own species, etc. And this requires "smicha."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף בקרבן נשים אבל בקרבן אנשים לא
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: with regard to an offering of women, But with regard to an offering of men, not
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "In the offering of women, but not in the offering of men."

hebrew_text: איתיביה אביי קרבן יחיד שנתערב בקרבן יחיד וקרבן ציבור שנתערב בקרבן ציבור וקרבן יחיד וקרבן ציבור שנתערבו זה בזה נותן ד' מתנות מכל אחד ואחד ואם נתן מתנה מכל אחד יצא ואם נתן ארבע מכולן יצא
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to the offering of an individual that was intermingled with offering of an individual, and a communal offering that was intermingled with communal offering, or the offering of an individual and a communal offering that were intermingled with each other, places four placements from each and every one But if he placed placement from each one, fulfilled And if he placed four from all of them fulfilled
llm_translation: Abbaye raised an objection: A private offering that became mixed with another private offering, and a communal offering that became mixed with another communal offering, and a private offering and a communal offering that became mixed with each other - one gives four gifts from each one. And if he gave a gift from each one, he has fulfilled his obligation. But if he gave four gifts from all of them, he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: במה דברים אמורים שנתערבו חיין אבל נתערבו שחוטין נותן ארבע מתנות מכולן
human_translation: In what is this statement, said? where were intermingled alive, But slaughtered were intermingled, places four placements from all of them
llm_translation: In what matters are these words said? When wine became mixed, but if blood became mixed, one gives four gifts from all of them.

hebrew_text: ואם נתן מתנה אחת מכולן יצא רבי אומר רואין את המתנה אם יש בה כדי לזה וכדי לזה כשרה ואם לאו פסולה
human_translation: And if he placed one placement from all of them, fulfilled Rabbi says: One assesses the placement if there is enough in for this and enough for that fit, but if not, disqualified.
llm_translation: "And if he gave one gift from all of them, Rabbi says: 'We inspect the gift - if it contains enough for this one and enough for that one, it is valid; but if not, it is invalid.'"

hebrew_text: קתני יחיד דומיא דציבור מה ציבור גברי אף יחיד גברי
human_translation: teaches an individual similar to, a communal Just as a communal men, so too, an individual men.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: An individual is similar to the public. Just as the public is significant, so too an individual is significant.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ותסברא הא מתרצתא היא דקתני במה דברים אמורים כשנתערבו חיין אבל נתערבו שחוטין לא מה לי חיים מה לי שחוטין
human_translation: Rava says: And can you understand this accurate as it teaches: In what is this statement said? where were intermingled alive. But slaughtered were intermingled not what to me alive whether slaughtered?
llm_translation: Rava said, and reasoning is this, that it is reconciled, as it is taught: In what case are these words said? When live animals were mixed together, but if slaughtered animals were mixed together, what difference does it make to me, live animals or slaughtered animals.

hebrew_text: אלא הכי קאמר בד"א שנתערבו שחוטין כעין חיים בכוסות אבל בבולל נותן ד' מתנות לכולן ואם נתן מתנה אחת לכולן יצא
human_translation: Rather, this is saying: In what is this statement said? where were intermingled slaughtered, similar to living in cups. But where mixed places four placements from all of them. And if he placed one placement from all of them, fulfilled
llm_translation: Rather, this is what it means: In the case of a mixture where slaughtered animals are mixed in the manner of live animals in cups, but in the case of a mixture of wine, one gives four gifts to all of them. And if he gave one gift to all of them, he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר רואין את המתנה אם יש בה כדי לזה וכדי לזה כשרה ואם לאו פסולה ומי אית ליה לרבי האי סברא והא תניא אמר רבי לדברי ר"א
human_translation: Rabbi says: One assesses the placement if there is enough in for this and enough for that fit, but if not, disqualified. And does Rabbi hold this reasoning, But isn’t it taught Rabbi says: According to the statement of Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "We inspect the gift; if it contains the requisite amount for this and for that, it is valid. If not, it is invalid." And does Rabbi hold this opinion? But isn't it taught in a Baraita: Rabbi said in accordance with the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: הזאה כל שהוא מטהרת הזאה אינה צריכה שיעור הזאה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול
human_translation: a sprinkling of any purifies sprinkling does not require measure a sprinkling half fit and half unfit
llm_translation: The sprinkling all that it purifies the sprinkling not needs measure the sprinkling half valid and half invalid.

hebrew_text: לדבריו דר"א קאמר ואיבעית אימא הזאה לחוד ונתינה לחוד:
human_translation: stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Eliezer, And if you wish, say sprinkling is discrete and placement is discrete,
llm_translation: According to his words, Rabbi Akiva said, and if you wish, say: "The sprinkling separately, and the giving separately."

hebrew_text: נתערבו בבכור ומעשר כו': אמר רמי בר חמא בכור לב"ש אין מאכילין לנדות תמורתו מהו
human_translation: were intermingled with a firstborn or with tithe Rami bar Ḥama says: a firstborn according to Beit Shammai, one may not feed to menstruating women, what is its substitute?
llm_translation: The firstborn and the tithe became mixed, etc. Rami bar Hama said: The firstborn according to Beit Shammai, one does not feed to a menstruant. What is the law regarding its substitute?

hebrew_text: בכור אינו נפדה תמורתו מהו בכור אינו נשקל בליטרא תמורתו מהו אמר רבא תניא בכור ומעשר משהוממו עושין תמורה ותמורתן כיוצא בהן
human_translation: A firstborn may not be redeemed, what is its substitute? A firstborn may not be weighed by the litra , What is its substitute Rava says is taught a firstborn or tithe from when they develop a blemish they render a substitute, and their substitute as them.
llm_translation: Firstborn is not redeemed, what is the redemption value? What is the redemption value of the firstborn not weighed in a litra? Rava said: It was taught in a Baraita: The firstborn and the tithe from its produce make an exchange, and their exchange is like them.

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא התפיס בכור לבדק הבית מהו שישקול בליטרא רווחא דהקדש עדיף או דלמא זילותא דבכור עדיף
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: dedicated firstborn to the Temple maintenance, what is that he may weigh by the litra ? the profit of the Temple preferable, or perhaps demeaning of the firstborn preferable.
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama asked: If one needs to take possession of a firstborn animal to inspect a house, what is the law regarding weighing it against a liter of space of consecrated property - is the sanctity of the consecrated property superior, or perhaps the elevation of the firstborn is superior?

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי בר זבידא ת"ש נתערבו בבכור ובמעשר ירעו עד שיסתאבו ויאכלו כבכור וכמעשר לאו למימרא דאינו נשקל בליטרא
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida says: Come hear were intermingled with a firstborn or with tithe they shall graze until they become unfit and they shall be eaten as a firstborn or as tithe not to say that is not weighed by the litra ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida said: Come and hear: If the firstborn and the tithe became mixed together, they may graze until they become satiated and then they may be eaten as firstborn and as tithe. This is not to say that it is not weighed in a litra.

hebrew_text: רב הונא ורבי חזקיה תלמידי דרבי ירמיה אמרי מי דמי התם שתי קדושות ושני גופין הכא שתי קדושות וגוף אחד
human_translation: Rav Huna and Rabbi Ḥizkiyya, students of Rabbi Yirmeya, say: Are comparable? There, two sanctities, and two bodies, here, two sanctities, but one body.
llm_translation: Rav Huna and Rabbi Hezekiah, disciples of Rabbi Jeremiah, said: What is the comparison there? Two sanctities and two bodies. Here, two sanctities and one body.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבי יוסי בר אבין מה אילו אמר הפדו לי בכור שהתפיסו לבדק הבית כלום שומעין לו הפדו רחמנא אמר לא תפדה
human_translation: Rav Yosei bar Avin objects to this: What if one says: Redeem for me, a firstborn that he dedicated to the Temple maintenance? Does listen to him? Redeem the Merciful One states you shall not redeem;
llm_translation: Challenges him Rabbi Yosei bar Avin: What if he said, "Redeem for me the firstborn that was designated for inspection of the house"? Do we heed him? The Merciful One said, "Do not redeem."

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר אמי כלום הקנה זה אלא מה שקנו לו:
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ami says: Can this transfer other than that which was transferred to him?
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ami said: Did he not acquire this? Rather, only what they acquired for him.

hebrew_text: הכל יכולין להתערב כו': מ"ש חטאת ואשם דהאי זכר והאי נקבה
human_translation: can become intermingled What is different a sin offering and a guilt offering, that this, a male, and that, a female?
llm_translation: All are able to intermingle, etc. What is the difference between a sin offering and a guilt offering, for this one is male and that one is female.

hebrew_text: חטאת ועולה נמי איכא שעיר נשיא האי שיער והאי צמר
human_translation: A sin offering and a burnt offering also there is goat Nasi , this hair and that wool,
llm_translation: Sin offering and burnt offering also exist, there is also a he-goat, the prince of this forest, and this wool.

hebrew_text: פסח ואשם נמי לא מיערב האי בן שנה והאי בן שתי שנים איכא אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע ואיבעית אימא איכא בן שנה דמיחזי כבן שתי שנים ואיכא בן שתים דמיחזי כבן שנה:
human_translation: A Paschal offering and a guilt offering also cannot become intermingled, this in its first year, and that in its second year. there is the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, And if you wish, say there is in its first year that looks like in its second year, and there is in its second year that looks like in its first year.
llm_translation: Passover and guilt-offering also do not mix, this one of a year and this one of two years there is, guilt-offering of a Nazirite and guilt-offering of a leper, and if you will say, is there a one-year-old that looks like a two-year-old and is there a two-year-old that looks like a one-year-old.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אשם שנתערב בשלמים רבי שמעון אומר שניהם ישחטו בצפון ויאכלו כחמור שבהן
human_translation: a guilt offering that was intermingled with a peace offering, Rabbi Shimon says: Both of them should be slaughtered in the north And must be eaten in accordance with the stringent of them,
llm_translation: Mishnah: If a guilt-offering became mixed with peace-offerings, Rabbi Shimon says: Both should be slaughtered in the north and eaten like the more stringent one among them.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו אין מביאין קדשים לבית הפסול
human_translation: said to one may not bring sacrificial to the status of unfitness.
llm_translation: They said to him, "One does not bring sacrifices to the disqualified house."

human_translation: pieces were intermingled with pieces offerings of the most sacred order with offerings of lesser sanctity; eaten for one day with eaten for two days and night, must be eaten in accordance with the stringent of them.
llm_translation: The pieces are mixed with pieces of the most holy things, with light holy things that are eaten in one day, they are eaten for two days and a night, they shall eat like their donkey.

human_translation: a tanna taught before Rav: Sabbatical one may not purchase teruma with its money, because reduces the eating

human_translation: The Sages said before Rabba, this not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon that if in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say, one may bring sacrificial to the status of unfitness?
llm_translation: The sages said before Rava: This is not like Rabbi Shimon, for if it were like Rabbi Shimon, he would say, "One may bring sacrifices to the Temple even if they are disqualified."

llm_translation: Abbaye said to him, "But isn't it similar to what you said about spices, and he told me to leave it for the Rabbinical contribution of spices. Here too, it is the Rabbinical contribution of vegetables. If so, the question arises: should we reverse it to teach about the vegetable of the contribution in the oil of the seventh year?"

hebrew_text: ולאו מי אותביתיה ממתני' דמתיר רבי שמעון ואמר לי דאיערב הכא נמי דאיערב

human_translation: Ravina objects to this Are comparable? piece that with the pieces, it has no remedy at all, this has a remedy through squeezing
llm_translation: Ravina objects to him: Is it comparable to a piece within pieces that has no remedy at all? This one has a remedy through pressing.

human_translation: And Rav Yosef how can one squeeze one squeezes a lot, causes a loss of Sabbatical one squeezes a little, ultimately will be intermingled,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef, how should he squeeze, he squeezes a lot, he loses in the seventh year, he squeezes a little, in the end, the mixture becomes mixed.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רבי שמעון אומר למחרת מביא אשמו ולוגו עמו ואומר אם של מצורע הרי זה אשמו וזה לוגו
human_translation: raised an objection to Rabbi Shimon says: On the following day, he brings his guilt offering and his log with it, and says If this of a leper, this is his, guilt offering and that is his log
llm_translation: His student asked Rabbi Shimon: "On the next day, should he bring his guilt-offering and his log of oil with him?" And he said: "If it is for a leper, this is his guilt-offering and this is his log of oil."

hebrew_text: ואם לאו אשם זה של שלמי נדבה ואותו אשם טעון שחיטה בצפון ומתן בהונות וסמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק

human_translation: And it is eaten on day and night, the remedy of a man is different
llm_translation: And we shall eat for day and night, the rectifications of a man are different.

human_translation: But requires burning that burn

human_translation: When If after the placement of seven is remainder that was lacking between removal of handful and burning, and one may not burn the handful for that
llm_translation: The time: when after the gifts seven they had leftover handfuls missing between the handful and the incense, and they do not burn the handful upon them.

human_translation: If, before the placement of seven Whatever is partly in the fire is subject to You may not make as an offering
llm_translation: If one gives the gifts of the seven days before the offering of the fat portions, it is considered as if he has offered it up in Babylon.

hebrew_text: לשם עצים
human_translation: for the sake of wood,

human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Shimon say one may not donate oil The remedy of a person is different,
llm_translation: And behold, Rabbi Shimon said: "Voluntary offerings are not like the oil of a man's rectification, for it is different."

hebrew_text: יתיב רב רחומי קמיה דרבינא ויתיב וקאמר משמיה דרב הונא בר תחליפא ונימא אשם זה יהא אשם תלוי
human_translation: Rav Reḥumi was sitting before Ravina, and he was sitting and saying in the name of Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa: But say this guilt offering shall be a provisional guilt offering,
llm_translation: Rav Rachumi was sitting before Ravina, and he was sitting and saying in the name of Rav Huna bar Tachlifa: "Let this guilt-offering be a hanging guilt-offering."

hebrew_text: ש"מ מאן תנא דפליג עליה דר' אליעזר רבי שמעון הוא דאמר אין מתנדבין אשם תלוי אמר ליה תורה תורה אימרי בדיכרי מיחלפי לך:
human_translation: learn from who is the tanna who disagrees with of Rabbi Eliezer, It is Rabbi Shimon, who says, one may not donate a provisional guilt offering. said to Torah, Torah! You are confusing lambs with rams.
llm_translation: Heard from whom is the Tanna who disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer? Rabbi Shimon, he said: One does not voluntarily bring a guilt-offering. He said to him: "Torah, Torah," should be said to you in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ איברי חטאת שנתערבו באיברי עולה ר' אליעזר אומר יתן למעלה ורואה אני את בשר החטאת מלמעלה כאילו הן עצים וחכמים אומרים תעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השריפה:
human_translation: the limbs of a sin offering, that were intermingled with the limbs of a burnt offering, Rabbi Eliezer says: shall place above, and I view the flesh of the sin offering above as though they are wood And the Rabbis say: the form of decays and they will go out to the place of burning
llm_translation: Mishnah: Limbs of a sin-offering that became mixed with limbs of a burnt-offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: Place them above, and I see the flesh of the sin-offering from above as if they are wood. And the sages say: Their form should be altered, and they should be taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מ"ט דרבי אליעזר אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, יב) ואל המזבח לא יעלו לריח ניחוח לריח ניחוח אי אתה מעלה אבל אתה מעלה לשם עצים
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer The verse states: but they shall not come up for a pleasing aroma on the altar” you may not offer up as a pleasing aroma, But you may offer up for the sake of wood.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Mishnah teaches: Rabbi Eliezer said: The verse states (Leviticus 2:12): "And they shall not ascend upon the altar to offer a pleasing aroma." For a pleasing aroma you may not ascend, but you may ascend for the sake of the wood.

hebrew_text: ורבנן מיעט רחמנא אותם אותם הוא דאי אתה מעלה אבל אתה מעלה לשם עצים אבל מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: And the Rabbis, the Merciful One excludes them.” it is them, that You may not offer up but you may offer up for the sake of wood. But other substances not
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "The Merciful One has limited them, limited them. For if you bring up the offering for its own sake, then you may bring it up, but if you bring it up for the sake of the wood, then you may not."

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר אותם הוא דרבאי לך כבש כמזבח אבל מידי אחריני לא
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, them, that includes ramp like the altar But other substances not
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, those are the words of Rabbai: "Go, take a lamb as an offering, but nothing else."

hebrew_text: ורבנן תרתי שמע מינה
human_translation: And the Rabbis, learn two from
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, two, hear from it.

hebrew_text: מתניתין דלא כי האי תנא דתניא אמר רבי יהודה לא נחלקו רבי אליעזר וחכמים על איברי חטאת שנתערבו באיברי עולה שיקרבו ברובע ונרבע שלא יקרבו
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis did not disagree with regard to the limbs of a sin offering that were intermingled with the limbs of a burnt offering, that they shall be sacrificed. with an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, that they shall not be sacrificed,
llm_translation: Mishnaic teachings that are not like this Tanna as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said, "Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages did not disagree regarding the limbs of a sin-offering that became mixed with the limbs of a burnt-offering, that they should be offered in a quarter and quarter so that they should not be offered."

llm_translation: Who heard him say that the commandments do not nullify each other? Rabbi Yehuda.

llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: Flax, its warp is impure due to its twisting, but its woof is pure. And if it was moist, its woof is impure due to the moisture of its mouth. human_translation: But according to Rav Zevid let combine them and teach them a difficulty
