hebrew_text: מתני׳ דם תמימים בדם בעלי מומין ישפך לאמה כוס בכוסות רבי אליעזר אומר אם קרב כוס אחד יקרבו כל הכוסות וחכמים אומרים אפילו קרבו כולן חוץ מאחד מהן ישפך לאמה
human_translation: the blood of unblemished with the blood of blemished shall be poured into the drain. a cup with cups Rabbi Eliezer says: if sacrificed, one cup, all cups shall be sacrificed, And the Rabbis say: Even all was sacrificed except for one of them, shall be poured into the drain.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The blood of unblemished animals with the blood of blemished animals shall be poured into an amah measure. Cup with cups. Rabbi Eliezer says, if one cup approached, all the cups shall approach. And the sages say, even if they all approached except for one of them, it shall be poured into an amah.

hebrew_text: הניתנין למטה שנתערבו בניתנין למעלה רבי אליעזר אומר יתן למעלה ורואה אני את התחתונים מלמעלן כאילו הם מים ויחזור ויתן למטה וחכמים אומרים ישפך לאמה ואם לא נמלך ונתן כשר
human_translation: that is placed below that was mixed with that is placed above Rabbi Eliezer says: shall place above and I view below above as though it is water, and again place below. And the Rabbis say: shall be poured into the drain. if did not consult and placed fit,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If the upper ones were mixed with the lower ones, Rabbi Eliezer says: Let him place them above, and I see the lower ones as if they are water, and then let him place them below. But the sages say: He should pour out a cubit, and if it does not become clear, then it is valid."

hebrew_text: הניתנין במתנה אחת שנתערבו בניתנין במתנה אחת ינתנו במתנה אחת (מהן) מתן ארבע במתן ארבע ינתנו במתן ארבע
human_translation: that is placed with one placement that was mixed with that is placed with one placement, shall be placed with one placement. four placements with four placements, shall be placed with four placements.
llm_translation: Those given in one gift that became mixed with those given in one gift, should be given in one gift (from them) a gift of four, in a gift of four they should be given in a gift of four.

hebrew_text: מתן ארבע במתנה אחת ר"א אומר ינתנו במתן ארבע ר' יהושע אומר ינתנו במתנה אחת
human_translation: four placements with one placement, Rabbi Eliezer says: shall be placed with four placements. Rabbi Yehoshua says: shall be placed with one placement,
llm_translation: The giving of four in one gift. Rabbi Eliezer says: They should be given in four gifts. Rabbi Yehoshua says: They should be given in one gift.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר הרי הוא עובר על בל תגרע אמר ליה רבי יהושע הרי הוא עובר על בל תוסיף
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to violates Do not diminish, Rabbi Yehoshua said to violates Do not add,
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Eliezer, "Behold, he transgresses 'do not diminish.'" Said to him Rabbi Joshua, "Behold, he transgresses 'do not add.'"

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי אליעזר לא נאמר בל תוסיף אלא כשהוא בעצמו א"ל ר' יהושע לא נאמר בל תגרע אלא כשהוא בעצמו ועוד א"ר יהושע כשנתת עברת על בל תוסיף ועשית מעשה בידך כשלא נתת עברת על בל תגרע ולא עשית מעשה בידך:
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Do not add, is stated only where is by itself, Rabbi Yehoshua said to Do not diminish, is stated only where is by itself. And Rabbi Yehoshua also said: When you placed you transgressed Do not add, and you performed a direct action. When you did not place you transgressed Do not diminish, you did not perform a direct action.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: It was not stated "do not add" except when it is in itself. Rabbi Yehoshua said to him: It was not stated "do not subtract" except when it is in itself. Furthermore, Rabbi Yehoshua said: When you have transgressed "do not add" and you have performed an action, when you have not transgressed "do not subtract" and you have not performed an action.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר אלעזר לא הכשיר ר"א אלא שנים שנים אבל אחד אחד לא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Rabbi Eliezer permitted only two two, but not one one,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said: Rabbi Eliezer only deemed the ritual immersion of utensils valid if they were immersed two by two, but not one by one.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב דימי וחכמים אומרים אפילו קרבו כולן חוץ מאחד מהן ישפך לאמה אמר ליה רבי יעקב לרבי ירמיה בר תחליפא אסברא לך מאי אחד זוג אחד
human_translation: Rav Dimi raises an objection And the Rabbis say even all was sacrificed except for one of them, shall be poured into the drain. Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Taḥlifa: I will explain to you: What one one pair,
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Dimi raised an objection, and the Sages say, "Even if they all come close except for one of them, he shall pour for an Amah." Rabbi Yaakov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Tachlifa, "I will explain to you, what is 'one pair, one'."

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי איתמר בהא בהא קא"ר אליעזר משום דאיתעביד ביה כפרתו אבל בהא אימא מודי להו לרבנן

llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if it was stated regarding this and this, Rabbi Eliezer said, because he performs atonement with it. But regarding this, say the Rabbis concede to them.

hebrew_text: ואי איתמר בהא בהא קאמרי רבנן אבל בהא אימא מודו לרבי אליעזר צריכא

hebrew_text: תנן התם צלוחית שנפלו לתוכה מים כל שהו ר"א אומר יזה שתי הזאות וחכמים פוסלין
human_translation: We learned there a flask into which any amount of water fell, Rabbi Eliezer says: should sprinkle two sprinklings but the Rabbis disqualify
llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah): If water fell into a basin, any amount, Rabbi Eliezer says: It is fit for immersion. And the Sages invalidate it.

hebrew_text: בשלמא רבנן סברי יש בילה והזאה צריכה שיעור ואין מצטרפין להזאות
human_translation: Granted, the Rabbis they hold there is mixing, And sprinkling requires measure And one cannot combine sprinklings,
llm_translation: In accordance with the Sages, they hold that there is a requirement for a minimum amount for Yibum and Halitzah, and they do not combine for Halitzah.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי אליעזר מאי קסבר אי קסבר אין בילה כי מזה שתי הזאות מאי הוי דילמא תרוייהו מיא קא מזי אלא קא סבר יש בילה אי קסבר אין הזאה צריכה שיעור למה לי שתי הזאות אלא קסבר הזאה צריכה שיעור ואי קסבר אין מצטרפין להזאות כי מזה שתי הזאות מאי הוי ואי נמי מצטרפין להזאות מי יימר דמלא ליה שיעורא
human_translation: But what Rabbi Eliezer hold? If he holds there is no mixing, if one sprinkles two sprinklings, what of it? Perhaps both he sprinkles water. Rather, holds there is mixing. If he holds sprinkling does not require measure, why do I two sprinklings? Rather, holds sprinkling requires measure. And if holds one cannot combine sprinklings, if one sprinkles two sprinklings, what of it? And alternatively, one combines sprinklings, who says that amount to measure?
llm_translation: Rather, what does Rabbi Eliezer hold? If he holds that there is no bila, then from where does he derive the two hairs? What is the case? Perhaps both are water? Rather, he holds there is bila. If he holds that the zavah requires a minimum amount, why does he need two hairs? Rather, he holds that the zavah requires a minimum amount. And if he holds that they do not combine for the hairs, then from where does he derive the two hairs? Alternatively, perhaps they do combine for the hairs. Who can say that it is complete?

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש לעולם יש בילה והזאה צריכה שיעור והכא במאי עסקינן כגון שנתערבו אחת באחת
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Actually, there is mixing, and sprinkling requires measure. And here we are dealing with where were mixed one to one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Reish Lakish said: Always there is Bilah and Zahah requires a measurement, and here what are we dealing with? For example, when one became mixed with the other.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לעולם יש בילה והזאה אין צריכה שיעור וקנסא דקנסו רבנן כי היכי דלא משתרש ליה
human_translation: Rava says: Actually, there is mixing, and sprinkling does not require measure. And a penalty the Sages imposed, so that would not benefit from this
llm_translation: Rava said: Always there is Bilah and Hezeh does not require a measurement, and the penalty that the Rabbis penalized, so that it does not take root for him.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר אין בילה יזה שתי הזאות
human_translation: Rav Ashi states there is no mixing, sprinkles two sprinklings.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: There is no "bila yaza" except for two hairs.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי רבי אומר לדברי ר"א הזאה כל שהוא מטהרת הזאה אין צריכה שיעור הזאה מחצה כשר ומחצה פסול
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi says: According to the statement of Rabbi Eliezer a sprinkling of any amount renders ritually pure, sprinkling does not require measure, a sprinkling half fit and half unfit
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The Tannaite scholars raised an objection: Rabbi Yehudah HaNasi says, according to the words of Rabbi Eliezer, "This is the rule: any amount of zavah (bodily discharge) purifies zavah. Zavah does not require a specific measure. If the zavah is half pure and half impure, it is valid."

hebrew_text: ועוד תניא בהדיא הניתנין למעלה שנתערבו בניתנין למטה רבי אליעזר אומר יתן למעלה והתחתונים עלו לו

llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught explicitly: those that are above mixed with those that are below, Rabbi Eliezer says, "Let the upper ones be placed above, and the lower ones ascend to him."

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת אין בילה אמאי עלו לו דילמא קיהיב עליונים למטה והתחתונים למעלה

hebrew_text: ת"ש נתן למטה ולא נמלך ר"א אומר יחזור ויתן למעלה והתחתונים עלו לו

llm_translation: Come and hear: He gave to the lower tribes and did not reign. Rabbi Eliezer says: He should return and give to the upper tribes, and the lower ones will rise to him.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי ברובא עליונים וקא יהיב למעלה שיעור תחתונים ועוד והא תחתונים עלו לו קתני לשם שירים

hebrew_text: תא שמע הניתנין במתנה אחת שנתערבו בניתנין במתנה אחת ינתנו במתנה אחת ואי אמרת אין בילה אמאי ינתנו במתנה אחת דילמא מהאי קיהיב ומהאי לא קיהיב כגון שנתערבו אחת באחת
human_translation: Come hear that is placed with one placement that was mixed with that is placed with one placement, shall be placed with one placement. And if you say there is no mixing, why shall they be placed with one placement? Perhaps he places from this and does not place from that where one was mixed with one
llm_translation: Come and hear: If items given as a gift were mixed together in one gift, they should be given in one gift. And if you say, "But there is no mixing," why should they be given in one gift? Perhaps from this one he will be pleased, and from that one he will not be pleased, such as when one mixed with another.

hebrew_text: מתן ארבע במתן ארבע הכא נמי שנתערבו ארבע בארבע
human_translation: four placements with with four placements, Here too, where four was mixed with four
llm_translation: The giving of four in the giving of four. Here too, four became mixed with four.

hebrew_text: מתן ארבע במתנה אחת
human_translation: four placements with one placement,
llm_translation: The giving of four in one gift.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ה"נ בנתערב באחת אי הכי אמר לו רבי יהושע הרי הוא עובר על בל תוסיף הכא בל תוסיף מהיכא

llm_translation: And if you say, "So too when they are mixed together in one vessel," if so, Rabbi Yehoshua said to him, "Behold, he transgresses 'Do not add' here, 'Do not add' - from where?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא בבלול לא פליגי כי פליגי בכוסות לר"א אית ליה רואין לרבנן לית להו רואין
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: do not disagree with regard to mixed When they disagree with regard to cups according to Rabbi Eliezer is of one views according to the Rabbis are not of one views
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: They do not disagree regarding mixing, but they disagree regarding cups. According to Rabbi Eliezer, he holds that the Sages have the ability to see, while according to the Rabbis, they do not have the ability to see.

hebrew_text: ובבלול לא פליגי והתניא א"ר יהודה לא נחלקו ר"א וחכמים על דם חטאת שנתערב בדם עולה שיקרב ברובע ונרבע שלא יקרב על מה נחלקו על דם תמימה שנתערב בדם בעלת מום שר"א אומר יקרב בין בבלול בין בכוסות וחכ"א לא יקרב
human_translation: And do they not disagree with regard to mixed But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis did not disagree of blood of a sin offering that was mixed with blood of a burnt offering that shall be sacrificed, in an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, that it shall not be sacrificed. With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to blood of an unblemished that was mixed with blood of a blemished as Rabbi Eliezer says shall be sacrificed, whether in mixed or in cups and the Rabbis say shall not be sacrificed.
llm_translation: In the mixture they do not argue. And it was taught: Rabbi Yehudah said, Rabbi Eliezer and the Sages did not disagree regarding the blood of a sin-offering that became mixed with the blood of a burnt-offering, that it should be offered in a quarter-log and be sprinkled, so what did they disagree about? Regarding the blood of an unblemished animal that became mixed with the blood of a blemished one. Rabbi Eliezer says it should be offered whether in a mixture or in separate vessels, and the Sages say it should not be offered.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אליבא דר"א מתני בין בבלול בין בכוסות ורבנן בכוסות פליגי
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer, teaches both in mixed and in cups, but the Rabbis disagree in cups.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda according to Rabbi Akiva teaches whether in mixing or in cups, and the Rabbis argue in cups.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לא שנו אלא תחלת חטאת ועולה
human_translation: Abaye says: taught only first of a sin offering, and a burnt offering
llm_translation: Abbaye said: They only taught this regarding the beginning of the sin-offering and burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: אבל סוף חטאת [ועולה] דברי הכל מקום עולה מקום שיריים א"ל רב יוסף הכי אמר רב יהודה שירים צריכין איצטבא
human_translation: But final of a sin offering, and a burnt offering everyone agrees the place of a burnt offering, the place of remainder Rav Yosef said to This is what Rav Yehuda says: remainder needs bench,
llm_translation: But the end of the sin offering and burnt offering, everyone agrees, the place of the burnt offering is the place of the leftovers. Rav Yosef said to him: So said Rav Yehudah, the leftovers require a spoon.

hebrew_text: וכן אמר ר"ש לא שנו אלא תחלת חטאת ועולה אבל סוף חטאת ועולה דברי הכל מקום עולה מקום שירים א"ר יוחנן ואיתימא רבי אלעזר עדיין היא מחלוקת
human_translation: And likewise Rabbi Shimon says: taught only first of a sin offering and a burnt offering But final of a sin offering and a burnt offering everyone agrees the place of a burnt offering the place of remainder Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and some say Rabbi Elazar is still dispute
llm_translation: And so said Rabbi Shimon: They only taught a distinction regarding the beginning of the sin-offering and burnt-offering, but regarding the end of the sin-offering and burnt-offering, it is the words of all that it can be offered in the place of the burnt-offering, in the place of the songs. Rabbi Yochanan said, and some say Rabbi Elazar: It is still a matter of dispute.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב הונא בר יהודה קדש הם שאם נתערב בדם קדשים אחרים יקרבו מאי לאו סוף עולה ובכור וש"מ מקום עולה מקום שירים לא תחילת עולה ובכור
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda raises an objection “They are holy” that if was mixed with blood of other sacrificial shall be sacrificed, What, is it not final of a burnt offering and a firstborn And learn from the place of a burnt offering, the place of remainder No, first of a burnt offering and a firstborn
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Judah raised an objection: "They are holy, so if they become mixed with the blood of other holy offerings, what should be done?" Is it not the end of an olah sacrifice and a firstborn animal? And we learn from this that the place of an olah is the place of the songs, not the beginning of an olah and a firstborn animal.

hebrew_text: ומאי קא משמע לן דאין עולין מבטלים זה את זה האי (ויקרא טז, יד) מולקח מדם הפר ומדם השעיר נפקא תנאי היא איכא דנפקא ליה מהכא ואיכא דנפקא ליה מהכא
human_translation: But what is teaching us? that ascend do not nullify one another? This is derived from “And he shall take of the blood of the bull and of the blood of the goat” is tanna’im , there is who derives from here, and there is who derives it from there.
llm_translation: And what is it teaching us that those who ascend do not nullify one another? This (Leviticus 16:14) is a dispute of Tannaim: there are those who derive it from here, and there are those who derive it from here.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבא (ויקרא א, ה) והקריבו בני אהרן את הדם וזרקו את הדם מה
human_translation: Rava raises an objection “And Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall present the blood and sprinkle the blood” What
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: "And the sons of Aaron shall bring the blood and sprinkle the blood" (Leviticus 1:5). What is meant by this?

hebrew_text: ת"ל דם דם שיכול אין לי אלא אלו שנתערבו בתמורתה שאף מחיים תקרב מנין לרבות תודה ושלמים
human_translation: the verse states “Blood,” “blood”? might I have only where this, was mixed with its substitute, as even when alive, shall be sacrificed. From where to include a thanks offering or a peace offering
llm_translation: The verse teaches: "Blood of blood" - I might only have these that became mixed with its redemption money, so too, from live animals, how do we know to include thanksgiving offerings and peace offerings?

hebrew_text: מרבה אני תודה ושלמים שבאין בנדר ונדבה כמותה מנין לרבות את האשם
human_translation: I include a thanks offering or a peace offering as they come as a vow and a gift like from where to include the guilt offering
llm_translation: I am abundant in thanks and peace offerings that come with a vow and a freewill offering like it, how do we include the guilt offering?

llm_translation: Let the law be that if it is invalid, and what in a place where it did not invalidate, the blood that is outside with that which is inside, the flesh that goes outwards is invalid. hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר מדמה דמה ולא בשר
human_translation: states: of the blood blood of but not meat
llm_translation: Behold, he says, "Similarity is compared, but not flesh."

hebrew_text: ק"ו מעתה ומה במקום שפסל דם שבפנים את שבחוץ בשר הנכנס לפנים כשר מקום שלא פסל דם שבחוץ את שבפנים בשר היוצא לחוץ אינו דין שכשר
human_translation: From now, an a fortiori And just as in a place where blood that inside disqualifies that outside meat that enters fit, a place where blood that outside does not disqualify that is inside is it not logical that meat that left outside fit?
llm_translation: It is all the same. Just as in a place where the blood inside disqualifies, the flesh that enters inside is valid, so too in a place where the blood outside does not disqualify, the flesh that goes outside is not considered valid.

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר (שמות כב, ל) ובשר בשדה טרפה לא תאכלו כיון שיצא בשר חוץ למחיצתו נאסר
human_translation: states: “And you shall not eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field” Once meat has left outside of its boundary, has become prohibited.
llm_translation: Behold, he says (Exodus 22:30), "And flesh in the field, torn, you shall not eat." Once the flesh has exited beyond its boundary, it becomes prohibited.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן פנימה אין לי אלא פנימה היכל מנין ת"ל (ויקרא י, יח) אל הקדש פנימה
human_translation: The Sages taught: within” I have only within, from where Sanctuary? The verse states: “Into the sacred place within,”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Inside" - I only have "inside." How do we know that the Sanctuary is meant? The verse states (Leviticus 10:18): "To the Sanctuary, inside."

hebrew_text: ויאמר קודש ואל יאמר פנימה אמר רבא בא זה ולימד על זה מידי דהוה אתושב ושכיר
human_translation: And let state “sacred place,” and not state “within.” Rava says: This comes and teaches about that just as it is with regard to a tenant and a hired worker.
llm_translation: And he said, "Kodesh," and one should not say, "Panimah." Rava said: This one came and learned from this, immediately when he was sitting and hired.

hebrew_text: דתניא תושב זה קנוי קנין עולם שכיר זה קנוי קנין שנים
human_translation: As it is taught “A tenant”; this acquired a permanent acquisition, “A hired worker”; this acquired an acquisition of years,
llm_translation: As it was taught: "A resident is acquired with an acquisition of eternity, a hired laborer is acquired with an acquisition of years."

hebrew_text: יאמר תושב ואל יאמר שכיר ואני אומר קנוי קנין עולם אינו אוכל קנוי קנין שנים לא כ"ש
human_translation: Let say “tenant” and let it not say “hired worker,” and I say: acquired a permanent acquisition does not partake not all the more so acquired an acquisition of years
llm_translation: A resident should say, and not a hired laborer, and I say, a purchase is an eternal acquisition, it cannot be compared to a purchase of two.

hebrew_text: אילו כן הייתי אומר תושב זה קנוי קנין שנים אבל קנוי קנין עולם יהא אוכל בא שכיר ולימד על תושב שזה קנוי קנין עולם וזה קנוי קנין שנים ואינו אוכל
human_translation: If so, I would say: “A tenant”; this is acquired an acquisition of years, but acquired a permanent acquisition may partake “hired worker,” comes and teaches about “tenant,” that this acquired a permanent acquisition and that acquired an acquisition of years, and may not partake
llm_translation: "If so, I would say: this resident is acquired with a double acquisition, but if acquired with a perpetual acquisition, he may eat from it, hire workers, and teach regarding a resident that is acquired with a perpetual acquisition and one that is acquired with a double acquisition, and he may not eat."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי בשלמא התם תרי גופי נינהו ואע"ג דה"ל לקרא למכתב נרצע לא יאכל ואידך אתי בק"ו מילתא דאתי בק"ו טרח וכתב לה קרא אלא הכא כיון (דאיכא) דאיפסל בהיכל (הכא) לפני ולפנים מאי בעי
human_translation: Abaye said to Granted, there, are two bodies. And even though the verse could have written a pierced may not partake and the other a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it But here, once it is disqualified in the Sanctuary, why is it necessary the innermost sanctum,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Granted, there they are two separate entities, and even though it is permissible to read from a document that has been folded, one may not eat it. And elsewhere, when a contradiction arises, one should exert effort and write a verse for it. But here, since there is a disqualification in the Temple, what does it require?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי לא נצרכא אלא לדרך משופש א"ל רבא והא הבאה כתיב ביה אלא אמר רבא כל מידי דחשיב עליה לפני ולפנים לא מיפסל בהיכל
human_translation: Rather, Abaye says: is necessary only for a roundabout manner, Rava said to But bringing is written in Rather, Rava says: any where intended the innermost sanctum, it is not disqualified in the Sanctuary,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, it is only necessary for a path that is trodden. Rava said to him, "But isn't it written in it 'the coming'? Rather, Rava said, anything that is considered important before and after does not disqualify the offering in the Temple."

hebrew_text: בעי רבא פר העלם דבר של צבור ושעיר עבודת כוכבים שהכניס דמן לפני ולפנים מהו
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: bull for an unwitting communal sin and goat for idol worship, that brought their blood into the innermost sanctum, what is
llm_translation: Rava inquired: "Regarding a bull of the world, an item of communal property, and a he-goat for idol worship that one brought blood from before it and from before it, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: מי אמרי' אל הקודש פנימה כל היכא דקרינן אל הקודש קרינן ליה פנימה כל היכא דלא קרינן אל הקודש לא קרינן פנימה או דלמא שלא במקומן הוא
human_translation: Do we say “Into the sacred place within” anywhere that we read “into the sacred place,” we read “within,” anywhere that we do not read “into the sacred place,” we do not read “within” Or perhaps, is not the place of these
llm_translation: Who said, "To the Holy, inward"? Wherever we read "To the Holy," we read it as "inward." Wherever we do not read "To the Holy," we do not read it as "inward." Or perhaps it is not in its proper place.

hebrew_text: ואם תימצי לומר שלא במקומן הוא פר ושעיר של יום הכיפורים שהזה מדמן על הבדים והוציאן להיכל והכניסן מהו
human_translation: And if you say that is not the place of these bull and goat of Yom Kippur, where sprinkled from their blood on the staves and he brought out to the Sanctuary and brought in what is
llm_translation: And if you will say not in their place it is a bull and a goat of Yom Kippur which this sprinkles their blood on the garments and takes them out to the sanctuary and brings them in, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: מי אמרינן מקומן הוא או דלמא הואיל ונפק נפק
human_translation: Do we say it is its place, Or perhaps since brought out, brought out,
llm_translation: Who said, "Is it their place or perhaps since he has gone out, he has gone out"?

hebrew_text: ואם תימצי לומר הואיל ונפק נפק הזה מדמן על הפרכת
human_translation: And if you say that since brought out, brought out, sprinkled from their blood on the Curtain
llm_translation: And if you will say, since he has already gone out, this one has gone out from their blood onto the curtain.

hebrew_text: והוציאו למזבח והכניסן מהו
human_translation: and brought out to the altar but brought in what is
llm_translation: And they shall bring them to the altar, and they shall bring them in. What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: הכא ודאי חד מקום הוא או [דילמא] יציאה קרינא ביה תיקו:
human_translation: here is certainly one place, Or perhaps, we call Going out, shall stand
llm_translation: Here certainly one place it is or perhaps exit we call in it, let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: נכנס לכפר: תניא רבי אליעזר אומר נאמר כאן לכפר בקודש ונאמר להלן (ויקרא טז, יז) וכל אדם לא יהיה באהל מועד בבואו לכפר בקדש
human_translation: entered to atone is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated here: to atone in the Sanctuary, and it is stated there, “And there shall be no man in the Tent of Meeting when he goes in to atone in the Sanctuary,
llm_translation: Entered the village: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, it is stated here "to the village in holiness," and it is stated there (Leviticus 16:17) "and no man shall be in the Tent of Meeting when he enters to make atonement in the sanctuary."

hebrew_text: מה להלן בשלא כיפר אף כאן בשלא כיפר
human_translation: Just as there, to when has not atoned, so too here, to when has not atoned.
llm_translation: What is said there in a case where there is no atonement, so too here in a case where there is no atonement.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר נאמר כאן לכפר ונאמר להלן (ויקרא טז, כז) ואת פר החטאת ואת שעיר החטאת אשר הובא את דמם לכפר מה להלן בשכיפר אף כאן בשכיפר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: It is stated here: “To atone” and it is stated there, “And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to atone Just as there, to when atoned, so too here, to where atoned,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: It is stated here for atonement, and it is stated there (Leviticus 16:27) for atonement, "And the bull for the sin offering and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought to make atonement." Just as there, with atonement, so too here, with atonement.

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי מ"ס דנין חוץ מחוץ ואין דנין חוץ מבפנים
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds one derives outside, from outside, but one does not derive outside from inside
llm_translation: With what do they argue? With regard to the Mishnah of "judging outside, but not judging inside."

hebrew_text: ומ"ס דנין בהמה מבהמה ואין דנין בהמה מאדם:
human_translation: And Sage, holds one derives an animal, from an animal, but one does not derive an animal from a person.
llm_translation: And the Mishnah states: We judge an animal against another animal, but we do not judge an animal against a human.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר כו': הא מזיד פסול בשכיפר או בשלא כיפר
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: But intentional, disqualified. in where atoned, or in where did not atone,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "The intentional act is invalid whether with atonement or without atonement."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ירמיה ממשמע שנאמר ואת פר החטאת ואת שעיר החטאת אשר הובא את דמם (אל אהל מועד) לכפר בקודש מה ת"ל (ויקרא טז, כח) והשורף
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said From that it is stated “And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to atone in the Sanctuary, Why the verse state: “And he who burns”?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said: From the implication, as it is stated, "And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering, whose blood was brought (into the Tent of Meeting) to atone in the sanctuary," what is the teaching (Vayikra/Leviticus 16:28) "and the one who burns"?

hebrew_text: מה תלמוד לומר והשורף לגופיה איצטריך אלא מה ת"ל חטאת חטאת
human_translation: Why the verse state: “And he who burns”? was necessary for itself, Rather, Why the verse state “Sin offering,” “sin offering,”
llm_translation: What does the Talmud teach us when it says, "And the one who burns it shall need it for himself"? Rather, what does it come to teach us? "A sin offering, a sin offering."

hebrew_text: לפי שלא למדנו אלא לפר ושעיר של יום הכפורים שנשרפין אבית הדשן מטמאין בגדים שאר נשרפין מנין ת"ל חטאת חטאת דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: that we have learned only with regard to bull and goat of Yom Kippur that are burned in the place of the ashes they render ritually impure garments From where other burned? The verse states: “Sin offering,” “sin offering,” the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: According to that we only learned regarding the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur that are burned in the place of the ashes, they render garments impure. How do we know that other things that are burned render impure? The Torah teaches "sin offering, sin offering" - this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי מאיר אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר ואת פר החטאת ואת שעיר החטאת שאין תלמוד לומר לכפר מה תלמוד לומר לכפר לימד על כל המתכפרים שהשורפן מטמא בגדים
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: This is not necessary. Now states: “And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering As no the verse to state to atone why the verse state: “To atone”? teaches with regard to all that atone that one who burns them renders garments impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: It is not necessary. For behold, it says, "And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering," to teach that there is no need to say "for atonement." What is the need to say "for atonement"? It teaches about all those who achieve atonement, that the one who burns them renders garments impure.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה לכפר לא משמע ליה מאי טעמא לאו משום דמיבעיא ליה לגזירה שוה:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda does not learn “to atone.” What is the reason not because he requires for a verbal analogy,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda to the village does not listen to him. What is the reason? Not because it is necessary for the gezeirah shavah.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל הזבחים שנתערבו
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding all the sacrifices that have become mixed.

hebrew_text: מתני' המזבח מקדש [את] הראוי לו
human_translation: The altar sanctifies that are suited to it.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The altar sanctifies the fitting sacrifice.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר כל הראוי לאישים אם עלה לא ירד שנאמר (ויקרא ו, ב) היא העולה על מוקדה מה עולה שהיא ראויה לאישים אם עלתה לא תרד אף כל שהוא ראוי לאישים אם עלה לא ירד
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Any that is suited to the fire if it ascended it shall not descend. as it is stated: “It is the burnt offering on the pyre Just as a burnt offering, which is suited to the fire if it ascended it shall not descend, so too, any that is suited to the fire if it ascended it shall not descend.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anyone fitting for men, if she ascended, she shall not descend, as it is stated (Leviticus 6:2), "It is the burnt offering that ascends upon the altar." Just as that which ascends is fitting for men, if it ascended, it shall not descend. So too, anyone who is fitting for men, if she ascended, she shall not descend.

hebrew_text: רבן גמליאל אומר כל הראוי למזבח אם עלה לא ירד שנאמר היא העולה על מוקדה על המזבח מה עולה שהיא ראויה למזבח אם עלתה לא תרד אף כל דבר שהוא ראוי למזבח אם עלתה לא תרד
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: any that is suited to the altar, if it ascended, it shall not descend, as it is stated: “It is the burnt offering on the pyre upon the altar,” Just as a burnt offering, which is fit for the altar, if it ascended it shall not descend, so too, any that is fit for the altar, if it ascended it shall not descend.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Anyone fitting for the altar, if it ascended, it shall not descend, as it is stated: "It is the burnt offering that ascends on the altar." Just as a burnt offering, which is fitting for the altar, if it ascended, shall not descend, so too, anything fitting for the altar, if it ascended, shall not descend.

hebrew_text: אין בין דברי רבן גמליאל לדברי רבי יהושע אלא הדם והנסכים שרבן גמליאל אומר לא ירדו ורבי יהושע אומר ירדו
human_translation: The difference between the statement of Rabban Gamliel and the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua is only blood and libations, as Rabban Gamliel says: They shall not descend, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: They shall descend,
llm_translation: There is no difference between the words of Rabban Gamliel and the words of Rabbi Yehoshua except for the blood and the libations. Rabban Gamliel says they should not descend, and Rabbi Yehoshua says they should descend.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר הזבח כשר ונסכים פסולין הנסכים כשירים והזבח פסול אפי' זה וזה פסולין הזבח לא ירד והנסכים ירדו:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: the offering was fit and libations unfit, the libations fit and the offering unfit, even this and that were unfit, the offering shall not descend, but the libations shall descend.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The sacrifice is valid, and the libations are invalid. The libations are valid, and the sacrifice is invalid. Even if both are invalid, the sacrifice does not descend, but the libations descend.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ראוי לו אין שאין ראוי לו לא למעוטי מאי אמר רב פפא למעוטי קמצין שלא קידשו בכלי
human_translation: suited to yes, that are not suited to no, to exclude what? Rav Pappa said: to exclude handfuls that were not sanctified in vessel
llm_translation: Gemara: It is fitting for him, and if not fitting for him, not to exclude what? What did Rav Papa say? To exclude small pieces that were not sanctified in a vessel.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבינא מאי שנא מדעולא דאמר עולא אימורי קדשים קלין שהעלן לפני זריקת דמן לא ירדו נעשו לחמו של מזבח
human_translation: Ravina objects to what is different from that of Ulla? As Ulla says: Sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that offered up before the sprinkling of blood, shall not descend, they have become the bread of altar,
llm_translation: Ravina objects: What is the difference from the teaching of Ula who said: "Light offerings that were brought before the sprinkling of their blood should not descend; they become like the bread of the altar."

hebrew_text: הנך לא מיחסרו מעשה בגופייהו הני מיחסרו מעשה בגופייהו:
human_translation: These do not lack an action with regard to themselves these lack an action with regard to themselves,
llm_translation: These are not lacking in their actions in their bodies, these are lacking in their actions in their bodies.

hebrew_text: ר' יהושע אומר כל הראוי לאישים כו': ורבן גמליאל נמי הכתיב עולה על מוקדה ההוא לאהדורי פוקעין הוא דאתא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Any that is suited to the fire And Rabban Gamliel also, isn’t it written “Burnt offering on the pyre”? That comes to restore dislodged
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: "Anyone fitting for men, etc." And Rabban Gamliel is also written: "He ascends upon that hearth, the Adorites are breaking forth, for he has come."

hebrew_text: ואידך לאהדורי פוקעין מנא ליה נפקא ליה מאשר תאכל האש
human_translation: And the other from where does he to restore dislodged He derives it from “That the fire has consumed
llm_translation: And the other one, for the Adorites, from where do they derive it? They derive it from "when the fire consumes" (Leviticus 6:2).

hebrew_text: ואידך ההוא מיבעי ליה לעכולי עולה אתה מחזיר ואי אתה מחזיר עכולי קטורת דתני רבי חנינא בר מניומי בר' אליעזר בן יעקב (ויקרא ו, ג) אשר תאכל האש את העולה על המזבח עכולי עולה אתה מחזיר ואי אתה מחזיר עכולי קטורת
human_translation: And the other requires that to you return consumed of a burnt offering but you do not return consumed of an incense As Rabbi Ḥanina bar Minyumi, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, teaches “that the fire has consumed of the burnt offering on the altar” you return consumed of a burnt offering but you do not return consumed of an incense
llm_translation: And the other one, he needs to eat the burnt offering, you return it, and if you do not return it, the leftovers of the incense. As Rabbi Chanina bar Minyumi, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, taught: "The fire shall consume the burnt offering on the altar" (Leviticus 6:3) - you return the burnt offering, and if you do not return it, the leftovers of the incense.

hebrew_text: ואידך לאו ממילא ש"מ דעכולי עולה מהדרינן:
human_translation: And the other not be learned by itself that we restore consumed of a burnt offering
llm_translation: And the other opinion is not automatically learned, for if the consumption of the burnt offering is we return.

hebrew_text: רבן גמליאל אומר כל הראוי כו': ורבי יהושע נמי הכתיב מזבח ההוא מיבעיא ליה מאי (טעמא) קאמר רחמנא כל הראוי למוקדה מקדש מזבח
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: any that is suited And Rabbi Yehoshua as well, isn’t it written: altar,” That is required What is the reason the Merciful One states any that is suited for the pyre altar sanctifies
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: "All who are fitting..." And Rabbi Yehoshua also, as it is written, "that altar." What is the reason? The Merciful One says: "All who are fitting for the altar are sanctified."

hebrew_text: ואידך מזבח אחרינא כתיב ואידך חד להיכא דהיתה לה שעת הכושר וחד להיכא דלא היתה לה שעת הכושר
human_translation: And the other “altar” is written another And the other One for where had a time of fitness and one for where did not have a time of fitness,
llm_translation: And the other opinion is written: "And the other altar" - one for where it was its time of validity, and one for where it was not its time of validity.

hebrew_text: ואידך כיון דפסולין נינהו ורבינהו רחמנא לא שנא היתה לו שעת הכושר לא שנא לא היתה לו שעת הכושר:
human_translation: And the other Once there are disqualified that the Merciful One included is no different had a time of fitness is no different did not have a time of fitness.
llm_translation: And the other opinion is since they are disqualified, and the Merciful One has not distinguished between them, whether he had a moment of fitness or did not have a moment of fitness.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר הזבח כשר כו': תניא רבי שמעון אומר עולה מה עולה הבאה בגלל עצמה אף כל הבאין בגלל עצמן יצאו נסכים הבאין בגלל זבח
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: the offering was fit It is taught Rabbi Shimon says: burnt offering: Just as a burnt offering, that comes for its own sake, so too, all items that come for their own sake Excluded libations, which come for the sake of the offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "The sacrifice is valid, etc." It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says: "Just as an Olah offering that comes for its own sake, so too, all those that come for their own sake, the libations that come for the sake of a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר מתוך שנאמר (שמות כט, לז) כל הנוגע במזבח יקדש שומע אני בין ראוי ובין שאינו ראוי ת"ל (שמות כט, לח) כבשים מה כבשים ראויין אף כל ראוי ר"ע אומר (שמות כט, יח) עולה מה עולה ראויה אף כל ראויה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: From that is stated: “Whatever touches the altar shall be sacred” I derive whether is fit or whether is unfit. the verse states: lambs” Just as lambs fit so too, all fit Rabbi Akiva says “Burnt offering,” Just as a burnt offering fit so too, all fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi the Galilean says: Since it is stated (Exodus 29:37), "Whatever touches the altar shall become holy," I might think this applies whether it is fitting or not fitting. Therefore, the verse teaches (Exodus 29:38), "As the sheep," just as the sheep must be fitting, so too, everything that is fitting. Rabbi Akiva says: (Exodus 29:18) "An elevation offering," just as an elevation offering must be fitting, so too, everything that is fitting.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רב אדא בר אהבה עולת העוף פסולה איכא בינייהו מר מייתי לה מעולה ומר מייתי לה מכבשים
human_translation: What is between Rav Adda bar Ahava said: a disqualified bird burnt offering is between them. Sage, cites from “burnt offering,” And Sage, cites from “lambs,”
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: The burnt offering of birds is invalid. The difference between them is that one brings it from fowl and the other brings it from sheep.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דמייתי לה מכבשים הכתיב עולה אי כתיב כבשים ולא כתיב עולה ה"א אפילו מחיים כתב רחמנא עולה
human_translation: And according to the one who cites from “lambs,” isn’t it written: “Burnt offering”? if “lambs” written and “burnt offering” not written, I would say even while alive the Merciful One writes: “Burnt offering,”
llm_translation: And according to whom does one bring from sheep? It is written "a burnt offering." If it had written sheep and not written burnt offering, one might have thought that even from living animals the Merciful One wrote "a burnt offering."

hebrew_text: ולמאן דמייתי ליה מעולה הא כתיב כבשים אי כתיב עולה ולא כתיב כבשים הוה אמינא אפילו מנחה כתב רחמנא כבשים
human_translation: And according to the one who derives from “burnt offering,” isn’t it written: “Lambs”? if “burnt offering” written and “lambs” not written, I would say even a meal offering. the Merciful One writes: “Lambs,”
llm_translation: And according to whom does one bring a burnt offering? This is what is written: "rams." If it had written "burnt offering" and not written "rams," I would have said that even for a meal offering, the Merciful One wrote "rams."

hebrew_text: מאי איכא בין הני תנאי להני תנאי דמתניתין אמר רב פפא קמצים שקדשו בכלי איכא בינייהו לתנאי דידן לא ירדו לתנאי דמתניתא ירדו
human_translation: What is there between these tanna’im , these tanna’im of the mishna? Rav Pappa said: between them is handfuls that were sanctified in vessel to our tanna’im , shall not descend, to the tanna’im of the baraita , shall descend,
llm_translation: What is the difference between these Tannaim and those Tannaim of the Mishnah? Rav Pappa said: Regarding kernels that were sanctified in a vessel, there is a difference between our Tannaim - they did not descend in holiness, and the Tannaim of the Mishnah did descend in holiness.

hebrew_text: (ר"ל אמר) מנחה הבאה בפני עצמה לדברי כולן לא תרד לדברי רבי יוסי הגלילי ור"ע
human_translation: Reish Lakish says a meal offering that comes by itself according to the statements of all it shall not descend According to the statements of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: (Reish Lakish said) A meal-offering that comes by itself, according to all of them, it does not descend; according to the words of Rabbi Yossi HaGelili and Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: תרד מנחה הבאה עם הזבח לדברי ר"ג ורבי יהושע לא תרד לדברי כולן תרד
human_translation: shall descend, a meal offering that comes with offering, according to the statements of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua, it shall not descend, According to the statements of everyone it shall descend,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tard mincha haba'a im hazevach ledivrei Rabbi Yehudah v'Rabbi Yehoshua lo tard ledivrei kulam tard." English translation: "The meal-offering that comes with the sacrifice, according to the words of Rabbi Judah and Rabbi Joshua it does not descend; according to the words of all it descends."

hebrew_text: נסכים הבאין בפני עצמן לדברי כולן ירדו לדברי ר"ג ור"ש לא ירדו נסכין הבאין עם הזבח לדברי כולן ירדו לדברי ר"ג לחודיה לא ירדו
human_translation: libations that come by themselves, according to the statements of everyone, they shall descend, according to the statements of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Shimon, they shall not descend. libations that come with an animal offering, according to the statements of everyone, they shall descend, the statement of Rabban Gamliel alone, they shall not descend.
llm_translation: Libations that come on their own, according to all of them, they descend; according to Rabbi Yehudah the Prince and Rabbi Shimon, they do not descend. Libations that come with the sacrifice, according to all of them, they descend; according to Rabbi Yehudah the Prince alone, they do not descend.

hebrew_text: פשיטא מנחה הבאה בפני עצמה איצטריכא ליה וכדרבא דאמר רבא מתנדב אדם מנחת נסכים בכל יום
human_translation: obvious? was necessary for a meal offering that comes by itself, and in accordance with of Rava. As Rava says: A person volunteer a meal offering on any day,
llm_translation: It is obvious. A meal offering that comes by itself is necessary for it. And like Rava said, Rava said: A person voluntarily brings a meal offering of libations every day.

hebrew_text: ונשמעינן כדרבא נסכים הבאים עם הזבח איצטריכא ליה דקא מקרב להו למחר וליומא חרא
human_translation: let teach us in accordance with of Rava. was necessary for libations that come with offering, that he may sacrifice the next day and on a later [ ḥara ] day
llm_translation: And we hear like Rava, libations that come with the sacrifice are necessary for him, as he brings them the next day and on the following day.

hebrew_text: ס"ד אמינא הואיל ואמר מר (במדבר כט, יח) מנחתם ונסכיהם בלילה מנחתם ונסכיהם למחר כנסכים הבאין בפני עצמן דמו ומודי ר"ש דלא ירדו קמ"ל:
human_translation: enter your mind to say since the Master says their meal offering and their liba-tions” at night, their meal offering and their libations” the next day considered as libations which come by themselves, and Rabbi Shimon concede that they shall not descend. teaches us
llm_translation: "Know, I say, since the Master said (Numbers 29:18), 'their meal offering and their drink offerings for the night,' their meal offering and their drink offerings for the next day are like independent libations. The blood is like the libations that come by themselves. And Rabbi Shimon agrees, that they do not descend. This teaches us."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אלו אם עלו לא ירדו הלן והיוצא והטמא ושנשחט חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו ושקבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמו
human_translation: These if they ascended they shall not descend: which were left overnight or that emerge or that ritually impure, or that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, or that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: Mishnah: These animals, if they ascended the altar, they do not descend: The "Helen," the "Yotzea," the "Tamei," and one that was slaughtered outside its designated time or place, and if they received the blood invalidly and they sprinkled its blood.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר שנשחט בלילה ונשפך דמה ויצא דמה חוץ לקלעים אם עלתה תרד ר"ש אומר לא תרד (שהיה פסולו בקדש) שר"ש אומר כל שפסולו בקדש הקדש מקבלו לא היה פסולו בקדש אין הקדש מקבלו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: that was slaughtered at night, or whose blood was spilled or blood emerged outside the curtains, if it ascended it shall descend. Rabbi Shimon says: it shall not descend, because its disqualification in sanctity. As Rabbi Shimon says: any whose disqualification in sanctity, the sacred renders acceptable, whose disqualification not in sanctity the sacred does not render acceptable.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If it was slaughtered at night and its blood was spilled, and its blood exited outside the Temple courtyard, if its fat ascended, Rabbi Shimon says it did not ascend (because its disqualification in the holy place). Rabbi Shimon says: Anything whose disqualification in the holy place the holy place accepts, if its disqualification in the holy place did not exist, the holy place does not accept it.

hebrew_text: ואלו שלא היו פסולן בקדש הרובע והנרבע והמוקצה והנעבד והאתנן והמחיר והכלאים והטרפה והיוצא דופן ובעלי מומין ר"ע מכשיר בבעלי מומין רבי חנינא סגן הכהנים אומר דוחה היה אבא את בעלי מומין מע"ג המזבח
human_translation: And these are whose disqualification not in sanctity: An animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality, and set aside and worshipped and payment or the price and diverse kinds, and an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], and born by caesarean section, and blemished Rabbi Akiva deems blemished fit Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, says: My father would reject blemished from upon the altar.
llm_translation: These are the ones that were not disqualified in the sanctification: the majority, the minority, the designated, the consecrated, the gift, the price, the hybrids, the torn, the offspring of a different species, and animals with blemishes. Rabbi Akiva deems animals with blemishes as valid, while Rabbi Chanina the deputy high priest says that Abba would push aside animals with blemishes from the altar.

hebrew_text: כשם שאם עלו לא ירדו כך אם ירדו לא יעלו וכולן שעלו חיים לראש המזבח ירדו עולה שעלתה חיה לראש המזבח תרד שחטה בראש המזבח יפשיט וינתחה במקומה:
human_translation: just as if they ascended they shall not descend, so too, if they descended they shall not ascend. And all of them that they ascended to the top of the altar alive they descend, A burnt offering that ascended to the top of the altar alive shall descend, one slaughtered at the top of the altar, he should flay and cut it into pieces in its place,
llm_translation: As they ascended, they shall not descend; so too, if they descended, they shall not ascend. And all those that ascended alive to the top of the altar shall descend as an elevation offering that ascended alive to the top of the altar shall descend. It shall be slaughtered at the top of the altar, its skin shall be flayed, and it shall be cut into pieces in its place.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא ר' יהודה אומר (ויקרא ו, ב) זאת היא העולה הרי אלו ג' מיעוטין פרט לשנשחטה בלילה ושנשפך דמה ושיצא דמה חוץ לקלעים שאם עלתה תרד
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: “This It is the burnt offering These are three exclusion excluded that was slaughtered at night, and whose blood was spilled, and whose blood emerged outside the curtains, that if ascended it shall descend.
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says (Leviticus 6:2), "This is the burnt offering." These are three exclusions: excluding one that was slaughtered at night, and its blood was spilled, and its blood exited outside the Temple courtyard, for if it ascended, it shall descend.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר עולה אין לי אלא עולה כשרה מנין לרבות שנשחטה בלילה ושנשפך דמה ושיצא דמה חוץ לקלעים והלן והיוצא והטמא ושנשחט חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו ושקבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “burnt offering” I have only a fit burnt offering From where includes that was slaughtered at night; or whose blood was spilled; or whose blood emerged outside the curtains, or that was left overnight; or that emerged or that ritually impure; or that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area; or that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "An Olah offering, I only have a valid Olah offering. How do I know to include one that was slaughtered at night, one whose blood was spilled, one whose blood exited outside the Temple courtyard, one that was left overnight, one that was taken out, one that is impure, one that was slaughtered outside its designated time, one that was slaughtered outside its designated place, one that was received by invalid individuals, and one whose blood was thrown."

hebrew_text: הניתנין למטה שנתנן למעלה ולמעלה שנתנן למטה והניתנין בחוץ שנתנן בפנים בפנים שנתנן בחוץ
human_translation: Those placed below was placed above and above that placed below and those whose placed outside, that placed inside, inside that placed outside?
llm_translation: Those that are placed below that were placed above, and those that were placed above that were placed below, and those that were placed outside that were placed inside, and those that were placed inside that were placed outside.

hebrew_text: ופסח וחטאת ששחטן שלא לשמן מנין ת"ל תורת העולה ריבה תורה אחת לכל העולין שאם עלו לא ירדו
human_translation: And a Paschal offering or sin offering that were slaughtered not for their sake, from where The verse states: “The law of the burnt offering,” included one law all that ascend that if they ascended they shall not descend.
llm_translation: "And the Passover offering and the sin offering, if one slaughters them not for their sake, from where do we derive it? The Torah of the burnt offering increases, one Torah for all the offerings, that if they ascended, they shall not descend."

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה הרובע והנרבע והמוקצה והנעבד ואתנן ומחיר וכלאים וטרפה ויוצא דופן ת"ל זאת
human_translation: might that I include an animal that copulated with a person, and an animal that was the object of bestiality, and set aside and worshipped and payment or price and diverse kinds, and a tereifa , and born by caesarean section. the verse states: “This,”
llm_translation: It is possible that I differentiate between the majority, the quarter, the half, the designated, the consecrated, the gift, the price, the mixtures, the torn, and the offspring of a non-kosher animal. The Torah teaches us this.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות את אלו ולהוציא את אלו אחר שריבה
human_translation: And what did you see to include those and exclude these? After that included
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those after it argued.

hebrew_text: הכתוב ומיעט מרבה אני את אלו שהיה פסולן בקדש ומוציא אני את אלו שלא היה פסולן בקודש
human_translation: and the verse excluded, I will include those whose disqualification was in sanctity, and I will exclude these whose disqualification was not in sanctity,
llm_translation: The verse: "And I will diminish them more than the former, saith the Lord of hosts: and in this place will I give peace, saith the Lord of hosts." (Haggai 2:9)

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה מייתי לה מהכא מפני מה אמרו לן בדם כשר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, he derives it from here, For what did say to us in blood fit,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda brings a proof from here: "Why did they tell us that blood is valid?"

hebrew_text: שהרי לן כשר באימורין לן באימורין כשר שהרי לן כשר בבשר
human_translation: as in sacrificial portions, left overnight fit. in sacrificial portions left overnight, fit? as in meat, left overnight fit,
llm_translation: For we have valid offerings in the case of offerings, and we have valid offerings in the case of offerings, for we have valid offerings in the case of flesh.

hebrew_text: יוצא שהיוצא כשר בבמה
human_translation: emerges since leaves fit in altar,
llm_translation: One who goes out, that which goes out valid on the altar.

hebrew_text: טמא הואיל והותר לעבודת ציבור
human_translation: ritually impure since permitted to the communal rites,
llm_translation: Impure, since it is permitted for communal service.

hebrew_text: חוץ לזמנו הואיל ומרצה לפיגולו
human_translation: beyond its time since effects acceptance its piggul .
llm_translation: Outside of its designated time, since it is pleasing for its invalidation.

hebrew_text: חוץ למקומו הואיל ואיתקש לחוץ לזמנו
human_translation: outside its area since juxtaposed to beyond its time.
llm_translation: Outside of its place, since it is compared to outside of its time.

hebrew_text: שקבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמו בהנך פסולי דחזו לעבודת ציבור
human_translation: that unfit collected and sprinkled its blood from these disqualified who are fit to the communal rites,
llm_translation: They received disqualified offerings and they threw its blood in the vessels used for offerings, the disqualified offerings are seen as valid for communal service.

hebrew_text: וכי דנין דבר שלא בהכשרו מדבר שבהכשרו
human_translation: But can one deduce a matter that is not fit, from a matter that is fit,
llm_translation: And when do we judge a matter that is not in its proper state? From a matter that is in its proper state.

hebrew_text: תנא אזאת תורת העולה ריבה סמיך ליה
human_translation: tanna relied on This is the law of the burnt offering: amplified
llm_translation: It was taught: "This is the law of the burnt offering; it is that which goes up on its firewood upon the altar all night until the morning."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן השוחט בהמה בלילה בפנים (המעלה בחוץ פטור בחוץ) והעלה בחוץ חייב
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who slaughters animal at night inside and offers up outside liable
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: One who slaughters an animal at night inside (if he brings it outside, he is exempt; if he brings it outside, he is liable).

hebrew_text: לא תהא פחותה משוחט בחוץ ומעלה בחוץ
human_translation: should not be less than slaughters outside and offers up outside.
llm_translation: Do not be less than slaughtering outside and bringing up outside.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב חייא בר אבין השוחט עוף בפנים ומעלה בחוץ פטור שחט בחוץ ומעלה בחוץ חייב נימא לא תהא פחותה משוחט ומעלה בחוץ
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin raises an objection One who slaughters a bird inside and offers up outside exempt, slaughtered outside and offered up outside liable let us say should not be less than slaughters and offers up outside
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Chiya bar Avin posed the following dilemma: One who slaughters a bird inside and carries it outside is exempt from liability, but if he slaughters it outside and carries it outside, he is liable. Shall we say that the act of carrying should not be less stringent than the act of slaughtering and carrying it outside?

hebrew_text: תיובתא איבעית אימא שחיטת העוף בפנים מיקטל קטליה
human_translation: a conclusive refutation, If you wish, say the slaughter of a bird inside he killed it.
llm_translation: Rebuttal: If you ask, say, "The slaughtering of a bird inside is considered as if it was slaughtered outside."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא אימורי קדשים קלים שהעלן לפני זריקת דמן לא ירדו נעשו לחמו של מזבח
human_translation: Ulla says: Sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that offered up before the sprinkling of their blood, shall not descend, they have become the bread of altar.
llm_translation: Ula said: "Imurei Kodsheim kalim shehalan lifnei zrikat daman lo yardu na'asu lechem shel mizbeach."

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אף אנן נמי תנינא שנשפך דמה ושיצא דמה חוץ לקלעים ומה התם דאם בא לזרוק אין לו לזרוק אמרת אם עלו לא ירדו הכא דאם בא לזרוק זורק לא כל שכן
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said We learn as well: whose blood was spilled, or whose blood emerged outside the curtains, And if there, where if he comes to sprinkle he cannot sprinkle you said if they ascended they shall not descend, here, that if he comes to sprinkle he sprinkles not all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: We also learned: If his blood spilled and his blood exited outside the curtains. And just as there, if he came to sprinkle and he does not have to sprinkle, you said, "If they went up, they shall not come down," here, if he came to sprinkle, he sprinkles, all the more so.

hebrew_text: תרגמא אקדשי קדשים
human_translation: Interpret to offerings of the most sacred order,
llm_translation: Targema Akdeshi Kodashim

hebrew_text: הרי פסח דקדשים קלים הוא תרגמא בשלא לשמן
human_translation: a Paschal offering, which is an offering of lesser sanctity, Interpret to not for its sake,
llm_translation: Behold, Pesach of light sanctities it is, translated as "for its own sake."

hebrew_text: תנן וכולן שעלו חיין לגבי מזבח ירדו הא שחוטין לא ירדו מאי לאו ל"ש קדשי קדשים לא שנא קדשים קלים
human_translation: We learned And all of them that they ascended to the altar alive, they descend. But slaughtered shall not descend, What, is it not is not different offerings of the most sacred order, and it is not different offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "And all of them that ascended alive to the altar, descended dead. What is the reason that those slaughtered did not descend? Is it not because 'holy of holies' is not different from 'holy things'?"

hebrew_text: לא הא שחוטין מהן ירדו מהן לא ירדו והא כולן קתני כולם אחיין
human_translation: No, But slaughtered of them shall descend of them shall not descend. But teaches all of them All of them to alive,
llm_translation: Not slaughtered from them, descended from them not descended, and this all it teaches all brothers.

hebrew_text: פשיטא לעולם אחיין ובדוקין שבעין ואליבא דר"ע דאמר אם עלו לא ירדו
human_translation: obvious Actually, with regard to living but to the cornea of the eye, and in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, who says if they ascended they shall not descend.
llm_translation: It is obvious. Always, brothers and diligent ones of seven, and according to Rabbi Akiva who said, "If they ascended, they shall not descend."

hebrew_text: ואלא דקתני כיצד עושה מוריד את הקרבים למטה ומדיחן למה לי

hebrew_text: אנן הכי קאמרינן מדיחן למה לי דאי מיתרמי כהן אחרינא ולא ידע נסקינהו

llm_translation: We say thus: Why do we need them? For if another priest is appointed in place of him and we do not know, we will be in a dilemma.

llm_translation: And we, we act for them, for the priests, a matter that came through negligence, nevertheless, it is preferable that the holy items not be treated as carrion.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חייא בר אבא בעי רבי יוחנן אימורי קדשים קלים שהעלן לפני זריקת דמן ירדו או לא ירדו
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that offered up before the sprinkling of their blood, shall they descend or shall they not descend?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: Rabbi Yochanan inquired: "Light sanctified items that were brought before their blood was sprinkled - did they descend or did they not descend?"

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי אמי ותיבעי לך מעילה א"ל מעילה לא קמיבעיא לי דזריקה הוא דקבעה להו במעילה כי קמיבעיא ליה ירידה ופשיט לא ירדו ואין בהן מעילה

llm_translation: He said to him, "Rabbi Ami, and you should inquire about 'me'ilah'?" When it comes to descent, it is obvious that they did not descend, and there is no me'ilah in them."

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק מתני הכי א"ר חייא בר אבא בעי רבי יוחנן אימורי קדשים קלים שהעלן לפני זריקת דמן יש בהן מעילה או לא א"ל רבי אמי ותיבעי לך ירידה א"ל ירידה לא קא מיבעי' לי דנעשו לחמו של מזבח כי קמיבעי' לי מעילה ופשיט הכי לא ירדו ואין בהן מעילה:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teaches this Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that offered up before the sprinkling of their blood, are they subject to misuse or not? Rabbi Ami said to him: And you should raise the dilemma descent said to him: descent I do not raise the dilemma, because they become the bread of altar When I raise the dilemma misuse And resolved this They shall not descend, and they are not subject to misuse
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak taught thus: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba asked Rabbi Yochanan, "Regarding light holy items that were brought before their blood was sprinkled, do they have atonement or not?" Rabbi Ami said to him, "And should you ask about descent?" He said to him, "I am not asking about descent, for if they were made into the bread of the altar, when I ask about atonement, it is obvious that they did not descend, and there is no atonement in them."

hebrew_text: ואלו לא היה פסולן [וכו']:

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק אף אנן נמי תנינא הנרבע והמוקצה והנעבד ואתנן ומחיר וטומטום ואנדרוגינוס כולן מטמאין בגדים אבית הבליעה ש"מ:

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא סגן הכהנים כו': מאי קמ"ל איבעית אימא מעשה קמ"ל ואיבעית אימא מאי דוחה כלאחר יד:

Ula said: They only taught that when the light does not shine on them, but if the light shines on them, they shall ascend.

hebrew_text: מאן דמתני אסיפא כ"ש ארישא ומאן דמתני ארישא אבל אסיפא לאו בני הקטרה נינהו:
human_translation: the one who teaches to the latter clause, all the more so to the first clause, And the one who teaches to the first clause, But to the latter clause are not subject to burning
llm_translation: The one who teaches the conclusion is all the more so the beginning, and the one who teaches the beginning, but not the conclusion, they are not sons of the incense.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו אם עלו ירדו בשר קדשי קדשים ובשר קדשים קלים ומותר העומר ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים ושירי מנחות והקטורת
human_translation: And these if they ascended they descend, The meat of offerings of the most sacred order, and the meat of offerings of lesser sanctity, and the surplus of the omer and the two loaves and the shewbread; and the remainder of the meal offerings and the incense
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are the offerings if they ascended or descended: the flesh of most holy offerings, the flesh of lesser holy offerings, and the remainder of the Omer, the two loaves, the showbread, the remnants of meal offerings, and the incense.

hebrew_text: הצמר שבראשי כבשים ושער שבזקן תישים והעצמות והגידים והקרנים והטלפים בזמן שהם מחוברים יעלו שנאמר (ויקרא א, ט) והקטיר הכהן את הכל פירשו לא יעלו שנאמר (דברים יב, כז) ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם:
human_translation: the wool that is on the heads of the sheep and the hair that is in the beard of goats and the bones, and the tendons, and the horns, and the hooves: When they are attached they shall ascend as it is stated: “And the priest shall make the whole smoke they separated they shall not ascend, as it is stated: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood”
llm_translation: The wool of the heads of sheep and the hair of the beards of goats, and the bones, and the sinews, and the horns, and the hooves, when they are attached, shall ascend, as it is stated (Leviticus 1:9), "And the priest shall burn all of it." When they are separated, they shall not ascend, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 12:27), "And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא א, ט) והקטיר הכהן את הכל המזבחה לרבות העצמות והגידים והקרנים והטלפים יכול אפילו פרשו תלמוד לומר ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם
human_translation: The Sages taught “And the priest shall make the whole smoke on the altar” to include the bones and the tendons and the horns and the hooves might even they separated the verse states: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "And the priest shall burn all of it upon the altar" (Leviticus 1:9) - to include the bones, the sinews, the horns, and the hooves. One might have thought that this even includes the hide; therefore, the Torah states: "And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood."

hebrew_text: אי בשר ודם
human_translation: If “the flesh and the blood,”
llm_translation: If in flesh and blood

human_translation: might remove tendons and bones and sacrifice the flesh upon the altar. the verse states: “And the priest shall make the whole smoke How these attached they shall ascend. they separated even they at the top of the altar, they shall descend.
llm_translation: He might extract sinews and bones and bring up flesh to the altar. The Torah teaches: "And the priest shall burn all of it." How so? If they are attached, they should be brought up; if they are separated, even if they are at the top of the altar, they should be brought down.

hebrew_text: מאן תנא דשמעת ליה דאמר פירשו ירדו רבי היא דתניא (ויקרא א, ט) והקטיר הכהן את הכל המזבחה לרבות העצמות והגידין והקרנים והטלפים אפילו פירשו
human_translation: Who is the tanna that you heard that says they separated they shall descend? It is Rabbi as it is taught “And the priest shall make the whole smoke on the altar” to include the bones, and the tendons, and the horns, and the hooves, even they separated
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that you heard, who said, "They shall descend"? Rabbi is the one who taught it, as it was taught in a Baraita: "And the priest shall burn all of it upon the altar" (Leviticus 1:9) - to include the bones, sinews, horns, and hooves, even if they were separated.

hebrew_text: ואלא מה אני מקיים (דברים יב, כז) ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם לומר לך עיכולי עולה אתה מחזיר ואי אתה מחזיר עיכולי גידין ועצמות
human_translation: But how do I realize “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood” to tell you you return consumed a burnt offering but you do not return consumed tendons and bones
llm_translation: And rather, how do I fulfill (Deuteronomy 12:27) "And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood"? To tell you that if you return the digestions of the burnt offering, you are fulfilling the commandment, but if you do not return them, you are returning the digestions of the sinews and bones.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר כתוב אחד אומר והקטיר הכהן את הכל המזבחה ריבה וכתוב אחד אומר ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם מיעט הא כיצד מחוברין יעלו פירשו אפי' הן בראש המזבח ירדו:
human_translation: Rabbi says one verse states: “And the priest shall make the whole smoke on the altar,” included and one verse states: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood,” excluded How these attached they shall ascend. they separated even they on top of the altar, they shall descend.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: It is written, "And the priest shall burn all of it upon the altar" (Leviticus 1:9), which is inclusive. And it is written, "And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood" (Leviticus 22:27), which is exclusive. How are they connected? If they ascend, they may descend even from the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: פירשו לא יעלו [וכו']: אמר רבי זירא לא שנו אלא שפירשו כלפי מטה אבל כלפי מעלה קרובי הוא דאקריבו לעיכול ואפילו פירשו
human_translation: they separated they shall not ascend. Rabbi Zeira said: taught only when they separated downward, But upward, they have become closer to consumption And even they separated,
llm_translation: They explained "they shall not ascend" etc.: Rabbi Zeira said, they only taught that they should be separated facing downward, but facing upward, it is closer for digestion, and even if they were separated.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה הכי קאמר לא שנו אלא שפירשו לאחר זריקה אבל פירשו קודם זריקה אתאי זריקה ושריתינהו אפי' למעבד מינייהו קתא דסכיני

hebrew_text: סבר לה כי הא דאמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי ישמעאל נאמר (ויקרא ז, ז) לו יהיה בעולה ונאמר (ויקרא ז, ז) לו יהיה באשם מה אשם עצמותיו מותרין אף עולה עצמות מותרין

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו בירוצי מדות במתניתא תנא אין מקדשין אלא שלימין ומלאים ומתוכן ובפנים
human_translation: What between between them is heaping measures. was taught in a baraita sanctify only whole, and full and from within them, and inside.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in the measurements. In the Mishnah it was taught: One may sanctify only whole, complete, and full animals, and from among them, and inside.

hebrew_text: א"ר אסי א"ר יוחנן לא שנו אלא שאין דעתו להוסיף אבל דעתו להוסיף ראשון ראשון קודש
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They taught only when intention not to add But his intention to add, each initial sacred,
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught that one should not intend to add, but if one intends to add, he should say "holy, holy" first.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי מלאין אין מלאין אלא שלימין אמר רבי יוסי אימתי בזמן שאין דעתו להוסיף אבל דעתו להוסיף ראשון ראשון קודש:
human_translation: This is also taught full full nothing other than whole Rabbi Yosei said: When at a time that intention not to add. But his intention to add, each initial sacred.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: "Full, not full, only complete." Rabbi Yosei said: "When is it considered 'not full'? When his intention is not to add. But if his intention is to add, it is considered 'full, full, holy."

hebrew_text: אין כלי הלח מקדש [וכו']: אמר רב ואיתימא רב אסי אין מקדשין ליקרב אבל מקדשין ליפסל
human_translation: the vessels liquids do not sanctify Rav says, and some say Rav Asi do not sanctify for sacrifice but they sanctify to be disqualified
llm_translation: The vessels of the Temple do not sanctify etc.. Rav said, and some say Rav Assi said: They do not sanctify to offer, but they do sanctify to disqualify.

hebrew_text: איכא דמתני לה אהא אין מביאין מנחות ונסכים ומנחת בהמה וביכורים מן המדומע ואין צ"ל מערלה וכלאי הכרם ואם הביא לא קדש אמר רב ואיתימא רב אסי לא קדש ליקרב אבל קדש ליפסל
human_translation: There are who teach this with regard to this One may not bring meal offerings, or libations, or meal offerings an animal, or first fruits, from a mixture And needless to say, from orla , or diverse kinds in a vineyard, And if he brought not sanctified. Rav says, and some say Rav Asi not sanctified for sacrifice but sanctified to be disqualified.
llm_translation: There are those who teach it: "One does not bring meal-offerings, libations, animal meal-offerings, and first-fruits from that which is tainted. And it does not mean uncircumcision and forbidden mixtures of the vineyard. And if one brought, it is not sanctified." Rav said, and some say Rav Assi: "It is not sanctified to be offered, but it is sanctified to disqualify."

hebrew_text: ת"ר כלי קדש שניקבו אין מתיכין אותן ואין מתיכין לתוכן אבר נפגמו אין מתקנין אותן סכין שנפגם אין משחיזין את פגימתה נשמטה אין מחזירין אותה אבא שאול אומר סכין מטרפת היתה במקדש ונמנו עליה כהנים וגנזוה
human_translation: the Sages taught: sacred vessels that were perforated, one may not melt them and one may not melt lead into them were damaged, one may not repair them. a knife that was damaged, one may not sharpen its damage. separated one may not restore it. Abba Shaul says: There was knife in the Temple render prohibited, priests voted concerning it, and hide it.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Sacred vessels that were perforated are not pounded, and one does not pound within them. If a limb is damaged, one does not repair it. If a knife is damaged, one does not sharpen its damage. If it fell off, one does not return it. Abba Saul says: There was a knife that was rendered unfit in the Temple, and the priests counted it and stored it away.

hebrew_text: ת"ר בגדי כהונה אין עושין אותם מעשה מחט אלא מעשה אורג שנאמר (שמות כח, לב) מעשה אורג נתגעלו אין מכבסין לא בנתר ולא באהל
human_translation: The Sages taught: Priestly vestments are not fashioned needlework, rather woven work, as it is stated: “Woven work” were soiled one may not launder neither with natron nor with soap,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The priestly garments are not made through the work of a needle, but through the work of weaving, as it is stated (Exodus 28:32), "the work of a weaver." If they became soiled, they are not laundered with niter or with soap.

hebrew_text: הא במים מכבסין אמר אביי ה"ק הוגעו במים מכבסין אותו בנתר ואהל
human_translation: But with water one may launder Abaye said: This is saying: reached with water one may launder them with natron and soap,
llm_translation: This is the Talmudic text: "הא במים מכבסין אמר אביי ה"ק הוגעו במים מכבסין אותו בנתר ואהל" English translation: Here, in water, one may launder. Abaye said: This is what is meant: If one is soiled with water, one may launder it with niter and soap.

hebrew_text: הוגעו לנתר ואהל אף במים אין מכבסים ויש אומרים אין מכבסין אותן כל עיקר שאין עניות במקום עשירות:
human_translation: reached natron or soap, one may not launder even with water. And some say: One may not launder at all, because there is no poverty in a place of wealth,
llm_translation: They reached the point of Natar and Ohel, even in water one does not launder, and some say they do not launder them at all, primarily where there is no poverty in a place of wealth.

hebrew_text: ת"ר מעיל כולו של תכלת היה שנאמר (שמות לט, כב) ויעש את מעיל האפוד כליל תכלת שוליו כיצד מביא תכלת וארגמן ותולעת שני שזורין ועושה אותן כמין רימונים שלא פיתחו פיהן וכמין קונאות של קנסות שבראשי תינוקות
human_translation: the Sages taught The robe was entirely of sky-blue wool, as it is stated: “And he made the robe of the ephod all of sky-blue wool” its skirts, how brings sky-blue wool, and purple wool, and scarlet wool, twined and fashions them as pomegranates that have not opened their mouths, and as cones [ konaot ] of helmets [ kenasot ] that on the heads of children.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The entire robe was of blue wool, as it is stated (Exodus 39:22), "And he made the robe of the ephod woven entirely of blue wool." How did they bring the blue, purple, and crimson wool, and the fine linen, and weave them like pomegranates, whose mouths have not opened, and like knots on the heads of infants.

hebrew_text: ומביא שבעים ושנים זגין שבהן שבעים ושנים עינבלין ותולה בהן שלשים וששה בצד זה ושלשים וששה מצד זה רבי דוסא אומר משום רבי יהודה שלשים וששה היו שמונה עשרה מצד זה ושמנה עשרה מצד זה
human_translation: And brings seventy-two bells, that inside them seventy-two bell clappers, and he suspends on Thirty-six on this side and thirty-six on that side, Rabbi Dosa says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: There were thirty-six eighteen from this side and eighteen from that side.
llm_translation: And he brings seventy-two vessels, in them seventy-two grapes, and hangs on them thirty-six on this side and thirty-six on that side. Rabbi Dosa says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: Thirty-six were eighteen on this side and eighteen on that side.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי עיניני בר ששון כמחלוקת כאן כך מחלוקת במראות נגעים דתנן מראות נגעים רבי דוסא בן הרכינס אומר ל"ו עקביא בן מהללאל אומר שבעים ושנים
human_translation: Rabbi Inini bar Sason says: Just as a disagreement here so a disagreement with regard to shades of marks. As we learned shades of marks, Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says: thirty-six, Akavya ben Mahalalel says: seventy-two.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Einini bar Sheshon: Just as there is a dispute here, so too there is a dispute regarding skin afflictions. For we learned in the Mishnah of skin afflictions: Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas says thirty-two, Akavya ben Mahalalel says seventy-two.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי עיניני בר ששון למה נסמכה פרשת קרבנות לפרשת בגדי כהונה לומר לך מה קרבנות מכפרין אף בגדי כהונה מכפרין
human_translation: And Rabbi Inini bar Sason says: Why the passage offerings juxtaposed to the passage priestly vestments to tell you just as offerings effect atonement, so too, priestly vestments effect atonement.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Einini bar Sheshon said: Why was the portion of sacrifices juxtaposed to the portion of the priestly garments? To tell you that just as sacrifices atone, so too the priestly garments atone.

hebrew_text: כתונת מכפרת על שפיכות דם שנאמר (בראשית לז, לא) וישחטו שעיר עזים ויטבלו את הכתנת בדם מכנסים מכפרת על גילוי עריות שנאמר (שמות כח, מב) ועשה להם מכנסי בד [לכסות (את) בשר ערוה] מצנפת מכפרת על גסי הרוח מנין אמר רבי חנינא יבא דבר שבגובה ויכפר על גובה
