human_translation: tunic atones for bloodshed, as it is stated “And they killed a goat, and dipped the tunic in the blood” trousers atone for forbidden sexual relations, as it is stated “And you shall make them linen trousers to cover the flesh of their nakedness” mitre atones for the arrogant. From where Rabbi Ḥanina says: an item at an elevation, shall come and atone for an elevated
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The tunic atones for bloodshed, as it is stated (Genesis 37:31), "And they slaughtered a he-goat and dipped the tunic in the blood." Trousers atone for illicit relations, as it is stated (Exodus 28:42), "And make them linen trousers to cover the flesh of nakedness." The turban atones for haughtiness. How do we know this? Rabbi Chanina said: Let something that is high come and atone for haughtiness.

hebrew_text: אבנט מכפר על הרהור הלב ' היכא דאיתיה חושן מכפר על הדינין שנא' (שמות כח, טו) ועשית חושן משפט אפוד מכפר על עבודת כוכבים שנאמר (הושע ג, ד) אין אפוד ותרפים
human_translation: belt atones for thought of the heart. where it is breastplate atones for judgments, as it is stated: “And you shall make a breastplate of judgment” ephod atones for idol worship, as it is stated: without ephod or teraphim”
llm_translation: The belt atones for impure thoughts, as it is written (Exodus 28:15), "And you shall make a breastplate of judgment." The ephod atones for idolatry, as it is written (Hosea 3:4), "Without ephod or teraphim."

hebrew_text: מעיל מכפר על לשון הרע מנין א"ר חנינא יבא דבר שבקול ויכפר על קול הרע וציץ מכפר על עזות פנים בציץ כתיב (שמות כח, לח) והיה על מצח אהרן ובעזות פנים כתיב (ירמיהו ג, ג) ומצח אשה זונה היה לך
human_translation: robe atones for malicious speech. From where Rabbi Ḥanina says: an item that sound, shall come and atone for an evil sound. And frontplate atones for brazenness. with regard to the frontplate it is written: “And it shall be upon Aaron’s forehead” and with regard to brazenness it is written: “And you had a harlot’s forehead”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "A robe atones for evil speech." How do we know this? Rabbi Chanina said: Let a matter that is heard come and atone for the evil speech. And the forehead-plate atones for brazenness of face. Concerning the forehead-plate it is written (Exodus 28:38), "And it shall be upon Aaron's forehead." And regarding brazenness of face it is written (Jeremiah 3:3), "And you had the forehead of a whore."

hebrew_text: איני והא"ר יהושע בן לוי שני דברים לא מצינו להן כפרה בקרבנות ומצינו לו כפרה ממקום אחר ואלו הן שפיכות דמים ולשון הרע
human_translation: Is that so, But doesn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: two matters we do not find for them an atonement with offerings, but we find for them an atonement from another place, and they are: Bloodshed and malicious speech.
llm_translation: I am, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Two things we do not find atonement for them in sacrifices, and we find atonement for them from another place, and these are bloodshed and slander.

hebrew_text: שפיכות דמים מעגלה ערופה ולשון הרע מקטרת דתני רב חנניה מנין לקטרת שמכפרת שנאמר (במדבר יז, יב) ויתן את הקטרת ויכפר על העם
human_translation: bloodshed, from heifer whose neck is broken. And malicious speech, from incense, as Rav Ḥananya teaches From where the incense effects atonement? As it is stated “And he put on the incense, and made atonement for the people”
llm_translation: The shedding of blood, the broken-necked heifer, and evil speech are like the incense offering. For Rav Hananiah taught: From where do we derive that the incense offering atones? As it is stated (Numbers 17:12), "And he placed the incense and atoned for the people."

hebrew_text: ותני דבי רבי ישמעאל על מה קטורת מכפרת על לשון הרע יבא דבר שבחשאי ויכפר על מעשה חשאי
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael teaches: For what does incense effect atonement? for malicious speech, an item that in private, shall come and atone for an action private,
llm_translation: "And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: For what reason does the incense atone for evil speech? Let a matter of praise come and atone for a matter of deed."

hebrew_text: קשיא לשון הרע אלשון הרע קשיא שפיכות דמים אשפיכות דמים
human_translation: a difficulty malicious speech and malicious speech, a difficulty bloodshed and bloodshed,
llm_translation: Difficult is lashon hara (evil speech), like lashon hara; difficult is shedding of blood, like shedding of blood.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא דידיע מאן קטליה הא דלא ידיע מאן קטליה אי דידיע מאן קטליה בר קטלא הוא במזיד ולא אתרו ביה
human_translation: not difficult, this, where it is known who killed this, where it is not known who killed If it is known who killed is deserving of death, intentionally but did not forewarn him
llm_translation: Not difficult. This one where it is known who killed him, that one where it is not known who killed him. If it is known who killed him, it is considered intentional murder; if it is not known who killed him, it is not attributed to him.

hebrew_text: ולשון הרע אלשון הרע נמי לא קשיא הא בצינעא הא בפרהסיא:
human_translation: And malicious speech and malicious speech, also not difficult. This, in private, this, in public.
llm_translation: And the language of evil, the language of evil, also is not difficult. This one in private, this one in public.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך המזבח מקדש
llm_translation: The altar returns to you, O Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל התדיר מחבירו קודם את חבירו התמידין קודמין למוספין מוספי שבת קודמין למוספי ר"ח מוספי ר"ח קודמין למוספי ר"ה שנאמר (במדבר כח, כג) מלבד עולת הבקר אשר לעולת התמיד תעשו את אלה:
human_translation: Any that is frequent than another precedes the other the daily offerings precede the additional offerings, additional Shabbat offerings precede additional New Moon offerings. additional New Moon offerings precede additional New Year offerings. As it is stated “Besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a daily burnt offering, you shall offer these”
llm_translation: Mishnah: All that is frequent from his fellow precedes his fellow. The daily offerings precede the additional offerings. The additional offerings of Shabbat precede the additional offerings of Rosh Chodesh. The additional offerings of Rosh Chodesh precede the additional offerings of Rosh Hashanah, as it is stated (Numbers 28:23): "Besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for the continual burnt offering, you shall offer these."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא לן מנא לן כדקאמר טעמא מלבד עולת הבקר דילמא תמידין הן דקדמו למוספין משום דתדירי מוספין למוספין מנ"ל
human_translation: From where do we From where do we that the reason is stated “Besides the burnt offering of the morning.” perhaps it is daily offerings that precede additional offerings, because they are frequent, additional offering over additional offering, From where do we
llm_translation: Gemara: We have a tradition, we have a tradition, as it says, "The reason is apart from the burnt offering of the cattle." Perhaps they are regular offerings that preceded the additional offerings because the additional offerings are more frequent than the additional offerings. How do we know?

hebrew_text: א"ר אילעא דאמר קרא (במדבר כח, כד) כאלה תעשו ליום שבעת ימים אלה כאלה
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a said that the verse states “Like these you shall offer daily, for seven days” these like those
llm_translation: Rabbi Ile'a said: Scripture says (Numbers 28:24), "Like these you shall do for seven days, these like these."

hebrew_text: והאי מיבעי ליה לגופיה א"כ ניכתוב אלה תעשו ליום
human_translation: But that is required to its own If so, let write: These you shall offer daily.
llm_translation: And this one requires for itself, if so, it should be written: "These you shall do for the day."

hebrew_text: אי כתב אלה תעשו ליום שבעת הימים ה"א אלה לשבעת הימים (אין מידי אחרינא לא) ליום כתיב
human_translation: If had written These you shall offer daily for the seven days, I would say these the seven days. daily,” is written
llm_translation: If he wrote "these you shall do" for the seven days, "these" for the seven days (nothing else) is written, not for the day.

hebrew_text: ואכתי אימא אלה ליום אבל שאר יומי לא ידענא כמה אמר קרא תעשו שיהו כל העשיות שוות
human_translation: And still, say these for the day; but other days, I do not know how many the verse states: “You shall offer [ ta’asu ],” that all the rites [ asiyyot ] should be equal.
llm_translation: And thus I say, these are for the day of mourning, but for the rest of the days, I do not know how many. As the verse says, "You shall make them so that all the work shall be equal."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר מגופה דקרא אם כן לימא קרא מלבד עולת הבקר ותישתוק אשר לעולת התמיד ל"ל למימר דהך דתדירא תיקדום:
human_translation: Abaye said: from the verse itself, if so, let the verse say “Besides the burnt offering of the morning,” and remain silent Why do I “Which is for a daily burnt offering”? to say that this that is frequent, should precede
llm_translation: Abbaye said: From the body of the verse, if so, let the verse say, "aside from the burnt offering of the cattle," and it should be silent regarding "which is for the continual burnt offering," to teach that the one that is more frequent should take precedence.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המקודש מחבירו קודם את חבירו דם החטאת קודם לדם העולה מפני שהוא מרצה איברי עולה קודמין לאימורי חטאת מפני שהוא כליל לאישים
human_translation: Any that is sacred than another precedes the other the blood of the sin offering precedes the blood of the burnt offering because it effects acceptance, the limbs of burnt offering precedes the portions of sin offering, because is entirely in the flames
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone who consecrates from his fellow, his fellow precedes him. The blood of the sin offering precedes the blood of the burnt offering because it is atoning. The limbs of the burnt offering precede the sacrificial portions of the sin offering because it is complete for the priests.

hebrew_text: חטאת קודמת לאשם מפני שדמה ניתן לד' קרנות על היסוד אשם קודם לתודה ואיל נזיר מפני שהוא קדשי קדשים תודה ואיל נזיר קודמים לשלמים מפני שהן נאכלין ליום אחד וטעונין לחם
human_translation: a sin offering precedes a guilt offering due to that its blood is placed on four corners on the base A guilt offering precedes a thanks offering and nazirite’s ram due to that it is an offering of the most sacred order, A thanks offering and a nazirite’s ram precede a peace offering due to that they are eaten for one day, and require loaves
llm_translation: Sin offering precedes guilt offering because its blood is placed on the four horns of the altar. Guilt offering precedes thanksgiving offering and ram of a Nazirite because it is most holy. Thanksgiving offering and ram of a Nazirite precede peace offerings because they are eaten in one day and require bread.

hebrew_text: השלמים קודמין לבכור מפני שהן טעונין מתן ד' [וסמיכה] ונסכים ותנופות חזה ושוק הבכור קודם למעשר מפני שקדושתו מרחם ונאכל לכהנים
human_translation: the peace offering precedes the firstborn due to that requires placing four, and placing hands and libations, and the wavings of breast and the thigh The firstborn precedes the tithe because it is sanctified from womb, and it is eaten by the priests,
llm_translation: The peace offerings precede the firstborn because they require the giving of the four elements: blood, leaning, libations, and waving and the breast and the thigh. The firstborn precedes the tithe because its sanctity is more stringent and it is eaten by the priests.

hebrew_text: המעשר קודם לעופות מפני שהוא זבח ויש בו קודש קדשים דמו ואימוריו העופות קודמין למנחות מפני שהן מיני דמים מנחת חוטא קודם למנחת נדבה מפני שהוא בא על חטא חטאת העוף קודמת לעולת העוף וכן בהקדישה:
human_translation: The tithe precedes bird due to that it slaughtering, and there are of offerings of the most sacred order: Its blood and its portions The bird precede meal offerings due to that they are types blood meal offering of a sinner precedes a voluntary meal offering due to that it comes for a sin. the bird sin offering precedes the bird burnt offering, and likewise with regard to its consecration,
llm_translation: The tithe precedes the birds because it is a sacrifice and contains holy of holies, its blood and its offerings. The birds precede the meal offerings because they are types of blood. The sin offering meal offering precedes the voluntary meal offering because it comes for a sin. The sin offering bird precedes the burnt offering bird, and the same with consecration.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא הני מילי דת"ר (במדבר ח, ח) ופר שני בן בקר תקח לחטאת
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught and a second young bull you shall take for a sin offering”
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters that the Rabbis taught (Numbers 8:8) "And a young bull of the herd you shall take for a sin offering"?

hebrew_text: אם בא ללמד שהן שנים הרי כבר נאמר (במדבר ח, יב) ועשה את האחד חטאת ואת האחד עולה מה ת"ל ופר שני בן בקר תקח לחטאת שיכול שיהא חטאת קודמת לכל מעשה עולה ת"ל ופר שני בן בקר תקח לחטאת
human_translation: If comes to teach that they are two is already stated: “And offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering” Why the verse state: “And a second young bull you shall take for a sin offering”? As might that sin offering should precede all rites of burnt offering, the verse states: “And a second young bull you shall take for a sin offering,”
llm_translation: If one comes to learn that they are two, behold, it has already been stated (Numbers 8:12), "And one shall be for a sin offering, and the other shall be for a burnt offering." What is it teaching us? "And a bull of the herd for a sin offering you shall take." Could one think that the sin offering should precede all the actions of the burnt offering? It teaches us, "And a bull of the herd for a sin offering you shall take."

hebrew_text: אי פר שני יכול תהא עולה קודמת לחטאת לכל מעשיה ת"ל ועשה את האחד חטאת ואת האחד עולה הא כיצד דם חטאת קודמת לדם עולה מפני שמרצה איברי עולה כו'
human_translation: If second bull, might burnt offering precedes sin offering with regard to all its rites. the verse states: “And offer the one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering,” How these blood of sin offering precedes blood of burnt offering because it effects acceptance, limbs of burnt offering
llm_translation: If a bull, second, could, should be, burnt-offering, before, sin-offering, to all, its actions, it is written, and, make, the one, sin-offering, and, the one, burnt-offering, this, how, blood, sin-offering, before, blood, burnt-offering, because, it makes acceptable, limbs, burnt-offering, etc.

hebrew_text: ואמאי מתנה קמייתא דמכפרה תיקדום והנך לא
human_translation: But why Let first placement which effects atonement, take precedence, and those not
llm_translation: And why is the gift before atonement? Let them establish it, and those not.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא הכא בחטאת הלוים עסקינן ואע"ג דכי עולה דמי קאמר רחמנא היא תיקדים במערבא אמרי הואיל והתחיל במתנות גומר:
human_translation: Ravina said: here, we are dealing with sin offering the Levites And even though is comparable to a burnt offering, the Merciful One states precedes In the West, they say Once commenced with the placements completes
llm_translation: Ravina said: Here we are dealing with the sin offering of the Levites, and even though the Torah states "when it is a guilt offering" (Leviticus 7:1), the Merciful One established it in the west. They said: Since he began with gifts, he concludes.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו דם חטאת ואיברי עולה איזה מהן קודם דם חטאת קודם מפני שמרצה או דילמא איברי עולה קודמין מפני שהן כליל לאישים
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before blood of a sin offering and limbs of a burnt offering which of them precedes blood of sin offering take precedence, due to that it effects acceptance? Or perhaps limbs of burnt offering take precedence, due to that they are entirely in the flames
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: the blood of the sin offering and the limbs of the burnt offering, which one of them comes first? Does the blood of the sin offering come first because it is pleasing, or perhaps the limbs of the burnt offering come first because they are entirely for the altar.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דם חטאת קודם לדם עולה לדם עולה הוא דקדים לאיברי עולה לא קדים
human_translation: Come hear, blood of a sin offering precedes blood of a burnt offering. with regard to the blood of burnt offering that it takes precedence, not take precedence with regard to the limbs of burnt offering.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The blood of the sin offering precedes the blood of the burnt offering. It is the blood of the burnt offering that precedes the limbs of the burnt offering, not the other way around.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מסיפא איברי עולה קודמין לאימורי חטאת לאימורי חטאת הוא דקדים לדם חטאת לא קדים אלא מהא ליכא למשמע מינה:
human_translation: On the contrary, from the latter clause limbs of a burnt offering precede the portions of sin offering it is with regard to the portions of sin offering that take precedence, not take precedence with regard to the blood of sin offering. Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: On the contrary, from the latter clause it is derived that the limbs of the burnt offering take precedence over the sacrificial portions of the sin offering. It is the sacrificial portions of the sin offering that take precedence over the blood of the sin offering, not the blood that takes precedence. From this, it is evident.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו דם עולה ואימורי חטאת איזה מהן קודם דם עולה קודם דקאתי מכח כליל או דילמא אימורי חטאת קודמין דקאתי מכח מכפר
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before blood of a burnt offering and portions of a sin offering which of them precedes the blood of burnt offering take precedence, as it comes from entirety Or perhaps the portions of sin offering take precedence because they come from effects atonement.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: the blood of the burnt offering and the sacrificial portions of the sin offering, which of them comes first? Does the blood of the burnt offering come before it comes from the strength of the entire offering, or perhaps the sacrificial portions of the sin offering come first before it comes from the strength of atonement.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דם חטאת קודם לדם עולה דם חטאת הוא דקדים לדם עולה אבל אימורי חטאת לא
human_translation: Come hear, the blood of sin offering precedes the blood of burnt offering. it the blood of sin offering that precedes the blood of burnt offering, but the portions sin offering not
llm_translation: Come and hear: The blood of the sin offering precedes the blood of the burnt offering. It is the blood of the sin offering that is considered primary over the blood of the burnt offering, but not the blood of the meal offering.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מסיפא איברי עולה קודמין לאימורי חטאת איברי עולה הוא דקדמי לאימורי חטאת אבל דם עולה לא אלא מהא ליכא למשמע מינה:
human_translation: On the contrary, from the latter clause the limbs of burnt offering precede portions of sin offering it is the limbs of burnt offering that precede the portions of sin offering but the blood of burnt offering not. Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: On the contrary, from the latter clause it is evident that the limbs of the burnt-offering precede the sacrificial portions of the sin-offering. It is the limbs of the burnt-offering that precede the sacrificial portions of the sin-offering. But as for the blood of the burnt-offering, no; rather, from this there is no inference.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו דם עולה ודם אשם איזה מהן קודם דם עולה קודם דקאתי מכח כליל או דילמא דם אשם קודם (דקאתי מכח) דמכפר
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before blood of a burnt offering and blood of a guilt offering which of them precedes blood of the burnt offering take precedence, as it comes from entirety Or perhaps the blood of a guilt offering takes precedence, as it effects atonement.
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: the blood of the burnt offering and the blood of the guilt offering, which one of them comes first? Does the blood of the burnt offering come first before it comes from the strength of the entire offering, or perhaps the blood of the guilt offering comes first before it comes from the strength of atonement?

hebrew_text: ת"ש דם חטאת קודם לדם עולה אבל דם אשם לא
human_translation: Come hear, the blood of sin offering precedes the blood of burnt offering. But blood of a guilt offering not
llm_translation: Come and hear: The blood of the sin offering precedes the blood of the burnt offering, but the blood of the guilt offering does not.

hebrew_text: בדין הוא דאיבעי למיתני דם אשם ואיידי דבעא למיתני סיפא איברי עולה קודמין לאימורי חטאת
human_translation: By right should have taught blood of a guilt offering. But since wants to teach the latter clause: the limbs of a burnt offering precedes the portions of a sin offering,
llm_translation: In judgment it is necessary to teach the blood of guilt offering, and since it is necessary to teach the latter part, burnt offerings precede the mention of sin offerings.

hebrew_text: דאי תנא לאימורי אשם ה"א לאימורי אשם הוא דקדמי לאימורי חטאת לא קדמי מש"ה תנא חטאת
human_translation: As, had taught to the portions of a guilt offering, I would say it is the portions of a guilt offering which take precedence, do not take precedence over the portions of a sin offering, Due to this taught a sin offering,
llm_translation: If a Tanna taught regarding the statement "Asham," it is regarding the statement "Asham" that preceded, not regarding the statement "Chatat" that preceded. Therefore, a Tanna taught "Chatat."

hebrew_text: ת"ש חטאת קודם לאשם חטאת הוא דקדמה ליה לאשם אבל עולה לא מאי לאו דם
human_translation: Come hear, a sin offering precedes a guilt offering. it a sin offering that precedes a guilt offering, but a burnt offering not. What, is not blood,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Sin-offering precedes guilt-offering." It is a sin-offering that precedes a guilt-offering, but an elevation-offering, is it not that it is not blood.

hebrew_text: לא אאימורים דיקא נמי דקתני מפני שדמה ניתן ש"מ:
human_translation: No, to the sacrificial portions is also precise as it teaches due to that its blood is placed conclude from
llm_translation: Not said they also that it is taught: "Because it appears like giving blood"?

hebrew_text: חטאת קודמת כו': אדרבה אשם קדים שכן יש לו קיצבה אפ"ה ריבוי דמזבח עדיף:
human_translation: A sin offering precedes On the contrary, guilt offering precede as it has a fixed value Even so, more on the altar greater
llm_translation: Sin-offering precedes, etc. On the contrary, guilt-offering precedes, for it has a fixed measure. Nevertheless, the multiplicity of the altar is superior.

hebrew_text: אשם קודם לתודה כו': אדרבה התודה ואיל נזיר קדמי שכן טעונין לחם אפ"ה קדשי קדשים עדיפי:
human_translation: A guilt offering precedes a thanks offering On the contrary, the thanks offering and nazirite’s ram precede as they require loaves Even so, offering of the most sacred order greater
llm_translation: Guilt-offering before thanksgiving, etc. On the contrary, thanksgiving and a ram of a Nazirite come first, for they require bread. Nevertheless, the most holy offerings are superior.

hebrew_text: תודה ואיל נזיר כו': אדרבה שלמים קדמי שכן ישנן בציבור כביחיד אפילו הכי נאכלין ליום אחד עדיפי
human_translation: A thanks offering and nazirite’s ram On the contrary, peace offerings precede as they are by the community as well as by the individual. Even so, are eaten for one day greater
llm_translation: Thanksgiving offering and Nazirite ram, etc.: On the contrary, peace offerings take precedence, for they are found in the community like individuals. Even so, if they are to be eaten in one day, they are preferable.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו תודה ואיל נזיר איזה מהן קודם תודה קדמה שכן טעונה ד' מיני לחם או דילמא איל נזיר קודם שכן יש עמו דמים אחרים ת"ש זו קודמת לזו שזו טעונה ד' מיני לחם וזו אינה טעונה אלא שני מיני לחם:
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a thanks offering and a nazirite’s ram which of them precedes thanks offering take precedence, as it requires four types of loaves, Or perhaps nazirite’s ram takes precedence, as there are other blood with Come hear This precedes that as this requires four types of loaves, and that requires only two types of loaves.
llm_translation: The question was asked: Which comes first, a thanksgiving offering or a Nazirite offering? Perhaps the thanksgiving offering comes first because it requires four types of bread. Or maybe the Nazirite offering comes first because it involves other blood. Come and hear: This one precedes that one, as this one requires four types of bread and that one requires only two types of bread.

hebrew_text: השלמים קודמין לבכור כו': אדרבה בכור קודם שכן קדושתו מרחם ונאכל לכהנים אפ"ה מצות יתירות עדיפי:
human_translation: And the peace offering precedes the firstborn On the contrary, firstborn precede as it is sanctified from womb and it is eaten by the priests, Even so, additional mitzvot greater
llm_translation: The peace offerings precede the firstborn, etc. On the contrary, the firstborn precedes because its sanctity is from the womb, and it is eaten by the priests. Nevertheless, the additional mitzvot are preferable.

hebrew_text: הבכור קודם כו': אדרבה מעשר קודם שכן מקדש לפניו ולאחריו אפ"ה קדושה מרחם עדיפא:
human_translation: The firstborn precedes On the contrary, tithe precede as before or after sanctified. Even so, sanctified from womb greater
llm_translation: The firstborn precedes, etc. On the contrary, the tithe precedes, for it sanctifies before and after it. Nevertheless, sanctity of the womb is preferable.

hebrew_text: מעשר קודם לעופות כו': אדרבה עופות קדמי שכן קדשי קדשים אפ"ה מין זבח עדיף
human_translation: tithe precedes bird On the contrary, bird precede as offerings of the most sacred order, Even so, type of slaughtering greater
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ma'aser kodem la'ofot, etc.: Adrabah, ofot kadmi, shachen kodshei kodashim, afilu min zevach adif. English translation: Tithes precede birds, etc.: On the contrary, birds precede, for the holiest of holies, even a species of sacrifice is superior.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא בר שילא אימורי קדשים קלים שיצאו לפני זריקת דמים פסולין ותנא תונא מפני שהוא זבח וישנו קדשי קדשים דמיו ואימורין
human_translation: Ravina bar Sheila says Sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of blood are disqualified. And the tanna taught: due to that it slaughtering, and there are offerings of the most sacred order: Its blood and its sacrificial portions
llm_translation: Ravina bar Sheilah said: "Light sacrificial items that went out before the sprinkling of the blood are invalid." And it was taught in a Baraita: "Tuna says: Because it is a sacrifice, and its value is like the Holy of Holies, its sacrificial portions."

hebrew_text: בשלמא אימורין ליתנהו בעופות אלא דם מיהא איתיה אלא לאו קמ"ל אימורין כי דמו
human_translation: Granted, there are no sacrificial portions from a bird but blood at least is Rather, is it not teach us sacrificial portions comparable to its blood?
llm_translation: In peace, they should be given in birds, but blood, from where does it come? Rather, it is there. But isn't it obvious? The Talmud teaches us that they should be given as their blood.

hebrew_text: מה דמו לפני זריקה אף אימורין קודם זריקה וקא קרי להו קדשי קדשים ומה דמו מיפסל ביוצא אף אימורין מיפסל ביוצא
human_translation: Just as its blood before sprinkling so too, sacrificial portions before sprinkling and calls them offerings of the most sacred order. And just as blood is disqualified by leaving so too, sacrificial portions are disqualified by leaving
llm_translation: What is the comparison to before the sprinkling, so too the sacrificial portions before the sprinkling, and it calls them "most holy." And what is the comparison to being disqualified by exiting, so too the sacrificial portions are disqualified by exiting.

hebrew_text: נימא מסייע ליה בשר קדשים קלים שיצא לפני זריקת דמים רבי יוחנן אמר כשר ר"ל אמר פסול
human_translation: Let us say supports his flesh of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of blood, Rabbi Yoḥanan says fit Reish Lakish says disqualified.
llm_translation: Nima assists him with the flesh of light holy offerings that went out before the sprinkling of blood. Rabbi Yochanan said: valid. Reish Lakish said: invalid.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר כשר הואיל וסופו לצאת ר"ל אמר פסול עדיין לא הגיע זמנו לצאת ע"כ לא פליגי אלא בבשר אבל באימורין לא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says fit, since it will ultimately leave Reish Lakish says unfit, its time to leave has not yet arrived disagree only with regard to flesh But with regard to sacrificial portions not
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "It is valid, since its end is to go out." Reish Lakish said: "It is invalid, as its time to go out has not yet arrived." Therefore, they only disagree regarding flesh, but not regarding sacrificial portions.

hebrew_text: הוא הדין דבאימורין נמי פליגי והא דקא מיפלגי בבשר להודיעך כחו דר"ל דאפילו בשר דסופה לצאת אמר עדיין לא הגיע זמנו לצאת
human_translation: The same is true with regard to sacrificial portions, also disagree And that disagree with regard to flesh is to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Reish Lakish, as even flesh, which will ultimately leave he says its time to leave has not yet arrived.
llm_translation: The same applies to statements, they also disagree. And that which they are disagreeing about regarding meat is to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Eliezer, that even meat whose time has not yet come to be eaten, he says it has not yet reached its time to be eaten.

hebrew_text: לימא כתנאי אימורי קדשים קלים שיצאו לפני זריקת דמים ר"א אומר אין מועלין בהן
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im : sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of blood, Rabbi Eliezer says from them not misuse
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: Light holy things that have gone out before the sprinkling of the blood. Rabbi Eliezer says: We do not act treacherously with them.

hebrew_text: ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא ר"ע אומר מועלין בהן וחייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא
human_translation: and is not liable for them due to piggul notar , or ritually impure. Rabbi Akiva says from them misuse and is liable for them due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: And not obligated upon them because of Pigul, leftover, and impure. Rabbi Akiva says: They are disqualified, and obligated upon them because of Pigul, leftover, and impure.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו בדהדר עיילינהו פליגי ובהא פליגי דמר סבר מיפסלי ביוצא ומר סבר לא מיפסלי ביוצא
human_translation: What, is it not disagree with regard to where then brought them into And, with regard to this they disagree: As Sage, holds are disqualified by leaving and Sage, holds are not disqualified by leaving
llm_translation: "What is the difference between them? They argue regarding this: one Master holds that they disqualify with an external factor, and the other Master holds that they do not disqualify with an external factor."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא בדהדר עיילינהו כ"ע לא פליגי והכא בדאיתנהו אבראי פליגי ובהא פליגי דמר סבר אין זריקה מועלת ליוצא ומר סבר זריקה מועלת ליוצא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said with regard to where then brought them into everyone agrees And here disagree with regard to where are outside And they disagree with regard to this As Sage, holds sprinkling is not effective to taken out and Sage, holds sprinkling is effective to taken out
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: When they went back, all do not disagree. And here, in that which they taught, they disagree. And in this they disagree: one master holds that throwing is not effective for the one who is exempt, and the other master holds that throwing is effective for the one who is exempt.

hebrew_text: והא רב פפא הוא דאמר בדאיתנהו אבראי כ"ע לא פליגי בדעיילינהו לגוואי פליגי
human_translation: But Rav Pappa is who said with regard to where are outside everyone, agrees disagree with regard to where returned to within
llm_translation: And behold, Rav Papa is the one who said in the teaching: "The Sages do not disagree regarding the limbs, they only disagree regarding the sinews."

hebrew_text: ה"מ גבי שתי לחם דלאו גופיה דזיבחא אבל אימורין דגופיה דזיבחא הוא בדאיתנהו אבראי פליגי:
human_translation: This statement to two loaves, as are not the offering itself. But sacrificial portions, which are the offering itself, disagree with regard to where they are outside
llm_translation: These are the words regarding the two loaves that are not the essence of the offering, but the words that are the essence of the offering, they are in dispute.

hebrew_text: עופות קודמין כו': אדרבה מנחות קודמות שכן ישנן בצבור כביחיד אפ"ה מיני דמים עדיפי:
human_translation: bird precede On the contrary, meal offerings precede as they are communal as individual Even so, types blood greater
llm_translation: Birds precede the offering of flour offerings. On the contrary, flour offerings precede the offering of birds, for they are found in the community like an individual. Nevertheless, blood offerings are superior.

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא כו': אדרבה מנחת נדבה קודמת שכן טעונה שמן ולבונה אפ"ה מנחת חוטא הבאה על חטא עדיפא דמכפרת
human_translation: The meal offering of a sinner On the contrary, a voluntary meal offering precede as it requires oil and frankincense. Even so, the meal offering of a sinner, which comes due to a sin, greater as effects atonement.
llm_translation: Minchat chotei 26a: On the contrary, a voluntary meal-offering takes precedence, as it requires oil and frankincense. Nevertheless, a sin-offering meal-offering that comes for a sin is preferable, as it atones.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו מנחת סוטה ומנחת נדבה איזו מהן קודמת מנחת נדבה קדמה שכן טעונה שמן (או) ולבונה או דלמא מנחת סוטה קדמה שכן באה לברר עון
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the meal offering of a sota , and a voluntary meal offering which of them precedes voluntary meal offering take precedence, as it requires oil and frankincense? Or perhaps the meal offering of a sota takes precedence, as it comes to clarify transgression,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: The meal offering of a Sotah and the meal offering of a voluntary offering, which one of them takes precedence? The meal offering of a voluntary offering takes precedence, for it requires oil and frankincense. Or perhaps the meal offering of a Sotah takes precedence, for it comes to clarify sin.

hebrew_text: ת"ש מנחת חוטא קודמת למנחת נדבה מנחת חוטא הוא דקדמה למנחת נדבה הא מנחת סוטה לא מי קתני מפני שהיא מכפרת מפני שהיא באה על חטא קתני והא נמי באה על חטא
human_translation: Come hear, the meal offering of a sinner precedes a voluntary meal offering. it is the meal offering of a sinner that precedes a voluntary meal offering, but the meal offering of a sota not. Is teaching due to that it effects atonement? teaches: Due to that it comes of a sin, and also comes of a sin,
llm_translation: Come and hear: The sin offering meal-offering precedes the voluntary meal-offering. The sin offering meal-offering, it is that precedes the voluntary meal-offering. But the meal-offering of the suspected adulteress, does not the Mishnah teach, because it atones, because it comes for a sin, it teaches. But does it not also come for a sin.

hebrew_text: ת"ש זו קודמת לזו שזו באה מן החיטין וזו באה מן השעורין מאי לאו מנחת נדבה למנחת סוטה לא מנחת חוטא למנחת סוטה
human_translation: Come hear This precedes that as this comes from wheat, and that comes from barley. What, does not a voluntary meal offering to the meal offering of a sota ? No, the meal offering of a sinner over the meal offering of a sota .
llm_translation: Come and hear: this one precedes that one, for this one comes from wheat and that one comes from barley. What, is it not a Minchat Nedavah? It is not a Minchat Chotei, but a Minchat Sotah.

hebrew_text: תיפוק לי דהא מכפרת והא לא מכפרת
human_translation: I derive due to that effects atonement and does not effect atonement.
llm_translation: Let it come out for me that it atones, and that it does not atone.

hebrew_text: ואלא מאי מנחת נדבה תיפוק לי דזו טעונה שמן ולבונה וזו אינה טעונה שמן ולבונה אלא חד מתרי טעמי [נקיט]:
human_translation: Rather, what a voluntary meal offering I derive that this requires oil and frankincense and that does not require oil and frankincense. Rather, cited one of two reasons.
llm_translation: And rather what is the Minchat Nedavah? It should be derived for me that this one requires oil and frankincense, and this one does not require oil and frankincense, but one of the two reasons we take.

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף קודמת כו': מנא ה"מ דת"ר (ויקרא ה, ח) והקריב את אשר לחטאת ראשונה מה ת"ל שאין ת"ל ללמד שתקרב ראשונה הרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ה, י) ואת השני יעשה עולה
human_translation: the bird sin offering precedes From where are these matters as the Sages taught “And he shall offer that which is for the sin offering first” Why the verse state As no the verse to state to teach that is sacrificed first, as is already stated: “And he shall prepare the second for a burnt offering”
llm_translation: Sin offering of bird precedes, etc.: From where do we derive this that the Rabbis taught (Leviticus 5:8) "And he shall bring that which is for the sin offering first"? What does the Torah teach us? That the Torah does not teach us to bring the first offering, as it is already stated (Leviticus 5:10) "And the second he shall make a burnt offering."

hebrew_text: אלא זה בנה אב לכל חטאות שיקדמו לעולה הבאות עמהן בין חטאת העוף לעולת העוף בין חטאת בהמה לעולת בהמה ואפי' חטאת העוף לעולת בהמה
human_translation: Rather, this established a paradigm for all sin offerings, that they should precede the burnt offering that comes with them; whether a bird sin offering over a bird burnt offering, whether an animal sin offering over an animal burnt offering, and even a bird sin offering over an animal burnt offering.
llm_translation: Rather, this one (case) the father (i.e., the sin-offering) for all sins that precede the burnt-offerings that come with them, whether the sin-offering of a bird to the burnt-offering of a bird, or the sin-offering of an animal to the burnt-offering of an animal, and even the sin-offering of a bird to the burnt-offering of an animal.

hebrew_text: הלכך חטאת העוף לעולת העוף מואת השני חטאת בהמה לעולת בהמה מדרבי רחמנא חטאת העוף לעולת בהמה מזה בנה אב
human_translation: Therefore, a bird sin offering over a bird burnt offering from “And the second an animal sin offering over an animal burnt offering from that the Merciful One extends a bird sin offering over an animal burnt offering from this established a paradigm
llm_translation: Therefore, the sin offering of a bird for the burnt offering of a bird is more stringent than the sin offering of an animal for the burnt offering of an animal, as derived from the Merciful One. The sin offering of a bird for the burnt offering of an animal is distinct; this is the opinion of Ben Azzai.

hebrew_text: תא שמע ר"א אומר כל מקום שנתחלפה חטאת חטאת קודמת וכאן (ביולדת) עולה קודמת
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Eliezer says: every instance where is exchanged sin offering, sin offering precedes But here, in a woman who gave birth, burnt offering takes precedence,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Eliezer says, "In any place where a sin offering is replaced, the original sin offering takes precedence, and here (in the case of childbirth) the burnt offering takes precedence."

hebrew_text: כל מקום שבא על חטא חטאת קודמת וכאן עולה קודמת וכל מקום ששנים באים תחת חטאת חטאת קודמת וכאן עולה קודמת
human_translation: every instance where comes of a sin, sin offering precedes But here, burnt offering precedes And every instance where two come instead of a sin offering, sin offering precedes But here, burnt offering precedes
llm_translation: Every place that a sin offering comes for a sin, the sin offering precedes, and here the preceding offering ascends. And every place that two come in place of a sin offering, the sin offering precedes, and here the preceding offering ascends.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא למקראה הקדימה הכתוב:
human_translation: Rava said: the verse mentions first with regard to reading
llm_translation: Rava said: The verse preceded its reading, as it is written:

hebrew_text: תא שמע פרים קודמין לאילים ואילים קודמין לכבשים כבשים לשעירים
human_translation: Come hear bulls precede rams, and rams precede sheep, sheep male goats.
llm_translation: Come and hear: calves precede rams, rams precede sheep, and sheep precede goats.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו דחג לא לנדבה פרים קודמין לאילים שכן נתרבו בנסכים וכן אילים לכבשים כבשים לשעירים שכן נתרבו באליה
human_translation: What, is it not of the festival No, to gift Bulls precede rams, as a greater of libations; and likewise rams sheep Sheep male goats, as greater; tail
llm_translation: What is the "no" of the festival? Not for voluntary offerings. Bulls precede rams, for they have increased in libations. And likewise rams to lambs, lambs to goats, for they have increased in burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: ת"ש פר כהן משיח קודם לפר העלם דבר של צבור פר העלם דבר של צבור קודם לפר עבודת כוכבים
human_translation: Come hear The bull of anointed priest, precedes bull for an unwitting communal sin, bull for an unwitting communal sin precedes bull for idol worship.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The bull of the anointed priest precedes the bull of the High Priest for a communal matter. The bull of the High Priest precedes the bull for idol worship.

hebrew_text: פר עבודת כוכבים קודם לשעירי עבודת כוכבים דאע"ג דפר עבודת כוכבים עולה ושעירי עבודת כוכבים חטאת
human_translation: bull for idol worship precedes male goats for idol worship, even though bull for idol worship a burnt offering, and male goats for idol worship sin offerings.
llm_translation: A young bull of idolatry precedes the he-goats of idolatry, for even though a young bull of idolatry is brought, and the he-goats of idolatry are for a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: ואימא מרישא פר העלם דבר של צבור קודם לפר עבודת כוכבים
human_translation: But say from the first clause bull for an unwitting communal sin, precedes bull for idol worship,
llm_translation: And say from the beginning, the hidden bull, a matter of the community precedes the bull of idolatry.

hebrew_text: בחד מינא מיהא לא קאמרינן דחטאת קדמה כי קאמרינן בתרי מיני אשכחן עולה דקדמה לחטאת
human_translation: In any event, with regard to one species we did not say that a sin offering takes precedence. When we say with regard to two species. we find a burnt offering that precedes a sin offering.
llm_translation: In one case, we do not say that the sin offering precedes, for when we say in two cases, we find a burnt offering preceding the sin offering.

hebrew_text: אמרי במערבא משמיה דרבא בר מרי חטאת עבודת כוכבים חסר א' (במדבר טו, כד) לחטת כתיב רבינא אמר כמשפט כתיב בהו
human_translation: They say in the West, in the name of Rava bar Mari: sin offering for idol worship is without an alef It is written lamed , ḥet , tet , tav . Ravina says “according to the ordinance” is written with regard to
llm_translation: They said in the West in the name of Rava bar Mari: "A sin-offering for idol worship lacking one." (Numbers 15:24) Ravina said: "It is written 'for a sin' in them."

hebrew_text: השתא דאתית להכי אפילו תימא פרים דחג נמי כמשפטם כתיב בהו:
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this Even you say bulls of the festival also “according to their ordinance” is written concerning
llm_translation: At this moment, when you come to this, even if you say "bulls of the feast," it is also written about them according to their judgment.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו חטאת העוף ועולת בהמה ומעשר איזו מהן קודם תיקדום חטאת העוף איכא מעשר דקדים לה ליקדים מעשר איכא עולת בהמה דקדמה ליה תיקדום עולת בהמה איכא חטאת העוף דקדמה לה
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a bird sin offering, and an animal burnt offering, and tithe which of them precedes the bird sin offering should take precedence, there is tithe that precedes it, tithe should take precedence, there is animal burnt offering that precedes it, animal burnt offering should take precedence, there is the bird sin offering that precedes it,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: the sin offering of a bird, the burnt offering of an animal, and the tithe - which one of them takes precedence? The sin offering of a bird takes precedence, for there is a tithe that takes precedence over it. The tithe takes precedence, for there is a burnt offering of an animal that takes precedence over it. The burnt offering of an animal takes precedence, for there is a sin offering of a bird that takes precedence over it.

hebrew_text: הכא תרגימו מין זבח עדיף במערבא אמרי עיילא בה עולת בהמה בחטאת העוף ואגבהתה ממעשר:
human_translation: Here, they explained a type of slaughtering greater In the West, they say: animal burnt offering has an effect on the bird sin offering and raises its above tithe
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: Here they translated "min zevach" as "adiyif" in the West. They said: "Ayla" refers to an offering of an animal, a sin offering of a bird, and its accompanying meal offering from the tithe.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל החטאות שבתורה קודמות לאשמות חוץ מאשם מצורע מפני שהוא בא על הכשר
human_translation: All the sin offerings by the Torah take precedence over the guilt offerings, except for the guilt offering of a leper, because it comes to fit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All the sins in the Torah precede the guilt offerings, except for the guilt offering of a leper, because it comes upon something permissible.

hebrew_text: כל האשמות שבתורה באין בני שתים ובאין בכסף שקלים חוץ מאשם נזיר ואשם מצורע שהן באין בני שנתן ואין באין בכסף שקלים
human_translation: All the guilt offerings by the Torah come in their second year, and come worth silver shekels, except for the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, as they come in their year, and do not come worth silver shekels,
llm_translation: All the guilt-offerings in the Torah come with two elements and with a monetary value, except for the guilt-offering of a Nazirite and the guilt-offering of a leper, which come with only one element and do not come with a monetary value.

hebrew_text: כשם שקודמין בהקרבתן קודמין באכילתן שלמים של אמש ושלמים של יום של אמש קודמין לשל יום שלמים של אמש חטאת ואשם של היום שלמים של אמש קודמין דברי ר"מ וחכ"א חטאת קודמת מפני שהיא קדשי קדשים
human_translation: Just as precede with regard to their sacrifice, they precede with regard to their consumption. a peace offering from yesterday and a peace offering from today, from yesterday precedes from today. a peace offering from yesterday a sin offering or a guilt offering from today, peace offering from yesterday precedes the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: sin offering precedes due to that it is an offering of the most sacred order.
llm_translation: As they precede in their offering, they precede in their consumption. The peace offerings of yesterday and the peace offerings of yesterday precede over the peace offerings of today. The sin offering and guilt offering of today precede over the peace offerings of yesterday. These are the words of Rabbi Meir, and the sages say: the sin offering precedes because it is the most holy.

hebrew_text: וכולן הכהנים רשאין לשנות באכילתן לאכלן צלוין ושלוקין ומבושלין לתת לתוכו תבלי חולין ותבלי תרומה דברי ר"ש ר"מ אומר לא יתן לתוכו תבלי תרומה שלא יביא התרומה לידי פסול:
human_translation: And all of the priests are permitted to alter their consumption to eat them roasted, or boiled, or cooked, to place in non-sacred spices or teruma spices. the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Meir says: One may not place teruma spices in it, that he will not bring the teruma to of disqualification.
llm_translation: "And all the priests are permitted to change in their eating, to eat them roasted, boiled, and cooked, to put into them spices of common food and spices of terumah. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon; Rabbi Meir says: One should not put into them spices of terumah, so that the terumah should not come into contact with something invalid."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איבעיא להו תדיר ומקודש איזה מהם קודם תדיר קודם משום דתדיר או דלמא מקודש קדים דקדיש תא שמע תמידין קודמין למוספין
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before a frequent and of sanctity which of them precedes frequent take precedence, due to that frequent, or perhaps of sanctity takes precedence, as of sanctity? Come hear daily offerings precede additional offerings
llm_translation: The Gemara: It was asked of them: If one has a choice between a frequent offering (Tadir) and a consecrated offering (Mekudash), which one of them takes precedence? Tadir takes precedence, perhaps because it is frequent, or perhaps the consecrated offering takes precedence, for it is sanctified. Come and hear: The daily offerings take precedence over the additional offerings.

hebrew_text: ואף ע"ג דמוספין קדישי אטו שבת למוספין אהנאי לתמידין לא אהנאי
human_translation: And even though additional offerings of sanctity, Is that to say Shabbat affects additional offerings not affect daily offerings
llm_translation: And even though we add Kaddish prayers on weekdays, for Shabbat we benefit for the additional prayers, for the daily prayers we do not benefit.

hebrew_text: ת"ש מוספי שבת קודמין למוספי ראש חודש אטו ראש חודש למוספין דידיה אהני למוספי שבת לא אהני
human_translation: Come hear additional Shabbat offerings precede additional New Moon offerings Is that to say New Moon affects its additional offerings does not affect the additional offerings of Shabbat?
llm_translation: Come and hear: The additional offerings of Shabbat take precedence over the additional offerings of Rosh Chodesh. Is it not the case that Rosh Chodesh takes precedence over its own additional offerings? It benefits the additional offerings of Shabbat, but it does not benefit its own additional offerings.

hebrew_text: תא שמע מוספי ראש חודש קודמין למוספי ראש השנה אע"ג דראש השנה קדשה אטו ראש השנה למוספי דידיה אהני למוספי ראש חודש לא אהני
human_translation: Come hear additional New Moon offerings precede additional New Year offerings even though the New Year of sanctity. Is that to say the New Year affects its additional offerings does not affect the additional offerings of New Moon?
llm_translation: Come and hear: The additional offerings of Rosh Chodesh take precedence over the additional offerings of Rosh Hashanah, even though Rosh Hashanah is a holy day. Can you infer that Rosh Hashanah benefits the additional offerings of itself, but does not benefit the additional offerings of Rosh Chodesh.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ד"א ברכת היין תדירה וברכת היום אינה תדירה ותדיר ושאינו תדיר תדיר קודם אע"ג דברכת היום קדישה אטו שבת לברכת היום אהנאי לברכת היין לא אהנאי
human_translation: Come hear Alternatively, The blessing over wine frequently, and the blessing over the day is not frequently, and a frequent and an infrequent frequent takes precedence even though the blessing of the day of sanctity, Is that to say Shabbat affects the blessing of the day does not affect the blessing on the wine?
llm_translation: Come and hear: It has been taught in a Baraita: The blessing of wine, which is frequent, and the blessing of the day, which is not frequent, the frequent takes precedence over the infrequent. Even though the blessing of the day is sanctified, nevertheless, the blessing of the wine takes precedence over the blessing of the day, as one benefits from the blessing of the day, but does not benefit from the blessing of the wine.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דאמר רבי יוחנן הלכה מתפלל אדם של מנחה ואח"כ של מוספין אטו שבת לתפלת מוספין אהנאי לתפלת מנחה לא אהנאי
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha a person prays the afternoon prayer and afterward the additional prayer, Is that to say Shabbat affects the additional prayer does not affect the afternoon prayer?
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is that a person prays the Mincha prayer and afterwards the Musaf prayer. Is this not referring to Shabbat, where one benefits from the Musaf prayer but does not benefit from the Mincha prayer.

hebrew_text: ת"ש שלמים של אמש חטאת ואשם של יום שלמים של אמש קודמין הא אידי ואידי דיום חטאת ואשם קדמי ואע"ג דשלמים תדירי
human_translation: Come hear a peace offering from yesterday a sin offering or a guilt offering from today, the peace offering from yesterday precedes this and that from today, sin offering or guilt offering takes precedence, and even though the peace offering frequent,
llm_translation: Come and hear: The peace offerings of yesterday precede the sin offering and guilt offering of today. The peace offerings of yesterday take precedence, even though peace offerings are more frequent.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מצוי קאמרת תדיר קמיבעיא לן מצוי לא קמיבעיא לן
human_translation: Rava said Are you speaking a common We raise the dilemma a frequent we do not raise the dilemma a common
llm_translation: Rava said: "When you said 'metzuy,' you were asking about 'tadir.' We were not asking about 'metzuy,' we were asking about 'tadir.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב הונא בר יהודה לרבא אטו מצוי לאו תדיר והתניא אוציא את הפסח שאינו תדיר ולא אוציא את המילה שהיא תדירה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda said to Rava: Is that to say a common not a frequent But isn’t it taught I should exclude the Paschal offering as it is not frequent, and I should not exclude the circumcision, as it is frequent?
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Judah said to Rava: Is it not found that something infrequent is more stringent than something frequent? And it was taught: One may bring out the Paschal lamb, which is infrequent, but one may not bring out the circumcision, which is frequent.

hebrew_text: מאי תדירה תדירה במצות ואיבעית אימא מילה לגבי פסח כי תדיר דמיא
human_translation: What frequent frequent in mitzvot And if you wish, say circumcision in relation to Paschal offering is considered like a frequent
llm_translation: What is considered frequent? Frequent in regards to mitzvot. And if you ask, say circumcision in comparison to Passover, for frequent is similar.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו תדיר ושאינו תדיר וקדים ושחט לשאינו תדיר מאי מי אמרינן כיון דשחטיה מקריב ליה או דלמא יהיב לאחר דממרס בדמו עד דמקריב ליה לתדיר והדר מקריב לשאינו תדיר
human_translation: dilemma was raised before a frequent and an infrequent and he slaughtered the infrequent first, what Do we say since slaughtered sacrifice it? Or perhaps gives to another who stirs its blood until sacrifices frequent and then sacrifices the infrequent
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: Regarding something frequent and something not frequent, and regarding the one that came first and slaughtered for the one that is not frequent, what is the law? Do we say, since he slaughtered it, he brings it close to the altar, or perhaps he gives it to another after it has become putrid in its blood until he brings it close to the frequent offering, and then he brings it close to the one that is not frequent.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא מסורא ת"ש שלמים של אמש חטאת ואשם של יום של אמש קודם לשל יום הא דיום דומיא דאמש
human_translation: Rav Huna from Sura said: Come hear a peace offering from yesterday a sin offering or a guilt offering from today, from yesterday precedes from today. but from today similar to from yesterday,
llm_translation: Rav Huna of Sura said: Come and hear: The peace offerings of yesterday precede the sin offering and guilt offering of the day before yesterday, just as the day is similar to yesterday.

hebrew_text: וה"ד דקדים שחטיה לשלמים חטאת ואשם קדמי
human_translation: And what are the circumstances where first slaughtered the peace offering sin offering or guilt offering takes precedence,
llm_translation: And this is the opinion that if one slaughtered it for peace offerings, the sin offering and guilt offering take precedence.

hebrew_text: דלמא שלמים דאמש וחטאת ואשם דיום היכי משכחת לה דשחטינהו לתרוייהו אבל לא שחטינהו לתרוייהו תיבעי לך
human_translation: Perhaps a peace offering from yesterday and a sin offering or a guilt offering from today, How can you find these where slaughtered both of them, But not slaughtered both of them, you raise the dilemma
llm_translation: Perhaps the peace offerings of yesterday, and the sin offering and guilt offering of today, how do you find them that they were slaughtered for both of them, but they were not slaughtered for both of them? It should be asked of you.

hebrew_text: ת"ש ד"א ברכת היין תדירה וברכת היום אינה תדירה ותדיר ושאינו תדיר תדיר קודם
human_translation: Come hear Alternatively, the blessing on wine frequently and the blessing of the day is not frequently, and a frequent and an infrequent frequent takes precedence
llm_translation: Come and hear: It has been taught in a Baraita: The blessing over wine, which is frequent, takes precedence over the blessing of the day, which is not frequent, and that which is frequent takes precedence over that which is not frequent.

hebrew_text: ה"נ דכיון דאתיין כמאן דשחיטי תרוייהו דמי
human_translation: Here too, since come comparable to where one slaughtered both
llm_translation: So it was taught: since they both come from the same source, they are considered equivalent.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דא"ר יוחנן הלכה מתפלל אדם של מנחה ואח"כ של מוספין ה"נ כיון דמטי זמן תפלת מנחה כמאן דשחיטי תרוייהו דמי
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha a person prays the afternoon prayer and afterward the additional prayer, Here too, since the time of the afternoon prayer has arrived, comparable to where one slaughtered both
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yochanan said, the halacha is that a person prays the Mincha prayer and afterwards the Musaf prayer. Similarly, once the time for the Mincha prayer arrives, it is considered as if both sacrifices have been slaughtered.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרב אשי לרבינא שחטו קודם חצות פסול מפני שנאמר בו (שמות יב, ו) בין הערבים קודם לתמיד כשר ויהא ממרס בדמו עד שיזרוק הדם
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina slaughtered before midday disqualified, because it is stated in its regard: “In the afternoon” before the daily offering valid, but should stir its blood until sprinkles the blood
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ashi, said to Ravina: "If one slaughters before midnight, it is invalid, as it is stated regarding it (Exodus 12:6), 'Between the evenings.' Before the continual offering is valid, and its blood should be splashed until the blood is thrown."

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן כגון דקדים שחטיה לתמיד ברישא אמר ליה רב אחא סבא לרב אשי מתניתין נמי דיקא דקתני עד שיזרק הדם (תמיד) ולא קתני עד שישחוט ויזרק דם ש"מ:
human_translation: Here we are dealing with where gave precedence to the daily offering slaughtered it first, Rav Aḥa the Elder said to Rav Ashi the mishna is also precise, as it teaches: Until the blood of the daily offering is sprinkled, and does not teach: Until he slaughters and sprinkles the blood. Conclude from
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if one slaughtered it (an animal) for the continual offering at first. Rav Acha the Elder said to Rav Ashi: The Mishnah also specifically teaches, "until the blood is sprinkled (continual offering)," and it does not teach "until it is slaughtered and the blood is sprinkled." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: ובכולן כהנים רשאין כו': מאי טעמא אמר קרא (במדבר יח, ח) למשחה לגדולה כדרך שהמלכים אוכלין:
human_translation: And with regard to all of the priests are permitted What is the reason verse states, lemoshḥa ” For greatness, in manner that kings eat
llm_translation: And in all of them, priests are permitted, etc. What is the reason? The verse says (Numbers 18:8), "For an anointing for greatness, as the way kings eat."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אמר רבי שמעון אם ראית שמן שהוא מתחלק בעזרה אין צריך לשאול מהו אלא מותר רקיקי מנחות ישראל ולוג שמן של מצורע
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: If you saw oil that is being distributed in the Temple courtyard do not need to ask what it is. Rather, left over of the wafers of the meal offerings of Israelites or log of oil of a leper
llm_translation: Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon said, "If you see oil that is being divided in the Temple courtyard, there is no need to ask what it is, rather it is permitted. This applies to the thin cakes of the meal-offerings of Israel and a log of oil of the leper."

hebrew_text: אם ראית שמן שהוא ניתן על גבי האישים אין צריך לשאול מהו אלא מותר רקיקי מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח שאין מתנדבין שמן רבי טרפון אומר מתנדבין שמן:
human_translation: If you saw oil that is placed on the flames do not need to ask what it is. Rather, left over of the wafers of the meal offering of priests, or the meal offering of the anointed priest, as one may not contribute oil Rabbi Tarfon says: One may contribute oil
llm_translation: If you see oil that is placed on the wicks, there is no need to ask what it is, rather it is permitted. The thin cakes of the meal offering of the priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest, for which oil is not donated. Rabbi Tarfon says oil is donated.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר שמואל לדברי ר"ט המתנדב שמן קומצו ושיריו נאכלין מאי טעמא אמר קרא קרבן מנחה מלמד שמתנדבין שמן וכי מנחה מה מנחה קומצה ושיריה נאכלין אף שמן קומצו ושיריו נאכלין
human_translation: Shmuel says: According to the statement of Rabbi Tarfon one who contributes oil, removes a handful of and its remainder is eaten What is the reason verse states: a meal offering [ korban minḥa ]” teaches that one may contribute oil, and like a meal offering: Just as a meal offering removes a handful and its remainder is eaten, so too oil, removes a handful and its remainder is eaten.
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said in the words of Rabbi Tarfon: "One who volunteers oil, its remnants and its leavings are eaten." What is the reason? It is said in a verse, 'a meal offering,' which teaches that those who volunteer oil. And just as a meal offering, its remnants and its leavings are eaten, so too, its remnants and its leavings are eaten.

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אף אנן נמי תנינא א"ר שמעון אם ראית שמן שמתחלק בעזרה אי אתה צריך לשאול מהו אלא מותר רקיקי מנחות ישראל ולוג שמן של מצורע שאין מתנדבין מכלל דמ"ד מתנדבין מתחלק
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said we learn as well: Rabbi Shimon said: If you saw oil that is being distributed in the Temple courtyard, you do not need to ask what it is; rather, left over of the wafers of the meal offerings of Israelites, or log of oil of a leper, as one does not contribute by inference that the one who says one may contribute distributed
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: We also learned similarly. Rabbi Shimon said: If you see oil that is being divided in the Temple courtyard, you do not need to inquire what it is, rather it is permitted. This applies only to the thin cakes of the meal offerings of Israel and a log of oil of a leper, as they are not voluntarily offered. From the general principle that voluntary offerings are divided.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי אימא סיפא אם ראית שמן שניתן על גבי אישים אי אתה צריך לשאול מהו אלא מותר רקיקי מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח שאין מתנדבין שמן מכלל דלמ"ד מתנדב כולן לאישים לאביי קשיא רישא לרבי זירא קשיא סיפא
human_translation: Abaye said to Say the last clause If you saw oil that is placed on the flames you do not need to ask what it is; rather, left over of the wafers of the meal offering of priests or the meal offering of the anointed priest, as one does not contribute oil by inference that according to the one who says one may contribute entirety in the flames For Abaye the first clause difficult, for Rabbi Zeira the last clause difficult.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Say the latter part: If you see oil that was placed on top of logs, you do not need to ask what it is, rather it is permitted. Only the thin cakes of the meal-offering of the priests and the meal-offering of the anointed priest, as voluntary offerings, for perhaps one might think that all are voluntary offerings for logs. This is difficult for Abbaye at the beginning, and difficult for Rabbi Zeira at the end.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבי זירא רישא בשירים סיפא בקומץ אלא לאביי קשיא תנא רישא אטו סיפא
human_translation: Granted, to Rabbi Zeira, the first clause to remainder the last clause to handful But to Abaye, a difficulty. taught the first clause due to the last clause.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Zeira, the beginning is in Shir Hashirim, the end is in the Kometz. But according to Abaye, it is difficult: the Tanna teaches the beginning, but not the end.

hebrew_text: בשלמא סיפא תני משום רישא אלא רישא משום סיפא מי תני אין אמרי במערבא תנא רישא משום סיפא:
human_translation: Granted, teach the last clause due to the first clause, But would teach the first clause due to the last clause? Yes; they say in the West, taught the first clause due to the last clause.
llm_translation: In the name of the Lord, the end teaches because of the beginning. But the beginning because of the end, who teaches? Do they not say in the West, the beginning teaches because of the end.

hebrew_text: ת"ש יין כדברי ר"ע לספלים שמן כדברי רבי טרפון לאישים מאי לאו מדיין כולו לספלים שמן כולו לאישים מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא
human_translation: Come hear wine, according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva into the basins oil, according to the statement of Rabbi Tarfon in the flames What, is it not from that wine its entirety into the basins oil its entirety in the flames Are the cases comparable? This as it is and that as it is,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Wine, according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, for libations; oil, according to the words of Rabbi Tarfon, for anointing. What, is it not the case that wine is entirely for libations, and oil entirely for anointing? This is as it was stated, and this is as it was stated.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא כתנאי שמן לא יפחות מלוג רבי אומר שלשת לוגין במאי קמיפלגי אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרב פפא דון מינה ומינה דון מינה ואוקי באתרה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: like tanna’im , oil not less than a log . Rabbi says: Three log . With regard to what do disagree? The Sages said this before Rav Pappa: Infer from it and from it; Infer from it but interpret to its place,
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: According to the first Tanna, the minimum amount of oil is a log. Rabbi says: Three logs. What are they arguing about? The Rabbis said before Rav Pappa: One evaluates each one separately, and one evaluates both together.

hebrew_text: דרבנן סברי מה מנחה מתנדבין אף שמן מתנדבין [ומינה מה מנחה לוג שמן אף כאן לוג שמן ומה מנחה קומצה ושיריה נאכלין אף שמן קומצו ושיריו נאכלין
human_translation: is between them, as the Rabbis hold Just as a meal offering is contributed, so too, oil is contributed, And from Just as a meal offering a log of oil, so too here, a log of oil. And just as a meal offering removes a handful and its remainder is eaten, so too oil, removes a handful and its remainder is eaten.
llm_translation: The Sages hold: Just as with the Minchah offering, the oil is voluntary, so too here the oil is voluntary. And just as with the Minchah offering, a Log of oil is required, so too here a Log of oil is required. And just as with the Minchah offering, its handful and its frankincense are eaten, so too here its handful and its frankincense are eaten.

hebrew_text: ואידך ממנחה מה מנחה מתנדבין אף שמן מתנדבין ואוקי באתרה] כנסכים מה נסכים שלשת לוגין [אף שמן שלש לוגין ומה נסכים כולן לספלין] אף שמן כולן לאישים
human_translation: And the other, from a meal offering: Just as a meal offering is contributed, so too, oil is contributed. But interpret to its place, like libations, Just as libations three log , so too, oil three log ; and just as libations their entirety into the basins, so too, oil its entirety in the flames
llm_translation: And the other opinion from the Mincha offering - what is the law regarding a voluntary Mincha offering? Just as with oil in voluntary offerings, so too with it in the Mincha offering. And with regards to libations - what is the law regarding libations? Three log measurements. Just as with libations of three logs, so too with oil of three logs. And regarding all types of libations that are poured into the libation vessels, so too with oil poured into the vessels.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב פפא לאביי אי ממנחה מייתי לה [רבי] דכ"ע דון מינה ומינה אלא רבי מאזרח גמר לה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If Rabbi cited from meal offering as everyone Infer from it and from it. Rather, Rabbi derives from homeborn
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abaye: If one brings it from the Minchah offering, Rabbi judges it according to its kind and its kind. Rather, Rabbi establishes it based on the citizen.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב הונא בריה דרב נתן לרב פפא מי מצית אמרת הכי והתניא קרבן מנחה מלמד שמתנדבין שמן וכמה שלשה לוגין ומאן שמעת ליה דאמר שלשה לוגין רבי היא וקא מייתי לה מקרבן א"ל  אי תניא תניא
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Pappa: How can you say that, But isn’t it taught a meal offering [ korban minḥa ]” teaches that one may contribute oil? And how much Three log . And whom did you hear who says three log ? This is Rabbi and cites from korban , said to him: If is taught, it is taught;
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Nathan, said to Rav Pappa, "Did you find a source for this statement?" And it was taught in a Baraita: The meal-offering teaches that they bring oil as a voluntary offering, and how much oil? Three log. And who did you hear say that three log is the amount? It is Rabbi, and he brings it from the offering." He said to him, "If it is taught in a Baraita, it is taught."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל המתנדב יין מביא ומזלפו על גבי האישים מ"ט אמר קרא (במדבר טו, י) ויין תקריב לנסך חצי ההין אשה ריח ניחוח לה' והא קא מכבי כיבוי במקצת לא שמיה כיבוי
human_translation: Shmuel says: One who contributes wine brings and sprinkles it on the flames What is the reason The verse states: “And you shall present for the libation half a hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a pleasing aroma to the Lord” But he extinguishes Extinguishing in a partial is not called extinguishing;
llm_translation: Said Samuel: "One who volunteers wine brings and pours it on the logs." What is the reason? Scripture says (Numbers 15:10), "And wine you shall offer for the drink offering, a half hin, an offering made by fire, a sweet aroma to the Lord." But this is extinguishing a fire in part, it is not called extinguishing.

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה המוריד גחלת מעל גבי המזבח וכיבה חייב דליכא אלא האי איבעית אימא כיבוי דמצוה שאני
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Naḥman say Rabba bar Avuh says: One who takes down a coal from upon the altar and extinguishes it is liable where there is only this If you wish, say extinguishing of a mitzva, is different,
llm_translation: I am not, but didn't Rav Nachman say in the name of Rabba bar Avuhah: One who removes a coal from on top of the altar and extinguishes it is liable? But there is none other than this: If you wish, say it is different because it is the extinguishing of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתנא ר"א בן יעקב כלפי שנתנה תורה לתרום יכול יכבה ויתרום אמרת לא יכבה שאני התם אפשר דיתיב ונטר
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov teaches: Since the Torah gave to remove might extinguish and remove you say: He shall not extinguish, is different there, possible to sit and wait
llm_translation: Come and hear: as it was taught by Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, regarding the case where the Torah was given to contribute, one might have thought that one could extinguish and contribute. You said: one may not extinguish. This is different there, for it is possible that one may sit and guard.

hebrew_text: ת"ש יין כדברי ר"ע לספלים שמן כדברי רבי טרפון לאישים ועוד תניא יין נסך לספלים או אינו אלא לאישים אמרת לא יכבה
human_translation: Come hear wine, according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva into the basins oil, according to the statement of Rabbi Tarfon onto the flames And is furthermore taught wine libation into the basins. Or not rather, onto the flames. you say: He shall not extinguish.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Wine, according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, for libations; oil, according to the words of Rabbi Tarfon, for men. Furthermore, it was taught: Wine for libations, is it for libations or only for men? You said: It shall not be extinguished.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא רבי יהודה הא ר"ש למימרא דשמואל כר"ש סבירא ליה והאמר שמואל מכבין גחלת של מתכת ברה"ר בשביל שלא יזוקו בה רבים
human_translation: not difficult, that Rabbi Yehuda, this Rabbi Shimon, Is this to say that Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon? But doesn’t Shmuel say: One may extinguish a piece of white-hot metal in a public thoroughfare so that the masses will not be injured by it;
llm_translation: There is no difficulty: this is Rabbi Yehuda, and this is Rabbi Shimon. To say that Shmuel holds like Rabbi Shimon, and Shmuel said: "One extinguishes a metal coal in a public domain so that many people will not be harmed by it."

hebrew_text: אבל לא גחלת של עץ ואי ס"ד כר"ש ס"ל אפילו גחלת של עץ נמי
human_translation: but not a wood coal, And if it enters your mind holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, even a wood coal.
llm_translation: But not a coal of wood. And if you will say according to Rabbi Shimon, he holds even a coal of wood also.

hebrew_text: בדבר שאין מתכוין סבר לה כר"ש במלאכה שאינה צריכה לגופה סבר לה כרבי יהודה
human_translation: with regard to an unintentional act, holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. with regard to labor not necessary for its own sake, he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: In a matter where one does not intend, he holds like Rabbi Shimon in a labor that is not needed for its own sake, he holds like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא נסכים שנטמאו עושה להן מערכה בפני עצמן ושורפן משום שנאמר (ויקרא ו, כג) בקודש באש תשרף תניא נמי הכי הדם והשמן והמנחות והנסכים שנטמאו עושה להן מערכה בפני עצמן ושורפן
human_translation: Rav Huna says: libations that became ritually impure, one prepares for them an arrangement by themselves and burns them due to that it is stated “In the sacred place…it shall be burned with fire” This is also taught the blood, the oil, the meal offerings, and the libations that became ritually impure, one prepares for them an arrangement by themselves and burns them
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: libations that became impure, one makes for them an arrangement by themselves and burns them, as it is stated (Leviticus 6:23), "In a holy place it shall be burned in fire." It was also taught likewise: the blood, the fat, the meal offerings, and the libations that became impure, one makes for them an arrangement by themselves and burns them.

hebrew_text: א"ל שמואל לרב חנא בגדתאה אייתי לי בי עשרה ואימא לך קמייהו נסכים שנטמאו עושה להן מערכה בפני עצמן ושורפן:
human_translation: Shmuel said to Rav Ḥana of Baghdad: Bring me an assembly of ten and I will tell you in their presence libations that became ritually impure, one prepares for them an arrangement by themselves and burns them
llm_translation: Samuel said to Rav Hana in Bagdad: "Bring me ten and say before them, 'Offerings that became impure, one should arrange for them separately and burn them.'"

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל התדיר
llm_translation: We will return to you, all who are frequent.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ דם חטאת שנתז על הבגד הרי זה טעון כיבוס אע"פ שאין הכתוב מדבר אלא בנאכלות שנאמר (ויקרא ו, יט) במקום קדוש תאכל אחד הנאכלות ואחד הפנימיות טעונות כיבוס שנאמר תורת החטאת תורה אחת לכל החטאות
human_translation: the blood of a sin offering that was sprayed on a garment, that requires laundering, Although the verse is speaking only of that are eaten as it is stated: “In a sacred place shall it be eaten” both that are eaten and the inner require laundering. As it is stated the law of the sin offering” one law for all the sin offerings.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The blood of a sin-offering that splattered onto a garment - this requires laundering, even though the verse only speaks about edible items, as it is stated (Leviticus 6:19), "In a holy place shall you eat." Both the edible items and the internal parts require laundering, as it is stated, "The teaching of the sin-offering is one teaching for all sin-offerings."

hebrew_text: חטאת פסולה אין דמה טעון כיבוס בין שהיתה לה שעת הכושר ובין שלא היתה לה שעת הכושר איזו היא שהיתה לה שעת הכושר שלנה ושנטמאה ושיצאת ואיזו היא שלא היתה לה שעת הכושר שנשחטה חוץ לזמנה וחוץ למקומה ושקיבלו פסולין (וזרקו) את דמה:
human_translation: a disqualified sin offering, its blood does not require laundering whether had a period of fitness or whether it did not have a period of fitness. Which is that had a period of fitness? that was left overnight or that became ritually impure; or that emerged Which is that did not have a period of fitness? that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area; or collected disqualified and sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: Sin-offering invalid not blood requires washing whether was to her time of validity and whether not was to her time of validity which is that was to her time of validity slept and became impure and left and which is that not was to her time of validity slaughtered outside of its time and outside of its place and received invalid (and they) threw its blood.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ דם חטאת (שמתה) כו' ואי תורה אחת לכל חטאות אפילו חטאת העוף נמי אלמה תניא יכול תהא דם חטאת העוף טעון כיבוס ת"ל (ויקרא ו, יח) זאת
human_translation: the blood of a sin offering that was sprayed And if one law for all sin offerings, even a bird sin offering also why is it taught might blood of a bird sin offering requires laundering. the verse states: “This
llm_translation: Gemara: The blood of the sin offering (that died) etc. And if one Torah for all sins even the sin offering of a bird also why it was taught? One might have thought that the blood of the sin offering of a bird requires washing. It is taught: Scripture says (Leviticus 6:18) "This."

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל משום בר קפרא אמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יח) תשחט בנשחטות הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of bar Kappara: The verse states: shall be slaughtered” The verse is speaking of that are slaughtered
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said in the name of Bar Kappara said the verse (Leviticus 6:18) states, "It shall be slaughtered with the slaughtered ones," the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: ואימא בנאכלות הכתוב מדבר כדכתיב במקום קדוש תאכל אבל פנימיות לא רבי רחמנא תורת
human_translation: And I say the verse is speaking of that are eaten, as it is written: “In a sacred place shall it be eaten” but internal not The Merciful One amplifies the law of
llm_translation: And say, in the consumed the Scripture speaks, as it is written, "In a holy place you shall eat." But the inner parts, no. Rabbi, the Merciful, the Torah.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אפילו חטאת העוף נמי מיעט רחמנא זאת
human_translation: If so, even the bird sin offering The Merciful One restricts “This
llm_translation: If so, even the sin offering of a bird also, "the Merciful One has diminished this."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית מסתברא דחטאת [בהמה] פנימיות ה"ל לרבויי שכן בהמה שחיטת צפון וקבלת כלי
human_translation: And what did you see It stands to reason that internal animal sin offerings should have been included as animal slaughter on the north and collection a vessel;
