llm_translation: And what did you see that it is logical that the sin offering of domestic animals is more stringent? For indeed, with regard to domestic animals, the slaughtering is in the north and the receiving of the vessel.

hebrew_text: וקרן ואצבע וחודה ואישים
human_translation: and corner and finger; and the edge of and flames

And they dispute in this matter because Rabbi Akiva holds that it is considered as if it is resting, and the Rabbis hold that it is not considered as if it is resting.

hebrew_text: ואיתיביה אביי מודה רבי עקיבא בהזאה שהעבירה על כלי חרס טמא על גבי משכב ומושב טמא שהיא טהורה שאין לך דבר שמטמא למעלה כלמטה אלא כזית מן המת ושאר כל המאהילין לאיתויי אבן המנוגעת

hebrew_text: חטאת פסולה כו': ת"ר מדמה מדם כשירה ולא מדם פסולה ר"ע אומר היתה לה שעת הכושר ונפסלה דמה טעון כיבוס לא היתה לה שעת הכושר ונפסלה אין דמה טעון כיבוס
human_translation: a disqualified sin offering, The Sages taught of its blood of the blood of a fit but not of the blood of a disqualified Rabbi Akiva says: had a period of fitness and was disqualified, its blood requires laundering. did not have a period of fitness and was disqualified, its blood does not require laundering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A disqualified sin-offering, etc.: The Sages taught: "One compares the blood from valid blood, and not from disqualified blood." Rabbi Akiva says: "If it had a moment of validity and then became disqualified, its blood requires sprinkling. If it did not have a moment of validity and then became disqualified, its blood does not require sprinkling."

hebrew_text: ור"ש אומר אחד זה ואחד זה אין דמה טעון כיבוס מאי טעמא דרבי שמעון כתיב אותה וכתיב מדמה חד להיכא דהיתה לו שעת הכושר
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon says: both this and that its blood does not require laundering. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? It is written it” And it is written “Of its blood” one for where had a period of fitness,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon says: "One this and one that, they do not resemble each other. What is the reason? Because it is written 'it' and it is written 'from the blood of one,' to where he had a moment of fitness."

hebrew_text: ורבי עקיבא אותה פרט לתרומה ור"ש לטעמיה דאמר קדשים קלים אין טעונין מריקה ושטיפה וכ"ש תרומה:
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva “it” excludes teruma , And Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he says: Offerings of lesser sanctity do not require scouring and rinsing and all the more so teruma
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva: that applies specifically to Terumah, and Rabbi Shimon holds according to his reasoning, for he said: light holy items do not require rinsing and washing, all the more so Terumah.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ניתז מן הצואר על הבגד אינו טעון כיבוס מן הקרן ומן היסוד אינו טעון כיבוס נשפך על הרצפה ואספו אין טעון כיבוס אין טעון כיבוס אלא דם שנתקבל בכלי וראוי להזאה:
human_translation: sprayed from the neck onto a garment, does not require laundering. from the corner or from the base does not require laundering, spilled onto the floor and collected does not require laundering. only blood that was received in vessel and is fit for sprinkling requires laundering.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If blood splattered onto a garment from the neck, it does not require rinsing. If it splattered from the horn or the foundation, it does not require rinsing. If it spilled onto the floor and was gathered, it does not require rinsing. It only requires rinsing if the blood was received in a vessel and is fit for sprinkling.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר יכול ניתז מן הצואר על הבגד יהא טעון כיבוס ת"ל אשר יזה לא אמרתי לך אלא בראוי להזאה תניא אידך יכול ניתז מן הקרן ומן היסוד יהא טעון כיבוס ת"ל אשר יזה פרט לזה שכבר הוזה:
human_translation: The Sages taught might sprayed from the neck onto a garment, should require laundering. the verse states: which it shall be sprinkled” I told you only with regard to fit for sprinkling, It is taught another might sprayed from the corner or from the base should require laundering. the verse states: which it shall be sprinkled,” excluding that that was already sprinkled.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: One might have thought that if one spits from the neck onto a garment, it should require rinsing. The Torah teaches, "which he spits," indicating that I only said this regarding what is fit for spitting. It was taught in another Baraita: One might have thought that if one spits from the horn or from the foundation, it should require rinsing. The Torah teaches, "which he spits," excluding this, as it has already been spitten upon.

llm_translation: Rava said: It was taught in a Baraita: One may immerse and not absorb blood until there is a requisite amount of blood for immersion, initially from the blood, from the blood regarding this matter.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך למיכתב בדם דאי כתב רחמנא וטבל ה"א אע"פ דליכא שיעור טבילה מעיקרו כתב [רחמנא] בדם
human_translation: And it was necessary to write “In the blood,” As, had the Merciful One written “And shall dip,” I would say even though there was not a measure dipping from the beginning, the Merciful One writes: “In the blood,”
llm_translation: And it was necessary to write with blood, for if the Merciful One wrote and dipped the quill in water, even though there is no prescribed measure for immersion from the outset, the Merciful One wrote with blood.

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא בדם ה"א אפילו מספג כתב רחמנא וטבל
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “In the blood,” I would say even wipes the Merciful One writes: “And shall dip,”
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One wrote with blood, "He," even if one merely touches it, the Merciful One wrote and immersed.

hebrew_text: מן הדם שבענין למעוטי מאי אמר רבא למעוטי שיריים שבאצבע מסייע לרבי אלעזר דאר"א שיריים שבאצבע פסולין
human_translation: of the blood that is in matter, to exclude what Rava said: to exclude the remainder that is on the finger supports of Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar says: The remainder that is on the finger unfit
llm_translation: From the blood - in the matter of what is it coming to exclude? What did Rava say? Coming to exclude the fingernails. This supports Rabbi Elazar the son of Rabbi Yosei's opinion, for fingernails are invalid.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבין בר רב אדא לרב אמר תלמידך אמר רב עמרם תנינא היה מזה וניתזה הזאה מידו עד שלא הזה טעון כיבוס משהזה אין טעון כיבוס
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda said to Rav, Your student says Rav Amram says: We learn was sprinkling and a sprinkle sprayed from his hand before he sprinkled, requires laundering, once he has sprinkled, does not require laundering.
llm_translation: He said to him, Ravin bar Rav Adda to Rav, said your student Rav Amram, we learned: If it was sprinkled and then became sprinkled, it is in need of rinsing; if it was not sprinkled, it is not in need of rinsing.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו ה"ק עד שלא גמר מלהזות טעון כיבוס משגמר להזות אין טעון כיבוס לא ה"ק עד שלא יצתה הזאה מידו טעון כיבוס משיצתה הזאה מידו אין טעון כיבוס
human_translation: What, is it not this is saying: before concluded sprinkling, requires laundering, once has concluded sprinkling, it does not require laundering? No, this is saying: before sprinkling has left his hand, it requires laundering, once sprinkling has left his hand, does not require laundering
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "no"? Until one has not finished spitting, rinsing is required. Once one has finished spitting, rinsing is not required. What is the meaning of "no"? Until the saliva has not left one's hand, rinsing is required. Once the saliva has left one's hand, rinsing is not required.

hebrew_text: איתיביה אביי גמר מלהזות מקנח ידו בגופה של פרה גמר אין לא גמר לא א"ל גמר מקנח ידו בגופה של פרה לא גמר מקנח אצבעו
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to concluded sprinkling he wipes his hand on the body of heifer. concluded yes, did not conclude not said to him: concluded he wipes his hand on the body of the heifer; has not concluded he wipes his finger
llm_translation: Abaye raised an objection: If one completes the sprinkling by placing his hand on the body of the cow, he has completed it; if he did not complete it, he has not completed it. He said to him: If one completes the sprinkling by placing his hand on the body of the cow, he has not completed it; he completes it by placing his finger.

hebrew_text: בשלמא גמר מקנח ידו בגופה של פרה שנאמר (במדבר יט, ה) ושרף את הפרה לעיניו אלא אצבעו במאי מקנח אמר אביי בשפת מזרק כדכתיב (עזרא א, י) כפורי זהב:
human_translation: Granted, concluded he wipes his hand on the body of heifer, as it is stated: “And the heifer shall be burned in his sight; But on what does he wipe his finger Abaye said: on the lip of bowl as it is written: “Atoning bowls [ keforei ] of gold”
llm_translation: In the case of Gamar who finishes anointing his hand on the body of the cow, as it is stated (Numbers 19:5) "And he shall burn the cow before his eyes," but his finger, with what does he anoint it? Abaye said: With the lip of the sprinkler, as it is written (Ezra 1:10) "golden bowls."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ניתז על העור עד שלא הופשט אינו טעון כיבוס משהופשט טעון כיבוס דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: sprayed onto the hide before it was flayed does not require laundering, after it was flayed, it requires laundering; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If it splattered on the skin before it spread out, it does not require washing. Once it has spread out, it requires washing. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר אף משהופשט אינו טעון כיבוס אלא מקום הדם ודבר שהוא ראוי לקבל טומאה וראוי לכיבוס
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even after it was flayed, it does not require laundering only place the blood and an item that is fit to become ritually impure, and fit for laundering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even when it is spread out, it does not require rinsing, except for the place of the blood and a matter that is fit to receive impurity and fit for rinsing.

hebrew_text: אחד הבגד ואחד השק ואחד העור טעונין כיבוס והכיבוס במקום קדוש ושבירת כלי חרס במקום קדוש ומריקה ושטיפה בכלי נחושת במקום קדוש זה חומר בחטאת מקדשי קדשים:
human_translation: the garment and the sackcloth, and the hide, all require laundering. And the laundering in a sacred place, and the breaking of an earthenware vessel in a sacred place, and scouring and rinsing of a copper vessel in a sacred place. this a stringency to a sin offering than offerings of the most sacred order.
llm_translation: One garment and one sackcloth and one leather require rinsing, and the rinsing is in a holy place, and the breaking of an earthenware vessel is in a holy place, and wringing and rinsing in a copper vessel is in a holy place. This is a stringency in the sin offering of the most holy things.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנהני מילי דת"ר (ויקרא ו, כ) בגד אין לי אלא בגד מנין לרבות עור משהופשט ת"ל (ויקרא ו, כ) אשר יזה עליה תכבס
human_translation: from where are these matters, as the Sages taught a garment” I have only a garment; from where include hide after it was flayed? The verse states: “You shall launder that on which it shall be sprinkled,”
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive the matters of the Sages? (Leviticus 6:20) "A garment" - I only have a garment. How do we derive to include skin that is spread out? The verse teaches (Leviticus 6:20) "Upon which the discharge has come." It shall be laundered.

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה עור עד שלא הופשט תלמוד לומר בגד מה בגד הראוי לקבל טומאה אף כל הראוי לקבל טומאה דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: might that I include a hide before it was flayed. the verse states: “Garment.” just as garment fit to become ritually impure so too any that fit to become ritually impure the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: I might say, one may increase the size of a hide until the Talmud has not been spread out, as it is stated, "garment" - just as a garment that is fit to receive impurity, so too, anything that is fit to receive impurity. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר בגד אין לי אלא בגד מנין לרבות שק
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: “Garment,” I have only a garment; from where include sackcloth
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: "A garment, I have only a garment. How do we derive to include a sack?"

hebrew_text: וכל מיני בגדים תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ו, כ) אשר עליה תכבס יכול שאני מרבה עור משהופשט ת"ל בגד מה בגד דבר המקבל טומאה אף כל דבר המקבל טומאה
human_translation: and all types of garments The verse states: “You shall launder that on which might that I include hide after it was flayed. verse states: “Garment,” just as a garment is an item that is susceptible to ritual impurity so too any item that is susceptible to impurity
llm_translation: "And all kinds of garments, Scripture states (Leviticus 6:20), 'On which the stain is washed,' could I say that I increase the law from a hide that is spread out? Therefore, it teaches 'garment' - just as a garment is something that can become ritually impure, so too, anything that can become ritually impure."

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר אביי מטלית פחותה משלש איכא בינייהו מאן דאמר ראוי הא נמי ראוי דאי בעי חשיב עליה מ"ד דבר המקבל טומאה הא מיהא לאו בת קבולי טומאה היא
human_translation: What between Abaye said: A patch less than three between the one who says fit this is also fit as if wants, he can intend it the one who says an object susceptible to impurity this in any event, is not susceptible to impurity
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: A cloth less than three handbreadths has a difference between them. Whoever says it is fitting, this is also fitting, for if one wants to consider it as a "vessel that can become impure," it is not a vessel that can become impure.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר בגד שחישב עליה לצורה איכא בינייהו מ"ד ראוי הא נמי ראוי דאי בעי מבטיל ליה למחשבתיה מ"ד דבר המקבל טומאה השתא מיהא לאו בת קבולי טומאה היא
human_translation: Rava said: A garment upon which intended to an image between the one who says fit this is also fit as if wants he can void his intention the one who says an item susceptible to impurity now, at least, is not susceptible to impurity
llm_translation: Rava said: A garment upon which one intended a specific form - there is a distinction between them. Some say: If it is fitting, then it is fitting. And also, it is fitting, for if he wishes, he can nullify it from his intention. Some say: An object that can become impure - now, it is not an object that can become impure.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר עוצבא דחשיב עלה לקצעה איכא בינייהו מ"ד ראוי הא נמי ראויה מאן דאמר דבר המקבל טומאה הא לאו מקבלה טומאה עד דמקצע לה והתניא רבי שמעון בן מנסיא אומר עוצבא שחשב עליה לקצעה טהורה עד שיקציענה:
human_translation: Rava said: An unfinished hide [ utzeva ] that one intended to trim between the one who says fit this is also fit the one who says an item susceptible to impurity this is not susceptible to impurity until he trims it. it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: An unfinished hide that intended to trim is ritually pure until he trims it.
llm_translation: Rava said: The sadness of a leaf to cut it. There is a difference between them - one says it is fitting, this one also is fitting. Who says a thing that can receive impurity, this one does not receive impurity until he cuts it. And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: The sadness that he intended to cut it is pure until he cuts it.

hebrew_text: אין טעון כיבוס כו': מנה"מ דת"ר יכול נתז על מקצת בגד יהא כל הבגד טעון כיבוס ת"ל (ויקרא ו, כ) אשר יזה לא אמרתי לך אלא מקום דם בלבד:
human_translation: requires laundering From where are these matters as the Sages taught: might sprayed on part of a garment, the entire garment should require laundering. the verse states: which it shall be sprinkled.” I told you only the place blood
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "There is no need for rinsing, etc." What is the meaning of this? The Rabbis taught: One might have thought that if blood splattered on some of the garment, the entire garment would require rinsing. The Torah teaches (Leviticus 6:20), 'Wherein the blood is sprinkled,' indicating only in the place of blood.

hebrew_text: דבר שהוא ראוי לקבל טומאה [וכו']: סתמא כרבי יהודה
human_translation: an item that is fit to become ritually impure, the unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: A matter that is fit to receive impurity etc.: presumably according to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ראוי לכיבוס למעוטי כלי דבר גרידה הוא:
human_translation: fit for laundering to exclude a vessel as it is suitable for scraping
llm_translation: Fit for laundering to exclude vessels of scraping it is.

hebrew_text: אחד הבגד ואחד השק כו': למימרא דעור בר כיבוס הוא ורמינהו היתה עליו לשלשת מקנחה בסמרטוט היתה (על). של עור נותן עליה מים עד שתכלה
human_translation: the garment and the sackcloth, that is to say that a hide, is suitable for laundering. And raises a contradiction there were bird droppings [ lishleshet ] on wipes it with a rag, it was on of leather, he applies water to it until dissolves.
llm_translation: One garment and one sack, etc.: To say that it is a skin of tanning and we raise a contradiction: If it was upon him for three days, he anoints it with oil. For a skin, he puts water on it until it is finished.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לא קשיא הא רבנן הא אחרים דתניא הבגד והשק מכבסו הכלי והעור מגררו אחרים אומרים הבגד והשק והעור מכבסו והכלי מגררו
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. That the Rabbis, this others. As it is taught a garment or sackcloth, he launders it; vessel or leather, he scrapes it Others say: a garment, or sackcloth, or leather, he launders it; but a vessel, he scrapes it
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It is not difficult. This is the opinion of the Rabbis, and that is the opinion of others, as it was taught: The garment and the sack, one washes; the vessel and the skin, one scrapes. Others say: The garment and the sack and the skin, one washes; and the vessel, one scrapes.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דאמר רב חייא בר אשי זימנין סגיאין הוה קאימנא קמיה דרב ושכשיכי ליה מסאניה במיא כמאן כרבנן
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said: Many times I would stand before Rav and place water on his shoes, In accordance with whose in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This is like what Rav Chiya bar Ashi said: "Many times I was standing before Rav, and I would pour him water in a cup like a servant." According to whom is this like? According to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ומי איכא למאן דאמר עור לאו בר כיבוס הוא והכתיב (ויקרא יג, נח) והבגד או השתי או הערב או כל כלי העור אשר תכבס אלא אמר רבא קרא ומתניתין ברכין כי פליגי בקשין
human_translation: Rava said: And is there anyone who says leather is not suitable for laundering? But isn’t it written “And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or any article of leather that you shall wash” Rather, Rava said: The verse and the mishna with regard to soft when disagree, with regard to hard
llm_translation: Rava said: Is there anyone who says that leather is not considered like wool? But it is written (Leviticus 13:58): "And the garment, or the warp, or the woof, or any article of leather which you wash." Rather, Rava said: The verse and the Mishnah disagree regarding difficult cases.

hebrew_text: והאמר רב חייא זימנין סגיאין הוה קאימנא קמיה דרב ושכשיכי ליה מסאניה במיא בקשין וכרבנן
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Ḥiyya say: Many times I would stand before Rav and place water on his shoes, of hard and in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: And Rav Chiya said: "Many times I was standing before Rav, and I would pour water for him to wash his hands, and the Rabbanan were present."

hebrew_text: הדר אמר רבא לאו מילתא היא דאמרי ניקו נימא ליה לקרא דכי כתיבן ברכין כתיבן מי לא עסקינן בכלי אכסלגיא הבאים ממדינת הים וקאמר רחמנא ניבעי כיבוס
human_translation: Rava then said: which I said, is not correct. Shall we stand say of the verse that when are written, of soft writes? Are we not dealing with articles of hard leather [ aksilgiyya ] that come from overseas, and the Merciful One says they require laundering?
llm_translation: Rava said: It is not a matter that they say "let us say to the verse, for when they are written in the blessings, are we not dealing with vessels of Akhsalgia that come from the sea, and the Merciful One says that immersion is required.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא צרעת כיון דמגופיה קא פרחה מחלחלא ליה ומשוי לה רך אמר רבא אי קשיא לי הא קשיא לי
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: leprosy, since sprouts from itself, it loosens it and renders it soft Rava said: if a difficulty for me, this a difficulty for me:
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "Regarding tzara'at, once it has spread on its own, it becomes a sign for him, and it is considered soft for him." Rava said: "If this is difficult for me, that is difficult for me."

hebrew_text: כרים וכסתות דרכין נינהו ותנן היתה של עור נותן עליה מים עד שתכלה אלא אמר רבא כל כיבוס דלית ליה כיסכוס לא שמיה כיבוס
human_translation: Cushions and blankets that are soft and we learned was of leather, he applies water to it until dissolves, Rather, Rava said: any laundering that does not include rubbing, is not considered laundering.
llm_translation: "Rams and hides are similar in their ways. And we learned in a Mishnah: If it was a leather skin, one may pour water on it until it is completed. Rather, Rava said: Any washing that does not have a receptacle is not called washing."

hebrew_text: והא דאמר רב חייא בר אשי זימנין סגיאין הוה קאימנא קמיה דרב ושכשיכי ליה מסאניה במיא שכשוך אין אבל כבוס לא אי ברכין וכדברי הכל אי בקשין וכאחרים
human_translation: And that that Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said: Many times I would stand before Rav and place water on his shoes, placing yes, but laundering, not If of soft all agree if of hard accords with the others,
llm_translation: And this that Rav Chiya bar Ashi said, "Many times I was standing before Rav, and I would pour for him a cup of water with sediment. If it was murky, he would not bless, but if it was clear, according to everyone's opinion, he would bless like others."

hebrew_text: אי הכי בגד נמי בגד שרייתו זהו כיבוסו
human_translation: If that is so, garment as well, a garment, its soaking is its laundering,
llm_translation: If so, also a garment, also a garment, its rinsing, this is its washing.

hebrew_text: [רבא לטעמיה דאמר רבא זרק סודר למים חייב זרק פשתן למים חייב בשלמא סודר עביד כיבוס] אלא זרע פשתן מ"ט
human_translation: Rava to his reasoning; as Rava says: cast a cloth into water liable one cast flax into water, liable. Granted, a cloth performs laundering; but flaxseed, what is the reason
llm_translation: Rava according to his reasoning said, Rava said: If one throws a cloth into live water, he is liable. If one throws flax into live water, he is liable. Granted, a cloth undergoes laundering. Rather, why does flax cause liability?

hebrew_text: וכ"ת משום דמקדח אי הכי חיטי ושערי נמי הנך אית להו רירי א"ה שלחים נמי התם קעביד לישה
human_translation: And if you would say because it sprouts if so, wheat and barley, also these have discharges If so, hides, also There, effects kneading,
llm_translation: And as it was stated because he grinds, if so, wheat and barley also have chaff. There, too, they make dough for baking.

hebrew_text: דרש רבא מותר לכבס מנעל בשבת א"ל רב פפא לרבא והא"ר חייא בר אשי זימנין סגיאין הוה קאימנא קמיה דרב ושכשיכי ליה מסאני במיא שכשוך אין אבל כיבוס לא הדר אוקי רבא אמורא עליה ודרש דברים שאמרתי לפניכם טעות הם בידי ברם כך אמרו שכשוך מותר כיבוס אסור:
human_translation: Rava taught permitted to launder a shoe on Shabbat. Rav Pappa said to Rava: But didn’t Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi say: Many times I would stand before Rav and place water on his shoes? placing yes, but laundering, not Rava went back and placed an interpreter before him and taught statements that I said before you are my error. Truly, said like this: Placing permitted, laundering prohibited.
llm_translation: Rava expounded: It is permitted to wash a shoe on Shabbat. Rav Pappa said to Rava: But didn't Rav Chiya bar Ashi say, "Sometimes I would stand before Rav and wash his hands with water, washing is permitted but soaking is not"? Rava, the Amora, responded and expounded: The words that I have said before you are in error, however, this is what they said: Soaking is permitted, but washing is prohibited.

hebrew_text: הכיבוס במקום קדוש כו': מנא הני מילי דת"ר (ויקרא ו, כ) תכבס במקום קדוש שבירת כלי חרס מניין ת"ל (ויקרא ו, כא) וכלי חרס אשר תבושל בו ישבר מריקה ושטיפה בכלי נחשת מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ו, כא) ואם בכלי נחשת בושלה ומורק ושוטף במים:
human_translation: The laundering in a sacred place, From where are these matters As the Sages taught “You shall launder in a sacred place” From where the breaking of an earthenware vessel The verse states: “And the earthenware vessel in which it is cooked shall be broken” From where scouring and rinsing of a copper vessel The verse states “And if it be cooked in a copper vessel, it shall be scoured, and rinsed in water.”
llm_translation: The laundering in a holy place, etc.: From where are these matters derived? As the Rabbis taught (Leviticus 6:20), "Launder in a holy place." How do we know that the breaking of earthenware vessels is required? The Torah states (Leviticus 6:21), "And the earthenware vessel in which it was cooked shall be broken." How do we know that rinsing and washing are done with copper vessels? The Torah states (Leviticus 6:21), "But if it is cooked in a copper vessel, it shall be scoured and rinsed with water."

hebrew_text: זה חומר בחטאת כו': ותו ליכא והאיכא שנכנס דמה (לפני ו) לפנים בחטאות החיצונו'
human_translation: this a stringency to a sin offering And are there no more But there is That its blood enters the innermost sanctum with external sin offerings,
llm_translation: This is the matter in the sin offering, etc. And furthermore, there is no need for this, for there is a case where its blood entered inside the sanctuary in the outer sin offerings.

hebrew_text: שאם נכנס דמה (לפני ו) לפנים פסולה כר"ע דאמר כל דמים שנכנסו להיכל לכפר פסולה
human_translation: that if its blood enters into disqualified. in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says: Every blood, that enters the Sanctuary to atone disqualified;
llm_translation: If entered blood (before and) inside disqualified like Rabbi Akiva said all bloods that entered the sanctuary to atone disqualified

hebrew_text: שכן מכפרין על חייבי כריתות בחטאת דשמיעת הקול
human_translation: that atone for those who are liable to karet , to a sin offering for hearing the voice,
llm_translation: So too, they atone for those liable for excision with a sin offering through the hearing of the voice.

hebrew_text: שכן טעונה ארבע מתנות כר' ישמעאל דאמר כל דמים טעונין ד' מתנות על ד' קרנות
human_translation: that requires four placements in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who says all blood requires four placements, upon four corners
llm_translation: So requires four gifts according to Rabbi Yishmael, for he said: "All blood requires four gifts for four corners."

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך האיכא קרן (בדם) האיכא אצבע האיכא חודה אלא חד מתרי תלתא חומרי נקט:
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, Isn’t there blood corner Isn’t there finger? Isn’t there the edge of rather cited one of two three stringencies.
llm_translation: And to support your reasoning, there is a horn, there is a finger, there is a hole. Rather, one of the two, three stringent measures is taken.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בגד שיצא חוץ לקלעים נכנס ומכבסו במקום קדוש נטמא חוץ לקלעים קורעו נכנס ומכבסו במקום קדוש כלי חרס שיצא חוץ לקלעים נכנס ושוברו במקום קדוש נטמא חוץ לקלעים נוקבו ונכנס ושוברו במקום קדוש
human_translation: a garment that went outside the curtains, reenters and launders it in a sacred place. became ritually impure outside the curtains, tears enters and launders it in a sacred place. an earthenware vessel that went outside the curtains, reenters and breaks it in a sacred place. became ritually impure outside the curtains, punctures and enters and breaks it in a sacred place.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A garment that went out to the laundry may be brought in and washed in a sacred place; if it went out of the laundry, tear it; bring it in and wash it in a sacred place. A clay vessel that went out to the laundry, if it is brought in and broken in a sacred place, it becomes impure; if it went out of the laundry, pierce it, bring it in, and break it in a sacred place.

hebrew_text: כלי נחשת שיצא חוץ לקלעים נכנס ומורקו ושוטפו במקום קדוש נטמא חוץ לקלעים פוחתו ונכנס ומורקו ושוטפו במקום קדוש:
human_translation: a copper vessel that went outside the curtains, reenters and scours it and rinses it in a sacred place. became ritually impure outside the curtains, one breaks and enters and scours and rinses it in a sacred place.
llm_translation: Vessels of copper that went out to the curtains, entered and were rinsed and washed in a holy place become impure. Outside the curtains, their impurity diminishes, and they enter and are rinsed and washed in a holy place.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מתקיף לה רבינא קורעו בגד אמר רחמנא ולאו בגד הוא
human_translation: Ravina objects to this: one tears it? The Merciful One states “a garment” and this is no a garment,
llm_translation: Gemara: Ravina objects to this: "He tears his garment," the Merciful One said, and is it not a garment?

hebrew_text: דמשייר ביה כדי מעפורת איני והאמר רב הונא ל"ש אלא שלא שייר בה כדי מעפורת אבל שייר בה כדי מעפורת חבור הוי
human_translation: when he leaves of enough for a small cloth. Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Huna say: taught only when did not leave of it enough for a small cloth, but if he left enough of it for a small cloth, it is a joining
llm_translation: He left in it like the size of a mustard seed - I do not know. And Rav Huna said: No, except that he did not leave in it like the size of a mustard seed, but if he left in it like the size of a mustard seed, it is considered a mixture.

hebrew_text: מדרבנן הוא:
human_translation: it is by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: From the Rabbis it is:

hebrew_text: כלי חרס שיצא כו': כלי אמר רחמנא ולא כלי הוא שניקב בשורש קטן:
human_translation: an earthenware vessel that went outside The Merciful One states: vessel… and, it is not a vessel. When it is punctured of a small root,
llm_translation: Vessel of earthenware that went out, etc.: vessel, said the Merciful One, and not a vessel, that was perforated in a small root.

hebrew_text: כלי נחשת [כו'] פוחתו [וכו']: והא לאו כלי הוא דרציף מרציף (הוא)
human_translation: a copper vessel one breaks this is not a vessel When he hammers
llm_translation: Vessels of copper 26b diminish it etc.: But is it not a vessel that is beaten by a beater (it)?

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש מעיל שניטמא מכניסו בפחות משלש על שלש ומכבסו משום שנא' (שמות כח, לב) לא יקרע
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: robe has contracted ritual impurity he brings it in less than three by three and launders it because it is stated “It shall not be torn”
llm_translation: Rabbi Reish Lakish said: A cloak that became impure, one may immerse it in a vessel of less than three by three handbreadths and launder it, as it is stated (Exodus 28:32), "It shall not be torn."

hebrew_text: מותיב רב אדא בר אהבה העבין והרכים אין בהן משום שלש על שלש
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raises an objection The thick and the soft are not subject to three by three
llm_translation: Challenger Rav Adda bar Ahava: "The liver and the kidneys do not have the status of 'three by three'."

hebrew_text: אגב אביהן חשיבי
human_translation: are significant due to their source
llm_translation: Regarding their father, they are considered important.

hebrew_text: והא בעי שבעת סממנין דא"ר נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה דם חטאת ומראות נגעים צריכין שבעת סממנין ותניא אלא שאין מכניסין מי רגלים למקדש
human_translation: But isn’t requires seven substances? As Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: Blood of a sin offering and shades of marks require seven substances And it is taught But urine is not brought into the Temple,
llm_translation: And this requires seven signs. Rabbi Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: The blood of a sin offering and the signs of leprosy require seven signs. And it was taught in a Baraita: Rather, they do not bring water for the feet into the Temple.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא דמבלע להו בהדי שבעה סממנין ומעבר להו לכולהו כחד והתנן העבירן שלא כסדרן או שהעביר שבעתן כאחד לא עשה ולא כלום
human_translation: And if you would say that is absorbed together with seven substances and one applies all of them at once But didn’t we learn applied them not according to their order, or applied all seven simultaneously, he has done nothing,
llm_translation: And if you will say that he swallowed them with seven sammanin and passed them all at once, and we learned in a Mishnah: If he passed them not in their proper order, or if he passed all seven at once, he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא דמיבלע להו בהדי חד מסממנין והא צריך לכסכס שלש פעמים בכל אחד ואחד תנן אלא דמבלע להו ברוק תפל דאמר ריש לקיש רוק תפל צריך שיהא עם כל אחד ואחד:
human_translation: And if you would say that is absorbed together with one of the substances, But didn’t we learn One must rub three times with each and every one Rather, that is absorbed in tasteless saliva, as Reish Lakish says: Tasteless saliva must accompany each and every one
llm_translation: And if you will say that he mixes it with one of the spices, but he needs to rinse it three times with each one, we learned except that he mixes it with spit. For Reish Lakish said: Spit requires that it be with each and every one.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אחד שבישל בו ואחד שעירה לתוכה רותח אחד קדשי הקדשים ואחד קדשים קלים טעונין מריקה ושטיפה ר"ש אומר קדשים קלים אין טעונין מריקה ושטיפה:
human_translation: Whether in which cooked or whether into which poured boiling whether offerings of the most sacred order or whether offerings of lesser sanctity, require scouring and rinsing. Rabbi Shimon says: offerings of lesser sanctity do not require scouring and rinsing.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One pot in which food was cooked, and one pot in which a piece of meat was placed and it boiled, one pot containing holy of holies offerings, and one containing light holy offerings, require rinsing and washing. Rabbi Shimon says: Light holy offerings do not require rinsing and washing.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא ו, כא) אשר תבושל בו אין לי אלא שבישל בו עירה לתוכו רותח מנין ת"ל ואשר תבושל בו ישבר
human_translation: the Sages taught “In which it is cooked” I have only that in which cooked From where into which poured a boiling The verse states “But in which it is cooked shall be broken.”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught (Leviticus 6:21), "Which shall be baked in it." I might have only known that it must be baked in it while it is boiling inside it. Whence do I derive that it must be broken? The verse states, "And that which is baked in it shall be broken."

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא תלאו באויר תנור מהו אבישול ובילוע הוא דקפיד רחמנא או דילמא אבישול בלא בילוע
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: suspended in the airspace of oven what is is it with regard to cooking and absorption that the Merciful One is particular? Or perhaps, about cooking without absorption
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama asked: If they were suspended in the air above the oven, what is the law regarding cooking? Is it considered cooking and baking, for which the Merciful One is particular, or perhaps it is considered cooking without baking?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ת"ש אחד שבישל בו ואחד שעירה לתוכו רותח
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear Whether in which cooked or whether into which poured boiling
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear: One pot in which food was cooked and one pot in which a kid was placed inside it and cooked, it is boiling.

hebrew_text: בלוע בלא בישול לא קמיבעיא לן כי קמיבעיא לן בישול בלא בילוע מאי
human_translation: absorption without cooking was not raised as a dilemma to us. When was raised a dilemma to us, cooking without absorption what
llm_translation: Swallowed without cooking not was asked to us, when was asked to us cooking without swallowing what.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה תנור של מקדש של מתכת היה ואי ס"ד בישול בלא בלוע לא קפיד ניעביד של חרס כיון דאיכא שירי מנחות דאפייתן בתנור ואיכא בישול ובילוע עבדינן של מתכת
human_translation: Come hear that which Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: The oven of the Temple was of metal. And if it enters your mind cooking without absorption, is not particular should be made of earthenware. Since there are the remainders of meal offerings, whose baking in the oven, and there is cooking and absorption we fashion of metal.
llm_translation: Come and hear! For Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: The oven of the Temple was made of metal. And if you will say that cooking without swallowing is not valid, we would have to make it of earthenware. But since there are leftover portions of meal-offerings that are baked in the oven, and there is cooking and swallowing, we make it of metal.

hebrew_text: ההוא תנורא דאטחו בה טיחייא אסרה רבה בר אהיליי למיכלה לריפתא לעולם ואפי' במילחא דילמא אתי למיכלה בכותחא
human_translation: a certain oven that was smeared with fat Rabba bar Ahilai prohibited eating bread forever, and even with salt lest one come to eat it with kutaḥ ,
llm_translation: That oven that was plastered with mud, Rabba bar Ahilai prohibited eating from it forever, even with salt, lest it come to be eaten with vinegar.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אין לשין את העיסה בחלב ואם לש כל הפת כולה אסורה מפני הרגל עבירה
human_translation: raises an objection one may not knead the dough with milk, and if one kneaded all of the bread forbidden, because accustomed to sin.
llm_translation: The question was raised: One may not knead the dough with milk, and if one did knead the entire bread is forbidden due to the prohibition of mixing meat and milk.

hebrew_text: כיוצא בו אין טשין את התנור באליה ואם טש כל הפת כולה אסורה עד שיסיק את התנור תיובתא דרבה בר אהיליי תיובתא
human_translation: Similarly, not smear [ tashin ] the an oven with tail, And if smeared all of the bread forbidden, until kindles the oven the refutation of Rava bar Ahilai, a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Like it, one may not plaster the oven with pitch, and if one did, the entire loaf is prohibited until one heats the oven. This is a refutation of Rabba bar Ahilai's argument.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי וכי מאחר דאיתותב רבה בר אהיליי אמאי אמר רב קדירות בפסח ישברו אמר ליה רב מוקי לה ההיא בשל מתכת
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Since Rava bar Ahilai was conclusively refuted, why does Rav say pots must be broken Passover? said to him: Rav construes that to of metal,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "Since Rabba bar Ahilai has come, why?" Rav said, "Pots on Passover should be broken." Rav objected to him, "That one is a metal pot."

hebrew_text: ואי בעית אימא בתנור של חרס זה הסיקו מבפנים וזה הסיקו מבחוץ
human_translation: Or if you wish, say to an earthenware oven, This is kindled from the inside, But that is kindled from the outside
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "In a clay oven." This one was scorched from the inside, and this one was scorched from the outside.

hebrew_text: ונעביד הסקה מבפנים חייס עלייהו דמתברי הילכך האי כוביא הסיקו מבחוץ הוא ואסיר
human_translation: And let us perform kindling from the inside, concerned for them, as they break Therefore, this earthenware tile [ kuvya ], its kindling is from the outside, prohibited
llm_translation: And we will perform the assessment from within, a fence upon them, for they are disputing. Therefore, this Kuvya, they assessed it from the outside, and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אלא קדירות של מקדש אמאי (אמר רחמנא) ישברו נהדרינהו לכבשונות א"ר זירא לפי שאין עושין כבשונות בירושלים
human_translation: But pots the Temple, why does the Merciful One state they should be broken? Let us return them to kilns Rabbi Zeira said: because, kilns are not built in Jerusalem
llm_translation: Rather, why should the pots of the Temple be broken? (The Merciful One said) they should be broken to become wicks. Rabbi Zeira said: Because they do not make wicks in Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי וכי עושין אשפתות בעזרה אישתמיטתיה הא דתני שמעיה בקלנבו שברי כלי חרס נבלעין במקומן
human_translation: Abaye said: But are scrap heaps assembled in the Temple courtyard? that which Shemaya taught in Kalnevo escaped him; shards of earthenware vessels were absorbed in their place.
llm_translation: Abbaye said, "Do they indeed make ashpatoth in the Temple courtyard?" This is what Shemaiah taught in the town of Kefar Hananiah: broken shards of earthenware vessels are swallowed in their place.

hebrew_text: אלא הא דאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה תנור של מקדש של מתכת הוה נעביד דחרס דהסיקו מבפנים הוא
human_translation: But that which Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: The oven in the Temple was of metal? Let us fashion of earthenware, as kindling is from the inside,
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuhah said: The oven of the Temple was made of metal, lined with earthenware, as they would plaster it from the inside.

hebrew_text: דכיון דאיכא שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים דאפייתן בתנור וקדושתן בתנור הוה ליה כלי שרת וכלי שרת דחרס לא עבדינן
human_translation: because there are the two loaves, and the shewbread, whose baking is in the oven, and whose sanctification in the oven. is a service vessel; and we do not make a service vessel of earthenware.
llm_translation: Since there are two showbreads, and the showbread is baked in an oven, and their sanctity is in the oven, it would be considered a vessel of service, and we do not make vessels of service out of earthenware.

hebrew_text: ואפי' ר' יוסי ברבי יהודה לא קאמר אלא דעץ אבל דחרס לא
human_translation: And even Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says only of wood, but of earthenware, not
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda, did not say except for wood, but not for earthenware.

hebrew_text: רב יצחק בר יהודה הוה רגיל קמיה דרמי בר חמא שבקיה ואזיל לרב ששת יומא חד פגע ביה אמר ליה אלקפטא נקטן ריחא אתי לה ליד משום דאזלת לך לקמיה דרב ששת הוית לך כי רב ששת
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yehuda was accustomed before Rami bar Ḥama. he left him and went to Rav Sheshet. One day met him said to him the chief of taxes [ alkafta ] grasped me the fragrance came to hand? because you went before Rav Sheshet, have you become like Rav Sheshet
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak son of Yehuda used to sit before Rami son of Chama. He left him and went to Rav Sheshet for one day. Rami met him and said to him, "You have taken the scent with you, for you have gone to sit before Rav Sheshet as if you were sitting before Rav Sheshet."

hebrew_text: א"ל לאו מש"ה מר כי בעינא מילתא פשיט לי מסברא כי משכחנא מתניתא פרכא לה רב ששת כי בעינא מילתא מיניה פשיט לי ממתניתא דכי נמי משכחת מתניתא ופרכא מתניתא ומתניתא היא
human_translation: said to him: not due to that Master, when I ask matter, resolves for me through reasoning. when I find a mishna refutes Rav Sheshet, when I ask of him matter, resolves for me by a mishna. when I also find a mishna, and refutes it is mishna and mishna,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Not so, Master, for when I want a matter, it is clear to me from reasoning, for when I forget a Mishnah, Rav Sheshet explains it to me, for when I want a matter from him, it is clear to me from the Mishnah, for when I also forget a Mishnah, and the explanation of the Mishnah, it is the Mishnah itself."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה בעי מיני מילתא דאיפשיט לך כי מתניתא בעא מיניה בישל במקצת כלי טעון מריקה ושטיפה או אין טעון א"ל אינו טעון מידי דהוה אהזאה
human_translation: said to him: Ask me a matter, which I resolve for you in accordance with a mishna. asked him: cooked in part of a vessel, does require scouring and rinsing, or does it not require said to him: does not require just as it is sprinkling
llm_translation: He said to him, "I want to ask you a matter that is difficult for you, as it is taught in a Mishnah: If one cooked in part of a vessel that requires rinsing and washing, or does not require it?" He said to him, "It does not require anything, for it was immediately absorbed."

hebrew_text: והא לא תנא הכי א"ל מסתברא כבגד מה בגד אינו טעון כיבוס אלא מקום הדם אף כלי אינו טעון מריקה ושטיפה אלא במקום בישול
human_translation: But the tanna does not teach this said to him: it stands to reason like a garment, Just as a garment requires laundering only place the blood so too, a vessel requires scouring and rinsing only in the place cooking.
llm_translation: And isn't it taught thus? He said to him: It is logical, like a garment. Just as a garment does not require rinsing except in the place of blood, so too a vessel does not require emptying and rinsing except in the place of cooking.

hebrew_text: א"ל מי דמי דם לא מפעפע בישול מפעפע ועוד תניא חומר בהזאה ממריקה ושטיפה וחומר במריקה ושטיפה מבהזאה
human_translation: said to him: Are comparable? Blood does not spread cooking, spreads Additionally, is taught stringency to sprinkling than scouring and rinsing; and stringency to scouring and rinsing than sprinkling.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Whose blood is similar to whose blood? Blood does not froth in cooking, it froths. Furthermore, it was taught in a Baraita: The stringency in sprinkling is more stringent than rinsing and washing, and the stringency in rinsing and washing is more stringent than sprinkling."

hebrew_text: חומר בהזאה שהזאה ישנה בחטאות החיצונות ובחטאות הפנימיות וישנה לפני זריקה מה שאין כן במריקה ושטיפה
human_translation: stringency to sprinkling that sprinkling applies to external sin offerings, and to internal sin offerings, and applies before sprinkling which is not so in scouring and rinsing.
llm_translation: Matter in sprinkling that sprinkling is effective in outer sins and in inner sins and is effective before casting what is not so in smearing and rinsing.

hebrew_text: חומר במריקה ושטיפה שהמריקה ושטיפה נוהגת בין בקדשי קדשים בין בקדשים קלים בישל במקצת הכלי טעון מריקה ושטיפה כל הכלי מה שאין כן בהזאה
human_translation: stringency to scouring and rinsing that the scouring and rinsing is practiced both for offerings of the most sacred order and for offerings of lesser sanctity; cooked in part of the vessel, the entire vessel requires scouring and rinsing, which is not so in sprinkling
llm_translation: Matter in rinsing and washing that rinsing and washing is practiced whether in holy of holies or in lesser sanctified items, requires rinsing and washing. Every vessel requires rinsing and washing, except for in the case of sprinkling.

hebrew_text: א"ל אי תניא תניא וטעמא מאי אמר קרא (ויקרא ו, כא) ואם בכלי נחשת בושלה ואפילו במקצת כלי:
human_translation: said to him: If is taught, it is taught, And what is the reason the verse states: “And if it be cooked in a copper vessel, even in part of a vessel,
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is taught, it is taught. And what is the reason? The verse says (Leviticus 6:21): "And if it is cooked in a copper vessel, then the vessel in which it is cooked shall be scoured, and rinsed in water."

hebrew_text: אחד קדשי קדשים וכו': ת"ר חטאת אין לי אלא חטאת כל קדשים מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ו, י) קדש קדשים היא
human_translation: Whether offerings of the most sacred order The Sages taught: sin offering” I have only a sin offering From where all sacrificial The verse states: it is most sacred”
llm_translation: One of the Holy of Holies etc.: The Rabbis taught: I have a law regarding a sin offering only, but how do I know the law applies to all holy offerings? The verse states (Leviticus 6:10): "It is most holy."

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה את התרומה ת"ל אותה פרט לתרומה דברי ר' יהודה ר"ש אומר קדשי קדשים טעונין מריקה ושטיפה קדשים קלים אינן טעונין מריקה ושטיפה דכתיב קדש קדשים קדשי קדשים אין קדשים קלים לא
human_translation: might that I include teruma , the verse states: of it; excludes teruma ; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: Offerings of the most sacred order require scouring and rinsing, offerings of lesser sanctity do not require scouring and rinsing, as it is written: “Most sacred.” offerings of the most sacred order, yes, offerings of lesser sanctity, no,
llm_translation: I might have thought to increase the Terumah, it teaches "it," excluding the Terumah. The words of Rabbi Yehudah, Rabbi Shimon says: Holy of Holies require rinsing and washing, regular holy items do not require rinsing and washing, as it is written: Holy of Holies, Holy of Holies, regular holies are not.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבי יהודה מדאיצטריך אותה למעוטי תרומה מכלל דקדשים קלים טעונין מריקה ושטיפה ור"ש אמר לך אותה כדאמרינן
human_translation: what is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? Since “of it” was necessary to exclude teruma , by inference, that offerings of lesser sanctity require scouring and rinsing. And Rabbi Shimon said to you: “of it” as we say
llm_translation: Reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda - because he needs it to exclude Terumah from the general category of light consecrated items that require rinsing and washing. And Rabbi Shimon said to you, like we say:

hebrew_text: ותרומה לא בעיא שטיפה ומריקה והתניא קדרה שבישל בה בשר לא יבשל בה חלב ואם בישל בנותן טעם תרומה לא יבשל בה חולין ואם בישל בנותן טעם
human_translation: And teruma , it does not require rinsing and scouring? But isn’t it taught a pot in which cooked meat, may not cook milk in it; and if cooked imparts flavor teruma may not cook non-sacred in it; and if cooked imparts flavor
llm_translation: Tractate: Trumah Text: Trumah does not require rinsing and squeezing. And it was taught in a Baraita: A pot in which meat was cooked should not have milk cooked in it. And if one cooked in it, imparting a taste, Trumah should not be cooked in it. And if one cooked in it, imparting a taste, common food should not be cooked in it. And if one cooked in it, imparting a taste.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי לא צריכא אלא לדאמר מר בישל במקצת כלי טעון מריקה ושטיפה כל הכלי הא תרומה לא צריך אלא מקום בישול
human_translation: Abaye said: is necessary only for which the Master said: cooked in part of vessel, the entire vessel requires scouring and rinsing. this teruma must only the place of cooking,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It is necessary only to say that the Master stated: If one cooked in a vessel that requires rinsing and washing, any vessel that is designated for terumah does not require anything except a place for cooking.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לא צריכא אלא לדאמר מר במים ולא ביין במים ולא במזוג הא אפי' ביין ואפי' במזוג
human_translation: Rava said: is necessary only for which the Master said: in water” but not in wine. “in water,” but not in diluted this even in wine, and even in diluted
llm_translation: Rava said: It is necessary only to say what the Master said, "in water" and not in wine, in water and not in a mixture. This applies even to wine and even to a mixture.

hebrew_text: רבה בר עולא אמר לא צריכא אלא לדאמר מר מריקה ושטיפה בצונן הא אפי' בחמין
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said: is necessary only for which the Master said: scouring and rinsing with cold this even with boiling
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Ulla said: It is not necessary except to say that the Master of Marikah and Shetifah in cold water, behold, even in hot water.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד מריקה ושטיפה בצונן אלא למ"ד מריקה בחמין ושטיפה בצונן מאי איכא למימר שטיפה יתירתא:
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says scouring and rinsing with cold but according to the one who says scouring with hot and rinsing with cold what can be said? the additional rinsing
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the opinion of the one who holds that rinsing and washing should be done with cold water. Rather, according to the opinion of the one who holds that rinsing should be done with hot water and washing with cold water, what can be said? There is excessive washing.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ רבי טרפון אומר בישל מתחילת הרגל יבשל בו כל הרגל וחכ"א עד זמן אכילה מריקה ושטיפה מריקה כמריקת הכוס ושטיפה כשטיפת הכוס מריקה ושטיפה בצונן
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon says: cooked from the beginning of the Festival, may cook in it the entire Festival; And the Rabbis say: scouring and rinsing before period partaking Scouring like the scouring of a cup, and rinsing like the rinsing of a cup. Scouring and rinsing with cold
llm_translation: Mishnah: Rabbi Tarfon says, one may cook from the beginning of the festival, one should cook in it for the entire festival. And the sages say, until the time of eating. Draining and rinsing, draining like the draining of a cup, and rinsing like the rinsing of a cup, draining and rinsing with cold water.

hebrew_text: השפוד והאסכלא מגעילן בחמין:
human_translation: the spit and the grill [ askela ], purges them in hot water.
llm_translation: The spit and the grill make them repulsive in hot water.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמא דר"ט דאמר קרא (דברים טז, ז) ופנית בבקר והלכת לאהלך הכתוב עשאו לכולן בקר אחד
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Tarfon? as the verse states and you shall turn in the morning, and go to your tents” the verse has rendered all of those one morning.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Rabbi Tarfon who said: The verse states (Deuteronomy 16:7), "And you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents," the Scripture made it for all of them one morning.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אחדבוי בר אמי וכי אין פיגול ברגל ואין נותר ברגל
human_translation: Rav Aḥadvoi bar Ami objects to this: But is there no an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its appointed time [ piggul ] during a pilgrimage Festival? And is there no notar , during a pilgrimage Festival?
llm_translation: Rav Akhadvoy bar Ami objects to him: Is there no Pigul in the leg and no Notar in the leg?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ה"נ והתניא ר' נתן אומר לא אמר ר"ט אלא זו בלבד
human_translation: And if you would say: Indeed, But it is taught Rabbi Natan says: Rabbi Tarfon said only this, alone,
llm_translation: And if you will say, "So it is," and it was taught: Rabbi Natan says, Rabbi Tarfon did not say this, but only that.

hebrew_text: אלא כדר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה דאמר ר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה כל יום ויום נעשה גיעול לחבירו:
human_translation: Rather, with that which Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh. As Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: each and every day becomes a purging agent for the other
llm_translation: Rather, as Rava said in the name of Rav Nahman, Rava bar Avuhah said: "Every day, disgrace is done to one's fellow."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א עד זמן אכילה כו': מאי קאמר אמר ר"נ אמר רבה בר אבוה ממתין לה עד זמן אכילה והדר עביד לה מריקה ושטיפה
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: before period partaking What saying? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: One waits for so long as the period of partaking, and then performs scouring and rinsing on it.
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory until the time of eating, etc. What is it saying? Said Rabbi Nahman said Rabba bar Avuhah: We wait for her until the time of eating, and then perform salting and rinsing.

hebrew_text: מנהני מילי א"ר יוחנן משום אבא יוסי בן אבא כתיב (ויקרא ו, כא) ומורק ושוטף וכתיב (ויקרא ו, כב) כל זכר בכהנים יאכל הא כיצד ממתין לה עד זמן אכילה והדר עביד לה מריקה ושטיפה:
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Abba Yosei bar Abba: It is written “It shall be scoured and rinsed and it is written “Every male among the priests may eat How so, waits with it until the period of partaking and then performs scouring and rinsing on it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where are these matters? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Abba Yose ben Abba: It is written (Leviticus 6:21) "and he shall scrape off and rinse," and it is written (Leviticus 6:22) "Every male among the priests may eat it." How so? One waits for it until the time of eating, and then performs scraping and rinsing on it.

hebrew_text: מריקה כמריקת הכוס שטיפה כשטיפת הכוס: ת"ר מריקה ושטיפה בצונן דברי רבי וחכמים אומרים מריקה בחמין ושטיפה בצונן
human_translation: Scouring like the scouring of a cup, rinsing like the rinsing of a cup; The Sages taught Scouring and rinsing with cold the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: Scouring with hot and rinsing with cold
llm_translation: Scouring is like the scouring of a cup, rinsing is like the rinsing of a cup: The Sages taught: Scouring and rinsing in cold water, this is the opinion of Rabbi. The sages say: Scouring in hot water and rinsing in cold water.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבנן מידי דהוה אגיעולי עובדי כוכבים ורבי אמר לך הגעלה לא קאמינא כי קאמינא למריקה ושטיפה דבתר הגעלה
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis? just as it is with purging gentiles, And Rabbi said to you: I do not say purging, when I say with regard to scouring and rinsing, which is after purging.
llm_translation: Reasoning of the Rabbis: Anything that the idolaters touch, and Rabbi says, "I am not speaking of defilement, rather I am speaking of rinsing and washing after defilement."

hebrew_text: ורבנן א"כ לכתוב קרא או מורק מורק או שוטף שוטף מאי ומורק ושוטף ש"מ מריקה בחמין ושטיפה בצונן
human_translation: And the Rabbis If so, let the verse write either: scoured scoured or: rinsed rinsed What “It shall be scoured and rinsed Conclude from scouring with hot and rinsing with cold
llm_translation: The Sages said: If so, one should write a verse, or spit spit, or rinse rinse. What is the meaning of "spit" and "rinse"? Learn from this that one should rinse with hot water and rinse with cold water.

hebrew_text: ורבי אי כתיב ומורק מורק ה"א תרי זימני מורק או תרי זימני שוטף לכך כתיב ומורק ושוטף לומר לך מריקה כמריקת הכוס שטיפה כשטיפת הכוס:
human_translation: And Rabbi If it were written: It shall be scoured scoured, I would say scoured two times, or rinsed two times. Therefore, it is written: “It shall be scoured and rinsed,” to tell you Scouring like the scouring of a cup, rinsing like the rinsing of a cup.
llm_translation: Rabbi, if it were written "and he spits, he spits," would it mean two times spitting or two times rinsing? Therefore it is written "and he spits and rinses" to tell you that spitting is like the spitting of a cup, and rinsing is like the rinsing of a cup.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בישל בו קדשים וחולין או קדשי קדשים וקדשים קלים אם יש בהן בנותן טעם הרי הקלים נאכלין כחמורין שבהן ואינן טעונין מריקה ושטיפה ואינן פוסלים במגע
human_translation: cooked in sacrificial and non-sacred or offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity, If there is of to impart flavor the lenient be eaten in accordance with the stringent therein, And do not require scouring and rinsing, and do not disqualify through contact.
llm_translation: Mishnah: He cooked in it a pot sacrificial items and non-sacred items, or items of the most holy order and regular holy items. If they contain a flavor, behold, the regular items are eaten like the most severe items among them, and they do not require salting and rinsing, and they are not invalidated by contact.

hebrew_text: רקיק שנגע ברקיק וחתיכה בחתיכה לא כל הרקיקין ולא כל החתיכות אסורין אינו אסור אלא במקום שבלע:
human_translation: wafer that touched wafer or a piece piece neither all the wafers nor all the pieces are forbidden. No forbidden other than in the place where absorbed
llm_translation: Thin pancake that touched thin pancake and piece that touched piece not all thin pancakes and not all pieces forbidden not forbidden except in place of swallowing.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי קאמר אם יש בהן בנותן טעם הרי הקלין נאכלין כחמורין וטעונין מריקה ושטיפה ופוסלין במגע
human_translation: What is saying? If there is of to impart flavor the lenient be eaten in accordance with the stringent require scouring and rinsing, and disqualify through contact.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is it saying? If they have a reason, they are eaten like donkeys, and require salting, rinsing, and disqualify by touch.

hebrew_text: אין בהן בנותן טעם אין הקלין נאכלין כחמורים ואין טעונין מריקה ושטיפה ואין פוסלין במגע
human_translation: If is not sufficient to impart flavor the lenient are not eaten in accordance with the stringent do not require scouring and rinsing, and do not disqualify through contact.
llm_translation: There is no in them giving taste, there are not light eaten like donkeys, and there is no need rinsing and washing, and there are not invalidated by contact.

hebrew_text: נהי דקדשי קדשים לא בעו קדשים קלים ניבעי
human_translation: granted, do not require offerings of the most sacred order. should require offerings of lesser sanctity?
llm_translation: It is so, for the holy of holies, not inquired about the light holy things is required.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מאי אין טעונין דקאמר קדשי קדשים אבל קדשים קלים טעונין רבא אמר הא מני ר"ש היא דאמר קדשים קלים אין טעונין מריקה ושטיפה
human_translation: Abaye said: What Do not require, which states? offerings of the most sacred order, but do require offerings of lesser sanctity. Rava said: whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, who says: offerings of lesser sanctity do not require scouring and rinsing
llm_translation: Abbaye said: What is meant by "do not require"? When it says "holy of holies," but "lesser holies" do require. Rava said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, who said that "lesser holies" do not require rinsing and washing.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבא היינו דקתני או קדשי קדשים וקדשים קלים אלא לאביי תרתי למה לי
human_translation: Granted, to Rava, this that which teaches: or offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity. But to Abaye, why do I two
llm_translation: To Rava, this is what was taught: "Or holy of holies and holy things, but to Abaye, why do I need two?"

hebrew_text: צריכי דאי תנא קדשים וחולין ה"א חולין הוא דמבטלי קדשים דלאו מינייהו אבל קדשי קדשים וקדשים קלים אימא לא
human_translation: are necessary, As, had taught sacrificial and non-sacred I would say it is non-sacred that can nullify sacrificial as not its type. But offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity, I would say: not
llm_translation: Necessary for if a Tanna teaches "Kodashim and Chulin," it means "Chulin" is what nullifies "Kodashim," for they are not of its kind, but regarding "Kodshei Kodashim" and "Kodashim Kalim," say not.

hebrew_text: ואי תנא קדשי קדשים וקדשים קלים ה"א קדשים הוא דאלימי לבטולי קדשים אבל חולין אימא לא צריכא:
human_translation: And had taught offerings of the most sacred order and offerings of lesser sanctity, I would say it is sacrificial that is strong to nullify sacrificial but non-sacred I would say: not necessary
llm_translation: And if you say, "the holy of holies and the lesser holies," it is the lesser holies that are subject to nullification, but with regard to secular items, one might say that it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: רקיק שהגיע ברקיק כו': ת"ר כל אשר יגע יכול אפי' שלא בלע ת"ל בבשרה
human_translation: wafer that reached wafer the Sages taught “Whatever shall touch might even did not absorb the verse states: “With its flesh [ bivsarah ]”
llm_translation: Thin cake that arrived thin etc.: The Rabbis taught: "Anything that touches the offering could become impure, even if it did not swallow any of it." The Torah states the word "in its flesh."

hebrew_text: עד שיבלע בבשרה
human_translation: unless absorbs into its meat.
llm_translation: Until it is swallowed in its flesh.

hebrew_text: יכול נגע במקצת חתיכה יהא כולו פסול ת"ל יגע הנוגע פסול הא כיצד חותך את מקום שבלע בבשרה ולא בגידין ולא בעצמות ולא בקרנים ולא בטלפים
human_translation: might if touched part of a piece the entire should become disqualified. the verse states: shall touch that touches disqualified. How so? One slices off the section that absorbed its flesh,” but not sinews, nor bones, nor horns, nor hooves.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Can one who touches part of the offering render the entire offering invalid? The Torah teaches: 'The one who touches shall be impure.' How so? If one cuts the place that was swallowed in its flesh, but not in the sinews, bones, horns, or hooves."

hebrew_text: יקדש להיות כמוה הא כיצד אם פסולה היא תפסל [ואם] כשרה היא תאכל כחמור שבה
human_translation: shall be sacred,” becomes like it, How so? If is disqualified, becomes disqualified. And if it is fit, be eaten in accordance with the stringent that to
llm_translation: She shall be consecrated to be like her. How so? If she is disqualified, she shall be invalidated, and if she is fit, she shall eat like her donkey.

hebrew_text: אמאי וניתי עשה ולידחי את לא תעשה אמר רבא אין עושה דוחה את לא תעשה שבמקדש
human_translation: why Should positive mitzva come and override prohibition Rava said: A positive mitzva does not override a prohibition that to the Temple.
llm_translation: Why did he come and perform an action to push aside a prohibition? Rava said: One who performs an action does not push aside a prohibition in the Temple.

hebrew_text: שנאמר (שמות יב, מו) ועצם לא תשברו בו ר"ש בן מנסיא אומר אחד עצם שיש בו מוח ואחד עצם שאין בו מוח אמאי ניתי עשה ולידחי את לא תעשה אלא אין עשה דוחה לא תעשה שבמקדש
human_translation: As it is stated “Nor shall you break a bone of it” Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Both a bone that contains marrow and a bone that does not contain marrow why Should positive mitzva come and override prohibition Rather, a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition that to the Temple.
llm_translation: It is stated (Exodus 12:46), "You shall not break a bone in it." Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: One bone that has marrow and one bone that does not have marrow. Why does it come to say, "Do" to push aside "Do not do"? Rather, a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment in the Temple.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר יקדש עשה הוא ואין עשה דוחה את לא תעשה ועשה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: shall be sacred” is a positive mitzva. and a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition and a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Yikadesh asah hu ve'ein asah docheh et lo ta'aseh ve'asah."

hebrew_text: אשכחן חטאת דמתקדש בבלוע שאר קדשים מנלן אמר שמואל משום ר"א (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה לעולה ולמנחה ולחטאת ולאשם ולמילואים ולזבח השלמים
human_translation: We found that a sin offering, becomes sanctified through that which is absorbed From where do we the rest of the sacred Shmuel says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: “This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the guilt offering, and of the inauguration offering, and of the sacrifice of peace offerings”
llm_translation: We find a sin-offering that becomes sanctified through consuming other holy items. From where do we derive this? Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: "This is the Torah of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the consecration offering, and the sacrifice of well-being." (Leviticus 7:37)

hebrew_text: [לעולה] כי עולה מה עולה טעונה כלי אף כל טעונה כלי מאי כלי אילימא מזרק בשלמי ציבור נמי כתיב בהו (שמות כד, ו) ויקח משה חצי הדם וישם באגנות
human_translation: “of the burnt offering” like a burnt offering just as a burnt offering requires a utensil so too do all require a utensil. What utensil? If we say a bowl, With regard to communal peace offerings it is also written of them: And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Regarding an Olah offering, what is an Olah offering? It requires vessels; likewise, every sacrifice that requires vessels. What are vessels? If you say, a sprinkler, it is also written regarding communal peace offerings (Exodus 24:6), 'And Moses took half of the blood and placed it in basins.'" English translation: "Regarding an Olah offering, what is an Olah offering? It requires vessels; likewise, every sacrifice that requires vessels. What are vessels? If you say, a sprinkler, it is also written regarding communal peace offerings (Exodus 24:6), 'And Moses took half of the blood and placed it in basins.'"

hebrew_text: אלא דסכין ועולה גופה מנלן דכתיב (בראשית כב, י) וישלח אברהם את ידו ויקח את המאכלת והתם עולה הוא דכתיב (בראשית כב, יג) ויעלהו לעולה תחת בנו
human_translation: Rather, of a knife, And a burnt offering itself, from where do we that which is written: “And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife and there, a burnt offering, as it is written: “And offered it up for a burnt offering instead of his son”
llm_translation: Rather, regarding a knife and an elevation-offering itself, from where do we derive? As it is written (Genesis 22:10), "And Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife," and there it is an elevation-offering that is written (Genesis 22:13), "And he offered it up as an elevation-offering in place of his son."

hebrew_text: ואי שלמי ציבור מריבוייא דקרא אתי (במדבר יח, י) בקדש הקדשים תאכלנו כל זכר יאכל אותו לימד על שלמי ציבור שאינן נאכלין אלא לזכרי כהונה

llm_translation: And if the communal peace offerings come in abundance, the verse comes to teach (Numbers 18:10), "In a most holy place you shall eat it; every male may eat it." This teaches regarding communal peace offerings that they are only eaten by male members of the priesthood.

llm_translation: Rava asked: "If the blood of the burnt offering goes below and the blood of the sin offering goes above, what is the law? Is it because it touches, and indeed it touches? Or perhaps it is because it is swallowed, and yet it is not swallowed?" He then resolved it: that it requires washing.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא פשיטא לי דם על בגדו חוצץ ואם טבח הוא אינו חוצץ רבב על בגדו חוצץ ואם מוכר רבב הוא אינו חוצץ בעי רבא דם ורבב על בגדו מהו
human_translation: Rava said: obvious to me blood on garment, interposes But if he is a butcher, does not interpose, fat [ revav ] on one’s garment, interposes. But if he is a fat seller, does not interpose. Rava asks: blood and fat on garment what is
llm_translation: Rava said: It is obvious to me that if blood is on his garment, it is a barrier. And if he is a butcher, it is not a barrier. If mud is on his garment, it is a barrier. And if he is a seller, it is not a barrier. Rava inquired: What is the ruling if there is both blood and mud on his garment?

llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters? Rava said: For the verse states (Leviticus 6:19), "The priest who sins shall eat it." A priest who sins may eat it; one who does not sin may not eat it.

llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do we learn that if one can eat the food he should divide it with others? To write the word "He shall divide it," as stated in the Torah. What is the meaning of "he can eat it"? - It teaches us that if it is fit for eating, one should divide it, but if it is not fit for eating, one should not divide it.

hebrew_text: בעי ר"ל בעל מום והוא טמא מהו שיחלקו לו כיון דלא חזי ורחמנא רבייה לא שנא מה לי טמא מה לי בעל מום או דלמא ראוי לאכילה חולק שאינו ראוי לאכילה אינו חולק
human_translation: Reish Lakish raises a dilemma: blemished and he is impure, what is give him a share since he is not fit and the Merciful One included him is no difference: What to me impure, what to me blemished? Or perhaps fit for partaking receives a share who is not fit for partaking does not receive a share
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer inquired: A blemished animal that is also ritually impure, what is the law regarding dividing it? Since it is not fit for consumption, and the Merciful One has shown mercy, is there a distinction between ritually impure and blemished? Or perhaps, if it is fit for consumption, one may divide it, but if it is not fit for consumption, one may not divide it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה ת"ש כהן גדול מקריב אונן ואינו אוכל ואינו חולק לאכול לערב ש"מ ראוי לאכילה בעינן ש"מ
human_translation: Rabba said: Come hear a High Priest he sacrifices an acute mourner. But he does not partake and he does not receive a share to partake in the evening. Conclude from we require fit for partaking Conclude from
llm_translation: Rabba said: Come and hear. A High Priest may perform the service while in a state of aninut, yet he may not eat, and he does not divide the meal for the evening. This teaches us that it is fitting for consumption, we require. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: בעי רב אושעיא טמא בקרבנות ציבור מהו שיחלקו לו מי אמרינן המחטא אמר רחמנא והאי נמי מחטא הוא או דלמא ראוי לאכילה חולק שאין ראוי לאכילה אינו חולק
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises a dilemma: impure, in communal offerings, what is give him a share Do we say the Merciful One states: who effects atonement,” and this is also effect atonement, Or perhaps fit for partaking receives a share who is unfit for partaking does not receive a share.
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya asked: If one is impure regarding communal sacrifices, what is the law if they should participate in the division? Do we say, "The one who sins, the Merciful One said," and this one also is considered as having sinned? Or perhaps, if it is fit for consumption, one may divide it, but if it is not fit for consumption, one may not divide it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא ת"ש כהן גדול מקריב אונן ואינו אוכל ואינו חולק לאכול לערב ש"מ ראוי לאכילה בעינן ש"מ:
