llm_translation: Impure, a creeping thing, impure, it is. The evening that requires the sun, and furthermore, even terumah also.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה באומר נשמרתי מדבר המטמאני ולא נשמרתי מדבר הפוסלני
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: where he says: I safeguarded myself from anything that would render me impure, but I did not safeguard my-self from anything that would render me unfit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: "I have guarded myself from something that renders me impure, but I have not guarded myself from something that disqualifies me."

hebrew_text: ומי איכא נטירותא לפלגא אין והתניא עודהו הסל על ראשו
human_translation: But is there partial care, Yes, and it is taught the basket was still on his head,
llm_translation: And is there a leftover for half? No. And it was taught: "He shall still lay his hand upon his head."

hebrew_text: ומגריפה בתוכו ואמר לבי על הסל ואין לבי על המגריפה הסל טהור והמגריפה טמאה
human_translation: and a shovel in and he said: I am minding the basket, but I am not minding the shovel, the basket is pure, and the shovel is impure.
llm_translation: "And if a basket is inside it, and he said, 'My heart is on the basket,' and not if my heart is on the contents, the basket is pure, and the contents are impure."

hebrew_text: ותטמא מגריפה לסל אין כלי מטמא כלי ותטמא מה שבתוכו אמר רבא באומר שמרתיה מדבר המטמאה ולא שמרתיה מדבר הפוסלה
human_translation: But the shovel render the basket impure? a vessel does not render vessel ritually impure. But the shovel render that which is in impure? Rava said: where he says: I safeguarded it, from anything that render impure, but I did not safeguard it from anything that would render it unfit,
llm_translation: And it became impure from a shard to a basket, a vessel does not render impure another vessel, and it became impure that which is inside it. Rava said: If one guards it from something that imparts impurity, but does not guard it from something that disqualifies it.

hebrew_text: איגלגל מילתא ומטאי לקמיה דרבי אבא בר ממל א"ל לא שמיע להו הא דאמר רבי יוחנן א"ר האוכל שלישי של תרומה אסור לאכול ומותר ליגע
human_translation: The matter circulated and came before Rabbi Abba bar Memel. He said to Have they not heard that which Rabbi Yoḥanan says Rabbi says: One who partakes of teruma third- is prohibited from partaking but permitted to touch
llm_translation: The matter was agitated and came before Rabbi Abba bar Memel. He said to them: "I did not hear this that Rabbi Yochanan said: 'One who eats the third of Terumah is forbidden to eat, but permitted to touch.'"

hebrew_text: אלמא באכילה עבוד רבנן מעלה בנגיעה לא עבוד רבנן מעלה:
human_translation: Apparently, in partaking, the Sages imposed a higher standard, in touching, the Sages did not impose a higher standard.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma b'achila avod rabanan ma'aleh, b'nega'ah lo avod rabanan ma'aleh."

hebrew_text: ואינו חולק לאכול כו': מיפלג הוא דלא פליג וכי מזמני ליה אכיל
human_translation: And he does not receive a share to partake he may not receive a share but when invite him he may partake
llm_translation: And he does not divide to eat, etc.: He is in disagreement, as he does not disagree. And does he invite him to eat?

hebrew_text: ורמינהי אונן (ומחוסר כיפורים) טובל ואוכל את פסחו לערב אבל לא בקדשים
human_translation: And raises a contradiction An acute mourner immerses and partakes of his Paschal offering in the evening, but not of sacrificial
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: An onen (and one lacking atonement) immerses and eats his Passover offering in the evening, but not with holy items.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ירמיה מדיפתי לא קשיא כאן בפסח כאן בשאר ימות השנה
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya of Difti said: not difficult. Here, with regard to Passover, there, with regard to the rest of the days of the year.
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiya said: From Difti it is not difficult. Here regarding Pesach, here regarding the rest of the days of the year.

hebrew_text: בפסח איידי דאכיל פסח אכיל נמי קדשים בשאר ימות השנה דלא חזי לא חזי ומאי אבל לא בקדשים אבל לא בקדשים של כל השנה
human_translation: On Passover, since he partakes of Paschal offering, he may also partake of sacrificial on the rest of the days of the year, when he is unfit he is unfit. And what But not of sacrificial But not of sacrificial of all the year,
llm_translation: In Pesach, since one eats Pesach, one also eats Kodshim on the rest of the days of the year. If one does not see, one does not see. And what is the case of "but not with Kodshim"? But not with Kodshim of the entire year.

hebrew_text: רב אסי אמר ל"ק כאן שמת לו מת בארבעה עשר וקברו בארבעה עשר כאן שמת לו מת בשלשה עשר וקברו בארבעה עשר יום קבורה לא תפיס לילו מדרבנן
human_translation: Rav Asi said not difficult. Here, where his died on the fourteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth There, where his died on the thirteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth the day of burial does not take hold of its night by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said to the sages: Here, if one's relative died on the fourteenth day of the month, and they buried him on the fourteenth, here, if one's relative died on the thirteenth day of the month, and they buried him on the fourteenth, the night of burial does not count towards the rabbinic requirement.

hebrew_text: מאן תנא אנינות לילה מדרבנן ר"ש היא דתניא אנינות לילה מדברי תורה דברי רבי יהודה ר"ש אומר אונן אינו מדברי תורה אלא מדברי סופרים תדע שהרי אמרו אונן טובל ואוכל את פסחו לערב אבל לא בקדשים
human_translation: Who taught acute mourning night by rabbinic law, is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Acute mourning at night is by Torah law; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: an acute mourner is not by Torah law, but by rabbinic law. Know as said: An acute mourner immerses and partakes of his Paschal offering in the evening, but not of sacrificial
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that holds nighttime mourning is Rabbinically mandated? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Nighttime mourning is from the words of the Torah, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: Mourning is not from the words of the Torah, but from the words of the Scribes. You should know this, for they said: An Onen may immerse and eat his Paschal offering in the evening, but not with consecrated items.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר"ש אנינות לילה מדרבנן והתניא ר"ש אומר אונן אינו משלח קרבנותיו מאי לאו ' ואפילו בפסח לא לבר מפסח
human_translation: And does Rabbi Shimon hold acute mourning at night is by rabbinic law But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: An acute mourner does not send his offerings What, is it not even to a Paschal offering? No, other than a Paschal offering.
llm_translation: And R. Shimon holds that nighttime mourning is Rabbinic. And it was taught: R. Shimon says, "An onen does not bring his sacrifices." What is the reason? "Even on Passover, not to exempt from Passover."

hebrew_text: והתניא ר"ש אומר שלמים כשהוא שלם מביא ואינו מביא כשהוא אונן מנין לרבות את התודה מרבה אני את התודה שכן נאכלת בשמחה כשלמים
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: shelamim when is whole [ shalem ], he brings but he does not bring when he is an acute mourner. From where to include a thanks offering? I include the thanks offering because it is consumed in joy, like a peace offering.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says, "Peace-offerings are brought when one is whole, and are not brought when one is in a state of mourning. How do we know to include the Thanksgiving offering? I increase the Thanksgiving offering, for it is also eaten with joy, like the Peace-offerings."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות את העולה מרבה אני את העולה שכן באה בנדר ובנדבה כשלמים מנין לרבות [בכור ומעשר ופסח מרבה אני] בכור ומעשר ופסח שכן אינן באין על חטא מנין לרבות חטאת ואשם ת"ל זבח
human_translation: From where to include a burnt offering? I include the burnt offering because it comes as a vow and as a gift like a peace offering. From where to include a firstborn and tithe and a Paschal offering, I include a firstborn and tithe and a Paschal offering, because they do not come for a sin. From where to include a sin offering and a guilt offering, The verse states: a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ]
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include the burnt offering? I increase the burnt offering, for it comes through a vow and a freewill offering, like the peace offerings. From where do we derive to include the offerings of the firstborn, the tithe, and the Passover offering? I increase the firstborn, the tithe, and the Passover offering, for they do not come for atonement. From where do we derive to include the sin offering and the guilt offering? The Torah teaches by using the word "sacrifice."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות העופות והמנחות והיין והעצים והלבונה ת"ל שלמים קרבנו כל קרבנות שהוא מביא כשהוא שלם מביא ואינו מביא כשהוא אונן
human_translation: From where to include the bird offerings, and the meal offerings, and the wine, and the wood, and the frankincense The verse states: his offering peace offerings [ shelamim korbano ],” all offerings [ korbanot ] that brings, he brings when he is whole [ shalem ], but he does not bring when he is an acute mourner.
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include birds, meal offerings, wine, wood, and frankincense? The verse states, "his offering shall be of a perfect quality." This teaches that all offerings that one brings, when he brings them in a complete state, he may bring them, but he may not bring them when he is in a state of mourning.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא פסח
human_translation: In any event, teaches a Paschal offering,
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: "From where do we derive the law of the Passover offering?"

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא פסח כדי נסביה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: a Paschal offering for no purpose.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: "The Passover offering is for the sake of marriage."

hebrew_text: רב ששת אמר מאי פסח שלמי פסח אי הכי היינו שלמים תנא שלמים הבאין מחמת פסח ותנא שלמים הבאין מחמת עצמן
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What Paschal offering? the peace offerings of Passover, If so, is a peace offering, taught peace offerings that come on account of Paschal offering, and taught peace offerings that come on their own account.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What is the Peace Offering of the Passover? If so, these are peace offerings. One Tanna says: Peace offerings that come because of the Passover. And one Tanna says: Peace offerings that come because of themselves.

hebrew_text: דאי לא תנא שלמים הבאין מחמת פסח סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ומחמת פסח אתי כגופיה דפסח דמי קמ"ל
human_translation: because if he did not teach peace offerings that come on account of Paschal offering, enter your mind to say: Since they come on account of Paschal offering, they are considered like Paschal offering itself, teaches us
llm_translation: If it did not teach "Shelamim that come due to Pesach," would you think I would say that since it comes due to Pesach, it is like Pesach itself? This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: רב מרי אמר
human_translation: Rav Mari said
llm_translation: Rav Mari said

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן שמת לו מת בי"ד וקברו בי"ד כאן שמת לו מת בי"ג וקברו בי"ד
human_translation: not difficult. Here, where his died on the fourteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth There, where his died on the thirteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth
llm_translation: Not difficult here, if he died when he had a corpse in hand, and they buried him with a corpse in hand; but difficult here, if he died when he had a corpse in pit, and they buried him with a corpse in hand.

hebrew_text: מת לו מת בי"ד וקברו בי"ד יום מיתה תופס לילו מדאורייתא מת לו מת בי"ג וקברו בי"ד יום קבורה מדרבנן אינו תופס לילו אלא מדרבנן
human_translation: his died on the fourteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth the day of death takes hold of its night by Torah law, his died on the thirteenth and he buried him on the fourteenth the day of burial, by rabbinic law. it takes hold of its night only by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: If one dies, and another dies on the same day, and they are buried on the same day, the day of death counts as his night biblically. If one dies, and another dies on the same day, and they are buried on different days, the night does not count as his night biblically, but only rabbinically.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אשי לרב מרי ואלא הא דקתני אמר לו ר"ש תדע שהרי אמרו אונן טובל ואוכל את פסחו אבל לא בקדשים נימא ליה קאמינא לך אנא יום מיתה דאורייתא ואמרת לי את יום קבורה דרבנן קשיא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Mari: But that which teaches: Rabbi Shimon said to Know as said: An acute mourner immerses and partakes of his Paschal offering but not of sacrificial let say to I am telling you the day of death, by Torah law, and you tell me the day of burial, by rabbinic law. a difficulty
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Mari, "But this that it teaches, Rabbi Shimon said to him, 'Know that they said: An onen may immerse and eat his Passover offering, but not eat consecrated items.' Let me say to you, I am in a state of Torah-required death today, and you tell me to wait for Rabbinically-required burial, which is difficult."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר לא קשיא כאן שמת קודם חצות כאן שמת לאחר חצות קודם חצות דלא איחזי לפסח חיילא עליה אנינות אחר חצות דאיחזי לפסח לא חיילא עליה אנינות
human_translation: Abaye said not difficult. Here, where died before midday There, where died after midday before midday, which he was not fit for a Paschal offering acute mourning applies to him, after midday, when he is fit for a Paschal offering, acute mourning does not apply to him
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is not difficult. Here, if one dies before midnight, here, if one dies after midnight. Before midnight, since it does not hold back the Paschal lamb, mourning is upon it. After midnight, since it holds back the Paschal lamb, mourning is not upon it.

hebrew_text: ומנא תימרא דשני ליה בין קודם חצות בין לאחר חצות דתניא (ויקרא כא, ג) לה יטמא מצוה לא רצה מטמאין אותו על כרחו ומעשה ביוסף הכהן שמתה אשתו בערב הפסח ולא רצה ליטמא ונמנו אחיו הכהנים וטימאוהו בעל כרחו
human_translation: And from where do you say that is different whether before midday whether after midday? As it is taught for her may he become impure” a mitzva did not want render him impure against his will. And an incident involving Yosef the priest, where his wife died on Passover eve, and he did not want to become impure, and his brethren the priests voted and rendered him impure against his will.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that one may shave his head whether before midnight or after midnight? For it was taught in a Baraita: "To him the high priest shall he be impure" (Leviticus 21:3) - he did not want to become impure, but his brothers, the priests, forced him to become impure against his will. And there is the incident of Yosef the priest, whose wife died on the eve of Passover, and he did not want to become impure, but his priestly brothers counted him as impure against his will.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי (במדבר ו, ז) ולאחותו מה ת"ל הרי שהלך לשחוט את פסחו ולמול את בנו ושמע שמת לו מת יכול יטמא אמרת (במדבר ו, ז) לא יטמא
human_translation: And raise a contradiction What the verse states or for his sister went to slaughter his Paschal offering or to circumcise his son, and he heard that of his died, might become impure You say, “he shall not become impure.”
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: What is the teaching regarding his sister? What does the Torah teach us? Behold, if he went to slaughter his Passover offering and to circumcise his son, and he heard that his relative had died, one might think he should become impure. You say, "He shall not become impure."

hebrew_text: יכול כשם שלא יטמא לאחותו כך אין מטמא למת מצוה ת"ל ולאחותו לאחותו הוא דאינו מטמא אבל מטמא הוא למת מצוה
human_translation: might just as he may not become impure to his sister, so too he may not become impure to a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ]. The verse states: “Or for his sister,” it is to his sister that he may not become impure, but he does become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: It is possible that just as he does not become impure for his sister, so too he does not become impure for a deceased relative who is a mitzvah. It is stated: "And for his sister he shall not become impure." It is his sister's sister for whom he does not become impure, but he does become impure for a deceased relative who is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: לאו ש"מ כאן קודם חצות כאן לאחר חצות
human_translation: not learn from Here, before midday, There, after midday.
llm_translation: Not here before midnight, here after midnight.

hebrew_text: ממאי דילמא לעולם אימא לך אידי ואידי אחר חצות והא רבי ישמעאל והא ר"ע דתניא לה יטמא רשות דברי רבי ישמעאל ר"ע אומר חובה
human_translation: From where Actually, perhaps I will say to you: this and that after midday. And this Rabbi Yishmael, and that Rabbi Akiva. As it is taught for her may he become impure” optional, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: mandatory.
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps, "I will say to you, both this and that after midnight." But Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: "With regard to her, she shall become impure" - the words of Rabbi Yishmael; Rabbi Akiva says, "It is obligatory."

hebrew_text: לא ס"ד דרישא דההיא ר"ע קתני לה דתניא ר"ע אומר (במדבר ו, ו) נפש אלו הקרובים מת אלו הרחוקים
human_translation: not enter your mind, because Rabbi Akiva teaches the first clause of As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: “body [ nefesh ]” relatives. “dead [ met ]” non-relatives.
llm_translation: Not think first part of that Rabbi Akiva teaches her for it is taught Rabbi Akiva says (Numbers 6:6) "soul" - these are the close ones; "dies" - these are the distant ones.

hebrew_text: לאביו אינו מטמא אבל מטמא הוא למת מצוה לאמו היה כהן והוא נזיר לאמו הוא דאינו מטמא אבל מטמא הוא למת מצוה לאחיו שאם היה כ"ג והוא נזיר לאחיו הוא דאינו מטמא אבל מטמא הוא למת מצוה
human_translation: “For his father,” he may not become impure but he does become impure to a met mitzva . “For his mother,” he was a priest and he was a nazirite, he may not become impure to his mother but he does become impure to a met mitzva . “For his brother,” that if he was a High Priest, and he a nazirite, he may not become impure to his brother but he does become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: To his father, he does not render impure, but he renders impure for a deceased who is a mitzvah. To his mother, if he was a kohen and he is a nazir to his mother, he does not render impure, but he renders impure for a deceased who is a mitzvah. To his brother, if he was a kohen gadol and he is a nazir to his brother, he does not render impure, but he renders impure for a deceased who is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ולאחותו מה ת"ל הרי שהלך לשחוט את פסחו ולמול את בנו ושמע שמת לו מת יכול יטמא אמרת לא יטמא יכול כשם שאין מטמא לאחותו כך אינו מטמא למת מצוה תלמוד לומר ולאחותו לאחותו לא יטמא אבל יטמא הוא למת מצוה
human_translation: What the verse states: “Or for his sister”? went to slaughter his Paschal offering or to circumcise his son, and he heard that of his died, might become impure. You say he may not become impure. might just as he may not become impure to his sister, so too he may not become impure to a met mitzva . The verse states: “Or for his sister,” he may not become impure to his sister but he does become impure to a met mitzva .
llm_translation: And to his sister, what does the Torah teach? Behold, if he went to slaughter his Passover offering and to circumcise his son, and he heard that his relative had died, one might think he should become impure. You say he should not become impure. One might think just as he does not become impure for his sister, so too he does not become impure for a deceased relative who is a mitzvah. The Torah teaches to say, "And to his sister" - to his sister he shall not become impure, but he shall become impure for a deceased relative who is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אידי ואידי אחר חצות ול"ק כאן קודם ששחטו וזרקו עליו כאן לאחר ששחטו וזרקו עליו
human_translation: Rava said this and that after midday and not difficult. Here, before slaughtered and sprinkled on his account, There, after slaughtered and sprinkled on his account.
llm_translation: Rava said: Both this and the other opinion after midnight. And there is a difference here: before they slaughtered and sprinkled upon it, here means after they slaughtered and sprinkled upon it.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אדא בר מתנה לרבא אחר ששחטו וזרקו את דמו מה דהוה הוה א"ל רבינא אכילת פסחים מעכבא מדרבה בר רב הונא א"ל ציית מאי דקאמר לך רבך
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rava: after slaughtered and sprinkled its blood, What was, was, Ravina said to Partaking of Paschal offering is indispensable from that which Rabba bar Rav Huna said to Listen to what your master, told you,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Matna said to Rava: After one slaughters it and throws its blood, what is the law? Ravina said to him: The eating of the Passover offering is a hindrance, as Rabba bar Rav Huna said to him: "Obey your master."

hebrew_text: מאי דרבה בר רב הונא דתניא יום שמועה כיום קבורה למצות שבעה ושלשים ולאכילת פסחים כיום ליקוט עצמות אחד זה ואחד זה טובל ואוכל בקדשים לערב
human_translation: What of Rabba bar Rav Huna As it is taught The day tidings as the day of burial to the mitzva of seven and thirty And with regard to partaking of Paschal offering, like the day of the gathering of bones both this and that he immerses and partakes of sacrificial in the evening.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of Rabbah bar Rav Huna as it was taught: The day of hearing is like the day of burial for the thirty-seven commandments, and the eating of the Passover offerings is like the day of gathering bones. One and the other immerse and eat of the holy offerings in the evening.

llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 10:16), "And the goat of the sin offering Moses diligently sought, the goat - this is the goat of Nahshon, the sin offering - this is the sin offering of the eighth day. He expounded: 'The goat of Rosh Chodesh.'"

hebrew_text: יכול שלשתן נשרפו ת"ל והנה שורף אחד נשרף ולא שלשתן נשרפו דרש דרש שתי דרישות למה אמר להו מפני מה חטאת זו נשרפה ואלו מונחות ואיני יודע איזהו כשהוא אומר (ויקרא י, יז) ואותה נתן לכם לשאת את עון העדה הוי אומר זה שעיר של ראש חודש
human_translation: might three of them were burned. the verse states: and, behold, it was burned,” one was burned, but not three of them were burned. diligently inquired [ darosh darash ].” Why two inquiries? said to them: For what this sin offering burned, and those left I do not know which of them When it states “And He has given it to you to bear the iniquity of the congregation” you must say: This is the goat of the New Moon,
llm_translation: I can infer that all three sin offerings were burned. The verse teaches us, "And behold, one is burned," indicating that only one was burned, and not all three were burned. He expounded and expounded again, asking, "For what reason was this sin offering burned, while these others were left to be eaten and I do not know which one is meant?" When it says, "And he gave it to you to carry the sin of the congregation," you should say, "This refers to the he-goat of Rosh Chodesh."

hebrew_text: שפיר קאמרי ליה רבי נחמיה לטעמיה דאמר קדשי שעה לא פסלה בהו אנינות
human_translation: say well to Rabbi Neḥemya to his reasoning, as he says: Acute mourning does not disqualify offerings of time.
llm_translation: "Good are saying to him Rabbi Nechemiah according to his reasoning, as he said, temporary sanctities do not disqualify due to mourning."

hebrew_text: אמר מר היה לו לאכלה לערב שפיר קאמרי ליה קסבר אנינות לילה דאורייתא
human_translation: The Master says He should have eaten it in the evening. say well to holds acute mourning in the evening by Torah law,
llm_translation: Said Mar: "It would have been fitting for him to eat in the evening." They said to him: "They hold that nighttime mourning is from the Torah."

hebrew_text: דבר אחר והלא פינחס היה עמהן שפיר קאמרי ליה סבר לה כרבי אלעזר דאר"א א"ר חנינא לא נתכהן פינחס עד שהרגו לזמרי דכתיב (במדבר כה, יג) והיתה לו ולזרעו אחריו ברית כהונת עולם
human_translation: Alternatively, wasn’t Pinehas, with them? say well to He holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. As Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Ḥanina says: Pinehas did not become a priest until he killed Zimri, As it is written “And it shall be unto him and to his seed after him the covenant of an everlasting priesthood”
llm_translation: Another explanation: But wasn't Pinchas with them? They were indeed saying well to him. He thought like Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as Rabbi Chanina said: Pinchas did not receive the priesthood until he killed Zimri, as it is written (Numbers 25:13), "And it shall be for him and for his descendants after him a covenant of eternal priesthood."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר עד ששם שלום בין השבטים שנאמר (יהושע כב, ל) וישמע פינחס הכהן ונשיאי העדה וראשי אלפי ישראל וגו'
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: until he made peace among the tribes as it is stated: “And Pinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, and the heads of the thousands of Israel heard
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, "Until there is peace among the tribes, as it is stated (Joshua 22:30), 'And when Phinehas the priest and the princes of the congregation and heads of the thousands of Israel heard...'"

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי והכתיב והיתה לו ולזרעו אחריו כי כתיב ההוא בברכה הוא דכתיב
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “And it shall be unto him, and to his seed after him, When that is written, with regard to blessing that it is written,
llm_translation: And the other also, and it is written, "And it shall be for him and for his descendants after him," for it is written in blessing, that is what is written.

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב וישמע פינחס הכהן ההוא ליחס זרעו אחריו
human_translation: And the other as well, isn’t it written: “And Pinehas the priest…heard”? That to entitle his descendants after him,
llm_translation: And the other one also, it is written: "And Phinehas the priest heard that, and he followed after his lineage."

hebrew_text: אמר רב משה רבינו כהן גדול וחולק בקדשי שמים היה שנאמר (ויקרא ח, כט) מאיל המלואים למשה היה למנה
human_translation: Rav says: Moses, our teacher, a High Priest and would receive a share of offerings to Heaven, as it is stated: it was Moses’ portion of the ram of inauguration,
llm_translation: Rav Moshe Rabbeinu the High Priest said and divides in the holy items of Heaven, as it is said (Leviticus 8:29) "From the ram of ordination, for Moshe, it was for his portion."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי והלא פינחס היה עמהן ואם איתא לימא והלא משה רבינו היה עמהן דילמא שאני משה דטריד בשכינה דאמר מר משה בהשכמה עלה ובהשכמה ירד
human_translation: raises an objection: Wasn’t Pinehas with them? And if it is so let them say: Wasn’t Moses, our teacher, with them? Perhaps Moses is different, since he was preoccupied with the Divine Presence, As the Master says: Moses ascended early in the morning, and descended early in the morning.
llm_translation: The question was raised: But was not Pinchas among them? And if you wish, you may say: But was not our teacher Moses among them? Perhaps Moses is different, for he was troubled by the Divine Presence, as the Master said: "Moses ascended with the dawn and descended with the dawn."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי (ויקרא כא, כב) לחם אלהיו מקדשי הקדשים ומן הקדשים יאכל אם נאמרו קדשי קדשים למה נאמר קדשים קלים ואם נאמרו קדשים קלים למה נאמר קדשי קדשים
human_translation: raises an objection “He may eat the bread of his God, both of the most sacred, and of the sacred” If offerings of the most sacred order are stated, why offerings of lesser sanctity stated? And if offerings of lesser sanctity are stated, why offerings of the most sacred order stated?
llm_translation: Challengers (Leviticus 21:22) "The bread of his God, of the most holy things, and of the holy things he shall eat." If the most holy things were already mentioned, why does it say holy things? And if the holy things were already mentioned, why does it say the most holy things?

hebrew_text: אילו לא נאמר קדשים קלים הייתי אומר קדשי קדשים הוא דאוכל . שהרי הותרו לזר ולהן קדשים קלים לא יאכל ואילו לא נאמרו קדשי קדשים הייתי אומר בקדשים קלים יהא אוכל שהן קלים בקדשי קדשים לא יהא אוכל לכך נאמרו קדשי קדשים ולכך נאמר קדשים קלים
human_translation: Had offerings of lesser sanctity not been stated, I would have said: It is offerings of the most sacred order that may eat, as they were permitted to a non-priest and to may not eat offerings of lesser sanctity, And had offerings of the most sacred order not been stated, I would have said: may eat offerings of lesser sanctity, as they are of lesser sanctity, he may not eat of offerings of the most sacred order, Therefore, offerings of the most sacred order are stated, and therefore, offerings of lesser sanctity stated.
llm_translation: If it were not stated "light holy things," I would say one may eat "holy of holies," for indeed they were permitted to a non-priest, and to them "light holy things" may not eat. And if it were not stated "holy of holies," I would say in "light holy things" one may eat, for they are light; in "holy of holies" one may not eat. Therefore, "holy of holies" were stated, and therefore "light holy things" were stated.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא שהרי הותרו לזר ולהן לאו משה אמר רב ששת לא בבמה לזר וכדברי האומר יש מנחה בבמה
human_translation: In any event, teaches: As they were permitted to a non-priest and to not Moses? Rav Sheshet said: No, to a non-priest on altar. And in accordance with the statement of the says: There is a meal offering on altar.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: For behold, it was permitted for a non-priest, but not for them. Did Moses not say? Rav Sheshet said: Not on a high place for a non-priest, and according to the words of one who says, "There is an offering on a high place."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מרים מי הסגירה א"ת משה הסגירה משה זר הוא
human_translation: raises an objection Miriam who quarantined her? If you say Moses quarantined her, Moses a non-priest,
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: "Miriam, who closed it?" "If you say Moses closed it, Moses is a stranger."

hebrew_text: ואין זר רואה את הנגעים וא"ת אהרן הסגירה אהרן קרוב הוא ואין קרוב רואה את הנגעים אלא כבוד גדול חלק לה הקב"ה למרים אותה שעה אני כהן ואני מסגירה אני חולטה ואני פוטרה
human_translation: and a non-priest may not inspect the marks And if you say Aaron quarantined her, Aaron a relative, and a relative may not inspect the marks. Rather, the Holy One, Blessed be He, bestowed a great honor on Miriam at that time, I am a priest, and I quarantine her I declare her and I exempt her
llm_translation: "And a non-priest does not see the afflictions. And if you ask, 'Aaron was a priest, Aaron was close, and a close relative does not see the afflictions,' rather, a great honor did the Holy One, blessed be He, bestow upon Miriam at that moment: 'I am a priest, and I am the one who closes, I am the one who makes leprous, and I am the one who declares clean.'"

hebrew_text: קתני מיהת משה זר ואין זר רואה את הנגעים
human_translation: In any event, teaches: Moses a non-priest, and a non-priest may not inspect the marks,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "From the word 'Moses' it is derived that a non-priest may not inspect skin afflictions."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק שאני מראות נגעים דאהרן ובניו כתובין בפרשה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: shades of marks are different, because Aaron and his sons, are written in the passage
llm_translation: Said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "I am different in regards to the appearance of afflictions of Aaron and his sons, as it is written in the portion."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חמש שמחות היתה אלישבע יתירה על בנות ישראל יבמה מלך אישה כהן גדול בנה סגן בן בנה משוח מלחמה ואחיה נשיא שבט ואבילה על שני בניה
human_translation: raises an objection Elisheva, had five more joy than daughters of Israel Her brother-in-law, a king; her husband, High Priest; her son, deputy her son’s son, anointed for war, and her brother, the prince of tribe But in mourning for her two sons,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Beraita: Five joys did Elisheva have more than the daughters of Israel: her brother-in-law was a king, her husband was a High Priest, her son was a deputy High Priest, her grandson was anointed for war, and her brother was a tribal leader, and she mourned over her two sons.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהת יבמה מלך מלך אין כ"ג לא אימא אף מלך
human_translation: In any event, teaches: Her brother-in-law, a king. yes, a king, not a High Priest, Say a king as well,
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: "Yevamah, King, King, there is none like him." Not "King," rather "even King."

hebrew_text: כתנאי (שמות ד, יד) ויחר אף ה' במשה רבי יהושע בן קרחה אומר כל חרון אף שבתורה נאמר בו רושם וזה לא נאמר בו רושם
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , “And the anger of the Lord burned against Moses, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: every burning anger that in the Torah, its effect is stated, but this no effect of is stated.
llm_translation: Tannaite (Exodus 4:14), "And the anger of the Lord burned against Moses." Rabbi Joshua ben Korḥa says, "Every expression of anger mentioned in the Torah has a mark, yet this one does not have a mark."

hebrew_text: ר"ש בן יוחי אומר אף זה נאמר בו רושם שנאמר (שמות ד, יד) הלא אהרן אחיך הלוי והלא כהן הוא הכי קאמר אני אמרתי אתה כהן והוא לוי עכשיו הוא כהן ואתה לוי
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: Even in this effect is stated, as it is stated “Is there not Aaron your brother the Levite? But isn’t a priest? This is saying I said you priest and he Levite; now he priest and you Levite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Also this was said regarding him, as it is said (Exodus 4:14), "Is it not Aaron the Levite? Is he not a kohen?" This is what he is saying: I said you are a kohen and he is a Levite. Now he is a kohen and you are a Levite.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים לא נתכהן משה אלא שבעת ימי המלואים בלבד ויש אומרים לא פסקה כהונה אלא מזרעו של משה שנאמר (דברי הימים א כג, יד) ומשה איש האלהים בניו יקראו על שבט הלוי ואומר (תהלים צט, ו) משה ואהרן בכהניו ושמואל בקוראי שמו
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Moses became a priest the seven days of inauguration alone, And some say: priesthood expired only for the descendants of Moses, as it is stated: “But as for Moses the man of God, his sons are named among the tribe of Levi” And states: “Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among them that call upon His name,
llm_translation: The Sages say: Moses was only anointed for the seven days of inauguration. And there are those who say: The priesthood did not cease except from the seed of Moses, as it is said (1 Chronicles 23:14), "And Moses, the man of God, his sons were called upon the tribe of Levi." And it is said (Psalm 99:6), "Moses and Aaron among His priests, and Samuel among those who call upon His name."

hebrew_text: מאי ואומר וכי תימא לדורות הוא דכתיב ואומר משה ואהרן בכהניו
human_translation: What And states? And if you would say is written only for generations, And states: “Moses and Aaron among His priests.”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he said"? And if you say it is for generations, it is written "and Moses and Aaron among His priests."

hebrew_text: וכל חרון אף שבתורה נאמר בו רושם והכתיב (שמות יא, ח) ויצא (משה) מעם פרעה בחרי אף ולא א"ל ולא מידי אמר ר"ל סטרו ויצא
human_translation: And every burning anger that in the Torah, its effect is stated? But isn’t it written “And he went out from Pharaoh in hot anger” And did not say anything to Reish Lakish said: slapped him and left.
llm_translation: And all anger even though in the Torah it is said about it "fury," and it is written (Exodus 11:8) "And Moses went out from Pharaoh in a great anger," and he did not say to him anything, and not immediately, said Rabbi Levi: "He restrained himself and went out."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר ר"ל הכי והכתיב (שמות ז, טו) ונצבת לקראתו על שפת היאור ואמר ר"ל מלך הוא והסביר לו פנים ורבי יוחנן אמר רשע הוא והעיז פניך בו איפוך
human_translation: And does Reish Lakish say this? But isn’t it written: and you shall stand by the river’s brink to meet him, and Reish Lakish says: is a king, and be amiable toward him, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: is wicked, and be insolent toward him. Reverse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And did Rabbi Levi say so? But it is written (Exodus 7:15), 'And you shall stand to meet him by the river's bank.' And Rabbi Levi said, 'He is a king, and one must show him respect.' And Rabbi Yochanan said, 'He is wicked, and you should confront him.'"

hebrew_text: א"ר ינאי לעולם תהא אימת מלכות עליך דכתיב (שמות יא, ח) וירדו כל עבדיך אלה אלי ואילו לדידיה לא קאמר ליה
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: Fear of kingship should always be upon you, as it is written “And all these your servants shall come down unto me but he did not say of himself,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: Always let the fear of the kingdom be upon you, as it is written (Exodus 11:8), "And all these servants of yours will come down to me," but it did not say for him.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר מהכא (מלכים א יח, מו) ויד ה' היתה אל אליהו וישנס מתניו וירץ לפני אחאב
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: from here: “And the hand of the Lord was on Elijah, and he girded up his loins and ran before Ahab
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: From here (I Kings 18:46) "And the hand of the Lord was upon Elijah, and he girded up his loins and ran before Ahab."

hebrew_text: אמר עולא בקש משה מלכות ולא נתנו לו דכתיב (שמות ג, ה) אל תקרב הלום ואין הלום אלא מלכות שנאמר (שמואל ב ז, יח) מי אנכי ה' אלהים [וגו'] כי הביאתני עד הלום
human_translation: Ulla says: Moses requested kingship, but it was not given to him, as it is written: “Do not draw hither” and “hither” nothing other than kingship, as it is stated: Who am I, O Lord God, that You have brought me hither”?
llm_translation: Ula said: Moses sought the kingship, but it was not granted to him, as it is written (Exodus 3:5), "Do not come closer here." And 'here' is none other than kingship, as it is said (2 Samuel 7:18), "Who am I, Lord God, and what is my house, that You have brought me up to here."

hebrew_text: מתיב רבא רבי ישמעאל אומר יבמה מלך אמר רבא לו ולזרעו קאמר
human_translation: Rava raises an objection Rabbi Yishmael says: brother-in-law, a king. Rava said: is saying for himself and for his descendants,
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection: Rabbi Yishmael says, "A yevamah (widow who is obligated to marry her deceased husband's brother) belongs to the king." Rava said to him, "He (the deceased husband) and his descendants."

hebrew_text: וכל היכא דכתיב הלום לדורות הוא והא גבי שאול דכתיב (שמואל א י, כב) הבא עוד הלום איש הוא אין זרעו לא
human_translation: And anywhere that it is written “hither” is for generations But isn’t it written about Saul: Is there yet a man who comes hither” indeed his descendants not.
llm_translation: And all the place where it is written "Halom" is for generations, and regarding Saul where it is written (1 Samuel 1:22) "Is he not here by the Halom?" He is a man, there is none like him.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא הא הוה איש בשת ואיבעית אימא שאני שאול דאפי' בגויה לא קאים
human_translation: If you wish, say: There was Ish-Bosheth, And if you wish, say Saul is different, because did not stand even for himself,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: This is similar to the case of Ish-bosheth. And if you wish, say: It is different because Saul did not even stand in his body.

hebrew_text: כדר' אלעזר אמר רבי חנינא בשעה שפוסקים גדולה לאדם פוסקים לו ולזרעו עד סוף כל הדורות שנאמר (איוב לו, ז) לא יגרע מצדיק עיניו ואת מלכים לכסא וגו' ואם הגיס דעתו הקב"ה משפילו שנאמר (איוב לו, ח) ואם אסורים בזקים ילכדון בחבלי עוני:
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Elazar Rabbi Ḥanina says: When greatness is apportioned to a person is apportioned to him and to his descendants until the end of all generations, as it is stated: “He withdraws not His eyes from the righteous; but with kings upon the throne But if he became arrogant, the Holy One, Blessed be He, humiliates him, as is stated “And if they be bound in fetters, and be held in cords of affliction”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: When they decree greatness for a person, they decree it for him and his descendants until the end of all generations, as it is stated (Job 36:7), "He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous, but with kings on the throne, etc." And if one's mind becomes arrogant, the Holy One, blessed be He, degrades him, as it is stated (Job 36:8), "And if they are bound in fetters, caught in the cords of affliction."

hebrew_text: בעלי מומין בין בעלי מומין כו': מנא ה"מ דת"ר (ויקרא ו, יא) כל זכר לרבות בעלי מומין
human_translation: Blemished whether blemished From where are these matters As the Sages taught “Every male to include blemished
llm_translation: Owners of blemishes, whether owners of blemishes, etc.: Whence do we derive this? As the Rabbis taught (Leviticus 6:11), "Any male" includes owners of blemishes.

hebrew_text: למאי אי לאכילה הרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא כא, כב) לחם אלהיו מקדשי הקדשים יאכל אלא לחלוקה
human_translation: For what If for consumption, it is already stated He may eat the bread of his God, of the most sacred, Rather, for receiving a share,
llm_translation: Regarding what? If for eating, behold it was already stated (Leviticus 21:22), "He shall eat the bread of his God, of the most holy and of the holy." Rather, it is for division.

hebrew_text: תניא אידך כל זכר לרבות בעלי מומין למאי אי לאכילה הרי כבר אמור אי לחלוקה הרי כבר אמור שיכול אין לי אלא תם ונעשה בעל מום בעל מום מעיקרו מנין ת"ל כל זכר
human_translation: is taught another “Every male to include blemished For what If for consumption, isn’t already stated If for receiving a share, isn’t already stated because might I have only unblemished and became blemished. From where blemished from birth The verse states “Every male.”
llm_translation: It is taught in another source: "Every male" includes those with blemishes. For what? If for eating, it has already been stated. If for sharing, it has already been stated. One might think I only have a complete animal, and if it becomes blemished, it is considered blemished. From where do we derive this? The Torah states, "Every male."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך כל זכר לרבות בעל מום למאי אי לאכילה הרי כבר אמור ואי לחלוקה הרי כבר אמור ואי לבעל מום מעיקרו הרי כבר אמור שיכול אין לי אלא בעל מום קבוע בעל מום עובר מנין ת"ל כל זכר
human_translation: is taught another “Every male to include a blemished For what If for eating, isn’t already stated? And if for receiving a share, isn’t already stated? And if for blemished from birth, isn’t already stated? because might I have only a permanently blemished From where temporarily blemished The verse states “Every male.”
llm_translation: It was taught in another source: "Every male" includes one with a blemish. For what? If for eating, it has already been stated. And if for division, it has already been stated. And if for one with a blemish from the outset, it has already been stated. One might have thought I only have liability for a fixed blemish. How do we know that one with a temporary blemish is also included? The verse states, "Every male."

hebrew_text: כלפי לייא אמר רב ששת איפוך
human_translation: Isn’t it the opposite [ kelapei layya ]? Rav Sheshet said: Reverse
llm_translation: Towards Leah, Rav Sheshet said: "Ipuḥ."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר לעולם לא תיפוך ואיצטריך סלקא דעתך אמינא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, do not reverse and was necessary enter your mind to say
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Always do not turn, and it was necessary for your mind to say."

hebrew_text: כי טמא מה טמא כמה דלא טהור לא אכיל אף האי נמי כמה דלא מתקן לא אכיל קא משמע לן:
human_translation: like a ritually impure Just as an impure may not partake as long as he is not pure, so too, this may not partake as long as he does not become fit. teaches us
llm_translation: When impure, how impure? Just as when not pure, do not eat, so too this also, how not fixed, do not eat, this is what it teaches us.

hebrew_text: כל שאינו ראוי וכו': ולא והרי בעל מום דלא ראוי לעבודה וחולק ותו הא ראוי לעבודה חולק הרי טמא בקרבנות ציבור דראוי לעבודה ואינו חולק
human_translation: Any who is unfit But doesn’t Isn’t a blemished who is not fit for the service and receives a share And furthermore, but fit for the service receive a share. isn’t an impure who, with regard to offerings of the community, is fit for the service, and does not receive a share?
llm_translation: "Anyone who is not fitting, etc.: And not 'Behold, a blemished animal' that is not fitting for service and divides. And also, one that is fitting for service divides, behold, impure in communal sacrifices, fitting for service and does not divide."

hebrew_text: ראוי לאכיל' קאמר
human_translation: is saying fit for partaking
llm_translation: Fit for eating, it says.

hebrew_text: והרי קטן דראוי לאכילה ואינו חולק הא לא קתני
human_translation: But isn’t minor, who is fit for partaking and does not receive a share? This is not taught.
llm_translation: And behold, a minor who is fit for eating and does not divide, but it was not taught.

hebrew_text: השתא דאתית להכי לעולם כדקאמר מעיקרא אי משום טמא טמא לא קתני ואי משום בעל מום רחמנא רבייה:
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this actually what said at the outset, If with regard to an impure does not teach an impure And if with regard to a blemished the Merciful One included him
llm_translation: At this moment, since you have come to this, forever as it was stated from the beginning: If due to impurity, impure, it does not teach. And if due to a blemish, the Merciful One, its Master.

hebrew_text: אפי' טמא בשעת זריקת דמים וטהור בשעת הקטר חלבים אינו חולק: הא טהור בשעת זריקת דמים וטמא בשעת הקטר חלבים חולק
human_translation: Even ritually impure at the time of the sprinkling of the blood and pure at the time of the burning of the fats, does not receive a share Consequently, pure at the time of the sprinkling of the blood, impure at the time of the burning of the fats, does receive a share.
llm_translation: Even impure at the time of blood sprinkling and pure at the time of offering incense does not divide. But if he is pure at the time of blood sprinkling and impure at the time of offering incense, he does divide.

hebrew_text: מתניתין דלא כאבא שאול דתניא אבא שאול אומר לעולם אינו אוכל עד שיהא טהור משעת זריקה עד שעת הקטר חלבים דאמר קרא (ויקרא ז, לג) המקריב את דם השלמים ואת החלב דאפי' הקטר חלבים נמי בעי:
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Abba Shaul, as it is taught Abba Shaul says: never partakes, unless he is pure from the time of sprinkling until the time of the burning of the fats, as the verse states: who sacrifices the blood of the peace offerings and the fat requires even the burning of the fats.
llm_translation: Mishnaic teachings that are not like Abba Shaul, as it was taught: Abba Shaul says, "One should never eat until he is pure from the time of sprinkling until the time of offering the fats," as the verse states (Leviticus 7:33), "The one who offers the sacrifice of peace offerings and the fats." For even the offering of fats also requires purity.

hebrew_text: בעי רב אשי נטמא בינתיים מהו בשעת זריקה ובשעת הקטרה בעינן והאיכא או דלמא עד שיהא טהור משעת זריקה ועד שעת הקטר חלבים תיקו
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma: became impure between what is Do we require at the time of sprinkling and at the time of burning and there is Or perhaps unless he is pure from the time of sprinkling until the time of the burning of the fats, shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Ashi asked: If one became impure in the meantime, what is the law regarding at the time of sprinkling and at the time of offering the incense? And there is a difficulty: perhaps one must be pure from the time of sprinkling until the time of offering the incense. Halakhic conclusion: "Silence is a sign of agreement."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא האי דינא מרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון גמירנא דאמר בבית הכסא דנתה בא טבול יום ואמר תן לי ממנחה ואוכל
human_translation: Rava says: I learned this halakha from Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said in the bathroom: You contend who immersed that day came and said Give me of a meal offering, and I will partake
llm_translation: Rava said: This law of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon we have learned, as he said in the restroom: If one who is a tevul yom entered and said, "Give me some bread so I can eat."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ומה אם במקום שיפה כחך בחטאתך דחיתיך מחטאת ישראל מקום שהורע כחך במנחתך אינו דין שאדיחך ממנחת ישראל
human_translation: said to him: Just as with regard to where your right is superior, in your sin offering, I deny you of the sin offering of an Israelite is it not logical that where your right is inferior, in your meal offering, I deny you of the meal offering of an Israelite?
llm_translation: He said to him, "And what if in a place where your strength is beautiful, I pushed you away from your sin offering of Israel, in a place where your strength is weakened in your meal offering, it is not proper that I should push you away from the meal offering of Israel."

hebrew_text: ומה אם דחיתני מחטאת ישראל שכשם שיפה כחי כך יפה כחך תדחיני ממנחה שכשם שהורע כחי כך הורע כחך
human_translation: But if you deny me of the sin offering of an Israelite since just as my right is superior so too, your right is superior you refuse me of meal offering where just as my right is inferior, so your right is inferior,
llm_translation: And what if you have pushed me away from the sin offering of Israel, for just as my strength is beautiful, so too may your strength be beautiful; push me away from the meal offering, for just as my strength is weakened, so too may your strength be weakened.

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא ז, ט) לכהן המקריב אותה לו תהיה בא הקרב ואכול
human_translation: states: shall be the priest’s that offers it” come sacrifice and partake
llm_translation: Behold he says (Leviticus 7:9), "To the kohen who offers it, it shall be his; it shall come as a gift, and he shall eat."

hebrew_text: תן לי מחטאת ישראל ואוכל
human_translation: Give me of the sin offering of an Israelite, and I will partake
llm_translation: Give me the sin offering of Israel and I will eat.

hebrew_text: א"ל ומה במקום שהורע כחי במנחתי דחיתיך ממנחת ישראל מקום שיפה כחי בחטאתי אינו דין שאדיחך מחטאת ישראל
human_translation: said to him: Just as with regard to where my right is inferior, in my meal offering, I deny you of the meal offering of an Israelite, is it not logical that where my right is superior, in my sin offering, I deny you of the sin offering of an Israelite?
llm_translation: He said to Him, "And in a place where my strength was weakened in my meal offering, I have pushed You away from the meal offering of Israel. In a place where my strength was strong in my sin offering, it is not proper that I should push You away from the sin offering of Israel."

hebrew_text: א"ל ומה אם שדחיתני ממנחת ישראל שכשם שהורע כחך כך הורע כחי תדחיני מחטאת ישראל שכשם שיפה כחך כך יפה כחי
human_translation: said to him: But if you deny me of the meal offering of an Israelite, where just as your right is inferior, so too my right is inferior, you deny me of the sin offering of an Israelite, where just as your right is superior so too my right is superior
llm_translation: He said to him: "And what if you have rejected me from the meal offering of Israel? Just as you have weakened my strength, so too weaken my sin offering of Israel. Just as you have beautified my strength, so too beautify my sin offering."

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא ו, יט) הכהן המחטא אותה יאכלנה בא חטא ואכול
human_translation: states “The priest who effects atonement shall eat it” come effect atonement and partake
llm_translation: Behold he says (Leviticus 6:19) "The priest who sins, he shall eat it; in a holy place shall it be eaten." He comes, sins, and eats.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה תן לי מחזה ושוק ואוכל
human_translation: said to him: Give me of breast and thigh, and I will partake
llm_translation: He said to him, "Give me the chest and thigh, and I will eat."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ומה במקום שיפה כחך בחטאתך דחיתיך [מחטאת ישראל] (מחזה ושוק) מקום שהורע כחך בשלמים שאין לך בהן אלא חזה ושוק אינו דין שאדיחך
human_translation: said to him: Just as with regard to where your right is superior, in your sin offering, I deny you of the sin offering of an Israelite, is it not logical that where your right is inferior, in a peace offering, of which you have only breast and thigh, I deny you
llm_translation: He said to him, "And in a place where your strength is beautiful in your sin offering, I pushed you away from the sin offering of Israel (Vision and Thigh), in a place where your strength is bad in the peace offerings, which only have the chest and thigh, it is not proper that I push you away."

hebrew_text: מה אם דחיתני מחטאת שכן הורע כחי אצל נשיי ועבדיי תדחיני מחזה ושוק שכן יפה כחי אצל נשיי ועבדיי
human_translation: if you deny me of a sin offering, where my right is inferior with regard to my wives and my slaves, you deny me of breast and thigh where my right is superior with regard to my wives and my slaves,
llm_translation: What if you pushed me from the sin offering, for it is as harmful as my strength with my wives and my servants, you will push me from the vision and the thigh, for it is as beautiful as my strength with my wives and my servants.

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא ז, יד) לכהן הזורק את דם השלמים לו יהיה בא זרוק ואכול
human_translation: states “It shall be the priest’s that sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings come sprinkle and partake
llm_translation: Behold, he says (Leviticus 7:14), "To the priest who throws the blood of the peace offerings, it shall be, the one who throws, and eats."

hebrew_text: יצא טבול יום קוליו וחמוריו על ראשו אונן מימינו מחוסר כפרה משמאלו
human_translation: who immersed that day left his a fortiori upon his head, an acute mourner on his right who had not yet atonement on his left.
llm_translation: He went out, the Tevul Yom, his voice and his donkey on his head, an Onen to his right, lacking atonement, to his left.

hebrew_text: פריך רב אחאי לימא ליה תן לי מבכור ואוכל
human_translation: Rav Aḥai refutes Let say to Give me of a firstborn and I will partake
llm_translation: Rav Ahai posed a question: "Let me eat the firstborn."

hebrew_text: משום דא"ל ומה במקום שהורע כחי בחטאת אצל נשיי ועבדיי דחיתיך מחטאת ישראל מקום שיפה כחי בבכור דכוליה דילי היא אינו דין שאדחך ממנו
human_translation: because say to him: Just as with regard to a sin offering, where my right is inferior with regard to my wives and my slaves, I deny you of the sin offering of an Israelite, is it not logical that with regard to a first-born, where my right is superior because all of is mine, I deny you of it?
llm_translation: Because he said, "And what in a place where my power was weakened in the sin offering by my wives and my servants, I have pushed you away from the sin offering of Israel, in a place where my power was strengthened in the firstborn, for all of it is mine, it is not proper that you should be pushed away from it."

hebrew_text: ומה אם דחיתני מחטאת שכשם שהורע כחך כך הורע כחי תדיחני מבכור שכשם שיפה כחך כך יפה כחי
human_translation: But if you deny me of a sin offering, where just as your right is inferior, so is my right inferior; you deny me of a firstborn where just as your right is superior, so my right is superior?
llm_translation: And what if you pushed me away from the sin offering, just as your strength was weakened, so too was my strength weakened; you will push me away from the firstborn, just as your beauty was diminished, so too will my beauty be diminished.

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר (במדבר יח, יז) את דמם תזרוק על המזבח ואת חלבם תקטיר ובשרם יהיה לך בא זרוק ואכול
human_translation: says “You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar and shall make their fat smoke And the flesh of them shall be yours, come sprinkle and partake
llm_translation: Behold he says (Numbers 18:17) "Their blood you shall sprinkle on the altar and their fat you shall offer up, and their flesh shall be yours; come, sprinkle and eat."

hebrew_text: ואידך פריך מי כתיב ובשרם לכהן הזורק ובשרם יהיה לך כתיב אפי' לכהן אחר
human_translation: But the other refute Is it written: And the flesh of them shall be for the priest who sprinkles, is written: “And the flesh of them shall be yours,” even to a priest other
llm_translation: And the other one asks: Where is it written "and their flesh shall be for the priest who throws"? It is written "and their flesh shall be for you." It is written even for another priest.

hebrew_text: והיכי עביד הכי והאמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן בכל מקום מותר להרהר חוץ ממרחץ ומבית הכסא לאונסו שאני:
human_translation: And how did do this? But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan says: permitted to contemplate in all places except the bathhouse and the bathroom? involuntary is different.
llm_translation: And how does one do so? But didn't Rabbah bar bar Ḥannah say in the name of Yoḥanan: In every place it is permitted to contemplate, except for from the bathhouse and the restroom, due to his lack of control.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל שלא זכה המזבח בבשרה לא זכו כהנים בעורה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, ח) עולת איש עולה שעלתה לאיש
human_translation: any for which the altar did not acquire its flesh, priests did not acquire its hide, as it is stated a man’s burnt offering, a burnt offering that satisfied of a man.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Anyone that the altar did not merit with its flesh, the priests did not merit with its skin, as it is stated (Leviticus 7:8), "The burnt offering of a man, the burnt offering that is for a man."

hebrew_text: עולה שנשחטה שלא לשמה אע"פ שלא עלתה לבעלים עורה לכהנים אחד עולת האיש ואחד עולת האשה עורותיהן לכהנים
human_translation: a burnt offering that was slaughtered not for its sake although it did not satisfy of the owner, its hide to the priests. both the burnt offering of a man and the burnt offering of a woman, their hides to the priests.
llm_translation: An offering that was slaughtered not for its sake, even though it did not ascend for the owners, its skin goes to the priests. The skin of the burnt offering of a man and the skin of the burnt offering of a woman, their skins go to the priests.

hebrew_text: עורות קדשים קלים לבעלים עורות קדשי קדשים לכהנים קל וחומר ומה אם עולה שלא זכו בבשרה זכו בעורה קדשי קדשים שזכו בבשרה אינו דין שיזכו בעורה אין מזבח יוכיח שאין לו עור בכל מקום:
human_translation: The hides of offerings of lesser sanctity to the owners; the hides of offerings of the most sacred order to the priests. an a fortiori If a burnt offering, for which do not acquire its flesh, they acquire its hide, offerings of the most sacred order, for which acquire its flesh, is it not right that they should acquire its hide? there is no altar will prove since it does not have hide in any place.
llm_translation: Skins of holy things light for owners, skins of holy of holies for priests, a fortiori, and what if it ascends that did not merit in its flesh, it merits in its skin, holy of holies that merited in its flesh, it is not the law that it should merit in its skin, the altar does not prove that it has no skin at all.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר עולת איש פרט לעולת הקדש דברי ר' יהודה רבי יוסי בר' יהודה אומר פרט לעולת גרים
human_translation: The Sages taught “a man’s burnt offering” to exclude the burnt offering of consecrated the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: to exclude the burnt offering of converts.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: "An olah offering of an individual" - excluding the olah offering of the Sanctuary. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: excluding the olah offering of proselytes.

hebrew_text: מאי פרט לעולת הקדש אמר רבי חייא בר יוסף פרט לעולה הבאה מן המותרות
human_translation: What to exclude the burnt offering of consecrated Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: to exclude a burnt offering that comes from left over.
llm_translation: What is the exclusion for the Olah of the Sanctuary? Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said: Excluding an Olah that comes from the permissible.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד מותרות לנדבת ציבור אזלי אלא למ"ד מותרות לנדבת יחיד אזלי מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says: Leftover goes toward communal gift But according to the one who says: Leftover goes toward an individual’s gift what can be said?
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says permitted for a communal donation go, rather according to the one who says permitted for an individual donation go, what is there to say.

hebrew_text: כדאמר רבא העולה עולה ראשונה ה"נ העולה עולה ראשונה
human_translation: as Rava says: the burnt offering first burnt offering Here too, the burnt offering a first burnt offering,
llm_translation: As Rava said: "The one who ascends, ascends first." So too, the one who ascends, ascends first.

hebrew_text: רבי אייבו א"ר ינאי פרט למתפיס עולה לבדק הבית
human_translation: Rabbi Aivu Rabbi Yannai says: to exclude one who consecrates a burnt offering for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ayyvo said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: "Except for the one who grasps the burnt offering to inspect the Temple."

hebrew_text: לא מיבעיא למ"ד קדשי בדק הבית תפסי מדאורייתא אלא אפילו למ"ד לא תפסי הני מילי בשר אבל עור תפיס
human_translation: It is not necessary according to the one who says consecration for Temple maintenance applies by Torah law Rather, even according to the one who says does not apply this matter meat; but hide, applies
llm_translation: It is not necessary according to the one who holds that the consecrated items of the Temple Mount are considered as if they were caught by Torah law, rather even according to the one who holds that they are not considered caught, these matters of flesh are not caught, but skin is caught.

hebrew_text: וכן אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה פרט לעולה הבאה מן המותרות
human_translation: And so says Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh says: to exclude a burnt offering that comes from left over.
llm_translation: And so said Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuhah: except for an olah that comes from the permissible.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב המנונא לרב נחמן כמאן כרבי יהודה הא הדר ביה דתניא ששה לנדבה לעולה הבאה מן המותרות שלא יהו כהנים זכאין בעורה דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said to Rav Naḥman: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. didn’t retract As it is taught six for gift toward burnt offerings that come from left over. that the priests have no right to the hide of the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said to Rav Nachman: According to whose opinion is this? Like the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is repeated in a Baraita: Six animals designated for a voluntary burnt offering that come from permissible animals, the priests are not entitled to their hides. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי נחמיה ואמרי לה ר"ש אם כן ביטלת מדרשו של יהוידע הכהן דתניא זה מדרש דרש יהוידע הכהן (ויקרא ה, יט) אשם הוא אשם אשם לה' כל שבא משום חטאת ומשום אשם ילקח בו עולות הבשר לשם עורה לכהנים
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya said to and some say Rabbi Shimon If so, you have nullified the interpretation of Jehoiada the priest. As it is taught Jehoiada the priest taught this interpretation: “It is a guilt offering; he is certainly guilty before the Lord” any comes on account of a sin offering or on account of a guilt offering, burnt offerings must be purchased with it, flesh to the Lord. its hide to the priests.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Nehemiah, and some say Rabbi Shimon: If so, you have nullified the exposition of Jehoiada the priest, as it is taught: This is the exposition that Jehoiada the priest expounded (Leviticus 5:19), "It is a guilt offering; he has indeed incurred guilt before the Lord." Any offering that comes for both a sin offering and a guilt offering, the portions of the meat should be given to the priests for their portion.

hebrew_text: א"ל אלא מר במאי מוקים לה א"ל מוקמינא ליה במקדיש נכסיו
human_translation: said to But how does the Master interpret said to him: I interpret it to one who consecrates his property,
llm_translation: He said to him: "But Master, with what is she established?" He said to him: "She is established with consecrating her property."

hebrew_text: וכדרבי יהושע דתנן המקדיש נכסיו והיו בהן בהמות הראויות לגבי מזבח זכרים ונקבות ר"א אומר זכרים ימכרו לצורכי עולות נקבות ימכרו לצורכי זבחי שלמים ודמיהן יפלו עם שאר נכסים לבדק הבית
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned one consecrates his property But among it were animals fit to altar, male or female, Rabbi Eliezer says: male shall be sold for the purpose of burnt offerings female shall be sold for the purpose of peace offerings And their proceeds shall be allocated with the rest of property for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: And like Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned: One who consecrates his property, and among them are animals suitable for the altar, males and females. Rabbi Eliezer says: The males shall be sold for burnt offerings, and the females shall be sold for peace offerings, and their value shall be mixed with the rest of the property for the maintenance of the Temple.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר זכרים עצמם יקרבו עולות ונקבות ימכרו לצורכי שלמים ויביא בדמיהן עולות ושאר נכסים יפלו לבדק הבית
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: males shall be sacrificed themselves burnt offerings; and females shall be sold for the purpose of peace offerings, and he shall bring burnt offerings with their proceeds; and the rest of property shall be allocated for Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Males themselves shall bring burnt offerings, and females shall be sold for the needs of peace offerings, and with their money shall burnt offerings be brought, and the rest of the property shall fall to the Temple treasury.

hebrew_text: ואפי' לרבי יהושע דאמר אדם חולק הקדישו הני מילי בשר אבל עור תפיס
human_translation: And even according to Rabbi Yehoshua, who says a person divides his consecrated this statement flesh, but hide, acquires
llm_translation: And even according to Rabbi Yehoshua who said, "A person divides his consecrated property, these matters apply to flesh, but not to skin."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר פרט לעולת גרים אמר ליה רב סימאי בר חילקאי לרבינא אטו גר לאו איש הוא אמר ליה פרט לגר שמת ואין לו יורשים
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: to exclude the burnt offering of converts. Rav Simai bar Ḥilkai said to Ravina: Is that to say a convert is not a man? said to him: to exclude a convert who died and has no heirs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: "Except for the burnt offering of proselytes." Rav Simai, son of Chilqai, said to Ravina: "Is a proselyte not a person?" He said to him: "Except for a proselyte who died and has no heirs."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן עולת איש אין לי אלא עולת איש עולת גרים נשים ועבדים מנין ת"ל עור העולה ריבה
human_translation: The Sages taught a man’s burnt offering, I have only a man’s burnt offering, From where the burnt offering of converts, women, or slaves? The verse states: “The hide of the burnt offering,” included
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "An olah offering of a man" - I have only the olah offering of a man; how do I know that the olah offering of converts, women, and slaves is also included? The Torah states: "The skin of the burnt offering" - this includes them.

hebrew_text: אם כן מה תלמוד לומר עולת איש עולה שעלתה לאיש פרט לשנשחטה חוץ לזמנה וחוץ למקומה שלא יהו הכהנים זכאין בעורה
human_translation: And if so, why the verse state: “A man’s burnt offering”? a burnt offering that satisfied of a man, to exclude that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area that the priests have no right to the hide of
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud say? "A burnt offering of a man that he offers, he shall offer it." Excluding if it was slaughtered outside its designated time or place, so that the priests are not entitled to its hide.

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה שנשחטה שלא לשמה הואיל ולא עלתה לבעלים
human_translation: might that I include that was not slaughtered for its own sake Since it does not satisfy of the owner,
llm_translation: It is possible that I might say that if it was slaughtered not for its intended purpose, since it did not ascend to the owners.

hebrew_text: לא יהו כהנים זכאין בעורה ת"ל עור העולה מ"מ
human_translation: the priests have no right to its hide. the verse states: “The hide of the burnt offering,” in any case
llm_translation: The priests are not eligible in its skin. It is taught: "skin that ascends."

hebrew_text: עור העולה אין לי אלא עור העולה עורות קדשי קדשים מנין ת"ל עור העולה אשר הקריב יכול שאני מרבה אף קדשים קלים ת"ל עולה מה עולה קדשי קדשים אף כל קדשי קדשים
human_translation: “the hide of the burnt offering” I have only the hide of the burnt offering. From where the hides of offerings of the most sacred order? The verse states: “The hide of the burnt offering which he has offered,” might that I include even offerings of lesser sanctity. the verse states: “Burnt offering,” just as a burnt offering is an offering of the most sacred order, so too all offerings of the most sacred order;
llm_translation: The skin of the burnt offering, I have only the skin of the burnt offering. The skins of the holy of holies, from where do we derive? It is stated: "The skin of the burnt offering that he offered." One might have thought to include even lighter holy items, therefore it is stated: "burnt offering." Just as the burnt offering is the holiest of holies, so too all the holiest of holies.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל אומר עור העולה אין לי אלא העולה עורות קדשי קדשים מנין ודין הוא ומה עולה שלא זכו בבשרה זכו בעורה קדשי קדשים שזכו בבשרן אינו דין שזכו בעורן
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says “the hide of the burnt offering,” I have only the burnt offering. From where the hides of offerings of the most sacred order? It is a logical inference: Just as a burnt offering, for which do not acquire its meat, acquire its hide, offerings of the most sacred order, for which do acquire its meat, is it not logical that acquire their hides?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: "The skin that ascends, I have only the ascending skin. Holy of Holies skins, from where? And it is a judgment. And just as the ascending offering that they did not merit in its flesh, they merited in its skin, Holy of Holies that they merited in their flesh, it is not a judgment that they merited in their skin."

hebrew_text: מזבח יוכיח שזכה בבשר ולא זכה בעור מה למזבח שכן לא זכה במקצת תאמר בכהנים שזכו במקצת הואיל וזכו במקצת זכו בכוליה
human_translation: altar prove as it acquires the meat, and it does not acquire the hide. What about the altar? in that it does not acquire in any Will you say concerning priests, who acquire some of Since acquire some of they acquire all
llm_translation: The altar proves that it was successful with the flesh but not successful with the skin. Just as for the altar, since it was not successful with part of it, you would say the same for the priests, that if they were successful with part, since they were successful with part, they were successful with all of it.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר כל עצמו לא הוצרכנו אלא לעור העולה בלבד שבכל מקום העור מהלך אחר הבשר
human_translation: Rabbi says: We need itself only to the hide of the burnt offering. As in all cases the hide follows the flesh
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "All his bone not we needed except for the skin that ascends only for in every place the skin goes after the flesh."

hebrew_text: פרים הנשרפין ושעירים הנשרפין הן ועורותיהן [נשרפין] עמהן חטאת ואשם וזבחי שלמי ציבור מתנה לכהן רצו מפשיטין אותן לא רצו אוכלין אותן ע"ג עורן קדשים קלים לבעלים רצו מפשיטין אותן רצו אוכלין אותן על גב עורן
human_translation: bulls that are burned and goats that are burned themselves, and their hides burned with them, A sin offering, and a guilt offering, and a communal peace offering a gift to the priest want, flay them do not want eat together with their hides. Offerings of lesser sanctity to the owners; want, flay them want, eat together with their hides.
llm_translation: Cows that are burnt offerings and goats that are burnt offerings, they and their hides are burnt offerings with them, sin-offerings, guilt-offerings, and communal peace-offerings are given as a gift to the priest. If they consent, they strip them; if they do not consent, they eat them on their hides. Light holy items for owners, if they consent, they strip them; if they consent, they eat them on their hides.

hebrew_text: אבל עולה נאמר בה (ויקרא א, ו) והפשיט את העולה ונתח אותה לנתחיה יכול לא יהו הכהנים זכאין בעורה ת"ל (ויקרא ז, ח) עור העולה אשר הקריב
human_translation: But with regard to a burnt offering it is stated: “And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into its pieces” might the priests have no right to its hide. the verse states: the hide of the burnt offering that he has sacrificed”
llm_translation: But regarding an Olah it is stated (Leviticus 1:6), "And he shall flay the Olah and cut it into its pieces." One might think that the priests are not entitled to its skin; therefore it is stated (Leviticus 7:8), "The skin of the Olah which he brought."

hebrew_text: לו יהיה פרט לטבול יום (ומחוסר כיפורים) ואונן שיכול לא יזכו בבשר שהוא לאכילה יזכו בעור שאינו לאכילה ת"ל לו יהיה פרט למחוסר כיפורים וטבול יום ואונן
human_translation: shall have to himself” to exclude who immersed that day and who has not yet an atonement and an acute mourner, As might will not acquire the meat, because it is for consumption, they will acquire the hide, because it is not for consumption. the verse states: “Shall have to himself,” to exclude who has not yet an atonement and who immersed that day, and an acute mourner.
llm_translation: If he shall not be a specific case for a Tevul Yom (and lacking atonements), and an Onen who is able, shall not merit with flesh which is for eating, they shall merit with skin which is not for eating. It is stated: "If he shall not be a specific case for lacking atonements and a Tevul Yom and an Onen."

hebrew_text: ות"ק נמי תיפוק לי מדינא מילתא דאתיא בקל וחומר טרח וכתב לה קרא
human_translation: But let the first tanna also derive logically, a matter that can be derived through an a fortiori verse takes the trouble and writes it
llm_translation: And the Talmudic sages also derived for me a matter from a fortiori reasoning; he exerted effort and wrote for it a verse.

hebrew_text: ורבי ישמעאל האי אשר הקריב מאי עביד ליה פרט לטבול יום ומחוסר כיפורים ואונן
human_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, what does he do with this that he has sacrificed,” to exclude who immersed that day, and who has not yet an atonement and an acute mourner,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yishmael, this one who brought near, what does he do with it? Except for one who is a tevul yom and lacking atonements and an onen.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה מלו יהיה רבי ישמעאל לטעמיה דאמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי ישמעאל נאמר בעולה לו יהיה ונאמר באשם לו יהיה מה להלן עצמותיו מותרין אף כאן עצמותיו מותרין
human_translation: But let derive from “Shall have to himself,” Rabbi Yishmael to his reasoning, As Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: is stated: “Shall have to himself” with regard to a burnt offering, and is stated: he shall have to himself” with regard to a guilt offering. Just as there, its bones permitted so too here, its bones are permitted.
llm_translation: And it was derived for him, "it shall be for him" - Rabbi Yishmael, according to his reasoning, for Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: It is stated regarding an olah offering, "it shall be for him," and it is stated regarding an asham offering, "it shall be for him." Just as there, its bones are permitted, so too here, its bones are permitted.

hebrew_text: מופני דאי לא מופני איכא למיפרך מה לאשם שכן בשרו מותר לו יהיה קרא יתירא הוא:
human_translation: are free, As, if they are not free, can be refuted What about a guilt offering? in that its meat is permitted “Shall have it to himself,” is a superfluous verse,
llm_translation: Facing, if not facing, there is to answer, what for guilt offering, so his flesh permitted to him will be, verse extra it is.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל הקדשים שאירע בהן פסול קודם להפשיטן אין עורותיהן לכהנים לאחר הפשיטן עורותיהן לכהנים אמר רבי חנינא סגן הכהנים מימי לא ראיתי עור שיוצא לבית השריפה
human_translation: any offerings were disqualified prior to their flaying, their hides do not to the priests; after their flaying, their hides to the priests. Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, said: In my days, I never saw a hide going out to the place of burning.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All consecrated items in which a disqualification occurred before their processing, their hides do not belong to the priests. After their processing, their hides belong to the priests. Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, said: "In all my days, I have never seen a hide that goes to the burning place."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי עקיבא מדבריו למדנו שהמפשיט את הבכור ונמצא טריפה שיאותו הכהנים בעורוו חכמים אומרים אין לא ראינו ראיה אלא יצא לבית השריפה:
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: From the statement of we learned that one flays the firstborn and discovered to have a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], that the priests may derive benefit [ sheye’otu ] from its hide. And the Rabbis say: We did not see, is no proof; rather, goes out to the place of burning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: From his words we learn that if one skins the firstborn and a blemish is found, the priests should burn it. The sages say: We have no proof except that it should be taken out to the burning place.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ כל שלא זכה המזבח בבשרה לא זכו הכהנים בעורה ואע"ג דאפשטיה לעור קודם זריקה מני רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון היא דאמר אין הדם מרצה על העור בפני עצמו
human_translation: any for which the altar did not acquire its flesh, the priests did not acquire its hide. even if flayed the hide before sprinkling Whose It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says: The blood does not effect acceptance of the hide by itself;
llm_translation: Gemara: Any animal that the altar did not merit with its flesh, the priests did not merit with its hide. And even though it spread out the hide before the sprinkling, according to Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, who said: "The blood does not atone for the hide by itself."

hebrew_text: אימא סיפא כל הקדשים שאירע בהן פסול קודם הפשיטן אין עורותיהן לכהנים לאחר הפשיטן עורותיהן לכהנים אתאן לרבי דאמר הדם מרצה על העור בפני עצמו רישא רבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון סיפא רבי
human_translation: Say the latter clause, any offerings were disqualified prior to their flaying, their hides do not to the priests. after their flaying, their hides to the priests. we arrive at Rabbi who says: The blood effects acceptance of the hide, by itself. the former clause Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, the latter clause Rabbi
llm_translation: Say the latter part: all the holy things that became disqualified in them before they were skinned, their hides do not belong to the priests. After they were skinned, their hides belong to the priests. They came to Rabbi, for he said: the blood makes atonement on the skin by itself.
