The first part is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon; the latter part is Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מדסיפא רבי היא רישא נמי רבי היא ומודה רבי שאין הפשט קודם זריקה
human_translation: Abaye said: Since the latter clause Rabbi the former clause is also Rabbi And Rabbi concedes that flaying is not before sprinkling.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: From the end, it is Rabbi; from the beginning, it is also Rabbi. And Rabbi concedes that the spreading does not precede the sprinkling.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר מדרישא ר"א ברבי שמעון סיפא נמי ר"א בר"ש מאי קודם הפשט
human_translation: Rava said: since the former clause Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, the latter clause is also Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. what Before flaying,
llm_translation: Rava said: In the exposition, Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon. The latter part also mentions Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Shimon. What is meant by "before the spreading out"?

hebrew_text: ומאי אחר הפשט קודם שנראו להפשט אחר שנראו להפשט
human_translation: and what After flaying? before became fit for flaying, after they became fit for flaying,
llm_translation: And what is "after the spreading out"? Before they appeared to spread out, after they appeared to spread out.

hebrew_text: מאי רבי ומאי רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון דתניא רבי אומר הדם מרצה על העור בפני עצמו וכשהוא עם הבשר נולד בו פסול בין קודם זריקה בין לאחר זריקה הרי הוא כיוצא בו
human_translation: What Rabbi and what Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? as it is taught Rabbi says: The blood effects acceptance of the hide by itself, And when is with the flesh, a disqualification appears on whether before sprinkling or after sprinkling is parallel to
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi and what is the ruling of Rabbi Elazar son of Shimon? As it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says, "If the blood spurts onto the skin by itself, it is valid. But when it is mixed with the flesh, if it was born in it, it is invalid, whether before the sprinkling or after the sprinkling, it is like it."

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר בר"ש אומר אין הדם מרצה על העור בפני עצמו וכשהוא עם הבשר נולד בו פסול קודם זריקה הרי הוא כיוצא בו אחר זריקה הורצה בשר שעה אחת יפשיטנו ועורו לכהנים
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The blood does not effect acceptance of the hide by itself. And when is with the flesh, a disqualification appears on before sprinkling is parallel to after sprinkling flesh was accepted for a time. may flay and its hide to the priests.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar bar Shimon says: "The blood does not spur on the skin by itself, and when it is with the flesh, if it was born in it, it is disqualified before sprinkling. It is like it after sprinkling. The flesh is permitted for one hour, he shall skin it and its skin to the priests."

hebrew_text: לימא בדרבי אליעזר ורבי יהושע קמיפלגי (דברים יב, כז) ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם רבי יהושע אומר אם אין דם אין בשר אם אין בשר אין דם
human_translation: Shall we say disagree about Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua? “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, Rabbi Yehoshua says: if there is no blood no flesh if there is no flesh no blood
llm_translation: Let us say in the name of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua disagree (Deuteronomy 12:27) "And you shall make your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood." Rabbi Joshua says: If there is no blood, there is no flesh. If there is no flesh, there is no blood.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר דם אע"פ שאין בשר שנאמר (דברים יב, כז) ודם זבחיך ישפך א"כ מה ת"ל ועשית עולותיך הבשר והדם לומר לך מה דם בזריקה אף בשר בזריקה הא למדת שריוח יש בין כבש למזבח
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: blood even if there is no flesh, as it is stated “And the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out If so, what the verse states: “And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood”? to tell you: Just as blood by sprinkling, so too, flesh by tossing. Consequently, you learn that there is a space between ramp and the altar,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Blood, even though there is no flesh." As it is stated (Deuteronomy 12:27), "And the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out." If so, what is the teaching when it says (Leviticus 1:9), "And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood"? To tell you that just as blood requires sprinkling, so too does flesh require sprinkling. This teaches you that there is a space between the lamb and the altar.

hebrew_text: לימא מ"ד הורצה כר"א ומ"ד לא הורצה כר' יהושע
human_translation: Shall we say the one who says is accepted in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, and the one who says is not accepted in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: Let us say: One who desires, like Rabbi Eliezer, and one who does not desire, like Rabbi Joshua.

hebrew_text: אליבא דר"א כ"ע לא פליגי כי פליגי אליבא דרבי יהושע
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Eliezer, everyone agrees When they disagree, according to of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: According to Rabbi Akiva, all do not argue. When they argue, it is according to Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: מ"ד לא הורצה כרבי יהושע מ"ד הורצה אמר לך עד כאן לא קאמר רבי יהושע התם אלא בבשר דליכא פסידא לכהנים אבל עור דאיכא פסידא לכהנים אפילו רבי יהושע מודה
human_translation: The one who says is not accepted in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua; The one who says is accepted, say to you: Rabbi Yehoshua says only there in flesh where there is no loss for the priests, But hide where there is a loss for the priests, even Rabbi Yehoshua concedes
llm_translation: Talmudic text: מ"ד לא הורצה כרבי יהושע מ"ד הורצה אמר לך עד כאן לא קאמר רבי יהושע התם אלא בבשר דליכא פסידא לכהנים אבל עור דאיכא פסידא לכהנים אפילו רבי יהושע מודה English translation: One opinion says: Rabbi Yehoshua did not agree, and one opinion says: he did agree. He said to you, until here Rabbi Yehoshua did not say, except there in the case of flesh where there is no loss to the priests, but in the case of skin where there is a loss to the priests, even Rabbi Yehoshua agrees.

hebrew_text: מידי דהוה אדיעבד דתנן נטמא בשר או נפסל או שיצא חוץ לקלעים ר"א אומר יזרוק רבי יהושע אומר לא יזרוק ומודה רבי יהושע שאם זרק הורצה:
human_translation: just as it is with regard to after the fact. As we learned flesh contracted ritual impurity or was disqualified, or emerged beyond the curtains Rabbi Eliezer says: sprinkle Rabbi Yehoshua says: may not sprinkle And Rabbi Yehoshua concedes that if sprinkled is accepted
llm_translation: Whenever it would happen that as it was taught: became impure the flesh or became disqualified or went out beyond the curtains, Rabbi Eliezer says: it shall be cast away, Rabbi Joshua says: it shall not be cast away, and Rabbi Joshua concedes that if it was cast, it is acceptable.

hebrew_text: א"ר חנינא סגן הכהנים כו': ולא הרי פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, said: And not Aren’t there bulls that are burned and goats that are burned
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, said: "And behold, the burnt calves and the burnt goats."

hebrew_text: למצותן לא קאמרינן
human_translation: We are not saying in accordance with their mitzva;
llm_translation: Regarding their commandments not we are saying.

hebrew_text: הרי קודם הפשט וקודם זריקה חלוץ קאמרינן
human_translation: isn’t there before flaying and before sprinkling We are saying stripped
llm_translation: Behold, before the removal and before the sprinkling, we say "chalutz."

hebrew_text: והאיכא אחר הפשט וקודם זריקה לרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון דאמר אין הדם מרצה על העור בפני עצמו
human_translation: But isn’t there after flaying and before sprinkling according to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says: The blood does not effect acceptance of the hide by itself?
llm_translation: And there is another opinion after the skinning and before the sprinkling, attributed to Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said: "The blood does not atone on the skin by itself."

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא כרבי סבירא ליה ואיבעית אימא אפילו תוקמא כרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון מודה רבי שאין הפשט קודם זריקה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina holds in accordance with Rabbi And if you wish, say even interpret in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi concedes that flaying is not before sprinkling,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina agrees with Rabbi Sevira, and if you wish, say even if the wall is like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, Rabbi concedes that the interpretation does not precede the casting.

hebrew_text: והאיכא נמצאת טריפה בבני מעיים
human_translation: But isn’t there was found in intestines a tereifa ,
llm_translation: And there is found a treifah in the intestines.

hebrew_text: קסבר נמצאת טריפה בבני מעיים מרצה דיקא נמי דקתני א"ר עקיבא מדבריו למדנו שהמפשיט את הבכור ונמצא טריפה שיאותו הכהנים בעורו ש"מ
human_translation: holds was found a tereifa in intestines, effects acceptance, is also precise, as it teaches: Rabbi Akiva said: From the statement of we learned that one flays the firstborn and discovered a tereifa , that the priests may derive benefit from its hide. learn from
llm_translation: He holds: If a blemish is found in the intestines, it is a clear indication. Also, since Rabbi Akiva taught us, we have learned that if one dismembers the firstborn and a blemish is found, the priests burn it with its skin. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ואלא מאי קמ"ל ר"ע הא קמ"ל אפילו בגבולין
human_translation: But what is Rabbi Akiva teaching us? This teaching us: even in the outlying areas,
llm_translation: And rather what is it coming to teach us? Rabbi Akiva teaches us even in the borders.

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן הלכה כר"ע ואף ר"ע לא אמר אלא כשהתירו מומחה אבל לא התירו מומחה לא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. And even Rabbi Akiva said only where an expert permitted it But an expert did not permit it, not
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. And Rabbi Eliezer only said this when an expert permitted it, but when an expert did not permit it, he did not.

hebrew_text: והלכתא כדברי חכמים (בשר בקבורה והעור בשריפה):
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis, flesh by burial and the hide by burning.
llm_translation: And the halakha is according to the words of the sages (flesh in burial and the skin in burning).

hebrew_text: מתני׳ פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים בזמן שהן נשרפין כמצותן נשרפים בבית הדשן ומטמאין בגדים ואם אינן נשרפין כמצותן נשרפין בבית הבירה ואינן מטמאין בגדים
human_translation: bulls that are burned, and goats that are burned, when they are burned in accordance with their mitzva, they are burned in the place of the ashes and they render garments impure And if are not burned in accordance with their mitzva they are burned in the place of the bira , and they do not render garments impure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Bulls that are burnt offerings and goats that are burnt offerings, when they are burnt in accordance with their requirements, they are burnt in the Temple courtyard and render garments unclean. But if they are not burnt in accordance with their requirements, they are burnt in the Temple chamber and do not render garments unclean.

hebrew_text: היו סובלין אותו במוטות יצאו הראשונים חוץ לחומת העזרה והאחרונים לא יצאו הראשונים מטמאין בגדים והאחרונים אינן מטמאין בגדים עד שיצאו יצאו אלו ואלו מטמאין בגדים רבי שמעון אומר אינן מטמאין עד שיוצת האור ברובן ניתך הבשר אין השורף מטמא בגדים:
human_translation: would carry on poles. the first emerged outside the wall of the courtyard and the latter did not emerge, the first render garments impure, and the latter do not render garments impure until they emerge. these and those emerged, they render garments impure. Rabbi Shimon says: They do not render garments impure, until the fire is ignited in the majority of the flesh is scorched, one who burns does not render garments impure.
llm_translation: They would carry him on poles, the first ones went out beyond the wall of the Azarah, and the last ones did not go out. The first ones become impure with garments, and the last ones do not become impure with garments until they go out. If they go out, both these and those become impure with garments. Rabbi Shimon says: They do not become impure until the majority of the light has departed. If the flesh is poured out, the one burning does not make garments impure.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי בירה אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן מקום יש בהר הבית ובירה שמו ור"ל אמר כל הבית כולו קרוי בירה שנאמר (דברי הימים א כט, יט) (ואל) הבירה אשר הכינותי
human_translation: What bira ? Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: There is a place on the Temple Mount, and its name is bira , And Reish Lakish says: The entire Temple is called bira , as it is stated the Temple [ bira ] for which I have made provision”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is a "birah"? Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: Rabbi Yoḥanan said, there is a place on the Temple Mount called Birah. And Rabbi Levi said: The entire house is called Birah, as it is stated (1 Chronicles 29:19), "And to the birah that I have prepared."

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה שלשה בית הדשנין הן בית הדשן גדול היה בעזרה ששם שורפין פסולי קדשי קדשים ואימורי קדשים קלים ופרים הנשרפין ושעירים הנשרפין שאירע בהן פסול קודם זריקה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: There are three places of the ashes. great place of the ashes was in the courtyard, where burn the disqualified offerings of the most sacred order, and the sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity, and bulls that are burned and goats that are burned they were disqualified prior to sprinkling
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: There are three Beit HaDeshenin. The Beit HaDeshen Gadol was in the Azarah, where they would burn disqualified holy items of the Holy of Holies, and light holy items of lesser sanctity, and burnt bulls and goats that became disqualified before the sprinkling.

hebrew_text: ובית הדשן אחר היה בהר הבית ששם שורפין פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים שאירע בהן פסול אחר זריקה וכמצותן חוץ לשלש מחנות
human_translation: And there was another place of the ashes on the Temple Mount, where burn bulls that are burned and goats that are burned they were disqualified after sprinkling And in accordance with their mitzva, outside three camps,
llm_translation: And the House of Ashes was behind the Temple Mount, where they would burn the burnt bulls and burnt goats that became disqualified after the sprinkling, and like their commandments, except for three camps.

hebrew_text: תני לוי שלשה בית הדשנין הן בית הדשן גדול היה בעזרה ששם שורפין פסולי קדשי קדשים ואימורי קדשים קלים ופרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים שאירע בהן פסול בין קודם זריקה בין לאחר זריקה ובית הדשן אחר היה בהר הבית ששם שורפין פרים הנשרפין ושעירים הנשרפין שאירע בהן פסול ביציאתן וכמצותן חוץ לשלש מחנות
human_translation: Levi teaches There are three places of the ashes. great place of the ashes was in the courtyard, where burn the disqualified offerings of the most sacred order, and the sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity, and bulls that are burned and goats that are burned they were disqualified, whether prior to sprinkling or after sprinkling And there was another place of the ashes on the Temple Mount, where burn bulls that are burned and goats that are burned they were disqualified upon emerging And in accordance with their mitzva, outside three camps.
llm_translation: Levi taught: There are three Beit HaDeshenin. The Beit HaDeshen Gadol was in the Azarah, where they would burn disqualified holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items, light holy items,

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה לינה מהו שתועיל בפרים הנשרפים ובשעירים הנשרפים מי אמרינן כי מהניא לינה בבשר דבר אכילה אבל הני דלאו בני אכילה נינהו לא או דלמא לא שנא
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: What is being left overnight is effective to bulls that are burned and goats that are burned? do we say: When being left overnight is effective in flesh that is fit for consumption, but these which are not fit for consumption, not Or perhaps is no different,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah asked: What is the benefit of sleeping in the hides of burnt oxen and burnt goats? Do we say that sleeping is beneficial in the flesh of something eaten, but these, which are not for eating, are not beneficial? Or perhaps it makes no difference.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הא מילתא איבעיא ליה לאביי ופשטנא ליה מהא ושוין שאם חישב באכילת פרים ובשריפתן שלא עשה כלום מאי לאו מדמחשבה לא פסלה לינה נמי לא פסלה
human_translation: Rava said: This matter, dilemma, was raised by Abaye, and I resolved it from this But agree that if intended for the consumption of bulls’ and their burning he did nothing, What, is it not since intention does not disqualify being left overnight also does not disqualify
llm_translation: Rava said: This matter was asked of Abaye, and we have resolved it for him from this source. And it is equal, for if one intended both to eat the fruits and burn them, but did not do anything, what is it? Is it not that since thought does not disqualify the offering, sleep also does not disqualify it.

hebrew_text: ודלמא מחשבה הוא דלא פסלה אבל לינה פסלה
human_translation: But perhaps it is intention that does not disqualify but being left overnight does disqualify
llm_translation: Perhaps it is thought that intention does not disqualify, but lodging does disqualify.

hebrew_text: תא שמע פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפין מועלין בהן משהוקדשו נשחטו הוכשרו ליפסל בטבול יום ובמחוסר כיפורים ובלינה מאי לאו לינת בשר
human_translation: Come hear bulls that are burned and goats that are burned, from them misuse from that they were consecrated. they have been slaughtered, they are susceptible to be rendered disqualified through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through left overnight What, is it not flesh left overnight?
llm_translation: Come and hear: Bulls that were burnt offerings and goats that were burnt offerings, if they were slaughtered after they were sanctified, they are disqualified by being left overnight, by immersion during the day, and by lacking atonement. What is the reason? Is it not because of the overnight stay of the flesh.

hebrew_text: לא לינת אימורין
human_translation: No, sacrificial portions left overnight,
llm_translation: Not for the night of the offerings.

hebrew_text: והא מדקתני סיפא כולן מועלין בהן בבית הדשן עד שיותך הבשר מדסיפא בשר רישא נמי בשר מידי איריא סיפא בשר רישא אימורין
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches: all of those from them misuse in the place of the ashes, until the flesh is incinerated. From that the latter clause flesh, the first clause also flesh, Are the cases comparable? The latter clause flesh, the first clause sacrificial portions.
llm_translation: And this, as it was taught in the latter clause, all of them are invalidated by them in the house of the ash heap until the flesh is consumed. From the beginning, flesh is also something that is consumed. In the latter clause, the flesh of the beginning is called "imurin."

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתני לוי שאירע בהן פסול ביציאתן מאי לאו לינה לא פסול טומאה ופסול יציאה
human_translation: Come hear which Levi teaches disqualified upon emerging What, is it not left overnight? No, disqualification by ritual impurity or disqualification by leaving
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Levi taught: If it occurred in them, they are disqualified in their exit. What, is it not that if it did not occur, it is not disqualified for impurity and disqualified for exit?

hebrew_text: בעי ר"א יציאה מהו שתועיל בפרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: What is leaving is effective to bulls that are burned and goats that are burned?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer inquired: What is the law regarding the efficacy of the removal of sacrificial parts in the case of burnt bulls and burnt he-goats?

hebrew_text: מאי קמיבעיא ליה א"ר ירמיה בר אבא אליבא דמ"ד עדיין לא הגיע זמנו לצאת
human_translation: What is the dilemma he is raising? Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: in accordance with of the one who says: its time to leave has not yet arrived.
llm_translation: What is the question being asked? Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba said: In the house of the one who says that it is not yet time to go out.

hebrew_text: מי אמרינן ה"מ בשר דאין סופו לצאת חובה אבל הני דסופן לצאת חובה לא או דלמא ה"נ לא הגיע זמנו לצאת
human_translation: Do we say this matter, flesh that need not eventually leave obligation? But these which eventually leave obligation, not Or perhaps here too its time to leave has not arrived.
llm_translation: We say this regarding meat that its end is not obligatory, but these whose end is obligatory not, or perhaps not yet its time to come out.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דתני לוי שאירע בו פסול ביציאתו מאי לאו פסול יציאה לא פסול טומאה ופסול לינה
human_translation: Come hear which Levi teaches they were disqualified upon emerging What, is it not disqualification by leaving No, disqualification by ritual impurity or disqualification by being left overnight.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Levi taught, if a blemish occurred in it, it is disqualified upon its emergence. What is meant by "disqualified upon its emergence"? Disqualified for emergence, not disqualified for impurity, and disqualified for lodging.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי אלעזר פרים הנשרפים ושעירים הנשרפים שיצא רובו במיעוט אבר מהו הך מיעוטא דאבר בתר רובא שדינן ליה והא לא נפקא ליה או דלמא בתר רובא דבהמה שדינן
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises dilemma: bulls that are burned and goats that are burned, the majority of emerged by the minority of a limb, what is Do we this minority of a limb casting it after the majority and that did not leave? Or perhaps we casting after the majority of animal,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar inquired: "Regarding burnt calves and burnt goats, if the majority of their limbs went out of the designated area through a minority of the limbs, what is the law concerning this minority of limbs after the majority? Do we consider it, or perhaps we only consider the majority of the animal's limbs?"

hebrew_text: פשיטא דלא שבקינן רובא דבהמה ואזלינן בתר רובא דאברים אלא שיצא חציו ברוב אבר האי מיעוטא דאבר
human_translation: obvious that we do not disregard the majority of the animal and follow the majority of the limbs? Rather, where half of emerged the majority of limb we this minority of a limb
llm_translation: It is obvious that we do not leave the majority of the animal and go after the majority of the limbs, but rather its half has gone out with the majority of the limbs. This is the minority of the limbs.

hebrew_text: בתר רוב אבר שדינן ליה והא נפק ליה או דלמא בתר בהמה שדינן ליה תיקו
human_translation: casting it after the majority of limb, and that did leave? Or perhaps we casting it after the animal, shall stand
llm_translation: After the majority of limbs we judge him, but perhaps it came out after an animal, we judge him. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רבה בר רב הונא מתני לה בגברי במתעסקין בו חמשה בני אדם ונפקו תלתא ופשו להו תרי מאי בתר רוב מתעסקין אזלינן או בתר בהמה אזלינן תיקו
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna teaches this with regard to people: In five people are handling and three emerged and two of them remained what we follow the majority of the people handling or we follow animal, shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Huna teaches it with regard to a man who is engaged in it, five people, and three of them leave and two remain. What is the law after the majority are engaged? We go after them, or after the animal? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי אלעזר פרים ושעירים הנשרפים שיצאו וחזרו מהו מי אמרינן כיון דנפקי להו איטמו להו או דלמא כיון דהדור הדור
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises dilemma: bulls and goats that are burned left and returned, what is Do we say: Once they left, they became impure? Or perhaps once they return, they return
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar inquired: Regarding burnt oxen and goats that went out and returned, what is the law? Do we say that once they have gone out, they are sealed for sacrifice, or perhaps since they have returned, they are sealed?

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אבא בר ממל ת"ש היו סובלין אותן במוטות הראשונים יצאו חוץ לחומת העזרה והאחרונים לא יצאו הראשונים שיצאו חוץ לחומת העזרה מטמאין בגדים והאחרונים אין מטמאין בגדים עד שיצאו ואי ס"ד כיון דנפקי להו איטמו הנך דאיכא גואי ליטמא
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel says: Come hear They would carry on poles. the first emerged beyond the wall of the courtyard and the latter did not emerge, the first who emerged beyond the wall of the courtyard, render garments impure, but the latter do not render garments impure until they emerge. And if it enters your mind once they leave, they become impure, these who are inside should be rendered impure,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba bar Memel: Come and hear! They would carry them on poles. The first ones went out beyond the wall of the Azarah, and the latter ones did not go out. The first ones who went out beyond the wall of the Azarah render garments impure, but the latter ones do not render garments impure until they go out. And if you will say, once they have gone out, let those who are inside become impure.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא ותסברא הא בעינא (ויקרא יד, ח) ואחר יבא אל המחנה וליכא
human_translation: Ravina said: And can you understand I require and afterward he may come into the camp” And not
llm_translation: Ravina said: And reasoning is needed. "And another shall come into the camp" (Leviticus 14:8), and there is none.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי אלעזר היכי בעי לה כגון דנקיטי לה בבקולסי
human_translation: But how did Rabbi Elazar raise this dilemma? where they take with staffs [ bevakulsei ],
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Elazar, how does he require it? Like the case where it entered into it in Bukolsei.

hebrew_text: ת"ר פרים ופרה ושעיר המשתלח המשלח השורפן והמוציאן מטמא בגדים והן עצמן אין מטמאין בגדים אבל מטמאין אוכלין ומשקין דברי ר"מ וחכ"א פרה ופרים מטמאין אוכלין ומשקין שעיר המשתלח אינו מטמא שהוא חי והחי אינו מטמא אוכלין ומשקין
human_translation: The Sages taught bulls and heifer, and the scapegoat the one who sends the one who burns them, and the one who takes them out render garments impure. And themselves, do not render garments impure, but they render food and drink impure. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: heifer and bulls render food and drink impure, the scapegoat does not transmit impurity as it is alive and a living being does not render food and drink impure.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A cow, a heifer, and a goat that are sent away, the one who sends them away, the one who burns them, and the one who takes them out, render garments impure, but they themselves do not render garments impure. However, they render food and drink impure. These are the words of Rabbi Meir, while the sages say: A cow and heifer render food and drink impure, but not garments. A goat that is sent away does not render impure, as it is alive, and the living do not render food and drink impure.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבי מאיר כדתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, לז) על כל זרע זרוע
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Meir in accordance with which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught. As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught upon any sowing seed
llm_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Meir, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:37) "Upon all seeds of sowing."

hebrew_text: מה זרעים שאין סופן ליטמא טומאה חמורה וצריכין הכשר אף כל שאין סופן ליטמא טומאה חמורה צריכין הכשר יצתה נבלת עוף טהור שסופה ליטמא טומאה חמורה ואין צריכה הכשר
human_translation: Just as seeds, which, can never contract impurity severe and they need rendered susceptible so too, all that can never contract impurity severe need rendered susceptible exclude the carcass of a kosher bird, which can contract impurity severe and does not need rendered susceptible
llm_translation: Seeds that their end is not to become impure with severe impurity and require preparation, even all that their end is not to become impure with severe impurity require preparation. If a carcass of a pure bird has emerged, whose end is to become impure with severe impurity and does not require preparation.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבנן אי אית להו דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל אפילו שעיר המשתלח אי לית ליה אפי' פרה ופרים מנלן
human_translation: But for the Rabbis, If they accept which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, even the scapegoat if they do not accept from where do we even heifer and bulls
llm_translation: Rather, for the Rabbis, if they have a tradition from the school of Rabbi Yishmael that even a goat sent away as a scapegoat on Yom Kippur, if it does not have the required qualifications, then even a cow and bulls cannot be used.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר אמרי במערבא צריכין הכשר טומאה ממקום אחר
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came said: in the West, say: need contract impurity from somewhere else
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: They said in the West, "One requires the qualification of impurity from another place."

hebrew_text: בעי רבי אלעזר פרים ושעירים הנשרפים מהו שיטמאו אוכלין ומשקין בפנים כבחוץ מחוסר יציאה כמחוסר מעשה דמי או לא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: bulls and goats that are burned, what is whether they can transmit impurity to food and drink inside as outside that has not yet left considered as action has not yet Or no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar inquired: Regarding burnt offerings of bulls and goats, if they become impure, do their food and drink items inside the Temple become impure like those outside the Temple, lacking an exit, similar to lacking an action, or not?

hebrew_text: בתר דבעיא הדר פשטה מחוסר יציאה כמחוסר מעשה דמי
human_translation: After raised the dilemma, he then resolved it: that has not yet left is considered as action has not yet
llm_translation: After the question was asked, she then removed it from the lack of exit, like the lack of an action.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי אבא בר שמואל מרבי חייא בר אבא נבלת עוף טהור לר' מאיר מהו שיטמא בכזית
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Shmuel posed dilemma to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: According to Rabbi Meir, what is the carcass of a kosher bird transmit impurity an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Abba bar Shmuel from Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: A carcass of a clean bird, according to Rabbi Meir, what if it becomes contaminated to the size of an olive?

hebrew_text: דמחתא לארעא לא תיבעי לך דנקיט בפומיה לא תיבעי לך כי תיבעי לך דנקיט ליה בידיה מחוסר קריבה כמחוסר מעשה דמי או לא
human_translation: Do not raise the dilemma where lies on the ground, do not raise the dilemma where holds in his mouth, When you raise the dilemma, where he holds in his hand. has not yet been brought close considered like action has not yet or not?
llm_translation: Blood of a slaughtered animal does not require ritual sprinkling on the ground; it does not require ritual sprinkling on the mouth. If it requires ritual sprinkling on the mouth, if he took it in his hand, lacking closeness, it is as if lacking an action. Is it similar or not?

hebrew_text: (בתר דבעיא הדר פשטה)
human_translation: After raised the dilemma, he then resolved it:
llm_translation: After the question was asked, she removed it.

hebrew_text: מחוסר קריבה לאו כמחוסר מעשה דמי
human_translation: has not yet been brought close not considered as action has not yet
llm_translation: Lack of closeness is not like lack of action.

hebrew_text: איתיביה שלשה עשר דברים נאמרו בנבלת עוף טהור וזה אחד מהן צריכה מחשבה ואין צריכה הכשר ומטמא טומאת אוכלין בכביצה מאי לאו ר"מ היא
human_translation: raised an objection to Thirteen matters were stated with regard to the carcass of a kosher bird, and this is one of them: requires intention and it does not need rendered susceptible and it transmits ritual impurity of food in an egg-bulk. What, is it not Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: He raised an objection: Thirteen matters were stated regarding the carcass of a clean bird, and this is one of them - it requires intent but does not require proper preparation, and it imparts ritual impurity of food through a lentil-sized portion. Is it not so that this is the opinion of Rabbi Meir?

hebrew_text: לא רבנן היא
human_translation: No, is the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Not the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: והא קתני רישא צריכה מחשבה ואין צריכה הכשר ומאן שמעת ליה האי סברא ר"מ ומדרישא ר"מ סיפא נמי ר"מ
human_translation: But the first clause teaches: requires intention and it does not need rendered susceptible And whom do you learn this reasoning? Rabbi Meir, And since the first clause Rabbi Meir, the latter clause also Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And this is the teaching of the beginning of the Mishnah: requires thought, and does not require ritual fitness. And who heard for him this reasoning? Rabbi Meir. And the exposition is Rabbi Meir. The end of the Mishnah also is Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: From the Talmudic text: "מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא" Translation: "Some say this way, and some say that way."

hebrew_text: והא מדקתני סיפא שחיטתה ומליקתה מטהרת טריפתה מטומאתה מאן שמעת ליה האי סברא ר"מ רישא וסיפא רבי מאיר ומציעתא רבנן
human_translation: But from that the latter clause teaches: The slaughter or the pinching of purifies it from its impurity, have a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ]. whom did you learn this reasoning? Rabbi Meir the first clause and the last clause Rabbi Meir, and the middle clause the Rabbis?
llm_translation: And this, as it was taught: the latter clause states that its slaughtering and its salting purify it, its trefah status and its impurity. Who agrees with this reasoning? Rabbi Meir in the first clause, and Rabbi Meir in the latter clause, and the resolution is in accordance with the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אין רישא וסיפא רבי מאיר ומציעתא רבנן
human_translation: Yes, the first clause and the last clause Rabbi Meir, and the middle clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The beginning and the end, Rabbi Meir, and the middle, the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב המנונא לרבי זירא לא תיתיב אכרעך עד דאמרת לי הא מילתא נבלת עוף טהור לר"מ מונין לה ראשון ושני או אין מונין ראשון ושני
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said to Rabbi Zeira: Do not sit down until you tell me this matter: The carcass of a kosher bird, according to Rabbi Meir, count its first and second Or does not count first and second
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said to Rabbi Zeira: Do not sit down until you tell me the following matter: "A carcass of a kosher bird - do we count it as the first and second degree of impurity according to Rabbi Meir, or do we not count it as the first and second degree of impurity?"

hebrew_text: א"ל כל היכא דמטמא אדם במגע מונין בו ראשון ושני כל היכא דאין מטמא אדם במגע אין מונין בו ראשון ושני
human_translation: said to him: Wherever can render a person impure through contact, counts its first and second wherever it cannot render a person impure through contact, does not count its first and second
llm_translation: He said to him, "Wherever a person becomes impure through contact, we count the first and second degree of impurity. Wherever a person does not become impure through contact, we do not count the first and second degree of impurity."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רבי זירא מרבי אמי בר חייא ואמרי לה מר' אבין בר כהנא הא דתנן חיבורי אוכלין ע"י משקין חיבור לטומאה קלה ואין חיבור לטומאה חמורה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira posed a dilemma to Rabbi Ami bar Ḥiyya, and some say to Rabbi Avin bar Kahana that which we learned Connections between foods by liquid, a connection for lenient impurity but not a connection for impurity severe
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Zeira from Rabbi Ami bar Chiya, and some say from Rabbi Avin bar Kahana: As we learned in a Mishnah, food items can contract ritual impurity through liquids. Connection to impurity for light impurity, but no connection to impurity for severe impurity.

hebrew_text: מונין בו ראשון ושני או אין מונין בו ראשון ושני
human_translation: count its first and second Or not count its first and second
llm_translation: We count in it the first and the second, or do we not count in it the first and the second.

hebrew_text: א"ל כל היכא דמטמא אדם מונין בו ראשון ושני אין מטמא אדם אין מונין בו ראשון ושני:
human_translation: said to him: Wherever can render a person impure, counts its first and second cannot render a person impure, does not count its first and second
llm_translation: He said to him: "Wherever a person becomes impure, we count the first and second instances of impurity. Where a person does not become impure, we do not count the first and second instances."

hebrew_text: יצאו אלו ואלו: מה"מ דת"ר להלן הוא אומר חוץ לג' מחנות כאן למחנה אחת לומר לך כיון שיצא חוץ למחנה אחת מטמא בגדים
human_translation: these and those emerged, From where are these matters As the Sages taught There, states outside three camps, here, one camp, to tell you: Once emerges beyond one camp, renders garments impure,
llm_translation: They both went out: What is the meaning of what the Rabbis taught there, that it says "outside the three camps here to one camp"? To tell you that once he has gone outside one camp, he renders garments impure.

hebrew_text: והיא גופה מנלן דת"ר (ויקרא ד, יב) והוציא את כל הפר אל מחוץ למחנה חוץ לג' מחנות אתה אומר חוץ לג' מחנות או אינו אלא מחנה אחת
human_translation: And from where do we that itself, As the Sages taught “Even the whole bull shall he carry outside the camp outside three camps. Do you say outside three camps, or only one camp?
llm_translation: And it is itself from where? As the Rabbis taught (Leviticus 4:12), "And he shall take out the entire bull to outside the camp." Outside of the three camps, do you say outside of the three camps, or is it only one camp?

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר בפר העדה (ויקרא ד, יב) מחוץ למחנה שאין צריך לומר שהרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ד, כא) כאשר שרף את הפר הראשון ליתן לו מחנה שניה
human_translation: When states with regard to the bull a communal outside the camp, as there is no need to state since it is already stated “And burn it as he burned the first bull,” To give it a second camp,
llm_translation: When it says in Parashat Ha'edah (Leviticus 4:12), "outside the camp," it is unnecessary to say, for it has already been stated (Leviticus 4:21), "as he burned the first bull outside the camp to give him a second camp."

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר מחוץ למחנה בדשן שאצ"ל שהרי כבר נאמר (ויקרא ד, יב) על שפך הדשן ישרף ליתן לו מחנה שלישית
human_translation: when states with regard to the ash: outside the camp as there is no need to state since it is already stated where the ashes are poured out shall it be burned” to give it a third camp,
llm_translation: When he says "outside the camp in the ash heap," as it is already stated (Leviticus 4:12), "on the ash heap it shall be burned," to give him a third camp.

hebrew_text: ור"ש האי מחוץ למחנה מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לכדתניא רבי אליעזר אומר נאמר כאן חוץ למחנה ונאמר להלן (במדבר יט, ג) חוץ למחנה מה להלן חוץ לג' מחנות אף כאן חוץ לג' מחנות ומה להלן למזרחה של ירושלים
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Shimon do with this “Outside the camp” He requires it for which is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated here: “Outside the camp,” and it is stated there, outside the camp” Just as here, outside three camps, so too there, outside three camps. And just as there, east of Jerusalem,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says, "This one outside the camp, what does he do?" It is necessary for him, as it was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "It is stated here 'outside the camp,' and it is stated there (Numbers 19:3) 'outside the camp.' Just as there, 'outside the three camps,' so too here, 'outside the three camps.' And just as there, towards the east of Jerusalem, so too here."

hebrew_text: אף כאן למזרחה של ירושלים
human_translation: so too here, east of Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Even here, to the east of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבנן היכא שריף להו כדתניא היכן נשרפין לצפון ירושלים חוץ לשלש מחנות רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר אבית הדשן נשרפין
human_translation: But according to the Rabbis, where do they burn them? As it is taught Where are burned? north of Jerusalem, outside of three camps. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: They are burned on the place of the ashes,
llm_translation: Rather, for the Rabbis, where is it burned for them? As it was taught: Where are they burned? To the north of Jerusalem, outside of the three camps. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The Avit HaDeshen is burned.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאן תנא דפליג עליה דר' יוסי הגלילי ר' אליעזר בן יעקב היא דתניא (ויקרא ד, יב) על שפך הדשן ישרף שיהא שם דשן (שיקדים לשם דשן) ר' אליעזר בן יעקב אומר שיהא מקומו משופך
human_translation: Rava said: Who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as it is taught “Where the ashes are poured out [ shefekh hadeshen ] shall it be burned” that ashes must be there Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: that its place should slope [ meshupakh ]
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, as it was taught (Leviticus 4:12): "The ash of the burnt offering shall be on the place of the ashes." Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "Its place shall be poured out."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי דילמא במקומו משופך פליגי
human_translation: Abaye said to Perhaps they disagree about the place must slope,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Perhaps they argue in its place.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן השורף מטמא בגדים ולא המצית את האור מטמא בגדים ולא המסדר את המערכה מטמא בגדים ואיזהו השורף המסייע בשעת שריפה
human_translation: The Sages taught the one who burns renders garments impure, but the one who kindles the fire does not render garments impure, and the one who sets up the arrangement does not render garments impure. And who is the one who burns? One who assists at the time of burning.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who burns imparts impurity to garments, but one who does not ignite the fire does not impart impurity to garments; one who extinguishes the fire imparts impurity to garments, but one who arranges the woodpile does not impart impurity to garments. And who is considered the one who burns? One who assists at the time of burning.

hebrew_text: יכול אף משנעשו אפר מטמא בגדים תלמוד לומר אותם אותם מטמאין בגדים ומשנעשין אפר אין מטמאין בגדים רבי שמעון אומר אותם מטמאין בגדים ניתך הבשר אין מטמאין בגדים
human_translation: might renders garments impure even after become ash. the verse states: them” they, render garments impure, but they do not render garments impure once they become ash. Rabbi Shimon says: they render garments impure, the flesh is incinerated they do not render garments impure.
llm_translation: I can even when they become ashes defile garments. The teaching states to say those, those defile garments. And when they become ashes, they do not defile garments. Rabbi Shimon says: those defile garments, but if the flesh is poured out, they do not defile garments.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רבא איכא בינייהו דשוייה חרוכא:
human_translation: What is between Rava said: between them is when he turned it into a charred
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rava said: There is a difference between them that is as clear as daylight.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך טבול יום
llm_translation: We will return to you, O Tevul Yom.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט והמעלה בחוץ חייב על השחיטה וחייב על העלאה
human_translation: One who slaughters and one who offers up outside liable for the slaughter and liable for offering up,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters and offers up outside the Temple is liable for the slaughtering and liable for the offering up.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר שחט בפנים והעלה בחוץ שחט בחוץ והעלה בחוץ פטור שלא העלה אלא דבר פסול אמרו לו אף השוחט בפנים ומעלה בחוץ כיון שהוציאו פסלו
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: he slaughtered inside and offered up outside he slaughtered outside, and he offered up outside, exempt as he offered up only an item unfit, said to him: even he slaughters inside and offers up outside, since that he took it outside rendered it unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: "Slaughter inside and bring the offering outside - if one slaughtered outside and brought the offering outside, he is exempt, for he only brought forth something invalid." They said to him: "Even one who slaughters inside and brings the offering outside, once he has brought it out, it becomes invalid."

hebrew_text: הטמא שאכל בין קדש טמא בין קדש טהור חייב רבי יוסי הגלילי אומר טמא שאכל טהור חייב וטמא שאכל טמא פטור שלא אכל אלא דבר טמא אמרו לו אף טמא שאכל את הטהור כיון שנגע בו טמאוהו
human_translation: One who is ritually impure who ate whether ritually impure sacrificial or ritually pure sacrificial liable Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: An impure who ate pure liable. But an impure who ate impure exempt, as he merely ate an impure item, said to him: even an impure who ate pure once he touched it, he rendered it ritually impure.
llm_translation: The impure who ate whether sanctified impure or sanctified pure obligated Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says impure who ate pure obligated and impure who ate impure exempt for he only ate a impure thing they said to him even impure who ate the pure since he touched it he made it impure.

hebrew_text: וטהור שאכל טמא פטור שאינו חייב אלא על טומאת הגוף:
human_translation: And a pure who ate impure exempt, as liable only due to impurity of body,
llm_translation: And pure who ate impure exempt for not obligated except on impurity of the body.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בשלמא העלה כתיב עונש וכתיב אזהרה עונש דכתיב (ויקרא יז, ד) ואל פתח אהל מועד לא הביאו אזהרה דכתיב (דברים יב, יג) השמר לך פן תעלה עולותיך וכי הא דא"ר אבין א"ר אלעזר כל מקום שנאמר השמר פן ואל אינו אלא לא תעשה
human_translation: Granted offering up, punishment is written and prohibition is written punishment as it is written: and will not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, prohibition as it is written: “Take heed to yourself lest you offer up your burnt offerings And in accordance with that which Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Elazar says: Wherever it is stated Observe, Lest, or: Do not, it is nothing other than a prohibition.
llm_translation: Gemara: Granted, regarding the burnt offering, punishment is written, and a warning is also written. Punishment, as it is written (Leviticus 17:4), "And they did not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." A warning, as it is written (Deuteronomy 12:13), "Be careful for yourself lest you offer your burnt offerings." But is this the same as what Rabbi Avin said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Any place where it says "Be careful lest" and "do not" is only a prohibition.

hebrew_text: אלא שחיטה בשלמא עונש דכתיב (ויקרא יז, ד) ואל פתח אהל מועד לא הביאו אלא אזהרה מנלן אמר קרא (ויקרא יז, ז) ולא יזבחו עוד
human_translation: But slaughtering, Granted punishment as it is written: and he did not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, But from where do we prohibition? The verse states “And they shall not slaughter anymore
llm_translation: Rather, slaughter, it is understandable, punishment, as it is written (Leviticus 17:4), "And they did not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." Only a warning. From where do we derive this? The verse states (Leviticus 17:7), "And they shall no longer sacrifice."

hebrew_text: האי מיבעי ליה לכדר"א דאמר מנין לזובח בהמה למרקוליס שהוא חייב דכתיב ולא יזבחו עוד את זבחיהם אם אינו ענין לכדרכה דכתיב (דברים יב, ל) איכה יעבדו תנהו ענין לשלא כדרכה
human_translation: this necessary for in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar, as he says: From where one who slaughters an animal to Mercury, that he is liable As it is written: they shall not slaughter anymore their offerings If is not matter of in accordance with its established manner, as it is written: How do these serve apply it matter of that not in accordance with its established manner.
llm_translation: This requires according to Rabbi Akiva who said, "From where do we derive that one who slaughters an animal for Mercury is liable, as it is written, 'And they shall no longer sacrifice their sacrifices' - if it is not in the usual manner, as it is written, 'How can they serve it?' - not in the usual manner."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה קרי ביה ולא יזבחו וקרי ביה ולא עוד
human_translation: Rabba said: Read into “And they shall not slaughter” And read into And not anymore
llm_translation: Rabba said: "It is read in it, 'and they shall not sacrifice,' and it is read in it, 'and not only that.'"

hebrew_text: אכתי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא עד כאן הוא מדבר בקדשים שהקדישן בשעת איסור הבמות והקריבן בשעת איסור הבמות

llm_translation: The Sages taught: "In the camp, one who slaughters an offering in the south is liable." It is stated: "Outside the camp."

hebrew_text: יכול חוץ לשלש מחנות [ת"ל (ויקרא יז, ג) או עז במחנה] (מנין אף במחנה לוייה ת"ל במחנה)
human_translation: might outside three camps. the verse states: or goat, in the camp,” From where even inside the Levite camp? The verse states: in the camp,”
llm_translation: I might have thought it applies even outside of the three camps It is taught: (Leviticus 17:3) "or a goat in the camp" (How do we know that it also applies in the Levite camp? The verse teaches: "in the camp").

hebrew_text: אי במחנה יכול השוחט עולה בדרום יהא חייב ת"ל או אל מחוץ למחנה
human_translation: If “in the camp,” might one who slaughters a burnt offering in the south will be liable. the verse states: “Or outside the camp.”
llm_translation: If in the camp, one might have thought that one who slaughters an offering in the south is liable, the Torah teaches "or outside the camp."

hebrew_text: מה חוץ למחנה מיוחד שאין ראוי לשחיטת קדשים ולשחיטת כל זבח יצא דרום שאע"פ שאין ראוי לשחיטת קדשי קדשים ראוי לשחיטת קדשים קלים
human_translation: just as “outside the camp” distinctive that is not fit for slaughtering offerings or for slaughtering any offering, excludes south as even though not fit for slaughtering offerings of the most sacred order, fit for slaughtering offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: What is considered outside the camp that is designated, not fitting for the slaughter of holy offerings and for the slaughter of any sacrifice? The south. Even though it is not fitting for the slaughter of most holy offerings, it is fitting for the slaughter of lesser holy offerings.

hebrew_text: אמר עולא השוחט על גגו של היכל חייב הואיל ואין ראוי לשחיטת כל זבח מתקיף לה רבא א"כ ניכתוב קרא (אל) מחוץ למחנה ולא בעי אל פתח אהל מועד אל פתח אהל מועד ל"ל לאו למעוטי גגו
human_translation: Ulla says: One who slaughters on the roof of Sanctuary liable since not fit for the slaughter of any offering. Rava objects to this: If so, let the verse write outside the camp,” and not necessary to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” Why do I to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting”? not to exclude the roof of
llm_translation: Ula said: One who slaughters on the roof of the sanctuary is liable, since it is not fitting for the slaughter of any sacrifice. Rava objects: If so, let the verse be written, "outside the camp," and it would not need to say, "at the entrance of the tent of meeting." "At the entrance of the tent of meeting" is stated to exclude the roof.

hebrew_text: ולרבא א"כ נכתוב אל פתח אהל מועד במחנה (ואל) מחוץ למחנה ל"ל לאו לאתויי גגו
human_translation: But according to Rava, if so let write “And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.” Why do I “in the camp” “outside the camp”? not to include the roof of
llm_translation: And to Rava, if so, it should be written "at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting in the camp (and) outside the camp," to exclude his roof.

hebrew_text: אמר רב מרי לאיתויי כולה בפנים וצוארה בחוץ
human_translation: Rav Mari said to include its entirely inside but its neck outside
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: "To bring it all inside, while its neck is outside."

hebrew_text: [צוארה] בחוץ פשיטא אמאי קפיד רחמנא אשחיטה ושחיטה בחוץ היא אלא לאיתויי כולה בחוץ וצוארה בפנים
human_translation: its neck outside obvious about what the Merciful One particular? about slaughter. And slaughter is out-side Rather, to include its entirely outside but its neck inside
llm_translation: צוארה - its neck, outside - it is obvious, why did the Merciful One specify that slaughtering must be done outside? Rather, to include the entire act outside and its neck inside.

hebrew_text: איתמר המעלה בזמן הזה ר' יוחנן אמר חייב ריש לקיש אמר פטור
human_translation: was stated one who offers up today, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable. Reish Lakish says: exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who commits the act of Ma'aleh in our time. Rabbi Yochanan said: He is liable. Reish Lakish said: He is exempt.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר חייב קדושה ראשונה קידשה לשעתה וקידשה לעתיד לבא ריש לקיש אמר פטור קדושה ראשונה קידשה לשעתה ולא קידשה לעתיד לבא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever, Reish Lakish says exempt, initial consecration sanctified for its time but did not sanctify forever.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One is obligated in the first sanctification, He sanctified it for its time, and He sanctified it for the future." Reish Lakish said: "One is exempt. The first sanctification, He sanctified it for its time, and He did not sanctify it for the future."

hebrew_text: נימא דבפלוגתא דר"א ור' יהושע קמיפלגי דתנן א"ר אליעזר כשהיו בונין בהיכל היו עושים קלעים בהיכל קלעים בעזרות אלא שבהיכל בונין מבחוץ ובעזרה בונין מבפנים
human_translation: Let us say disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned Rabbi Eliezer said: when they were building the Sanctuary they would fashion curtains for the Sanctuary curtains for the courtyards only that in the Sanctuary, built outside and in the courtyards, built within
llm_translation: Said in the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua, for it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, when they were constructing the Temple, they would make curtains in the Temple and curtains in the Courtyard, except that in the Temple they would build from the outside, and in the Courtyard they would build from the inside.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהושע שמעתי שהיו מקריבין אע"פ שאין בית ואוכלים קדשי קדשים אע"פ שאין קלעים קדשים קלים ומעשר שני אע"פ שאין חומה מפני שקדושה ראשונה קידשה לשעתה וקידשה לעתיד לבא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that one sacrifices even if there is no Temple, and one partakes of offerings of the most sacred order even if there are no curtains, and offerings of lesser sanctity and second-tithe even if there is no wall due to that initial consecration sanctified for their time and sanctified forever.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that they used to bring sacrifices even though there was no Temple, and they would eat holy of holies even though there were no holy garments, and the second tithe even though there was no wall, because the original sanctity sanctified it for the present and sanctified it for the future.

hebrew_text: לאו מכלל דר"א סבר לא קידשה
human_translation: not by inference Rabbi Eliezer maintains it did not sanctify
llm_translation: Not from the general principle of Rabbi Akiva holds, did not sanctify her.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבינא לרב אשי ממאי דלמא דכולי עלמא קדושה ראשונה קידשה לשעתה וקידשה לעתיד לבא ומר מאי דשמיע ליה קאמר ומר מאי דשמיע ליה קאמר וכי תימא קלעים לר' אליעזר למה לי לצניעותא בעלמא
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From where Perhaps everyone initial consecration sanctified for their time and sanctified forever. And Sage, stated that which he heard and Sage, stated that which he heard And if you would say: Why do I curtains according to Rabbi Eliezer? merely for seclusion,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From what source can one say that the entire world was sanctified both for its time in the past and will be sanctified for the future? And the Master, what does he hear in this? And the Master, what does he hear in this? And if you say that it is for Rabbi Eliezer, why do I need it for modesty in general?

hebrew_text: איתמר המעלה ואין בו כזית ועצם משלימו לכזית רבי יוחנן אמר חייב ריש לקיש אמר פטור
human_translation: was stated one who offers up and does not have an olive-bulk but bone completes to an olive-bulk. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable. Reish Lakish says: exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: If one carries out on Shabbat and it does not contain a k'zayit minimum amount, and a bone completes it to a k'zayit, Rabbi Yochanan said: liable, Reish Lakish said: exempt.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר חייב חיבורי עולין כעולין דמי ריש לקיש אמר פטור חיבורי עולין לאו כעולין דמו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, attached to offered up as offered up Reish Lakish says exempt, attached to offered up not as offered up
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One is liable for the connection of ropes just as the ropes themselves." Reish Lakish said: "One is exempt, for the connection of ropes is not equivalent to the ropes themselves."

human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: one who offers up

llm_translation: Rosh ben Yonah that does not have a kezayit and salt complements it to a kezayit, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא מפרזקיא לרב אשי לאו היינו פלוגתייהו דר' יוחנן ור"ל תיבעי לרבי יוחנן ותיבעי לר"ל
human_translation: Rava from Parzakya said to Rav Ashi: Is this not the dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish The dilemma can be raised according to Rabbi Yoḥanan and the dilemma can be raised according to Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Ashi: Is this not the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish? Let it be asked of Rabbi Yochanan and let it be asked of Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: תיבעי לר' יוחנן ע"כ לא קאמר ר' יוחנן התם אלא עצם דמינא דבשר הוא אבל מלח דלאו מינא דבר יונה הוא לא תיבעי לר"ל ע"כ לא קאמר ר"ל התם אלא דאי פריש מינה לאו מצוה לאסוקי אבל הכא דאי פריש מצוה לאסוקי לא או דלמא ל"ש
human_translation: The dilemma can be raised according to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Yoḥanan states only there, a bone, as it is the kind that flesh But salt, which is not the kind as a pigeon, not the dilemma can be raised according to Reish Lakish: Reish Lakish states only there, as if separates from no mitzva to offer up But here, which if it separates a mitzva to offer up, not Or perhaps is no difference
llm_translation: It is asked to Rabbi Yochanan: Is it not so that Rabbi Yochanan did not say there, but rather it is the essence of the blood of meat, but salt, which is not the essence of a dove, is it not asked to Rabbi Levi: Is it not so that Rabbi Levi did not say there, but rather if one separates from it, it is not a mitzvah to use it, but here, if one separates, it is a mitzvah to use it, or perhaps not.

hebrew_text: תיקו:
human_translation: shall stand
llm_translation: The case remains undecided.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי הגלילי אומר כו':
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi HaGalili says: text continues...

hebrew_text: השיב רבי תחת רבי יוסי הגלילי מה לשוחט בפנים ומעלה בחוץ שהיתה לו שעת הכושר תאמר בשוחט חוץ ומעלה בחוץ שלא היתה לו שעת הכושר
human_translation: Rabbi responded on behalf of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: What about slaughtering inside and offering up outside? that had a period of fitness. Can you say about slaughtering outside and offering up outside, where never had a period of fitness?
llm_translation: Rabbi replied in place of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean: What if one slaughters inside and brings the offering outside, but he had a valid time to do so? You shall say that he slaughters outside and brings it outside, but he did not have a valid time to do so.

hebrew_text: השיב ר"א בר' שמעון תחת ר"י הגלילי מה לשוחט בפנים ומעלה בחוץ שכן קודש מקבלו תאמר בשוחט בחוץ שאין קודש מקבלו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, responded on behalf of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili: What about slaughtering inside and offering up outside? in that sanctity renders acceptable Can you say about slaughtering outside where sanctity does not render acceptable?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, responded in place of Rabbi Yehuda the Galilean: What is the law regarding slaughtering inside and carrying the blood outside? It is permissible, for thus holiness is accepted. You shall say the law is the same regarding slaughtering outside, that holiness is not accepted.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר זעירי שחיטת לילה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between these Ze’eiri said: between them is slaughtering at night
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Zairi said: the slaughtering of the night there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: רבה אמר קבלה בכלי חול איכא בינייהו:
human_translation: Rabba said: between them is collection in a non-sacred vessel
llm_translation: Rabah said: "Tradition in a mundane vessel there is a distinction between them."

hebrew_text: טמא שאכל בין קודש כו':
human_translation: ritually impure who ate whether sacrificial
llm_translation: Impure who ate between holy, etc.

hebrew_text: שפיר קאמרי ליה רבנן לרבי יוסי הגלילי
human_translation: The Rabbis are saying well to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili;
llm_translation: "Good are saying to him the Rabbis to Rabbi Yossi the Galilean."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא כל היכא דנטמא טומאת הגוף ואחר כך נטמא בשר דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דחייב שכן טומאת הגוף בכרת
human_translation: Rava said Wherever rendered impure impurity of the body and afterward meat is rendered impure, everyone agrees that liable because impurity of body, of karet ,
llm_translation: Rava said: Wherever one becomes impure with impurity of the body, and afterwards becomes impure with flesh, everyone agrees that he is liable, for impurity of the body is subject to karet.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי בשנטמא בשר ואח"כ נטמא הגוף
human_translation: When they disagree meat is rendered impure and afterward the body is rendered impure.
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding one who became impure through contact with a corpse and afterwards the body became impure.

hebrew_text: דרבנן סברי אמרינן מיגו ור' יוסי הגלילי סבר לא אמרינן מיגו
human_translation: as the Rabbis hold we say since And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says we do not say since
llm_translation: The Sages hold: we say "from him," and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds: we do not say "from him."

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי נהי דמיגו לא אמרינן תיתי טומאת הגוף דחמירא ותחול על טומאת בשר
human_translation: But Rabbi Yosei granted that we do not say since impurity of body, which a more stringent should come and take effect upon ritual impurity meat
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yossi, since he did not say, we do not apply the impurity of the body, which is stringent, and it takes effect on the impurity of flesh.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי ממאי דטומאת הגוף חמורה דלמא טומאת בשר חמורה שכן אין לה טהרה במקוה:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: From where that impurity of the body is more stringent? Perhaps impurity of meat is more stringent, as does not have purification in a ritual bath,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: From what is the impurity of the body severe? Perhaps the impurity of flesh is severe, for it has no purification in a mikveh.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חומר בשחיטה מבעלייה ובעלייה מבשחיטה
human_translation: a greater stringency with regard to slaughtering than with regard to offering up and with regard to offering up than with regard to slaughtering
llm_translation: Mishnah: Chumra in Shechitah Meba'aliyah, u'ba'aliyah Me'shechitah.

hebrew_text: חומר בשחיטה שהשוחט להדיוט חייב והמעלה להדיוט פטור חומר בעלייה שנים שאחזו בסכין ושחטו פטורים אחזו באבר והעלו חייבין
human_translation: greater stringency with regard to slaughtering that one who slaughters for an ordinary liable. But one who offers up for an ordinary exempt. greater stringency with regard to offering up two who grasped a knife and slaughtered exempt. grasped a limb and offered up liable.
llm_translation: Matter in slaughtering, one who slaughters for a commoner is liable, and one who lifts up for a commoner is exempt. Matter in lifting up, two individuals who grasped the knife and slaughtered are exempt; they grasped a limb and lifted up, they are liable.

hebrew_text: העלה חזר והעלה וחזר והעלה חייב על כל עלייה דברי ר"ש ר' יוסי אומר אינו חייב אלא אחת
human_translation: offered up and then offered up and then offered up liable for each offering up; the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yosei says: liable only one
llm_translation: The burnt offering, he went up, and the burnt offering, and he went up, and he went up, he is liable for each ascent. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yossi says, he is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: ואינו חייב עד שיעלה לראש המזבח ר"ש אומר אפילו העלה על הסלע או על האבן חייב:
human_translation: And liable only once he offers up at the top of an altar Rabbi Shimon says: Even he offered up on a rock or on a stone, liable.
llm_translation: "And he is not liable until he ascends to the top of the altar. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he offered it on the rock or on the stone, he is liable."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי שנא המעלה להדיוט דפטור דכתיב (ויקרא יז, ד) לה' בשחיטה נמי הכתיב לה'
human_translation: What is different one who offers up for an ordinary that he is exempt? As it is written: to the Lord” with regard to slaughtering, isn’t it also written: to the Lord”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the difference between one who slaughters for a layperson and is exempt? As it is written (Leviticus 17:4), "To the Lord" - in the context of slaughter, it is also written "to Him."

human_translation: to exclude unwitting, compelled to act, or mistaken. If so, here too, necessary to exclude unwitting, compelled to act, or mistaken.

hebrew_text: ת"ר (ויקרא יז, ג) איש איש מה ת"ל לרבות שנים שאחזו באבר והעלו שחייבין שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה השוחט להדיוט שחייב שנים שאחזו בסכין ושחטו פטורין המעלה להדיוט שפטור אינו דין ששנים שאחזו פטורין ת"ל איש איש דברי ר"ש
human_translation: The Sages taught What the verse states: “Any man [ ish ish ]… two people who grasped a limb and offered up liable. as might Could this not be inference: If one who slaughters for an ordinary liable, two who grasped a knife and slaughtered exempt, one who offers up for an ordinary exempt, is it not logical that two who grasped exempt? the verse states “ ish ish ” the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "A man, a man" - what does the Torah teach us to include? To include two individuals who held onto a limb and lifted it, they are liable. Perhaps this is obvious? Just as one who slaughters for a layperson is liable if two individuals held onto the knife and slaughtered, they are exempt. The one who lifts for a layperson is exempt, it is not the same law that two individuals who held onto it are exempt. The Torah teaches "a man, a man" - these are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, This “That is necessary to exclude unwitting, compelled to act, or mistaken. And Rabbi Yosei from hu “ hahu .” And Rabbi Shimon does not expound from hu “ hahu .”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon this that he requires to exclude unintentional sin, coerced sin, and mistaken sin, and Rabbi Yosei that he requires that, and Rabbi Shimon that he does not require that.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי מדהאי איש איש דברה תורה כלשון בני אדם ההוא איש איש נמי דברה תורה כלשון בני אדם ואלא השוחט להדיוט מנא ליה דחייב נפקא ליה (ויקרא יז, ד) מדם יחשב לאיש ההוא דם שפך ואפילו השוחט לאיש:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, from that “ ish ish ” the Torah spoke in the language of people, also that “Any man [ ish ish ]” the Torah spoke in the language of people, But from where that one who slaughters for an ordinary liable? He derives it from “Blood shall be imputed to that man; he has shed blood” even one who slaughters for man
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei from that, a man, a man, the Torah spoke like the language of people. That man, too, the Torah spoke like the language of people. And if one slaughters for a commoner, from where does he derive that he is liable? It is derived for him (Leviticus 17:4), "From the blood of a man." That man spilled blood, and even if he slaughters for a man.

hebrew_text: העלה וחזר והעלה כו':
human_translation: offered up and then offered up
llm_translation: The burnt offering and returned and the burnt offering, etc.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ל מחלוקת בד' וה' אברים דמר סבר כי כתיב לעשות אותו על השלם הוא חייב ואינו חייב על החסר אכל בהמה כתיב ומר סבר אכל אבר ואבר כתיב אבל אבר אחד דברי הכל אינו חייב אלא אחת
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: dispute concerns four or five limbs As Sage, holds: When it is written: “To sacrifice it” for a complete liable but not liable for an incomplete it is written with regard to a whole animal. And Sage, holds is written with regard to each and every limb But one limb everyone agrees liable only one
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: There is a dispute regarding four and five limbs. Mar holds that since it is written "to make it complete," one is liable if it is complete and not liable if it is lacking. Regarding consuming an animal, it is written, and Mar holds that one must consume limb by limb. However, since it is written "limb" and "limb," everyone agrees that one is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אמר מחלוקת באבר אחד דמר סבר מוקטרי פנים שחסרו והעלה בחוץ חייב ומר סבר פטור אבל בד וה' איברין דברי הכל חייב על כל אבר ואבר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute concerns one limb As Sage, holds that are burned inside that became incomplete and were offered up outside liable. And Sage, holds exempt But with regard to four or five limbs, everyone agrees liable for each and every limb,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: The dispute is regarding one limb, as Mar holds that if the interior parts are lacking and he brought it outside, he is liable, and Mar holds that he is exempt. But regarding a limb and its five parts, everyone agrees that one is liable for each limb and part.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דעולא דאמר עולא הכל מודים במוקטרי פנים שחסרו והעלו בחוץ שחייב לא נחלקו אלא במוקטרי בחוץ שחסרו והעלו בחוץ דמר סבר פטור ומ"ס חייב
human_translation: And disagrees of Ulla, as Ulla says: Everyone concedes with regard to that are burned inside that became incomplete and were offered up outside that liable. They disagree only with regard to are burned outside, that became incomplete and were offered up outside. As Sage, holds exempt, and Sage, holds liable.
llm_translation: And there is a dispute of Ula, for Ula said: Everyone agrees regarding bundles of produce that were lacking and were brought in from outside, that one is liable. They only disagreed regarding bundles of produce that were lacking and were brought in from outside. Mar holds that one is exempt, and the Sages hold that one is liable.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר עולא הכל מודים במוקטרי חוץ שחסרו והעלו בחוץ שהוא פטור לא נחלקו אלא במוקטרי פנים שחסרו והעלו בחוץ דמ"ס פטור ומ"ס חייב
human_translation: There are who say Ulla says: Everyone concedes with regard to are burned outside, that became incomplete and were offered up outside, that one is exempt. They disagree only with regard to that are burned inside that became incomplete and were offered up outside. As Sage, holds exempt, and Sage, holds liable.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Ulla said: Everyone agrees regarding bundles of produce outside a private domain that are lacking in some way and were brought inside the private domain, that one is exempt. They only disagree regarding bundles inside a private domain that are lacking in some way and were brought outside the private domain, where some say exempt and some say liable.

hebrew_text: ופליגי דאבוה דשמואל אלישנא קמא דעולא דאמר אבוה דשמואל כמאן מהדרינן פוקעין לגבי מזבח כמאן דלא כר' יוסי:
human_translation: And of Shmuel’s father disagrees with the first version of Ulla’s as Shmuel’s father says: In accordance with whose do we restore that were dislodged to the altar? In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: And they dispute, the father of Shmuel and Elishna the first, of Ula, who said, the father of Shmuel, "Like whom do we act? We strike against the altar, like one who is not following the opinion of Rabbi Yosei."

hebrew_text: ואינו חייב עד שיעלה כו': אמר רב הונא מאי טעמא דרבי יוסי דכתיב (בראשית ח, כ) ויבן נח מזבח לה'
human_translation: And liable only once he offers up Rav Huna says: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? As it is written: “And Noah built an altar to the Lord,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And he is not liable until it ascends, etc." Rav Huna said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? As it is written (Genesis 8:20), "And Noah built an altar to the Lord."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן מ"ט דר"ש דכתיב (שופטים יג, יט) ויקח מנוח את גדי העזים ואת המנחה ויעל על הצור לה'
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written: “And Manoah took the kid with the meal offering, and offered it up upon the rock, to the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason for the teaching of Reish Lakish, as it is written (Judges 13:19), "And Manoah took the kid of the goats and the meal offering and offered it upon the rock to the Lord."

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי והכתיב ויבן מזבח לה' ההוא גובהה בעלמא ואידך נמי הא כתיב ויקח מנוח הוראת שעה היתה
human_translation: But also the other isn’t it written: “And built an altar to the Lord”? That merely an elevated place But also the other isn’t it written: “And Manoah took that was a provisional edict
llm_translation: And the other one also, and it is written, "And he built an altar to the Lord." That height is in the world. And the other one also, it is written, "And he took a resting place." It was a temporary instruction.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא ה"ט דר"ש כדתניא ר"ש אומר (ויקרא יז, ו) מזבח פתח אהל מועד ואין מזבח בבמה לפיכך העלה על הסלע או על האבן חייב
human_translation: And if you wish, say the reason of Rabbi Shimon is as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says altar at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” but altar is not on altar Therefore, one who offered up on a rock or on a stone liable.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says (Leviticus 17:6), "An altar at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," and there is no altar on a high place. Therefore, if one offers a sacrifice on a rock or on a stone, he is liable.

hebrew_text: יצא מיבעי ליה ה"ק לפיכך בשעת איסור הבמות העלה על הסלע או על האבן חייב
human_translation: should have fulfilled This is saying: therefore, during a period when altars is prohibited, offers up on a rock or on a stone liable.
llm_translation: He went out, it is required for him, the Holy One, Blessed be He, therefore, at the time of the prohibition of the altars, if one offered a sacrifice on a rock or on a stone, he is liable.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי יוסי בר' חנינא קרן וכבש ויסוד וריבוע מהו שיעכבו בבמה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, raises a dilemma: corner, ramp base and square shape. What is whether they are indispensable for altar
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, inquired: What is the ruling regarding a horn, a ram, a foundation, and a square if they are placed on a raised platform?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבי ירמיה תניא קרן וכבש וריבוע ויסוד מעכבין בבמה גדולה ואין מעכבין בבמה קטנה:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to him: It is taught corner, ramp, base, and square shape are indispensable for a great altar, but they are not indispensable for a small altar.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya: It was taught in a Baraita: A horn, a ram, a square, and a foundation impede in a large platform, but do not impede in a small platform.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אחד קדשים כשרין ואחד קדשים פסולין שהיה פסולן בקודש והקריבן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: both fit sacrificial and unfit sacrificial whose disqualification occurred in sanctity, and one sacrificed them outside liable.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One consecrated offering is valid, and one consecrated offering is invalid. If it was invalid in the sanctuary and he offered it outside, he is liable.

hebrew_text: המעלה כזית מן העולה ומן האימורין בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: One who offers up outside an olive-bulk of a burnt offering and of sacrificial portions liable.
llm_translation: The one who brings up an olive's worth from the burnt offering and from the portions outside the Temple, is liable.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (ויקרא יז, ח) אשר יעלה עולה או זבח אין לי אלא עולה מנין לרבות אימורי אשם ואימורי חטאת ואימורי קדשי קדשים ואימורי קדשים קלים ת"ל זבח
human_translation: The Sages taught “That offers up a burnt offering or sacrifice, I have only a burnt offering, From where to include the sacrificial portions of a guilt offering, the sacrificial portions of a sin offering, the sacrificial portions of offerings of the most sacred order, or the sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity? The verse states: “Sacrifice,”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: "Which is brought as a burnt offering or as a sacrifice" - I only have a burnt offering. How do I know to include the offerings of guilt, the offerings of sin, the offerings of most holy things, and the offerings of lesser holy things? The verse states: "sacrifice."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות הקומץ והלבונה והקטורת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח והמנסך שלשת לוגין יין ושלשת לוגין מים ת"ל (ויקרא יז, ט) ואל פתח אהל מועד לא יביאנו כל הבא לפתח אהל מועד חייבין עליו בחוץ
