human_translation: From where to include the handful the frankincense the incense, the meal offering of priests; the meal offering of the anointed priest, and one who pours as a libation three log of wine, or three log of water The verse states: “And he will not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” any brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting liable for outside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive to include the handful, frankincense, and incense, and the meal offering of the priests, and the meal offering of the anointed priest, and the libation of three log of wine and three log of water? It is stated (Leviticus 17:9), "And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting he shall not bring it." Whoever brings these offerings to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting is liable to punishment, they the offerings must be brought outside.

hebrew_text: ואין לי אלא קדשים כשרים מנין לרבות פסולין
human_translation: I have only fit offerings; from where to include unfit
llm_translation: And I have only holy items, how do I know to include invalid ones?

hebrew_text: כגון הלן והיוצא והטמא ושנשחט חוץ לזמנו וחוץ למקומו ושקבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמו והניתנין למטה שנתנן למעלה והניתנין למעלה שנתנן למטה והניתנין בחוץ שנתנן בפנים והניתנין בפנים שנתנן בחוץ ופסח וחטאת שנתנן שלא לשמן
human_translation: For example: that was left overnight, or that went outside or that impure, or that was slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, or that an unfit collected and sprinkled its blood, or one placed that is placed above below or one placed that is placed below above or one placed that is placed inside outside or one placed that is placed outside inside or a Paschal offering or sin offering whose was placed not for their sake?
llm_translation: Such as these: Halan, Hayotzei, Hatamei, and one that was slaughtered outside its designated time and place, and those that were received invalid, and its blood was thrown, and those that were given above when they should have been given below, and those that were given below when they should have been given above, and those that were given outside when they should have been given inside, and those that were given inside when they should have been given outside, and the Passover offering and the sin offering that were given not for their sake.

hebrew_text: מנין ת"ל לא יביאנו לעשות כל המתקבל בפתח אהל מועד חייבין עליו בחוץ:
human_translation: From where The verse states: he will not bring it to sacrifice any that is acceptable at entrance of the Tent of Meeting, liable for it outside
llm_translation: From where do we derive the law that one should not bring it the offering to perform the service - anyone who is accepted at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, they are obligated concerning him outside the Tent of Meeting?

hebrew_text: המעלה כזית מן העולה כו': עולה ואימוריה אין שלמים ואימוריהן לא
human_translation: One who offers up outside an olive-bulk of a burnt offering a burnt offering and its sacrificial portions, yes, a peace offering and its sacrificial portions, not
llm_translation: The one who brings up an olive-bulk from the burnt-offering, etc.: the burnt-offering and its meal-offering are not complete, and their meal-offerings are not.

hebrew_text: תנינא להא דת"ר עולה ואימוריה מצטרפין לכזית להעלותן בחוץ ולחייב עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא
human_translation: We learn that which the Sages taught a burnt offering and its sacrificial portions combine to an olive-bulk, for offering them up outside and to render liable for them due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Baraita: The burnt offering and its meal offering combine to the size of an olive for their being brought outside, and one is liable for them due to the prohibition of "Piggul," "Remaining," and "Impure."

hebrew_text: בשלמא העלאת עולה דכליל אין שלמים לא אלא פיגול ונותר וטמא מ"ט
human_translation: Granted, offering up a burnt offering, which is consumed yes, peace offerings, not But piggul , notar , and ritually impure, what is the reason
llm_translation: In peace, the offering of a burnt offering is complete, there are no peace offerings, only disqualified, leftover, and impure. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: והא תנן כל הפגולין מצטרפין וכל הנותרין מצטרפין קשיא פיגול אפיגול קשיא נותר אנותר
human_translation: And didn’t we learn Anything that is piggul combines and anything that is notar combines piggul difficult, by piggul notar difficult, by notar
llm_translation: And behold, we learned in a Mishnah: all the piggul offerings combine, and all the leftovers combine. This is difficult: piggul with piggul is difficult, leftover with leftover is difficult.

hebrew_text: פיגול אפיגול לא קשיא כאן בפיגול כאן במחשבת פיגול
human_translation: piggul by piggul not difficult. Here, concerns piggul , there, concerns piggul intention.
llm_translation: "פיגול אפיגול לא קשיא כאן בפיגול כאן במחשבת פיגול" "Pigul is not pigul, it is not difficult: here regarding pigul, here regarding the thought of pigul."

hebrew_text: נותר אנותר לא קשיא כאן בנותר כאן בשניתותרו עד שלא נזרק הדם
human_translation: notar by notar not difficult. Here, concerns notar , there, concerns which remained before blood was sprinkled.
llm_translation: Remains, it remains, not difficult. Here, in remains, here, in a second remains until the blood is not thrown.

hebrew_text: ומני רבי יהושע היא דתניא ר' יהושע אומר כל הזבחים שבתורה שנשתייר בהן כזית בשר
human_translation: And whose It is Rabbi Yehoshua, as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all the offerings that in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of meat,
llm_translation: And from the school of Rabbi Yehoshua it is, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says, "All the sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains in them an olive's worth of flesh."

hebrew_text: וכזית חלב זורק את הדם
human_translation: or an olive-bulk of fat sprinkles the blood
llm_translation: And like an olive-bulk of fat, he shall cast the blood.

hebrew_text: חצי זית בשר וחצי זית חלב אינו זורק את הדם ובעולה חצי זית בשר וחצי זית חלב זורק את הדם מפני שכולה כליל ומנחה אפילו כולה קיימת לא יזרוק
human_translation: half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, one may not sprinkle the blood, But for a burnt offering, half an olive-bulk of flesh and half an olive-bulk of fat, one sprinkles the blood, because consumed in its entirety, And a meal offering, even if all of it exists, one does not sprinkle
llm_translation: Half an olive's worth of meat and half an olive's worth of milk - one does not discard the blood. And in the case of an elevation offering, half an olive's worth of meat and half an olive's worth of milk - one discards the blood because it is entirely consumed. And a meal offering, even if it is entirely intact, one should not discard.

hebrew_text: מנחה מאי עבידתה אמר רב פפא מנחת נסכים הבאה עם הזבח:
human_translation: What is the relevance of a meal offering Rav Pappa said: a meal offering libations that accompany offering.
llm_translation: Mincha, what is its service? Rav Papa said: A meal-offering of libations that comes with the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: מתני' הקומץ והלבונה והקטרת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים שהקריב מאחת מהן כזית בחוץ חייב ר"א פוטר עד שיקריב את כולן וכולן שהקריב בפנים ושייר מהן כזית והקריבו בחוץ חייב
human_translation: the handful the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, and the meal offering libations where one sacrificed an olive-bulk from one of these, outside liable, Rabbi Eliezer deems exempt unless he sacrifices the whole of But any of them that one sacrificed inside but left over an olive-bulk from them and sacrificed that outside liable.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The handful, frankincense, incense, meal-offering of priests, meal-offering of an anointed priest, and libations offering, if one offered from any of them an olive's bulk outside, Rabbi Eliezer deems him liable, Rabbi Yehoshua exempts him until he offers all of them, and all of them that he offered inside, and there remains an olive's bulk of them, and he offered them outside, he is liable.

hebrew_text: וכולן שחסרו כל שהו והקריבו בחוץ פטור
human_translation: And any of these that were lacking any amount, one sacrifices it outside exempt.
llm_translation: And all of them that are lacking any amount and they offered it outside, exempt.

hebrew_text: המקריב קדשים ואימורים בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: One who sacrifices sacrificial and sacrificial portions, outside liable
llm_translation: The one who offers holy items and sacrificial portions outside the Temple is liable.

hebrew_text: גמ' ת"ר המקטיר כזית בחוץ חייב חצי פרס בפנים פטור
human_translation: The Sages taught one who burns an olive-bulk outside liable. half a peras inside exempt.
llm_translation: The Gemara: The Sages taught: One who burns an olive-bulk outside is liable, inside he is exempt half a Persian.

hebrew_text: קס"ד מאי פטור פטור זר אמאי הקטרה היא
human_translation: It enters our mind What exempt? a non-priest, exempt Why is sacrificial burning?
llm_translation: Kas'd, what is "patur patur zar"? Why is it considered "haktarah"?

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אמר רב חסדא אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב מאי פטור פטור ציבור
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Ḥisda said Rav Yirmeya, son of Abba, said Rav said: What exempt? community exempt
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rav Chisda said, Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said, Rav said: What is exempt, exempt for the community.

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אי קשיא לי הא קשיא לי הא דאמר רב עלה בהא אפילו ר' אליעזר מודה דהא ר' אליעזר לאו הקטרה היא קאמר
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If difficult for me this difficult for me: That which Rav said concerning With regard to this even Rabbi Eliezer concedes. as Rabbi Eliezer saying is not sacrificial burning.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: If this is difficult for me, that is difficult for me. This is what Rav said: Even if Rabbi Eliezer concedes in this case, for Rabbi Eliezer is not speaking about incense.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בהקטרה דהיכל דכולי עלמא לא פליגי
human_translation: Rabba said: With regard to burning of Sanctuary everyone, agrees
llm_translation: Rabbah said: In the burning of the Temple, everyone agrees.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי בהקטרה דפנים דמר סבר (ויקרא טז, יב) מלא חפניו דוקא ומ"ס מלא חפניו לאו דוקא
human_translation: When they disagree with regard to burning of inner As Sage, holds “his handful” specifically And Sage, holds “his handful” not specifically
llm_translation: When they disputed regarding the incense of the Panim, Mar holds (Leviticus 16:12) "fill his palms specifically," and the Sages hold "fill his palms" is not specific.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי והא כי קא כתיבא חוקה בהקטרה דפנים הוא דכתיב
human_translation: Abaye said to But when “statute” is written it is written with regard to burning of inner
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: But is it not written, "a statute for the incense altar, the tops of the poles thereof" (Exodus 30:27)?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי בהקטרה בפנים כ"ע לא פליגי
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: With regard to burning in inner everyone agrees
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "Regarding incense, they do not disagree in any way."

hebrew_text: כי פליגי בהקטרה דחוץ מ"ס ילפינן פנים מחוץ ומ"ס לא ילפינן
human_translation: When they disagree with regard to burning of outside Sage, holds we derive inner from outer And Sage, holds we do not derive
llm_translation: When they dispute regarding the incense offering, outside the Sanctuary we turn the face away, but inside the Sanctuary we do not turn the face away.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא השתא חוץ מחוץ לא ילפי רבנן פנים מחוץ מיבעי
human_translation: Rava said Now, the Rabbis do not derive outer from outer necessary inner from outer
llm_translation: Rava said: "Now, outside, outside, the Rabbis do not decree, outside, inside, is required."

hebrew_text: מה היא דתניא יכול המעלה פחות מכזית קומץ ופחות מכזית אימורין והמנסך פחות משלשת לוגין יין [פחות] מג' לוגין מים יהא חייב תלמוד לומר לעשות על השלם חייב ואינו חייב על החסר
human_translation: What is as it is taught might one who offers up less than an olive-bulk of handful or less than an olive-bulk of sacrificial portions, or who pours as a libation less than three log of wine less than three log of water, he would be liable. the verse states: to sacrifice liable for the a complete but one is not liable for the an incomplete
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is it? As it was taught: One might have thought that one who offers less than a k'zayit of a handful, and less than a k'zayit of sacrificial portions, and one who pours less than three log of wine less than three log of water, he is obligated. The Talmud teaches to say, 'He is obligated to make restitution for the full amount, and he is not obligated for the missing amount.'"

hebrew_text: והא פחות משלשת לוגין דאית בהו כמה זיתים ולא ילפי רבנן חוץ מחוץ
human_translation: But less than three log that contains a few olive-bulks. And the Rabbis do not derive outer from outer
llm_translation: And this, less than three log that has in it how many olives, and the Rabbis do not decree except for except.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא כגון דקבעינהו שני חצאי פרס
human_translation: Rather, Rava said where, for example, one designated two half- peras
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: such as when they established for them two halves of a Persian.

hebrew_text: במנא מר סבר קביעות מנא מילתא היא ומר סבר לאו מילתא היא
human_translation: in a vessel. Sage, holds designation of a vessel is matter And Sage, holds is nothing
llm_translation: In the count of Mar, he holds that the establishment of the count is the matter, and the other holds that it is not the matter.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא השתא למאן דאמר קביעותא דמנא ולא כלום הוא קבע ששה לפר ומשך מהן ארבעה והקריבן בחוץ חייב שראויין לאיל
human_translation: Rava said: Now, according to the one who says designation vessel is nothing, one designated six as a bull, and removed four from and brought those outside liable, as fit for a ram
llm_translation: Rava said: Now, according to the one who says that the establishment of a count is nothing, he established six for a bull and deducted four from them, and one must offer them outside, as they are fit for a ram.

hebrew_text: קבע ארבעה לאיל ומשך מהן שלשה והקריבן בחוץ חייב שראויין לכבש
human_translation: designated four for a ram and removed three of and brought those outside liable, as fit for a lamb
llm_translation: Establish four for a ram and draw from them three and offer outside liable fitting for a lamb.

hebrew_text: חסרו כל שהוא והקריבן בחוץ פטור
human_translation: were lacking any amount, and one brought them outside exempt
llm_translation: Lacking any amount and he brought it outside, exempt.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר ניסוך מהקטרה לא ילפי רבנן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said the Rabbis do not derive pouring a libation from burning
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "The pouring of the incense should not be done by the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אף על גב דחוץ מחוץ לא ילפי הקטרה מהקטרה ילפי אף על גב דחוץ מפנים:
human_translation: Even though do not derive outer from outer they do derive burning from burning even though outer from inner
llm_translation: Even though outside, from outside, he should not handle the incense, from the incense he should handle, even though inside from inside.

hebrew_text: וכולן שחסרו: איבעיא להו חסרון דחוץ שמיה חסרון או לא שמיה חסרון
human_translation: And any of these that were lacking a dilemma was raised before a lack that outside considered a lack Or not considered a lack?
llm_translation: And all of them that are lacking: It was asked of them, is the lack of the outside vessel considered a lack or not considered a lack.

hebrew_text: מי אמרינן כיון דנפק איפסלו להו מה לי חסר מה לי יתר או דילמא יוצא דאיתיה בעיניה אין דליתיה בעיניה לא
human_translation: Do we say once emerges it is disqualified, what to me lacking what to me complete? Or perhaps emerging where it is in its original state, yes, not in its original state, not
llm_translation: Who said that once they have gone out, they are disqualified? What do I lack, what do I have in excess? Or perhaps, if it is present in their eyes, it is not absent in their eyes.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ת"ש ר' אליעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את כולן
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear Rabbi Eliezer deems exempt unless he sacrifices the whole of
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Come and hear. Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he brings all of them close.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבה בר רב חנן לאביי מדר' אליעזר פשיט מר
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: Master resolve from of Rabbi Eliezer?
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: "From what Rabbi Eliezer said, it is obvious, Master."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה בפירוש שמיע לי מיניה דרב עד כאן לא פליגי רבנן עליה דר' אליעזר אלא דאיתיה בעיניה אבל בחסרון מודו ליה לאו דחסר בחוץ לא דחסר בפנים
human_translation: said to him: I heard explicitly from Rav the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Eliezer only where is in its original form, But where lacking, they concede to him not where it became lacking outside No, where it became lacking inside
llm_translation: He said to him: "Explain to me what Rav said about this matter." Until here, the Rabbis do not argue with Rabbi Eliezer, except where it is visible to him. But in a case of deficiency, they agree with him, not that it is deficient on the outside, but that it is deficient on the inside.

hebrew_text: ת"ש וכולן שחסרו והקריבן בחוץ פטור לאו דחסר בחוץ לא דחסר בפנים:
human_translation: Come hear And any of these that were lacking one sacrifices them outside exempt. not where it became lacking outside No, where it became lacking inside
llm_translation: Come and hear: "And all of them that are lacking, and he brought them outside, he is exempt." Not that if it is lacking outside, he is not lacking inside.

hebrew_text: המקריב קדשים: אמאי והאיכא חציצה
human_translation: One who sacrifices sacrificial Why isn’t there an interposition
llm_translation: The one who offers sacrifices: Why, and there is a "chatzitza."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל כשהפכן
human_translation: Shmuel said: where he turned them over
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: "When they overturned."

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן אמר אפילו תימא שלא הפכן והא מני רבי שמעון היא דאמר אפילו העלו על הסלע חייב
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said You even say where they did not turn them over. And whose is this is Rabbi Shimon, who says even if one offered it up on a rock liable.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, even if you say they did not overturn them. But according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon who said, even if they placed them on the rock, one is liable.

hebrew_text: רב אמר מין במינו אינו חוצץ:
human_translation: Rav said a substance with same substance does not interpose.
llm_translation: Rav said: "A species with its own kind does not create a barrier."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מנחה שלא נקמצה והקריבה בחוץ פטור קמצה וחזר קומצה לתוכה והקריבו בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: a meal offering which a handful was not removed, and one sacrificed it outside exempt took a handful from it and returned its handful into and one sacrificed outside liable,
llm_translation: Mishnah: A meal-offering that was not crumbled, and was offered outside the Temple, one is exempt. If it was crumbled, then re-crumbed inside, and then offered outside, one is liable.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ואמאי ליבטלי שירים לקומץ
human_translation: But why Let remainder nullify the handful.
llm_translation: Gemara: And why should the songs be nullified for the handful?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא נאמרה הקטרה בקומץ ונאמרה הקטרה בשירים מה הקטרת קומץ אין קומץ מבטל חבירו אף הקטרת שירים אין שירים מבטלין קומץ:
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: burning is stated with regard to the handful and burning is stated with regard to the remainder just as burning of handful, handful does not nullify another, so too, burning of remainder, remainder does not nullify handful.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: It is stated regarding the incense offering "with a handful" and it is stated regarding the incense offering "with songs." Just as the incense offering with a handful does not nullify its counterpart, so too the incense offering with songs does not nullify the handful.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הקומץ והלבונה שהקריב את אחד מהן בחוץ חייב ר' אליעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את השני אחד בפנים ואחד בחוץ חייב
human_translation: the handful and the frankincense, where one sacrificed one of them outside liable. Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he sacrifices the second. one inside and one outside liable.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The handful and the frankincense, if one of them was brought outside, Rabbi Eliezer obligates the person to bring the other inside, but exempts him until he brings the other one. One offering inside and one outside makes him obligated.

hebrew_text: שני בזיכי לבונה שהקריב את אחד מהם בחוץ חייב ר' אליעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את השני אחד בפנים ואחד בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: two bowls of frankincense, where one sacrificed one of them outside liable. Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he sacrifices the second, one inside and one outside liable.
llm_translation: Two in the incense of frankincense that he offered one of them outside, liable Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he offers the second one, one inside and one outside, liable.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בעי ר' יצחק נפחא קומץ מהו שיתיר כנגדו בשירים מישרא שרי או קלושי מיקלש
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa raises a dilemma: handful what is whether will permit the corresponding of the remainder? permit or weaken
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha asked: What is the ruling regarding a handful of grain that is placed opposite it the altar with songs - is it permitted, or is it considered disrespectful?

hebrew_text: אליבא דמאן אי אליבא דרבי מאיר דאמר מפגלין בחצי מתיר מישרא שרי
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with of Rabbi Meir, who says: One can render piggul during half permit permit
llm_translation: On the side of whom? If on the side of Rabbi Meir, who says, "Invalidated in half, permitted in its entirety," it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אי אליבא דרבנן דאמרי אין מפגלין בחצי מתיר לא מישרא שרי ולא מקלש קליש
human_translation: If in accordance with of the Rabbis, who say: One cannot render piggul during half permit neither permit nor weaken
llm_translation: If according to the Rabbis who say "One does not render food invalid in a half-measure," neither with a straight utensil nor with a curved utensil.

hebrew_text: אלא אליבא דרבי אליעזר ר"א כרבנן סבירא ליה דאמר אין מפגלין בחצי מתיר
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who say: One cannot render piggul during half permit
llm_translation: Rather, according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Yosei agrees with the Rabbis that he holds that one does not render something invalid through intent in the middle of the process.

hebrew_text: אלא אליבא דרבנן דהכא מאי מישרא שרי או קליש מקלש
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of the Rabbis that here what permit or weaken
llm_translation: Rather, according to the Rabbis, here what is the meaning of "straight" - is it permissible or forbidden?

hebrew_text: תיקו:
human_translation: shall stand
llm_translation: The case remains undecided.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הזורק מקצת דם בחוץ
human_translation: One who sprinkles part of blood outside
llm_translation: Mishnah: Hazorek mikzat dam bachutz.

hebrew_text: חייב ר"א אומר אף המנסך מי החג בחג בחוץ חייב רבי נחמיה אומר שירי הדם שהקריבו בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: liable. Rabbi Elazar says: So too, one who pours as a libation water of the festival during the Festival, outside liable. Rabbi Neḥemya says: remainder of the blood that one sacrificed outside liable.
llm_translation: "Chayav Rabbi Eliezer says even one who pours the water of the festival on the festival outside is liable. Rabbi Nechemiah says the leftover blood that was offered outside is liable."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבא ומודה רבי אלעזר בדמים
human_translation: Rava says: but Rabbi Elazar concedes with regard to blood
llm_translation: Gemara: Rava said, and Rabbi Elazar concedes, regarding blood.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי אלעזר ורבי שמעון אומרים ממקום שפסק הוא מתחיל:
human_translation: which is taught Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: From the place that stopped he begins
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say, "From the place where he ceased, he begins."

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר אף המנסך מי החג [בחג] בחוץ: א"ר יוחנן משום רבי מנחם יודפאה רבי אלעזר בשטת רבי עקיבא רבו אמרה דאמר ניסוך המים דאורייתא דתניא רבי עקיבא אומר (במדבר כט, לא) ונסכיה בשני ניסוכים הכתוב מדבר אחד ניסוך המים ואחד ניסוך היין
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: So too, one who pours as a libation water of the festival during the Festival, outside Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Menaḥem Yodfa’a: Rabbi Elazar said that in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher, who says: The water libation by Torah law. As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says and its libations” the verse is speaking of two libations. One the water libation, and one the wine libation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Even one who pours the water of the festival during the festival outside. Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Menachem Yudphaah: Rabbi Elazar in the courtyard, Rabbi Akiva his teacher said: The water libation is from the Torah, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says (Numbers 29:31) "And its libations, two libations," the verse speaks of one libation of water and one libation of wine.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ריש לקיש לר' יוחנן אי מה להלן שלשת לוגין אף כאן שלשת לוגין והא ר"א מי החג קאמר אי מה להלן בשאר ימות השנה אף כאן בשאר ימות השנה [ור"א] בחג קאמר
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: If just as there, three log , so too here, three log . But Rabbi Elazar says Water of the festival just as during the rest of the days of the year so too, during the rest of the days of the year. But Rabbi Elazar says during the Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to Reish Lakish: If there, three log also here three log. But Rabbi Eliezer, did he say "if there, in the rest of the days of the year, also here in the rest of the days of the year"? And Rabbi Eliezer said "in the festival."

hebrew_text: אישתמיטתיה הא דאמר רבי אסי דאמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי נחוניא איש בקעת בית חורתן עשר נטיעות ערבה וניסוך המים הלכה למשה מסיני
human_translation: That which Rabbi Asi says escaped him, as Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Neḥunya, a man of the valley of Beit Ḥortan: ten saplings, a willow and the water libation a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: I will leave it to him, as Rabbi Assi said, as Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Neḥunia: "A man in the valley of Beit Ḥorṭan planted ten saplings of willow, and the pouring of water is a halakha from Moses at Sinai."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן המנסך שלשת לוגין מים בחג בחוץ חייב ר"א (בר"ש) אומר אם מלאן לשם חג חייב
human_translation: The Sages taught One who pours as a libation three log of water during the festival outside liable. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: If he filled them for the sake of Festival, liable.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who pours three logs of water on the Festival outside the Temple is liable. Rabbi Eliezer (son of Rabbi Shimon) says: If he intended to pour them for the sake of the Festival, he is liable.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק ביש שיעור במים קמיפלגי
human_translation: What between Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: They disagree with regard to there is measure of water
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: In the measurement of water they disagree.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר
human_translation: Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Rav Papa said

hebrew_text: בקרבו נסכים במדבר פליגי
human_translation: They disagree with regard to libations were offered in the wilderness
llm_translation: In his midst libations in the wilderness they dispute.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר בלמדין ניסוך המים מניסוך היין פליגי
human_translation: Ravina said: They disagree with regard to a water libation can be derived from a wine libation.
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Regarding the teaching of pouring water, they dispute from the pouring of wine."

hebrew_text: ת"ר המנסך שלשה לוגין יין בחוץ חייב ר' אלעזר בר"ש אומר והוא שקדשן בכלי
human_translation: The Sages taught One who pours as a libation three log of wine outside liable. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: And that is where he consecrated in vessel.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who pours three log of wine outside is liable. Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon says: And this is only if he sanctified them in a vessel.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רב אדא בר רב יצחק בירוצי מידות איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between them? Rav Adda bar Rav Yitzḥak said: between them is overfill of measuring vessels
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rav Adda bar Rav Yitzchak said: In the measurements of Yerushalayim there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: רבא בריה דרבה אמר קרבו נסכים בבמה איכא בינייהו
human_translation: Rava, son of Rabba, said: between them is libations were offered on altars.
llm_translation: Rava, son of Rabba, said: "Bring libations to the altar; there is a distinction between them."

hebrew_text: ובפלוגתא דהני תנאי דתניא במת יחיד אינה צריכה נסכים דברי רבי וחכ"א טעונה נסכים
human_translation: And with regard to the dispute between these tanna’im , as it is taught a private altar does not need libations; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: require libations.
llm_translation: And in the dispute of these Tannaim as it was taught: "In the case of an individual corpse, libations are not required," the words of Rabbi, while the sages say: "It does require libations."

hebrew_text: והני תנאי כהני תנאי דתניא (במדבר טו, ב) כי תבאו להטעינה נסכים בבמה גדולה הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: And these tanna’im is like those tanna’im , as it is taught “When you come The verse speaks to require libations upon a great altar.
llm_translation: And these teachings are like the teachings as it was taught (Numbers 15:2) "When you come to bring offerings in a great high place, the Scripture speaks."

hebrew_text: אתה אומר בבמה גדולה או אינו אפי' בבמה קטנה כשהוא אומר (במדבר טו, ב) אל ארץ מושבותיכם וגו' אשר אני נותן לכם הרי בבמה הנוהגת לכולכם הכתוב מדבר דברי רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: Do you say to a great altar, or is it even to a small altar? When states: “Into the land of your dwellings, which I give to you [ lakhem ],” the verse is speaking of altar that is used by everyone; the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: You say in a large high place or not even in a small high place, when it says (Numbers 15:2) "To the land of your dwellings, etc." that I give to you, behold, the altar that is customary for all of you, the Scripture speaks. These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר כי תבאו להטעינה נסכים בבמה קטנה הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “When you come,” the verse speaks to require libations upon a small altar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "When you come to offer libations on a small altar, the verse speaks."

hebrew_text: אתה אומר לבמה קטנה או אינו אלא לבמה גדולה כשהוא אומר אל ארץ מושבותיכם הרי בבמה הנוהגת בכל מושבות הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Do you say a small altar Or is it only to a great altar? When states: “Into the land of your dwellings,” the verse is speaking of an altar that is used in all your dwellings,
llm_translation: You say "small altar" or is it rather a "large altar" when it says "To the land of your settlements" - behold, it speaks of the altar that is practiced in all settlements, as the verse states.

hebrew_text: כשתמצא לומר לדברי רבי ישמעאל לא קרבו נסכים במדבר ולדברי ר"ע קרבו נסכים במדבר:
human_translation: When you will find say according to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael, libations were not offered in the wilderness. And according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva libations were offered in the wilderness.
llm_translation: When you find to say the words of Rabbi Yishmael, "Libations were not brought in the wilderness," and according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, "Libations were brought in the wilderness."

hebrew_text: רבי נחמיה אומר שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב:
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: remainder of the blood that one sacrificed outside liable.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: "The remnants of the blood that one offered outside are liable."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן [תנא] רבי נחמיה כדברי האומר שיריים מעכבין
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Neḥemya taught in accordance with the statement of the one who says remainder disqualifies
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan Tanna Rabbi Nechemiah: According to the one who says that Shirayim (songs) are a hindrance.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי רבי נחמיה אומר שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב אמר לו ר"ע והלא שירי הדם שירי מצוה הם אמר לו איברין ופדרין יוכיחו שהן שירי מצוה והמקריבן בחוץ חייב אמר לו לא אם אמרת באיברים ופדרים שהן תחלת עבודה תאמר בשירי הדם שאינן תחלת עבודה
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Neḥemya says remainder of the blood that one sacrificed outside liable. Rabbi Akiva said to him: Isn’t the remainder of the blood a non-essential mitzva, said to him: limbs and fats will prove as they are a non-essential mitzva, and one who sacrifices them outside liable. said to him: No, if you said with regard to limbs and fats, which is the start of rite, shall you say with regard to remainder of the blood, which is not the start of rite,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The school of Rabbi Nehemiah says: The leftover blood that one offered outside the Temple is liable. Rabbi Akiva said to him: But are not the leftover blood considered leftover of a commandment? He said to him: Limbs and fats will prove that they are considered leftover of a commandment, and one who offers outside is liable. He said to him: No, if you say that limbs and fats are the beginning of the service, will you say that leftover blood, which is not the beginning of the service is also liable?

hebrew_text: ואם איתא לימא ליה הני נמי מעכבי תיובתא
human_translation: And if it is so let say to These too, disqualifies a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And if it should come to say to him, these also are impediments to the claim.

hebrew_text: והשתא דאמר רב אדא בר אהבה מחלוקת בשיריים הפנימיים אבל בשיריים החיצונים דברי הכל לא מעכבי כי קאמר רבי נחמיה בשיריים הפנימים כי תניא ההיא בשיריים החיצונים
human_translation: And now that Rav Adda bar Ahava says: dispute with regard to remainder of the inner but with regard to remainder of the external everyone agrees does not disqualify When Rabbi Neḥemya says to remainder of the inner When that is taught to remainder of the external
llm_translation: And now, as Rav Adda bar Ahava said, there is a dispute regarding the inner songs, but regarding the outer songs, everyone's words do not prevent each other. For Rabbi Nechemiah said concerning the inner songs, as it was taught in a Baraita concerning the outer songs.

hebrew_text: (ורבי עקיבא לא ידע מאי קאמר רבי נחמיה הוא סבר רבי נחמיה שיריים חיצונים אמר וקא מהדר ליה שיריים החיצונים ורבי נחמיה) לדבריו דר' עקיבא קאמר:
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva did not know what Rabbi Neḥemya was saying. thought Rabbi Neḥemya was stating remainder of external responded to him remainder of the external And Rabbi Neḥemya saying in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva did not know what Rabbi Nechemiah was saying. He thought that Rabbi Nechemiah meant outer songs. And he was repeating to him the outer songs, and Rabbi Nechemiah, according to his words, said:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המולק את העוף בפנים והעלה בחוץ חייב מלק בחוץ והעלה בחוץ פטור השוחט את העוף בפנים והעלה בחוץ פטור
human_translation: One who pinches a bird inside and offers up outside liable. one pinched outside and offered up outside exempt, One who slaughters, a bird inside and offers up outside exempt,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who removes the innards of a bird inside and burns the fat outside is liable for lashes for doing it outside, but if he slaughters the bird inside and burns the fat outside, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: שחט בחוץ והעלה בחוץ חייב
human_translation: slaughtered outside and offered up outside, liable.
llm_translation: He slaughtered outside and he offered outside - liable.

hebrew_text: נמצא דרך הכשירו בפנים פטורו בחוץ דרך הכשירו מבחוץ פטורו בפנים
human_translation: Evidently, the manner of its preparation inside its exemption outside the manner of its preparation outside its exemption inside
llm_translation: It is found: the way that renders it fit inside exempts it outside; the way that renders it fit outside exempts it inside.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר כל שחייבין עליו בחוץ חייבין על כיוצא בו בפנים שהעלה בחוץ חוץ מן השוחט בפנים ומעלה בחוץ:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: any which, outside liable for it liable for offered up outside a similar inside except with regard to one who slaughters inside and offers up outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "All that they are obligated for him outside, they are obligated for him inside, that he brought outside, except for the one who slaughters inside and brings outside."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ האי הכשירו חיובו הוא תני חיובו:
human_translation: This its preparation, is its liability. teach: Its liability.
llm_translation: Gemara: This one, his qualification is his obligation. It was taught: his obligation.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר [וכו']: אהיכא קאי
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: To what does he refer?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says etc.: Where is it standing?

hebrew_text: אילימא ארישא קאי המולק עוף בפנים והעלה בחוץ חייב מלק בחוץ והעלה בחוץ פטור וא"ל ר"ש כי היכי דפנים מיחייב בחוץ נמי מיחייב האי כל שחייבין עליו בחוץ כל שחייבין עליו בפנים מיבעי ליה
human_translation: If we say that he is referring to the first clause One who pinches bird inside and offers up outside liable, one pinched outside and offered up outside, exempt; and Rabbi Shimon says to Just as inside liable, so too outside liable, that any which, outside liable for it he should have any which, inside liable for it
llm_translation: The first clause: One who slaughters a bird inside and burns it outside is liable for lashes; if he slaughters it outside and burns it outside, he is exempt. Rabbi Shimon said to him: Just as he is liable for outside, so too he should be liable for inside, for anything for which they are liable outside, they are also liable for inside.

hebrew_text: אלא כי היכי דבחוץ לא מיחייב בפנים נמי לא ליחייב האי כל שאין חייבין עליו בחוץ מיבעי ליה
human_translation: Rather, Just as outside not liable, so too inside not liable. that he should have any which, outside not liable for it
llm_translation: Rather, how so that outside does not obligate, inside also does not obligate, this - all that they do not obligate outside, he requires.

hebrew_text: אלא אסיפא קאי השוחט עוף בפנים והעלה בחוץ פטור שחט בחוץ והעלה בחוץ חייב ואמר ליה ר"ש כי היכי דבפנים לא מיחייב בחוץ נמי לא מיחייב האי כל שאין חייבין מיבעי ליה
human_translation: Rather, he is referring to the latter clause One who slaughters a bird inside and offers up outside is exempt, one slaughtered outside and offered up outside, liable. And Rabbi Shimon says to Just as inside not liable, so too outside not liable. that he should have any which, not liable for it
llm_translation: Rather, the conclusion stands: one who slaughters a bird inside and offers it up outside is exempt. If he slaughters it outside and offers it up outside, he is liable. And Rabbi Shimon said to him: "In order that one is not liable for inside, he is also not liable for outside. This is because whatever is not obligatory, he should not be required to do."

hebrew_text: אלא כי היכי דבחוץ מיחייב בפנים נמי מיחייב הא קתני חוץ מן השוחט בפנים והמעלה בחוץ
human_translation: Rather, Just as outside liable, so too inside liable. this, teaches except with regard to one who slaughters inside and offers up outside
llm_translation: Rather, how so that outside is obligated, inside is also obligated. This is as it teaches: outside from the one who slaughters, inside from the one who lifts up outside.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי שחיטת בהמה בלילה איכא בינייהו והכי קאמר [וכן] השוחט בהמה בפנים בלילה והעלה בחוץ פטור שחט בחוץ בלילה והעלה בחוץ חייב
human_translation: Ze’eiri said: between is slaughter of an animal at night and this is saying: And so too, one who slaughters an animal inside at night and offers up outside exempt, slaughtered outside at night and offered up outside liable.
llm_translation: Za'iri said: There is a difference between slaughtering an animal at night, and this is what he is saying: Similarly, one who slaughters an animal inside at night and brings it outside is exempt from liability, but if he slaughters outside at night and brings it outside, he is liable.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר כל שחייבין עליו בחוץ חייבין על כיוצא בו בפנים והעלה בחוץ חוץ מן השוחט עוף בפנים והעלה בחוץ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: any which, outside liable for it liable for offered up outside a similar inside except with regard to one who slaughters inside and offers up outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Anyone upon whom they are obligated outside, they are obligated for the equivalent inside. And one who brings an offering outside, except for one who slaughters a bird inside and brings it outside."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר קבלה בכלי חול איכא בינייהו וה"ק [וכן] המקבל בכלי חול בפנים והעלה בחוץ פטור המקבל בכלי חול בחוץ והעלה בחוץ חייב
human_translation: Rava said between is collection in a non-sacred vessel, and this is saying: And so too, one who collects in a non-sacred vessel inside and offers up outside exempt, one who collects in a non-sacred vessel outside and offers up outside liable.
llm_translation: Rava said: There is a distinction between receiving in a vessel of secular use, and it is written: "And similarly, one who receives in a vessel of secular use indoors and brings it outside is exempt; one who receives in a vessel of secular use outside and brings it outside is liable."

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר כל שחייבין עליו בחוץ חייבין על כיוצא בו בפנים והעלו בחוץ חוץ מן השוחט עוף בפנים והעלו בחוץ
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: any which, outside liable for it liable for offered up outside a similar inside except with regard to one who slaughters inside and offers up outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Anyone upon whom they are obligated outside, they are obligated on his behalf inside, and if they offered it outside, except for one who slaughters a bird inside and offers it outside.

hebrew_text: השתא דתני אבוה דשמואל בר רב יצחק המולק עוף בפנים והעלו בחוץ חייב מלק בחוץ והעלה בחוץ פטור ור"ש מיחייב ר"ש התם קאי ותני כל שחייבין עליו בפנים והעלה בחוץ חייבין עליו בחוץ:
human_translation: Now that Shmuel’s father, son of Rav Yitzḥak, has taught One who pinches bird inside and offers it up outside liable, pinched outside and offered up outside exempt. And Rabbi Shimon liable. Rabbi Shimon is referring to there, and teach: any which, inside liable for it outside liable outside
llm_translation: Currently, as it was taught by the father of Shmuel, son of Rav Yitzchak: One who removes the sacrificial bird inside the Temple and offers it outside the Temple is liable for lashes; if he removes it outside and offers it outside, he is exempt. Rabbi Shimon, however, deems him liable. Rabbi Shimon's reasoning is that there in the Mishnah it stands and teaches: "Any case where they are liable for it inside the Temple, and he offers it outside, they are liable for it outside."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חטאת שקבל דמה בכוס אחד נתן בחוץ וחזר ונתן בפנים בפנים וחזר ונתן בחוץ חייב שכולו ראוי בפנים
human_translation: a sin offering where one collected its blood in one cup, placed outside and then placed inside inside and then placed outside liable as its entirety is fit inside
llm_translation: Mishnah: A sin offering whose blood was received in one vessel, he placed it outside, then returned and placed it inside, inside, then returned and placed it outside - he is liable, for its entirety is fitting inside.

hebrew_text: קבל דמה בשתי כוסות נתן שניהם בפנים פטור שניהם בחוץ חייב אחד בפנים ואחד בחוץ פטור אחד בחוץ ואחד בפנים חייב על החיצון והפנימי מכפר
human_translation: one collected its blood in two cups placed both of them inside exempt both of them outside liable, one inside and one outside, exempt. one outside and one inside, liable for the external and the internal atones
llm_translation: Received blood in two cups, placed both inside - exempt; both outside - liable; one inside and one outside - exempt; one outside and one inside - liable. The outer and inner atone.

hebrew_text: למה הדבר דומה למפריש חטאתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ואח"כ נמצאת הראשונה והרי שתיהן עומדות שחט שתיהן בפנים פטור שתיהן בחוץ חייב אחת בפנים ואחת בחוץ פטור אחת בחוץ ואחת בפנים חייב על החיצונה והפנימית מכפרת
human_translation: To what is this matter comparable? to separated his sin offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its place, and thereafter, the first was found. both of them stand he slaughtered both of them inside exempt. both of them outside liable, one inside and one outside exempt one outside and one inside liable for the external and the internal atones
llm_translation: The matter is similar to one who designates his sin-offering and it gets lost, and he designates another in its place, and afterwards the first one is found. And behold, both of them are standing. If he slaughters both of them inside, he is exempt. If he slaughters both of them outside, he is liable. If he slaughters one inside and one outside, he is exempt. If he slaughters one outside and one inside, he is liable. The outer one and the inner one atone.

hebrew_text: כשם שדמה פוטר את בשרה כך היא פוטרת את בשר חבירתה:
human_translation: just as the blood of exempts its meat so too, it exempts the meat of its counterpart,
llm_translation: As the blood of the bird exempts its flesh, so too she exempts the flesh of her fellow.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בשלמא בחוץ וחזר ונתן בפנים שכולו ראוי להיות בפנים אבל בפנים והעלן בחוץ שיריים נינהו
human_translation: Granted outside and then placed inside As its entirety is fit to be inside But inside and then offered up outside is a remainder,
llm_translation: Gemara: Granted, if the animal was outside the Temple courtyard and then returned and was placed inside, since it is entirely fitting to be inside, but if it was inside and then taken outside, they are considered remnants.

hebrew_text: הא מני רבי נחמיה היא דאמר שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: whose is this is Rabbi Neḥemya, who says: remainder of the blood that one sacrificed outside liable.
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi Nechemiah: "The leftover blood that was offered outside is liable."

hebrew_text: אי רבי נחמיה אימא סיפא קבל דמה בשני כוסות נתן שניהם בפנים פטור שניהם בחוץ חייב אחד בפנים ואחד בחוץ פטור והאמר רבי נחמיה שירי הדם שהקריבן בחוץ חייב
human_translation: If Rabbi Neḥemya, say the latter clause: one collected its blood in two cups placed both of them inside exempt. both of them outside liable. one inside and one outside, exempt. But doesn’t Rabbi Neḥemya say: the remainder of the blood that one offered outside liable?
llm_translation: If Rabbi Nechemiah, say the latter part: If he placed the blood in two cups, putting both inside exempts, putting both outside obligates, one inside and one outside exempts. But didn't Rabbi Nechemiah say: The leftover blood that was offered outside is liable.

hebrew_text: סיפא אתאן לתנא קמא דרבי אלעזר ברבי שמעון דאמר כוס עושה דחוי לחבירו:
human_translation: the latter clause we arrive at the first tanna , Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. As says: cup renders the other disqualified.
llm_translation: The latter clause: We came to the first Tanna of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said, "A cup that causes embarrassment to his fellow."

hebrew_text: למה הדבר דומה למפריש חטאתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ואחר כך נמצאת הראשונה:
human_translation: To what is this matter comparable? to separated his sin offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its place, and thereafter, the first was found.
llm_translation: "Why is the matter comparable to one who separates his sin-offering and it gets lost, and he separates another in its place, and afterwards the first one is found."

hebrew_text: למה הדבר דומה למה לי הא מני רבי היא דאמר אבודה בשעת הפרשה מתה
human_translation: Why do I To what is this matter comparable, whose is this is Rabbi who says lost during the time of separation put to death.
llm_translation: "Why is the matter comparable to 'What is it to me?' This is like the statement of Rabbi Hiya who said, 'A lost object during the time of reading the Torah portion is considered dead.'"

hebrew_text: והכי קאמר טעמא דאבדה הא הפריש שתי חטאות לאחריות חדא מינייהו מעיקרא עולה היא
human_translation: And this is saying The reason that was lost But one separated two sin offerings as a guarantee, from the outset, one of these is a burnt offering,
llm_translation: And so it says: The reason for the lost item is that this one separated two sin offerings for responsibility, one of them is primary.

hebrew_text: וכדרב הונא אמר רב דאמר רב הונא אמר רב אשם שניתק לרעייה ושחטו סתם כשר לעולה
human_translation: And in accordance with Rav Huna Rav says, as Rav Huna says Rav says: A guilt offering that was consigned to grazing and slaughtered it, unspecified fit as a burnt offering.
llm_translation: And as Rav Huna said, Rav said, as Rav Huna said, Rav said: A guilt-offering that was detached for its mate, and one slaughtered it without specifying, is valid for a burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: מי דמי התם אשם זכר ועולה זכר אבל חטאת נקבה היא א"ר חייא מיוסתיניא בשעיר נשיא:
human_translation: Are comparable? There, a guilt offering a male and a burnt offering a male But a sin offering is a female Rav Ḥiyya from Yostiniyya said: with regard to the goat of Nasi ,
llm_translation: Who is comparable there? Guilt offering male and burnt offering male, but sin offering female it is. Rabbi Chiya of Yosetina says: in a he-goat of the leader.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך השוחט והמעלה
llm_translation: The one who slaughters and offers, we will return to you.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ פרת חטאת ששרפה חוץ מגתה וכן שעיר המשתלח שהקריב בחוץ פטור
human_translation: the heifer of purification that one burned outside its pit, and likewise the scapegoat that one sacrificed outside exempt
llm_translation: Mishnah: A red heifer whose ashes were burned outside the Temple Mount except for its hide, and similarly, a scapegoat that was sent away to Azazel which was offered outside the Temple Mount, is exempt.

hebrew_text: שנאמר (ויקרא יז, ד) ואל פתח אהל מועד לא הביאו כל שאין ראוי לבא אל פתח אהל מועד אין חייבין עליו
human_translation: as it is stated and to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting he did not bring it, any that is not fit to come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting one is not liable for its
llm_translation: As it is stated (Leviticus 17:4), "And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting they did not bring it," anyone who is not fitting to enter the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, they are not liable for it.

hebrew_text: הרובע והנרבע והמוקצה והנעבד והמחיר [והאתנן] והכלאים והטריפה ויוצא דופן שהקריבן בחוץ פטור
human_translation: an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality, or that set aside or that was worshipped or the price or payment or diverse kinds, or an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], or born by caesarean section, which one sacrificed outside exempt.
llm_translation: The square, the half-square, the set-aside, the consecrated, the exchanged, the rentals, the hybrids, the treifah, and one who brings an offering outside the Temple, is exempt.

hebrew_text: שנאמר (ויקרא יז, ד) לפני משכן ה' כל שאין ראוי לבא לפני משכן ה' אין חייבין עליו
human_translation: as it is stated: before the Tabernacle of the Lord.” any that is not fit to come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting one is not liable for its
llm_translation: As it is stated (Leviticus 17:4), "Before the Tabernacle of the Lord." Anyone who is not fitting to come before the Tabernacle of the Lord is not obligated concerning him.

hebrew_text: בעלי מומין בין בעלי מומין קבועין בין
human_translation: blemished whether permanently blemished whether
llm_translation: Owners of blemishes, whether owners of blemishes are established or

hebrew_text: בעלי מומין עוברין שהקריבן בחוץ פטור ר"ש אומר בעלי מומין קבועין פטור בעלי מומין עוברין חייב בלא תעשה
human_translation: temporarily blemished, which one sacrificed outside exempt. Rabbi Shimon says: permanently blemished exempt; temporarily blemished liable for a prohibition,
llm_translation: Owners of blemishes transgress that they offered outside exempt Rabbi Shimon says owners of blemishes established exempt owners of blemishes transgress liable for negative commandment

hebrew_text: תורים שלא הגיע זמנן ובני יונה שעבר זמנן שהקריבן בחוץ פטור ר"ש אומר בני יונה שעבר זמנן פטור ותורים שלא הגיע זמנן בלא תעשה
human_translation: doves whose time has not arrived, and pigeons whose time has passed, that one sacrificed outside exempt. Rabbi Shimon says: pigeons whose time has passed exempt, and doves whose time has not arrived in a prohibition.
llm_translation: Oxen that have not reached their designated time, and young pigeons that have passed their designated time, if they were offered outside the Temple, one is exempt. Rabbi Shimon says: Young pigeons that have passed their designated time are exempt, and oxen that have not reached their designated time is considered a violation of a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: אותו ואת בנו ומחוסר זמן פטור ר"ש אומר הרי זה בלא תעשה שר"ש אומר כל שהוא ראוי לבא לאחר זמן ה"ז בלא תעשה ואין בו כרת וחכ"א כל שאין בו כרת אין בו לא תעשה
human_translation: itself and its offspring and whose time has not yet exempt. Rabbi Shimon says: that in prohibition, as Rabbi Shimon says: any that is fit to come after time, that in a prohibition but there is no karet . And the Rabbis say: In any in which there is no karet there is no a prohibition.
llm_translation: That and his son and lacking time exempt Rabbi Shimon says behold this is without doing Rabbi Shimon says anything that is fit to come after time this is without doing and it does not have karet and the sages say anything that does not have karet does not have a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: מחוסר זמן בין בגופו בין בבעליו
human_translation: whose time has not yet whether intrinsically whether for its owner.
llm_translation: Lacking time, whether in his body or in his possessions.

hebrew_text: איזהו מחוסר זמן בבעליו הזב והזבה והיולדת והמצורע שהקריבו חטאתם ואשמם בחוץ פטורין עולותיהן ושלמיהן בחוץ חייבין
human_translation: Which is whose time has not yet for its owner? a man who experiences a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ], and a woman who experiences a discharge of uterine blood after her menstrual period [ zava ], and a woman after childbirth, and a leper where sacrificed their sin offerings or guilt offerings outside they are exempt, their burnt offerings or their peace offerings outside they are liable,
llm_translation: Which is considered lacking in time for their owners? The male and female zav, the woman who gave birth, and the metzora who brought their sin-offerings and guilt-offerings outside the Temple, their burnt-offerings and peace-offerings are exempt from being brought outside, while they are obligated to bring them inside.

hebrew_text: המעלה מבשר חטאת מבשר אשם מבשר קדשי קדשים מבשר קדשים קלים ומותר העומר ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים ושירי מנחות
human_translation: One who offers up of the meat of a sin offering of the meat of a guilt offering; of the meat of offerings of the most sacred order of the meat of offerings of lesser sanctity, And the surplus of the omer offering, or the two loaves, or the shewbread or the remainder of meal offerings,
llm_translation: One who brings up from the flesh of a sin-offering, from the flesh of a guilt-offering, from the flesh of most holy offerings, from the flesh of holy offerings, light holy offerings, and the Omer, and the two loaves, and the showbread, and the remnants of meal-offerings.

hebrew_text: והיוצק והפותת והבולל והמולח והמניף והמגיש והמסדר את השולחן והמטיב את הנרות והקומץ והמקבל דמים בחוץ פטור
human_translation: And one who pours and one who breaks and one who mixes and one who salts and one who waves and one who brings and one who arranges the table and one who removes the ashes the lamps and one who removes a handful and one who collects blood outside exempt.
llm_translation: The one who pours, and the one who smoothes, and the one who mixes, and the one who salts, and the one who waves, and the one who serves, and the one who arranges the table, and the one who makes the lamps good, and the one who gathers, and the one who receives blood outside - exempt.

hebrew_text: ואין חייבין עליו לא משום זרות ולא משום טומאה ולא משום מחוסר בגדים ולא משום [שלא] רחוץ ידים ורגלים
human_translation: And one is not liable for neither due to a non-priest nor due to ritual impurity, nor due to lacking vestments nor due to without washing hands and feet.
llm_translation: And not obligated upon him neither because of being a stranger, nor because of impurity, nor because of lacking garments, nor because of not washing hands and feet.

hebrew_text: עד שלא הוקם המשכן היו הבמות מותרות ועבודה בבכורות ומשהוקם המשכן נאסרו הבמות ועבודה בכהנים קדשי קדשים נאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים וקדשים קלים בכל מחנה ישראל באו לגלגל הותרו הבמות קדשי קדשים נאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים וקדשים קלים בכל מקום
human_translation: Until the Tabernacle was established, altars were permitted and service by the firstborn. And from that the Tabernacle was established, altars were prohibited and service by the priests. Offerings of the most sacred order were eaten within the curtains and offerings of lesser sanctity throughout the camp of Israel. arrived at Gilgal altars were permitted, offerings of the most sacred order were eaten within the curtains, and offerings of lesser sanctity anywhere.
llm_translation: Until the Tabernacle was established, the altars were permitted, and the service with firstborn animals. And when the Tabernacle was established, the altars were prohibited, and the service with priests. The most holy offerings were eaten within the curtains, and the lesser holy offerings in the entire camp of Israel. When they arrived at Gilgal, the altars were permitted. The most holy offerings were eaten within the curtains, and the lesser holy offerings in any place.

hebrew_text: באו לשילה נאסרו הבמות ולא היה שם תקרה אלא בית אבנים בלבד מלמטן והיריעות מלמעלן והיא היתה מנוחה קדשי קדשים נאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים וקדשים קלים ומעשר שני בכל הרואה
human_translation: they arrived at Shiloh, altars were prohibited. And there was no roof there, rather only a building of stone below and the curtains above it. And was “rest” Offerings of the most sacred order were eaten within the curtains and offerings of lesser sanctity and second tithe in any that overlooks
llm_translation: They came to Shiloh, the altars were prohibited, and there was no roof there, only a stone house below and curtains above, and it was a resting place. The most holy offerings were eaten inside the curtains, and the lesser holy offerings and the second tithe by anyone who sees.

hebrew_text: באו לנוב וגבעון הותרו הבמות קדשי קדשים נאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים קדשים קלים בכל ערי ישראל
human_translation: arrived at Nov, and Gibeon, altars were permitted. Offerings of the most sacred order were eaten within the curtains offerings of lesser sanctity in all the cities of Yisrael.
llm_translation: They came to Nob and Gibeon, the altars were permitted, holy of holies are eaten before the curtains, light holy things in all the cities of Israel.

hebrew_text: באו לירושלים נאסרו הבמות ולא היה להן היתר והיא היתה נחלה קדשי קדשים נאכלין לפנים מן הקלעים קדשים קלים ומעשר שני לפנים מן החומה
human_translation: arrived at Jerusalem altars were prohibited, and did not have permitted. And was “inheritance” Offerings of the most sacred order were eaten within the curtains, offerings of lesser sanctity and second tithe within the walls
llm_translation: They came to Jerusalem, the altars were prohibited, and they did not have permission, and it was an inheritance, holy of holies were eaten before the curtains, light holy items, and second tithe before the wall.

hebrew_text: כל הקדשים שהקדישן בשעת איסור הבמות והקריבן בשעת איסור הבמות מבחוץ הרי אלו בעשה ולא תעשה וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: all offerings that one consecrated during a period of prohibition of altars and sacrificed during a period of prohibition of altars, outside these in positive mitzva and prohibition and he is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: All the holy items that were sanctified during the prohibition of the altars, and the offering during the prohibition of the altars, if done from the outside, these are subject to positive commandments and negative commandments, and one is liable for them with karet.

hebrew_text: הקדישן בשעת היתר הבמות והקריבן בשעת איסור הבמות בחוץ הרי אלו בעשה ולא תעשה ואין חייבין עליהן כרת הקדישן בשעת איסור הבמות והקריבן בשעת היתר הבמות הרי אלו בעשה ואין בהן לא תעשה
human_translation: one consecrated during a period of permitting of altars and sacrificed them during a period of prohibition of altars, outside these in a positive mitzva and a prohibition, but he is not liable to karet for them. he consecrated during a period of prohibition of altars and sacrificed them during a period of permitting of altars, these in a positive mitzva but these are not subject to a prohibition,
llm_translation: They sanctified at the time of the permissibility of the altars, and offered at the time of the prohibition of the altars, outside - these are transgressions of positive commandments and negative commandments, and one is not liable for them to receive the punishment of excision. They sanctified at the time of the prohibition of the altars, and offered at the time of the permissibility of the altars - these are transgressions of positive commandments, and there is no negative commandment in them.

hebrew_text: ואלו קדשים קרבין במשכן קדשים שהוקדשו למשכן קרבנות ציבור קרבין במשכן וקרבנות היחיד בבמה קרבנות היחיד שהוקדשו למשכן יקריבו במשכן ואם הקריבן בבמה פטור
human_translation: And these are sacrificial are sacrificed in the Tabernacle Sacrificial that were consecrated for the Tabernacle. communal offerings are sacrificed in the Tabernacle, but offerings of an individual on altar. offerings of an individual that were consecrated for the Tabernacle, one must sacrifice in the Tabernacle. But if he sacrificed them on altar, exempt.
llm_translation: These are the holy sacrifices brought in the Tabernacle: holy sacrifices that were sanctified for the Tabernacle, communal sacrifices are brought in the Tabernacle, and individual sacrifices on the altar. Individual sacrifices that were sanctified for the Tabernacle should be brought in the Tabernacle, and if one brought them on the altar, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ומה בין במת יחיד לבמת ציבור סמיכה ושחיטת צפון
human_translation: And what between the altar of an individual and the public altar placing hands slaughter in the north,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between the slaughter of an individual's offering and the slaughter of a communal offering? The proximity of the offering and the slaughtering being done in the north.

hebrew_text: ומתן סביב ותנופה והגשה ר"י אומר אין מנחה בבמה וכיהון ובגדי שרת וכלי שרת וריח ניחוח ומחיצה לדמים וריחוץ ידים ורגלים
human_translation: placement around waving and bringing Rabbi Yehuda says: There is no meal offering on an altar And priesthood service vestments, service vessels, pleasing aroma partition for the blood, and washing of hands and feet
llm_translation: And the giving around and waving and bringing near. Rabbi Yehudah says: There is no meal-offering on the altar, and the anointing oil, and the priestly garments, and the priestly vessels, and the pleasing aroma, and the partition for the blood, and the washing of hands and feet.

hebrew_text: אבל הזמן הנותר והטמא שוין בזה ובזה:
human_translation: But the time, the left over [ notar ] and the ritually impure are equal in this, and that,
llm_translation: But the remaining time and the impure are equal in this and in this.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי חוץ מגתה אמר ר"ל חוץ ממקום הבדוק לה אמר לו רבי יוחנן והלא כל א"י בדוקה היא
human_translation: What Outside its pit? Reish Lakish said: outside the place that was inspected Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: But is not all of Eretz Yisrael inspected
llm_translation: Gemara: What is meant by "except for Giteh"? R. Levi said: Except for a place that has been examined for her. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: But isn't every land examined?

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר יוחנן כגון ששחטה לפנים מן חומת ירושלים
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: where slaughtered within the walls of Jerusalem
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: such as she slaughtered it within the walls of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: ולוקמה כגון ששחטה חוץ לחומה שלא כנגד הפתח דאמר רב אדא בר אהבה שחטה שלא כנגד הפתח פסולה שנאמר (במדבר יט, ג) ושחט והזה
human_translation: But let interpret it where slaughtered it outside the wall not opposite, the entrance as Rav Adda bar Ahava says: he slaughtered it not opposite the entrance, disqualified, as it is stated and it shall be slaughtered and sprinkle
llm_translation: And for Lokmah, such as if she slaughtered it outside the wall not opposite the entrance, for Rav Adda bar Ahava said: If she slaughtered it not opposite the entrance, it is invalid, as it is stated (Numbers 19:3), "And slaughter and sprinkle."

hebrew_text: מה הזאתה כנגד הפתח אף שחיטתה כנגד הפתח וכי תימא דלא מקיש והא אתמר (שחטה שלא כנגד הפתח רבי יוחנן אמר פסולה ושחט והזה ר"ל אמר כשרה (במדבר יט, ג) אל מחוץ למחנה ושחט
human_translation: Just as its sprinkling opposite the entrance, so too, its slaughter opposite the entrance. And if you would say that not juxtapose But was stated slaughtered not opposite the entrance Rabbi Yoḥanan says: disqualified, “and it shall be slaughtered” “and sprinkle.” Reish Lakish says: fit, outside the camp, and it shall be slaughtered,”
llm_translation: "What is this? Corresponding to the entrance, so too its slaughtering is corresponding to the entrance. And if you were to say that it is not derived, but wasn't it stated: 'If one slaughters it not corresponding to the entrance, Rabbi Yochanan said it is invalid, and one slaughters it and sprinkles,' Reish Lakish said it is valid (Numbers 19:3) 'outside the camp' and slaughter."

hebrew_text: ואיתמר נמי) שרפה שלא כנגד הפתח רבי יוחנן אמר פסולה ור' אושעיא אמר כשרה ר' יוחנן אמר פסולה ושרף והזה
human_translation: And was also stated burned not opposite the entrance Rabbi Yoḥanan says: disqualified, and Rabbi Oshaya says: fit. Rabbi Yoḥanan says disqualified “And shall be burned “And sprinkle
llm_translation: And it was stated as well: (a) a burnt offering that is not opposite the entrance. Rabbi Yochanan said: invalid. And Rabbi Oshaya said: valid. Rabbi Yochanan said: invalid, and he burnt it, and he sprinkled.

hebrew_text: ורבי אושעיא אמר כשרה (במדבר יט, ה) על פרשה ישרף מקום שפורשת למיתה שם תהא שריפתה
human_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya says fit, “With its dung [ pirshah ], shall be burned,” the place that departs [ poreshet ] for death, there shall be its burning.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya said: "Kosher" (Numbers 19:5) - regarding a portion that is separated for death, there shall its burning be.

hebrew_text: אמרי לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא חוץ לחומה דרחוקי רחקה אלא אפי' לפנים מן החומה דקרובי קרבה ואימא תתכשר קמ"ל
human_translation: Say is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary outside the wall as he has distanced it But even inside the wall that he brings it closer and say it is a valid teaches us
llm_translation: They said: "It is not necessary." What is it saying "it is not necessary"? Outside the wall, far away, it is far away. Rather, even inside the wall, close by, it is close by. And say, it should be valid. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: אמר מר אמר לו רבי יוחנן והלא כל א"י בדוקה היא במאי קמיפלגי מר סבר ירד מבול לא"י ומר סבר לא ירד
human_translation: The Master says Rabbi Yoḥanan said to But is not all of Eretz Yisrael inspected With regard to what do they disagree? Sage, holds the flood descended upon Eretz Yisrael, And Sage, holds did not descend
llm_translation: The Master said, Rabbi Yochanan said to him, "But isn't all the Land of Israel examined? What are they arguing about?" One Master holds that the Flood descended to the Land of Israel, and the other Master holds that it did not descend.

hebrew_text: אר"נ בר יצחק ושניהם מקרא אחד דרשו (יחזקאל כב, כד) בן אדם אמר לה את ארץ לא מטוהרה היא לא גושמה ביום זעם
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: And both of them, interpreted the same verse, “Son of man, say to her: You are a land that is not cleansed, nor rained upon in the day of indignation”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nachman bar Yitzchak and both of them expounded a single verse, as it is written (Ezekiel 22:24), "Son of man, say to her, 'You are a land that is not cleansed, not rained upon in the day of indignation.'"

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן סבר אתמוהי מתמה קרא א"י מי לא מטוהרה את כלום ירדו עליך גשמים ביום זעם ור"ל סבר כפשטיה ארץ לא מטוהרה את מי לא ירדו עליך גשמים ביום זעם
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds the verse is asking question: Eretz Yisrael, are you not cleansed Did rains fall upon you on the day of indignation? And Reish Lakish holds in accordance with its straightforward meaning, You are a land that is not cleansed. Didn’t rains fall upon you on the day of indignation?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan holds: "At the time of the inquiry, the verse says, 'Is it not pure with nothing?' Rain descended upon you in the day of anger." And Resh Lakish holds: "According to its simple meaning, the land is not pure. Is it not that rain descended upon you in the day of anger."

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר"ל לר' יוחנן חצירות היו בירושלים בנויות על הסלע ותחתיהן חלול מפני קבר התהום ומביאין נשים מעוברות ויולדות ומגדלות שם בניהם לפרה
human_translation: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan Courtyards were built in Jerusalem on stone, and beneath space due to grave the depths. And they bring pregnant women, and give birth And raise their children there, to the heifer.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Levi to Rabbi Yochanan: "There were courtyards in Jerusalem built upon the rock, and beneath them was a hollow due to the grave of the abyss, and they would bring pregnant women, and they would give birth and raise their children there for the cow."

hebrew_text: ומביאין שוורים ועל גביהן דלתות ותינוקות יושבין עליהן וכוסות של אבן בידן ומלאו וישבו במקומן
human_translation: And bring oxen And on the backs of doors, and children sit upon and cups of stone, in their hands, And filled and would sit in their places
llm_translation: And they bring oxen, and on their backs doors, and infants sit on them, and cups of stone in their hands, and they filled and sat in their place.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע מעלה עשו בפרה
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said established a higher standard in the red heifer,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Esau ascends in a heifer.

hebrew_text: איתיבי' רבי יוחנן לריש לקיש פעם אחד מצאו עצמות בלשכת דיר העצים ובקשו לגזור טומאה על ירושלים עמד רבי יהושע על רגליו ואמר לא בושה וכלימה היא לנו שנגזור טומאה על עיר אבותינו איה מתי מבול איה מתי נבוכדנצר
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish Once, bones were found in the Chamber of the Woodshed, and sought to decree impurity upon Jerusalem, Rabbi Yehoshua stood upon his feet and said: Is it not a shame and disgrace for us to decree impurity upon the city of our fathers Where are the dead of the flood, where are the dead Nebuchadnezzar?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: One time they found bones in the chamber of the woodchopper and they sought to decree impurity upon Jerusalem. Rabbi Yehoshua stood on his feet and said, "It is a disgrace and a humiliation for us to decree impurity upon the city of our forefathers. Where were you, O Jerusalem, at the time of the Flood? Where were you at the time of Nebuchadnezzar?"

hebrew_text: מדקאמר הכי לאו למימרא דלא הוו ולטעמיך הרוגי נבוכדנצר הכי נמי דלא הוו אלא הוו ופנינהו הכא נמי הוו ופנינהו ואי אפנו
human_translation: From that said this, not to say that there were no And according to your reasoning, so too were there not those killed by Nebuchadnezzar, Rather, were, and removed Here too, there were, and removed And If they were removed,
llm_translation: From when he said so, is it not to say that they were not? And according to your reasoning, the slayers of Nebuchadnezzar were also not, but they were. And their faces were here also, they were and their faces. And if they turned.

hebrew_text: הא איפני נהי דאיפני מירושלים מכולה א"י לא איפני
human_translation: they were removed. Granted that were removed from Jerusalem, were not removed from all Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: This way, as it turns out, that it turns out from Jerusalem, from all of the Land of Israel, it does not turn out.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי איתיביה ר"ל לרבי יוחנן איה מתי מבול איה מתי נבוכדנאצר מאי לאו מדהני הוו הני נמי הוו מידי אירי' הא כדאיתיה והא כדאיתיה
human_translation: There are who say Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan, Where are the dead of the flood, where are the dead Nebuchadnezzar? What, is it not since those were those were also Are the cases comparable? This as it is and that as it is,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: "Where is the death of the Flood? Where is the death of Nebuchadnezzar?" What, is it not so that these were also punishments? They were immediate punishments, as it is written here and as it is written there.

hebrew_text: איתיביה (בראשית ז, כב) מכל אשר בחרבה מתו בשלמא לדידי דאמינא ירד מבול לא"י משום הכי מתו אלא לדידך אמאי מתו משום הבלא
human_translation: raised an objection to whatsoever was on the dry land, died” Granted, according to my that I say flood descended upon Eretz Yisrael, due to that died, But according to your why did they die due to the heat
llm_translation: He raised an objection: "Of all that was in the city, they died." Now, according to my reasoning, I would say that the Flood came down to the Land of Israel, and that is why they died. But according to your reasoning, why did they die? Because of the confusion.

hebrew_text: כדרב חסדא דאמר רב חסדא ברותחין קלקלו וברותחין נידונו דכתיב הכא (בראשית ח, א) וישוכו המים וכתיב התם (אסתר ז, י) וחמת המלך שככה
human_translation: in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda says: sinned with boiling and they were punished with boiling As it is written here, and the waters calmed [ vayashoku hamayim ]” and it is written there, Then the king’s boiling anger was assuaged [ shakhakha ]”
llm_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said, Rav Ḥisda said: "Boiling waters have been corrupted, and boiling waters have been judged," as it is written here (Genesis 8:1), "And the waters subsided," and it is written there (Esther 7:10), "And the king's wrath subsided."

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי איתיביה רבי יוחנן לר"ל מכל אשר בחרבה מתו בשלמא לדידי דאמינא לא ירד מבול לא"י משום הכי הוי חרבה אלא לדידך מאי חרבה חרבה שהיתה מעיקרא
human_translation: There are who say Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish “whatsoever was on the dry land, died” Granted, according to my that I say flood did not descend upon Eretz Yisrael, due to that there was dry land But according to your what “dry land”? land that had been dry initially,
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "From all that is in it, they died by the sword." Now, according to my opinion, I would say that the Flood did not descend to the Land of Israel, and therefore it was not considered desolate. But according to your opinion, what is considered desolate? Desolate from the beginning.

hebrew_text: ואמאי קרי ליה חרבה כדרב חסדא דאמר רב חסדא בדור המבול לא נגזרה גזרה על דגים שבים שנאמר מכל אשר בחרבה מתו ולא דגים שבים
human_translation: And why call it “dry land” in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda says: During the generation of the flood no decree was decreed upon the fish in the sea, as it is stated: “Whatsoever was on the dry land, died” but not fish in the sea.
llm_translation: And why is it called "Charvah" like Rav Chisda? For Rav Chisda said: In the generation of the Flood, a decree was not decreed upon the fish of the sea, as it is stated, "Of all that was in the dry land died" (Genesis 7:22), but not the fish of the sea.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד לא ירד מבול לא"י היינו דקם רימא התם אלא למ"ד ירד רימא היכא קם א"ר ינאי גוריות הכניסו בתיבה
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says the flood did not descend upon Eretz Yisrael, this is that the reima remained there, But according to the one who says descended how did the reima remain? Rabbi Yannai says: brought cubs into the ark,
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who says that the Flood did not descend upon the Land of Israel, that is where Rimma stood. However, according to the one who says that the Flood did descend, where did Rimma stand? Rabbi Yannai said: The young cubs were brought into the Ark.

hebrew_text: והאמר רבה בר בר חנה לדידי חזי לי אורזילא דרימא בת יומא והוי כהר תבור והר תבור כמה הויא ארבעין פרסי משכא דצואריה תלתא פרסי מרבעתא דרישא פרסא ופלגא רמא כבא וסכר ירדנא
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say: I have seen a day-old offspring of the reima , and was as Mount Tabor. And how is Mount Tabor? forty parasangs. the length of neck three parasangs, the place where its head rests, a parasang and a half. It cast feces, and dammed up the Jordan
llm_translation: And Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said: According to my observation, I saw a beam of light one day, and it was as bright as the peak of Tabor. And how high is Mount Tabor? Forty parasangs. The length of his neck is three parasangs, the width of his head is one parasang, and half a parasang is the height of his forehead.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן ראשו הכניסו לתיבה והאמר מר מרבעתא דרישא פרסא ופלגא אלא ראש חוטמו הכניסו לתיבה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: They brought the head of into the ark, But doesn’t the Master, say the place where its head rests a parasang and a half? Rather, they brought the head, of its nose into the ark,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: His head they brought into the ark, and the Master said: "From the navel upwards is Persian and below is Median." Rather, his head they brought into the ark.

hebrew_text: והא א"ר יוחנן לא ירד מבול לא"י לדברי ר"ל קאמר
human_translation: But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say flood did not descend upon Eretz Yisrael? said in accordance with the statement of Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: And behold, Rabbi Yochanan said: The Flood did not descend to the Land of Israel, according to the words of Rabbi Levi.

hebrew_text: והא קסגיא תיבה אמר ר"ל קרניו קשרו בתיבה והאמר רב חסדא אנשי דור המבול ברותחין קלקלו וברותחין נידונו
