human_translation: But the ark was moving Reish Lakish says: They tied its horns to the ark, But doesn’t Rav Ḥisda say the people of the generation of the flood sinned with boiling and were punished with boiling
llm_translation: And this is difficult, the ark, it says, Rabbi Levi said: its horns were tied to the ark. And Rav Chisda said: The people of the generation of the Flood were boiling, they sinned, and they were judged while boiling.

hebrew_text: ולטעמיך תיבה היכי סגיא ועוד עוג מלך הבשן היכא קאי אלא נס נעשה להם שנצטננו בצידי התיבה
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, how did ark move? Moreover, how did Og, king of the Bashan stand, Rather, a miracle was performed for them, that on the sides of the ark cooled,
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, how is a box large? Furthermore, where is Og, king of Bashan, situated? Rather, a miracle was performed for them, as they were arranged on the sides of the ark.

hebrew_text: ולר"ש [בן לקיש] נהי נמי דירד מבול לא"י והא לא פש דאמר ר"ל למה נקרא שמה מצולה שכל מתי מבול נצתללו שם ורבי יוחנן אמר למה נקרא שמה שנער שכל מתי מבול ננערו שם אי אפשר דלא אידבקו
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, though flood did indeed descend upon Eretz Yisrael, no remains As Reish Lakish says: Why called Metzula because all the dead of the flood, sank [ nitztalelu ] there. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why is called Shinar? because all the dead of the flood were deposited [ ninaru ] there. It is impossible that were not stuck
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, it is also fitting that the flood descended to the Land of Israel, yet it did not spread, as Rabbi Levi said: Why is it called Mitzula? Because all the corpses of the flood were piled up there. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Why is it called Sin'ar? Because all the corpses of the flood were scattered there. It is impossible that they did not adhere.

hebrew_text: א"ר אבהו למה נקרא שמה שנער שמנערת עשיריה והא קחזינן דהוו תלתא דרי לא משכי
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: Why is it called Shinar? Because it shakes [ shemena’eret ] its wealthy But we see that there are does not extend three generations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Why is it called Shunem? Because she (the woman of Shunem) made her wealth grow. But we see that there were three generations that did not go away.

hebrew_text: א"ר אמי כל האוכל מעפרה של בבל כאילו אוכל בשר אבותיו תנ"ה כל האוכל מעפרה של בבל כאילו אוכל בשר אבותיו וי"א כאילו אוכל שקצים ורמשים:
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: anyone who eats the dust of Babylonia, as if he eats the flesh of his ancestors, This is also taught anyone who eats the dust of Babylonia, as if he eats the flesh of his ancestors. And some say: as if he eats repugnant creatures and crawling things,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ami said: Anyone who eats from the dust of Babylon is as if he is eating the flesh of his forefathers. It was taught in a Baraita: Anyone who eats from the dust of Babylon is as if he is eating the flesh of his forefathers. And some say: It is as if he is eating abominations and creeping things.

hebrew_text: שעיר המשתלח:
human_translation: the scapegoat
llm_translation: Goat that is sent away:

hebrew_text: ורמינהי (ויקרא יז, ד) או קרבן שומע אני אפילו קדשי בדק הבית שנקראו קרבן שנאמר (במדבר לא, נ) ונקרב את קרבן ה'
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Or “offering” I derive even consecrated for Temple maintenance, as are called offerings, as it is stated “And we have brought the Lord’s offering,
llm_translation: And we raised a contradiction: "Or a sacrifice" - I would think even the consecrated items of the Temple courtyard that are called sacrifices, as it is stated (Numbers 31:50), "And we will bring the offering of the Lord."

hebrew_text: ת"ל ואל פתח אהל מועד לא הביאו מי שראוי לבא באהל מועד יצאו קדשי בדק הבית שאינן ראוין
human_translation: the verse states: “And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting he did not bring it” that which is fit to come to Tent of Meeting, Excluded consecrated for Temple maintenance, which are not fit
llm_translation: The text teaches: "And at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, they did not bring in one who is fitting to enter the Tent of Meeting, they brought out the holy items of the Temple courtyard that are not fitting."

hebrew_text: אוציא את אלו שאינן ראוין ולא אוציא את שעיר המשתלח שהוא ראוי לבא אל פתח אהל מועד ת"ל לה' להוציא שעיר המשתלח שאינו מיוחד לה'
human_translation: I shall exclude these, which are not fit but I shall not exclude the scapegoat, which is fit to come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. the verse states: to the Lord,” to exclude the scapegoat, which is not designated to the Lord,
llm_translation: I will remove those that are not fitting, but I will not remove the Azazel-goat, which is fitting to come to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. It is stated: "to the Lord" - to remove the Azazel-goat that is not designated for Him.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן קודם הגרלה כאן לאחר הגרלה אחר הגרלה נמי האיכא וידוי
human_translation: not difficult. Here, before lottery, There, after lottery, After lottery also there is confession
llm_translation: Not difficult here before the lottery here after the lottery after the lottery also there is confession.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב מני לא קשיא כאן קודם וידוי כאן לאחר וידוי:
human_translation: Rather, Rav Mani said: not difficult, here, before confession, There, after confession,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Meni said: It is not difficult. Here, before confession; here, after confession.

hebrew_text: הרובע והנרבע:
human_translation: an animal that copulated with a person, or an animal that was the object of bestiality,
llm_translation: The square and the rectangle.

hebrew_text: והא נמי תיפוק לי מפתח אהל מועד
human_translation: And this too, derive from “To the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,”
llm_translation: And this also can be derived for me from the key of the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew_text: בשלמא רובע ונרבע משכחת ליה דאקדשינהו מעיקרא והדר רבעו
human_translation: Granted, an animal that copulated with a person or an animal that was the object of bestiality, you find where one initially consecrated it, and then engaged in bestiality with it.
llm_translation: In accordance with the majority opinion, if one quartered and then quartered again, he finds that he has sanctified them from the outset, and then he quarters again.

hebrew_text: אלא מוקצה ונעבד אין אדם אוסר דבר שאינו שלו בקדשים קלים ואליבא דר' יוסי הגלילי דאמר קדשים קלים ממון בעלים הוא
human_translation: But set aside or worshipped, a person does not render forbidden an item that is not his. in offerings of lesser sanctity, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: An offering of lesser sanctity is the property of the owner.
llm_translation: Rather, muktzeh and consecrated items that do not belong to a person may be handled; one does not prohibit something that is not his. Regarding light consecrated items, and according to Rabbi Yosei the Galilean who said, "Light consecrated items are the property of their owners."

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא ה, כא) ומעלה מעל בה' לרבות קדשים קלים שהן ממונו דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי
human_translation: as it is taught and commit a trespass against the Lord, to include offerings of lesser sanctity, since they the property of the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 5:21), "And he shall bring his forfeited property to the Lord," to include light holy items, which are his property. These are the words of Rabbi Yossi HaGelili.

hebrew_text: הלכך רובע ונרבע דבר ערוה מוקצה ונעבד עבודת כוכבים בקדשים קלים
human_translation: Therefore, An animal that copulated with a person and an animal that was the object of bestiality a matter of forbidden sexual intercourse. set aside or was worshipped idol worship of an offering of lesser sanctity,
llm_translation: Therefore, one who crushes and grinds a matter of forbidden relations, it is considered as muktzeh, and one who serves idolatry with light holy items.

hebrew_text: אתנן ומחיר כלאים יוצא דופן בולדות קדשים
human_translation: payment or price diverse kinds, born by caesarean section, to the offspring of sacrificial
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: "And the price of forbidden mixtures goes out with the offspring of consecrated animals."

human_translation: holds the offspring of sacrificial they are sanctified as they are

hebrew_text: בעלי מומין וכו' אותו ואת בנו וכו':

llm_translation: Owners of blemishes, etc. him and his son, etc.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי תנא בעלי מומין משום דמאיסי אבל תורין דלא מאיסי אימא (לא) דמודו ליה לר"ש
human_translation: And are necessary. As, if taught blemished because they are repulsive; but doves which are not repulsive I will say not that concede to Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if a Tanna taught "Ba'alei Mumim" it is because they are despised, but "Torin" which are not despised, say (no), they did not agree with Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ואי תנא תורין משום דלא חזי ואידחו אבל בעלי מומין דאיחזו ואידחו אימא (לא) דמודה להו ר"ש לרבנן
human_translation: And if taught doves because they are not Fit and rejected; But blemished which were fit and disqualified, I will say not as Rabbi Shimon concedes to the Rabbis
llm_translation: "And if you say that they are exempt because the blemish is not visible, and they the Sages rejected this argument. But with regard to animals with blemishes that are visible and they the Sages rejected this argument, say that Rabbi Shimon does not agree with the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: ואי תנא הני תרתי משום דפסולא דגופייהו אבל אותו ואת בנו דפסולא מעלמא קאתי לה אימא מודו ליה רבנן לר"ש צריכא:
human_translation: And if taught these two because their disqualification inherent. But itself and its offspring, the disqualification comes to from an external I will say the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Shimon necessary
llm_translation: And if you say, these two cases are different because their disqualification is inherent to them, but that one and his son, their disqualification comes from elsewhere, say the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Shimon that it is necessary.

hebrew_text: שהיה רבי שמעון אומר: מאי טעמא דר"ש
human_translation: that Rabbi Shimon says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon would say: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon?

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אילעא אמר ריש לקיש דאמר קרא (דברים יב, ח) לא תעשון ככל אשר אנחנו עושים פה היום אמר להו משה לישראל כי עייליתו לארץ ישרות תקריבו חובות לא תקריבו
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a says Reish Lakish says that the verse states: “You shall not do all that we do here this day, Moses said to the Jewish people: When you enter Eretz upright you may sacrifice, obligatory you may not sacrifice,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ela said Resh Lakish that said Scripture (Deuteronomy 12:8) "You shall not do all that we are doing here today." Moses said to the Israelites, "When you come to the land that you are to inherit, you shall bring obligatory offerings; you shall not bring voluntary offerings."

hebrew_text: וגלגל לגבי שילה מחוסר זמן הוא וקאמר להו משה לא תעשון
human_translation: And Gilgal, in relation to Shiloh, whose time has not yet and Moses said to “You shall not do,”
llm_translation: And a wheel opposite Shiloh is lacking time, and Moses said to them, "Do not do."

human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: If so,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah to Rabbi Zeira: If so...

hebrew_text: מילקי נמי לילקי אלמה אמר רבי זירא הכתוב נתקו לעשה
human_translation: should also receive lashes Why did Rabbi Zeira say the verse has transmuted into a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: Milkay also Lilkei Almah. Rabbi Zeira said: The verse has been detached for the purpose of action.

hebrew_text: הני מילי לרבנן לרבי שמעון הכי נמי
human_translation: That statement according to the Rabbis, according to Rabbi Shimon, indeed
llm_translation: These matters are for the Sages, for Rabbi Shimon as well.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר פנים דגלגל לגבי שילה כחוץ דמי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: inside in Gilgal, in relation to Shiloh, is considered like outside,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "The face of a wheel towards Shiloh is considered as outside."

hebrew_text: רבה אמר טעמיה דרבי שמעון כדתניא רבי שמעון אומר מנין לזובח פסח בבמת יחיד בשעת איסור הבמות שהוא בלא תעשה ת"ל (דברים טז, ה) לא תוכל לזבוח את הפסח
human_translation: Rabba said: The reason of Rabbi Shimon As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: From where that one who slaughters Paschal offering on a private altar at a time prohibited altars a prohibition? The verse states: “You may not sacrifice the Paschal offering
llm_translation: Rabah said: The reasoning of Rabbi Shimon is as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: From where do we derive that one may slaughter the Passover sacrifice on a private altar at a time when the use of altars is prohibited by a negative commandment? It is stated (Deuteronomy 16:5), "You may not slaughter the Passover sacrifice."

hebrew_text: יכול אף בשעת היתר הבמות כן ת"ל באחד שעריך לא אמרתי לך אלא בשעה שכל ישראל נכנסין בשער אחד
human_translation: might even at a time permitted altars so. the verse states: “Within any [ be’aḥad ] of your gates,” I said to you only when all of the Jewish people enter through one [ eḥad ] gate
llm_translation: I might have thought that even during the time of permission for the altars, so it teaches: "In one of your gates." I only said to you, but at the time when all of Israel enter through one gate.

hebrew_text: אימת אי נימא אחר חצות כרת נמי מחייב אלא לאו קודם חצות
human_translation: When If we say after midday be deemed liable karet as well, Rather, is it not before midday,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: When is it? If we say after midnight, then it should also incur the penalty of karet, rather, is it not before midnight.

hebrew_text: לעולם לאחר חצות ובשעת היתר הבמות קאי
human_translation: Actually, after midday and referring to a time permitted altars,
llm_translation: Always after midnight and at the time of the permissibility of the altars stands.

hebrew_text: והא בשעת איסור הבמות קאמר איסור במה לו היתר במה לחבירו:
human_translation: But doesn’t state: At a time prohibited altars? prohibited for altar, permitted altar for another
llm_translation: And this, at the time of the prohibition of the altars, it says, "A prohibition in what is it for him, a permission in what is it for his fellow."

hebrew_text: מחוסר זמן כו': והני בני אשמות נינהו אמר זעירי תני מצורע בהדייהו:
human_translation: whose time has not yet And are these subject to guilt offerings? Ze’eiri said: teach: Leper, together with
llm_translation: "Machusar zman, etc.: And these are the sons of guilt. Zairi said: A metzora is among them."

human_translation: their burnt offerings or their peace offerings And are these subject to peace offerings? Rav Sheshet said: Teach a Nazirite of Ze’eiri fixed the tanna’im of Rav Sheshet, not fixed the tanna’im
llm_translation: Their burnt offerings and peace offerings. These are the sons of Shlomim. Rav Sheshet said: It was taught in a Baraita of Neziri from Zeiri: The Tanna of Rav Sheshet established it, the Tanna did not establish it.

hebrew_text: א"ר חלקיה (דבי) רב טובי לא שנו אלא לשמו אבל שלא לשמו חייב הואיל וראוי לשלא לשמו בפנים
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥilkiya, from the school of Rav Tovi, says: They taught only for its own sake. But not for its own sake liable because fit to not for its own sake inside

hebrew_text: אי הכי לשמו נמי ניחייב הואיל וראוי לשלא לשמו בפנים בעי עקירה
human_translation: If so, for its own sake should also be liable since fit not for its sake inside requires uprooting
llm_translation: If so, for his name also he is liable, since it is fitting to uproot the plant for his name, he requires uprooting.

human_translation: Rav Huna objects to And is there anything that is not fit for its own sake, but is fit not for its sake? And not? But
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Huna: "And is there for you a thing that is not valid for its name, and valid not for its name, and not and behold."

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא יז, ג) שור מ"מ כשב מ"מ עז מ"מ ואילו חטאת שיירא
human_translation: the verse states “Ox” in any case “lamb” in any case “goat” in any case while a sin offering omitted
llm_translation: It is taught (Vayikra 17:3): "An ox, a sheep, or a goat, it shall be as a sin offering."

human_translation: What are we dealing with If we say at its time, why specifically a guilt offering? a sin offering as well. Rather, not at its time,
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say in his time, what is the relevance of guilt offering? Even sin offering as well, except that it is not in his time.

hebrew_text: ובמאי אילימא לשמו אשם אמאי חייב אלא לאו שלא לשמו לעולם בזמנו ושלא לשמו
human_translation: And what with? If we say for its sake, why liable a guilt offering Rather, is not not for its sake, Actually, at its time and not for its sake.
llm_translation: And with what is the offering brought? If you say it is brought for its name purpose, why is one liable? Rather, is it not brought not for its name purpose forever, in its time, and not for its name purpose.

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר היא דאמר מקשינן אשם לחטאת
human_translation: And is Rabbi Eliezer, who says: We juxtapose a guilt offering with a sin offering
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, this is what he said: We ask about a guilt offering for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: ותנא טפל וה"ה עיקר
human_translation: And taught: secondary But the same is true primary,
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Tefel" and similarly "Ikar."

hebrew_text: ת"ש יכול שאני מרבה עולת מחוסר זמן בגופה וחטאת בין בגופה בין בבעלים
human_translation: Come hear might that I include a burnt offering whose time has not yet intrinsically and a sin offering whether intrinsically or the owner.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Perhaps one might say that one can bring an Olah offering from an animal that is lacking in time to be offered in its body, and a Chatat offering, whether the animal is lacking in time in its body or in its owners.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא יז, ד) ואל פתח אהל מועד כל שאינו ראוי לבא בפתח אהל מועד אין חייבין עליהן ואילו אשם שיירא
human_translation: the verse states “And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” any that is unfit to be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, one is not liable for But a guilt offering omitted
llm_translation: The verse teaches (Leviticus 17:4): "And to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting." Anyone who is not fit to enter through the entrance of the Tent of Meeting is not liable for them. And this is the guilt offering that remains.

hebrew_text: במאי עסקינן אילימא לשמו אשם נמי ליפטריה אלא לאו שלא לשמו
human_translation: What are we dealing with? If we say for its sake, a guilt offering should also be exempt, Rather, is it not not for its sake?
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say it is for its own sake, then even with a guilt-offering one should exempt her. Rather, is it not dealing with a case where it is not for its own sake.

hebrew_text: לעולם שלא לשמו ור"א היא דמקיש אשם לחטאת תנא עיקר וכ"ש לטפל
human_translation: Actually, not for its sake. And be Rabbi Eliezer, who juxtaposes a guilt offering with a sin offering; taught: primary and all the more so to secondary
llm_translation: Forever not for his name and Rabbi Eliezer it is as he compares guilt offering to sin offering, it was taught primarily and all the more so for secondary.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דכי אתא רב דימי אמר תנא דבי ר' ליואי יכול שאני מוציא אף עולת מחוסר זמן בבעלים אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע (מנין ונסיב להו תלמודא לחיובא ולא ידענא מאי היא)
human_translation: Come hear as when Rav Dimi came he said the school of Rabbi Livai taught might that I exclude even a burnt offering whose time has not yet due to for its owner, a guilt offering of a nazirite or the guilt offering of a leper From where And brought a derivation liable, but I do not know what is.
llm_translation: Come and hear: When Rav Dimi came, he said: A Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yochanan taught: One might have thought that I can also include a burnt offering that is lacking its designated time among the guilt offerings of owners, the guilt offering of a Nazirite, and the guilt offering of a leper. (From where do we derive this? The Gemara came and established it as obligatory, but we do not know what it is.)

hebrew_text: מאי תלמודא אמר רבינא שור מכל מקום כשב מכל מקום עז מכל מקום הא מאי רומיא כדאמרת
human_translation: What is the derivation? Ravina said “ox” in any case “lamb” in any case “goat” in any case What contradiction this? as you stated
llm_translation: What is Talmud? Ravina said: An ox from any place, a sheep from any place, a goat from any place. Now, what is Rome? As you said.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"נ משום [דרמי] דתנא דבי ר' ליואי אדתני לוי אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע ששחטן שלא לשמן כשירין ולא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said because he raises a contradiction between that the school of Rabbi Livai taught that Levi taught: The guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper that one slaughtered not for their sakes are fit, but they do not satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Rami that the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yochanan ben Levi taught: The guilt-offering of a Nazirite and the guilt-offering of a leper, if they were slaughtered not for their sake, are valid, and they do not fulfill the obligation of the owners.

hebrew_text: שחטן מחוסר זמן בבעלים או שהיו בני שתי שנים ושחטן פסולין
human_translation: slaughtered them premature due to its owner, or were in their second year slaughtered them, are disqualified,
llm_translation: The slaughterer, lacking time, in the presence of the owners, or if they were under two years old, the slaughter is invalid.

hebrew_text: ומשני רב דימי לא קשיא כאן לשמו כאן שלא לשמו
human_translation: And Rav Dimi answers: not difficult. Here, for its sake; there, not for its sake.
llm_translation: And Rav Dimi taught: It is not difficult - here (it is) for its own sake, here (it is) not for its own sake.

hebrew_text: רב אשי רמי מתני' אברייתא ומשני כאן לשמו וכאן שלא לשמו
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a contradiction between the mishna, and the baraita , And answers: Here, for its sake. And there, not for its sake,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi raises a contradiction between a Mishnah and a Braita: here it states "for its own sake," and here "not for its own sake."

hebrew_text: לימא תיהוי תיובתיה דרב הונא
human_translation: shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna,
llm_translation: Let the objection of Rav Huna be stated.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רב הונא הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שהפריש שתי אשמות לאחריות דחד מינייהו מעיקרא עולה היא
human_translation: Rav Huna said to you: What are we dealing with here, where separated two guilt offerings as a guarantee, since one of them, is a burnt offering from the outset.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to you: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if one separated two guilt offerings for liability, one of them is primary.

hebrew_text: כדרב הונא אמר רב דאמר רב הונא אמר רב אשם שניתק לרעיה ושחטו סתם כשר לעולה:
human_translation: in accordance with Rav Huna Rav says. As Rav Huna says Rav says: a guilt offering was consigned to grazing and slaughtered it without specification fit as a burnt offering.
llm_translation: As Rav Huna said, Rav said, as Rav Huna said, Rav said: A guilt-offering that was detached for its fellow and slaughtered it without specific intent is valid for a burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: המעלה מבשר חטאת [וכו']: ת"ר מנין למעלה מבשר חטאת ומבשר אשם ומבשר קדשי קדשים ומבשר קדשים קלים וממותר העומר ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים ושירי מנחות שפטור
human_translation: One who offers up of the meat of a sin offering the Sages taught From where that one who offers up of the meat of a sin offering, or of the meat of a guilt offering, or of the meat of offerings of the most sacred order, or of the meat of offerings of lesser sanctity, or of the surplus of the omer offering, or the two loaves, or the shewbread, or the remainder of meal offerings exempt,
llm_translation: The one who brings up from the flesh of the sin offering etc.: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that one who brings up from the flesh of the sin offering, and from the flesh of the guilt offering, and from the flesh of the most holy offerings, and from the flesh of the lesser holy offerings, and from the remainder of the Omer offering, and from the two loaves, and from the showbread, and from the remnants of meal offerings, is exempt.

hebrew_text: ת"ל עולה מה עולה שהיא ראויה להעלאה אף כל שראויה להעלאה
human_translation: The verse states a burnt offering Just as a burnt offering is fit for offering up so too, anything that is fit for offering up
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Talmudic text: ת"ל עולה מה עולה שהיא ראויה להעלאה אף כל שראויה להעלאה" English translation: "It is taught: 'An offering,' what is an offering that is fit for elevation? Also, any offering that is fit for elevation."

hebrew_text: מנין שאף היוצק והבולל והפותת והמולח והמניף והמגיש והמסדר השלחן והמטיב את הנרות והקומץ והמקבל בחוץ שפטור
human_translation: From where that even one who pours and one who mixes and one who breaks and one who salts and one who waves and one who brings and one who arranges the table and one who removes the ashes the lamps and one who removes a handful and one who collects the blood outside exempt.
llm_translation: From where do we derive that even the one who pours, and the one who mixes, and the one who grinds, and the one who salts, and the one who waves, and the one who presents, and the one who sets the table, and the one who arranges the candles, and the one who gathers, and the one who receives from outside, are exempt?

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא טז, ט) אשר יעלה עולה או זבח מה העלאה שהיא גמר עבודה אף כל שהוא גמר עבודה:
human_translation: The verse states: “That sacrifices a burnt offering or sacrifice” Just as sacrificing is the conclusion of service, so too, any that is the conclusion of service
llm_translation: The text states: "It is taught (Leviticus 16:9), 'which is brought up as a burnt offering or a sacrifice.' Just as the burnt offering is a complete act of service, so too, any offering that is a complete act of service."

hebrew_text: עד שלא הוקם המשכן [וכו']: יתיב רב הונא בר רב קטינא קמיה דרב חסדא וקא קרי (שמות כד, ה) וישלח את נערי בני ישראל א"ל הכי אמר ר' אסי (קרבו) ופסקו
human_translation: Until the Tabernacle was established, Rav Huna bar Rav Ketina was sitting before Rav Ḥisda and was reading “And he sent the young men of the children of Israel, said to him: This Rabbi Asi said: They sacrificed and ceased
llm_translation: Until the Tabernacle was not established etc.: Rav Huna son of Rav Katina was sitting before Rav Ḥisda, and he was reading (Exodus 24:5) "And he sent the youths of the children of Israel." He said to him: So said Rabbi Asi, "Approach and cease."

hebrew_text: סבר לאותוביה ממתניתין שמעיה דקאמר משמיה דרב אדא בר אהבה עולה שהקריבו ישראל במדבר אינה טעונה הפשט וניתוח אותביה ברייתא דשויא בכולהו
human_translation: thought to raise a contradiction from the mishna, he heard say in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava burnt offering that the Israel sacrificed in the wilderness did not require flaying and cutting raised the contradiction a baraita that is equal with regard to both of them,
llm_translation: He thought to Otovia from the Mishnah, he heard that he said in the name of Rav Adda bar Ahava: "The Ola offering that the Israelites brought in the desert does not require skinning and dismembering." Otovia explained in the Braita that it is valid in all cases.

hebrew_text: דתני' עד שלא הוקם המשכן הבמות מותרות ועבודה בבכורות והכל כשירין להקריב בהמה חיה ועוף זכרים ונקבות תמימין ובעלי מומין טהורין אבל לא טמאין
human_translation: As it is taught Until the Tabernacle was established, altars permitted, the service by the firstborn, and all fit to be sacrificed: A domesticated animal, an undomesticated animal, or a bird; males and females; unblemished and blemished kosher, but not non-kosher
llm_translation: It was taught: Until the Tabernacle was erected, altars are permitted, and the service of firstborn animals is permitted, and all are fit to offer, whether cattle, wild animals, or birds, males and females, unblemished and blemished, are pure, but not impure.

hebrew_text: והכל קרבו עולות ועולה שהקריבו ישראל במדבר טעונה הפשט וניתוח ונכרים בזמן הזה רשאין לעשות כן
human_translation: And all sacrificed burnt offerings. And burnt offering that the Jewish people sacrificed in the wilderness required flaying and cutting And today, gentiles are permitted to
llm_translation: And all brought near burnt offerings, and burnt offering that the Israelites brought in the wilderness requires examination and dissection, and foreigners nowadays are permitted to do so.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא (שמות יט, כב) וגם הכהנים הנגשים אל ה' יתקדשו ר' יהושע בן קרחה אומר זו פרישות בכורות רבי אומר זו פרישות נדב ואביהוא
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught “And let the priests also that come near to the Lord sanctify themselves, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: This the separation of firstborn, Rabbi says: This the separation of Nadav and Avihu,
llm_translation: It is a dispute in a Baraita: "And also the priests who come near to the Lord shall sanctify themselves" (Exodus 19:22). Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: This refers to the separation of the firstborn. Rabbi says: This refers to the separation of Nadav and Avihu.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד זו פרישות נדב ואביהוא היינו דכתיב (ויקרא י, ג) הוא אשר דבר ה' לאמר בקרובי אקדש
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says the separation of Nadav and Avihu, this is which is written This is it that the Lord spoke, saying: Through them that are near to Me I will be sanctified…
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who says that this refers to the separation of Nadav and Avihu, that is what is written (Leviticus 10:3), "I will be sanctified through those near to Me."

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד זו פרישות בכורות היכא רמיזא דכתיב (שמות כט, מג) ונועדתי שמה לבני ישראל ונקדש בכבודי אל תקרי בכבודי אלא במכובדיי
human_translation: But according to the one who says the separation of firstborn, where is the allusion As it is written: “And there I will meet with the children of Israel; and it shall be sanctified by My glory” Do not read “by My glory [ bikhvodi ]”; rather, By My honored ones [ bimekhubadai ].
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who learns this, what is the hint of "perishut" (asceticism) in the laws of firstborns? As it is written (Exodus 29:43), "And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and it shall be sanctified with My honor." Do not read it as "with My honor," but rather as "with My honored ones."

hebrew_text: דבר זה אמר הקב"ה למשה ולא ידעו עד שמתו בני אהרן כיון שמתו בני אהרן אמר לו אהרן אחי לא מתו בניך אלא להקדיש שמו של הקב"ה כיון שידע אהרן שבניו ידועי מקום הן שתק וקבל שכר שנאמר (ויקרא י, ג) וידום אהרן
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said this statement to Moses, but did not know until the sons of Aaron died. Once the sons of Aaron died, said to him: Aaron, my brother, your sons died only to sanctify the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He. When Aaron knew that his sons were beloved by the Omnipresent, he was silent and received a reward, as it is stated: “And Aaron held his peace [ vayidom ].”
llm_translation: This matter, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, and they did not know until the sons of Aaron died. Once the sons of Aaron died, Aaron said to him, "My brother, your sons did not die except to sanctify the name of the Holy One, blessed be He." Once Aaron knew that his sons were known in their place, he remained silent and accepted reward, as it is said, "And Aaron was silent" (Leviticus 10:3).

hebrew_text: וכן בדוד הוא אומר (תהלים לז, ז) דום לה' והתחולל לו אע"פ שמפיל לך חללים חללים את שתוק וכן בשלמה הוא אומר (קהלת ג, ז) עת לחשות ועת לדבר פעמים ששותק ומקבל שכר על השתיקה פעמים מדבר ומקבל שכר על הדבור
human_translation: And likewise in David states: “Resign yourself [ dom ] to the Lord, and wait patiently [ vehitḥolel ] for Him” Although He strikes down many corpses [ ḥalalim ] you, you be silent And likewise in Solomon states: “A time to keep silence, and a time to speak” times that is silent and receives reward for the silence, times speaks and receives reward for the speech.
llm_translation: And so in David, he says (Psalms 37:7), "Be silent to the Lord and wait for Him, though He casts down those who fall before you." Be silent. And so in Solomon, he says (Ecclesiastes 3:7), "A time to be silent and a time to speak." Sometimes one is silent and receives reward for the silence, sometimes one speaks and receives reward for the speech.

hebrew_text: והיינו דא"ר חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן מאי דכתיב (תהלים סח, לו) נורא אלהים ממקדשך אל תיקרי ממקדשך אלא ממקודשיך בשעה שעושה הקב"ה דין בקדושיו מתיירא ומתעלה ומתהלל
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What which is written: “Awesome is God out of your holy places” Do not read “From your holy places [ mimikdashekha ]”; rather, From your holy ones [ mimekudashekha ]. When the Holy One, Blessed be He, carries out judgment upon His holy ones, He is feared, and exalted, and praised
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the meaning of what is written (Psalms 68:36), "God is awesome from Your holy places"? Do not read it as "from Your holy places," but rather as "from Your sanctified ones." At the time when the Holy One, blessed be He, executes judgment upon His sanctified ones, He becomes fearful, exalted, and praised.

hebrew_text: אלא קשיא עולה תרי תנאי היא דתניא ר' ישמעאל אומר כללות נאמרו בסיני ופרטות באהל מועד
human_translation: But a difficulty burnt offering, is two tanna’im . As it is taught Rabbi Yishmael says: general statements, were said at Sinai, and details in the Tent of Meeting.
llm_translation: Rather, it is difficult. It is a dispute between two Tannaim, as it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael says: General principles were stated at Sinai, and the details in the Tent of Meeting.

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר כללות ופרטות נאמרו בסיני ונשנו באהל מועד ונשתלשו בערבות מואב
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: general statements and details were said at Sinai and taught again in the Tent of Meeting, and a third time in the plains of Moab,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: General principles and specifics were stated at Sinai, and repeated in the Tent of Meeting, and expounded upon in the plains of Moab.

hebrew_text: אמר מר הכל כשירין להקריב מנא הני מילי אמר רב הונא דאמר קרא (בראשית ח, כ) ויבן נח מזבח לה' ויקח מכל הבהמה הטהורה ומכל עוף הטהור בהמה כמשמעו חיה בכלל בהמה
human_translation: The Master said all fit to be sacrificed: From where are these matters Rav Huna said: As the verse states “And Noah built an altar to the Lord, and took of every pure animal, and of every pure fowl, “Animal [ behema ],” in accordance with its plain meaning, an undomesticated animal [ ḥayya ] included in “ behema ”
llm_translation: The Master said: "All are fit to bring an offering." What is the reason for these words? Rav Huna said, as the verse states (Genesis 8:20), "And Noah built an altar to the Lord, and took of every clean animal and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar." Animals, as implied, include wild animals in the category of animals.

hebrew_text: זכרים ונקבות תמימין ובעלי מומין (דאמר מר תמות וזכרות בבהמה ואין תמות וזכרות בעופות
human_translation: Males and females, unblemished and blemished that the Master said unblemished status and male status to animal but unblemished status and male status not to birds.
llm_translation: Males and females, unblemished and blemished (as the Master said: "males and females in cattle, but not males and females in birds").

hebrew_text: ואיתקש בהמה לעוף
human_translation: And a domesticated animal is juxtaposed with a bird,
llm_translation: And it was juxtaposed, "behemah" to "of"

hebrew_text: תמימין ובעלי מומין) לאפוקי מחוסר אבר דלא א"ר אלעזר מנין למחוסר אבר שנאסר לבני נח ת"ל (בראשית ו, יט) ומכל החי מכל בשר אמרה תורה הבא בהמה שחיין ראשי איברין שלה
human_translation: Unblemished and blemished to exclude lacking a limb, which not Rabbi Elazar says: From where that lacking a limb is forbidden to the descendants of Noah, The verse states “And of every living being of all flesh, the Torah stated: Bring an animal whose limbs are living,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Tamimim and Ba'alei Mumim (blemished animals), excluding a missing limb, as Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we derive that a missing limb is prohibited for the descendants of Noah? The Torah teaches (Genesis 9:4), 'But flesh with its life, which is its blood, you shall not eat.' The Torah specifies that an animal must come with its vital organs intact."

hebrew_text: ודילמא למעוטי טריפה ההוא מלחיות זרע נפקא
human_translation: But perhaps to exclude an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] is derived from “To keep seed alive”
llm_translation: And perhaps to exclude the case of a treifah, that the issue of the sciatic nerve arises.

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד טריפה אינה יולדת אלא למ"ד טריפה יולדת מאי איכא למימר האמר קרא אתך בדומין לך
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says a tereifa cannot give birth. But according to the one who says a tereifa can give birth, what can be said? Doesn’t the verse state with you” with regard to similar to you,
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says a treifah does not give birth, but according to the one who says a treifah does give birth, what can be said? This is what the verse says: "With you are those who shed blood."

hebrew_text: ודילמא נח גופיה טריפה הוה תמים כתיב ביה ודילמא תמים בדרכיו צדיק כתיב ביה
human_translation: But perhaps Noah himself was a tereifa . It is written about “complete” But perhaps his ways were complete, It is written about him “righteous”
llm_translation: And perhaps it was itself a treifah, it is written in it "tamim," and perhaps "tamim" in his ways, righteous, is written in it.

hebrew_text: ודילמא תמים בדרכיו צדיק במעשיו אי סלקא דעתך דנח גופיה טריפה הוה מי קאמר ליה לנח דכוותך עייל שלמים לא תעייל
human_translation: But perhaps complete in his manner, righteous in his deeds. If it enters your mind that Noah himself was a tereifa , would the Merciful One have said to him: Bring in like you do not bring in whole
llm_translation: Perhaps "tamim" in his ways, "tzadik" in his deeds. If you say that Noah himself was flawed, was he saying to Noah, "You should bring whole burnt offerings, not flawed ones"?

hebrew_text: ומאחר דנפקא לן מאתך לחיות זרע למה לי מהו דתימא אתך לצותא בעלמא אפי' זקן אפילו סריס קמשמע לן:
human_translation: And once we derive from “with you,” why do I “to keep seed alive”? “with you,” you would say only for companionship, even old even one who is castrated teaches us
llm_translation: And since it has been derived for us from you to live, why do I need seed? What if you say from you for a command in general, even an old man, even a eunuch, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: טהורין אבל לא טמאין: ומי הוו טמאין וטהורין בההיא שעתא א"ר שמואל בר נחמני א"ר יונתן מאותן שלא נעבדה בהן עבירה
human_translation: kosher, but not non-kosher And were there pure and impure at that time, Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: from those that had not been used in the performance of sin.
llm_translation: Pure but not impure: And were they impure and pure at that time? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From those that were not used for sin.

hebrew_text: מנא הוו ידעי כדרב חסדא דאמר רב חסדא העבירן לפני התיבה כל שהתיבה קולטתן בידוע שהוא טהור אין התיבה קולטתן בידוע שהן טמאין
human_translation: From where did know in accordance with of Rav Ḥisda. As Rav Ḥisda says: pass before the ark. All that the ark accepted, known to be pure; the ark did not accept them, known that they impure.
llm_translation: They knew how to act according to Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: "He should pass them before the ark. If the ark receives them, it is known that they are pure; if the ark does not receive them, it is known that they are impure."

hebrew_text: רבי אבהו אמר אמר קרא (בראשית ז, טז) והבאים זכר ונקבה הבאין מאיליהן
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says The verse states: “And they that went in, male and female that went in on their own.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: The verse states, "And those who entered, male and female of all flesh, entered as God had commanded him."

hebrew_text: אמר מר והכל קרבו עולות עולות אין שלמים לא והא כתיב (שמות כד, ה) ויזבחו זבחים שלמים לה' פרים אלא אימא הכל קרבו עולות [ושלמים
human_translation: the Master said: And all sacrificed burnt offerings. Burnt offerings, yes, peace offerings not But it is written: and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen to the Lord” Rather, say All sacrificed burnt offerings or peace offerings.
llm_translation: The Master said, "And all brought burnt offerings, burnt offerings are not peace offerings." But isn't it written (Exodus 24:5), "And they sacrificed peace offerings to the Lord, oxen"? Rather say, "And all brought burnt offerings and peace offerings."

hebrew_text: והתניא אבל שלמים לא כי אם עולות] עולות אין שלמים לא כמ"ד לא קרבו שלמים בני נח דאיתמר ר"א ור' יוסי בר חנינא חד אמר קרבו [שלמים בני נח] וחד אמר לא קרבו
human_translation: And isn’t it taught But peace offerings not rather, only burnt offerings burnt offerings, yes, peace offerings not in accordance with the one who says peace offerings were not sacrificed descendants of Noah. As it was stated Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina One says the descendants of Noah sacrificed peace offerings, and one says they did not sacrifice
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "But peace offerings are not brought except for burnt offerings." Burnt offerings are not peace offerings. As it is stated: "The sons of Noah did not bring peace offerings." For it was stated: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, one said: "The sons of Noah brought peace offerings," and one said: "They did not bring."

hebrew_text: מ"ט דמ"ד קרבו שלמים בני נח דכתיב (בראשית ד, ד) והבל הביא גם הוא מבכורות צאנו ומחלביהן איזהו דבר שחלבו קרב לגבי מזבח ואין כולו קרב לגבי מזבח הוי אומר זה שלמים
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the one who says the descendants of Noah sacrificed peace offerings? As it is written: “And Abel, he also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of the fat thereof” What is an item, the fat of which is sacrificed upon the altar, but is not sacrificed in its entirety upon the altar? You must say: This is the peace offering,
llm_translation: Reasoning of the Gemara: The sons of Noah bring peace offerings, as it is written (Genesis 4:4), "And Abel also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of their fat portions." What is the matter whose fat is brought near the altar, but not all of it is brought near the altar? You would say this is a peace offering.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דמ"ד לא קרבו דכתיב (שיר השירים ד, טז) עורי צפון ובואי תימן תתנער אומה שמעשיה בצפון ותבוא אומה שמעשיה בצפון ובדרום
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the one who says they did not sacrifice As it is written: “Awake [ uri ], O north; and come, south… nation, whose acts, in the north, shall be removed [ titna’er ], and shall come nation, whose acts, in the north and in the south,
llm_translation: Reasoning of the Gemara: Why did the Sages not come close? As it is written (Song of Songs 4:16), "Awake, O north wind, and come, O south wind; blow upon my garden, that its spices may flow out. Let my beloved come to his garden and eat its pleasant fruits."

hebrew_text: ומר נמי הכתיב ומחלביהן משמניהן [דידהו]
human_translation: And also the Master isn’t it written: “And of the fat thereof,” the fattest of them,
llm_translation: And Mar also said: It is written, "And from their fatness you shall take away their fat."

hebrew_text: ומר נמי הכתיב עורי צפון [ההוא] בקיבוץ גליות הוא דכתיב
human_translation: And also the Master isn’t it written: “Awake, O north,” that is written with regard to the ingathering of the exiles,
llm_translation: And Mar also said: "My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat."

hebrew_text: והא כתיב (שמות י, כה) ויאמר משה גם אתה תתן בידינו זבחים ועולות ועשינו לה' אלהינו זבחים לאכילה ועולות להקרבה
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And Moses said: You must also give into our hand sacrifices [ zevaḥim ] and burnt offerings, that we may sacrifice to the Lord our God” “ zevaḥim ” for consumption, and “burnt offerings” for sacrifice.
llm_translation: And the it is written (Exodus 10:25), "And Moses said, 'You also must give into our hands sacrifices and burnt offerings, and we will make sacrifices to the Lord our God. Sacrifices for eating and burnt offerings for drawing near.'"

hebrew_text: והא כתיב (שמות יח, יב) ויקח יתרו [חותן משה] עולה וזבחים ההוא לאחר מתן תורה הוא דכתיב
human_translation: But isn’t it written “And Yitro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices [ zevaḥim ] That was written after the giving of the Torah,
llm_translation: And behold, it is written (Exodus 18:12), "And Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God; and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God."

hebrew_text: הניחא למ"ד [יתרו] אחר מתן תורה היה אלא למ"ד [יתרו] קודם מתן תורה היה מאי איכא למימר דאיתמר בני ר' חייא ור' יהושע בן לוי חד אמר יתרו קודם מתן תורה היה וחד אמר יתרו אחר מתן תורה היה למ"ד יתרו קודם מתן תורה היה קסבר שלמים הקריבו בני נח
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says Yitro was after the giving of the Torah. But according to the one who says Yitro was before the giving of the Torah, what can be said? As it was stated: The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi One says Yitro was before the giving of the Torah, and one says Yitro was after the giving of the Torah. The one who says Yitro was before the giving of the Torah maintains the descendants of Noah did sacrifice peace offerings.
llm_translation: It is preferable according to the one who says Yitro was after the giving of the Torah, but according to the one who says Yitro was before the giving of the Torah, what can be said? It can be said that it was stated: The sons of Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said Yitro was before the giving of the Torah, and one said Yitro was after the giving of the Torah. According to the one who says Yitro was before the giving of the Torah, he holds that the non-Jews brought peace offerings.

hebrew_text: כתנאי (שמות יח, א) וישמע יתרו כהן מדין מה שמועה שמע ובא ונתגייר ר' יהושע אומר מלחמת עמלק שמע שהרי כתיב בצדו (שמות יז, יג) ויחלש יהושע את עמלק ואת עמו לפי חרב
human_translation: like tanna’im : “Now Yitro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard What tiding did he hear that he came and converted? Rabbi Yehoshua says: He heard the war with Amalek, as it is written adjacent to “And Joshua weakened Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Tanna'im (Exodus 18:1) "And Yitro, the priest of Midian, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel, His people, that the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt." Rabbi Yehoshua says: "He heard about the war with Amalek, as it is written on its side (Exodus 17:13) 'And Joshua weakened Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.'"

hebrew_text: ר"א המודעי אומר מתן תורה שמע [ובא] שכשניתנה תורה לישראל היה קולו הולך מסוף העולם ועד סופו וכל [מלכי] עובדי כוכבים אחזתן רעדה בהיכליהן ואמרו שירה שנאמר (תהלים כט, ט) ובהיכלו כולו אומר כבוד
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i says: He heard the giving of the Torah and came. As when the Torah was given to the Jewish people, the voice of went from end of the world to the end, and all of the kings of the nations of the world were overcome with trembling in their palaces and recited a song as it is stated: and in his palace all say: Glory”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer HaModai says: "The giving of the Torah, 'Hear and come,' when the Torah was given to Israel, his voice was going from one end of the world to the other, and all the kings of idolaters, their palaces shook, and they said a song, as it is said (Psalms 29:9), 'And in His temple, all say glory.'"

hebrew_text: נתקבצו כולם אצל בלעם הרשע ואמרו לו מה קול ההמון אשר שמענו שמא מבול בא לעולם (אמר להם) (תהלים כט, י) ה' למבול ישב [אמר להם] וישב ה' מלך לעולם כבר נשבע הקב"ה שאינו מביא מבול לעולם
human_translation: all of gathered around Balaam the wicked, and said to him: What is the tumultuous sound, that we have heard? Perhaps a flood is coming to the world, as it is stated: “The Lord sat enthroned at the flood” said to them: “The Lord sits as King forever” the Holy One, Blessed be He, already took an oath never to bring a flood to the world,
llm_translation: They all gathered by the wicked Balaam and said to him, "What is the sound of the multitude that we heard? Perhaps a flood is coming to the world." He said to them, "The Lord sits enthroned over the flood." (Psalms 29:10) He said to them, "The Lord will reign forever." The Holy One, blessed be He, has already sworn that He will not bring a flood to the world.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו מבול של מים אינו מביא אבל מבול של אש מביא שנא' (ישעיהו סו, טז) כי (הנה) באש ה' נשפט אמר להן כבר נשבע שאינו משחית כל בשר
human_translation: said to him: He will not bring a flood of water, but He will bring a flood of fire, as it is stated: “For by fire will the Lord contend, said to them: He already took an oath that He will not destroy all flesh
llm_translation: They said to him: A flood of water does not bring destruction, but a flood of fire does bring destruction, as it is stated (Isaiah 66:16): "For by fire will Hashem judge." He said to them: He has already sworn that He will not destroy all flesh.

hebrew_text: ומה קול ההמון הזה ששמענו אמר להם חמדה טובה יש לו בבית גנזיו שהיתה גנוזה אצלו תתקע"ד דורות קודם שנברא העולם וביקש ליתנה לבניו שנאמר (תהלים כט, יא) ה' עוז לעמו יתן [מיד] פתחו כולם ואמרו (תהלים כט, יא) ה' יברך את עמו בשלום
human_translation: And what is this tumultuous sound that we have heard? said to them: He has a good precious item in His treasury, that was hidden away with Him 974 generations before the world was created, and He seeks to give it to his children, as it is stated: “The Lord will give strength to His people” Immediately, they all began to say: “The Lord will bless His people with peace”
llm_translation: And what is the sound of this multitude that we heard? It said to them, "He has a precious treasure in his treasury that was hidden with him 974 generations before the world was created, and he desired to give it to his children, as it is said (Psalms 29:11), 'The Lord will give strength to His people; the Lord will bless His people with peace.'"

hebrew_text: ר"א אומר קריעת ים סוף שמע ובא שנא' (יהושע ה, א) ויהי כשמוע כל מלכי האמורי ואף רחב הזונה אמרה לשלוחי יהושע (יהושע ב, י) כי שמענו את אשר הוביש ה' את מי ים סוף
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: He heard the splitting of the Red Sea and came, as it is stated “And it came to pass, when all the kings of the Amorites, heard And even Rahab the prostitute said to Joshua’s messengers: “For we have heard how the Lord dried up the water of the Red Sea
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The splitting of the Red Sea, hear and come, as it is said (Joshua 5:1), "And it was when all the kings of the Amorites heard." And even Rahab the harlot said to the messengers of Joshua (Joshua 2:10), "For we have heard how the Lord dried up the water of the Red Sea."

hebrew_text: מאי שנא התם דאמר (ליה) (יהושע ה, א) ולא היה בם עוד רוח ומ"ש הכא דקאמר (יהושע ב, יא) ולא קמה עוד רוח באיש
human_translation: What is different there, where states: “Neither was there spirit in them anymore,” and what is different here, where states: “Neither did there remain [ kama ] any more spirit in any man”
llm_translation: What is the difference there that he said (to him) (Joshua 5:1) "and there was no longer spirit in them" and what is the reason that it says here (Joshua 2:11) "and no longer did spirit arise in a man."

hebrew_text: דאפילו אקשויי נמי לא אקשו ומנא ידעה דאמר מר אין לך כל שר ונגיד שלא בא על רחב הזונה
human_translation: that were not even become erect, And how did know As the Master said: You do not have any prince or ruler who did not engage in intercourse with Rahab the prostitute.
llm_translation: Even if they are hard, they are not hard, and from where do we know? As the Master said, "There is no prince or ruler who has not come upon the broad expanse of the harlot."

hebrew_text: אמרו בת י' שנים היתה כשיצאו ישראל ממצרים וזנתה [כל] מ' שנה שהיו ישראל במדבר אחר נ' שנה נתגיירה אמרה יהא מחול לי בשכר חבל חלון ופשתים:
human_translation: said She was ten years old when the Jewish people left Egypt, and she engaged in prostitution all forty years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness. After fifty years converted She said: May be forgiven me as a reward rope, window, and flax,
llm_translation: They said: The daughter of ten years old was when the Israelites left Egypt, and she committed adultery for forty years that the Israelites were in the wilderness. After fifty years she converted. She said: Let it be considered as a reward for me that a rope, a window, and flax were involved.

hebrew_text: אמר מר ועובדי כוכבים בזמן הזה רשאין לעשות כן מנא ה"מ דת"ר (ויקרא יז, א) דבר אל בני ישראל בני ישראל מצווין על שחוטי חוץ ואין העובדי כוכבים מצווין על שחוטי חוץ
human_translation: The Master said And today gentiles are permitted to do so, From where are these matters As the Sages taught “Speak to the children of Israel” Jews are commanded with regard to slaughtered outside but gentiles are not commanded with regard to slaughtered outside
llm_translation: The Master said, "And idolaters nowadays are permitted to do so." From where do we derive this? As the Rabbis taught (Leviticus 17:1), "Speak to the children of Israel," the children of Israel are commanded regarding slaughter outside the Temple, but idolaters are not commanded regarding slaughter outside.

hebrew_text: לפיכך כל אחד ואחד בונה לו במה לעצמו ומקריב עליה כל מה שירצה א"ר יעקב בר אחא אמר רב אסי אסור לסייען ולעשות שליחותן אמר רבה ולאורינהו [להו] שרי
human_translation: Therefore, each and every construct altar for himself, and sacrifice upon it whatever he desires. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa says Rav Asi says: prohibited to assist them or to fulfill their agency Rabba said: But to instruct them permitted.
llm_translation: Therefore, each and every one builds for himself a platform, and offers upon it whatever he desires. Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said in the name of Rav Assi: It is forbidden to assist them or to do their errands. Rabba said: But to light their lamps, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: כי הא דאיפרא הורמיז אימיה דשבור מלכא שדרה קורבנא לרבא שלחה ליה אסקוה ניהליה לשם שמים אמר להו לרב ספרא ולרב אחא בר הונא זילו ודברו תרי עולמי גולאי וחזו היכא דמסקא ימא שירטון ושקלו ציבי חדתי ואפיקו נורא ממרא חדתא ואסקוה ניהליה לשם שמים
human_translation: similar to that which Ifera Hurmiz, the mother of King Shapur sent an offering to Rava, she sent to him: Sacrifice this for me, for the sake of Heaven. said to Rav Safra and to Rav Aḥa bar Huna: Go, take two youths of the same age, and see where the sea raises silt [ sirton ], And take new wood and bring out fire from new vessels, and sacrifice for her, for the sake of Heaven.
llm_translation: This is what happened: the mother of King Shapur saw a sacrifice being brought to Rava. She sent to him a message: "Take it and offer it for the sake of Heaven." Rava said to Rav Safra and to Rav Acha bar Huna: "Go and speak with the two worlds, reveal and see where the sea recedes, take a new rope and measure the depth, and bring forth a new light from a new place, and offer it for the sake of Heaven."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי כמאן כר"א בן שמוע דתניא ר' אלעזר בן שמוע אומר מה מזבח שלא ישתמש בו הדיוט אף עצים שלא ישתמש בהן הדיוט והא מודה ר"א בן שמוע בבמה
human_translation: Abaye said to In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua? As it is taught Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua says: Just as altar that is not used by an ordinary so too, wood must not be used by an ordinary But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua concede in altar
llm_translation: Abbaye said: According to whom is the halakha? Like R. Elazar ben Shamu'a, as it was taught in a baraita: R. Elazar ben Shamu'a says, "Just as regarding an altar that a commoner may not make use of it, so too regarding wood that a commoner may not make use of it." And R. Eliezer ben Shamu'a concedes this law regarding a high place bamah.

hebrew_text: דתניא כתוב אחד אומר (דברי הימים א כא, כה) ויתן דוד לארנן במקום שקלי זהב משקל שש מאות וגו' וכתיב (שמואל ב כד, כד) ויקן דוד את הגרן ואת הבקר בכסף שקלים חמשים הא כיצד
human_translation: As it is taught one verse states: “So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight. And it is written “So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver. How these
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: One verse says (1 Chronicles 21:25), "And David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold, etc." And it is written (2 Samuel 24:24), "So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver." How so?

hebrew_text: גובה מכל שבט ושבט חמשים שהן שש מאות רבי אומר משום אבא יוסי בן דוסתאי בקר [ועצים] ומקום מזבח בנ' וכל הבית כולו בשש מאות
human_translation: collect from each tribe fifty which are six hundred Rabbi says in the name of Abba Yosei ben Dostai cattle and wood and the site of altar for fifty and the entire Temple for six hundred
llm_translation: Height from every tribe and tribe fifty that they are six hundred. Rabbi says in the name of Abba Yossi ben Dosatai in cattle and trees and the place of the altar in fifty, and the entire house in six hundred.

hebrew_text: ר"א בן שמוע אומר בקר ועצים ומקום מזבח בנ' וכל הבית כולו בשש מאות דכתיב (שמואל ב כד, כב) ויאמר ארונה אל דוד יקח ויעל אדוני המלך [הטוב בעיניו] ראה הבקר לעולה והמוריגים [וכלי הבקר] לעצים ורבא אמר לך התם נמי בחדתי
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua says cattle and wood and the site of altar for fifty and the entire Temple for six hundred as it is written: “And Araunah said to David: Let my lord the king take and offer that which is good in his eyes; see the cattle for the burnt offering, and the threshing tools, and the implements of the cattle for the wood” And Rava said to you There too, with new
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Shamu'a says: "With cattle, wood, and the place of the altar, in fifty shekels, and the entire house in six hundred, as it is written (2 Samuel 24:22), 'And Araunah said to David, 'Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him. See, here are cattle for burnt offering, and the threshing sledges and the yokes of the cattle for wood.' And Rava said: There too, it is also with my own."

hebrew_text: מאי מוריגים אמר עולא מטה של טורבל מאי מטה של טורבל אמר אביי עיזא דקרקסא דדיישן דישאי אמר אביי מאי קרא (ישעיהו מא, טו) הנה שמתיך למורג חרוץ חדש בעל פיפיות
human_translation: What “the threshing instruments [ morigim ]” Ulla said: a turbal bed. What a turbal bed? Abaye said: a heavy, serrated board [ dekurkesa ], for threshing. Abaye said: What is the verse “Behold, I have made you a new threshing board [ morag ] having sharp teeth; you shall thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shall make the hills as chaff”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is "morigim"? Ula said: The staff of turbal. What is the staff of turbal? Abaye said: The staff of the courtyard of the dyers. Yishai said: Abaye said: What is the verse? (Isaiah 41:15) "Behold, I have made you a new, sharp threshing sledge with double edges."

hebrew_text: מקרי ליה רבא לבריה ורמי ליה קראי אהדדי כתיב ויתן דוד לארנן וגו' וכתיב ויקן דוד וגו' הא כיצד גובה מכל שבט ושבט חמשים שהן שש מאות
human_translation: Rava teaching to his son, and raised a contradiction between verses: It is written: “So David gave to Ornan… and it is written: “So David bought… How these collect from each tribe fifty which are six hundred
llm_translation: Rava called to his son and raised contradictory verses: it is written "And David gave to Arnan, etc." and it is written "And David acquired, etc." How so? He collected from every tribe fifty, which are six hundred.

hebrew_text: ואכתי קשיין אהדדי התם כסף הכא זהב אלא ה"ק גובה כסף במשקל שש מאות זהב:
human_translation: But are still difficult, one another, there silver here gold Rather, this saying: collect silver six hundred gold
llm_translation: And thus they are difficult to each other there silver here gold rather here it says the redemption of silver by weight six hundred gold.

hebrew_text: קדשים קלים נאכלים [בכל מחנה ישראל]: אמר רב הונא בכל מקומות ישראל אבל מחנה לא הוי
human_translation: offerings of lesser sanctity eaten throughout the camp of Israel. Rav Huna says: in any places an Israelite But there was no camp,
llm_translation: Holy things light are eaten in every camp of Israel: said Rav Huna in every place of Israel but a camp not is

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר"נ לרב הונא ומחנות במדבר לא הואי והא תניא כשם שמחנה במדבר כך מחנה בירושלים מירושלים להר הבית מחנה ישראל מהר הבית לשער נקנור מחנה לויה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman raised an objection to Rav Huna: And were there not camps in the wilderness? But isn’t it taught Just as a camp in the wilderness so too, camp in Jerusalem: from Jerusalem to the Temple Mount the Israelite camp. from the Temple Mount to Nicanor’s Gate the Levite camp.
llm_translation: Rav Nahman raised an objection to Rav Huna: "But encampments in the wilderness were not permanent!" Yet, it was taught: Just as there was an encampment in the wilderness, so too there was an encampment in Jerusalem. From Jerusalem to the Temple Mount was the encampment of Israel; from the Temple Mount to the Gate of Nicanor was the encampment of the Levites.

hebrew_text: מכאן ואילך מחנה שכינה והן הן קלעים שבמדבר
human_translation: From that onward, the camp of the Divine Presence; and the curtains in the wilderness.
llm_translation: From here and onwards, the camp of the Divine Presence, and they are the curtains in the desert.

hebrew_text: אלא אימא בכל מקום מחנה ישראל פשיטא מהו דתימא איפסלו ביוצא קמ"ל
human_translation: Rather, say wherever the Israelite camp obvious? Lest you say were disqualified due to leaving teaches us
llm_translation: Rather say, in every place the camp of Israel is obvious. What might you say? That they are disqualified by an external factor? It teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ואימא ה"נ אמר קרא (במדבר ב, יז) ונסע אהל מועד אע"פ שנסע אהל מועד הוא
human_translation: But say indeed so, the verse states: “Then the Tent of Meeting, shall travel although it traveled it is the Tent of Meeting.
llm_translation: And say: So said the verse (Numbers 2:17), "And the Tent of Meeting shall journey," even though the Tent of Meeting itself journeyed.

hebrew_text: תניא רשב"י אומר עוד אחרת היתה וחיל עזרת נשים היא ולא היו עונשין עליה ובשילה לא היו אלא שני מחנות בלבד
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: There was an additional and it the rampart of the women’s courtyard. but they would not punish for it, And in Shiloh there were only two camps.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai says, "Another interpretation it was, and the women's auxiliary force it was, and they were not punished for it, and in Shiloh there were only two camps."

hebrew_text: הי מינייהו לא הוה אמר רבה מסתברא דמחנה לויה הואי דאי סלקא דעתך מחנה לויה לא הואי
human_translation: Which of was not Rabba said: It stands to reason that the Levite camp was As, if it enters your mind to say the Levite camp was not
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabah did not say their names, it is reasonable that it is a camp of Levi, for if you think it is not a camp of Levi, it is not.

hebrew_text: נמצאו זבין וטמאי מתים משתלחין חוץ למחנה אחת והתורה אמרה (במדבר ה, ג) ולא יטמאו את מחניהם
human_translation: found zavim and ritually impure a corpse are sent out of one camp, But the Torah said that they will not defile their camps”
llm_translation: Found zavim and those impure from contact with the dead are sent outside of one camp, and the Torah said (Numbers 5:3) "And they shall not defile their camps."

hebrew_text: תן מחנה לזה ומחנה לזה
human_translation: Give camp to this and camp to this
llm_translation: Give a camp to this one and a camp to this one.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא אלא מאי מחנה ישראל לא הואי נמצאו זבין ומצורעין משתלחין למקום אחד והתורה אמרה (ויקרא יג, מו) בדד ישב שלא ישב טמא אחר עמו
human_translation: Rava said to him: Rather, what the Israelite camp was not found zavim and lepers are sent to one place, But the Torah said “He shall dwell alone; that another ritually impure person should not dwell with him.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Rather, what is the meaning of "Camp of Israel"? It is not that they should be found together, those with gonorrhea and those with leprosy, sent to one place. And the Torah said (Leviticus 13:46): "He shall dwell alone; outside the camp shall his dwelling be."

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם כולהו תלתא הוו ומאי לא היו אלא שתי מחנות לקליטה מכלל דבמדבר הואי קלטה מחנה לויה
human_translation: Rather, actually, all three were and what There were only two camps? with regard to refuge By inference, that in the wilderness the Levite camp did provide refuge
llm_translation: Rather, all of them were three. And what? Not were but two camps for reception. From the general principle that in the wilderness it was a reception camp for the Levites.

hebrew_text: אין והא תניא (שמות כא, יג) ושמתי לך מקום בחייך מקום מקומך (שמות כא, יג) אשר ינוס שמה מלמד שמגלין במדבר להיכן גולין למחנה לויה
human_translation: Yes, and so it is taught and I will appoint for you a place during your lifetime. “a place” your place, “Where he may flee” teaches that would exile in the wilderness To where did they exile to the Levite camp,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, v'ha tania (Shemot 21:13) u'samti l'cha makom b'chaiyecha, makom makomcha (Shemot 21:13) asher yanus shamah." Melamed she'magilin b'midbar l'heichan golin l'machaneh Leviyah. English translation: "No, and isn't it taught (Exodus 21:13) 'I will provide you a place for your life, a place, your place (Exodus 21:13) where one may flee there.'" This teaches that they reveal in the wilderness where to flee to the camp of Levi.

hebrew_text: מכאן אמרו בן לוי שהרג גולה מפלך לפלך ואם גלה לפלכו פלכו קולטו
human_translation: From here said: A Levite who killed is exiled from city to city. And if he was exiled to his city, he is admitted to his city,
llm_translation: From here Ben Levi said: One who kills a refugee from one city to another, and if he exiles him to his own city, his city must accept him.

hebrew_text: מאי קרא אמר רב אחא בריה דרב איקא (במדבר לה, כח) כי בעיר מקלטו ישב עיר שקלטתו כבר:
human_translation: What is the verse Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, says “For in his city of refuge he shall dwell” a city in which he was already admitted,
llm_translation: What is the verse? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: "For in the city of his refuge shall he dwell; until the death of the Kohen Gadol."

hebrew_text: באו לגלגל: ת"ר כל נידר ונידב היה קרב בבמה שאין נידר ונידב אין קרב בבמה מנחה ונזירות קריבין בבמה דברי ר"מ וחכ"א לא קרבו יחיד אלא עולות ושלמים בלבד
human_translation: arrived at Gilgal The Sages taught Any a vow, or contributed was sacrificed on altar; any that is neither a vow nor contributed not sacrificed on altar. a meal offering, and a nazirite, sacrificed upon altar. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Only burnt offerings and peace offerings were sacrificed a private
llm_translation: They came to Gilgal: The Rabbis taught: Every vow and freewill offering that was brought on a high place, if it was not a vow or freewill offering, it is not brought on a high place. Meal offerings and Nazirites are brought on a high place, according to the words of Rabbi Meir, but the Sages did not bring them on a high place, only individual burnt offerings and peace offerings.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר כל שהצבור והיחיד מקריבין באהל מועד שבמדבר מקריבין באהל מועד שבגלגל מה בין אהל מועד שבמדבר לבין אהל מועד שבגלגל אהל מועד שבמדבר לא היו במות מותרות אהל מועד שבגלגל היו הבמות מותרות ובמתו שבראש גגו לא היה מקריב עליה אלא עולה ושלמים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any that the public or an individual sacrifice in the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness sacrificed in the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal. What, between the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness and the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal? the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness altars were not permitted the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal altars were permitted. But his altar on his roof, sacrifice upon it only burnt offerings and peace offerings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Any offering that the congregation and an individual bring in the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness, they bring in the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal. What is the difference between the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness and the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal? In the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness, there were no rooftops permitted, but in the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal, rooftops were permitted. And if one's rooftop had a corpse on it, they would only bring up burnt offerings and peace offerings."

hebrew_text: וחכ"א כל שהצבור מקריבין באהל מועד שבמדבר מקריבין באהל מועד שבגלגל וכאן וכאן לא קרבו יחיד אלא עולה ושלמים בלבד ר' שמעון אומר אף צבור לא הקריבו אלא פסחים
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Any that the public sacrifice in the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness sacrificed in the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal, and here, and there, only burnt offerings and peace offerings were sacrificed an individual. Rabbi Shimon says: Even public sacrificed only Paschal offerings
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory: All that the congregation offers in the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness, they offer in the Tent of Meeting in Gilgal. And here and here they did not offer except for burnt offerings and peace offerings. Rabbi Shimon says: Even the congregation did not offer except for Passover offerings.

hebrew_text: וחובות שקבוע להן זמן
human_translation: and compulsory that have a set time
llm_translation: And obligations that have a fixed time.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דר"מ דאמר קרא (דברים יב, ח) לא תעשון ככל אשר אנחנו עושים פה היום
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir as the verse states: “You shall not do all that we do here this day,
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir who said: The verse says (Deuteronomy 12:8), "You shall not do all that we are doing here today."

hebrew_text: אמר להן משה לישראל כי עייליתו לארץ ישרות תקריבו חובות לא תקריבו מנחות ונזירות ישרות נינהו
human_translation: Moses said to the Jewish people: When you enter Eretz fitting yesharot you may sacrifice, you may not sacrifice obligatory Meal offerings and a nazirite are fitting
llm_translation: Moses said to them, "When you enter the land of Israel, you shall bring obligatory offerings, you shall not bring voluntary offerings, and they are called straight Nazirites."

hebrew_text: ורבנן אין מנחה בבמה נזירות חובות נינהו
human_translation: And the Rabbis a meal offering is not upon altar a nazirite are compulsory.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "Mincha offerings are not brought on the altar of the Bamah; Nazirites are obligatory."

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל מחלוקת בחטאת ואשם אבל בעולות ושלמים דברי הכל ישרות נינהו וקרבי
human_translation: Shmuel says the disagreement to the sin offering and the guilt offering But with regard to the burnt offering and the peace offering all agree they are fitting and are sacrificed
llm_translation: Said Samuel: Dispute in sin-offering and guilt-offering, but in burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, the words of all are straightforward and near.

hebrew_text: מותיב רבה חזה ושוק ותרומת לחמי תודה נוהגין בבמה גדולה ואין נוהגין בבמה קטנה ואילו הזרוע בשלה שיירה
human_translation: Rabba raises an objection the breast and thigh and the teruma of the loaves of the thanks offering, apply with regard to a great altar, and do not apply with regard to a small altar. By contrast, the cooked foreleg omitted
llm_translation: Rabba raises an objection: "The breast, the thigh, and the heave offering of my thanksgiving sacrifices are practiced in the Great Altar, but are not practiced in the Small Altar. However, the leftover arm is left."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא בעולה ושלמים פליגי הא מני רבנן היא אלא אי אמרת בחטאת ואשם פליגי הא מני
human_translation: Granted, if you say disagree with regard to a burnt offering and peace offering whose is this is the Rabbis, But if you say they disagree with regard to a sin offering and guilt offering, whose is this
llm_translation: If you say in burnt offering and peace offerings they argue, this is according to the Rabbis. However, if you say in sin offering and guilt offering they argue, this is not according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר הכי איתמר אמר שמואל מחלוקת בעולה ושלמים אבל בחטאת ואשם דברי הכל חובות נינהו ולא קרבי
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated like this: Shmuel said disagreement to burnt offering and peace offering But with regard to sin offering and guilt offering, all agree that they are compulsory, and are not sacrificed
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Shmuel said: Dispute is regarding burnt offerings and peace offerings, but regarding sin offerings and guilt offerings, everyone agrees they are obligations and not voluntary offerings.

hebrew_text: אמר מר וחכמים אומרים כל שהצבור מקריבין באהל וכו'
human_translation: The Master, said And the Rabbis say: Any that the public sacrifice in the Tent
llm_translation: Said Mar, and the sages say: "Any offering brought by the congregation in the tent, etc."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמייהו דרבנן אמר קרא (שופטים יז, ו) איש הישר בעיניו יעשה איש ישרות הוא דליקרוב חובות לא ליקרוב וצבור אפי' חובות ליקרוב
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis The verse states man whatsoever is fitting in his own eyes” “a man,” who may sacrifice only “fitting,” may not sacrifice compulsory But public may sacrifice even compulsory
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? The verse says (Judges 17:6), "Every man did what was right in his own eyes." It is a man of uprightness who should come close for obligations, not to come close, and the community, even for obligations, should come close.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה אמר לך כי כתיב הישר (בעיניו) הוא דכתיב אבל בבמה גדולה אפילו חובות נמי ליקרוב
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, said to you when is fitting” is written, it is “in his own eyes” that it is written. But on a great altar, even compulsory may be sacrificed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to you, as it is written "the upright (in his eyes)" - this is what is written. But in a large high place, even obligations also should approach.

hebrew_text: אלא הא כתיב איש לאו למימרא דאיש ישרות הוא דליקרוב הא חובות לא ליקרוב כי כתיב איש להכשיר את הזר
human_translation: But isn’t “man” written Isn’t that to say that “a man,” only fitting may be sacrificed, but compulsory may not be sacrificed? When “man” is written to qualify a non-priest
llm_translation: Rather, is it not written "a man" to say that it is a man of uprightness who should approach, not debts to approach, for it is written "a man to make the stranger eligible."

hebrew_text: זר (ויקרא יז, ו) מוזרק הכהן את הדם על מזבח ה' נפקא
human_translation: a non-priest derived from “And the priest shall dash the blood against the altar of the Lord
llm_translation: "Stranger (Leviticus 17:6) the priest throws the blood on the altar of the Lord, it is derived."

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא ליבעי קדוש בכורות כמעיקרא קא משמע לן
human_translation: Lest you say consecration of firstborn required as initially, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning for saying that the Holy One, blessed be He, desires firstborn offerings just as He did initially?

hebrew_text: חכמים היינו תנא קמא
human_translation: the Rabbis is the first tanna ,
llm_translation: Sages, we are the first Tanna.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא קרבו נסכים במדבר איכא בינייהו:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: between them libations were offered in the wilderness
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "There is a difference between libations in the wilderness."

hebrew_text: אמר מר רבי שמעון אומר וכו': מ"ט דרבי שמעון דכתיב (יהושע ה, י) ויעשו בני ישראל את הפסח בגלגל
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Shimon says What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? As it is written: “And the children of Israel in Gilgal; they kept the Passover
llm_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Shimon says, etc. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon? As it is written (Joshua 5:10), "And the children of Israel kept the Passover in Gilgal."

hebrew_text: פשיטא אלא הא קמ"ל דחובות כעין פסח הוא דקרב הא לאו כעין פסח לא קרב ואידך
human_translation: obvious Rather, this teaches us that only compulsory similar to Paschal were sacrificed, but not similar to Paschal were not sacrificed. And the other
llm_translation: It is obvious, rather this teaches that obligations are like the Passover offering, for just as this one is brought, so too the other.

hebrew_text: מיבעי ליה לכדרבי יוחנן דא"ר יוחנן משום רבי בנאה ערל מקבל הזאה
human_translation: It is necessary for that by Rabbi Yoḥanan. As Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Bena’a: an uncircumcised may receive sprinkling
llm_translation: It is necessary according to Rabbi Yochanan, as Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Banaah: A foreskin is susceptible to impurity.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דרב אדא בר אהבה אין בין במה גדולה לבמה קטנה אלא פסח וחובות הקבוע להן זמן (א"ל יחיד חובות שקבוע להן זמן מנא ליה
human_translation: a tanna taught in the presence of Rav Adda bar Ahava: The difference between a great altar, and a small altar is only Paschal offering and compulsory that have a set time said to him: From where an individual compulsory that have a set time?
llm_translation: A Tanna taught before Rav Adda bar Ahava: There is no difference between a large altar and a small altar except for the Passover offering and debts that have a fixed time. (He said to him: How does one know that debts with a fixed time are considered individual obligations?)

hebrew_text: א"ל אסמייה) א"ל תתרגם מתניתך בעולת חובה דאיכא עולת נדבה דאי חטאת יחיד הוא חובות דקביע ליה זמן מי איכא
human_translation: said to him: shall I remove it said to him: interpret your mishna to a compulsory burnt offering, as there is, a voluntary burnt offering as if it is a sin offering an individual, are there compulsory that have a set time?
llm_translation: He said to him: "Do not translate your Mishnah in the case of an obligatory burnt offering, for there is a voluntary burnt offering. For if it is a sin offering for an individual, are there fixed obligations for it?"

hebrew_text: ולוקמה במנחת חובה דהא איכא חביתין קא סבר אין מנחה בבמה:
human_translation: And let him establish to compulsory meal offering as there is griddle-cake holds there is no meal offering upon an altar
llm_translation: And regarding the case of a Minchat Chovah, for there are barrels, he holds that there is no Minchah on a high place.
