hebrew_text: באו לשילה וכו': מנא הני מילי א"ר חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן כתוב אחד אומר (שמואל א א, כד) ותביאהו בית ה' שילה וכתוב אחד אומר (תהלים עח, ס) ויטש (את) משכן שילה אהל שכן באדם וכתיב (תהלים עח, סז) וימאס באהל יוסף ובשבט אפרים לא בחר
human_translation: they arrived at Shiloh, From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One verse states, “And she brought him to the house of the Lord in Shiloh” and one verse states: “And He forsook the Tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent that He had made to dwell among men” And it is written: “Moreover he abhorred the tent of Joseph and chose not the tribe of Ephraim”
llm_translation: They came to Shiloh, etc. Whence do we derive these matters? R. Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One verse says (1 Samuel 1:24), "And she brought him to the house of the Lord in Shiloh," and another verse says (Psalms 78:60), "And He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent where He dwelt among men." And it is written (Psalms 78:67), "And He rejected the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim."

hebrew_text: הא כיצד לא היתה שם תקרה אלא אבנים מלמטן ויריעות מלמעלן והיא היתה מנוחה:
human_translation: How these There was no roof there; rather, stone below, and curtains above it, And was “rest”
llm_translation: This is how it was: there was no roof there, only stones below and curtains above, and it was a resting place.

hebrew_text: קדשי קדשים: מנא הני מילי א"ר אושעיא דאמר קרא (דברים יב, יג) השמר לך פן תעלה עולותיך בכל מקום אשר (אתה) תראה בכל מקום אשר תראה אי אתה מעלה אבל אתה אוכל בכל מקום שאתה רואה
human_translation: offerings of the most sacred order From where are these matters Rabbi Oshaya said: As the verse states: “Take heed to yourself that you do not offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see” You may not offer up in every place that you see, but you may eat in every place that you see.
llm_translation: Holy of Holies: From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Oshaya said: It is derived from the verse (Deuteronomy 12:13) "Be careful for yourself lest you offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see." "In every place that you see" - if you offer sacrifices you transgress, but you may eat sacrifices in every place that you see.

hebrew_text: אימא בכל מקום שאתה רואה אי אתה מעלה אבל אתה זובח בכל מקום שתראה
human_translation: Say You may not offer up in every place that you see, but you may slaughter in every place that you see.
llm_translation: Say: in every place that you see, you do not ascend, but you slaughter in every place that you see.

hebrew_text: א"ר ינאי אמר קרא (דברים יב, יד) שם תעלה ושם תעשה
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said the verse states: there you shall offer and there you shall do
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: The verse states (Deuteronomy 12:14), "There you shall ascend, and there you shall do."

hebrew_text: רבי אבדימי בר חסא אמר אמר קרא
human_translation: Rabbi Avdimi bar Ḥasa said the verse states:
llm_translation: Rabbi Avdimi bar Ḥasa said: "Said the verse..."

hebrew_text: ולו תאנת שילה מקום שכל הרואה אותו מתאנח עליו על אכילת קדשים שלו
human_translation: “And Taanath Shiloh” place which whoever saw moan [ mitane’aḥ ] for it with regard to the consumption of sacrificial
llm_translation: And to him a fig tree of Sheilah, a place where all who see it sigh over it for the eating of his holy things.

hebrew_text: רבי אבהו אמר אמר קרא (בראשית מט, כב) בן פרת יוסף בן פרת עלי עין עין שלא רצתה לזון וליהנות מדבר שאינו שלו תזכה ותאכל כמלא עיניה
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says the verse states “Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine by a fountain [ ayin ]” An eye [ ayin ] that did not wish to partake or derive benefit from something that was not his, shall merit consumed to the fullest of its eyes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said, the verse says (Genesis 49:22), "Joseph is a fruitful vine, a fruitful vine by a spring, its branches run over a wall." A spring that did not desire to nourish and benefit from something that is not its own, may you merit and eat to your heart's content.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ברבי חנינא אמר (דברים לג, טז) ורצון שוכני סנה עין שלא רצתה ליהנות מדבר שאינו שלו תזכה ותאכל בין השנואין
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says “And the good will of Him Who dwelt in the bush [ seneh ]” An eye that did not wish to derive benefit from something that was not his shall merit consumed among the haters [ senu’in ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said (Deuteronomy 33:16), "And the will of the dweller in the bush shall come upon him, to benefit from something that is not his, may he merit and eat among those who are despised."

hebrew_text: תנא רואה שאמרו רואה כולו ולא המפסיק בינו לבינו אמר ליה רבי שמעון בן אליקום לר' אלעזר אסברא לך כגון בי כנישתא דמעון אמר רב פפא רואה שאמרו לא רואה כולו אלא רואה מקצתו
human_translation: taught: Overlooks, that stated sees its entirety, and nothing that obstructs between and Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakum said to Rabbi Elazar: I shall explain to you: For example, the synagogue of Maon, Rav Pappa said Overlooks, that was stated not see its entirety, but sees partially,
llm_translation: Mishna: One who sees, as they said, sees the entire text and does not pause between one word and another. Rabbi Shimon ben Elikom said to Rabbi Elazar, "I will explain to you with an example like the synagogue of Maon." Rav Papa said, "One who sees, as they said, does not see the entire text, but sees part of it."

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא עומד ורואה יושב ואינו רואה מאי בעי ר' ירמיה עומד על גבי הנחל ורואה (יושב) בתוך הנחל ואינו רואה מאי תיקו
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: stands and sees sits does not see what Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: stand upon the stream and see in the stream he does not see what shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa asked: "One who is standing can see, but one who is sitting cannot see. What is the reason?" Rabbah bar Yirmeya asked: "One who is standing on the bank of the river can see, but one who is sitting inside the river cannot see. What is the resolution?"

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי אמר רבי בשלשה מקומות שרתה שכינה על ישראל בשילה ונוב וגבעון ובית עולמים ובכולן לא שרתה אלא בחלק בנימין שנאמר (דברים לג, יב) חופף עליו כל היום כל חפיפות לא יהו אלא בחלקו של בנימין
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi The Divine Presence rested upon the Jewish people in three places: In Shiloh, and Nov and Gibeon, and the Eternal House, and in all of those rested only in the portion of Benjamin, as it is stated He covers him all the day All coverings, shall be only in the portion of Benjamin.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi stated, "In three places the Divine Presence dwelt among the Israelites: in Shiloh, Nob, and Gibeon, and in Beit Olamim. Yet, in all of them, it only dwelt in the portion of Benjamin, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 33:12), 'The beloved of the Lord shall dwell in safety by Him; He covers him all the day, and He dwells between his shoulders.' All coverings were only in the portion of Benjamin."

hebrew_text: כי אזיל אביי אמרה קמיה דרב יוסף אמר חד ברא הוה ליה לכייליל ולא מיתקן והכתיב (תהלים עח, ס) ויטש (את) משכן שילה וכתיב (תהלים עח, סז) וימאס באהל יוסף ובשבט אפרים לא בחר
human_translation: when Abaye went he said before Rav Yosef. said Kaylil, had one son, and he is not proper. But isn’t it written “And He forsook the Tabernacle of Shiloh” and it is written: “Moreover He abhorred the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim”
llm_translation: When Abaye went, he said before Rav Yosef: "There was one altar for him to burn incense, and it was not fixed." And it is written (Psalms 78:60), "And He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh," and it is written (Psalms 78:67), "And He rejected the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אדא מאי קא קשיא ליה דלמא שכינה בחלק בנימין וסנהדרי גדולה בחלק יוסף מדמצינו בבית עולמים דשכינה בחלקו של בנימין וסנהדרין בחלק יהודה
human_translation: Rav Adda said: What difficulty Perhaps Divine Presence in the portion of Benjamin, and Great Sanhedrin, in the portion of Joseph. what we found in the Eternal House, where Divine Presence in the portion of Benjamin and Sanhedrin in the portion of Judah.
llm_translation: Rav Adda said: What is difficult for him? Perhaps the Divine Presence is in the portion of Benjamin, and the Great Sanhedrin in the portion of Joseph, as we find in the World to Come that the Divine Presence is in the portion of Benjamin and the Sanhedrin in the portion of Judah.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה הכי השתא התם מיקרבן נחלות גבי הדדי הכא מי מקרבן הכא נמי מקרבן כדאמר רבי חמא בר' חנינא רצועה היתה יוצאת מחלקו של יהודה ונכנסת לחלקו של בנימין ובה היה מזבח בנוי והיה בנימין הצדיק מצטער עליה לבלעה
human_translation: said to him How can be compared? There, the portions close to each other, Here, are close Here too they are close, as Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: A strip protruded from the portion of Judah and entered into the portion of Benjamin, and the altar was built on And Benjamin the righteous would agonize over it every day, to take it
llm_translation: He said to him thus: There, they would bring near the portions by Hadid; here, who brings near? Here too, brings near, as Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina said: A strip extended from the territory of Judah and entered the territory of Benjamin, and upon it was built an altar, and Benjamin the righteous was distressed over it to swallow it.

hebrew_text: ה"נ רצועה היתה יוצאת מחלקו של יוסף לחלקו של בנימין והיינו דכתיב (יהושע טז, ו) תאנת שילה
human_translation: Here too, a strip protruded from the portion of Joseph into the portion of Benjamin, And that is which is written Taanath Shiloh”
llm_translation: So it was: a strip of land extended from the portion of Joseph to the portion of Benjamin, as it is written (Joshua 16:6), "the terebinth of Shechem."

hebrew_text: כתנאי חופף עליו זה מקדש ראשון כל היום זה מקדש שני ובין כתיפיו שכן אלו ימות המשיח
human_translation: like tanna’im , “He covers him”; this First Temple. “All the day”; this Second Temple. “And He dwells between his shoulders”; this the messianic era.
llm_translation: Disputants: One slaps upon him saying, "This is the First Temple all day," and this one says, "This is the Second Temple." And between his shoulders, these are the days of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר חופף עליו זה העולם הזה כל היום אלו ימות המשיח ובין כתיפיו שכן זה העולם הבא
human_translation: Rabbi says: “He covers him”; this this world. “All the day”; this the messianic era. “And He dwells between his shoulders”; this the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "This world slaps him all day, these are the days of the Messiah, and between his shoulders, so is the World to Come."

hebrew_text: ת"ר ימי אהל מועד שבמדבר ארבעים שנה חסר אחת ימי אהל מועד שבגלגל ארבע עשרה ז' שכבשו וז' שחלקו ימי אהל מועד שבנוב וגבעון חמשים ושבע נשתיירו לשילה ג' מאות ושבעים חסר אחת
human_translation: the Sages taught: The days of the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness forty years, less one The days of the Tent of Meeting that in Gilgal fourteen Seven which conquered and seven which they divided The days of the Tent of Meeting that in Nov and Gibeon fifty-seven remain for Shiloh 370 less one.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The days of the Tabernacle in the wilderness were forty years, lacking one. The days of the Tabernacle in Gilgal were fourteen, seven they conquered and seven they apportioned. The days of the Tabernacle in Nob and Gibeon were fifty-seven. There remained for Shiloh three hundred and seventy, lacking one.

hebrew_text: ימי אהל מועד שבמדבר ארבעים חסר אחת מנלן דאמר מר שנה ראשונה עשה משה את המשכן שניה הוקם המשכן ושלח משה מרגלים
human_translation: From where do we the days of the Tent of Meeting that in the wilderness forty less one? As the Master said the first year Moses constructed the Tabernacle; second the Tabernacle was erected, and Moses sent spies.
llm_translation: The days of the Tabernacle in the wilderness were forty less one. Whence do we derive this? For the Master said: In the first year, Moses made the Tabernacle; in the second year, the Tabernacle was erected, and Moses sent spies.

hebrew_text: שבגלגל ארבע עשרה שבע שכבשו ושבע שחלקו מנלן דקאמר כלב (יהושע יד, ז) בן ארבעים שנה אנכי בשלוח משה עבד ה' אותי מקדש ברנע לרגל את הארץ ואשיב אותו דבר כאשר עם לבבי וכתיב ועתה הנה אנכי היום בן חמש ושמונים שנה
human_translation: From where do we that in Gilgal fourteen seven which conquered and seven which they divided As Caleb, said “Forty years old was I when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land; and I brought him back word as it was in my heart” and it is written: “And now, I am this day eighty and five years old”
llm_translation: In the wheel fourteen seven captured and seven divided. From where do we derive that it says "forty years old I am when Moses, the servant of the Lord, sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I brought him word again as it was in my heart"? And it is written, "And now, behold, I am this day eighty-five years old."

hebrew_text: כי עבריה לירדן בר כמה הוי בר שבעין ותמני וקאמר בן חמש ושמונים שנה הרי שבע שכבשו
human_translation: When crossed the Jordan, how old was seventy-eight old: And he said eighty-five years old. seven years which conquered
llm_translation: When Hebrew crossed the Jordan, son of Kama was seventy-eight years old, and it says, "At the age of eighty-five, behold, they conquered."

hebrew_text: ושבע שחלקו מנלן איבעית אימא מדשבע שכבשו שבע נמי שחלקו
human_translation: And from where do we seven which they divided If you wish, say: Since seven which they conquered also seven which they divided
llm_translation: And seven who divided - from where do we derive? If you say from the seven who conquered, also those who divided.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא מדלא משכחת לה (יחזקאל מ, א) בארבע עשרה שנה אחר אשר הוכתה העיר:
human_translation: And if you wish, say Because you do not find in the fourteenth year after that the city was smitten”
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: since you did not find it (Ezekiel 20:1) "In the fourteenth year after the city was smitten."

hebrew_text: אהל מועד שבנוב וגבעון חמשים ושבע מנ"ל דכתיב (שמואל א ד, יח) ויהי כהזכירו את ארון האלהים
human_translation: the Tent of Meeting that in Nov and Gibeon fifty-seven From where do we As it is written “And it came to pass, when he made mention of the Ark of God,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Tent of Meeting in Nov and Givon, fifty-seven. From where do we derive this? As it is written (1 Samuel 4:18), "And it came to pass, when he mentioned the Ark of God."

hebrew_text: ותנא כשמת עלי הכהן חרבה שילה ובאו לנוב כשמת שמואל הרמתי חרבה נוב ובאו לגבעון
human_translation: And taught: When Eli the priest died, Shiloh was destroyed and arrived at Nov, When Samuel from Rama died, Nov was destroyed and they arrived at Gibeon,
llm_translation: And it was taught: When Eli the priest died, Shiloh was desolate, and they came to Nob. When Samuel the Ramathite died, Nob was desolate, and they came to Gibeon.

hebrew_text: וכתיב (שמואל א ז, ב) ויהי מיום שבת הארון בקרית יערים וירבו הימים ויהיו עשרים שנה וינהו כל בית ישראל אחרי ה'
human_translation: And it is written: “And it came to pass, from the day that the Ark abode in Kiriath Jearim that the time was long; for it was twenty years; and all the house of Israel yearned after the Lord”
llm_translation: And it is written (1 Samuel 7:2), "And it was from the day that the Ark dwelt in Kiriath-jearim, and the days increased and they were twenty years, and all the house of Israel yearned after the Lord."

hebrew_text: הני עשרים שנה עשר שנה שמלך שמואל בעצמו ושנה שמלך שמואל ושאול ושתים שמלך שאול ושבע דדוד
human_translation: these twenty years Ten years that Samuel reigned alone, and year that Samuel and Saul reigned, and two that Saul reigned And seven of David’s
llm_translation: These twenty years: ten years Samuel reigned by himself, and one year Samuel and Saul reigned, and two years Saul reigned, and seven David.

hebrew_text: דכתיב (מלכים א ב, יא) והימים אשר מלך דוד על ישראל מ' שנה בחברון מלך ז' שנים [וגו']
human_translation: As it is written: “And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: Seven years he reigned in Hebron,
llm_translation: As it is written (1 Kings 1:1), "Now King David was old, advanced in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he could not get warm."

hebrew_text: ובשלמה כתיב (דברי הימים ב ג, ב) ויחל לבנותו בשנת ארבע למלכותו נשתיירו לשילה שלש מאות ושבעים חסר אחת:
human_translation: And with regard to Solomon, it is written: “And he began to build it in the fourth year of his reign” remain for Shiloh 370 less one
llm_translation: And in Solomon it is written (Chronicles 2:3:2), "And he began to build it in the fourth year of his reign." There remained for Shiloh three hundred and seventy less one.

hebrew_text: באו לנוב וגבעון [וכו']: מנא ה"מ דת"ר (דברים יב, ט) כי לא באתם עד עתה אל המנוחה ואל הנחלה
human_translation: arrived at Nov and Gibeon, From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “for you have not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance”
llm_translation: They came to Nob and Gibeon etc.: From where do we derive this? As the Rabbis taught (Deuteronomy 12:9), "For you have not yet come to the resting place and the inheritance."

hebrew_text: אל המנוחה זו שילה נחלה זו ירושלי' למה חלקן כדי ליתן היתר בין זה לזה
human_translation: “To the rest”; this Shiloh. inheritance”; this Jerusalem. Why divide them in order to give permission between this and that
llm_translation: To the resting place this Shiloh, inheritance this Jerusalem. Why divided them? In order to give permission between this and this.

hebrew_text: א"ל ריש לקיש לר' יוחנן מעשר שני נמי ליתני א"ל מעשר שם שם מארון קא ילפי כיון דארון לא הוה מעשר נמי לא הואי
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Let teach second tithe as well. said to him: tithe is derived from the Ark, “there” “there.” since there was no Ark there was also no tithe
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said to Reish Lakish: "Regarding Ma'aser Sheni, should it also not be taught?" He said to him: "Ma'aser Sheni is only applicable in the place designated for it. Since there was no Ark in the time of the Second Temple, Ma'aser Sheni was also not observed."

hebrew_text: אי הכי פסח וקדשים נמי דשם שם מארון ילפי דכיון דארון לא הוה אינהו נמי לא הוו
human_translation: If so Paschal offering and sacrificial also that they are derived from the Ark “there” “there,” since the Ark was not they too were not
llm_translation: If so, Pesach and Kedushim also, because there the name of the Ark will be revealed, since there was no Ark, they also were not.

hebrew_text: א"ל [דאמר לך] הא מני ר"ש היא דאמר אף צבור לא הקריבו אלא פסח וחובות הקבוע להן זמן אבל חובות שאין קבוע להם זמן הכא והכא לא קרב מעשר בהמה חובות שאין קבוע להן זמן הוא ואיתקש מעשר דגן למעשר בהמה
human_translation: said to him: who said this to you, whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, who says: Even public sacrificed only Paschal offerings and compulsory public offerings that have a set time. But compulsory that do not have a set time were not sacrificed here or there, an animal tithe is a compulsory offering that has no set time, and grain tithe is juxtaposed to animal tithe.
llm_translation: He said to him as he said to you, this is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, for he said: Even the congregation only brought the Passover offering and obligatory offerings that have a fixed time, but obligatory offerings that do not have a fixed time, here and here they did not bring. Tithes of animals, which do not have a fixed time, it is, and he compared the tithe of grain to the tithe of animals.

hebrew_text: מכלל דלרבי יהודה קרב אין דהאמר רב אדא בר מתנה מעשר שני ומעשר בהמה נאכלין בנוב וגבעון לדברי רבי יהודה והא בעי בירה ולאו תני רב יוסף שלש בירות הן שילה ונוב וגבעון ובית עולמים הוא תני לה והוא אמר לה לאכילת מעשר שני ואליב' דרבי יהודה:
human_translation: by inference that according to Rabbi Yehuda sacrificed? Yes, as Rav Adda bar Mattana says: Second tithe and animal tithe were consumed in Nov and Gibeon according to the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. But require Temple, But didn’t Rav Yosef teach There three temples: Shiloh, Nov and Gibeon, and the Eternal House. He teaches it and he says it: to consuming second tithe, and in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: From the principle that Rabbi Yehuda holds, it is close, as Rav Adda bar Matna said: "Second tithe and tithe of animals are eaten in Nov and Givon according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda." But isn't there a question about a city? And isn't it taught by Rav Yosef: "There are three cities - Shiloh, Nov, and Givon, and Beit Olamim is included in them." He taught it, and he said to eat the second tithe, and in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda's opinion.

hebrew_text: באו לירושלים [וכו']: ת"ר כי לא באתם עד עתה אל המנוחה ואל הנחלה מנוחה זו שילה נחלה זו ירושלים
human_translation: arrived at Jerusalem, the Sages taught “For you have not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance” “rest,” this Shiloh, “inheritance,” this Jerusalem.
llm_translation: They came to Jerusalem etc.: The Rabbis taught: "For you have not come to the rest and to the inheritance until now." Rest - this is Shiloh. Inheritance - this is Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: ואומר (ירמיהו יב, ח) היתה לי נחלתי כאריה ביער ואומר (ירמיהו יב, ט) העיט צבוע נחלתי לי העיט סביב עליה דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: And states: My inheritance has become to Me as a lion in the forest” And states: “Is My inheritance to Me as a speckled bird of prey? Are the birds of prey against her round about?” the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: And he says (Jeremiah 12:8), "My heritage has become to Me as a lion in the forest." And he says (Jeremiah 12:9), "Is the bird of prey against Me a speckled bird? Is the bird of prey around her? Go, assemble all the beasts of the field, bring them to devour." These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר מנוחה זו ירושלים נחלה זו שילה ואומר (תהלים קלב, יד) זאת מנוחתי עדי עד פה אשב כי אויתיה ואומר (תהלים קלב, יג) כי בחר ה' בציון אוה למושב לו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “rest,” this Jerusalem, “inheritance,” this Shiloh. And says: “This is My resting place forever; here will I dwell, for I have desired it” And it states “For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His habitation”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "This rest is Jerusalem, this inheritance is Shiloh." And it says (Psalms 132:14): "This is My resting place forever; here I will dwell, for I have desired it." And it says (Psalms 132:13): "For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His dwelling place."

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד מנוחה זו שילה היינו דכתיב אל המנוחה ואל הנחלה אלא למ"ד מנוחה זו ירושלים נחלה זו שילה אל הנחלה ואל המנוחה מיבעי ליה הכי קאמר לא מיבעיא מנוחה דלא מטיתו אלא אפילו לנחלה נמי לא מטיתו
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says “rest,” this Shiloh; that is, as it is written: “To the rest and to the inheritance,” But according to the one who says “rest,” this Jerusalem, “inheritance,” this Shiloh, should have stated: To the inheritance and to the rest. This is saying: it is not necessary that you have not arrived at “rest,” but you have not even arrived at “inheritance,”
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who says that "rest" refers to Shiloh, this is what is meant by the verse "to the resting place and to the inheritance." But according to the one who says that "rest" refers to Jerusalem and "inheritance" refers to Shiloh, it is necessary for him to say so: Not necessary is the rest that you did not bring, but even to the inheritance you also did not bring.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל זו וזו שילה רבי שמעון בן יוחי אומר זו וזו ירושלים בשלמא למאן דאמר מנוחה זו
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught this and that, Shiloh. Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: This and that Jerusalem. Granted, according to the one who says “rest,” this
llm_translation: Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: This and this is Shiloh. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: This and this is Jerusalem. Granted, according to the one who says "rest," this...

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד זו וזו שילה מנוחה דנחו מכיבוש נחלה (זו) דפלגו התם נחלות דכתיב (יהושע יח, י) ויחלק להם יהושע ויפל להם גורל בשילה על פי ה'
human_translation: Granted, according to the one, who says this and that Shiloh, “rest” because rested from conquest “inheritance” because divided portions there, as it is written: “And Joshua divided for them, and he cast a lot for them in Shiloh according to the Lord”
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion that both this and that refer to the resting place of Noah from the conquest of the land, this is in reference to the division of the inheritance, as it is written (Joshua 18:10), "And Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord."

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד זו וזו ירושלים בשלמא נחלה נחלת עולמים אלא מנוחה מאי מנוחה מנוחת ארון דכתיב ויהי כנוח הארון
human_translation: But according to the one, who says this and that Jerusalem, granted “inheritance” an eternal inheritance. But “rest,” what rest The rest of Ark, as it is written: And when the ark rested.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says this and that, Jerusalem. Granted, inheritance is an eternal inheritance, but rest, what is rest? The resting of the Ark, as it is written, "And it came to pass, when the Ark rested."

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד זו וזו ירושלים אבל שילה הוה שריא במות היינו דכתיב (שופטים יג, יט) ויקח מנוח את גדי העזים ואת המנחה ויעל על הצור לה'
human_translation: Granted, according to the one, who says this and that Jerusalem, but Shiloh altars were permitted, this is as it is written: “So Manoah took the kid with the meal offering, and offered them upon the rock to the Lord”

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד זו וזו שילה ובמות הוה אסירן מאי ויקח מנוח הוראת שעה היתה
human_translation: But according to the one, who says this and that Shiloh, and altars were forbidden what “So Manoah took,” was a provisional edict

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל כרבי שמעון בן יוחי דאמר זו וזו ירושלים וסימניך משכי גברא לגברי:

human_translation: And additionally, it is taught Rabbi Shimon would say four principles with regard to sacrificial consecrated during a period of prohibition of altars, and slaughtered and offered up outside during a period of prohibition of altars, these in a positive mitzva and a prohibition, and they carry karet . consecrated them during a period of permitting of altars, and slaughtered and offered up during a period of prohibition of altars, these in a positive mitzva and a prohibition, but they do not carry karet .

llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar raises verses against each other. It is written (1 Samuel 14:33), "And he said, 'Roll a large stone over to me today.'"

hebrew_text: וכתיב (שמואל א יד, לד) ויאמר שאול פוצו בעם ואמרתם להם הגישו אלי איש שורו ואיש שיהו ושחטתם בזה ואכלתם ולא תחטאו לה' לאכול על הדם ויגישו כל העם איש שורו בידו הלילה וישחטו שם
human_translation: And it is written: “And Saul said: Disperse yourselves among the people and say to them: Bring me here every man his ox and every man his sheep, and slay them here and eat and sin not against the Lord in eating with the blood. And all the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and slew them there”
llm_translation: And it is written (1 Samuel 14:34), "And Saul said, 'Disperse yourselves among the people and say to them, "Bring me each man his ox and each man his sheep, and slaughter them here and eat, and do not sin against the Lord by eating with the blood."' So all the people brought each man his ox in his hand that night and slaughtered them there."

hebrew_text: מר משני כאן בחולין כאן בקדשים ומר משני כאן בקדשי במה גדולה כאן בקדשי במה קטנה
human_translation: Sage answers here, of non-sacred there, of sacrificial And Sage answers Here, to the sacrificial of a great altar, there, to sacrificial of a small altar.
llm_translation: Master said: Here regarding mundane matters, here regarding holy matters. And Master said: Here regarding holy matters, how great? Here regarding holy matters, how small?

hebrew_text: איתמר עולת במת יחיד רב אמר אין טעונה הפשט וניתוח ורבי יוחנן אמר טעונה הפשט וניתוח וקא מיפלגי בדר"י הגלילי דתניא ר"י הגלילי אומר עולה שהקריבו ישראל במדבר אין טעונה הפשט וניתוח שאין הפשט וניתוח אלא מאהל מועד ואילך
human_translation: was stated the burnt offering of a private altar, Rav says: It does not require flaying and cutting and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It does require flaying and cutting And they disagree with regard to of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: The burnt offering that the Jewish people sacrificed in the wilderness, did not require flaying and cutting because flaying and cutting only from the Tent of Meeting and onward,
llm_translation: It was stated: An Olah offering for an individual who is impure. Rav said: It does not require examination and dissection. And Rabbi Yochanan said: It does require examination and dissection. And they are in disagreement regarding Rabbi Yehuda HaGalili, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda HaGalili says: An Olah offering that the Israelites brought in the desert does not require examination and dissection, as examination and dissection are only from the Tent of Meeting and onwards.

hebrew_text: מר סבר מאהל מועד ואילך לא שנא במה גדולה ולא שנא במה קטנה ומר סבר בבמה גדולה אין בבמה קטנה לא
human_translation: Sage, holds from the Tent of Meeting and onward is no difference a great altar, and is no difference a small altar. And Sage, holds with regard to a great altar, yes, with regard to a small altar not.
llm_translation: Master holds: "From the Tent of Meeting and onward, it is not different in what is large and not different in what is small." And Master holds: "In what is large, there is not in what is small."

hebrew_text: תניא כותיה דרבי יוחנן דברים שבין במה גדולה לבמה קטנה קרן וכבש ויסוד וריבוע בבמה גדולה ואין קרן ויסוד וכבש וריבוע בבמה קטנה כיור וכנו בבמה גדולה ואין כיור וכנו בבמה קטנה חזה ושוק בבמה גדולה ואין חזה ושוק בבמה קטנה
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: matters that are different between a great altar and a small altar? corner ramp, base and square in a great altar, but corner, base, ramp, and square are not in a small altar. Basin and its base in a great altar, but Basin and its base are not in a small altar. breast and thigh at a great altar, but breast and thigh are not at a small altar.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: The items that are found in a large platform but not in a small platform are a horn, a ram, a foundation, and a square. And the items that are found in a small platform but not in a large platform are a basin and its stand. A breast and a thigh are found in a large platform but not in a small platform. And a breast and a thigh are not found in a small platform.

hebrew_text: דברים ששוותה במה גדולה לבמה קטנה שחיטה בבמה גדולה וקטנה הפשט וניתוח בגדולה וקטנה דם מתיר ומפגל בגדולה וקטנה מומין וזמן בגדולה וקטנה
human_translation: matters which a great altar is identical to a small altar: Slaughter at a great altar and a small Flaying and cutting at a great and a small blood permits and renders piggul at a great and a small blemishes and time at a great and a small
llm_translation: Matters that are equal in what way is a large altar to a small altar? Slaughtering on a large altar and a small one, skinning and dismembering on a large and small one, blood permits and disqualifies on a large and small one, blemishes and disqualifications on a large and small one.

hebrew_text: אבל נותר והזמן והטמא שוין בזה ובזה:
human_translation: But left over [ notar ] and the time and the ritually impure are equal in this, and that,
llm_translation: But remained and the appointed time and the impure equal in this and in this.

hebrew_text: ת"ר מנין לעשות זמן בבמה קטנה כבמה גדולה (אמרה תורה לן ישרף) ופיגול ישרף מה פיגול פסול בבמה אף לן פסול בבמה
human_translation: the Sages taught From where time, of a small altar should be made equivalent to of a great altar? The Torah stated: left overnight be burned, and an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ] be burned. Just as piggul is disqualified of altar, so too, left overnight disqualified of altar.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that making a designated time for sacrifice on a small altar is like making it on a large altar? (The Torah said to us: "It shall be burned.") Just as a disqualified offering (pigul) is burned on the large altar, so too, it is disqualified on the small altar.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו) דהא אמרה תורה לן ישרף ויוצא ישרף מה יוצא כשר בבמה אף לן כשר בבמה ולאו ק"ו הוא מעופות
human_translation: Or go this way, because the Torah stated: left overnight must be burned, and leaves must be burned, Just as leaves valid in altar so too, left overnight valid in altar, And is it not an a fortiori from bird
llm_translation: Or go on this path) for the Torah said to us "it shall be burned and the one who goes out shall be burned." Just as the one who goes out is valid on a high place, so too are we valid on a high place. And is it not a fortiori reasoning? It is from birds.

hebrew_text: מה עופות שאין המום פוסל בהן זמן פוסל בהן קדשי במה קטנה שהמום פוסל בהן אינו דין שזמן פוסל בהן
human_translation: If bird that a blemish does not disqualify them, are disqualified by time, sacrificial of a small altar, which are disqualified by a blemish, is it not logical that they disqualified by time?
llm_translation: What birds that their blemish disqualifies them, their designated time disqualifies them, and their consecrated status disqualifies them? A small domestic fowl, that its blemish disqualifies it, is it not the case that its designated time disqualifies it as well?

hebrew_text: מה לעופות שכן אין הזר כשר בהן תאמר בבמה קטנה שהזר כשר בה לא יהא זמן פסול בה ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יא) וזאת תורת זבח השלמים לעשות זמן במה קטנה כזמן במה גדולה:
human_translation: What about bird in that a non-priest is not fit to them. Shall you say with regard to a small altar, where a non-priest is fit? should not be disqualified by time. the verse states: “And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings” to render time a small altar identical to time a great altar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What about birds? Since a non-priest is not valid for them, you will say in a small altar that a non-priest is valid for it, should not the time be disqualified in it? It is taught: 'And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace-offerings' - to make the time in a small altar like the time in a large altar." (Leviticus 7:11)

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרת חטאת וסליקא לה מסכת זבחים
llm_translation: We will return to you, O cow of sin-offering, and we will go up with her from the tractate of Zevachim.
